"LITE" BANANA SPLIT DESSERT
(140 Calories Per Serving)  
ingredients
4  c. corn flakes
1/2  c. diet margarine
1/3  c. Sweet 'N Low (4 packets)
3  boxes sugar-free vanilla pudding and pie filling
6  c. 2% milk
3  1/2 bananas
2 (20 oz.)  c. crushed pineapple, drained
1  (12 oz.) lite Cool Whip
preparation
      Heat oven to 375°.  Mix crushed cereal, margarine and Sweet 'N Low in bowl.  Pat mixture in 13 x 9 x 2-inch ungreased pan.  Bake 10 minutes.  Cool.
      Prepare pudding and pie filling as directed.  Refrigerate 10 minutes.  Slice bananas.  Arrange on crust.  Spread pudding over bananas.  Top with pineapple.  Spread whipped topping to the edges of pan.  Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.

SUSHI "ALIVE"
ingredients
1/4  c. sesame seeds
1/2  c. raw cashews
3/4  c. lentil sprouts
1  medium carrot
1/2  small green bell pepper
1  (4 inch) celery stalk
2  Tbsp. olive oil
1  leaf Chinese cabbage
2  tsp. tamari or soy sauce
8  sheets toasted nori
1  large tomato, halved and thinly sliced
  alfalfa and sunflower seed sprouts
preparation
      Place the sesame seeds, cashews and lentil sprouts in a food processor and process until thick and meaty.  Add the carrot, pepper, and celery and process until smooth.  Add the olive oil, cabbage and tamari and process until the cabbage is chopped but not liquified.  The cabbage should add some texture to the mixture.  Spread approximately 1/2 cup filling on the lower half of a sheet of nori.  Add a line of sliced tomatoes and sprouts. Roll and eat immediately or wrap in a plastic wrap and store until ready to use.  As the sushi sits, nori becomes less crunchy.

Cheese Fondue
  
Servings: 4
Cooking Time: 30 minutes
Cuisine: American
ingredients
3  Tbsp. margarine 
3  Tbsp. flour 
1/2  tsp. garlic salt 
1/2  tsp. salt 
  
dash of pepper, nutmeg and Tabasco
2  1/2 c. milk 
1  lb. American cheese 
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce 
1/3  c. milk 
2  Tbsp. milk 
preparation
Melt margarine in fondue set over a moderate, direct heat. Stir in flour, garlic salt, salt, pepper, nutmeg and Tabasco. Stir in milk. Cook until sauce is smooth and slightly thick; lower heat. Add cheese, a small amount at a time and stir until cheese is melted. Stir in Worcestershire sauce and 1/3 cup milk. Cool and eat. Serve with cubes of French bread, raw vegetables or meats.
notes
   
wer54w66sf32re2

POST THANKSGIVING TURKEY CASSEROLE
ingredients
2  c. cooked turkey breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
2  c. sliced celery
1  c. mayonnaise
3  Tbsp. grated onion
1 to 1 1/2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/4  c. slivered almonds
1  c. grated cheese
1/2  c. chow mein noodles
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.   In a 2-quart casserole, combine turkey, celery, mayonnaise, onion and lemon juice.  Top with almonds, cheese and noodles.  Bake 30 minutes.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.

APPETIZER CHICKEN WINGS
ingredients
3  lb. chicken wings (15 or 16)
1/3  c. soy sauce
2  Tbsp. salad oil
2  Tbsp. chili sauce
1  Tbsp. dry sherry (optional)
1/2  c. honey
2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. ginger
1  clove garlic, pressed or 1/4 tsp. powdered garlic
4  drops Tabasco sauce
preparation
      Cut wings at joints; remove wing tip.  Wash and pat dry. Combine remaining ingredients in a 9 x 13-inch pan.  Arrange wings, single layer, in marinade.  Cover and refrigerate several hours.  Bake, uncovered, at 370°  for about 30 to 40 minutes. Serves 6 to 8.

BARBECUE BEEF ON THE GRILL
ingredients
4 to 6  lb. loin-eye or rib-eye beef roast
  Worcestershire sauce
  garlic salt
  black pepper
preparation
      Salt and pepper roast, using a liberal amount of garlic salt. Marinate in Worcestershire sauce 24 hours or more.  Use enough Worcestershire sauce to cover meat.  You may use a plastic bag to help keep sauce in contact with meat.  Cook in covered charcoal grill for 2 1/2 to 3 hours or until done.  Slice in 1/2 to 3/4 inch thick slices and serve hot.

APPLE PEACH PLUM CAKE
ingredients
1  c. flour
1  pinch salt
1  tsp. baking powder
4  tsp. sugar
1/4  c. butter
1  egg and enough milk to measure 2/3 c.
  apple, peach and plum fruit slices
  sugar and cinnamon
preparation
      Mix together flour, salt, baking powder and sugar.  Blend in butter.  Break egg in cup and add enough milk to measure 2/3 cup. Mix together.  Pour into pan.  Overlap fruit slices.  Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon.  Bake at 375° for 25 to 30 minutes.

CHILLED SUMMER SQUASH SOUP
ingredients
4  medium zucchini, washed and cut into 1-inch slices
1  large yellow crookneck squash, washed and cut into 1-inch slices
1  pattypan squash, quartered
1  large onion, thinly sliced
1  tsp. finely minced garlic
3 to 3 1/2  c. chicken broth
  salt and freshly ground white pepper to taste
2  Tbsp. finely chopped fresh basil
2  Tbsp. finely chopped fresh parsley
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  c. buttermilk
preparation
      In a large saucepan, place all the squash.  Add the onion, garlic, broth, salt and pepper.  Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes or until the vegetables are very tender.  Allow to cool slightly; puree in a food processor or blender with basil, parsley and lemon juice until smooth.  Place in a container, cover and refrigerate for 6 hours or overnight.  When ready to serve, add the buttermilk.  Whisk until smooth and adjust the seasonings with salt and pepper.  Serve chilled and garnished with chopped basil and parsley.  Serves 6.

GRILLED VEAL CHOPS
ingredients
4  veal chops, cut 1-inch thick and well trimmed
  salt and freshly ground pepper
1 1/2  Tbsp. olive oil
1  tsp. crumbled Herbes de Provence*
preparation
      Preheat an outdoor grill or a broiler.  Place the veal chops in a shallow dish and season with salt and pepper.  Combine the oil with Herbes de Provence and brush lightly over both sides of the chops.  Allow to sit for 15 to 20 minutes at room temperature. Grill the chops for 5 to 6 minutes per side or until the desired degree of doneness.  Serve hot, garnished with parsley or other fresh herbs.  Serves 4.
      *This is a French blend of herbs available in gourmet food shops and some supermarkets.  If you can't find it, substitute a blend of 1 tablespoon each crumbled dried basil, oregano and thyme and 1/2 teaspoon each crumbled dried sage and ground rosemary; a pinch of dried lavender is optional.

CHICKEN NOODLE AND VEGETABLE SOUP
ingredients
2 (14 1/2 oz.)  cans chicken broth
8  oz. boned skinless chicken breast halves
1  medium carrot, thinly sliced
1  stalk celery, thinly sliced
1/4  tsp. dried rosemary, crushed
1/4  tsp. dried basil, crushed
  dash of poultry seasoning
1  oz. fine noodles (1/2 c.)
preparation
      In a large saucepan, bring broth to boiling.  Cut chicken into 1/2-inch cubes and add to broth.  Add carrot, celery, chicken, rosemary, basil and poultry seasoning and bring to boiling.  When broth boils, reduce heat.  Add noodles.  Cover and simmer for 5 to 7 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink and noodles are tender.  Serves 3.
      Per Serving:  178 Calories, 3 g. Fat, 53 mg.  Cholesterol and 945 mg.  Sodium.

CHOCOLATE PUMPKIN NUT BREAD
ingredients
1 2/3  c. flour
1  Tbsp. pumpkin pie spice
1  tsp. baking soda
3/4  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. baking powder
1 1/2  c. sugar
1/2  c. oil
2  eggs
1  c. canned pumpkin
1  c. chocolate chips
1/2  c. toasted almonds
preparation
      Mix flour, spice, soda, salt and baking powder.  Beat sugar, oil and eggs in a large bowl.  Beat in pumpkin and 1/3 cup water. Stir in flour mixture, then chocolate chips and nuts.  Scrape into greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.  Bake at 350° for about 70 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.  Cool in pan for 15 minutes.  Turn out on wire rack and cool completely. Freezes well.

"LITE" CREAMED POTATOES
ingredients
4  medium potatoes, peeled and chunked
1/3  c. water
  salt
1/4 to 1/3  c. fat-free Ranch dressing (bottled)
  liquid from potatoes as needed
  Molly McButter as needed
preparation
      Steam (covered) boil potatoes in small amount of salted water. (A chicken bouillon cube can be substituted for salt.)  When tender, drain, retaining liquid.  Add Ranch dressing (more or less as needed) and beat potatoes with electric mixer.  If needed, add small amounts of retained liquid (or skim milk if desired) until of desired consistency.  Add butter sprinkles to taste.

GRILLED STEAK WITH MUSTARD MARINADE
ingredients
4  lb. lean flank steak, well trimmed
1/4  c. grainy-style Dijon mustard
2  Tbsp. lime juice
1 1/2  Tbsp. reduced-sodium soy sauce
1  Tbsp. hoisin sauce
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  tsp. finely minced garlic
1  tsp. finely minced fresh ginger
  freshly ground pepper to taste
preparation
      Place the steak in a large glass or ceramic dish.  In a medium bowl, whisk the remaining ingredients together.  Pour over the meat; coat both sides.  Cover and allow to marinate at room temperature for 1 hour or in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours. Preheat an outdoor grill or a broiler.  Remove the steak from the marinade and grill for 5 minutes on each side or until cooked to the desired doneness, basting occasionally with the marinade. Serve immediately, sliced on the bias.  Serves 8.

SAVORY CHICKEN AND DUMPLINGS
ingredients
1  c. cooked chicken
1  can cream of chicken soup
1  c. chicken broth
1  c. frozen peas and carrots
2  stems celery, cut
2  Tbsp. dried minced onion
1/4  tsp. summer savory
1/8  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Combine  ingredients  in large saucepan. Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
Dumplings:
ingredients
1  c. biscuit mix
1/3  c. milk
1/8  tsp. savory
1/8  tsp. sage
preparation
      Combine biscuit mix, milk and herbs.  Stir lightly with fork and drop by spoonfuls onto chicken mixture.  Cook, uncovered, 10 minutes.  Cover and cook for 10 minutes more.  Serves 4 to 6.
      Per Serving:  204 Calories, 7 g. Fat (33%), 26 mg.  Cholesterol and 911 mg.  Sodium.

CHUNKY BARBECUE BEEF
(Serves 8)  
ingredients
1 3/4  lb. lean beef, cubed
1 1/2  oz. pkg. dry onion soup mix
2 1/2  c. tomato juice
1/2  c. water
1/2  c. catsup
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Brown meat in skillet sprayed with vegetable pan spray.  Add remaining ingredients; mix.  Place in 2-quart casserole dish; cover.  Bake at 325° for 2 hours, adding water if necessary.  Serve over rice, noodles or potatoes.
      Exchanges:  3 lean meat, 1/2 vegetable, 1/2 bread, 1/2 fat. (One-half cup serving of rice, noodles or potatoes equals 1 bread.)

CORN TIMBALES
ingredients
2  slightly beaten eggs
1  c. skim milk
1/4  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
1 (12 oz.)  can whole kernel corn, drained (can use 1/2 c. of another cooked or canned vegetable)
1/4  c. sliced green onions
2  Tbsp. fine dry bread crumbs
2  Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese
2  tsp. margarine, melted
preparation
      In a medium mixing bowl, stir together eggs, milk, salt and pepper.  Stir in corn and green onions (may set aside some corn and green onions for garnish).  Spray 2 (12-ounce) casseroles with nonstick coating.  Divide egg mixture between the two.  Bake, uncovered, at 325° for 25 minutes.
      Stir together bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese and margarine.  Put on top of baked casseroles.  Put back in oven for 15 minutes more or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.  Garnish with reserved corn and onions.  Makes 2 servings.
      Per Serving:  348 Calories, 14 g. Fat, 282 mg.  Cholesterol and 628 mg.  Sodium.

ROMAINE-VEGETABLE SALAD
ingredients
1/2  small head romaine lettuce
2  stalks celery, thinly sliced
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. loose-pack frozen broccoli, red peppers, bamboo shoots and straw mushrooms
2  Tbsp. water
1  Tbsp. white wine vinegar
1  Tbsp. cooking oil
2  tsp. soy sauce
1/4  tsp. five-spice powder
preparation
      Dressing:  Mix vinegar, oil, soy sauce and five-spice powder in a custard cup or small bowl; set aside.
      Clean and tear romaine into bite-size pieces (makes about 3 cups).  In a 12-inch skillet combine frozen vegetables and water. Cook over medium-high heat for 3 to 4 minutes or until thawed and just heated through, stirring occasionally.  Reduce heat to medium. Stir in dressing and add romaine and celery.  Carefully toss about 30 seconds or until romaine begins to wilt.  Makes 6 servings.
      To Serve:  Immediately spoon romaine mixture onto salad plates.
      Per Serving:  49 Calories, 2 g. Fat, 0 mg.  Cholesterol and 149 mg.  Sodium.

BEER FISH BATTER
ingredients
1 1/2  c. flour
1  c. Italian bread crumbs
3  eggs
3  tsp. baking powder
1  tsp. lemon pepper seasoning
1  can stale or flat beer
preparation
      Combine all ingredients.  If batter is too thick, use water to thin.  Dip fish in batter and deep fry in hot oil.  Delicious with all vegetables:  broccoli, peppers, parsley, mushrooms, onions, etc.

SLUSH DRINK
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
2  c. tea (made with 4 tea bags)
3/4  c. sugar
7  c. water
4  c. whiskey
preparation
      Mix together and put into freezer.  When frozen, add 1 ice cream scoop of slush to glass and fill with Sprite, 7-Up or ginger ale.

PIZZA IN A POCKET
ingredients
1  pkg. pita bread (10 to 12)
2  lb. Mozzarella cheese, shredded
1  onion, diced
1  medium green pepper, diced
1  pkg. pepperoni, sliced
1/2 to 1  lb. sausage, cooked
1/2  lb. mushrooms, sliced
2  cans pizza sauce
preparation
      Place all ingredients in separate bowls and have the children create their own pizzas.  Place on cookie sheet and bake at 400° until cheese is melted.  Great idea for sleepovers and birthday parties.

APPLE NUT DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. sugar
3/4  c. sifted flour
2  tsp. baking powder
1  Tbsp. softened shortening
1/2  c. evaporated milk
1  tsp. vanilla
3  c. chopped, peeled apples
1/2  c. broken nutmeats
2  Tbsp. brown sugar
2  Tbsp. softened butter
1/3  c. flour
preparation
      Mix sugar, sifted flour, baking powder, shortening, evaporated milk and vanilla with a fork until well blended.  Stir in chopped apples and nuts until well coated with batter.  Spread evenly in greased 9-inch pan.  Combine brown sugar, softened butter and the 1/3 cup flour; sprinkle over apple mixture in pan.  Bake in 400° oven for 30 to 35 minutes, until top is golden brown.  Serve with cream or ice cream.

FIRST CLASS PASTA SAUCE
ingredients
1  lb. lean ground beef
1  c. chopped onion
1  large garlic clove, crushed
1 (28 oz.)  can whole, peeled tomatoes and juice
2 (6 oz.)  cans tomato paste
1  c. water
1  c. sliced fresh mushrooms
1  bay leaf
1  tsp. dried oregano leaves
1/2  tsp. dried basil leaves
1  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
1  lb. cooked, drained pasta
1/2  c. grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Brown ground beef with onion and garlic in large saucepan. Drain fat.  Cut up tomatoes; add tomatoes and juice, tomato paste, water, mushrooms, bay leaf, oregano, basil, salt and pepper.  Heat to boiling.  Reduce heat and cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally, 30 minutes.  Remove bay leaf.  Serve over cooked pasta.  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Makes 8 servings.

THANKSGIVING TURKEY
ingredients
  turkey
1  unpeeled quartered apple
3  stalks celery
1  onion
preparation
      This is for any size turkey so long as you have a roaster large enough to hold it with the lid tightly fitting; no foil cover please.  It will work with a gas or electric stove if your oven registers the correct temperature.
      Preheat oven to 475°, very hot.  About nine or ten o'clock, place turkey that has been completely thawed and allowed to come near to room temperature in a covered roaster.  Place an unpeeled quartered apple, 3 stalks of celery and an onion in the cavity. Melt 1 stick of butter and pour over turkey after it has been salted and peppered.  Add 1 quart of warm water.  Cover tightly and bake for 1 hour.
      Turn off oven.  Do not open oven door, leave all night.  In the morning when you look at it, it will be a golden brown.  You will have plenty of broth for dressing and gravy and the tenderest turkey you ever tasted.

"LITE" CARROT CAKE
ingredients
2  c. all-purpose flour
3/4  c. + 2 Tbsp. sugar
1  tsp. baking powder
1  tsp. baking soda
1/2  tsp. salt
2  tsp. cinnamon
3  c. shredded carrots
1/4  c. corn oil
4  egg whites
1 (8 oz.)  can unsweetened crushed pineapple
preparation
      You will also need vegetable cooking spray.
      Preheat oven at 350°.  Coat a (13 x 9 x 2-inch) baking pan with cooking spray.  Combine dry ingredients in a large mixer bowl, stirring well.  Set aside.  Drain pineapple, reserving 1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons juice.  Set pineapple and juice aside.  Add carrots, oil, egg whites and pineapple to dry ingredients.  Mix until moistened; beat at medium speed of an electric mixer for 2 minutes.  Pour into prepared baking pan.
      Bake in 325° oven for 50 to 60 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.  Cool thoroughly on wire rack. Frost with cream cheese frosting.
Frosting for "Lite" Carrot Cake:
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. light cream cheese
3/4  c. powdered sugar
1  tsp. vanilla extract
1  Tbsp. reserved pineapple juice
preparation
      Beat cream cheese, powdered sugar and pineapple juice until smooth.  Stir in vanilla.  Spread over cake.
      Yields 16 servings with 207 calories, 36 grams carbohydrates, 69% calories from carbohydrates, 21 grams sugars, 15 grams complex carbohydrates, 5 grams fat, 22.6% calories from fat and 7 mg cholesterol.

BAKED FISH WITH PAPAYA SALSA
ingredients
1 1/2 to 2  lb. thick, firm, fleshy fish fillets (sea bass, snapper, halibut, orange roughy)
1  c. Papaya Salsa
preparation
      Preheat the oven to 350°.  Place the fish in a baking dish. Spread the salsa on top.  Cover with foil and bake for 10 minutes. Remove the foil and continue to bake for 5 to 10 minutes longer or until the fish is tender and flaky.  Serve hot, garnished with cilantro sprigs.  Serves 4.

BUNNY PATCH DESSERT
ingredients
1 (10.75 oz.)  pkg. frozen pound cake, thawed
1 (21 oz.)  can pie filling (any flavor)
1  box Cool Whip
1  c. coconut
  green food coloring
  jelly beans, assorted Easter candies and decorations
preparation
      Slice cake into 10 slices.  Line bottom of 12 x 8-inch baking dish with cake slices.  Top with pie filling and all of the whipped topping.  Refrigerate 1 hour or until ready to serve.  Tint coconut pale green with food coloring.  Sprinkle over center of whipped topping.  Decorate with jelly beans, Easter candies and decorations.

ORANGE SLUSH DRINK
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1  c. water
1  c. milk
1  tsp. vanilla
  several ice cubes
preparation
      Mix and blend in blender until a thick slush.  Serve.

CRESCENT ROLL PASTRY
ingredients
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened (to room temperature)
2 (8 oz. each)  pkg. crescent rolls
1  egg yolk (save white)
3/4  c. granulated sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      Spray 13 x 9-inch pan with vegetable spray.  Mix cream cheese, egg yolk, sugar and vanilla together in electric mixer until well blended.  Place 1 package crescent rolls on bottom of pan.  Spread cream cheese mixture on top.  Place the package of crescent rolls on top of cream cheese mixture.  Brush top with egg white.  Bake in preheated 350° oven for 30 minutes until top is golden brown.

3 QUICK AND EASY FRUIT DESSERTS
No 1:
ingredients
1  pt. vanilla ice cream
2  c. champagne
1/2  c. chopped peaches
preparation
      Mix in a blender until smooth.
No 2:
ingredients
  raspberry jam
  a little Grand Marnier
  sliced peaches
  vanilla ice cream
preparation
      Mix jam with Grand Marnier.  Add peaches.  Serve over vanilla ice cream.
No 3:
ingredients
  strawberries, blueberries, sliced plums and nectarines
  sugar
  sweet white wine
preparation
      Mix fruits together in a glass dish.  Sprinkle with sugar and top with white wine.  Bake at 325° for 20 minutes.
      These are 3 separate simple fruit desserts.

ORANGE BRUSSELS SPROUTS
ingredients
1/2  lb. Brussels sprouts or 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen Brussels sprouts*
1/4  c. chopped onion
1/8  tsp. salt (optional)
2  tsp. margarine
1/2  tsp. finely shredded orange peel
2  Tbsp. orange juice
1  Tbsp. sliced almonds, toasted
preparation
      *If using fresh Brussels sprouts, trim stems and remove wilted or discolored leaves.  Wash Brussels sprouts and cut large ones in half lengthwise.
      Cook  fresh  or  frozen Brussels sprouts with onion and salt (if  desired)  in  a small amount of boiling water until crisp-tender   (about  9  to  11  minutes).  Drain  well.  Add margarine  and orange peel; toss to coat. Stir in orange juice and nuts.  Makes 5 servings.
      Per Serving:  44 Calories, 2 g. Fat, 0 mg.  Cholesterol and 28 mg.  Sodium.

Spinach Dip
  
Servings: 4
Cuisine: American
ingredients
1  (12 oz.) carton 1% low-fat cottage cheese 
1  (10 oz.) pkg. frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained 
1/2  c. low-fat sour cream 
1/4  c. dry vegetable soup mix 
1  tsp. lemon juice 
1  (10 oz.) can water chestnuts, drained and chopped 
preparation
Process in food processor the cottage cheese. Place in bowl. Press spinach between paper towels until barely moist. Add spinach and remaining ingredients to cheese. Stir; cover and refrigerate 3 hours. Serve with crackers or raw vegetables. Yields 3 cups.
Per Serving (1 Tablespoon): 14 Calories and .4 g. Fat.
notes
   
wer54w66sf32re2

CHRISTMAS ORNAMENTS
ingredients
2  c. flour
1/2  tsp. baking soda
1/2  tsp. salt
2  c. warm water
preparation
      You will need cookie cutters, a small paintbrush, paints, glitter and ribbon.
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Blend all ingredients until well mixed. You may have to add more flour if too wet or more water if too dry. Flour working area and roll dough out until 1/4-inch thick.  Dip cookie cutters in the flour and cut out ornaments.  Place on lightly greased cookie sheet.  Use the end of the paintbrush to punch a hole in the top to hang by.  Decorate with paints, glitter and ribbon.

VORT LIMPA FAVORITE CHRISTMAS BREAD
ingredients
1 1/2  c. stout or ale (can use Coke)
1  Tbsp. anise seed, finely crushed
2  Tbsp. shortening
1/2  c. dark corn syrup or light Brer Rabbit molasses
  grated rind of one orange
1/4  c. sugar
1/4  tsp. salt
4  c. sifted all-purpose flour
2  c. sifted medium rye flour
1 cake compressed yeast or 1  pkg. dry yeast (as directed when using dry yeast)
1/4  c. lukewarm water
preparation
      Mix stout or ale, anise seed and shortening in saucepan; heat to lukewarm.  Pour into large mixing bowl.  Add sugar, orange rind, syrup and salt.  Mix well.  Add 2 cups white flour and 1 cup rye flour.  Beat until smooth.  Dissolve yeast in warm water and add to first mixture.  Beat until thoroughly mixed; add remaining flour. Turn dough out on lightly floured board.  Knead until smooth and satiny (elastic to the touch) using only enough flour to keep from sticking to hands.  This must be done quickly, but thoroughly. Place in well-greased large bowl.  Turn dough over to grease both sides of dough.  Cover and let rise until double in bulk.  Putting bowl over warm (not too hot) water quickens rising.  Let rise about 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until double in bulk.  Shape into two loaves about 12-inches long.  Place in greased pans.  Can be baked on large cookie sheet, greased; grease between loaves, place loaves close together.  Let rise until double in bulk, about 1 hour.  Bake in moderate oven preheated to 350° about 45 to 60 minutes.  Remove from oven at once and turn out on cloth covered board.  Brush lightly with hot water.  Cover and let cool.  This recipe came from Sweden.  Seems complicated, but very simple once you've made it.

"QUICK AND EASY CHERRY FLUFF"
ingredients
1  can cherry pie filling
1  can Eagle Brand milk
8  oz. can crushed pineapple
8  oz. Cool Whip
1  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Blend all ingredients together and chill.

RICE FOR SUSHI
ingredients
3  c. cooked Japanese style rice
3/4  c. white vinegar
1/3  c. plus 2 Tbsp. sugar
2  Tbsp. salt
2  tsp. monosodium glutamate
1  pkg. yeast
1/4  c. warm water
3 1/2  c. unsifted flour
1  tsp. salt
3/4  c. sugar
1  c. (1/2 lb.) butter
2  eggs, slightly beaten
3/4  c. sour cream
2  tsp. vanilla
  flour
preparation
      Soften yeast in warm water.  Sift flour, salt and 1/4 cup of the sugar into a large bowl.  Cut in butter until mixture resembles fine crumbs.  Stir in yeast mixture, eggs, sour cream and vanilla to make a smooth dough; form into a ball.  Seal in plastic.  Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.  Divide dough in half; wrap and return half to refrigerator.  Roll on a lightly floured board to 12 x 18-inches.  Fold in thirds.  Roll out again on floured board to same size, repeat folding.  Repeat process 1 more time; cut in half to form two 6-inch squares.  Turn in corners to form circle.  Sprinkle board with about 2 tablespoons of sugar.  Roll out to a 12-inch circle.  Cut in 8 wedges.  Roll up each wedge and place on greased baking sheet. Repeat until all is rolled.  Let rolls rise until puffy (about 45 minutes).  Bake at 375° for 12 to 15 minutes, until golden brown. Makes 32 crescents.

FRENCH CHERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1  lb. crushed graham crackers
1 1/2  sticks melted butter
2  Tbsp. sugar
2  pkg. Dream Whip
1 1/2  c. powdered sugar
1 large  pkg. cream cheese
2  cans cherry pie filling
preparation
      Mix cracker crumbs, melted butter and sugar together.  Press into bottom of 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 8 minutes. Set aside to cool.  Mix Dream Whip.  Mix powdered sugar with cream cheese, which has been softened to room temperature.  Blend Dream Whip with cream cheese mixture.  Spread over cracker crumb crust and top with cherry pie filling.  Chill.

"FEATHER LITE" PANCAKES
ingredients
1  c. flour
2  Tbsp. baking powder
2  Tbsp. sugar
1/2  tsp. salt (optional)
1  beaten egg
1  c. milk
2  Tbsp. salad oil
preparation
      Add dry ingredients to liquid; beat smooth.  Bake on hot griddle.  Yields 10 pancakes (6-inches each).

CHOCOLATE DIPPED STRAWBERRIES
  
Servings: 4
ingredients
1/4  c. semi-sweet chocolate chips 
2  Tbsp. oil 
1/4  c. milk chocolate chips 
1  tsp. vanilla 
1  pt. strawberries (do not remove stems) 
preparation
In the top of a double boiler, put first 3 ingredients. Heat until liquid. Take off stove and add the vanilla. Dip the strawberries and set them on wax paper until chocolate is hardened.
notes
   
wer54w66sf32re2

NO ROLL PASTRY
ingredients
2  c. flour
1  tsp. salt
3/4  c. shortening
2 to 3  Tbsp. cold water
preparation
      Mix in medium bowl with fork.  Stir flour and salt.  Add shortening and mix until it resembles coarse crumbs.  Reserve 1 cup mixture.  Sprinkle 2 to 3 tablespoons cold water into flour mixture, a tablespoon at a time, mixing lightly with fork after each addition until pastry is moist enough to hold together. Press to bottom and sides of 8-inch or 9-inch pie plate; flute edges.  Fill crust with fruit, mincemeat or pumpkin filling; sprinkle reserved flour on top.

DILL DIP
ingredients
1  c. low-fat cottage cheese
2  Tbsp. sliced green onion
2  Tbsp. snipped fresh parsley
1  tsp. dried dill weed
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/4  tsp. pepper
  dash of garlic powder
preparation
      Place ingredients in a food processor or blender; cover and blend or process until smooth.  Chill, covered, for at least 1 hour before serving.  Makes 8 (2 tablespoon) servings.
      Serve with assorted sliced raw vegetables or crackers.
      Per Serving:  27 Calories, 1 g. Fat, 2 mg.  Cholesterol and 122 mg.  Sodium.

CURRIED ASPARAGUS SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. asparagus, tough ends trimmed, cut into 2-inch pieces
4  c. strong chicken broth
4  scallions, coarsely chopped (green and white parts included)
3  Tbsp. chopped fresh chives or scallion greens
2  tsp. lemon juice
1 to 2  tsp. curry powder or to taste
  salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
preparation
      In a medium saucepan, place the asparagus, broth and greens and bring to a boil.  Cover, reduce heat and simmer slowly for 12 to 15 minutes or until the vegetables are very tender.  Place the mixture in a food processor or blender and add the lemon juice and seasonings.  Puree until smooth.  Serve hot immediately or chill.

"QUICK AND EASY" MEXICAN CASSEROLE
ingredients
2  lb. hamburger meat
2  cans cream of mushroom soup
2  cans cream of chicken soup (be sure it's condensed)
1 or 2  cans green chilies, chopped (optional)
1  whole moon Cheddar cheese
1  onion
1  bag round tortilla chips
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Brown hamburger and drain grease.  Mix all soups and green chilies with meat; stir and simmer until hot. Grate cheese and cut your onion up (not too small).  You'll need a large, deep pan.  Put some chips in the pan (enough to cover bottom).  Put some mixture on top of the chips (use sparingly). Put onion and cheese over this; do not mix together.  (Be sure and save some onion and cheese.)
      After the cheese, you'll repeat it:  chips, mixture, onion and cheese (lots of cheese).  Put in oven for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted.  Great with picante sauce, refried beans, rice, etc.

CHRISTMAS DAMPER
ingredients
2  c. self-rising flour
1/2  tsp. salt
2  tsp. sugar
1  Tbsp. butter
1  c. milk or water (enough to make a medium or soft dough)
1  tsp. bicarbonate soda
preparation
      Rub the butter into the flour.  Knead.  Mould into a Christmassy shape (a wreath or a star).  Bake in hot oven (or in ashes if you are cooking it in a fire).  Cook for 20 minutes until brown.  Serve with butter and jam, honey or golden syrup.

APPETIZER CHICKEN WINGS
ingredients
25  chicken wings, tips discarded
3/4  c. beef bouillon
1/4  c. brown sugar
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
2  Tbsp. soy sauce
1/4  tsp. ginger
preparation
      Marinate wings in sauce (made by mixing balance of ingredients) at least 1 hour in glass bowl. Bake, uncovered, in liquid until it disappears and wings are brown at 350° (about 1 1/2 hours).

SPINACH DIP
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  carton 1% low-fat cottage cheese
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
1/2  c. low-fat sour cream
1/4  c. dry vegetable soup mix
1  tsp. lemon juice
1 (10 oz.)  can water chestnuts, drained and chopped
preparation
      Process in food processor the cottage cheese.  Place in bowl. Press spinach between paper towels until barely moist.  Add spinach and remaining ingredients to cheese.  Stir; cover and refrigerate 3 hours.  Serve with crackers or raw vegetables.  Yields 3 cups.
      Per Serving (1 Tablespoon):  14 Calories and .4 g. Fat.

CREAM OF CHICKEN SOUP
ingredients
6  Tbsp. butter or margarine
6  Tbsp. all-purpose flour
5  chicken bouillon cubes
3  c. boiling water
1  c. milk
1  c. finely diced, cooked chicken
  dash of pepper
preparation
      Melt butter in saucepan.  Blend in flour.  Dissolve bouillon cubes in boiling water.  Add with milk to saucepan.  Cook, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and boils.  Cook and stir for 2 minutes.  Reduce heat and stir in chicken and pepper.  Return to boiling.  Serve immediately.  Makes 4 or 5 servings.

INARI SUSHI SUBSTITUTE
ingredients
2 1/4  c. short grain rice
4  Tbsp. rice vinegar
6  Tbsp. sugar
1/2  tsp. salt
1  small carrot
8  pockets "abura age" (a soy bean product)
1 1/2  c. "dashi" (bouillon) soup
3  Tbsp. soy sauce
1  Tbsp. mirin
  pinch of salt
preparation
      Cook rice as directed.  Make vinegar mixture by heating vinegar, 2 tablespoons sugar and salt (1/2 teaspoon) to boiling point.  Mix hot rice and hot vinegar mixture and cool in a large shallow container.  Prepare carrots, cutting them into long narrow sticks, boiling them slightly. Drain.  Cut "abura age" pockets in half to open up.  Cook for 2 to 3 minutes to boil out grease.  In another pan, put in the "dashi" soup, pinch of salt, 4 tablespoons sugar, soy sauce and the boiled "abura age." Cover and boil on low heat until only a little liquid is left.  Stir in 1 tablespoon mirin. Cook 1 minute and cool.  Put the rice into the "abura age" pockets.  Serve.  Makes about 16 bags or pockets.

INDIAN CURRIED CHICKEN AND BROCCOLI
ingredients
4  boned, skinless chicken breast halves or turkey breast tenderloin steaks (about 1 lb. total)
1/2  c. plain low-fat yogurt
1  Tbsp. all-purpose flour
2  Tbsp. water
1  tsp. curry powder
1/2  tsp. bottled minced garlic or 1/8 tsp. garlic powder
1/4  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. dried finely shredded lemon peel
  dash of paprika
2 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen broccoli spears, cooked according to pkg. directions and drained
1/4  c. peanuts, chopped
preparation
      Preheat oven to 400°.  Put chicken or turkey in a shallow baking dish, cover with foil and bake at 400° for 20 to 25 minutes until meat is tender and no longer pink.  Combine yogurt and flour; set aside.  Stir water, curry powder, garlic, salt, lemon peel and paprika together in saucepan and bring to boiling.  Reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 1 minute.  Add yogurt mixture.  Cook until mixture is thickened and bubbly; continue cooking for 1 more minute.  Arrange broccoli on a serving platter; place poultry on top.  Pour sauce over poultry and top with peanuts.  Makes 4 servings.
      Per Serving:  247 Calories, 7 g. Fat, 68 mg.  Cholesterol and 255 mg.  Sodium.

QUICKIE LAYERED SUSHI
ingredients
3 3/4  c. rice
3 3/4  c. water
1  pkg. Shiofuke Konbu
1/3  c. Furikake Nori
1/2  c. Takuwan, diced
preparation
      Cook rice.  Line a 9 x 13-inch cake pan with waxed paper. Spread Konbu and Nori evenly on the bottom.  While rice is still hot, spread half of rice in pan over the Konbu and Nori mixture. Pack down slightly.  Spread diced Takuwan over the rice and cover with the remaining half of rice.  Pack rice down so that the layers will stick together and hold its shape.
      When rice is cool, or when ready to serve, invert pan over a tray or platter.  The Konbu-Nori part will be on top.  Remove the waxed paper and cut Sushi into squares.  Yield: approximately 30 (2-inch) squares.

LITTLE PIZZAS
ingredients
6  English muffins, split
1 small  can tomato paste
2  Tbsp. sugar
1  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
2  cloves garlic, diced
4  oz. Mozzarella cheese, grated
1/2  lb. sausage
  oregano
preparation
      Mix  together tomato paste, sugar, salt, Worcestershire sauce and garlic.  Spread thinly on muffins.  Sprinkle cheese over tomato   mixture.   Top  with  sausage.  Sprinkle  with oregano. Bake at 450° about 15 minutes.

NO-ROLL PASTRY
ingredients
1 1/2  c. pastry or all-purpose flour
1  tsp. salt
1 1/2  tsp. sugar
1/2  c. vegetable oil
2  Tbsp. milk
preparation
      Sift directly into a 9-inch pie pan the first 3 ingredients. Mix oil and milk in a cup.  Pour over the flour and mix with a fork until no dry flour shows.  Press with fingers to line pan and sides as evenly as possible.  Fill and bake according to recipe for any one-crust pie.
      To make a baked shell, prick all over with a fork.  Bake 15 minutes at 425°.
      Note:  Do not adjust proportions or a tire patch may result.

MY LITTLE GARDEN SALAD
ingredients
1  small carrot
1/2  apple
  lettuce leaf
2  Tbsp. yogurt
  raisins
preparation
      Let your child arrange the pieces of the cut-up carrot and apple on the lettuce leaf.  Top with yogurt and raisins.  Great for a snack or salad.

MARINATED CHICKEN FOR THE GRILL
ingredients
1  c. pineapple juice
1  c. soy sauce
1/2  c. dry cooking sherry
1/2  c. cooking oil
3  cloves garlic, chopped
3  to 4 bay leaves
2  tsp. onion powder
12  chicken breasts or legs
preparation
      Wash and cut up chicken.  Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.  Add chicken and marinate for several hours.  Drain marinade.  Grill chicken, basting with marinade.
      This chicken is just as good the next day, cold from the fridge.

BROCCOLI-CHEESE-NOODLE SOUP
ingredients
2  Tbsp. butter
3/4  c. chopped onion
6  c. water
6  chicken bouillon cubes
8  oz. fine noodles
1/8  tsp. garlic powder
2  pkg. frozen broccoli
6  c. milk
1  lb. American cheese, cubed
  pepper to taste
preparation
      In a large saucepan, heat butter.  Add onion and sauté for 3 minutes.  Add water and bouillon cubes.  Heat to boiling, until cubes dissolve.  Add broccoli (chopped) and garlic powder.  Cook for 2 minutes.  Add noodles and cook until tender.  Add cheese and stir until melted.  Add milk and pepper.  Stir constantly.  Makes 4 quarts.  May be frozen.

CHOCOLATE COVERED PEANUTS
ingredients
6  oz. semi-sweet chocolate chips
6  oz. butterscotch chips
2  Tbsp. peanut butter
2  c. Spanish peanuts
preparation
      Melt chips and peanut butter over low heat.  Add 2 cups Spanish peanuts.  Drop by spoonfuls on waxed paper.  Let sit in refrigerator about 30 minutes.  Can store at room temperature.

LOW CHOLESTEROL CHICKEN MADEIRA
ingredients
1/2  c. bread crumbs
1/8  tsp. garlic powder
1/8  tsp. rosemary leaves
4  chicken breasts, skinned
1  egg white, slightly beaten
2  Tbsp. cornstarch
  rind of 2 oranges
1 1/2  c. orange juice
1/3  c. Madeira or dry sherry
8  to 10 mushrooms, sliced
preparation
      Mix bread crumbs with garlic powder and rosemary.  Dip the chicken in egg white and roll in seasoned bread crumbs.  Brown both sides of chicken under the broiler.  Place in a shallow baking dish.
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Combine cornstarch, orange rind, orange juice and Madeira or sherry to make sauce.  Pour sauce over browned chicken and bake about 45 minutes, adding mushrooms during last 5 minutes.  Serve chicken with brown rice.  Pour sauce over chicken and rice.  Makes 4 servings.

"LITE" JAMBALAYA
ingredients
1  lb. chicken breast, boneless, skinless and cubed
1  lb. turkey sausage
6  oz. frozen shrimp
1  Tbsp. butter
1  c. onions, chopped
3/4  c. green peppers, chopped
2  cloves garlic, crushed
  salt and pepper to taste
1/8  tsp. ground nutmeg
1/8  tsp. ground cloves
1  qt. chicken broth
1  qt. water
1 1/2  c. rice
1/4  tsp. cayenne pepper
preparation
      In a heavy pan, saute chicken cubes, butter, onions and garlic until chicken is thoroughly cooked.  Add sausage, salt, pepper, nutmeg and cloves and simmer on low heat for 3 to 5 minutes.  Add chicken broth and water and bring to a boil.  Stir in rice; lower heat and simmer, covered, for 20 minutes or until rice is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed.  Stir in shrimp and let them get hot.  Pour into serving dish with cayenne pepper.  Serve hot!

CHOCOLATE DELUXE ZUCCHINI CAKE
ingredients
3  c. flour
1 1/4  tsp. each:  baking powder and baking soda
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. cinnamon
4  eggs
3  c. sugar
1 1/2  c. oil
3  sq. (3 oz.) unsweetened chocolate, melted and cooled
1 1/2  tsp. vanilla
1/2  tsp. almond extract
3  c. coarsely grated or ground zucchini (about 3 medium zucchini)
1  c. chopped nuts
1/2  c. chopped dates
preparation
      Sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon; set aside.  Beat eggs in large bowl until frothy; gradually beat in sugar and oil.  Add chocolate, vanilla and almond extract.  Fold in dry ingredients.  Squeeze excess moisture from zucchini; fold zucchini, nuts and dates into batter.  Pour into greased and floured 10-inch tube pan.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour and 15 minutes (cake will appear moist).  Let stand inverted on wire rack 20 minutes; remove pan.  Cool cake completely.  Frost with butter frosting or a chocolate glaze, if you wish.  Makes 10 to 12 servings.

PIZZA COOKIE
ingredients
1/2  c. butter, softened
3/4  c. firmly packed light or dark brown sugar
1  egg
1 1/4  c. all-purpose flour
1/2  tsp. baking soda
1  c. miniature marshmallows
3/4  c. chocolate covered raisins
3/4  c. chocolate covered peanuts
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Grease a 12-inch pizza pan.  In medium bowl with electric mixer at medium speed, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.  Beat in egg.  Stir in flour and baking soda until well blended.  Spread dough into prepared pan.  Bake 20 minutes or until lightly browned.  Sprinkle marshmallows and candies on cookie during the last 5 minutes of baking.  Cool 10 minutes in pan on wire rack.  To serve, cut cookies into 16 wedges. (Use your imagination, adding more candies, etc.)

HICKORY NUT PIE
ingredients
1  c. hickory nuts (the more the better)
3  eggs
1  c. light syrup
2  Tbsp. butter
1/2  tsp. vanilla
1  c. sugar
1  Tbsp. flour
1  unbaked pie shell
preparation
      Mix ingredients and pour into unbaked pie shell.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.  Serves 6.

1  (8 qt.) box dry milk

2  to 3 c. powdered sugar 
preparation
Mix all ingredients together in gallon jar. Use 2 to 3 tablespoons in a cup of hot water.

LOW CALORIE BEEF/CHICKEN GRAVY
ingredients
1  c. beef or chicken bouillon
2  Tbsp. cold water
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
1  tsp. dehydrated onion flakes
preparation
      Add onion flakes to bouillon.  Bring to a boil.  Dissolve cornstarch in cold water.  Add cornstarch mixture to boiling bouillon.  Simmer until gravy thickens, stirring constantly, about 2 minutes.  Yields 1 cup.  Calories:  Negligible.  For diabetics: Exchanges:  Free.

CHOCOLATE DRINK MIX
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  box instant chocolate powder
1 (8 qt.)  box powdered milk
1 (6 oz.)  jar powdered cream
1/2  c. powdered sugar
preparation
      Combine all ingredients and mix well.  Store in airtight container.  To serve:  Use 1/3 cup mix to 1 cup hot water.

CHICKEN CACCIATORE
ingredients
3  chicken breasts, split
1 1/2  c. cooked down tomato juice
5  oz. onion, diced fine
4  oz. carrots, diced fine
1/4  c. green pepper, diced fine
1  oz. white wine vinegar (add a little basil)
1  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
1/4  tsp. garlic powder or 1 clove fresh garlic
1/2  tsp. basil
1/4  tsp. oregano
1/2  lb. or 4 oz. can mushrooms, drained
1/2  envelope Sweet 'N Low
preparation
      Broil chicken, skin side up, for 5 to 10 minutes.  Make a sauce of all the other ingredients except mushrooms and Sweet 'N Low. Add chicken to sauce and simmer in covered skillet for 3/4 hour. Add mushrooms.  Cook uncovered for 10 to 15 minutes.  Add Sweet 'N Low and serve.  Serves 3. Each portion contains 3 ounces of dinner vegetable.  Freezes well if made ahead.

CHOCOLATE COCONUT CAKE
ingredients
1  pkg. golden pound cake mix
1/3  c. dairy sour cream
2/3  c. water
3  sq. (1 oz. each) semi-sweet chocolate, melted and cooled
2  eggs
1/3  c. flaked coconut
1  sq. (1 oz.) semi-sweet chocolate, melted
2  Tbsp. honey or light corn syrup
  flaked coconut (if desired)
preparation
      Heat oven to 325°.  Generously grease and flour 12-cup Bundt cake pan.  Beat cake mix (dry), sour cream, water, chocolate and eggs on low speed, scraping bowl constantly, until moistened.  Beat on medium speed, scraping bowl frequently, 3 minutes.  Fold in coconut.  Pour into pan.  Bake until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, 45 to 50 minutes.  Cool 10 minutes; remove from pan.  Cool completely.  Mix chocolate and honey; drizzle over cake. Sprinkle with coconut.

DIP FOR FRESH FRUIT
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  carton plain low-fat yogurt
1/4  c. unsweetened applesauce
1  Tbsp. powdered sugar
1/8  tsp. ground cinnamon, nutmeg or ginger
1/2  tsp. vanilla
3  c. assorted sliced fresh fruit (such as pineapple chunks, strawberries, apple slices and peach slices)
preparation
      In small bowl, stir together the first 5 ingredients.  Makes 6 (3 tablespoon) servings.
      To  Serve:  Spear  fruit with toothpicks, then dip into yogurt mixture.
      Per Serving:  87 Calories, 1 g. Fat, 2 mg.  Cholesterol and 28 mg.  Sodium.

HOLIDAY DIP
ingredients
3 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
3 (6 1/2 oz.)  cans crabmeat, drained
2  Tbsp. prepared mustard
1  Tbsp. powdered sugar
1/2  c. mayonnaise
1/2  c. white wine
1  Tbsp. onion juice
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Melt cream cheese in double boiler or soften in microwave. Add all other ingredients.  Heat until bubbly.  Serve from chafing dish with crackers or vegetables.

LAYERED GARDEN PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1 (7 to 8 oz.)  pkg. macaroni shells
1/2  c. sliced green onions
1/2  c. bacon bits
1  c. mayonnaise
1/4  c. lemon juice
3  tsp. grated Parmesan cheese
1  tsp. sugar
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
4  c. bite size salad greens
1  medium zucchini, sliced
1  c. sliced cauliflowerets
1  c. broccoli flowerets
2  medium tomatoes, cut into wedges
preparation
      Cook macaroni as per package directions and drain.  Rinse with cold water; drain again.  Stir together macaroni, onions and bacon bits in medium bowl.  Mix mayonnaise, lemon juice, cheese, sugar and garlic powder.  In 3 1/2-quart salad bowl, layer salad greens, macaroni mixture, zucchini and cauliflowerets.  On top of this, layer broccoli and tomatoes.  Pour dressing evenly over top.  Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours.  Sprinkle with bacon bits just before serving.  Refrigerate only remaining salad.  Makes 10 servings.

A QUICK, EASY, NOURISHING SUPPER
ingredients
6  to 8 onions
1 1/2  lb. chopped meat
2  cans tomato soup
1  can V-8 juice
1  lb. thin spaghetti
preparation
      Fry sliced onions.  When onions are partially done, put chopepd meat in same pan, break up into small pieces and fry until done.  Add soup and V-8 juice.  Simmer a few minutes and it's ready.  Serves 5 or more.
      One can increase or decrease all of the ingredients as desired. Cook as much spaghetti as you like.

GREEK-STYLE SALAD
ingredients
1  medium tomato, cut into 8 wedges
4  c. torn mixed salad greens
1/2  small red onion, sliced and separated into rings
1/4  small cucumber, sliced
1/4  c. sliced pitted ripe olives
2  Tbsp. reduced-calorie Italian salad dressing
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  Tbsp. water
1/2  tsp. dried mint, crushed
1/4  c. crumbled Feta cheese or 2 Tbsp. crumbled Blue cheese
preparation
      Cut tomato wedges in half crosswise.  Combine them with salad greens,  onion  rings,  cucumber  and olives in a large bowl.
      Dressing:  In a screw-top jar, combine salad dressing, lemon juice, water and mint.  Cover and shake well.  Pour over greens. Toss lightly until coated.
      To  Serve:  Spoon  greens  onto  salad plates. Sprinkle salads with Feta or Blue cheese.  Makes 4 servings.
      Per Serving:  59 Calories, 4 g. Fat, 8 mg.  Cholesterol and 172 mg.  Sodium.

HOT OR COLD SHRIMP PASTA SALAD
ingredients
2  garlic cloves, minced
3  Tbsp. olive oil
1 1/4  lb. small cooked Oregon Bay shrimp
1/2  c. sour cream
1/2  c. fresh or frozen cooked peas
1/4  c. chopped fresh thyme or basil
  salt and pepper to taste
1/2  lb. semolina corkscrew pasta, cooked and drained
preparation
      In a large saucepan, lightly sauté the garlic in olive oil.  Do not brown.  Add shrimp and cook 1 minute.  Add sour cream, peas, thyme, salt and pepper and mix thoroughly.  When heated through (do not boil), either pour over hot, drained pasta or allow to cool and toss with cool cooked pasta.  Serve with a small green salad with herb vinaigrette dressing.  Serves 3.

PASTA-CRAB SALAD
ingredients
2  oz. vermicelli
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. frozen crab meat
1/2  c. thinly sliced celery
1/4  c. low calorie mayonnaise
1  Tbsp. sliced pimiento, drained
1  Tbsp. minced green onion
1/4  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Break vermicelli into 2 inch lengths.  Cook according to directions.  Rinse with cold running water and drain well.  In a medium bowl, toss vermicelli with remaining ingredients.  Cover and chill 20 minutes.  Makes 2 servings.
      Per 1 1/4 cups serving:  269 calories, 694.4 mg sodium, 19.2 g protein, 9.2 g fat and 26.5 g carbohydrates.

"LITE" CRISPY/SPICY BAKED POTATOES
ingredients
4  baking potatoes
1/4  c. oil
1 to 2  Tbsp. Parmesan cheese
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1/8  tsp. pepper
1/4  tsp. paprika
preparation
      Cut unpeeled potatoes in wedges.  Place skin side down in baking dish.  Combine remaining ingredients and pour over potatoes.  Bake 30 minutes at 375°.  Stir occasionally.

DATE-NUT PINWHEELS
Date Mixture:
ingredients
2 1/4  c. chopped dates
1/2  c. sugar
1  c. water
1  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Cook dates, sugar, water.  Add nuts when cool.
Dough:
ingredients
1/2  c. Crisco
1/2  c. margarine
2  eggs
4  c. flour
1/2  tsp. soda
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
      Combine all ingredients for dough.  Roll dough out and spread with date mixture.  Roll up in pinwheel.  Place in wax paper. Leave in refrigerator overnight.  Slice, then bake in 350° oven until lightly browned.

APPLE STRUDEL QUICK AND EASY
ingredients
1  can apple pie filling
8  sheets phyllo pastry
3  Tbsp. butter, melted
  confectioners sugar
preparation
      Preheat oven to 400°.  Grease a baking sheet.  To prepare pastry, unfold sheets of phyllo so they lie flat.  Stack 4 sheets on plastic wrap.  Brush top sheet with butter.  Keep other sheets covered with plastic wrap and damp cloth (to keep from drying out).  Spread 1/2 pie filling on short side of phyllo.  Roll jelly roll style, using plastic wrap as guide.  Repeat with remaining sheets.  Bake until golden, 15 to 20 minutes.  Cool sheets on wire racks for 15 minutes.  Transfer to serving tray until cool. Sprinkle with confectioners sugar.

CREAM CHEESE SUGAR COOKIES
ingredients
1  c. sugar
1  c. margarine or butter, softened
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. almond extract
1/2  tsp. vanilla
1  egg, separated
2 1/4  c. flour
preparation
      In large bowl combine sugar, margarine, cream cheese, salt, almond extract, vanilla and egg yolk; blend well.  Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup; level off.  Stir in flour until well blended.  Chill dough 2 hours.  Heat oven to 375°.  On lightly floured surface, roll out dough 1/3 at a time to 1/8-inch thickness.  Cut into desired shapes with lightly floured cookie cutters.  Place 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets.  Leave cookies plain or, if desired, brush with slightly beaten egg white and sprinkle with colored sugar.  Bake at 375° for 7 to 10 minutes or until light golden brown.  Cool completely.  Frost and decorate, if desired.  Makes 5 to 6 dozen cookies.

DESSERT PIZZA
ingredients
1  c. butter
1  egg
1  tsp. vanilla
1 3/4  c. flour
1/2  c. sugar
1/2  c. brown sugar
1  c. peanuts
1  c. miniature marshmallows
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. chocolate chips
preparation
      Mix butter, egg, vanilla, flour and sugars; bake in an ungreased 13 x 7-inch pan at 375° for 12 minutes.
      Combine peanuts, miniature marshmallows and chocolate chips. Spread this on the batter.  Place back in oven until marshmallows start to turn brown.  Cut in squares.

ON-THE-WING APPETIZERS
ingredients
30  wing drums (drum portion of chicken wing)
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  c. soy sauce
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  Tbsp. sugar
1/2  tsp. ground ginger
5  drops Tabasco sauce
1/4  c. spiced peach syrup
1  tsp. garlic salt
preparation
      Place drums on rack on a foil lined baking sheet.  Sprinkle with salt.  Mix remaining ingredients thoroughly.  Brush marinade generously on drums.  Place in 350°  oven for about 1 hour or until drums are golden brown and tender, brushing frequently with the marinade.

CHRISTMAS WREATH COOKIES
ingredients
1/2  c. melted butter
30  large marshmallows
1/2  tsp. green food coloring
1/2  tsp. vanilla
3  1/2 corn flakes
preparation
      Mix butter, marshmallows, coloring and vanilla in frypan.  Heat until a smooth consistency.  Add corn flakes.  Working quickly with buttered fingers, use a tablespoon to remove some mixture; shape into wreaths and put on waxed paper.  Sprinkle with colored sugar decorating sprinkles.  Be careful; mixture will be hot.

CHRISTMAS PICKLES
ingredients
1 1/4  c. white sugar
1  medium onion, chopped fine
1  tsp. celery seed
3  Tbsp. vinegar
1  Tbsp. prepared horseradish
1  qt. dill pickles
preparation
      Drain 1 quart dill pickles and cut in strips.  Place back in jar and add ingredients.  Leave in refrigerator; shake often to dissolve sugar.

NUT MILK
ingredients
2  c. water
1  Tbsp. vanilla essence
1  c. cashew milk
  honey to taste
preparation
      Blend all ingredients together.  Add water to thicken or dilute based on need.  Chill and serve.  You can substitute walnuts for cashews.  Remove brown shell by soaking in hot water.

HICKORY NUT COOKIES
ingredients
1  lb. butter, softened
1 1/4  c. confectioners sugar, sifted
4  c. cake flour
2  c. hickory nuts (the more the better)
3/4  Tbsp. vanilla
preparation
      Cream butter and sugar.  Stir in flour, nuts and vanilla.  Mix well.  Shape in 1-inch balls.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes at 325°.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

COBBLER FOR PEACH, BLUEBERRY OR BLACKBERRY
ingredients
1  qt. fruit, sweetened to taste
6  Tbsp. softened butter
1  c. flour
1  c. sugar
preparation
      Put fruit in a 9 x 9-inch baking dish.  Preheat oven to 350°. Cream the butter and sugar with a fork.  Blend in the flour with the fork to form little clumps.  Spread over fruit and bake until browned and bubbly.

PARTY SLUSH DRINK
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. raspberry/strawberry Jell-O
1  c. sugar
2  c. water
1  qt. Cold Duck
1  qt. pineapple juice (unsweetened)
4  oz. ReaLemon juice
1/2  tsp. almond extract
preparation
      Boil the Jell-O, water and sugar until dissolved. Add Cold Duck, pineapple juice, lemon juice and extract to this mixture. Mix all ingredients well.  Freeze mixture for 24 hours.  Remove from freezer the afternoon of your event.  Serve mixture as it reaches the slush stage. Re-freeze what you do not drink.

FIG, PEACH AND RASPBERRY COBBLER
ingredients
1  c. Blue Ribbon Calimyrna figs
3  c. peeled and sliced fresh or frozen peaches
2  c. fresh or frozen raspberries
1/4  c. sugar plus 5 Tbsp., divided
1/4  c. water
8  Tbsp. unsalted butter, divided
1 1/2  c. all-purpose flour
2  tsp. baking powder
6  Tbsp. milk
1/2  tsp. ground cinnamon
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°.  Adjust oven rack to middle level. Remove small stem from each fig; cut figs into quarters.  Mix figs with remaining fruit, 1/4 cup sugar and water.  Spoon into 1 1/2-quart shallow baking dish.  Cut 2 tablespoons butter into small pieces and place over top evenly; set aside.
      In medium bowl, stir flour with baking powder and 4 tablespoons sugar.  Cut remaining 6 tablespoons butter into small pieces.  Toss with flour mixture.  Using both hands, press butter between index fingers and thumbs to form thin flakes.  Keep butter coated with flour to prevent softening.  Blend to a crumble.  Stir in milk; blend evenly.  Press dough into a ball.  Dust with flour and roll into a shape that will cover top of baking dish.  Place over fruit, bringing dough to edge of dish.  Cut 4 slits in center with a knife.  Lightly brush top with water.  Stir remaining 1 tablespoon sugar with cinnamon.  Sprinkle over top.  Place in oven and bake 35 to 45 minutes or until top is nicely browned and fruit is tender.  Set aside to cool for 30 minutes before serving. Serve with peach or vanilla ice cream.  Makes 8 servings.

SOUTHERN PARTY POTATOES
ingredients
2  lb. frozen hash browns
1/2  c. melted butter
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/2  c. chopped onion
1  can cream of chicken or cream of celery soup
1  carton sour cream
1 small  jar Cheez Whiz or 2 c. grated cheese
1/4  c. melted butter
2  c. crushed corn flakes
preparation
      Defrost potatoes.  Combine butter, salt, pepper, onion, soup, sour cream and cheese.  Mix thoroughly.  Pour over potatoes in 3-quart casserole.  Mix 1/4 cup butter and corn flakes; sprinkle over top.  Cover and bake at 350° for 45 minutes.  Serves 16.

CABBAGE SOUP
ingredients
1 large  can tomato juice or V-8 juice (32 oz. size)
32  oz. can water
2  Tbsp. beef bouillon (2 cubes)
2  Tbsp. chicken bouillon (2 cubes)
2  Tbsp. parsley flakes
2  Tbsp. minced onion
2  Tbsp. dehydrated green bell pepper
1  tsp. Sweet 'N Low
1/2  tsp. garlic salt or powder
1  head cabbage, shredded
preparation
      Boil first 9 ingredients together slowly for about 1 hour. Then add shredded cabbage and continue cooking for 1/2 hour or so.

SLUSH...FROSTY DRINK
ingredients
1 (48 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1  large frozen orange concentrate
1  large lemonade or fresh juice
6  ripe bananas
1  qt. water
3 1/2  c. white sugar
preparation
      In blender, whiz up all but last 2 ingredients.  Boil last 2 ingredients for 5 minutes.  Mix with rest of ingredients and divide into 2 ice cream pails.  Freeze.  When ready to use, add 2 quarts ginger ale to each portion.  Stir well and serve while still frozen.  Serves 30.

LOW CHOLESTEROL MARINADE FOR FISH
ingredients
  any fresh fish fillets
1/2  c. white wine
1/4  c. corn oil
1/8  tsp. garlic powder
1/4  tsp. dried parsley
1/8  tsp. pepper
  dash of Tabasco sauce
  chopped black olives
  sliced fresh mushrooms
  chopped pimientos
preparation
      Combine the wine, corn oil, garlic powder, parsley, pepper and Tabasco sauce.  Pour over fish in oven pan.  Top with the olives, mushrooms and pimientos.  Let stand in refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours.  Bake fish at 350° for 45 minutes, less if thin pieces, or until fish flakes with fork.

EVERYDAY THANKSGIVING
(Slow Cooker)  
ingredients
1  turkey breast
15  oz. can whole berry cranberry sauce
1  envelope dry onion soup mix
1/2  c. orange juice
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Place turkey in slow cooker. Combine remaining ingredients. Pour over turkey. Cover and cook on low 6 to 8 hours.

FISH TOPPED WITH WINE AND VEGETABLES
ingredients
1/3  c. bulgur wheat
1/2  tsp. instant chicken bouillon granules
1/2  c. water, boiling
1/2  lb. fresh skinless orange roughy, flounder or pike fillets (about 1/2-inch thick)
1/4  tsp. garlic salt
1/4  tsp. dried basil, crushed
1  c. loose-pack frozen broccoli, baby carrots and water chestnuts or frozen cauliflower, broccoli and carrots
1/2  small tomato, chopped
2  Tbsp. dry white wine
preparation
      Combine  bulgur  and  bouillon  granules  in a 10 x 6 x 2-inch baking dish and pour boiling water over the top.  Place fish  on top,  tucking under  any  thin edges.  Sprinkle with garlic  salt and basil.  Place frozen vegetables and tomato on top  of  fish; drizzle with wine.  Cover tightly with foil and bake  in  a preheated  450°  oven  for 25 to 30 minutes (fish should flake easily with fork).  Makes 2 servings.
      Per Serving:  208 Calories, 1 g. Fat, 55 mg.  Cholesterol and 477 mg.  Sodium.

CHICKEN SOUP
ingredients
1  (2 lb.) chicken
1  gal. water (approximately)
1/2  tsp. black pepper
1/2  tsp. salt
2  c. chopped celery with leaves
1/2  c. chopped onion
4  carrots, diced
1  can vegetable beef soup
1  large or 2 medium potatoes, diced
preparation
      Cook chicken in water until easily removed from bones.  Debone and chop meat.  You will need at least 2 cups of poultry.  Pour water and all remaining ingredients into large Dutch oven or pan. Bring to boil, then simmer until all vegetables are cooked.

THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY RELISH
ingredients
1 1/2  c. water
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. strawberry gelatin
1  lb. (16 oz.) fresh cranberries
1  medium unpeeled orange, quartered and seeded
1  tart apple
1  c. chopped celery
1  c. chopped pecans
1  c. sugar
1/2  c. ReaLemon
preparation
      In a medium saucepan, bring 1 cup water to a boil; remove from heat.  Add gelatin and sugar; stir until dissolved.  Add ReaLemon and remaining water.  Chill while preparing remaining ingredients.
      In a food processor or by hand, chop cranberries and orange. Place in a large bowl; stir in chopped apple, celery, nuts and gelatin mixture.  Chill until set in a 6 cup mold or may be served in orange cups.

CHICKEN YUMMY
ingredients
3  whole chicken breasts
6 (1 oz.)  slices Swiss cheese
1  can cream of chicken soup
1/4  c. water
1  box Stove Top stuffing
1/3  c. melted butter
preparation
      Split, skin and bone chicken; arrange in shallow baking pan. Top each with a piece of cheese.  Stir soup and water together and spoon on top of chicken.  Sprinkle with stuffing and drizzle with butter.  Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 50 minutes.

AREQUIPE DESSERT
ingredients
3  qt. milk
2  lb. sugar
  pinch of salt
1/4  tsp. baking soda
2  egg yolks
  cinnamon stick
preparation
      Combine ingredients in a saucepan and simmer until thickened. Stir constantly, preferably with a wooden spoon, until you see the saucepan while stirring (4 to 5 hours).  Add the egg yolks and let cook 2 or 3 minutes longer.  Remove cinnamon stick.  Let cool. This recipe must be watched constantly.

EQUAL YOGURT FRUIT DIP
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. low calorie cream cheese, softened
1  c. plain low-fat yogurt
1  tsp. vanilla
1  tsp. grated lemon rind
14  packets Equal
preparation
      Combine cream cheese and yogurt.  Blend until smooth.  Stir in remaining ingredients.  Chill.  Serve with fresh fruit.  Makes 2 cups or 8 servings; contains approximately 100 calories per serving.

QUICK GINGER CHICKEN
ingredients
2  tsp. ground ginger
2  Tbsp. honey
2  Tbsp. low sodium soy sauce
4  boned, skinned chicken breast halves
  green onion strips (optional)
preparation
      Combine ginger, honey and soy sauce in a small bowl; stir well and set aside.  Place each chicken breast half between 2 sheets of heavy-duty plastic wrap; flatten to 1/4-inch thickness, using a meat mallet or rolling pin.  Coat grill rack with vegetable cooking spray; place on grill over medium hot coals.  Place chicken on rack and cook 4 minutes on each side, basting frequently with soy sauce mixture.  Place chicken on serving platter; garnish with green onion strips, if desired.  Yields 4 servings; contains about 201 calories per chicken breast half.

CHICKEN WING APPETIZERS
ingredients
3/4  c. cornflake crumbs
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1/4  tsp. garlic salt
1 1/2  Tbsp. dried parsley
1/3  c. melted butter
16  chicken wings
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Wash chicken wings, breaking in two at the joints.  Remove tips and keep for soup.  Combine the crumbs and all the dry ingredients.  Dip wing pieces in melted butter and then into the crumb mixture.  Place wings in a single layer on a greased cookie sheet.  Bake uncovered for 18 minutes at 350°.  Serve hot.  Makes 32 appetizers.

GLAZED FRUIT SALAD
ingredients
1 (4 oz.)  can chunk pineapple, drained (reserve liquid)
1 (3 3/4 oz.)  pkg. vanilla pudding
1  can fruits for salad
1  can mandarin oranges
2  bananas
  maraschino cherries (for garnish)
preparation
      Combine pineapple juice and vanilla pudding.  Cook over medium heat; stir until it boils.  Remove and let it cool.  Combine fruits and mix in pudding.  Garnish with cherries.  Chill.  Makes 6 cups.
      Per Serving (1-Cup):  156 Calories, trace of Fat, 0 mg. Cholesterol and 131 mg.  Sodium.

Choclate Drink Mix
  
Cuisine: American
ingredients
1  (16 oz.) box instant chocolate powder 
1  (8 qt.) box powdered milk 
1  (6 oz.) jar powdered cream 
1/2  c. powdered sugar 
preparation
Combine all ingredients and mix well. Store in airtight container. To serve: Use 1/3 cup mix to 1 cup hot water.

A QUICK EASY BARBECUE SAUCE
(For Chicken)  
ingredients
1/4  c  A-1 Sauce
1/4  c catsup
1  (16 oz) coke
  salt and pepper
1  or 2 fryers cut in pieces
preparation
      Mix sauce, pour over chicken pieces in a pan. Cook 1 hour or until tender, at 350 degrees.

PASTA AND CARBONARA SAUCE
ingredients
4  eggs (at room temperature)
1/4  c. butter
1  lb. fettucini
1/4  c. cream
7  oz. salami
1  c. Parmesan cheese
1/4  c. fresh parsley
preparation
      Beat eggs and cream until blended.  Cook pasta.  Put cooked pasta in a hot baking dish (250°).  Mix in butter and salami; pour egg mixture over and toss.  Add cheese and parsley.  Serve warm.

SKILLET SWEET POTATOES
ingredients
1  lb. sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced*
1/2  tsp. finely shredded orange peel
1/2  c. orange juice
1  Tbsp. molasses or brown sugar
1/4  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/8  tsp. ground allspice
preparation
      Bring 1 inch of water to a boil in skillet.  Add sweet potatoes; reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until tender.  Drain.  In a small bowl, combine orange peel, orange juice, molasses or brown sugar, salt, cinnamon and allspice and pour over potatoes.  Cook and stir gently until bubbly.  Simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes or until potatoes are glazed, spooning sauce over potatoes occasionally.  Makes 4 servings.
      Note:  Can substitute 1 (18 ounce) can sweet potatoes for fresh.  Cut potatoes into 2-inch pieces and place in 1-quart casserole.  Pour sauce over sweet potatoes and bake, uncovered, in a 350° oven about 30 minutes or until heated through and sauce is bubbly.
      Per Serving:  134 Calories, 0 g. Fat, 0 mg.  Cholesterol and 149 mg.  Sodium.

NO ROLL PASTRY
Houston, Texas  
ingredients
1/2  c. shortening (Crisco shrinks the least)
1 1/2  c. flour
1/4  tsp. baking powder
4  Tbsp. boiling water
preparation
      Mix the shortening, flour and baking powder well with a pastry blender or fork.  Add boiling water.  Press pastry with hands into a 9-inch pie plate.  Do not pierce.  Use unbaked or bake at 450° until brown.  Makes 2 shells in smaller pans.
      Variation:  Chocolate pastry:  use 1 c. flour and 1/2 c. cocoa powder with 3 Tbsp. sugar instead of 1 1/2 c. flour.
      Total prep time:  15 minutes.

CHRISTMAS GINGERBREAD COOKIES
ingredients
1  c. shortening
1  c. light brown sugar
3  eggs, well beaten
1 1/2  c. molasses
6  c. bread flour
1 1/2  Tbsp. ginger
2 1/4  tsp. salt
1  tsp. cinnamon
1 1/2  tsp. soda
preparation
      Cream shortening and sugar; add eggs and molasses.  Stir dry ingredients together and add.  Chill.  Roll out not too thin.  Bake at 350° until dry, not crisp.  Makes enough dough for many shaped cookies.  Frost, if desired.

LOW CALORIE PARTY MIX
ingredients
4  tsp. margarine
1  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/8  tsp. onion powder
1/8  tsp. garlic powder
1 1/2  oz. donut shaped cereal (about 1 c.)
1 1/2  oz. biscuit shaped cereal (Chex, about 3/4 c.)
1  oz. broken pretzels
preparation
      Melt oleo with Worcestershire sauce, onion and garlic powder. Stir until combined.  Add cereals and pretzels.  Stir together gently until cereals and pretzels are coated.  Bake in 250° oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until crispy.  Divide into 4 equal servings of 145 calories each.
      Diabetic or Weight Watchers exchanges are:  1 bread serving, 1 fat serving, 25 optional calories.

SUSHI SU
ingredients
1  c. plus 1 Tbsp. plus 1 tsp. sugar
1  c. Japanese vinegar
1  tsp. ajinomoto
2  Tbsp. sea salt (I use Hain sea salt, not to be confused with Hawaiian salt)
preparation
	Combine the ingredients; boil gently until dissolved.
	For Makizushi:	Su  enough for 4 uncooked American cups of rice and some aside for rolling nori.
	For Barazushi:	Su  enough for 5 uncooked American cups of rice.
	Note:  This su can also be used for namasu.
	Gu  for  Makizushi:  Carrots,  celery, shiitake, unagi, red powdered ebi and egg.
	Gu  for  Barazushi:  Carrots,  bamboo shoots, shiitake, kamaboko and beans.  Topping:  Eggs and red part of kamaboko.

PARTY DIP
ingredients
1  can Campbell's cream of shrimp soup
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/4  c. finely chopped green pepper
2  Tbsp. finely chopped onion
  dash of hot pepper sauce
preparation
      With  electric  mixer or rotary beater, gradually blend soup into  cream  cheese.  Beat  just  until  smooth.  Mix in remaining ingredients.  Chill.  Serve  as a dip with crackers or chips. Makes about 2 1/3 cups dip.

BEEF ENCHILADA
ingredients
1/2  lb. beefsteak or lean ground beef
1  Tbsp. oil
1/3  c. diced onion
1  clove garlic, minced
3  oz. green chilies, diced
1 1/2 to 2  tsp. chili powder
1/2  tsp. oregano
1 (8 oz.)  can whole tomatoes in juice
1/2  tsp. salt
3/4  c. water
1 1/2  c. Minute rice
  chopped parsley
2  slices (1 oz. each) American cheese, cut in strips
preparation
      Brown beef in oil in skillet.  Add onion and sauté with beef until tender.  Add garlic; sauté 15 seconds.  Add chilies, chili powder, oregano, tomatoes with juice, salt and water.  Break up tomatoes and bring mixture to a boil.  Add rice.  Stir, cover and remove from heat.  Let stand 5 minutes.  Sprinkle dish with chopped parsley.  Place cheese on top.  Replace cover.  Let stand 3 to 5 minutes until cheese has melted.  Serve.  Makes 4 servings, containing less than 350 calories each.

Spring Roll
  
ingredients
1  to 1 1/2 lb. sirloin steak or 4 large chicken breasts, boned 
1/2  tsp. garlic powder 
1/2  tsp. onion powder 
1/4  c. soy sauce 
1  tsp. Chinese 5 spice powder 
2  c. chopped celery 
1  c. shredded cabbage (optional) 
1  bunch broccoli (optional) 
1  carrot, grated 
3  c. fresh bean sprouts 
1  Tbsp. cornstarch 
1  egg, beaten 
1  pkg. spring roll skins (found in produce section) 
preparation
Cut meat into small thin pieces. (Tofu may be substituted). In large frying pan or wok, heat 2 tablespoons of oil until smoking. Stir-fry meat, small portion at a time, and set aside. Add more oil if necessary, and stir-fry vegetables until crisp-tender.
In separate container, mix cornstarch and spices with soy sauce. Add meat back into vegetable mixture and reduce heat. Add soy sauce mixture, stirring constantly until a thick sauce forms, coating meat/veggies. Place about 1 1/2 tablespoons of mixture in center of each spring roll skin and fold corners into center around filling, sealing opening with beaten egg. Do not leave any openings which expose filling! Heat about 2-inches of oil in heavy saucepan or Dutch oven to about 350°. Fry rolls in hot oil until brown. Drain on paper towels.
notes
   
wer54w66sf32re2

STUFFED MUSHROOMS
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. large fresh mushrooms (about 20; remove stems and save)
1/4  c. chopped onion
2  cloves garlic, minced
1  Tbsp. margarine
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen chopped spinach (thaw, drain and squeeze out excess liquid)
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1/4  c. fine bread crumbs
1/4  c. finely chopped pimiento
1/2  tsp. dried basil, crushed
1/2  tsp. dried oregano, crushed
1/4  tsp. salt
  dash of pepper
preparation
      Spray  a  15  x  10  x  1-inch baking pan with nonstick coating.  Chop  enough  mushroom  stems  to make 2 cups.  Cook chopped  mushroom  stems,  onion and garlic in margarine until onion is tender, but not browned (use a 10-inch skillet).  Add spinach  and  cook  over low heat until most of the liquid has evaporated.  Stir  in  cheese,  bread crumbs, pimiento, basil, oregano,  salt  and pepper.  Spoon mixture into mushroom tops. Place  stuffed  mushroom  tops  in the prepared baking pan and bake  at  425°  for  10  to  15 minutes or until mushrooms are tender.  Makes about 20 servings.
      Per Serving:  30 Calories, 1 g. Fat, 1 mg.  Cholesterol and 78 mg.  Sodium.

ITALIAN-STYLE PORK SOUP
ingredients
1 1/4 to 1 1/2  lb. boneless pork shoulder, cut into 3/4-inch pieces
1  Tbsp. oil
1  large onion, diced
2  cloves garlic, minced
1  tsp. each:  Italian seasoning and salt
1/2  tsp. each:  dried basil leaves, fennel seed and pepper
1 (16 oz.)  can tomatoes, broken up
2  c. water
1  medium green pepper, diced
1  small zucchini, thinly sliced
1/3  c. small pasta (bow ties, elbow macaroni or shells)
  grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Brown pork pieces in oil with onion and garlic.  Pour off drippings.  Sprinkle Italian seasoning, salt, basil, fennel and pepper over pork.  Add tomatoes and water; cover tightly and simmer 1 hour.  Add green pepper, zucchini and pasta to pork.  Increase heat to medium-low and continue cooking, covered, 30 minutes or until vegetables and pasta are done.  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

LEMON-MUSHROOM SALAD
ingredients
1/2 (8 oz.)  carton plain low-fat yogurt
1  Tbsp. reduced-calorie mayonnaise or salad dressing
1  tsp. honey
1/8  tsp. finely shredded lemon peel
1/2  tsp. lemon juice
1/8  tsp. dry mustard
1/8  tsp. pepper
3  c. sliced fresh mushrooms (8 oz.)
2  Tbsp. frozen chopped onion
1  medium tomato
  lettuce leaves
  coarsely ground pepper (optional)
preparation
      Stir  together  yogurt,  mayonnaise  or salad dressing, honey, lemon peel, lemon juice, mustard and pepper in a large mixing bowl.  Add  mushrooms  and  onion.  Toss lightly until coated.
      To  Serve:  Cut  tomato  into  8  wedges.  Line 4 salad plates with lettuce leaves.  Spoon mushroom mixture on top of lettuce. Garnish  with  tomato  wedges.  If desired, sprinkle with coarsely ground pepper.  Makes 4 servings.
      Per Serving:  56 Calories, 2 g. Fat, 2 mg.  Cholesterol and 46 mg.  Sodium.

THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1 large  box strawberry Jello
1  can pineapple, drained
1  can cranberry sauce, jellied or whole
1/2  c. chopped pecans
1  c. boiling water
preparation
      Dissolve Jello in boiling water. Add other ingredients and chill.

CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP
ingredients
1  (2 1/2 to 3 lb.) ready to cook broiler-fryer chicken, cut up
3  qt. water
1  medium onion, quartered
  few sprigs parsley
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. whole black peppercorns
2  c. uncooked fine noodles
1  c. diced celery
1/2  c. shredded carrots
2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. dried thyme, crushed
1/4  tsp. dried oregano, crushed
preparation
      Place chicken in Dutch oven or deep kettle.  Add water, onion, parsley, salt and whole black peppercorns.  Cover and simmer for 1 hour.  Remove chicken from broth.  Cool and remove meat from bones. Dice meat.  Strain broth and return to kettle.  Bring stock to boiling and add noodles, celery, shredded carrots, salt, thyme and oregano.  Return to boil.  Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes, or until noodles are tender.  Add chicken and heat.  Makes 2 1/2-quarts.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

HEALTHY, HEALTHY CHICKEN SOUP
ingredients
1  broiler fryer chicken, cut into parts
3  c. water
2  c. chopped cabbage
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  (16 oz.) tomatoes
1  pkg. dry onion soup mix
preparation
      Place chicken parts, water, celery, salt, pepper and tomatoes in pot.  Fill 2/3 full with water.  Cook for 20 minutes.  Reduce heat and remove chicken.  Skim off the fat.  Add onion soup mix and cabbage; simmer uncovered for 10 minutes.  Remove bones and skin from chicken; chop into bite-size pieces.  Return to pot and cook uncovered for 5 minutes.  Serves 4.  Contains 240 calories.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

QUICK AND TASTY GRILLED BEEF ROAST
ingredients
3  lb. chuck roast
1  pkg. Lipton beefy onion soup mix
preparation
      Marinate roast in beefy onion soup mix all day and night (turn often).  Preheat gas grill; sear roast on both sides.  Turn grill to low setting and baste well.  Cook until inside temperature is about 140° to 150°.

PIZZA SNACK
ingredients
1/4  c. tomato puree
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1/4  tsp. onion powder
1/4  tsp. oregano
1  slice bread or 1/2 English muffin
1  oz. cheese
preparation
      Toast bread.  Put tomato, seasonings and cheese on toast. Broil for 1 to 5 minutes.  Good with salad.  Equals 1 bread, 1 fat, 1 meat, 1/2 vegetable exchange on diabetic diet.

OIL AND GARLIC SAUCE FOR PASTA
ingredients
4  cloves garlic, minced
1/2  c. olive oil
1/2  c. water
1  Tbsp. chopped parsley
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Sauté garlic in olive oil until golden brown.  Add water, parsley and pepper.  Simmer 10 minutes.  Serve over cooked pasta; add 1/4 to 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese.  Toss well.

BEEF STROGANOFF - QUICK AND EASY
ingredients
1  lb. beef
1  Tbsp. hot shortening
  chopped onion to taste
  chopped garlic to taste
1  can mushroom soup
1 (3 oz.)  can undrained mushroom pieces
2  Tbsp. ketchup
2  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
8  oz. sour cream
preparation
      Cut beef in 1-inch strips.  Brown in hot shortening.  Add chopped onion and garlic.  Lightly season beef.  Stir in soup and mushroom pieces.  Add ketchup, Worcestershire sauce and sour cream. Heat, but do not boil.  Serve over noodles.

WINNING TEA PUNCH (NON-ALCOHOLIC DRINK)
(1 Gallon)  
ingredients
1/2  c. 100% instant tea
2  qt. water
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen limeade concentrate
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade concentrate
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen pineapple juice concentrate
1  pt. cranberry juice cocktail
preparation
      In punch bowl, combine instant tea, water, concentrates and cranberry juice.  Just before serving, add ice.

*QUICK AND EASY GINGERBREAD
ingredients
1/2  c. melted shortening or Wesson oil
1/2  c. white sugar
1/2  c. molasses
2  c. all-purpose flour
1/2  tsp. salt
1  tsp. soda
1  tsp. ginger
1  tsp. cinnamon
1  c. hot water
preparation
      Combine shortening, sugar and molasses.  Add sifted dry ingredients alternately with hot water, beating until smooth. Bake in a greased 6 x 10-inch or 9 x 9-inch greased and floured pan at 350° for about 40 minutes.  This is especially good served warm.  Makes 9 servings.

YELLOW PARTY PUNCH
ingredients
2 (6 oz.)  cans frozen orange juice
2 (16 oz.)  cans frozen lemonade
7  c. water
1 1/2  c. sugar
1  can pineapple juice
1  bottle ginger ale
1  bottle club soda
preparation
      Mix all ingredients except ginger ale and club soda.  Pour into containers and freeze.  Remove from freezer in time to get slushy at serving time.  Add equal amounts of ginger ale and club soda.

PIZZA DUNKS
ingredients
1  loaf Italian bread, unsliced
1  c. Mozzarella cheese, shredded
1 large or 2 small  jars pizza sauce
preparation
      Slice bread lengthwise, then into strips and finally into cubes about 1 to 2-inches square.  Place on cookie sheet and heat in a 425° oven until tan.  Remove and put in a bread basket.  Put sauce in baking dish and heat in microwave until hot.  Remove and sprinkle cheese on top.  When cheese melts, put on table with bread.  Give each child a fork and let him or her stab a cube of bread and dip it into sauce.  No mess and no waste!
