SWEET AND SOUR CHICKEN
ingredients
2/3  c. unsweetened pineapple juice
1/4  c. teriyaki sauce
1/4  c. rice vinegar
1  Tbsp. plus 1 tsp. honey
1  Tbsp. plus 1 tsp. mustard
1  garlic clove, sliced
  1-inch ginger root, pared and sliced
3  lb. chicken, skinned
preparation
      In bowl, combine all ingredients except chicken; add chicken and toss to coat.  Cover bowl and refrigerate for at least 8 hours, occasionally tossing chicken in marinade.  Remove chicken from marinade; remove and discard garlic and ginger.  In blender container pureed marinade.  Arrange chicken parts in disposable aluminum roasting pan; grill over hot coals until tender, basting occasionally with pureed marinade.  Transfer chicken and pan juices to serving platter.  In small saucepan bring remaining marinade to a boil; serve with chicken.  May also substitute turkey for chicken.

CHICKEN PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. frozen pea pods
1 (5 oz.)  pkg. spiral macaroni
1/3  c. mayonnaise or salad dressing
1/4  c. French dressing
2  c. cut up chicken, cooked (about 12 oz.)
1  c. cherry tomatoes, cut in halves
preparation
      Remove pea pods from package; place in a bowl of cool water until thawed. Drain. Cook macaroni as directed on package except add pea pods about 2 minutes before macaroni is done; drain. Rinse macaroni and pea pods with cold water; drain. Mix mayonnaise and French dressing in a large bowl. Add macaroni mixture and remaining ingredients; toss.  Yields 4 servings.

BARBECUED CHICKEN WITH HONEY-MUSTARD GLAZE
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato sauce
1/2  c. olive oil
1/2  c. orange juice
1/4  c. vinegar
1 1/2  tsp. dried oregano, crushed
1 1/2  tsp. salt
6  peppercorns
1  clove garlic, minced
2  whole chicken breasts, split
4  chicken legs (including thighs)
1  recipe Honey-Mustard Glaze
preparation
      In a large screw-top jar, combine all ingredients, except chicken and glaze.  Cover and shake vigorously to blend.  In shallow dish, pour tomato sauce mixture over chicken.  Cover and marinate 2 hours at room temperature or overnight in refrigerator, turning occasionally.  Drain, reserving marinade.  Grill chicken over medium flame for 45 to 50 minutes, brushing with marinade and turning frequently.  Just before serving, brush with Honey-Mustard Glaze.
Honey-Mustard Glaze:
ingredients
1/4  c. honey
1/2  tsp. dry mustard
preparation
      Combine ingredients.

SOUTH OF THE BORDER CHICKEN CASSEROLE
ingredients
4  chicken breasts or 1 whole chicken, cooked
1  doz. corn tortillas
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1  can cream of chicken soup
1  c. milk
1  onion, chopped
1 (4 oz.)  can Ortega green chilies, chopped
1  lb. Cheddar cheese, grated
preparation
      Cut chicken into bite size pieces.  Cut tortillas into 1-inch strips.  Mix soups, milk, onion and chilies.  Into a greased 9 x 13-inch baking dish, layer one-half of the tortilla strips, chicken, soup mixture and grated cheese.  Repeat with remaining ingredients in same order.  Allow to stand in refrigerator for 24 hours.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes.  Serves 8 to 10.

COUNTRY CHICKEN CAMP STEW
ingredients
1  onion, diced
1  chicken, cut up
1  doz. potatoes, sliced
3  cans tomatoes
  salt and pepper to taste
1/2  c. barbecue sauce
1 (32 oz.)  bottle ketchup
preparation
      Boil onion and chicken until chicken comes off the bones.  Pick off the bones and cut up chicken.  Discard bones.  Add potatoes, tomatoes, salt and pepper.  Cook until potatoes are in pieces.  Add barbecue sauce and ketchup.  Stir well.  Let simmer for 30 minutes on medium heat.

STIR-FRIED CHICKEN AND CASHEWS
ingredients
2  whole medium chicken breasts, skinned, boned and cut in 1/2-inch cubes
2  Tbsp. soy sauce
1  Tbsp. plus 1/2 tsp. dry sherry
1  c. raw cashew nuts
2  Tbsp. cooking oil
1  Tbsp. hoisin sauce
  sliced green onion (optional)
  hot cooked rice
preparation
      In medium bowl, combine chicken, soy sauce and sherry; set aside.  In a 12-inch skillet or wok, stir-fry cashews in hot oil over high heat for 1 to 2 minutes or until browned.  Lift out with a slotted spoon and set aside.  Add the chicken mixture to the skillet.  Stir-fry over high heat for 2 to 3 minutes or until just done.  Stir in hoisin sauce and cashews.  If desired, sprinkle with sliced green onion.  Serve at once with hot cooked rice.  Makes 4 or 5 servings.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

MEXICAN CHICKEN/BEEF SOUP
ingredients
5  lb. chicken
6  to 8 corn-on-the-cob (yes, cobs, 3 to 4-inches wide)
1/2  cabbage, cut in wedges
5  potatoes, cut in 1/4 pieces
1 (14.5 oz.)  can diced tomatoes
2  onions, sliced in strips
1  bundle cilantro, chopped
1  green pepper
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato sauce
2  zucchini, diced
2  big carrots, sliced chunky
1  lime (optional)
1 1/2  gal. water
2  Tbsp. salt
preparation
      Cook chicken in 1 1/2 gallons water.  When chicken is half cooked, add potatoes and carrots.  When potatoes and carrots are cooked, add rest of ingredients with salt.  Soup should be cooked at least 1 hour and 30 minutes on medium flame.  When serving, squeeze lime into soup in bowl.

MAMAW'S CHICKEN PIE
ingredients
1  (3 lb.) chicken
2  c. water
1  Tbsp. salt
preparation
      Boil chicken in large deep pot in salted water until tender. Remove bones and skin; cut into bite sized pieces and place in a well-greased 3-quart casserole (Pyrex 9 x 13-inch dish is ideal).
Sauce:
ingredients
3  Tbsp. butter, melted
3  Tbsp. flour
1 1/2  c. milk
1 1/2  c. chicken broth
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  Tbsp. instant minced onion
preparation
      Make sauce by blending flour into melted butter and adding milk, chicken broth, lemon juice and minced onion.  Cook over medium heat until slightly thick.  Pour over chicken.  Top with Pinwheel Crust.
Pinwheel Crust:
ingredients
1 1/2  c. flour
2  tsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. salt
3  Tbsp. shortening
1/2  c. milk
1 large  jar chopped pimientos, drained
1 to 1 1/2  c. Cheddar cheese, grated
preparation
      Will need 32 pinwheels to cover pie.
      Sift dry ingredients together.  Cut in shortening and add all of milk at once.  Stir just enough to mix.  Roll out to 1/4-inch thickness on floured board.  Spread chopped pimientos and cheese over pastry.  Roll in jelly roll fashion and slice into pieces about 3/4-inch thick.  Place rounds on top of chicken and sauce. Bake at 350° for about 30 minutes or until brown and bubbly. Serves 8 to 12.  Freezes well.

CHICKEN, ARTICHOKE AND RICE SALAD
ingredients
1  box chicken Rice-A-Roni
1 (6 oz.)  jar marinated artichoke hearts
1  onion, thinly sliced
1/2  c. sliced celery
1/2  chopped green pepper
1/2  c. sliced green olives
1  c. diced, cooked chicken
preparation
      Cook rice according to directions, omitting butter, and allow to cool.  Drain artichokes, saving juice for dressing.  Cut artichokes in halves or slice and add to rice with remaining ingredients.
Dressing:
ingredients
1/2  c. mayonnaise
  marinade from artichokes
3/4  tsp. curry powder
preparation
      Blend dressing ingredients.  Toss with rice mixture and chill.

ASPARAGUS AND CHICKEN SOUP
ingredients
8  c. chicken stock
1  large chicken breast
1  bunch fresh asparagus
4  tsp. cornstarch
3  Tbsp. cold water
2 1/2  Tbsp. dry sherry
2  eggs, beaten
preparation
      Heat stock.  Cut chicken into small pieces.  After asparagus is cooked, cut into small pieces.  Save 1 cup of water to add to chicken stock.  Add chicken and boil.  Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.  Mix cornstarch with cold water and add to soup, stirring constantly.  Add sherry.  Slowly add beaten eggs and asparagus.  Heat through.

CHICKEN TETRAZZINI
ingredients
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can cream of celery soup
1/2  c. milk
12  oz. cubed, cooked chicken
6  oz. pasta bow ties, cooked and drained
1/3  c. diced green pepper
4  oz. can sliced mushrooms
1  c. frozen English peas
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Heat oven to 375°.  Generously grease a shallow 2 quart baking dish.  Mix undiluted soup and milk in a large bowl until well blended.  Add remaining ingredients except cheese and toss gently to mix.  Turn into prepared dish.  Sprinkle cheese evenly over top.  Bake 15 minutes or until hot and bubbly.  Makes 4 servings.

CHICKEN BAKE CASSEROLE
ingredients
1 (1 lb.)  pkg. frozen mixed vegetables (broccoli, cauliflower and carrots), thawed and drained
1  can cream of chicken soup
3/4  c. milk
2  c. chopped, cooked chicken
1  c. biscuit mix
1  egg, slightly beaten
1/4  c. milk
1  c. Velveeta cheese, cubed
1  can Durkee onion rings
preparation
      Combine soup, milk, chicken, vegetables, 1/4 cup cheese and 1/2 can onions until well blended.  Spread mixture into 8 x 12-inch baking dish sprayed with Pam.  Bake uncovered at 425° for 10 minutes.
      Meanwhile, combine biscuit mix, egg and milk to form a soft ball dough.  Spoon over hot chicken mixture to form a lattice design.  Bake at 425° for 20 to 30 minutes until biscuits are golden brown.
      Remove from oven and put remaining cheese and onions on top of biscuits and bake until cheese melts and onions are lightly browned.
      Yields 6 servings; 3/4 cup per exchange equals 1 vegetable, 2 meat and 1 1/2 fats.

BAKED CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
6  C. chopped cooked chicken
1/2  C. toasted sliced almonds
3  tsp. lemon juice
1/2  C. minced onion
1/4  tsp. pepper
3  C. chopped celery
1 1/2  C. chopped mushrooms
2  C. cooked rice
1  can mushroom soup
1  can cream of chicken soup
1  can mushroom soup
1 soup  can salad dressing
2  oz. Amaretto (optional)
3  C. grated cheddar cheese
3  C. crushed potato chips
preparation
      Combine  the first 8 ingredients.  Mix together the soups, salad dressing and Amaretto.  Combine with chicken mixture.
      Top with:  3 C. grated cheddar cheese; top cheese with 3 C. crushed potato chips.
      Bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours or to heat thoroughly.

CHICKEN KIEV
ingredients
2/3  c. butter
1/2  c. dry bread crumbs
2  Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese
1  tsp. basil
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
2  chicken breasts, split
1/4  c. apple juice
1/4  c. chopped green onion
1/4  c. chopped parsley
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°.  In a 2 quart saucepan melt butter.  On a piece of wax paper combine bread crumbs, cheese, basil and garlic salt.  Dip chicken breasts in melted butter, then roll in bread crumbs to coat.  Place skin side up in ungreased 9-inch square baking dish.  Bake in oven at 375° for 50 to 60 minutes.  While chicken is baking, add apple juice, onion and parsley to remaining melted butter.  When chicken is golden brown, pour butter sauce over and around.  Return to oven for 3 to 5 minutes more or just until sauce is hot.  Serve with sauce spooned over.  Good with wild rice as an accompaniment.

CHICKEN SOUP
ingredients
3  qt. water
1  fryer chicken
2  medium potatoes
1  medium onion
2  bay leaves
3  carrots
3  celery stalks (optional)
  chicken bouillon cube (optional)
preparation
      Boil (slowly) chicken in the water for 40 to 45 minutes. Remove chicken from water.  Set aside on platter to cool.  Skim top of the water and discard skimmings.  Add vegetables to water (can be cut first if you wish) and bouillon cube.  When the chicken has cooled, remove meat from bone and put back in water to simmer for 2 more hours.

CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
3  c. cubed, cooked chicken
1  Tbsp. minced onion, cooked
1/4  c. chicken stock
1  c. Cheddar cheese, cubed
1  hard-cooked egg, chopped
1/4  c. (2 oz. jar) pimientos, drained and chopped
2  Tbsp. mayonnaise or salad dressing
preparation
      Simmer whole fryer. Cook minced onion. Combine chicken, onion and chicken stock. Add cheese, egg and pimientos. Sprinkle with garlic powder and pepper, if desired. Add mayonnaise and mix carefully.

THREE CHEESE CHICKEN LASAGNA
ingredients
8  oz. lasagna noodles
1/2  c. chopped onion
1/2  c. chopped green pepper
3  Tbsp. butter
1  can cream of chicken soup
6  oz. can mushrooms, drained
1/2  c. chopped pimento
1/3  c. milk
1/2  tsp. dried basil
1 1/2  c. cottage cheese
2  c. diced chicken
2  c. shredded American cheese
1/2  c. grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Cook noodles and drain.  Cook onion and green pepper in butter until tender.  Stir in soup, mushrooms, pimento, milk and basil. Lay 1/2 the noodles in a 13 x 9-inch pan.  Top with half each the sauce, cottage cheese, chicken and American and Parmesan cheeses. Repeat layers except for the last 2 cheeses.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.  Top with remaining cheeses.  Bake a few minutes more.  Makes 8 to 10 servings.

CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
1  oz. lean boiled chicken (1 meat)
1  Tbsp. Weight Watchers light mayonnaise (1 fat)
1/2  c. unsweetened pineapple (1 fruit)
1  small apple (1 fruit)
2  Tbsp. raisins (1 fruit)
  slivered almonds
preparation
      Place cleaned fryer hen in Dutch oven with water and poultry seasoning (generous amount); salt and pepper if your diet allows. Cook until meat falls away from bone.  Let cool and then remove meat from bone.  Add remaining ingredients to chicken, sprinkling slivered almonds on top of salad.
      Note:  The recipe is for a diet for 3 meats, 2 fats, 2 fruit exchanges; however, you may design your own recipe to fit your diet by using the base amounts listed as follows:
Sample Recipe:
ingredients
3  oz. meat (chicken - 3 meats)
2  Tbsp. light mayo (2 fats)
1/4  c. pineapple, partially drained**
1/2  peeled, chopped apple**
2  Tbsp. raisins**
2  slices bread (2 bread)
  almonds
preparation
      **Fruit amounts equal 2 fruits.
      Use 4 to 6 small Tupperware bowls and line them up on the counter, assembly-line style.  In this manner, add the amount of the ingredients in each bowl so that when completed, you have 4 to 6 exact meals ready to put into lunch boxes or serve at the table. Complete meal is served with 2 slices of bread.

TURKEY OR CHICKEN CRESCENTS
ingredients
3  oz. cream cheese
3  Tbsp. margarine or butter, melted (divided)
2  c. cubed, cooked turkey
1/4  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
2  Tbsp. milk
1  Tbsp. chopped chives
8  oz. crescent rolls
3/4  c. croutons, crushed
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Blend cream cheese and 2 tablespoons margarine or butter until smooth.  Add turkey, salt, pepper, milk and chives.  Mix well.  Separate rolls into 4 rectangles.  Firmly press rolls to seal.  Spoon 1/2 cup meat mixture onto center of each square.  Pull 4 corners of dough to top center.  Twist slightly and seal edges.  Brush top with reserved butter.  Dip in crouton crumbs.  Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 20 to 25 minutes until golden brown.

CANNELLONI AND CHICKEN WITH HAM
ingredients
3/4  c. butter
3  chicken livers
3/4  c. Parmesan cheese, grated
2 1/2  c. milk, scalded
1/2  tsp. salt
8  oz. homemade cannelloni
2  whole chicken breasts, boned
5  slices ham
5 1/2  Tbsp. flour
5 to 8  c. light cream
1/4  tsp. white pepper
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°.  In a frying pan, melt 4 tablespoons of butter.  Add chicken breasts and fry for 5 minutes, until lightly browned on both sides.  Transfer to bowl.  Add chicken livers to the frypan and cook 2 minutes on each side.  Transfer to bowl with chicken breasts.  Mince the chicken breasts, livers and ham together.  Add 1/4 cup Parmesan to the ground meat and mix well with a fork.  In a medium saucepan, melt another 4 tablespoons butter.  With a wooden spoon, stir the flour into the butter and cook for 2 minutes.  Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the milk slowly.  Return to heat and cook until sauce thickens.  Remove and add cream, salt and pepper.  Add 1/4 of the sauce to the meat and cheese mixture in the bowl and mix well.  Set aside.  Bring 2 1/2 quarts of water to a boil.  Drop into the boiling water and cook for 6 to 15 minutes, depending on the thickness.  With a slotted spoon, remove the pasta from the pan and place on dampened cloth to drain.  Using 1 tablespoon of butter, grease a large baking dish and spread 2 tablespoons of meat and cheese mixture on each pasta square.  Fold over and make a roll.  Place the cannelloni in either one or two layers, placing the joined side down in the baking dish.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese and cover with reserved sauce.  Dot the top of the dish with small pieces of butter and place in oven.  Bake for 30 minutes until lightly browned.
Cannelloni:
ingredients
2  c. flour
3  eggs
1/4  tsp. salt
preparation
      Sift flour and salt into a mixing bowl.  Add eggs.  Use hands to mix the flour and eggs together and form a ball.  Place ball of dough on floured board and knead for 10 minutes, until smooth but stiff.  If necessary, add more flour.  Divide the dough into 4 pieces and roll out into thin sheet.  Cover with cloth and leave for 30 minutes.  Cut into 4 x 3-inch rectangles.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

CHICKEN BREASTS WITH ADOBADO SAUCE
ingredients
12  ancho chilies
1/2  c. vinegar
2  onions
1  Tbsp. garlic, pureed
2  Tbsp. cumin
4  c. chicken stock, canned or preferably homemade
1/4  c. brown sugar
1/4  c. orange juice
1/8  c. lemon or lime juice
1/4 to 1/2  c. tomato puree (no salt added)
6  medium-sized chicken breasts
preparation
      Remove the seeds from the chilies and lightly roast to develop the full flavor.  Soak in the vinegar (add enough water to cover) for 15 minutes, then puree.  Brown the onions, then add the garlic puree and cumin.  Add the chili puree and stock.  Let cook for about 20 minutes or until the flavors have all merged.
      Make a paste of the brown sugar, orange juice, lemon or lime juice and tomato puree.  Whip into the sauce and continue cooking another 15 minutes.  Taste and adjust seasoning.  Marinate the chicken breasts in the sauce 2 to 3 hours.  Grill over charcoal or bake in 400° oven for 20 to 25 minutes.  To broil, allow about 8 minutes a side.  This sauce is also an excellent marinade for pork chops or ribs.  Serves 6. Contains 275 calories per serving.

BARBECUE SAUCE FOR CHICKEN
ingredients
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1/3  c. vinegar
2  tsp. prepared mustard
1/4  tsp. ginger
1  Tbsp. paprika
1  tsp. sugar
2  Tbsp. Karo syrup
1  medium onion, chopped
1  c. tomato puree
1/4  c. butter
1/2  c. hot water
1/3  c. lemon juice
1/3  c. pineapple or grapefruit juice
1  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
  pineapple chunks
preparation
      Mix all ingredients in saucepan.  Heat to boiling point and pour over chicken.  Place chicken in oven with sauce.  Cook until done.

CHICKEN MUSHROOM SOUP
ingredients
1/2  lb. fresh mushrooms, sliced
1/4  c. butter
3  Tbsp. flour
1/2  tsp. salt
1  c. whipping cream
1  Tbsp. dry sherry
2  c. chicken broth
2  cooked boneless skinless chicken breasts, cubed
preparation
      Melt butter and cook mushrooms.  Sprinkle in flour and salt; cook until thick, stirring constantly.  Gradually whisk in cream, then broth.  Add chicken.  When hot add sherry and serve immediately.  Makes about 4 servings.

SINGAPORE CHICKEN SATAY
ingredients
1  Tbsp. curry powder
1  Tbsp. sugar
1/4  c. vegetable oil
1/4  c. soy sauce
2  cloves minced garlic
2  lb. skinless boneless chicken breasts, cut in 3/4-inch cubes
  Peanut Sauce Dip
preparation
      In a small bowl, stir together curry powder, sugar, oil, soy sauce and garlic.
      Cut chicken into 3/4-inch cubes and place in plastic bag.  Pour in marinade; seal bag.  Refrigerate, turning occasionally, for 2 hours.
      Wet bamboo skewers with water.  Thread chicken on skewers; broil until lightly browned and tender.
      Dip pieces of chicken in Peanut Sauce Dip.
Peanut Sauce Dip:
ingredients
1/2  c. water
1/3  c. peanut butter
1  clove minced garlic
1  Tbsp. brown sugar
3/4  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/2  Tbsp. soy sauce
1/4  tsp. crushed red pepper
preparation
      In a small pan, combine water, peanut butter and garlic.  Cook over medium heat, stirring, until mixture boils and thickens. Remove from heat and stir in other ingredients.  Let cool to room temperature before serving.  Makes 1 cup.

EASY CHICKEN ENCHILADA SOUP
ingredients
1 (26 oz.)  can chicken and rice soup
1 (10 oz.)  can Ro-Tel tomatoes and chile peppers
1 (15 oz.)  can beans (black, pinto or kidney)
1 (15 oz.)  can yellow corn
1 large (12.5 oz.)  can chicken breast meat (Sweet Sue's works best)
preparation
      Mix and warm to boil.

PARMESAN FRIED CHICKEN
ingredients
5  lb. meaty broiler-fryer chicken pieces
2  Tbsp. butter or margarine
2  Tbsp. vegetable shortening
1  c. flour
2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
2  tsp. paprika
2  eggs, slightly beaten
3  Tbsp. milk
1 1/3  c. Parmesan cheese, grated
2/3  c. dry bread crumbs
1/4  c. butter or margarine, melted
preparation
      Remove skin from chicken pieces.  Lightly salt chicken. Preheat oven to 400°.  In oven, melt 2 tablespoons butter and shortening in a 15 1/2 x 10 1/2-inch jelly roll pan.  In 2-quart plastic bag, combine flour, salt, pepper and paprika.  Shake chicken pieces to coat them well.  In medium bowl, beat together eggs with milk.  Dip flour coated chicken in egg mixture.  In another 2-quart plastic bag, combine cheese and bread crumbs. Shake chicken pieces in cheese mixture to coat well.  Place chicken bone side down in melted butter and shortening in jelly roll pan. Drizzle 1/4 cup butter over chicken pieces and bake in preheated oven at 400° for 1 hour.  Serve hot or cold.  Serves 8 to 10.

CHICKEN AVOCADO SALAD FOR 3
ingredients
4  breasts of chicken
  salt
1  bay leaf
2  hard boiled eggs
2  stalks celery
2  green onions
  mayonnaise
  avocados
preparation
	Cook chicken breasts covered with water.  Add salt and bay leaf.  Bone, skin and cube chicken breasts.  Mash eggs; chop celery and green onions.  Combine; add mayonnaise to consistency you want.  Serve on half avocados.	Garnish any way you want.

WILTED LETTUCE WITH CHICKEN
ingredients
3  c. torn romaine
3  c. torn red leaf lettuce
1  c. sliced fresh mushrooms
1/4  c. green onion, sliced
1  Tbsp. olive oil
1  whole large chicken breast, skinned, boned and cut into bite size julienne strips
1  tsp. mustard seed
3  Tbsp. olive oil
2  Tbsp. white wine vinegar
2  small apples, cut into very thin wedges
3  hard-cooked eggs, cut into wedges
preparation
      In a large mixing bowl, combine romaine, red leaf lettuce, mushrooms and onion.  Toss lightly to mix.  Set aside.  In a 12-inch skillet, heat one tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add chicken and mustard seed.  Cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes or until chicken is tender.  Reduce heat to medium.  Stir in 3 tablespoons of olive oil and the vinegar.  Add apples and cook for 30 seconds.  Remove skillet from heat and immediately add lettuce mixture.  Carefully toss for about one minute or until lettuce begins to wilt.  Spoon lettuce mixture into 4 salad plates. Garnish with egg wedges.  Makes 4 servings.

CHICKEN FRICASSEE CUBAN STYLE
ingredients
4 to 5  lb. skinned fryer chicken parts
1  tsp. m.s.g.
5  cloves minced garlic
1  onion, chopped
1/2  chopped green bell pepper
2 (15 oz.)  cans tomato sauce
4  bay leaves
1  tsp. cumin seed
1 1/2  tsp. dried leaf oregano
1  c. raisins
1  c. stuffed green olives
1  tsp. cider vinegar
preparation
      Place chicken parts in a large deep skillet.  Add m.s.g., garlic, onion, green pepper, tomato sauce, bay leaves, cumin, oregano, raisins, olives and vinegar.  Cover and bring to a boil. Turn heat down and simmer 1 hour, turning chicken occasionally. Remove chicken to a platter and serve the sauce over rice or noodles.

CHICKEN ACAPULCO
ingredients
1  medium onion, chopped
1  Tbsp. butter or margarine
3  c. chopped, cooked chicken
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can cream of chicken soup
1 (8 oz.)  carton sour cream
1 (4.5 oz.)  jar sliced, drained mushrooms
1 (4 oz.)  can chopped green chilies
1/2  c. toasted, sliced almonds
1/2  tsp. dried whole oregano
1/4  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
10  (7-inch) flour tortillas
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can cream of chicken soup
1  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
1/2  c. milk
preparation
      Sauté onion in butter in a large saucepan until tender.  Stir in chicken, 1 can cream of chicken soup, sour cream, mushrooms, green chilies, almonds, oregano, salt and pepper, mixing well. Spoon about 1/2 cup chicken mixture in center of each tortilla; roll up and place seam side down in a lightly greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish.  Combine remaining ingredients; spoon over tortillas.  Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 35 minutes.

CHICKEN CORN SOUP
ingredients
4  c. cooked deboned chicken
2  c. potatoes, diced
2  pt. fresh or frozen corn
1  small onion, chopped
1/2  c. celery, chopped
  salt and pepper
preparation
      Add  potatoes,  corn,  onion and celery to three quarts broth. May  use  1/2 water and 1/2 broth.  Cook until vegetables are done.  Add  chicken.  Bring to a boil and serve.  If using canned corn, add it when you add chicken.

CHICKEN AND VEGETABLE SOUP
ingredients
1  c. butter (2 sticks)
2  c. celery, diced
2  c. onion, diced
1/2  c. flour
8  c. chicken stock
1  Tbsp. garlic powder
1  Tbsp. dill weed
1  Tbsp. celery seed
  salt and pepper to taste
4  c. fresh or frozen vegetables (your choice)
10  boneless skinless chicken breasts, cooked and diced
preparation
      In a large skillet sauté butter, onions and celery until tender.  Add flour to mixture, turn heat to low, and cook for about 45 minutes, stirring constantly, until flour mixture is golden in color.  Add chicken stock and next 4 ingredients.  Turn heat to medium; add cooked chicken and vegetables and simmer until vegetables are tender.  Serve immediately.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

CHICKEN WINGS ON THE GRILL
ingredients
1  lb. chicken wings
1/2  bottle Italian dressing
preparation
      Marinate chicken wings in the Italian dressing overnight. Grill over low heat for 30 minutes; turn and grill 30 minutes more. Enjoy!

CHICKEN TERIYAKI
ingredients
4  boneless chicken breasts, skinned
6  Tbsp. soy sauce (preferably shoyu; Japanese light soy sauce)
6  Tbsp. sake (Japanese rice wine) or dry sherry
2  Tbsp. sugar
2  garlic cloves, crushed
  1-inch piece of fresh ginger, peeled and crushed
  salt and freshly ground pepper
1 to 2  Tbsp. vegetable oil
preparation
      Cut the chicken breasts into bite-size pieces.  Place the pieces in a shallow bowl.  Mix together half the soy sauce, sake and sugar, then add half the garlic and ginger with salt and pepper to taste.  Pour over the chicken.  Cover and leave to marinate overnight.  Turn the chicken pieces in the marinade occasionally during the marinating time.  Thread the cubes of chicken onto oiled kebab skewers.  Brush with oil.  Barbecue or broil under moderate heat for about 10 minutes, until the chicken is tender.  Baste the chicken with the marinade and turn frequently during cooking.
      While the chicken is cooking put the remaining soy sauce, sake and sugar in a small pan with the remaining garlic and ginger.  Add salt and pepper to taste and heat through.  Serve the chicken hot with the warmed soy sauce mixture poured over to moisten.  Serves four.
      Menu suggestion:  Spicy and sweet, this Japanese skewered chicken looks good on a bed of saffron rice.  For an exotic touch, follow with a mixed salad of oriental vegetables, such as bean sprouts, bamboo shoots, scallions and fresh ginger.

CHICKEN CORN CHOWDER
(Makes 6 Servings)  
ingredients
1  Tbsp. butter or margarine
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. sliced fresh mushrooms
1  medium onion, chopped
2 (14 1/2 oz.)  cans chicken broth
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. frozen Shoepeg white corn
2  c. cubed cooked chicken breast
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can condensed cream of chicken soup
1/2  c. uncooked orzo
1/2  tsp. dried basil
1/2  tsp. dried rosemary or thyme
1  Tbsp. sugar
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  c. milk
2  Tbsp. all-purpose flour
3  Tbsp. all-purpose flour
1 (1.4 oz.)  pkg. fajita seasoning, divided
4  skinned and boned chicken breast halves, cubed
3  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1  medium onion, chopped
1  tsp. minced garlic
1 (15 1/4 oz.)  can whole kernel corn with red and green peppers, drained
1 (15 oz.)  can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 (14 1/2 oz.)  can Mexican-style stewed tomatoes
1 (4.5 oz.)  can chopped green chiles
3  c. water
1  c. uncooked instant brown rice
1 (2 1/4 oz.)  can sliced ripe olives (optional)
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can condensed nacho cheese soup
3  Tbsp. chopped fresh cilantro
1  Tbsp. lime juice
  chopped fresh cilantro (garnish)
  breadsticks (optional)
preparation
      Combine flour and 2 tablespoons fajita seasoning in a heavy-duty zip-top plastic bag. Add chicken; seal and shake to coat. Cook chicken in hot oil in a large Dutch oven over high heat, stirring often, 4 minutes or until browned. Reduce heat to medium-high. Add onion and garlic; saut 5 minutes. Stir in remaining fajita seasoning, corn, next 5 ingredients, and if desired, olives. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer 5 minutes. Remove lid and stir in nacho cheese soup, chopped cilantro and lime juice. Garnish, if desired, and serve with breadsticks, if desired. Prep: 15 minutes. Cook: 15 minutes.

SOUTH OF THE BORDER CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
2  boneless chicken breasts, cooked and diced
2  ripe tomatoes, diced
1  small red onion, diced
1  large jicama, diced (Mexican potato)
1  bunch fresh cilantro, chopped
1  lime, juiced
1  avocado, peeled, seeded, and sliced
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      In large bowl, combine chicken, tomatoes, red onion, jicama, cilantro and lime juice. Toss together well.  Garnish with slices of avocado, season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

CHICKEN SALAD RIVIERA
ingredients
1  can (20 oz.) pineapple tidbits, drained
1 1/2  lb. chicken meat, cooked and cut into chunks
1/2  c. frozen green peas, thawed
1/2  c. celery, sliced
1/2  c. seedless grapes, halved
1/2  c. toasted slivered almonds
3  Tbsp. green onions, chopped
  crisp salad greens
  Sunny Dressing
preparation
      Combine pineapple, chicken, peas, celery, grapes, almonds, and onion in a bowl.  Toss with Sunny Dressing.  Serve on salad plates lined with crisp greens.  Serves 4 to 6.
Sunny Dressing:
ingredients
1/3  c. mayonnaise
1  clove garlic, pressed
1/3  c. sour cream
1  tsp. ground coriander
1/2  tsp. ground cumin
1/4  tsp. dry mustard
1/4  tsp. ground cloves
1/8  tsp. cayenne pepper
preparation
      Combine all ingredients thoroughly.

WITCHES BREW CHICKEN SOUP
ingredients
1  Tbsp. butter or margarine
4  skinned and boned chicken breast halves chopped
1  large onion chopped
3  carrots chopped
2 garlic  cloves minced
2 (14 oz.)  cans low sodium chicken broth
1  Tbsp. chicken bouillon granules
1  tsp. ground cumin
1/4  tsp. ground red pepper
3 (16 oz.)  cans great northern beans, rinsed, drained and divided
1 (4.5 oz.)  can chopped green chilies
2  Tbsp. all-purpose flour
1/2  c. milk
1/4  c. chopped fresh cilantro
  Toppings: shredded cheddar cheese, sour cream, sliced green onions, cooked and crumbled bacon
preparation
      Melt butter in a large dutch-oven over medium-high heat.  Add chicken and next three ingredients and sauté 10 minutes.  Stir in broth and next three ingredients.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally for 20 minutes.  Stir in 2 cans of beans and chilies.  Mash remaining can of beans in a small bowl. Whisk together flour and milk and stir into beans.  Gradually add bean mixture to soup mixture; stirring constantly.  Cook 10 minutes or until thickened.  Remove from heat and stir in cilantro.  Serve with desired toppings.  Make a salad, grab some crusty bread and you've got a complete meal.
       Yield: 12 c.

VEGETABLE CHICKEN SOUP
ingredients
1  Tbsp. olive oil
1/2  lb. boneless skinless chicken breast
2  large garlic cloves
1  c. cauliflower chunks
1  c. fresh spinach
5  drops hot chili sauce
2  c. chopped tomatoes with juice
1  medium onion
3/4  c. sliced carrots
2  cans nonfat, low-sodium chicken broth
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      In large saucepan, heat oil. Sauté chicken until slightly brown. Remove chicken to a bowl. Add onions, garlic and carrots to the pan, stirring until onions begin to soften. Return chicken to pan along with cauliflower, tomatoes and broth. Simmer 20 to 25 minutes. Stir in spinach, chili sauce or hot sauce and simmer an additional 5 minutes.

CHICKEN CACCIATORE
ingredients
1  (2 1/2 to 3 1/2 lb.) fryer, cut up
1/2  c. vegetable oil
1/2  c. chopped green onion
1/2  c. chopped celery
2  cloves garlic, chopped
1 (4 oz.)  can button mushrooms
1 1/2  c. canned tomatoes, strained
1/2 (6 oz.)  can tomato paste
1/2  c. dry sherry
2  tsp. sugar
  salt and pepper
2 1/2  c. water
3/4  lb. spaghetti
preparation
      Brown chicken in oil over medium heat; remove chicken.  Add onion and celery; fry slowly 15 minutes.  Stir in mushrooms, tomatoes, tomato paste, sherry, sugar and seasonings.  Add water and chicken; cook over low heat until chicken is tender.  Cook spaghetti; then remove chicken from sauce and place in serving dish.  Pour remaining sauce over drained spaghetti.

CHICKEN AND HAM SALAD
ingredients
1/3  c. mayonnaise
1/3  c. dairy sour cream
1  Tbsp. prepared mustard
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  c. diced, cooked chicken
2  c. diced, cooked ham
1  c. chopped celery
  salad greens
  Planters slivered almonds, toasted
  Ritz crackers
preparation
      In large bowl, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, mustard and lemon juice.  Mix in chicken, ham and celery.  Chill until ready to serve.
      To Serve:  Spoon salad onto individual salad plates lined with crisp salad greens.  Sprinkle with Planters slivered almonds. Serve with Ritz crackers.

CONNIE'S CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
2 sm.  cans Chicken
1 8  oz. pkg. Cream Cheese
1 sm.  can Pineapple, crushed, drain
1  small Onion, chopped finely
2 - 3  tbsp. Sugar
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together and refrigerate.  Serve with crackers or bread.

CHICKEN AND ASPARAGUS MEDLEY
ingredients
6  whole chicken breasts (boneless)
  chicken seasonings
1  lb. fresh asparagus
3  Tbsp. margarine
1 large  can Campbell's chunky cream of mushroom soup
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°.  Pound chicken breasts; add seasonings to taste.  Cut bottoms off the asparagus, leaving them about 6 inches long (most tender part).  Lay breasts flat, then put 3 or 4 spears side by side in the center of each breast.  Spread 1/2 tablespoon margarine across the spears in each breast.  Fold chicken over like a jacket (overlap).
      Spray a square casserole dish with Pam or vegetable oil or grease bottom and sides with margarine.  Flip chicken over so that seams are face down and lie in pan.  Spread entire can of soup over chicken (do not add water or milk).  Cover with foil and cook for 25 minutes, then remove foil and cook another 20 to 25 minutes. (This should thicken the sauce.)  Makes 6 hearty servings.

SINGAPORE CHICKEN AND BLACK BEAN SALAD
ingredients
3/4  c. picante sauce
1/2  c. rice vinegar
2  Tbsp. peanut butter
1  clove garlic, peeled
6  c. salad greens, torn in bite-size pieces
1/2  c. fresh cilantro leaves
1 (about 16 oz.)  can black beans, drained and rinsed
2  green onions, sliced
2  c. cooked chicken strips
1  large green or red pepper, cut into 1/4-inch rings
preparation
      In a blender place picante sauce, vinegar, peanut butter and garlic.  Cover and blend until smooth.  Toss salad greens, cilantro, beans and onions with 1/2 cup picante sauce mixture until evenly coated.
      Arrange on 4 plates.  Arrange chicken and pepper of salad greens.  Pour remaining picante sauce mixture over chicken.

CHICKEN BARLEY SOUP
ingredients
1  broiler-fryer chicken (2 to 3 lb.), cut up
2  qt. water
1 1/2  c. diced carrots
1  c. diced celery
1/2  c. barley
1/2  c. chopped onion
1  chicken bouillon cube
1  tsp. salt
1  bay leaf
1/2  tsp. poultry seasoning
1/2  tsp. pepper
1/2  tsp. dried sage
preparation
      In large kettle, cook chicken in water until tender. Cook broth and skim off fat. Bone the chicken and cut into bite size pieces; return to kettle along with remaining ingredients. Simmer, covered, for at least 1 hour or until vegetables and barley are tender. Remove bay leaf. Makes about 1 1/2 quarts or about 5 servings.

CHICKEN WITH GINGER AND GARBANZO BEANS
ingredients
1  chicken, skinned and cut into serving pieces
  water
1/3  c. lemon juice
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  Tbsp. vegetable oil
2  chopped onions
1/4  c. fresh chopped ginger
1  tsp. ground cumin
1  tsp. ground cardamom
1  tsp. ground coriander
2 (16 oz.)  cans garbanzo beans, drained
2  c. chicken broth
preparation
      Do not skimp on the ginger.  Serve with a starch such as bulgur or brown rice.
      Place chicken in a large bowl.  Cover with water.  Add lemon juice.  Let marinate for 20 minutes.  Drain chicken.  Pat dry, then season with salt and pepper.  In a 4-quart pot, heat oil.  Brown chicken in oil on all sides.  Remove from pot.  Cook the onions in the same pot until soft.  Add more oil, if needed.  To the onions, add ginger, cumin, cardamom and coriander.  Cook for a few more minutes.  To the pot, add the chicken, garbanzo beans and broth. Bring to a boil on high heat.  Reduce heat.  Let cook, covered, for 30 minutes or until chicken is tender.  Serve with cooked bulgur, brown rice and/or pita bread.

CHICKEN LIVERS
ingredients
2  onions, sliced thin
2  stalks celery, sliced thin
1  Tbsp. diet margarine
1  lb. chicken livers
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. fresh ground pepper
preparation
      Sauté onions and celery in margarine until celery is wilted. Remove and set aside.  Add livers and turn heat high.  Cook, turning once or twice, until done, approximately 3 to 5 minutes. Top with onions and celery.  Season with salt and pepper.
      Exchanges per serving - 1 serving = 1 fat, 3 meat, 1 "A" and 1 "B" vegetable.  Yields 4 servings, 279 calories per serving.

CHICKEN PARMIGIANA
ingredients
4  whole large chicken breasts, boned and skinned, each cut in half
1 1/2  c. dried bread crumbs
  olive oil or salad oil
1 (18 oz.)  pkg. Mozzarella cheese
1 (15 to 15 1/2 oz.)  jar spaghetti sauce
  Parmesan cheese
preparation
      With meat mallet or dull edge of French knife, pound each chicken breast half to 1/4-inch thickness.  Place bread crumbs in pie plate.  Moisten chicken pieces with water, then dip into bread crumbs to coat evenly.  In a 12-inch skillet, over medium-high heat, add 3 tablespoons hot oil.  Cook chicken a few pieces at a time until golden brown on both sides, about 2 minutes.  Add more oil if necessary.  Slice Mozzarella cheese lengthwise into 8 slices.  Alternate chicken and cheese, overlapping slightly in baking dish.  Spoon spaghetti sauce over chicken.  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

CREAMY CHICKEN SOUP
ingredients
3  chicken breasts, cooked and cut in chunks (reserve broth)
1  can whole kernel corn, drained
1  can cream of chicken soup
1  can milk
1  can Ro-Tel (hot or mild, your choice)
1  Tbsp. butter or margarine
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
	Boil chicken breasts in pot until cooked. Reserve broth. Cut into bite-size pieces.
	In large pot, add chicken, corn, cream of chicken soup, milk, Ro-Tel, salt and pepper and butter. If soup is too thick, you can add a little chicken broth to desired consistency.	Stir well and heat thoroughly.

TACO CHICKEN
ingredients
1/2  c. milk
1  can cream of chicken soup
1  can cream of mushroom soup
2  Tbsp. chopped onion
1  c. sour cream
1 (4 oz.)  can chopped ripe olives
1 (4 oz.)  can chopped green chilies
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
  taco chips
4  c. chopped (large pieces), cooked and boned chicken
1/2  lb. Monterey Jack cheese, shredded
preparation
      Combine milk, chicken soup, mushroom soup, onion, sour cream, olives, chilies and garlic salt in large mixing bowl.  Break taco chips into bite size pieces and cover bottom of casserole dish. Layer with chicken and soup mixture and cheese, starting with chips; repeat.  Bake until bubbly for 45 minutes at 350°.

LEMON-GARLIC CHICKEN
ingredients
5  cloves garlic, chopped
3/4  c. lemon juice
1  Tbsp. salt
1/2  Tbsp. pepper
1  Tbsp. oregano
1/4 to 1/2  c. oil
8  to 10 pieces chicken
preparation
      Combine first 6 ingredients for marinade.  Marinate chicken overnight (or all day).  Cook chicken on grill, basting with marinade.
      Or  may broil or bake in oven, as you would normally do chicken.  Bake  at  400° for about 30 to 40 minutes.  Baste as desired.

THAI CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
4  boneless skinless chicken breasts
1/2  c. bean sprouts
2  green bell peppers, finely chopped
1  bag mixed salad greens
  Dressing
preparation
      Poach chicken in salted water until opaque.  Drain and shred into pieces.  Toss dressing with chicken.  Add sprouts and peppers; serve over mixed greens.  Serves 4 to 6.
Dressing:
ingredients
1 1/2  tsp. olive oil
1  lime (juice only)
2  tsp. sugar
1  tsp. chili powder
2  Tbsp. Teriyaki sauce
1  Tbsp. water
3  Tbsp. rice wine vinegar
2  Tbsp. fresh ground ginger
4  scallions, chopped
1/2  c. fresh basil leaves, chopped
1/2  c. fresh mint leaves, chopped
preparation
      Combine all ingredients and mix thoroughly.

HONEY OF A CHICKEN BREAST
ingredients
3  chicken breasts, skinned, split and boned
  seasoned salt and pepper
1  c. coarse bread crumbs
1/2  tsp. thyme
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. oregano
1/2  c. white wine
1/2  c. vegetable oil
preparation
      Rinse chicken under running cold water; drain and pat dry with paper towel.  Season lightly with salt and pepper.  Combine crumbs and herbs.  Brush all sides of chicken with oil; then roll each piece in crumb mixture until coated on all sides.  Spread honey mixture on each piece of chicken and roll into a ball.  Make a cup of foil to hold each piece of chicken.  Place in baking dish.  Pour wine over each piece of chicken.  Then generously cover top of chicken with more honey sauce, about 1 1/2 tablespoons for each piece.  Place in 375° oven and bake, uncovered, for 45 minutes or until golden brown.
Honey Sauce For Chicken:
ingredients
1  c. honey
1/4  c. prepared mustard
1/4  c. prepared horseradish
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together.  The honey sauce is the secret to this recipe.  Use leftover sauce to dip fried chicken in.  We like it best like this.

CHICKEN AND RICE CASSEROLE
ingredients
2  hard-cooked eggs, chopped
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can cream of mushroom soup
1  small onion, chopped
1 1/2  c. diced, cooked chicken (no skin)
1  c. cooked rice
1/2  c. chopped celery
1/4  c. reduced calorie mayonnaise
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/4  c. soft bread crumbs
1  Tbsp. dry butter substitute
preparation
      Combine eggs, soup, onion, chicken, rice, celery, mayonnaise and lemon juice, stirring well.  Spoon mixture into nonstick 2-quart casserole.  Combine bread crumbs and butter substitute; sprinkle over top of casserole.  Bake at 350°, uncovered, for 40 to 45 minutes or until bubbly.

CHICKEN MARINADE
ingredients
1/2  c. oil or butter
1/2  c. lemon juice
1/2  c. wine vinegar
1/4  c. soy sauce
1/2  tsp. Accent salt
1 1/2  tsp. brown sugar
2 to 3  drops Worcestershire sauce
2 to 3  drops Tabasco sauce
preparation
      Mix together and bring to a boil.  Clean chicken.  Spread with lemon juice and let marinate while fire gets ready.  Season with garlic salt, seasoned salt, salt and pepper.  Place inside (boney side) down and let it brown.  Move over and cook over indirect heat until done.  Keep basting!

SWISS CHICKEN
ingredients
4  chicken breasts
  mayonnaise
  Swiss cheese slices
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1/4  c. chicken broth
  bread crumbs or croutons
  butter
preparation
      Place 4 chicken breasts (halved and boned, 8 fillets) in mayonnaise coated casserole.  Cover with slices of Swiss cheese. Mix 1 can cream of mushroom soup with 1/4 cup chicken broth; pour over chicken and cheese.  Cover top with bread crumbs or croutons and dot with butter.  Bake at 325° for 3/4 to 1 hour.

CHICKEN SALSA
ingredients
1 1/2  c. salsa
2  Tbsp. brown sugar
1  Tbsp. mustard
  chicken (enough for one meal)
preparation
      Mix salsa, sugar and mustard.  Pour over chicken; bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes.

PASTA AND CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. box ruffles pasta (Muellers)
1  medium onion, diced
1  green pepper, sliced
2  stalks celery, sliced very thin
1  c. mayo or salad dressing
1 (10 oz.)  can chunk chicken
preparation
      Use the quantity of each that is to your taste to make a salad to feed 5 to 8 people.

CHICKEN NUGGETS
(Appetizer)  
ingredients
4  chicken breasts, boneless
1  egg
1/2  c. water
3/4  c. all purpose flour
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Cut chicken into 1-inch pieces.  Heat 3-inches of oil in a large heavy saucepan over medium heat until it reaches 375°, adjust heat to maintain temperature.  Meanwhile beat egg and water in large bowl until well mixed.  Add flour, salt, and pepper, stirring to form smooth batter.  Dip chicken pieces into batter, draining off excess.  Fry chicken, a few pieces at a time, in hot oil about 4 minutes or until golden brown.  Drain on paper towels. Serve with sauces.
Apricot Sauce:
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  jar apricot preserves
3  Tbsp. Dijon mustard
2  Tbsp. prepared horseradish
preparation
      In a small bowl blend well.  Microwave at high (100%) 1 to 1 1/2 minutes or until heated through.
Dill Mayonnaise Sauce:
ingredients
1  c. mayonnaise
2  cloves garlic, minced
1 1/2  tsp. dill weed
preparation
      Combine in small bowl, cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Cocktail Sauce:
ingredients
3/4  c. catsup
2  Tbsp. tomato paste
1  Tbsp. prepared horseradish
4  Tbsp. lemon juice
  Hot pepper sauce to taste
preparation
      Combine all in small bowl, blend well.

CROCK-POT CHICKEN AND RICE CASSEROLE
ingredients
1 small  can cream of chicken soup
1 small  can cream of celery soup
1 small  can cream of mushroom soup
4  large chicken breasts
1/2  c. diced celery
1  c. Minute rice
preparation
      Mix  in  crock-pot  the 3 cans of soup and rice.  Place the chicken on top of the mixture, then add the diced celery. Cook for 3 hours on high or 4 hours on low.  Makes 4 servings.
      More rice, about 1/2 cup, and 2 additional chicken breasts may be added to make 6 servings.

CHICKEN SALAD ON BUNS
ingredients
2  c. diced, leftover, cooked chicken
1/4  lb. process American cheese, diced
1 to 2  Tbsp. pickle relish
1/4  c. salad dressing or mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. chopped onion
2  Tbsp. chopped green pepper
  kaiser rolls
preparation
      In a bowl, combine the first 6 ingredients; mix well. Spoon about 1/3 cup onto each roll. Wrap each tightly in foil. Bake at 300° for 20 to 30 minutes or until heated through. Yield: 6 to 8 servings.

QUICK AND EASY CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
4  boneless chicken breasts, cooked
1/2  c. slivered almonds
1/2  c. fat-free plain yogurt
1/2  c. red or green seedless grapes
  pepper to taste
preparation
      Toast almonds on a baking sheet for 6 to 8 minutes at 350°. Remove from oven and let cool. Cut grapes in half. Mix chicken, grapes, almonds and yogurt along with pepper. Chill.

CHICKEN ENCHILADAS
ingredients
2  doz. corn tortillas
2  cans cream of chicken
1  whole chicken
1  c. green onions, chopped
1 large  can chili verde or Ortega chili, chopped
1  small container sour cream
  garlic salt to taste
  salt to taste
  sprinkle of oregano
  pepper to taste
2 to 4  c. grated Longhorn cheese (mild)
preparation
      Boil chicken.  When done, debone.  Mix chicken with cream of chicken, onions, chili and sour cream.  Add spices to taste.  Layer tortillas on bottom of pan, covering it.  Add ingredients in layers.  Sprinkle cheese over it.  Layer again with tortillas, etc. Add rest of cheese on top of last layer.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.

AMISH CHICKEN CORN SOUP
ingredients
2  lbs cut up chicken
5  cups water
1  med. onion (chopped)
2  tbsp chopped parsley
1/2  cup chopped celery
2  cups corn
  salt
  pepper
1  cup flour
1  egg, beaten
1/4  cup milk
preparation
      Simmer chicken in boiling water until tender, remove bones and skin, strain the stock.  Return stock and chicken to the pot, add onions, celery and corn.  Simmer until vegetables are tender.
      Mix flour with egg and milk.  Rub mixture with a fork till it crumbles, drop crumbs in soup.  Cook 10 more minutes covered. Serves 3 to 4.

HONEY CHICKEN & GRAPE SALAD
ingredients
1/2  c. Sweet Honey Catalina Dressing (Kraft) or Light Done Right Catalina
1/4  tsp. grated orange peel
6  oz. grilled chicken breast strips
1 1/2  c. halved red grapes
3/4  c. sliced celery
4  c. torn romaine lettuce
  Hulled sunflower seeds
preparation
      Mix dressing and orange peel in large bowl.  Add chicken breast strips, grapes and celery.  Toss lightly.  Refrigerate several hours or overnight.  Toss with lettuce and sprinkle with sunflower seeds just before serving.

GRILLED CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
4  eggs, boiled and sliced
1  cucumber, sliced
1  head lettuce
  red onion, sliced
2  leaves romaine lettuce
4  boneless, skinless chicken breasts
1/2  c. Italian dressing
2  Tbsp. honey
2  tsp. lemon pepper
  salt to taste
  favorite salad dressing
preparation
      Mix honey and dressing for marinade.  Place chicken breasts, cut in strips, in 1/2 marinade in refrigerator for 3 hours.  Pour out marinade.  Grill chicken until done, basting with remaining marinade that chicken was not in.
      Mix together eggs and salad greens.  Add others if you wish. Cube chicken over salad.  Pour on favorite dressing.

GLAZED CHICKEN WINGS
ingredients
2  c. duck sauce
4  oz. honey
3  Tbsp. lemon juice
3  Tbsp. soy sauce
3  Tbsp. brown sugar
2 to 3  lb. chicken wings or wingettes (little wings without tips)
preparation
      Mix first 5 ingredients in a bowl, set aside.  Cut chicken at joints; place in a row in roasting pan.  Place the sauce over the wings and bake until golden brown in a 350° oven.

CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
1  whole broiler-fryer chicken (3 1/2 lb.)
2  medium stalks celery, thinly sliced
1  can (4.5 oz.) large pitted ripe olives, drained and cut lengthwise in half
3/4  c. mayonnaise
1  Tbsp. whipping cream
1  Tbsp. tarragon vinegar
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. lemon pepper
  chicory leaves
1/2  pint cherry tomatoes, halved
preparation
      Steam chicken in steamer or simmer in large saucepot until fork-tender; drain and cool.  Discard skin and bones; cut meat into bite-size chunks.  In large bowl, mix chicken and remaining ingredients except chicory and tomatoes.  Chill mixture at least 1 hour to blend flavors.  To serve, line serving platter with chicory.  Spoon chicken salad onto platter and garnish with cherry tomato halves. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

QUICK CHICKEN CACCIATORE
ingredients
4  (4 oz.) boneless chicken breasts, lightly seasoned with salt and pepper
  flour
2  cloves garlic, finely chopped
4  Tbsp. olive oil
1 (26 oz.)  jar Classico di Napoli pasta sauce
1  small green pepper, seeded and cut into strips
2  slices Provolone cheese, cut in half
1 (7 oz.)  pkg. Creamettes elbow macaroni, cooked and drained
  chopped parsley
preparation
      Coat chicken with flour.  In large skillet, brown chicken and garlic in 3 tablespoons oil; remove chicken from pan.  Add pasta sauce, then chicken; stir.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.  Cover and simmer 20 minutes, adding pepper during last 5 minutes. Uncover; top each chicken breast with half cheese slice.  Toss hot cooked macaroni with remaining 1 tablespoon oil and parsley.  Serve with chicken and sauce.

SIMMERING CHICKEN STRAWBERRY KABOBS
ingredients
1  c. lemon juice
2 -8  oz. cans pineapple chunks, juice reserved
  salt and pepper to taste
2  tsp. ground cinnamon
3  skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed
1  c. butter, melted
2  Tbsp. brown sugar
1  tsp. ground nutmeg
24  large strawberries
preparation
      In a shallow glass bowl combine lemon juice, juice from pineapple can, salt, pepper and 1 teaspoon cinnamon.  Mix together. Add cubed chicken and marinate for 1 hour in the refrigerator. Preheat grill to medium heat.  In a small bowl combine the melted butter or margarine, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, brown sugar and nutmeg. Lightly oil grate.  Using metal or soaked wooden skewers arrange chicken, pineapple chunks and strawberries on each stick (approximately 4 to 6 pieces of each item per skewer).  Brush kabobs with butter or margarine mixture place on grill and cook, turning on all sides, until chicken is cooked through and strawberries are sizzling, approximately 8 to 10 minutes.
      You may want to spice the chicken up a bit more to add to the contrast between the meat and the fruit. Try adding some crushed chilies to your chicken marinade.

CHICKEN CRESCENTS
ingredients
1  can crescent rolls
3  oz. pkg. cream cheese
2  Tbsp. soft margarine
1/4  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
2  Tbsp. milk
1  Tbsp. chopped onion
1  Tbsp. chopped pimento
2  c. cooked chopped chicken
preparation
	Separate crescent rolls into 4 rectangles. Place on a cookie sheet. Blend all other ingredients. Spoon 1/2 cup of chicken mixture onto each rectangle. Roll the 4 corners of the crescent dough over chicken mixture to the center. Brush with melted butter or margarine. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

CHICKEN FRIED STEAKS AND MILK GRAVY
ingredients
4  (4 to 5 oz.) cube steaks
1/2  tsp. salt
1 1/2 to 1 3/4  tsp. pepper
1  c. all-purpose flour
2  eggs, lightly beaten
1/4  c. lard or vegetable oil
1  c. milk
preparation
      Season meat with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Mix flour with 1 teaspoon pepper in shallow plate.  Dredge each steak in flour.  Dip in beaten egg, then dredge in flour again. Heat lard or oil in large, heavy skillet until hot.  Fry steak 3 to 4 minutes on each side, until golden brown.  Drain on paper towels. Pour off all but 2 tablespoons of the oil.  Sprinkle 2 tablespoons of the dredging flour into oil.  Cook over medium heat 1 minute, scraping up browned bits from bottom of skillet.  Stir in milk, a little at a time, until gravy is smooth.  Cook, stirring frequently, 3 to 4 minutes, until thickened and bubbly.  Add 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon pepper and 1/4 teaspoon salt; gravy should be quite peppery.  Serve steaks smothered in gravy.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

CHICKEN SPAGHETTI WITH ROTEL TOMATOES
ingredients
1  stick oleo
1  medium onion
1  bell pepper (optional)
1  can Ro-Tel diced tomatoes
1  can cream of chicken soup
1 1/2  c. grated Cheddar cheese or 8 oz. cubed Velveeta cheese
1  fryer, cooked, deboned and cut up (can use frozen breasts)
7  oz. thin spaghetti, cooked in the chicken broth and drained
preparation
      Melt 1 stick oleo in skillet and sauté medium chopped onion and bell pepper (optional) until tender.  Add the Ro-Tel tomatoes, cream of chicken soup and Cheddar cheese.  Add chopped chicken and drained spaghetti.  Keep heat low until the cheese melts.  Pour in 9 x 13-inch casserole and bake at 350° for approximately 25 to 30 minutes.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

QUICK CHICKEN CHOWDER
ingredients
1/4  c. chopped celery
1  tsp. instant minced onion
1  Tbsp. butter or margarine
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. frozen green peas and potatoes with cream sauce
1 3/4  c. chicken broth
1 (6 oz.)  can evaporated milk
1/8  tsp. dried rosemary, crushed
  dash of pepper
1  c. diced, cooked chicken
  bacon, crisp-cooked and crumbled or paprika (for garnish)
preparation
      Cook celery and onion in butter until tender, but not brown. Stir in peas and potatoes, broth, milk, rosemary and dash of pepper.  Cook and stir until mixture boils.  Reduce heat.  Cover and simmer about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Add chicken and heat to boiling.  Serve hot and sprinkle crumbled, crisp-cooked bacon or paprika over the top.  Makes 4 servings.

CHICKEN AND ESCAROLE SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. hamburger
2  slices bread (wet), broken up
2  eggs
1 1/2  c. grated Cheddar cheese
1/2  c. Parmesan cheese
  salt to taste
  oregano to taste
preparation
      Boil 1 chicken or stewing hen.  Squeeze 1/2 lemon into stock. Use 2 or 3 cubes chicken bouillon or 2 tablespoons chicken soup base.  Boil with celery, onion and garlic.  Remove chicken and pick meat off bones.  Return meat to stock.  The fat needs to be skimmed off.  (It's easier to refrigerate and then skim off and re-cook the next day.)  Heat stock.  Add meatballs and cook about 2 hours. Just before serving, add one bunch escarole (spinach), chopped up. Heat and serve.

CHICKEN LIVERS
ingredients
1/2  c. margarine
1  medium onion, minced
1/2  lb. mushrooms, sliced
  salt and pepper to taste
1  c. instant rice
2  c. chicken broth, boiling
1/2  lb. chicken livers
preparation
      Heat 1/4 cup margarine in heavy saucepan.  Add onion and sauté 2 to 3 minutes.  Add mushrooms and cook 5 minutes.  Add rice and stir until rice just begins to brown.  Stir in boiling broth. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes.  Add a little more broth if mixture is too dry.  Sauté livers in remaining margarine, after dusting them with flour, until done.  Add seasoning.  Stir gently into rice mixture.

CHICKEN TACO SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. chicken breasts, boned and skinned
2  Tbsp. Olive oil
1  pkg. Taco seasoning mix
1  onion, finely chopped
1  clove garlic, minced
1 (15 oz.)  can stewed tomatoes
1 (4 oz.)  can green chilies, chopped
2  c. water
1 (8 oz.)  can or jar mild green chili salsa
1 (15 oz.)  can black beans
1 (15 oz.)  can pinto beans
1 (15 oz.)  can Mexican style stewed tomatoes
preparation
      Season chicken to taste and broil in oven until done.  Remove meat; cool and shred with a fork.  (Chicken may be covered with water and boiled on stove until done if preferred.  Remove from water; cool and shred with a fork.)  In a large skillet, combine shredded chicken, olive oil, taco seasoning, onions, and garlic. Cook until onions are clear.  While cooking chicken mixture, combine all the remaining ingredients in a pot and heat.  When skillet mixture is done, add to the pot and heat thoroughly.  Serve soup with cheese and chips or corn bread.

CHICKEN CHOW MEIN
ingredients
1  Tbsp. vegetable oil
3  c. slant-sliced celery
1/2  c. slant-sliced green onions with tops
2 1/2  c. hot chicken broth
3  Tbsp. cornstarch
1/8  tsp. garlic powder
1/2  tsp. ground ginger
1/2  c. cold water
1  Tbsp. soy sauce
3 1/4  c. cooked chicken in small pieces
1 (6 oz.)  can mushrooms
1 1/4  c. chopped green pepper
1 (8 oz.)  can water chestnuts, drained and sliced
1 (3 1/2 oz.)  can chow mein noodles
2  Tbsp. finely cut candied ginger
preparation
      Heat oil in deep heavy pot; add celery and onions.  Stir-fry over moderate heat until onions are transparent but not brown.  Add chicken broth; cover and cook 4 to 5 minutes.
      Meanwhile, mix cornstarch, salt, garlic, ginger, cold water and soy sauce; mix until smooth.  Add slowly to hot mixture, stirring constantly.  Cook until liquid is thick and clear.  Add chicken, green pepper, mushrooms and water chestnuts; mix well.  Cover and cook on low about 5 minutes or until hot.  Turn into 2-quart serving dish.  Mix noodles and candied ginger and scatter on top of chicken mixture.

RANCH CHICKEN BALL
ingredients
8  oz. cream cheese
10  oz. (1 can) chicken breast chunks
1  oz. (1 pkg.) ranch salad dressing, dry mix (Hidden Valley)
2  Tbsp. almonds, sliced (optional)
preparation
      Cream together cream cheese, chicken breast chunks and salad dressing mix.  Refrigerate for several hours in a Cool Whip tub which has been lined with Saran Wrap.  After several hours (or overnight), turn out onto a plate and top with almonds.
      Serve with Triscuits or favorite crackers.

BAKED ALMOND CHICKEN
ingredients
1  broiler-fryer (3 1/2 lb.), cut in pieces
  flour
1  tsp. celery salt
1  tsp. paprika
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. curry powder
1/2  tsp. oregano
1/2  tsp. ground pepper
6  Tbsp. melted butter
3/4  c. sliced almonds
1 1/2  c. light cream
1/2  c. sour cream
3  Tbsp. bread crumbs, blended with 1 Tbsp. melted butter
preparation
      Coat chicken pieces with flour.  Blend celery salt, paprika, salt, curry powder, oregano and pepper with butter, coating all sides.  Arrange chicken in single layer in a baking dish (9 x 13-inches).  Sprinkle evenly with almonds.  Pour light cream between pieces.  Bake, uncovered, in a moderate 350° oven for 45 minutes.  Uncover.  Spoon 1/2 cup sauce from pan into sour cream and mix together.  Pour evenly over chicken.  Sprinkle with bread crumbs.  Bake, uncovered, about 15 minutes longer or until chicken is tender.  Makes 6 servings.

CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP
ingredients
2  c. cooked egg noodles
2  cans cream of chicken soup
2  cooked, chopped chicken breasts
1 small  can sliced carrots
2 soup  cans skim milk
  salt to taste
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  Stir while heating thoroughly on medium heat.

CHICKEN-VEGETABLE PACKETS
ingredients
3  to 4 large potatoes, scrubbed well, unpeeled and cut into bite-size pieces
3  to 4 large carrots, diagonally sliced
1/2  lb. green beans, each snapped in half
3/4  c. water
3  Tbsp. butter or margarine
1 1/4  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/4  tsp. thyme leaves
3  tsp. instant chicken flavor bouillon
4  chicken breasts (may use 1 thigh and 1 leg in place of 1 breast)
preparation
      Prepare outdoor grill.  In large bowl, mix all ingredients except chicken.  On double thickness of heavy-duty foil, place 1/4 of chicken and 1/4 of vegetable mixture.  Wrap chicken and vegetable mixture in foil.  Make certain seam of foil is folded several times to seal in juices.  Repeat to make three more packets.
      Place packets on grill over medium heat.  Cook approximately 45 minutes or until chicken and vegetables are fork-tender.  Turn packets occasionally with tongs.  Makes 4 servings.

BARBECUE SAUCE FOR CHICKEN
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  bottle catsup
1  c. brown sugar
1/4  c. vinegar
2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
2  Tbsp. soy sauce
1  tsp. dry mustard
2 large  cloves garlic, minced
2  Tbsp. fresh lemon juice
1  Tbsp. chili powder
  hot pepper sauce to taste
preparation
      Combine all ingredients in 2-quart saucepan.  Heat to boiling; reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes.  Yields about 2 cups.

QUICK AND EASY CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP
ingredients
1  pkg. Lipton Noodles-n-Sauce (chicken flavor)
7  c. water
1  large celery stalk, chopped
2  carrots, chopped
1  c. chicken broth
1 large  can Swanson white chicken
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
	Mix all ingredients except Noodles-n-Sauce.  Simmer for 1 hour or until vegetables are tender.  Add Noodles-n-Sauce.  Continue to cook for 10 minutes.

Mock "Fried Chicken"
ingredients
1  lb. firm tofu, diced 1/4 to 1/8-inch thick
1  Tbsp. soy sauce plus 2 to 3 Tbsp. water (enough of this mixture to cover marinade dish)
3  Tbsp. vegetable oil (may need to add more)
1/3  c. nutritional yeast flakes
  onion powder (approximately 1/8 tsp.)
  cayenne to taste
preparation
      Make a light paste with all of the ingredients, except tofu and oil.  Marinate tofu for a few minutes, turning occasionally.  Heat skillet with oil until hot.
Dry Mixture:
ingredients
  unbleached white flour*
  salt and cayenne to taste
  nutritional yeast flakes*
preparation
      *Flour ration should be approximately 4 to 1 yeast flakes.
      Dredge tofu in flour mixture.  Fry tofu until brown on both sides.  Drain on paper towels.  This mock "fried chicken" can be eaten as "cold chicken" after refrigeration.

CHICKEN AND DUMPLINGS
Chicken and Broth:
ingredients
1  whole chicken (3 to 4 lb.)
1  small carrot
1  stalk celery
3  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
3  c. flour
1/2  c. shortening
1/2  c. milk
1/2  stick butter
preparation
      Wash chicken and place in a large pot with enough water to cover well.  Add salt, pepper, carrot and celery.  Bring to a boil; lower heat and cook at a gentle boil for about 45 minutes to an hour.  Be sure to add more water if it gets low.
      When chicken is very tender, remove chicken, carrot and celery from broth; discard vegetables.  When chicken is cool, remove meat from the bones.  Add meat back to the broth.  If the chicken broth does not have a good amount of fat on top, add a half stick of butter.
Dumplings:
ingredients
3  c. flour
1  tsp. salt
1/2  c. shortening
1/2  c. milk or more
preparation
      Sift flour and salt into a bowl; cut in shortening.  Stir in enough milk to make a stiff dough.  Turn dough out onto a floured surface.  Knead dough, but don't overwork.  Roll dough thin and cut into strips about an inch or two wide and about three-inches long. Coat the dumplings well with flour and let them air dry for an hour or two.  You can make these as you put the chicken on to cook and let them dry until the chicken and broth are ready.
      Bring chicken and broth to a boil.  Drop dumplings into pot, a few at a time, keeping the broth at a gentle boil.  When all dumplings are in, lower heat, cover and simmer for a few minutes. Add more salt and pepper if needed.
      An easier way is to thin dough with more milk and spoon dumplings into boiling chicken and broth mixture as directed.  It is faster, but the dumplings will be softer and moister.  You can also add a can of cream of chicken soup to make the dumplings richer.  I don't think Granny would have minded us saving time!

GUACAMOLE CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
1/2  c. mayonnaise or salad dressing
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/2  tsp. salt
3  c. chopped, cooked chicken
1  c. chopped celery
1  medium tomato, chopped
1  avocado, diced
  lettuce leaves
preparation
      Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice and salt; blend well.  Stir in chicken, celery, tomato and avocado; chill to blend flavors.  Serve on lettuce leaves.  Makes four servings.

CURRIED CHICKEN DIP
ingredients
4  c. cooked shredded Chicken
1  c. Mayonnaise
1  c. Sour Cream
1 lg.  jar diced Pimento
1/2  tsp. Curry Powder
1/4  c. chopped Nuts
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together. Serve with crackers.

OVEN FRIED CHICKEN
ingredients
1/4  c. wheat germ
1/4  c. mashed potato flakes
1/4  c. buttermilk
1/2  tsp. paprika
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
  dash of pepper
1  broiler, cut up and skinned
preparation
      Sprinkle chicken with pepper and salt.  Let stand for 30 minutes.  Mix other dry ingredients and put in plastic bag.  Dip chicken in buttermilk.  Place a few pieces at a time in dry mixture and shake.  Place chicken in a baking dish which has been sprayed with a nonstick preparation.  Bake at 350° for about 35 to 40 minutes or until chicken is brown and tender.

CHICKEN SAVANNAH
ingredients
8  chicken breasts (skinless; 4 oz. raw weight)
40  oz. buttermilk
1  c. flour (self-rising)
1  Tbsp. salt
1/2  tsp. cayenne pepper
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
3/4  c. butter
1/2  c. honey
2  Tbsp. dark brown sugar
1/2  c. pecans (10% halves, 90% pieces)
preparation
      Soak chicken in buttermilk for 1 1/2 hours; remove and drain. Mix flour, salt, pepper and garlic.  Thoroughly coat chicken with mixture and allow to sit for 20 minutes.  Heat vegetable oil to 375° and fry chicken.
      Make glaze by melting butter and adding honey and brown sugar. Bring mixture to a low boil.  Add pecans and simmer for 20 minutes. Place chicken on a sheet pan and top with 1 1/2 ounces sauce per breast.  Place chicken in oven and bake at 400° for 8 to 10 minutes.
