Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

FROG EYE SALAD
ingredients
1 (7 oz.)  box macaroni rings
1 (15 oz.)  can fruit cocktail, drained
1 (15 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
1 (15 oz.)  can chunk pineapple, drained
2  cans mandarin oranges, drained
2 1/2  c. syrup from fruit
1  c. sugar
1/2  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. flour
3  eggs, beaten well
1  pkg. miniature marshmallows
8  oz. Cool Whip
preparation
      Cook macaroni; rinse with cool water. Drain canned fruit well. Cook sugar, salt, flour and eggs; cool. Then mix all together except marshmallows and Cool Whip. Refrigerate overnight. May freeze this fruit mixture. Add Cool Whip to the amount of salad you want to use; add marshmallows. Makes a large salad.

WALDORF SALAD
ingredients
3  c. chopped apples
2  c. miniature marshmallows
1  c. thin celery slices
1/2  c. chopped walnuts
  Miracle Whip salad dressing
preparation
      Combine  apples, marshmallows, celery and walnuts.  Add enough salad dressing to moisten.  Toss lightly.  Chill.  Add additional salad dressing and garnish with apple slices before serving, if desired.  Makes 6 to 8 servings.
Variations:
preparation
      Add one 11-ounce can of Mandarin orange segments, drained.
      Add 1 cup raisins.
      Add 1 cup seedless green grapes.
      Add 1/2 cup chopped dates.
      Add 1/4 cup toasted coconut.

RED LEAF SALAD
ingredients
1  bunch red leaf lettuce
1 or 2  bunches green onions
1/2 to 1  pkg. fresh mushrooms
1  to 2 avocados
1  can artichoke hearts (not marinated)
1  pkg. Good Seasons Italian dressing
preparation
      Mix Good Seasons almost according to directions: Use olive oil (I use 3/4 olive oil and 1/4 regular oil). No water. Add extra garlic powder.
      In dressing, put chopped onions, sliced mushrooms, sliced artichoke hearts and let marinate while rest of dinner is being prepared.
       Break up lettuce and when ready to serve, have avocados bite size pieces. Pour dressing over. Stir and serve.

CRUNCHY ROMAINE SALAD
ingredients
1  head romaine or green curly lettuce, washed and torn
1  bunch broccoli, florets chopped
1  bunch green onions, chopped (tops and bottom)
1  can Mandarin oranges, drained
6  Tbsp. butter
1  c. nuts, chopped
2  pkg. Ramen noodles, crushed (discard flavor packet)
preparation
      Mix lettuce, broccoli, onions and oranges. Brown nuts and noodles (crushed) in butter. Put nut and noodle mixture over lettuce mixture just before serving.
Dressing:
ingredients
1  c. oil
1  c. sugar
1/2  c. red vinegar
3  Tbsp. soy sauce
  pepper to taste
preparation
      Mix oil, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce and pepper together. Shake well. Add to salad just before serving.

FRUIT SALAD
ingredients
1 large  can fruit cocktail
1  apple, diced
2  bananas, sliced
1  can Mandarin oranges, drained
1  small vanilla pudding mix
  pecans (optional)
preparation
      Mix all together.

CRAB SALAD
ingredients
1/2 small  box ring macaroni
1  c. peas
1/2  c. carrots, diced
1/2  c. celery, diced
2  Tbsp. onions, diced
16  oz. imitation crab meat, diced (shrimp may be substituted)
preparation
      Cook the macaroni until tender. Drain and wash. Cut up vegetables.
Dressing:
ingredients
3/4  c. Miracle Whip
1/2  c. sour cream
1  tsp. sugar
1 heaping  tsp. bold and spicy brown mustard
preparation
      Mix well and pour over salad; mix. Pepper to taste.

GERMAN POTATO SALAD
ingredients
5  lb. boiled potatoes
1  bunch green onions
1  bunch celery
1  lb. bacon
10  eggs, hard boiled
preparation
      Slice boiled and skinned potatoes.  Dice 10 hard-boiled eggs, bunch of celery and green onions including 3 Tbsp. of tops (chives).  Fry bacon crisp and crumble into potato mixture. Drizzle 3 Tbsp. bacon grease over mixture.
Dressing:
ingredients
1/3  c. sugar
1/3  c. vinegar
2  eggs.
8  Tbsp. Hellmann's mayonnaise
preparation
      Bring sugar, vinegar and eggs to a full rolling boil.  Toss in salad.  Add mayonnaise to desired consistency.  Serve at room temperature.

STRAWBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. strawberry gelatin
3/4  c. chopped fresh strawberries
1  c. plain yogurt
2  tsp. sugar
1  tsp. vanilla extract
  vegetable cooking spray
preparation
      Prepare gelatin according to package directions.  Chill until slightly thickened.  Mash strawberries.  Add to gelatin mixture. Add yogurt, sugar and vanilla.  Stir until well blended.  Pour into 4 (1/2-cup) molds coated with cooking spray.  Chill until set.  To serve, unmold onto salad plates.  Yield: 4 servings.

OLD FASHIONED POTATO SALAD
ingredients
1  c. mayonnaise
1  c. minced onion
3  Tbsp. white vinegar
2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
2  hard-cooked eggs, chopped
3  lb. potatoes, cooked, peeled and cubed (about 6 c.)
2  c. sliced celery
preparation
      In large bowl, stir together mayonnaise, onion, vinegar, salt, pepper and eggs.  Add potatoes and celery.  Toss to coat well.  Cover.  Refrigerate for at least 4 hours.  If desired, sprinkle with paprika.  Makes about 8 cups.

CHOPPED ITALIAN SALAD
Salad:
ingredients
1  head romaine lettuce, cut into 1-inch squares
1/4  lb. pepperoni, chopped
1/3  c. drained sliced pimentos (one 4 oz. jar)
1/3  c. chopped red onion
1 1/2  c. drained, rinsed and chopped canned artichoke hearts (one 15 oz. can)
preparation
      Toss to combine all of the above ingredients.
Dressing:
ingredients
3  Tbsp. red or white wine vinegar
1/4  c. olive oil
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/2  c. grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Mix dressing ingredients and toss with salad.

TAFFY APPLE SALAD
ingredients
1  Tbsp. flour
2  Tbsp. apple cider vinegar
1/2  c. sugar
1  egg
4  c. Red Delicious apples
1  c. salted peanuts
8  oz. Cool Whip
8  oz. crushed pineapple, drained
preparation
      Cook flour, vinegar, sugar, egg and pineapple juice until thick, stirring constantly. Refrigerate while peeling and dicing apples. Fold all ingredients together and let set for at least 1 day.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

MARINATED GREEN BEAN SALAD
ingredients
1/2  tsp. dry mustard
1/4  c. water
1/2  tsp. sweet basil
1  tsp. salt
2  c. green beans, cooked
  sugar substitute to equal 1 tsp. sugar
1/2  c. red wine vinegar
1/2  tsp. oregano
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/2  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/2  c. finely chopped onion
preparation
      Mix dry mustard with 1 tablespoon of vinegar until completely dissolved.  Add remaining ingredients except beans and onions; mix well.  Pour over green beans and marinate for at least 2 hours before serving.  Serve cold with finely chopped onions sprinkled over top.
      Exchange:  One-half cup equals 1 vegetable.

FOUR BEAN SALAD
ingredients
1  can green beans
1  can yellow wax beans
1  can red kidney beans
1  can garbanzo beans
1  small purple onion, sliced in rings
1  small white onion, sliced in rings
1/4  green pepper, slivered in narrow strips
1/2  c. vegetable oil
1/2  c. brown sugar
2/3  c. herb vinegar
1/4  c. small diced sharp cheese
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. coarse pepper
preparation
      Drain beans and mix together.  Mix ingredients together.  Store in large jar or Tupperware, sealed airtight.  Refrigerate.  Keeps 10 days.  Serve on lettuce leaf or with cooked pasta as a salad.
      Optional:  Dice 1 chorizo sausage or finely diced cooked ham.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

POTATO SALAD
ingredients
4  medium potatoes
1  tsp. sugar
1  tsp. vinegar
1/2  c. celery, chopped
3/4  c. mayonnaise or salad dressing
2  hard-boiled eggs
1/4  c. onion, chopped
1/4  c. sweet pickles, chopped
1  tsp. salt
  paprika
preparation
      Cook potatoes in their jackets about 25 to 30 minutes, until done.  Remove from heat and drain water.  Let cool before dicing. Sprinkle potatoes with sugar and vinegar.  Add celery, onion, pickles and salt.  Stir gently to combine.  Add mayonnaise by folding into mixture.  Add sliced eggs.  Sprinkle top with paprika.

MACARONI SALAD
ingredients
1 small  box macaroni
1  cucumber, chopped
1  green pepper, chopped
1  stalk celery, chopped
1  onion, chopped
3  boiled eggs
1/2  pt. mayonnaise
3  Tbsp. milk
1  tsp. mustard
2  tsp. vinegar
1  Tbsp. sugar
preparation
      Cook macaroni according to directions on the box; drain.  Add the cucumber, green pepper, celery, onion and eggs.  Stir.  Make a dressing using the mayonnaise, milk, mustard, vinegar and sugar. Pour over macaroni.  Stir well.  Chill.

MARINATED VEGETABLE SALAD
ingredients
1  can early June peas
1  can white Shoepeg corn
1  can bean sprouts
1  can sliced water chestnuts
1 medium  jar pimentos
1 large  jar sliced mushrooms
2/3  c. sugar
2/3  c. white cider vinegar
2/3  c. vegetable oil
preparation
      Drain all liquids from your peas, corn, etc.  Combine those ingredients in a large plastic container.  Pour sugar, vinegar and oil into bowl.  Stir until well mixed.  Cover container and store overnight in refrigerator.

PARTY SALAD
1st Step:
ingredients
1  pkg. family size lemon or orange Jell-O, dissolved in 4 c. hot water
1  c. marshmallows
3  diced bananas
1  can chunk pineapple, drained
preparation
      When Jell-O has set up and firmed, layer the top of Jell-O with marshmallows, bananas and pineapple.
2nd Step:
ingredients
1  can pineapple juice (from drained pineapple)
1/2  c. sugar
1  egg, well beaten
1  Tbsp. flour
1 small  carton sour cream
preparation
      Boil pineapple juice, sugar and egg until thick.  When very cold, add sour cream.  Mix well and spread over salad.

MY MIRACLE SALAD
ingredients
1  envelope Knox plain gelatine
1  pkg. lemon Jell-O
1 large  can fruit cocktail
1  container Cool Whip
2/3  c. chopped pecans
1/4  c. cold water
1  c. boiling water
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
      Soften Knox gelatine in cold water.  Dissolve the Jell-O in boiling water.  Combine gelatine and Jell-O.  Allow to cool.  Add fruit cocktail.  Soften cheese with Cool Whip.  Add all other ingredients.  Mix well.  Refrigerate to congeal.  Serve on lettuce with mayonnaise.

PASTA SALAD
ingredients
2  boxes tri-colored noodles (curly)
1/2  onion
1/2  flat of mushrooms
2  bottles "Wish-Bone Zesty Italian" dressing
2  jars pimentos, diced or chopped
2  cans artichoke hearts (Reese's)
2  cans pitted olives, sliced
1  to 2 spoons mayo or "Lite" mayo
  Parmesan cheese (lots)
preparation
      Cook the pasta noodles until almost done (you'll want them a little firm for stirring).  Then use cold water to rinse and let them sit in the refrigerator while doing rest of cutting and chopping of other ingredients.
      Take noodles out of the refrigerator and coat noodles with the 1 to 2 spoons of mayo, then add in all ingredients. Mix and stir. Add lots of Parmesan cheese as you go.
      Note: If you use this dish for the next day, add in a little more Italian dressing and Parmesan cheese to give it more zip! Enjoy!

COTTAGE CHEESE SALAD
ingredients
1 large  carton small curd cottage cheese
1 small  box jello (your choice of flavor)
1 large  can crushed pineapple, drained
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. mini marshmallows
1  small container Cool Whip
  fresh strawberries (to garnish)
preparation
      Mix container of cottage cheese with dry jello. Add miniature marshmallows, pineapple and Cool Whip. Mix. Garnish top with sliced or whole strawberries. Serves 12.

TURKEY WALDORF SALAD
ingredients
1  medium unpared red apple, cored and diced (1 1/4 c.)
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  c. coarsely diced, cooked turkey
1  c. halved and seeded red grapes
1  c. sliced celery
1/4  c. broken walnuts
1/4  c. finely chopped onion
2/3  c. mayonnaise or salad dressing
1/2  tsp. salt
  dash of pepper
  lettuce
1  hard-cooked egg
preparation
      Chill ingredients.  Sprinkle diced apple with lemon juice.  Add turkey, grapes, celery, walnuts, onion, salad dressing, salt and pepper and toss lightly.  Serve in lettuce-lined bowl.  Cut white of egg into wedges and arrange in shape of a flower.  Top with grated yolk.  Makes 5 to 6 servings.

QUICK TACO SALAD
ingredients
3/4  lb. lean ground beef
1/2  c. chopped onion
1  pkg. Rice-A-Roni beef flavor
1/2  c. salsa
1  tsp. chili powder
4  c. shredded lettuce
1  medium tomato, chopped
1/2  c. shredded Monterey Jack or Cheddar cheese
1/2  c. crushed tortilla chips
preparation
      In large skillet, brown ground beef and onion.  Drain. Remove from skillet.  Set aside.  In same skillet, prepare Rice-A-Roni as package directs.  Stir in meat mixture, salsa and chili powder.  Continue cooking over low heat 3 to 4 minutes or until heated through.  Arrange lettuce on serving platter.  Top with rice mixture, tomatoes, cheese and tortilla chips.  Serves 5.

LAYERED GARDEN PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1 (7 to 8 oz.)  pkg. macaroni shells
1/2  c. sliced green onions
1/2  c. bacon bits
1  c. mayonnaise
1/4  c. lemon juice
3  tsp. grated Parmesan cheese
1  tsp. sugar
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
4  c. bite size salad greens
1  medium zucchini, sliced
1  c. sliced cauliflowerets
1  c. broccoli flowerets
2  medium tomatoes, cut into wedges
preparation
      Cook macaroni as per package directions and drain.  Rinse with cold water; drain again.  Stir together macaroni, onions and bacon bits in medium bowl.  Mix mayonnaise, lemon juice, cheese, sugar and garlic powder.  In 3 1/2-quart salad bowl, layer salad greens, macaroni mixture, zucchini and cauliflowerets.  On top of this, layer broccoli and tomatoes.  Pour dressing evenly over top.  Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours.  Sprinkle with bacon bits just before serving.  Refrigerate only remaining salad.  Makes 10 servings.

THREE BEAN SALAD
ingredients
1/2  c. vinegar
1/4  c. oil
2  Tbsp. sugar
1/4  c. sliced green onion
1  tsp. salt
  dash of pepper
  dash of garlic powder
1 (16 oz.)  can drained green beans
1 (16 oz.)  can drained chickpeas
1 (16 oz.)  can drained red kidney beans
preparation
      Mix vinegar, oil, sugar, salt, pepper and garlic powder.  Add beans and onions; toss well.  Cover and refrigerate 3 hours or overnight, tossing occasionally.  Serve on lettuce.  Makes 8 or 10 servings.

POTATO SALAD
ingredients
4  large or 8 small potatoes
1/2  c. chopped onion
1  small container chopped pimento
1/2  c. chopped green pepper
1  tsp. salt
1  c. mayonnaise
1/4  c. mustard
1  Tbsp. celery seed
preparation
      Cook potatoes until tender.  Peel, cube and toss with onions, pimento, pepper and celery seed.
      Mix mayonnaise, mustard and salt.  Toss in potatoes.  If potatoes are not completely covered, mix up more mayo and mustard. Cover and refrigerate several hours before serving.  May be garnish with cross sections of green pepper.

FRUIT SALAD
(Low-Fat)  
ingredients
1  box sugar-free vanilla pudding (cooking type)
1  can pineapple tidbits, drained
2  bananas, sliced
24  seedless grapes, halved
2  oranges, peeled and cut in pieces
preparation
      Pour pineapple juice in measuring cup and add enough water to make 1 1/2 cups. Cook pudding and juice-water on stove until it boils and thickens. Cool. Mix with fruit and chill.

EGGPLANT AND PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1  large eggplant (1 1/2 lb.)
1  medium onion, (1/2 c.), finely chopped
2  ripe tomatoes, chopped
1  clove garlic, minced
1/2  c. olive oil
1/4  c. lemon juice
4  Tbsp. chopped parsley
1/2  tsp. oregano (fresh)
2  tsp. salt
1/2  lb. macaroni (ditalini or rotini)
  tomato wedges (for garnish)
  lemon slices (for  garnish)
  black olives (for garnish)
preparation
      Wash eggplant; prick skin in several places with fork.  Bake in 350° oven for 45 minutes or until tender; cool.  Peel eggplant; cut pulp into 1/2-inch diced pieces.  Combine eggplant, onion, tomatoes, garlic, oil, lemon juice, parsley, oregano and salt in large bowl.  Toss and mix well.  Cover and refrigerate overnight.  Cook pasta in boiling salted water.  Drain and do not rinse.  Add to eggplant mixture.  Toss and mix well.  Serve warm or cold in lettuce-lined bowl garnished with tomato wedges, lemon slices and Greek olives.

AMBROSIA SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. strawberry jello
2  c. boiling water
1/2  c. cold water
1/2  c. chopped nuts (optional)
1  pkg. raspberry jello
1  pkg. frozen sliced strawberries (10 oz.)
1 (8 oz.)  can crushed pineapple
2/3  c. Carnation milk
preparation
      Use a 5-cup mold and chill 4 hours.
      Mix both packages jello with boiling water.  Add frozen strawberries.  Add cold water, canned milk, pineapple (juice and all) and nuts.  Chill, stirring every now and then.

BROCCOLI SALAD
ingredients
1  medium onion
2  c. shredded cheese
1  container real bacon bits
1 1/2  c. salad dressing
3/4  c. sugar
3  tsp. vinegar
3 large  bunches broccoli
preparation
      Chop broccoli and onion.  Place in large bowl.  Add shredded cheese, bacon bits, salad dressing, sugar and vinegar.  Stir together.  Cover and refrigerate overnight.  Serves 8 to 10.

COCA-COLA SALAD
ingredients
2 small  pkg. cherry jello
1 small  pkg. lime jello
1 large  can crushed pineapple
2 1/2  c. Coca-Cola
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Mix together cherry jello, lime jello and crushed pineapple. Put on stove and cook until boiling.  Take off stove and add Coke and nuts to mixture.  Stir in pan well; pour in bowl and refrigerate.

ICE CREAM SALAD
ingredients
1/2  gal. peach ice cream
1 large  can pears, mashed
1 large  can peaches, mashed
  cherries
1  can pineapple
  marshmallows
  slivered almonds, toasted
8  oz. cole slaw dressing
preparation
      Mix well and refreeze.

CRANBERRY SALAD
ingredients
2 small  boxes any flavor red Jell-O
1 large  can crushed pineapple
1  can jellied cranberry sauce
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Drain pineapple and reserve juice. Add water to juice to make 2 cups and heat to boiling point. Add Jell-O, pineapple and cranberry sauce; stir until cranberry sauce is completely melted. Stir in nuts and refrigerate until set.

AUTUMN APPLE SALAD
ingredients
1 (20 oz.)  can crushed pineapple
1/4  c. sugar
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lemon gelatin
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
2  medium apples chopped
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1/2  c. chopped celery
1  (4 oz.) frozen whipped dessert topping, thawed
preparation
      Combine undrained crushed pineapple and sugar in a large saucepan.  Bring to boil; boil gently for 3 minutes, stirring often.  Add gelatin and stir till dissolved.  Add the cream cheese and stir till mixture is thoroughly combined.  Remove from heat; cool slightly.  Cover and refrigerate salad for 1 hour.  Fold in apples, nuts and celery.  Gently fold in dessert topping.  Pour into a 2-quart square baking dish.  Cover and chill several hours or until firm.  Garnish with apple slices and sprinkle salad with additional chopped nuts.

SHRIMPARONI SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. shell macaroni, cooked
2  cans shrimp or more
1 1/2  c. chopped celery
1  small cucumber, chopped up
2/3  c. mayonnaise
1/3  c. sour cream
2  Tbsp. horseradish
1  Tbsp. grated onion
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Mix all together and chill.

CREAMED HERRING SALAD
ingredients
1 medium size  jar herring in wine sauce
1  carrot
1  cucumber
1  green pepper
3  radishes
1  or 2 green scallions
1  medium size container sour cream
2  Tbsp. sugar
preparation
      Drain herring of wine sauce and dice into bite-sized pieces. Put in mixing bowl.  Grate carrot into same bowl.  Dice cucumber, pepper and radishes into bowl.  Add diced scallions.  Add desired amount of sour cream to moisten and sugar to taste.  Mix.
      This is best if made 2 days in advance and can be served on bagels or on small slices of rye bread (cocktail rye) as an appetizer.

GREEK PASTA SALAD
ingredients
2 (12 oz.)  pkg. pasta Primavera (3 color pasta)
1  bottle Greek salad dressing
1  can black pitted olives, drained
  Feta cheese (optional)
preparation
      Cook pasta al dente; rinse, drain and cool.  Mix in salad dressing and olives.  Chill overnight.  Just before serving, crumble Feta cheese over top.

HOT OR COLD SHRIMP PASTA SALAD
ingredients
2  garlic cloves, minced
3  Tbsp. olive oil
1 1/4  lb. small cooked Oregon Bay shrimp
1/2  c. sour cream
1/2  c. fresh or frozen cooked peas
1/4  c. chopped fresh thyme or basil
  salt and pepper to taste
1/2  lb. semolina corkscrew pasta, cooked and drained
preparation
      In a large saucepan, lightly sauté the garlic in olive oil.  Do not brown.  Add shrimp and cook 1 minute.  Add sour cream, peas, thyme, salt and pepper and mix thoroughly.  When heated through (do not boil), either pour over hot, drained pasta or allow to cool and toss with cool cooked pasta.  Serve with a small green salad with herb vinaigrette dressing.  Serves 3.

STRAWBERRY PRETZEL SALAD
ingredients
2  c. crushed pretzels
3  Tbsp. sugar
3/4  c. melted butter
8  oz. cream cheese, softened
9  oz. Cool Whip
1/2  c. sugar
2 (3 oz.)  boxes strawberry Jell-O
2  c. boiling water
2 (10 oz.)  pkg. strawberries
preparation
      Mix pretzels, sugar and melted butter.  Spread in a 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.  Cool.
      Cream the cream cheese, Cool Whip and sugar together.  Spread over pretzel crust.
      Dissolve the Jell-O in boiling water.  Add strawberries.  Let cool a little.  Spread on cream cheese layer.  Chill several hours.

DEANNE'S WONDERFUL CRABMEAT SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. imitation crabmeat
1/4  c. mayonnaise
1/2  c. chopped green onions
  Ranch salad dressing
1  tsp. horseradish
  Garlic powder to taste
  Italian spices to taste
preparation
      Mix crabmeat, onions, spices, and mayonnaise in bowl. Continue adding ranch salad dressing and mayonnaise until desired consistency and taste.  Let chill overnight for best results. Serve on crackers for great finger food.

BLUEBERRY SURPRISE JELLO SALAD
ingredients
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. blackberry or raspberry Jell-O
2  c. boiling water
1 (15 oz.)  can blueberries, drained (I use Oregon brand; do not use pie filling)
1 (8 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water. Drain blueberries and pineapple and measure liquid. Add enough water to make 2 cups. Add to Jell-O. Stir in blueberries and pineapple and pour in 2-quart dish; cover. Put in the refrigerator until firm.
Topping:
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1/2  c. sugar
1/2  pt. sour cream
1/2  tsp. vanilla
1/2  c. nuts, chopped
preparation
      Combine cream cheese, sugar, sour cream and vanilla. Spread over firm Jell-O. Sprinkle with nuts. Serves 10 to 12. Enjoy!

BROCCOLI SALAD
ingredients
1  bunch broccoli, finely chopped
1/2  c. raisins
1/2  c. onion, finely chopped
1/2  c. sunflower seeds
preparation
      Chop broccoli and onions.  Mix together in bowl with raisins and sunflower seeds.
Dressing:
ingredients
1  c. Hellmann's mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. white vinegar
1/2  tsp. sugar
preparation
      Combine all dressing ingredients and mix well.  Pour onto vegetables and refrigerate.

CHERRY SALAD
ingredients
1  can cherry pie filling
1  can Eagle Brand milk
1 small  can crushed pineapple, drained
1  c. pecans
1  large container Cool Whip
preparation
      Strawberry pie filling can also be used in place of cherry.
      Mix all ingredients together and put in refrigerator.

CALIFORNIA CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
3  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  c. diced, cooked chicken
1/2  c. finely diced apples
1/2  c. chopped ripe olives
1/2  c. diced celery
2  tsp. mayonnaise, thinned with 2 Tbsp. cream (sweet or sour)
preparation
      Sprinkle lemon juice over chicken and apples, mixing lightly. Combine remaining ingredients, using only enough mayonnaise to moisten.  Add chicken and apples and toss together lightly.  Serve cold.

LOBSTER AND SHRIMP SALAD
ingredients
1  c. shrimp, cut in pieces
1/2  c. lobster, cut in pieces
1  c. celery, diced
  mayonnaise to moisten
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
  lettuce
  Chinese noodles
  tomato wedges
  hard-boiled eggs, quartered
  stuffed celery
  capers
preparation
      Combine shrimp, lobster, celery, mayonnaise and lemon juice. Season to taste.  For each serving, line plate with lettuce.  Put 1/2 cup Chinese noodles in center of lettuce and a serving of salad on top of noodles.  Garnish with tomato wedges, quartered hard-boiled eggs and stuffed celery.  Top with additional mayonnaise and capers.  Serves 4.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

CHICKEN AND ORANGE SALAD
ingredients
1/2  c. long grain rice
1  small onion, chopped
  salt and pepper to taste
1 1/3  c. cooked chicken, diced
2  stalks celery, chopped
4  stuffed olives, chopped
1/2  c. mayonnaise
2  oranges
  lettuce leaves
preparation
      Cook rice in boiling salted water until tender.  Drain and while still hot, mix with onion and seasonings; cool.  Add chicken, celery, olives and mayonnaise.  Toss lightly.  Peel oranges and split them into sections.  Cut 1/2 of the sections into small pieces.  Add to mixture.
      To Serve:  Place salad on bed of lettuce.  Garnish with remaining orange sections.

SALAD DRESSING
ingredients
1  doz. stuffed olives
2  pimientos (canned or fresh)
1  green pepper
  small jar of pickled onions
  juice of 2 lemons
2  Tbsp. vinegar
1  tsp. salt
  salad oil to cover
preparation
      Cut up into a 1-pint jar the olives, pimientos, green pepper and onions.  Then add lemon juice, vinegar, salt and salad oil. Let stand overnight and serve over a green or fresh vegetable salad.

SHOEPEG CORN SALAD
ingredients
2 (16 oz.)  cans Shoepeg corn, drained
1 (2 oz.)  jar pimentos, drained
1/2  c. green pepper, chopped
1/2  c. onion, chopped
2  stalks celery, chopped
1/2  c. sugar
1/2  c. vegetable oil
1/2  c. white vinegar
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  Cover.  Refrigerate and let marinate overnight.  Drain before serving.

MEXICORN SALAD
ingredients
2 or 3 small  cans Mexicorn
8 to 12  oz. sharp Cheddar cheese
1/4  c. green onions
1 small  jar pimentos
1/2  c. sour cream
1/2  c. mayonnaise
preparation
      Mix above ingredients together. Taste to see if you need to add any salt. Add salt if needed.
      You can use Fritos to dip or use with vegetables.

OLD FASHION EGG SALAD
ingredients
1/4  c. mayonnaise
2  tsp. lemon juice
1  tsp. chopped onions
1/4  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
6  hard-boiled eggs, chopped
1/2  c. celery, chopped fine
preparation
      In a bowl, combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, onions, salt and pepper.  Stir in eggs and celery.  Cover and chill.

STRAWBERRY PRETZEL SALAD DESSERT
ingredients
2 1/2  c. crushed pretzels
3  Tbsp. powdered sugar
3/4  c. melted butter
8  oz. cream cheese
1  egg (may omit)
1  c. powdered sugar
9  oz. Cool Whip
2  pkg. strawberry jello
2  c. boiling water
2 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen strawberries
preparation
      Mix together the first 3 ingredients and put in 9 x 13 pan. Bake 10 minutes at 350°. Cool crust completely.
      Mix together the cream cheese, egg, powdered sugar and Cool Whip and spread on  cooled crust.
      Next Layer: Mix the jello with the boiling water. Add the frozen strawberries. When thickened, pour over the other mixture. Chill until firm.

BAKED SEAFOOD RICE SALAD
ingredients
1 1/3  c. rice, cooked
1  c. chopped celery
1/2  c. green pepper, finely chopped
3  green onions, finely sliced
1 (6 1/2 oz.)  can water chestnuts
1 (4 1/2 oz.)  can medium shrimp, drained
1 (6 1/2 oz.)  can crabmeat or chicken
1  c. mayonnaise
3/4  c. tomato juice
  grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Combine first 9 ingredients.  Put in shallow 2 quart casserole and sprinkle with cheese.  Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.  Makes 6 servings.

CREAMY GARDEN PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1  c. mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. chopped scallions
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  tsp. basil
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
4  oz. thin spaghetti, cooked
1  c. chopped, seeded cucumber
1/4  lb. green beans, cooked and cut into 1-inch pieces
1  c. thinly sliced carrots
1  c. thinly sliced zucchini
1/2  c. chopped green or red pepper
1/2  c. chopped parsley
preparation
      In large bowl stir together the mayonnaise, scallions, lemon juice, basil, salt and pepper until smooth.  Add remaining ingredients; toss to coat well.  Cover; chill.  Makes 8 servings.

CRANBERRY SALAD
ingredients
2  bags cranberries
2  c. cold water
2 1/2  c. sugar
2 large  pkg. cherry Jello
1  c. chopped apples
1  c. chopped celery
1  c. chopped oranges
1  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Wash and clean cranberries and place in a large pan.  Add water to cranberries and cook for 5 minutes, then add sugar and continue to cook over a medium heat until all the berries have popped. (Around 1/2 hour).  Remove from heat and add Jello, apples, nuts, oranges and celery, making sure mixture is stirred well.  Pour into pans and place in refrigerator until mixture is jelled, best if it sets for at least 24 hours in the refrigerator. Cut and serve.  Will keep in refrigerator for 2 weeks.

GREEN BEAN AND ONION SALAD
ingredients
2  c. fresh green beans
1/4  c. onions, sliced
  salt
  pepper
  dash of Italian seasoning
2  Tbsp. salad oil
3/4  Tbsp. wine vinegar
preparation
      Cook  green  beans  until done, but still firm.  Drain. Add onions, salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, oil and vinegar. Toss. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

ORIENTAL SHRIMP SALAD
ingredients
1 (1 lb.)  can bean sprouts
4  c. cooked shrimp
2  c. chow mein noodles
1/4  c. green onions, minced
1/2  c. celery, minced
1 (5 oz.)  can water chestnuts, drained and minced
  Soy Mayonnaise (recipe follows)
preparation
      Rinse bean sprouts in cold water and drain.  Combine first 6 ingredients and mix with Soy Mayonnaise.  Serves 8.
Soy Mayonnaise:
ingredients
1  c. mayonnaise
1 1/2  Tbsp. each:  lemon juice and soy sauce
3/8  tsp. ground ginger
1/2  tsp. Accent
preparation
      Mix mayonnaise with lemon juice, soy sauce, ginger and Accent.

CHEF SALAD
ingredients
3/4  c. cooked ham, in thin strips
1/4  c. sliced cucumber
2  oz. Swiss cheese, in strips
2  Tbsp. crumbled Blue cheese
2  hard-boiled eggs, sliced
1/4  c. salad oil
2  Tbsp. vinegar
1  Tbsp. snipped parsley
1  Tbsp. chopped onion
1/4  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. garlic powder
  dash of pepper
2  c. torn lettuce
preparation
      Place lettuce into 2 individual bowls.  Arrange ham strips, Swiss cheese, cucumber, Blue cheese and hard-boiled eggs on top of lettuce in each salad bowl.
      For dressing, combine salad oil, vinegar, parsley, onion, salt, garlic powder and pepper.  Chill and serve.  If desired, add dressing over salads.

ACINI DE PEPE SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. Acini De Pepe (#28 soup mac) macaroni
1 (20 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained (save the juice)
1  can chunk pineapple, drained (save the juice)
2 (11 oz.)  cans Mandarin oranges, drained
1  (10 oz.) bag mini marshmallows
1  large container Cool Whip
1  jar Maraschino cherries (red or green)
preparation
      Cook macaroni according to package directions.  Mix fruits and marshmallows together.
Sauce:
ingredients
  Pineapple juice
1  c. sugar
2  eggs
2  Tbsp. flour
preparation
      Mix all ingredients for sauce in a saucepan and cook.  Cool.
      Mix macaroni, fruits and marshmallow with sauce.  Add large Cool Whip.  Let stand overnight in refrigerator.  May have to add more Cool Whip before serving.  Makes a large bowl.  Recipe can be cut in half.

MOLDED CORN BEEF SALAD
ingredients
1  can corned beef
1 small  can peas, drained
1  medium onion, chopped
2  hard boiled eggs, chopped
1  pkg. lemon Jello (dissolved in 2 cups boiling water)
1  c. celery, diced
1  green pepper, chopped
1  c. mayonnaise
  Salt
  Pimento
preparation
      Make Jello and set aside to cool.  Break corn beef apart with a fork and add chopped vegetables, eggs, salt and mayonnaise.  Mix all with Jello and garnish with chopped pimento and chill until set.

TEQUILABERRY SALAD
ingredients
1  (16 oz.) bag iceberg salad mix
4  c. chopped fresh cauliflower florets
1  lb. bacon, fried crisp
1  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1  c. light mayo
1  Tbsp. white vinegar
1/3  c. sugar
3  Tbsp. milk
preparation
      In a large bowl, combine salad mix, cauliflower, bacon and Parmesan. In a small bowl, combine mayo, vinegar, sugar and milk. Do not combine salad and dressing until ready to serve. Garnish with some extra bacon and Parmesan if desired. Yields about 12 servings.

HOMEMADE SALAD DRESSING
(Especially For Potato Salad)  
ingredients
1  c. egg yolks
1  c. sugar
1  c. vinegar
1  c. sour cream
1  tsp. dry mustard
1/4  tsp. salt
preparation
      Place all in top of double boiler and beat until smooth. Cool thoroughly and put in a glass jar. Refrigerate after cooling and it keeps for several weeks. Good also on macaroni salads.

ORANGE/PINEAPPLE CONGEALED SALAD
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. orange/pineapple jello
1  c. boiling water
2  c. miniature marshmallows
1  (8 oz.)  Cool Whip
3  oz. cream cheese, softened
1 small  can crushed pineapple
1  can mandarin oranges
1  c. nuts (optional)
preparation
      Add jello and marshmallows to boiling water.  Stir until jello is dissolved.  Drain juice from oranges and pineapple; add water to make 1 cup.  Mix cream cheese, fruit juice, fruit and nuts together.  Add to jello mixture.  Let chill until thick, then fold in Cool Whip.  (If this is to be molded, 1 envelope plain gelatin may be added with dry jello.)

GRILLED CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
4  eggs, boiled and sliced
1  cucumber, sliced
1  head lettuce
  red onion, sliced
2  leaves romaine lettuce
4  boneless, skinless chicken breasts
1/2  c. Italian dressing
2  Tbsp. honey
2  tsp. lemon pepper
  salt to taste
  favorite salad dressing
preparation
      Mix honey and dressing for marinade.  Place chicken breasts, cut in strips, in 1/2 marinade in refrigerator for 3 hours.  Pour out marinade.  Grill chicken until done, basting with remaining marinade that chicken was not in.
      Mix together eggs and salad greens.  Add others if you wish. Cube chicken over salad.  Pour on favorite dressing.

SEVEN LAYER SALAD
ingredients
1  head lettuce, chopped
1/2  c. celery, diced
1/2  c. sweet onion, diced
1/2  c. green pepper, diced
4  eggs, hard boiled
8  strips bacon, fried and crumbled
4  oz. shredded cheddar cheese
preparation
      Layer first four salad ingredients in order.
Dressing:
ingredients
2  c. Hellmann's mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. sugar
4  eggs, hard boiled and chopped
8  strips of bacon, fried and crumbled
4  oz. cheddar cheese
preparation
      When ready to serve top with chopped eggs, bacon and cheese.

PISTACHIO SALAD
ingredients
1 (9 oz.)  carton whipped topping
1  box instant pistachio pudding
1 (1 lb.)  can crushed pineapple and juice
1  c. miniature marshmallows
1/2  c. nuts
preparation
      Fold dry pudding mix into whipped topping.  Add pineapple and juice, marshmallows and nuts.  Refrigerate.

CINDY'S LAYERED SALAD
ingredients
1  small head lettuce
1 small  bottle bacon bits
1  c. grated Cheddar cheese
  Miracle Whip
3  to 4 boiled eggs, diced
1  can young sweet peas
1  pkg. deli ham, slivered
preparation
      First Layer: Tear lettuce in bite-sized pieces to cover bottom of dish.
      Second Layer: Young sweet peas.
      Third Layer: Boiled eggs, diced.
      Fourth Layer: Ham, cut into slivers.
      Fifth Layer: Cheese.
      Sixth Layer: Last layer of lettuce.
      Seventh Layer: Spread completely with Miracle Whip to edges of dish.
      Eighth Layer: Sprinkle top with bacon bits.
      Optional: Sometimes I add a little diced onion.

BROCCOLI SALAD
ingredients
1  bunch broccoli, chopped
1  bunch green onions, chopped (stems and all)
1  c. walnuts or pecans
1/2  c. bacon bits
1/2  c. Miracle Whip
  sugar to taste
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together. Refrigerate.

CAPER SALAD DRESSING FOR PASTA
ingredients
1/8  c. capers
1/4  c. red wine vinegar
1  garlic clove
2  tsp. salt
1  tsp. oregano
1/4  tsp. lemon pepper
1/4  tsp. seasoned salt
1/4  tsp. sesame seed
3/4  c. olive oil
preparation
      Puree the first 8 dressing ingredients.  Slowly pour in the oil, blending continuously until smooth.  Pour the dressing over the pasta.  Serves 4 deliciously.

WATERGATE SALAD
ingredients
1 large  pkg. instant pistachio pudding (use dry)
1 large  can crushed pineapple (do not drain)
1 1/2  c. miniature marshmallows
1  (8 oz.) Cool Whip
  coconut (if desired)
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  Chill until firm.

HOT TURKEY SALAD
ingredients
2  c. cooked turkey, diced
1  c. celery, chopped
1 1/2  c. cooked rice (equal to 1/2 c. raw rice)
1  tsp. green onions, chopped
1/2  c. slivered almonds (optional)
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
3/4  c. mayonnaise
1/4  c. chicken broth
1  can cream of chicken soup
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
2  c. potato chips, crushed
preparation
      Mix first 11 ingredients and pour into casserole.  Cover with crushed potato chips.  Bake 30 to 40 minutes at 350°.  Serves 6.

CHICKEN PINEAPPLE SALAD
ingredients
1 small (8 oz.)  can pineapple chunks
2/3  c. mayonnaise
1  Tbsp. Dijon mustard
3/4  tsp. curry powder
1/8  tsp. salt
4  c. cooked chicken, cooled
1/4  c. celery, thinly sliced
2  Tbsp. green onion
1/3  c. slivered almonds
1/3  c. raisins
  lettuce
preparation
      Combine 2 tablespoons juice from pineapple with mayonnaise, mustard, curry powder and salt.  Set aside.  Cut chicken into small pieces and mix with celery, green onion, almonds and raisins.  Add mayonnaise mixture and blend well.  Refrigerate 1 hour.  Serve with lettuce and pineapple.

SPAGHETTI SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. spaghetti
1  medium red onion
3  medium size cucumbers
1/2  jar Salad Supreme
3  red tomatoes
  Italian dressing
preparation
      Cook the spaghetti; set aside. Chop the onion, slice cucumbers and dice tomatoes; mix together. Add spaghetti, Salad Supreme and 1 bottle Italian dressing.
      Optional: Shrimp or ham.

JELLO SALAD (ORANGE)
ingredients
1  (16 oz.) container cottage cheese
1 (8 oz.)  box orange Jell-O
1  (8 or 12 oz.) container Cool Whip
preparation
      Place cottage cheese in mixing bowl. Mix in box of Jell-O (orange) powder mixture. Mix in the Cool Whip. Refrigerate overnight.

POTATO SALAD
ingredients
5  medium potatoes
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  c. chopped celery
3  Tbsp. chopped onion
2  Tbsp. chopped sweet pickles
2  Tbsp. pickle juice
3  Tbsp. low calorie Italian salad dressing
2  hard-cooked eggs, chopped fine
2  tsp. prepared mustard
1/4  c. low oil mayonnaise
preparation
      Cook potatoes in jackets until fork tender; peel and cut into small pieces.  Add salt, pepper, celery, onion, sweet pickles, pickle juice, Italian dressing and eggs while warm.  Toss lightly and chill.  Combine mustard with mayonnaise and mix carefully with potato mixture.  Chill.  Makes 8 servings, containing about 100 calories each.

PASTA SALAD DRESSING
ingredients
2  cloves garlic, crushed
1/2  c. salad oil
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. dry mustard
1  tsp. white pepper
2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
6  anchovy fillets
3  Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese
2  eggs
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Combine all ingredients and puree until smooth.  Add and toss with pasta and veggies.

ORANGE SALAD
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  carton low-fat cottage cheese
1/2  c. low-fat mayonnaise
1 (11 oz.)  can mandarin oranges, drained
1  pkg. sugar-free orange gelatin
preparation
      Combine all ingredients.  Mix well.  Chill.
      Each serving equals 1 meat, 1 1/2 fruits and 3 fat exchanges.

RUBY RED RASPBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. raspberry-flavored gelatin
2  c. boiling water, divided
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen raspberries in syrup
1 1/2  c. sour cream
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cherry flavored gelatin
1 (20 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
1 (16 oz.)  can whole-berry cranberry sauce
preparation
      Dissolve raspberry gelatin in 1 cup boiling water.  Add raspberries and stir until berries are thawed and separated.  Pour into a 13 x 9-inch pan; chill until set.  Carefully spread with sour cream; chill.  Dissolve cherry gelatin in remaining boiling water.  Add pineapple and cranberry sauce; mix well.  Allow to thicken slightly.  Carefully spoon over sour cream mixture; chill. Cut into squares and serve on lettuce leaves, if desired.  Yields 12 to 16 servings.

BROCCOLI PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. spaghetti
1  (16 oz.)  Wish-Bone dressing
2  c. sour cream
1  Tbsp. Italian herbs
1  c. chopped broccoli
1  c. chopped celery
2  c. mayonnaise
1/2  c. Parmesan cheese
1  c. chopped onion
1  c. chopped pepper
1  box Skroodles noodles
  ripe olives and cherry tomatoes (for garnish)
preparation
      Boil spaghetti and rinse.  In large container, toss with 1/2 Wish-Bone dressing.  Cook Skroodles; drain.  Rinse.  Add to spaghetti and Wish-Bone dressing.
      Combine remaining dressing with mayonnaise and sour cream.  Add herbs and Parmesan cheese.  Add to spaghetti mixture.  Fold in vegetables.  Garnish with olives and tomatoes.

STRAWBERRY SPINACH SALAD
ingredients
2  Tbsp. honey
1/2  c. orange juice
1/4  c. corn oil
1  bag fresh spinach
1  pt. strawberries, sliced
  sliced almonds
preparation
      Place honey, juice and oil in glass measuring cup.  Heat in microwave until honey dissolves.  Pour over spinach, berries and almonds.  Serve.

FESTIVE CRANBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1 (14 oz.)  can sweetened condensed milk
1/4  c. lemon juice
1 (20 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
1 (16 oz.)  can whole-berry cranberry sauce
2  c. miniature marshmallows
1/2  c. chopped pecans
  Red food coloring (optional)
1 (8 oz.)  carton frozen whipped topping, thawed
preparation
      In a bowl, combine milk and lemon juice, mix well.  Stir in the pineapple, cranberry sauce, marshmallows, pecans and food coloring if desired.  Fold in whipped topping.  Spoon into a 13 x 9 inch baking dish.  Freeze until firm, 4 hours or overnight.  Cut into squares.  Yield:  12 - 16 servings.

INDEPENDENCE DAY SALAD
ingredients
2  c. cooked, chopped ham
4  c. cooked, cubed potatoes
2  c. diced celery
1  c. torn lettuce
1/4  c. finely diced pickles
1/4  c. minced green pepper
4  hard-cooked eggs, sliced
1  tsp. salt
  dash of pepper
1  tsp. mustard
1/4  c. sour cream
1  c. mayonnaise
  watercress
  ripe olives
preparation
      Combine ham, potatoes, celery, lettuce, pickles, green pepper and 2 eggs.  Mix seasonings, sour cream and mayonnaise.  Blend into ham mixture.  Pile onto bed of lettuce.  Garnish with sprigs of watercress, remaining eggs and ripe olives, if desired.  Yields 6 to 10 servings.

ingredients
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. cherry jello
1  c. boiling water
1  c. cold water
1 (1 lb.)  can whole cranberry sauce
1  c. chopped celery
1  c. crushed pineapple
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  Chill.

SCANDINAVIAN SALAD
ingredients
1  medium head lettuce
6  oz. sour cream
1  Tbsp. plus 1 tsp. sugar
1  tsp. vinegar
1  tsp. grated onion
1  tsp. horseradish
1  tsp. salt
preparation
      Prepare lettuce.  Blend remaining ingredients for dressing.

CALICO SALAD
ingredients
1/2  c. brown sugar
1/3  c. cider vinegar
2  tsp. celery seed
1/4  tsp. round turmeric
  Salt and pepper to taste
2  Tbsp. chopped onion
1 (16 oz.)  can cut green beans, drained
1 (16 oz.)  can sliced carrots, drained
1 (16 oz.)  can whole kernel corn, drained
preparation
      Combine brown sugar, vinegar, celery seed, turmeric and salt and pepper mix well.
      Add onion and vegies, stir gently to coat and chill overnight. Makes 6 servings.

CHICKEN AND HAM SALAD
ingredients
1/3  c. mayonnaise
1/3  c. dairy sour cream
1  Tbsp. prepared mustard
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  c. diced, cooked chicken
2  c. diced, cooked ham
1  c. chopped celery
  salad greens
  Planters slivered almonds, toasted
  Ritz crackers
preparation
      In large bowl, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, mustard and lemon juice.  Mix in chicken, ham and celery.  Chill until ready to serve.
      To Serve:  Spoon salad onto individual salad plates lined with crisp salad greens.  Sprinkle with Planters slivered almonds. Serve with Ritz crackers.

EASY COMPANY SALAD
ingredients
1  head lettuce
1  head cauliflower
1  bunch green onions, chopped
1  can real bacon bits
1  bottle Ranch dressing
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  Stir in Ranch dressing right before serving.

STRAWBERRY PRETZEL SALAD
Bottom Layer:
ingredients
2 2/3  c. crushed pretzels
1 1/2  sticks margarine
3  Tbsp. sugar
preparation
      Mix crushed pretzels, margarine and 3 Tbsp. sugar.  Spread in 9 x 13 inch baking pan.  Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.  Cool.
Middle Layer:
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  c. sugar
1  small tub whipped topping.
preparation
      Beat together cream cheese, and 1 c. sugar.  Fold in whipped topping.  Spread over pretzel crust.
Top Layer:
ingredients
1  qt. frozen strawberries
2  c. boiling water
1 large  box strawberry gelatin
preparation
      Mix one large box strawberry gelatin in 2 cups boiling water, stir until gelatin is dissolved.  Add frozen strawberries.  Frozen berries will cause the gelatin to set.  Pour over cream cheese layer.  Refrigerate until ready to serve.

SUMMER PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1/3  c. oil
3  Tbsp. vinegar, preferably red wine
1  tsp. each:  salt, oregano and basil
4  c. large pasta twists (spirals), cooked and drained
1 (16 oz.)  can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
1  c. cherry tomatoes, halved
4  oz. Mozzarella, cut in thin strips (about 1 c.)
2  oz. sliced salami, cut in thin strips (about 1/2 c.)
1/2  c. pitted ripe olives
preparation
      In large salad bowl or deep serving dish, mix well oil, vinegar, salt, oregano and basil.  Add pasta, chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, Mozzarella, salami and olives; toss to combine.  Cover; chill several hours or overnight.  Toss; let stand at room temperature 30 minutes before serving.  Makes 4 servings.  Can be made up to a day ahead.

CHRISTY'S FRUIT SALAD
ingredients
1  can peach pie filling
1 small  can pineapple tidbits, drained
1  can mandarin oranges, drained
1  pkg. frozen strawberries, thawed
2  bananas (optional)
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.  Refrigerate. Before serving, add 2 sliced bananas, if desired.

KELLY'S BROCCOLI SALAD
ingredients
3  or 4 hard-boiled eggs
2  bunches broccoli florets (cut into bite size pieces)
1/3  c. chopped Vidalia or purple onion
2  c. shredded cheddar cheese
1  lb. bacon, cooked and crumbled
preparation
      Mix first 4 ingredients together in a large bowl and set aside.
Dressing:
ingredients
1  c. Miracle Whip
1/3  c. sugar
2  Tbsp. cider vinegar
preparation
      Mix all dressing ingredients together and add to broccoli mixture and chill.  When ready to serve, top with one pound of cooked crumbled bacon.

FROZEN STRAWBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. nonfat cream cheese, softened
1/2  c. sugar
1  (8 oz.) container reduced fat frozen whipped topping, thawed
2  c. frozen (no sugar added) whole strawberries, thawed and halved
1 (15 1/4 oz.)  can unsweetened crushed pineapple (undrained)
1 1/2  c. sliced banana (12 medium)
preparation
      Beat cream cheese at medium speed of an electric mixer until creamy.  Gradually add sugar, beating until smooth.  Fold in whipped topping and remaining ingredients.  Spoon mixture into a 13 x 9 x 2-inch dish.  Cover and freeze until firm.

ORIENTAL PASTA SALAD
ingredients
12  oz. pasta bow ties
5  qt. boiling water
6  oz. fresh snow peas, washed and trimmed
2  red bell peppers, seeded and cut into strips
6  scallions, sliced thin
4  c. fresh broccoli florets and thinly sliced stems
3  c. cooked diced chicken
1 1/2  c. Miracle Whip salad dressing
1  tsp. Tabasco sauce
1  tsp. garlic powder
1  tsp. ground ginger
preparation
      Gradually add pasta bow ties to boiling water so that water continues to boil.  Cook uncovered until tender.  Drain in colander and cool.  Add snow peas, red peppers, scallions, broccoli and diced chicken.  Combine salad dressing, Tabasco, garlic powder and ginger.  Pour over pasta mixture.  Toss lightly.  Chill and enjoy.

ONION SALAD
ingredients
3  c. Spanish onions, thinly sliced
1/4  tsp. soda
1/4  c. vinegar
1/2  tsp. sugar
1/4  tsp. salt
  dash of pepper
1/4  c. mayonnaise
preparation
      Place onion and soda in lukewarm water and let stand 5 minutes. Drain.  Then crisp onions by allowing them to stand in ice water, changing water several times.  Drain and dry thoroughly.  Add vinegar, sugar and seasoning.  Let stand 10 minutes.  Drain and dry thoroughly.  Serve on crisp lettuce.  Garnish with mayonnaise. Makes 6 servings.

STRAWBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1/2  c. mayonnaise
1 (12 oz.)  pkg. sliced strawberries
1  c. pecan pieces
1  c. whipping cream
1/4  lb. finely chopped marshmallows (miniature may be used or cut up large one with kitchen shears)
1 (20 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
preparation
      Soften cream cheese.  Blend in a small amount of stiffly beaten cream.  Fold cream cheese into remainder of whipped cream.  Mix other ingredients.  Put into heart shaped mold.  Freeze until firm. Let stand 3 minutes to thaw.  Serve on lettuce.

ORANGE SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. orange jello
1  c. boiling water
1/4  tsp. orange flavoring
1  pt. vanilla ice cream
1 (8 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
1  c. shredded cheese
1  c. chopped pecans
preparation
   Mix together.

PARTY PINK SALAD
ingredients
  juice of No. 2 can crushed pineapple
24  large marshmallows
1  pkg. strawberry gelatin
2  c. cottage cheese
1  c. drained crushed pineapple
1  c. chopped pecans
1 (8 oz.)  box Cool Whip
preparation
      Combine pineapple juice and marshmallows.  Place over low heat. Add gelatin.  Melt marshmallows and dissolve gelatin.  Add all other ingredients.  Mix. Fold in Cool Whip last.  Place in refrigerator.  Will keep for several days.

APRICOT SALAD
ingredients
2 small  pkg. orange jello
2  c. hot water
1  c. juice (from apricot and pineapple juice)
1 (No. 2 1/2)  can apricots, cut
1 (No. 2 1/2)  can crushed pineapple
3/4  c. miniature marshmallows
preparation
      Dissolve jello and water.  Add juice from fruits.  Chill until slightly thickened.  Fold in fruit and marshmallows.  Pour into 9-inch square dish.  Chill until firm.
Frosting:
ingredients
1/2  c. sugar
3  Tbsp. flour
1  egg, slightly beaten
2  Tbsp. butter
1  c. juice (apricot and pineapple)
1  c. heavy cream, whipped
preparation
      Combine sugar and flour.  Add juice and egg.  Cook until thickened.  Add butter and cool.  Fold in whipped cream.  Frost salad.

ZESTY HALIBUT SALAD
ingredients
4  halibut steaks
1/2  onion
3  stalks celery
4  hard-boiled eggs, chopped
1  c. celery, chopped
1/4  c. sweet pickle, chopped
1  c. mayonnaise
  juice of 1/2 lemon
1/4  c. stuffed olives, sliced
  salt and pepper
preparation
      Cook halibut steaks with onion and celery in small amount of water.  Cool.  Flake and remove all bones.  Mix fish with the rest of the ingredients, seasoning to taste with salt and pepper. Serves 4 to 6. Shape in a fish mold if desired or serve on lettuce leaf.

VEGGIE SALAD
ingredients
2 (No. 303)  cans green beans, drained
2 (No. 303)  cans peas, drained
1 (No. 303)  can white corn, drained
6  stalks celery
1 (4 oz.)  jar pimento
1  bunch green onion
2  medium green peppers
1  c. sugar
1  c. oil
1  c. vinegar
2  Tbsp. water
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Mix all together and leave to marinate overnight.

SOUTH OF THE BORDER SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. pork or ground beef
1/2  c. chopped onion
1  clove garlic
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato sauce
1  can chopped tomato
1 (4 oz.)  can green chili peppers, chopped
2  Tbsp. flour
2  tsp. chili powder
6  c. torn lettuce
1 (15 1/2 oz.)  can garbanzo beans, drained
1/2  c. sliced pitted ripe olives
1  c. shredded Monterey Jack or Cheddar cheese (4 oz.)
1  c. cherry tomatoes, halved
1  c. green pepper strips
1  avocado
preparation
      Cook pork or ground beef, onions and garlic until meat is browned and onions tender.  Drain off fat.  Stir in tomato sauce, undrained tomatoes, chili peppers, flour and chili powder.  Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly.  In salad bowl, mix lettuce, beans and olives.  Toss.  Top with meat mixture.  Sprinkle with shredded cheese.  Top with cherry tomato halves and green pepper strips.  Peel and slice avocado.  Arrange slices on top of salad.

SALAD DRESSING
ingredients
2  Tbsp. lemon juice or wine vinegar
1  Tbsp. honey
1  clove garlic, diced
1  Tbsp. rosemary
2  Tbsp. water
1  small diced onion
1  Tbsp. flax seed
1  tsp. parsley
preparation
      Place in blender until smooth.

MOMMA'S COKE SALAD
ingredients
2 large  pkg. lime jello
4  c. boiling water
4  c. Coke
1 1/2  c. celery, chopped fine
1 1/2  c. pecans, chopped
preparation
      Dissolve jello in hot water, stirring until completely dissolved.  Add Coke and blend until smooth.  Refrigerate until jello starts to set.  Stir in celery and nuts.  Mix well. Refrigerate until firm.

TURKEY-FRUIT SALAD
ingredients
8  c. torn spinach leaves
1  c. sliced celery
1 (8 oz.)  can pineapple chunks (juice pack)
2  medium apples
1  orange, peeled and sectioned
1/2  lb. cooked turkey, cut into strips
1/2  c. plain yogurt
2  Tbsp. buttermilk
1/2  tsp. celery seed
  dash of hot pepper sauce
preparation
      In salad bowl, combine spinach and celery.  Drain pineapple, reserving juice.  Core apples; cut into wedges.  Dip apples in reserved pineapple juice.  Arrange pineapple chunks, apple wedges, orange sections and turkey atop spinach.
      For dressing, combine yogurt, buttermilk, celery seed and hot pepper sauce.  Makes 4 servings.

TURKEY KIDNEY BEAN SALAD
ingredients
1  c. cooked turkey, chopped
1 1/4  c. kidney beans, canned and drained
1/3  c. chopped sweet pickle
2/3  c. coarsely chopped celery
1  Tbsp. finely chopped onion
2  hard-cooked eggs, diced
1  tsp. salt
3  Tbsp. mayonnaise
1  tsp. prepared mustard
1  tsp. pickle liquid
preparation
      Combine all ingredients; toss lightly.  Chill at least 1 hour to blend flavors.  Yields 6 (1/2-cup) servings and contains about 205 calories per serving.

HOT CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
4  c. chicken, cooked and diced
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
3/4  c. mayonnaise
3/4  c. cream of chicken soup
1  tsp. salt
2  c. celery, diced
4  hard-boiled eggs, diced
1  tsp. onion, dried
1 small  jar pimentos, chopped
1 1/2  c. potato chips, crushed
1  c. cheese, grated
2/3  c. almonds, sliced
preparation
      Thoroughly combine all of the ingredients, except for chips, cheese and almonds.  Place in a rectangular baking dish and top with the chips, cheese and almonds.  Let stand overnight in the refrigerator.  Bake at 400° for 20 to 25 minutes.  Serves 8.

JELLO SALAD
ingredients
1 small  pkg. jello (any flavor)
1 small  pkg. vanilla pudding (cook type)
1 1/2  c. water
9  oz. Cool Whip
1  can mandarin oranges
1 small  can pineapple tidbits
1 small  can fruit cocktail
preparation
      Boil jello, pudding and water. Cool. Drain fruit. Fold in cooled jello. Chill. Serve.

MACARONI SALAD
ingredients
2  c. uncooked macaroni
1  lb. hamburger or ground round
1 (1 1/4 oz.)  pkg. taco seasoning mix
1  c. commercial French dressing
1/2  head lettuce, shredded
1  pt. cherry tomatoes
1  c. (4 oz.) sharp cheese, shredded
1/2  c. chopped green onion
1/2  c. chopped green pepper
preparation
      Cook macaroni according to directions.  Drain.  Rinse with cold water and drain.  Chill at least 1 hour.  Cook meat in skillet until brown; drain.  Stir in taco seasoning and French dressing; cool.  Combine macaroni, beef mixture and remaining ingredients in large bowl, tossing well.  Serve salad immediately.

SINGAPORE CHICKEN AND BLACK BEAN SALAD
ingredients
3/4  c. picante sauce
1/2  c. rice vinegar
2  Tbsp. peanut butter
1  clove garlic, peeled
6  c. salad greens, torn in bite-size pieces
1/2  c. fresh cilantro leaves
1 (about 16 oz.)  can black beans, drained and rinsed
2  green onions, sliced
2  c. cooked chicken strips
1  large green or red pepper, cut into 1/4-inch rings
preparation
      In a blender place picante sauce, vinegar, peanut butter and garlic.  Cover and blend until smooth.  Toss salad greens, cilantro, beans and onions with 1/2 cup picante sauce mixture until evenly coated.
      Arrange on 4 plates.  Arrange chicken and pepper of salad greens.  Pour remaining picante sauce mixture over chicken.

7 LAYER SALAD
ingredients
1  head lettuce
10  oz. pkg. frozen peas
1  green bell pepper
7 to 8  slices bacon, cooked and broken
4  to 5 boiled eggs, sliced
1/2  c. celery (optional)
1/2  c. onions, chopped
2  c. mayo
2  Tbsp. sugar
8  oz. shredded Mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Wash lettuce and layer in bottom of casserole dish. Continue layers in order above, ending with onions. Mix mayo and sugar until well blended. Spread over top of layers. Top with cheese. Place in the refrigerator overnight.

MEXICALI PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. fettuccine
10  cherry tomatoes, halved
2  avocados, diced
1  can (1 c.) whole pitted ripe olives
3  green onions, chopped
1/4  lb. fresh mushrooms, halved
2  fresh green chili peppers (Anaheim or Poblano)
1/2  lb. sharp Cheddar cheese, cubed
  vinaigrette dressing
preparation
      Cook fettuccine; drain and set aside.  Add remaining ingredients.  Bell pepper may be substituted for chili peppers. Toss with fettuccine and vinaigrette dressing.

CRAB SALAD
ingredients
2  cans crab, drained
2  cans shrimp, drained
1  loaf buttered bread (remove crusts)
1  c. celery
4  eggs, boiled
1  c. onion
3  c. mayonnaise
preparation
      Butter bread and break it up. Add onion and egg. Blend and refrigerate overnight. Add other ingredients and refrigerate 12 hours.

SOUR CREAM SALAD
ingredients
1 (29 oz.)  can fruit cocktail, drained
1/2  pt. sour cream
1/4  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. lemon juice
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1/2  c. shredded cheese
preparation
      Mix all together and pour into serving bowl.

BAKED CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
2  Tbsp. butter or margarine
1  c. thinly sliced celery
1/2  c. chopped onion
1/2  c. mayonnaise
1/2  c. sour cream
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/2  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
2  c. cubed, cooked chicken
1/2  c. slivered, toasted almonds
1 (4 oz.)  can sliced mushrooms, drained
1/4  c. potato chips
preparation
      In large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.  Add celery and onion; cook about 4 minutes.  Remove from heat.  Stir in mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, salt and pepper until well blended.  Add chicken, almonds and mushrooms; toss to coat well. Spoon into 1 1/2-quart casserole.  Sprinkle with potato chips. Bake in 325° oven for 25 to 30 minutes.  Serves 6.

WEIGHT CONTROL CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
1  (5-inch) zucchini
5  medium mushrooms (fresh)
1 (6 oz.)  can white meat boned chicken
4  Tbsp. light mayonnaise (Miracle Whip)
2  tsp. Mrs. Dash seasoning
2  regular pita pockets or 4 mini pitas
preparation
      Mince zucchini and mushrooms.  Stir in chicken, mayonnaise and seasoning.  Fill pita pockets.  Serves 2.

INDONESIAN FRUIT SALAD
ingredients
2  large bananas, sliced
2  medium oranges, sectioned
1/2  c. dates, slivered
1 (1 lb. 4 oz.)  can pineapple bits
2  Tbsp. white wine vinegar
1  tsp. curry powder
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  c. salad oil
  crisp salad greens
  cottage cheese
  chopped salted peanuts
preparation
      Combine bananas, oranges and dates in a large bowl.  Drain pineapple, reserving 1/2 cup juice.  Add pineapple to fruit. Combine juice with wine vinegar, curry powder, salt and salad oil. Shake well; pour over fruit and marinate about 1/2 hour.  Arrange on platter with crisp greens.  Spoon cottage cheese on top and fruit over all.  Top salad with peanuts and serve.

CAESAR SALAD
ingredients
1  clove garlic, chopped
6  anchovies, mashed
4  Tbsp. olive oil
2  Tbsp. vinegar
  twist of pepper
  dash of Worcestershire and lemon juice
  pinch of oregano
1  raw egg
  grated Parmesan cheese
  croutons
1  large head or 2 small heads Romaine lettuce
preparation
      Clean and tear lettuce. Set aside. Mix together well the garlic, anchovies, oil and vinegar. Season with pepper, Worcestershire, lemon juice and oregano. Add beaten egg. Wait until ready to serve before tossing dressing on lettuce. Add Parmesan cheese and croutons.
      Croutons: Cut day old Italian or French bread into 1-inch cubes. Toss in mixture of olive oil, salt, oregano and chopped garlic. Bake on cookie sheet at 275° for about 25 minutes to dry out. Keep in airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

GREEN PEA PICNIC SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. frozen green peas
1  medium cucumbers (for 3/4 c. chopped)
2  cloves fresh garlic
1/4  c. fresh basil leaves (optional)
1  medium red bell pepper (for 1 c. chopped)
1  small onion (for 1/2 c. chopped)
2/3  c. light sour cream
1/3  c. light mayonnaise
  juice from 1/2 lemon (2 Tbsp.)
1/2  tsp. salt or more to taste
1/4  tsp. pepper or more to taste
preparation
      Place peas in a colander and run cool water over them to thaw.  Set aside to drain well.  Cut the cucumber in half and using a spoon, scrape out the seeds.  Chop the cucumber and place it in a 2-quart or larger bowl.  Peel and finely mince the garlic, adding it to the bowl.  Add basil, red bell pepper and onion.  Add sour cream, mayonnaise, lemon, salt and pepper to the bowl.  Stir well to mix the vegetables.  Add the green peas and toss to coat. Mix well.  Serve at once or cover and chill up to 24 hours.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

GERMAN POTATO SALAD
ingredients
1/2  lb. cooked bacon, diced
1/3  c. bacon drippings
1  Tbsp. flour
1  Tbsp. sugar
1/2  tsp. salt
1  tsp. celery seed
1/4  tsp. ground pepper
1/2  c. chicken broth
1/2  c. white vinegar
6  c. sliced and cooked potatoes (about 3 lb.)
preparation
      Cook bacon until crisp; drain.  Heat drippings; blend in flour, sugar, salt, celery seed and pepper.  Gradually blend in broth and vinegar.  Cook, stirring constantly, until slightly thickened. Combine potatoes and bacon bits.  Pour sauce over; toss gently and put in serving dish.  Put in oven at 325° to reheat for 1/2 hour.

GOURMET TOSSED GREEN SALAD
ingredients
1  medium head lettuce
1  small head cauliflower
1  small sweet onion
1  medium green pepper, diced
1  pimiento, diced
6  large fresh mushrooms, sliced
1/2  c. Roquefort cheese, crumbled
1  clove garlic, crushed or grated
  low calorie French dressing
preparation
      Tear lettuce into bite-size pieces.  Wash cauliflower; remove green stalks and separate into tiny flowerets.  Cut onion in paper-thin rings.  Toss gently with green pepper, pimiento, mushrooms, cheese and garlic.  Chill about 1 hour.  Toss and serve immediately with low calorie French dressing.

FROG EYE SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. (4 serving size) sugar-free vanilla cook & serve pudding mix
2/3  c. nonfat dry milk powder
2  c. canned crushed pineapple packed in juice, drained
1  tsp. vanilla extract
2  c. cooked Acine del Pepe macaroni
1  c. canned Mandarin oranges, rinsed and drained
3/4  c. Cool Whip (8 calories per Tbsp.)
1/2  c. miniature marshmallows
preparation
      Drain pineapple and reserve juice.  In a medium saucepan combine dry pudding mix and dry milk powder.  Add enough water to reserved pineapple juice to make 1 and 1/2 cups liquid.  Add liquid to dry pudding mixture and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and starts to boil.  Remove from heat.  Stir in vanilla extract and cooked macaroni.  Mix gently to combine.  Cool 10 minutes.  Fold in Mandarin oranges and pineapple.  Pour into medium bowl.  Cover and cool at least 1 hour.  Fold in Cool Whip lite and marshmallows.  Chill until ready to serve.  This makes eight servings. of 2/3 cup.

BUTTERMILK SALAD
ingredients
1 large  can crushed pineapple
1  pkg. lemon Jell-O
1  pkg. orange Jell-O
2  c. buttermilk
1  c. grated cheese
8  oz. carton Cool Whip
preparation
      Heat pineapple to boiling.  Dissolve in this lemon and orange Jell-O.  Let cool thoroughly.  Add buttermilk, cheese and Cool Whip.  Mix all ingredients well.  Pour into a square or long dish. Place in refrigerator to chill well.  Will keep for several days. (Travels well.)

MARINATED FRESH VEGETABLE SALAD
ingredients
1  head cauliflower, cut in small flowerets
1  bunch broccoli, cut in small buds
1  large cucumber, sliced thin
4  large carrots, sliced thin
2  large sweet onions (make rings after slicing)
1  large green pepper (cut in rings)
1 (16 oz.)  bottle low calorie Italian Zesty dressing
preparation
      Marinate all cut up vegetables in dressing for  4 to 6 hours.
      Note:  This is a nice salad that will keep well in refrigerator a week in a tightly closed container.  It is also good for munchies.

GARDEN GREEN SALAD
ingredients
2  c. torn romaine lettuce
1/2  c. sliced green onions (scallions)
1/2  c. thinly sliced celery
3  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1/2  tsp. dehydrated cane juice
1/8  tsp. pepper
2  c. torn fresh spinach
1  medium cucumber
8  cherry tomatoes, halved
1  tsp. dried parsley flakes
1/4  tsp. dried whole oregano
preparation
      Combine first 6 ingredients in a large bowl.  Toss well. Combine lemon juice and remaining ingredients in a jar.  Cover tightly and shake vigorously.  Pour over lettuce mixture.  Toss gently.  Yields  4 servings.

TURKEY-RICE SALAD
ingredients
3/4  c. water
3/4  c. quick cooking rice
1  c. peas
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  c. mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. pickle relish
1  Tbsp. chopped onion
1  c. cooked cold turkey, diced
1/2  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
      Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan.  Add rice, peas and salt.  Stir to moisten.  Remove from heat.  Let stand for 15 minutes.  Add mayonnaise, relish and onion.  Fold to blend.  Cover and chill thoroughly.  Fold in turkey and cheese.  Serve on lettuce leaf.

MACARONI SEAFOOD SALAD
ingredients
2  c. macaroni
1 large  can shrimp or 1 1/2 lb. fresh shrimp*
1 1/2  c. chopped celery
1  Tbsp. chopped pimento
1/4  tsp. black pepper
1/2  c. diced pineapple
3  hard-boiled eggs
1  c. mayonnaise
  sliced stuffed olives
1 large  can green peas (optional)
preparation
      Cook macaroni; drain and chill.  Combine remaining ingredients. If fresh shrimp are used, boil 15 minutes, then blanch in cold water and remove shells and center black line.
      *Can substitute tuna or salmon.

PISTACHIO SALAD
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  box pistachio pudding
1  c. miniature marshmallows
  Nuts and Maraschino cherries
1 (20 oz.)  can crushed pineapple with juice
1  c. Cool Whip
preparation
      Combine pudding powder and all other ingredients, in a serving bowl, mix well.  Decorate with nuts and cherries and let set.

PASTA & SLAW SALAD
ingredients
1  bag broccoli slaw
1  bag frozen peas
1 large  bottle ranch dressing
1  bag bow tie pasta, cooked and drained
preparation
      Add cooked pasta to slaw, peas and dressing.  Enjoy.

BLACK-EYED PEA SALAD
ingredients
2 1/2  c. cooked black-eyed peas, drained
3/4  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/4  tsp. hot sauce
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/4  c. salad oil
2  Tbsp. mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. pimento
4  slices bacon, fried and crumbled
1 1/2  tsp. liquid smoke
2  tsp. prepared mustard
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/2  c. onions, chopped
2  hard-boiled eggs, chopped
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  May use cooked green beans, red beans, limas.

ARTICHOKE SALAD
ingredients
1  artichoke
1  green bell pepper
2  carrots
3  Tbsp. flax seed oil
  a dash of parsley
1  purple onion
1  tomato
2  Tbsp. apple cider vinegar
1/4  c. celery
preparation
      Wash the artichokes well and boil in covered pot 45 minutes to 1 hour.  When ready, peel them until you can see the center. Remove the "chokes" with a spoon and discard.  Cut the artichoke heart and other vegetables into bite size pieces.  Combine and toss with vinegar and oil.

OVERNIGHT SALAD
ingredients
1  head lettuce
1  head cauliflower
1  pt. mayo (not salad dressing)
  chopped onion to taste
  bacon to taste, crumbled
  Parmesan cheese to taste
1/2  c. sugar
preparation
      Layer lettuce, then cauliflower. Spread mayo on top of cauliflower. Sprinkle onion and bacon on top of mayo. Cover with sugar and Parmesan cheese. Let set in the refrigerator overnight. Stir before serving.
       You can add red cabbage, snow peas or any other vegetable for color and taste.

TORTELLINI SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. frozen cheese tortellini
1  large bag frozen combination style vegetables (such as carrots, cauliflower, broccoli
4  Tbsp. olive oil
1 1/2  tsp. dried oregano
1  tsp. garlic salt
  salt and pepper to taste
  finely chopped fresh zucchini, red or green peppers and cucumbers (added at the last minute if you want)
preparation
      Bring large pot of water to boil.  Add 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add tortellini and cook until al dente.  Do not overcook.  Drain and rinse under cold water.  Meanwhile, cook the vegetables according to package directions in boiling water or microwave. When done, rinse under cold water and drain well.  In large serving bowl, stir together the olive oil, garlic salt and oregano.  Add cooked tortellini and vegetables.  Stir gently to coat with dressing.  If salad seems dry, add a little more olive oil.  Chill at least 1 hour.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.

MARGE'S WALDORF SALAD
ingredients
2  c. diced tart apples
1  Tbsp. sugar
1/2  tsp. lemon juice
  Dash of salt
1  c. celery, diced
1/2  c. broken walnuts
1  c. red seedless grapes, halved
1/4  c. mayonnaise
1/2  c. whipping cream, whipped
preparation
      Sprinkle apple cubes with sugar, lemon juice and salt.  Add celery, nuts and grapes.  Fold mayonnaise into whipped cream. Gently fold into apple mixture.  Makes 6 servings.

SOY SAUCE SALAD DRESSING
ingredients
1  c. vegetable oil
1/2  c. cider vinegar
1/2  c. sugar
4  Tbsp. soy sauce
preparation
      Shake and chill.
       This is good on salads, cornbread, green beans or anything.

SWEET BASIL SALAD DRESSING
ingredients
2  Tbsp. onion powder
1  c. water
1/2  c. sunflower seeds
3/4  tsp. salt
1  tsp. dried sweet basil
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
  thyme (optional)
preparation
      Combine all ingredients in the blender and blend until smooth.

JAPANESE PEAR SALAD
ingredients
  lettuce
2  Japanese pears, sliced (when in season)
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
2  Tbsp. sugar
2  Tbsp. vinegar
4  Tbsp. salad oil
preparation
      Mix together salt, pepper, sugar, vinegar and oil for dressing. Pour over lettuce and pears.  Makes 4 servings.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

TURKEY SALAD
ingredients
1/2  c. sugar-free mayonnaise
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/4  tsp. sea salt
1/8  tsp. marjoram
  dash of cayenne
  ripe olives
  tomato slices
3  c. cooked turkey, chopped
preparation
      Combine mayonnaise with lemon juice, sea salt, marjoram and cayenne.  Mix turkey with dressing and arrange on a large platter with ripe olives and tomato slices.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

LAYERED SALAD
ingredients
1  head lettuce, chopped
1  c. celery, chopped
10  oz. frozen peas
1/2  c. bell pepper, chopped
1  medium onion, chopped
1  c. shredded carrot
2  c. mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. sugar
8  oz. Mozzarella cheese, shredded
  bacon bits (if desired)
preparation
      Place a layer of lettuce. Add each vegetable in layers. Top off vegetables with more lettuce. Spread over lettuce 2 cups mayonnaise. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons sugar over mayonnaise. Add the Mozzarella cheese. Let set for 24 hours. Sprinkle bacon bits before serving, if desired.

AUTUMN APPLE SALAD
ingredients
1 (20 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, undrained
2/3  c. granulated sugar
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lemon Jello, dry
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  c. red delicious apples, diced (unpeeled)
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1  c. celery, chopped
1  c. Cool Whip
preparation
      Place pineapple and sugar in saucepan and boil for 3 minutes.  Add lemon Jello.  Stir well and cool. Place cream cheese in medium mixing bowl.  Gradually blend in pineapple mixture. Fold in apples, nuts, celery, and Cool Whip.  Place in oblong 9 x 13 inch baking dish and refrigerate.  Keeps well.

MEDITERRANEAN PASTA SALAD
ingredients
2/3  c. olive oil
3  Tbsp. red wine vinegar
2  Tbsp. fresh basil
1/4  c. chopped green onions
2  Tbsp. Parmesan cheese
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. black pepper
12  oz. rotelle pasta, freshly cooked and drained
1  each:  small red, green and yellow bell peppers, halved lengthwise and cut in thin strips
1  medium tomato, cut in wedges
1/4  c. ripe black olives
8  oz. cubed Feta or Mozzarella cheese
1/4  tsp. dried oregano
preparation
      Process oil, vinegar, basil, green onions, Parmesan cheese, salt and pepper in blender until smooth.  Put pasta, bell pepper strips, tomato wedges and olives in large bowl.  Pour in dressing; toss to mix.  Roll cheese cubes in remaining 2 tablespoons basil to coat.  Add to salad; sprinkle with oregano.  Toss lightly.  Serve at room temperature.  Serves 4 main dish servings.

CRUNCH BAKED HAM SALAD
ingredients
3  c. cubed, cooked ham
1  c. chopped celery
2/3  c. mayonnaise
1/2  c. chopped pimento stuffed olives
1/4  c. chopped onion
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1 1/2  tsp. prepared mustard
1  c. crushed potato chips
preparation
      Combine ingredients (not the potato chips).  Stir well. Spoon this into a lightly greased 8-inch baking dish.  Top with potato chips. Bake at 400° for 20 or 25 minutes.  Will serve six.

CORNBREAD SALAD
ingredients
1  c. self-rising cornmeal
2  Tbsp. plain flour
1  c. sour cream (8 oz.)
1  stick butter, melted
2  eggs
1  c. English peas
1  c. onions, chopped
1  c. green peppers, chopped
1  c. fresh tomatoes, chopped
1  c. sweet pickles, cubed
1  c. mayonnaise
1  Tbsp. sugar
1  c. shredded cheese (of choice)
preparation
      Mix cornmeal, flour, sour cream, butter and eggs. Bake until done at 350°. Let cool and crumble in a 9 x 13-inch dish. Add one layer at a time the peas, onions, pepper, tomatoes and pickles. Top with 1 cup mayonnaise and 1 tablespoon sugar, mixed well. Then sprinkle with the cheese.

POTATO SALAD
ingredients
1  c. mayonnaise
1  tsp. prepared mustard
1/2  tsp. celery seed
1/2  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. black pepper
4  c. cubed, cooked potatoes
2  hard-cooked eggs, chopped
1/2  c. chopped onion
1/2  c. celery slices
1/2  c. chopped sweet pickle
  paprika for sprinkling (if desired)
preparation
      Combine mayonnaise, mustard, celery seed, salt and pepper; mix well.  Add potatoes, eggs, onion, celery and pickle; mix lightly. Chill before serving.

FRUIT SALAD
ingredients
2  c. sliced strawberries
1 1/2  c. cubed cantaloupe
1 1/2  c. cubed watermelon
1 1/2  c. cubed honeydew melon
2  c. sliced peaches
2  c. seedless whole grapes
2  c. fresh whole blueberries
2  c. cubed apples
1/4  c. water
1 1/2  Tbsp. sugar or sweetener
preparation
      Mix all ingredients in a large bowl; chill for 1 1/2 to 2 hours and serve.  Use 1/2 watermelon as serving bowl.

STRAWBERRY JELLO SALAD
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  box strawberry Jell-O
2  (10 oz.) small frozen strawberries
1 1/2  c. boiling water
1  c. crushed pineapple
2  large bananas
1 (8 oz.)  carton sour cream
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in water.  In a bowl, mash bananas and thawed strawberries, crushed pineapple and Jell-O mixture.  Pour half of this mixture into 9 x 13-inch cake pan.  Refrigerate until mixture has set.  Take out of refrigerator, spread sour cream and add remaining mixture over this and refrigerate again.  Cut in squares and serve.

CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
1  oz. lean boiled chicken (1 meat)
1  Tbsp. Weight Watchers light mayonnaise (1 fat)
1/2  c. unsweetened pineapple (1 fruit)
1  small apple (1 fruit)
2  Tbsp. raisins (1 fruit)
  slivered almonds
preparation
      Place cleaned fryer hen in Dutch oven with water and poultry seasoning (generous amount); salt and pepper if your diet allows. Cook until meat falls away from bone.  Let cool and then remove meat from bone.  Add remaining ingredients to chicken, sprinkling slivered almonds on top of salad.
      Note:  The recipe is for a diet for 3 meats, 2 fats, 2 fruit exchanges; however, you may design your own recipe to fit your diet by using the base amounts listed as follows:
Sample Recipe:
ingredients
3  oz. meat (chicken - 3 meats)
2  Tbsp. light mayo (2 fats)
1/4  c. pineapple, partially drained**
1/2  peeled, chopped apple**
2  Tbsp. raisins**
2  slices bread (2 bread)
  almonds
preparation
      **Fruit amounts equal 2 fruits.
      Use 4 to 6 small Tupperware bowls and line them up on the counter, assembly-line style.  In this manner, add the amount of the ingredients in each bowl so that when completed, you have 4 to 6 exact meals ready to put into lunch boxes or serve at the table. Complete meal is served with 2 slices of bread.

DUM DUM SALAD
ingredients
1 (15 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
1 (15 oz.)  can Thank You brand cherry pie filling
1  (8 oz.) container Cool Whip, thawed
1  can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
preparation
      Put all ingredients in a bowl and mix with mixer at medium speed until mixed well.  Place in refrigerator for 1 hour.  Serve.

PAUL'S GUACAMOLE SALAD
ingredients
  3-5 semi-soft avocados
1 small  can Herdez Salsa Casera
  Roasted, peeled, seeded, chopped green chiles (optional)
1  pkg. spicy guacamole mix (produce section at grocer)
  Shredded or chopped cilantro leaves to taste
preparation
      Peel, remove seed, and mash avocados.  Mash everything together.  Chill for at least one hour to re-hydate the guacamole mix ingredients.

ORANGE SHERBET SALAD
ingredients
2 small  pkg. (or 1 large) orange jello
1 small  can mandarin oranges, drained
1 small  can crushed pineapple, drained
1 small  can pineapple tidbits
1  pt. orange sherbet
preparation
      Dissolve jello in 2 cups boiling water.  While hot, stir in 1 pint orange sherbet.  Add mandarin oranges, crushed pineapple and pineapple tidbits.  Stir and chill.

CHERRY SALAD
ingredients
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. cherry jello
2  c. hot water
1 (1 lb. 5 oz.)  can cherry pie filling
12  large marshmallows
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  c. Cool Whip
preparation
      Dissolve jello in hot water. Cool, but do not let jello set. Stir in pie filling. Refrigerate until firm. Melt marshmallows. Add cream cheese until well blended. Cool marshmallow mixture. Fold in whipped cream. Spread on jello.
      Tip: Jello is also very good without topping.

SWEET 'N SOUR TURKEY POTATO SALAD
ingredients
3  Tbsp. sugar
5  Tbsp. cider vinegar
1  small onion, finely chopped
1  tsp. salt
  pepper to taste
1  Tbsp. ketchup
3  Tbsp. mayonnaise
1 1/2  lb. red potatoes, boiled, peeled and kept warm
2  ribs celery, peeled and diced
3/4  lb. diced, smoked turkey breast
preparation
      In small saucepan, combine sugar and vinegar.  Heat until the sugar dissolves.  Transfer to large bowl.  Add onion, salt, pepper, ketchup and mayonnaise.  Add the potatoes, celery and turkey.  Toss well.  Makes 4 servings.
