Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

LIME SALAD
ingredients
2 (3 oz.)  boxes lime jello
1 (20 oz.)  can unsweetened crushed pineapple, drain (save juice)
2  c. boiling water
1  c. cold water
1  c. pineapple juice
1  c. pineapple
1  c. cottage cheese
1  c. Miracle Whip
preparation
      Put jello in large container.  Add boiling water and stir 2 minutes.  Add cold water and pineapple juice.  Stir and put in refrigerator.  Just before it is solid, add pineapple, cottage cheese and Miracle Whip.  Mix this with beater just until well blended, then put back in refrigerator until solid.

BLACK BEAN AND COUSCOUS SALAD
ingredients
1  can black beans
1/3  c. olive oil
1 1/2  oz. sherry wine vinegar
1/2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. fresh cracked pepper
1  glove garlic, chopped
1  tsp. cumin
preparation
      Drain beans and rinse. Mix above ingredients in a small bowl. Add black beans and put aside.
Step 2 Ingredients:
ingredients
3  Tbsp. sherry wine vinegar
1/4  c. olive oil
1  glove garlic, chopped
1/2  oregano
  juice from 1 lemon
1/2  Tbsp. cumin
1/2  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
2  Tbsp. olive oil
1  box instant couscous
preparation
      In a large bowl, whisk sherry wine vinegar, olive oil, garlic, oregano, cumin, salt, pepper and lemon juice. Prepare couscous using chicken stock and 2 tablespoons olive oil. Fold in dressing; remove any lumps.
Step 3:
ingredients
1/2  red pepper, chopped
1/2  yellow pepper, chopped
1/2  orange pepper, chopped
3/4  c. fresh parsley
1/2  c. green onion, sliced diagonally
preparation
      Toss marinated beans with couscous. Add red pepper, yellow pepper, orange pepper, parsley and green onion. Serve at room temperature.

CRUNCHY PEA SALAD
ingredients
10  oz. pkg. frozen baby peas, thawed
1  c. diced celery
1  c. chopped cauliflower
1/4  c. diced green onion
1  c. chopped cashews
1/2  c. sour cream
1  c. prepared Hidden Valley Ranch
12  pieces bacon
preparation
      Combine all these ingredients, except the bacon.  Chill. Cook bacon until crisp and crumble over top of salad before serving.

STRAWBERRY SALAD
ingredients
2  bags romaine lettuce
1  pt. strawberries, cut up
  Parmesan cheese or to taste
1/2 to 1  c. sunflower seeds or to taste
preparation
      Mix together and set aside.
Dressing:
ingredients
3/4  c. mayo
1/4  c. milk
1  Tbsp. poppy seeds
1/3  c. sugar
1  Tbsp. white vinegar
preparation
      Mix together.  Toss together above ingredients with dressing when ready to serve.

SWEET FLORET SALAD
ingredients
1/2  c. mayonnaise*
1/3  c. sugar
1/4  c. vegetable oil
1/4  c. vinegar
1  medium head cauliflower, broken into florets
1 3/4  lb. broccoli (florets also)
  red onion slices
preparation
      In small saucepan, combine mayo, sugar, oil and vinegar. Bring to boil, whisking constantly.  Cool to room temperature. Combine remaining ingredients in large bowl.  Add dressing.  Toss to coat.  Cover and refrigerate several hours or overnight.  Add bacon.
      *Cannot substitute light or fat-free.

LIME JELLO SALAD
ingredients
1 large  box lime Jell-O
1  c. boiling water
1  c. cold water
1  pt. (2 c.) cottage cheese
8  oz. cream cheese, softened
2  c. crushed pineapple (large), drained
1  c. chopped nuts (optional)
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water.  Stir in cold water.  Set aside.  In medium bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy.  Stir in cottage cheese.  Add this mixture to the Jell-O and stir until well mixed.  Add pineapple and nuts.  Stir well.  Pour into dish and chill until set.

TANGY BROCCOLI SALAD
ingredients
1  c. Miracle Whip dressing
2  Tbsp. sugar
2  Tbsp. vinegar
1 medium  bunch broccoli, cut into flowerets (about 6 c.)
12  slices bacon, cooked crisp and crumbled
1/2  c. chopped red onion
preparation
      Mix dressing, sugar and vinegar in large bowl. Add remaining ingredients; mix lightly. Refrigerate 1 hour or until chilled.

ORANGE WHIP SALAD
ingredients
1 small  can crushed pineapple, drained
1 small  can mandarin oranges, drained
1  carton cottage cheese
1 small  pkg. orange jello
1  medium container Cool Whip
preparation
      Drain both pineapple and mandarin oranges. Mix all ingredients together. Chill.

LAYERED SALAD
ingredients
1  head lettuce
1  head cauliflower
1  lb. bacon
2  c. mayonnaise
1/4  c. sugar
1/3  c. Parmesan cheese
2  green onions (optional)
preparation
      Place torn lettuce pieces on bottom.  Cauliflower pieces on next layer.  Combine mayonnaise, sugar and Parmesan cheese.  Mix thoroughly.  Spread mixture on top of lettuce, cauliflower and onions.  Seal.  Refrigerate overnight.  Add bacon just before tossing.

PASTA AND PEPPERONI SALAD
ingredients
8  oz. tri-color corkscrew pasta, cooked and drained
2  c. pepperoni or salami, cubed
1  c. chopped zucchini
1/2  c. chopped green onion
1/2  c. chopped green pepper
1/3  c. oil and vinegar salad dressing
1/2  c. cubed Cheddar cheese
  sliced ripe olives (optional)
3/4  c. mayonnaise
3/4  c. sour cream
1  Tbsp. blue cheese salad dressing mix
preparation
      Mix with salad ingredients.

CARAMEL APPLE SALAD
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  can crushed pineapple
1 (3 1/2 oz.)  pkg. instant butterscotch pudding
1  (8 oz.) tub Cool Whip
1  c. dry roasted peanuts
1  c. miniature marshmallows
3  c. unpeeled chopped apples
preparation
      Mix pineapple and pudding. Fold in Cool Whip. Add remaining ingredients and refrigerate.

SHRIMP SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. fresh or frozen shrimp
1/8  tsp. white pepper
3/4  tsp. chopped pimento
1/8  tsp. chopped parsley
1/4  c. reduced calorie mayonnaise
1/2  tsp. prepared mustard
1/3  c. finely chopped celery
preparation
      Place shrimp in boiling water to cover; cook 5 minutes.  Cool shrimp.  Peel and devein shrimp; chop.  Combine remaining ingredients except celery to make salad dressing; mix well.  Add shrimp and celery to salad dressing.  Refrigerate until served. Yield:  4 servings.  Each Serving:  1/3 cup.
      Exchange:  3 low-fat meat.

BROKEN GLASS SALAD
ingredients
3  oz. pkg. strawberry Jell-O
3  oz. pkg. orange Jell-O
3  oz. pkg. lime Jell-O
1  pkg. Knox gelatine
1  c. pineapple juice
3  Tbsp. sugar
24  graham crackers
1/2  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. soft butter
1  pt. whipping cream
1/2  c. sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      Dissolve each package of Jell-O in 1 1/2 cups boiling water. Pour into shallow pans to jell.  Take 1 package Knox gelatine and dissolve in 1/4 cup cold water.  Bring 1 cup of pineapple juice to a boil.  Add 3 tablespoons of sugar and the plain gelatin.  Mix and set aside to cool thoroughly.  Crush 24 graham crackers and mix with 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup soft butter.  Press 1/2 cracker mix in the bottom of an 8 1/2 x 11-inch pan.  Whip 1 pint of whipping cream.  Add 1/2 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon of vanilla. Fold in gelatin pineapple mixture.  Cut the strawberry, orange and lime Jell-O into squares and add to whipped cream mixture. Sprinkle remaining cracker mixture on top.  Chill overnight.

SHRIMP SALAD A LA FINLAND
ingredients
1  head lettuce
1  bunch leaf lettuce
2  to 3 chopped tomatoes
1  red bell pepper, chopped
1 small  can each:  corn, peas and green beans, drained
1/2  lb. Edam or Feta cheese, shredded
preparation
      Tear lettuce into bite size chunks.  Add all other ingredients and toss well.  Chill until serving time.  Serve with buttermilk dressing.

YVONNE'S SALAD
ingredients
1  head lettuce, chopped
2  pkg. salad in a bag
3/4  pkg. of pepperoni
2  pkg. Mozzarella cheese, shredded
1 (16 oz.)  bottle Wish Bone robusto Italian dressing
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  Pour dressing over salad mix.  Fresh vegetables can be added.  Makes 10 - 15 servings.

SPRING SALAD
ingredients
4  c. dry shell macaroni
  carrots
  onion
  celery
  green pepper
  cucumber
  radishes
2  c. Miracle Whip salad dressing
1  c. sugar
1/2  c. vinegar
14  oz. can sweetened condensed milk
preparation
      Boil the macaroni. Cool completely. In a large bowl, combine salad dressing, sugar, vinegar and milk. Slice in the vegetables, using as many as you want. Add macaroni. Refrigerate overnight.

PINEAPPLE AND APRICOT SALAD
ingredients
1 medium  can tidbit pineapple
1  can apricots
1  pkg. orange jello
1  c. hot water
3/4  c. miniature marshmallows
1/4  c. sugar
1  beaten egg
1  Tbsp. flour
1  Tbsp. butter
1/2  c. whipped topping
  Cheddar cheese
preparation
      Drain the juice from the pineapple and apricots.  Save juices. Dissolve the jello in the hot water.  Add 1/2 of each juice.  When jello thickens, add 3/4 cup mashed apricots and marshmallows. Refrigerate until firm.  When set, spread the top with the following.
       Cook 3/4 cup pineapple and apricot juices, sugar, egg, flour and butter until thick. When cool, fold in the whipped topping and mix well. Spread over entire salad. Sprinkle Cheddar cheese over top of all before serving.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

FROZEN FRUIT SALAD
ingredients
1  can Bing cherries
1  can chunk pineapple
10  oz. pkg. miniature marshmallows
8  oz. cream cheese
1/2  pt. whipped cream (can use Cool Whip)
8  Tbsp. powdered sugar
1  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Mix some of the juice from Bing cherries with cream cheese until very soft (not runny). Add remaining ingredients. Mix by hand. Be sure to cut cherries and pineapple in halves before mixing. I always double this recipe. Put in molds, clear glass containers, etc. Cover with foil and freeze.

ICEBOX MACARONI SALAD
ingredients
7  oz. Creamettes macaroni (2 c. dry)
2  Tbsp. salad oil
2  Tbsp. vinegar
1  Tbsp. minced onion
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. seasoned pepper
1  c. Cheddar cheese, diced
1/2  c. mayonnaise
1 (17 oz.)  can peas, drained
1  c. ham, cooked and diced
1  c. celery, diced
preparation
      Cook macaroni until tender and then drain it.  Do not chill yet.  While still hot, drizzle with oil and vinegar.  Add onion, seasonings and cheese.  Toss well.  Gently mix in peas and remaining ingredients.  Chill thoroughly.  Serve on lettuce leaves if desired.

MARINATED ARTICHOKE AND PASTA SALAD
ingredients
6  oz. rotelle or other pasta
6  small tomatoes
1 (14 oz.)  can artichoke hearts, drained
1/2  lb. fresh mushrooms
1 (7 oz.)  jar green olives, drained
1/4  c. salad oil
1/4  c. red or salad vinegar
1  clove garlic, minced or pressed
1  tsp. oregano
1/4  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Cook pasta according to package directions; drain, rinse and set aside.  Cut tomatoes into quarters or eighths; place in large bowl.  Trim off any tough pieces on artichoke hearts; halve and place in bowl.  Add mushrooms and olives (halve or quarter, if needed); toss gently.
      In a shaker jar, combine remaining ingredients; shake well to mix.  Pour dressing over vegetables; toss.  Add cooked pasta to salad; toss gently, being careful not to break pasta.  Cover with plastic wrap.  Serve salad at room temperature; refrigerate leftovers.  Add shrimp, Italian sausage, pepperoni or salami to make a main dish salad.

SAUERKRAUT SALAD
ingredients
1  can sauerkraut, drained and rinsed
1  c. green bell pepper, diced
1  c. onion, diced
1  c. celery, diced
1 (2 oz.)  jar pimientos, drained
1  c. cider vinegar
2  c. sugar
preparation
      Combine first 5 ingredients in a serving bowl. Heat vinegar and sugar until dissolved. Cool to lukewarm and pour over vegetables. Mix well and refrigerate until serving time.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

SHRIMP AND PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1/3  c. diced onion
1/3  c. diced kosher dill pickle
3/4  c. sliced black olives
1 small  can shrimp
3/4  c. sliced green olives
1 small  pkg. macaroni
  some pickle juice
3  diced hard-boiled eggs
1  c. sliced celery
1/2  tsp. prepared mustard
1  c. mayonnaise
preparation
      The night before, arrange onion, dill pickle, black olives, shrimp and green olives in layers, starting with the diced onion. On the following day, cook macaroni; drain and stir in some pickle juice, tossing several times to allow flavor to blend in.  You should have about 3 cups of the macaroni.  Add remaining ingredients to the macaroni and then combine all with the first mixture, stirring lightly.  Cool several hours or overnight.

SHRIMP SALAD
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  can shrimp
1  small head lettuce, chopped
1  small onion, chopped
3  hard-cooked eggs, chopped
1/4  c. chopped green pepper
2  tomatoes, chopped
  salt and pepper to taste
  low calorie French dressing
preparation
      Drain and rinse shrimp.  Combine first 7 ingredients.  Toss to mix.  Serve with dressing.  Yields 4 servings.

CHERRY COKE SALAD
ingredients
3/4  c. water
3/4  c. sugar
1  can cherry pie filling
2  pkg. cherry jello
1 (16 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  can Coke
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Bring water and sugar to a boil; add cherry pie filling. Bring to boil again. Add jello and stir until dissolved. Remove from heat; add pineapple, lemon juice, Coke and nuts. Stir together and refrigerate.

ORIENTAL SALAD
ingredients
4 - 6  slices of bacon, fried and crumbled
1/2  c. chow mein noodles
4  Tbsp. sesame seeds
1/3  c. sliced almonds
1  head lettuce
1  small onion (purple onion adds color)
preparation
      Brown and crumble bacon, drain on paper towel.  Toast sesame seeds and almonds at 350° for 5 minutes (watch closely, almonds burn easily).  Break lettuce into bite size pieces, add onions. Top with bacon, seeds, almonds and noodles.
Dressing:
ingredients
1/2  c. salad oil
2  Tbsp. vinegar
1/4  c. white sugar
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Add dressing and toss just before serving so that the noodles stay crunchy.

CHRISTMAS TREE SALAD
ingredients
1  box lime Jello
1  can crushed pineapple
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese (softened)
1  c. Cool Whip
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Dissolve Jello in 1 cup boiling water.  Let cool.  Add Philadelphia cream cheese, pineapple and Cool Whip.  Mix with beater.  Add nuts.  For tree effect pour salad mixture in coffee cup liners.  Gel.  Dip in hot water to loosen.  Turn upside down on leaf of lettuce.  Top with Cool Whip.  Place a Maraschino cherry on top of tree for effect, or pour into small square pan.

MOLDED FRUIT SALAD
ingredients
2  eggs, beaten
1  c. sugar
1  Tbsp. flour
1 small  pkg. jello (apricot, peach or orange)
2 (11 oz.)  cans Mandarin orange sections, drained
6  medium sized bananas, sliced
1 (No. 2)  can crushed pineapple, drained (reserve juice)
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. mini marshmallows
preparation
      Drain pineapple, reserving juice.  Combine reserved pineapple juice, eggs, sugar and flour.  Cook over low heat until thick (about 5 minutes).  Add gelatin.  Stir until dissolved.  Cool before adding orange sections, bananas, pineapple and marshmallows. Chill in refrigerator for several hours before serving.

FROZEN FRUIT SALAD
ingredients
8  oz. pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/4  c. maple syrup
2  medium bananas, mashed
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
8 3/4  oz. pineapple, drained
1/2  c. finely chopped dates
1/2  c. chopped pecans
10  oz. frozen strawberries, crushed
1  c. whipping cream, whipped
preparation
      Cream the cheese.  Beat in syrup.  Add lemon juice and bananas.  Stir in pineapple, strawberries, dates and pecans.  Fold in the whipped cream. Line muffin baking pan with paper bake cups. Fill with salad.  Freeze until firm.  Store in plastic bag in freezer.  Take out of freezer 15 minutes before serving.

DREAM-UP SALAD
ingredients
2 small  boxes lemon Jello
2  c. boiling water
2  c. 7-UP
1  can crushed pineapple, drained (reserve juice)
1  c. bananas, mashed
preparation
      Dissolve Jello in boiling water, add 7-UP and rest of ingredients.  Chill until firm.
Topping:
ingredients
1/2  c. sugar
2  Tbsp. cornstarch
1  egg, beaten
1  c. pineapple juice
1  envelope prepared Dream Whip
  Chopped nuts
preparation
      Mix first four ingredients together and cook over low heat stirring constantly until mixture thickens.  Remove from heat and cool.  Mix topping with prepared Dream Whip.  Cover chilled Jello with topping.  Sprinkle nuts over topping.

DUMPY SALAD
ingredients
1  can cherry pie filling
1  can drained crushed pineapple
1 large  box Cool Whip
1  can Eagle Brand milk
1/2  c. chopped pecans (optional)
preparation
      Beat cherry pie filling with mixer or blender.  Mix together pie filling, crushed pineapple, Cool Whip, Eagle Brand milk and pecans.  Refrigerate for 2 hours or more.  Serve.

STRAWBERRY JELLO SALAD
ingredients
1  (6 oz.) strawberry jello
1 1/2  c. hot water
1 large  can crushed pineapple
1  pt. frozen strawberries and juice
1/2  c. chopped pecans
4  mashed bananas
1  carton sour cream
preparation
      Mix jello as directed.  Add all ingredients.  Pour 1/2 of the mixture into bowl and sit in freezer until solid, but not frozen. Spread layer of sour cream over jello and then pour rest of jello mixture over the sour cream.  Let sit in freezer until solid, but not frozen.  Remove and keep in refrigerator until ready to serve.

CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
4  to 6 chicken breasts
1/2  c. chopped green onions
1  c. chopped celery
1/2  c. sour cream
1/2  c. mayonnaise
  Lawry's salt to taste
preparation
      Boil chicken until cooked.  Remove chicken from bones.  Cut into small pieces.  Add green onions and celery.  In separate container, mix sour cream, mayonnaise and Lawry's salt.  When thoroughly mixed, add to chicken.  Refrigerate until served.

PINEAPPLE SALAD
ingredients
1 large  pkg. lime jello
1 (8 oz.)  can crushed pineapple
1/2  lb. grated Colby cheese
preparation
      Make jello as directed on package.  Cool to room temperature. Add pineapple and cheese.  Stir well.  Chill and serve.

FRESH FRUIT SALAD
ingredients
1  watermelon
1  cantaloupe
1  honeydew melon
2  bananas
1  c. seedless grapes
3  Tbsp. frozen orange juice concentrate
2  Tbsp. frozen lemonade concentrate
preparation
      Scoop out 3 cups watermelon balls and all the cantaloupe and honeydew balls you can get.  Combine melon balls and grapes in large mixing bowl.  Add the frozen juices and mix well.  Slice and add bananas just before serving.

TOMATO-MOZZARELLA SALAD
ingredients
3  medium tomatoes, sliced
1/2  lb. part skim Mozzarella cheese, thinly sliced
1/3  c. safflower oil
3  Tbsp. red wine vinegar
3  Tbsp. chopped parsley
3  Tbsp. finely chopped onion
1  Tbsp. finely chopped fresh basil or 1/2 tsp. dried basil
  dash of salt
  dash of pepper
preparation
      Layer tomatoes and cheese in shallow dish.  In small jar with tight fitting lid, place oil, vinegar, parsley, onion, basil, salt and pepper.  Cover and shake well.  Pour over tomatoes and cheese. Cover and refrigerate several hours, occasionally spooning dressing over tomato salad.  Makes 4 servings.

CRUNCHY CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
5 1/2  c. chopped, cooked chicken*
3  hard-cooked eggs, chopped (optional)
1  c. chopped celery
1  c. cubed sweet pickles
1  c. chopped pecans, toasted
1  c. seedless green grapes, halved
1  c. mayonnaise
1 (8 oz.)  can chopped water chestnuts, drained
1/2  c. olives, chopped (optional)
1  small onion, chopped
preparation
      Combine all ingredients; blend well.  Chill.  Serve on lettuce cups or use for sandwiches.  Yields 12 servings.
      *I buy the 2 cans of chicken at Sam's and it is the correct amount.

MINIATURE CHICKEN SALAD PUFFS
ingredients
4  c. cooked chicken, chopped
4  Tbsp. chopped green olives
4  Tbsp. chopped ripe olives
1  c. celery
1  c. toasted chopped almonds
4  Tbsp. salad pickles
4  hard-cooked eggs, chopped
1 1/2  c. mayonnaise
1  Tbsp. cooking sherry
1  recipe Puff Pastry (recipe follows)
preparation
      Combine all ingredients.  Fill pastries with salad.  Garnish with slices of green and ripe olives and fresh parsley.  Yield: 36.
Puff Pastry:
ingredients
  butter for greasing baking sheets
1  c. water
8  Tbsp. butter
1/4  tsp. salt
1  c. flour
4  eggs
preparation
      Preheat oven to 400°.  Lightly grease 2 or 3 baking sheets. Combine water, butter and salt in saucepan.  Heat to a boil, stirring to combine.  Remove from heat.  Add flour all at once. Stir vigorously with wooden spoon until mixture leaves side of pan and sticks to spoon.  Set aside and cool for 2 to 3 minutes.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
      Drop the mixture by rounded teaspoonfuls onto prepared sheets. Leave 2-inches between puffs.  Bake for 10 minutes.  Reduce heat to 350° and bake for additional 12 to 15 minutes, until golden brown and rigid to touch.  Slit the puffs in the side.  Pull out insides and discard.  Fill with chicken salad and garnish.

MOM'S WALDORF SALAD
ingredients
6  - 8 apples, cubed
1  c. walnuts, chopped
1  c. grapes
1  c. celery, diced
1/2  can sweetened condensed milk
2 - 3  c. Miracle Whip salad dressing
3  Tbsp. sugar
preparation
      Core and cube apples.  Mix apples, walnuts, grapes and celery together.  Stir in condensed milk.  Mix Miracle Whip with sugar and stir into apple mixture.  Refrigerate for 1/2 hour and serve chilled.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

CAULIFLOWER BROCCOLI SALAD
ingredients
1  head cauliflower
1  bunch broccoli
1  large red onion
1  lb. Cheddar cheese
1  lb. bacon
1  c. mayonnaise
1/2  c. sugar
1/4  c. vinegar
preparation
      Chop cauliflower, broccoli and onion.  Grate or cube cheese. Fry bacon crisp and crumble, then combine all together in large serving bowl.  Mix mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar until smooth. Stir in with other ingredients until all is well coated.  Chill for awhile before serving.  This keeps well in refrigerator in a tightly closed container.

BLACK CHERRY JELLO SALAD
ingredients
1 large  box black cherry jello
1  c. chopped pecans
1  can cherry pie filling
preparation
      Mix jello with 1 cup water.  Add pie filling and stir.  Add pecans and stir.  Chill.

FRENCH SALAD DRESSING
ingredients
2  cans tomato soup
  *1/4 to 1/2 c. vinegar
1 small  can tomato sauce
  *1 1/2 to 1 3/4 c. salad oil (soybean preferred)
  *3 to 4 Tbsp.  Sugar Twin
3  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  Tbsp. onion powder
  *1/2 to 1 tsp. garlic powder
1  tsp. paprika
4  tsp. dry mustard
1/2  c. water
preparation
      *Taste before adding full amount.
      Mix all ingredients except water in electric mixer or blender. Mix well.  If dressing is too thick, add small amount of water until desired thickness is obtained.

CHERRY SALAD
ingredients
1  can cherry pie mix
1 (20 oz.)  can chunk or crushed pineapple, drained
1  can sweetened condensed milk
1 (8 oz.)  carton Cool Whip
2  c. miniature marshmallows
preparation
      Combine ingredients in order. Place in refrigerator until ready to serve.

MID-EASTERN POTATO SALAD
ingredients
4  potatoes, peeled and cubed
1/4  c. parsley, chopped
1  medium onion, chopped
3  Tbsp. olive oil
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
      Boil potatoes until tender.  Toss all remaining ingredients with potatoes.  Let stand 15 minutes.

SEVEN LAYER SALAD
ingredients
1  head lettuce, shredded
2  cucumbers, chopped
1  c. chopped celery
1  c. chopped pepper
1 1/2  c. chopped onions
8  strips bacon, cooked, drained and crumbled
1  box frozen peas
1 1/2  c. mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. sugar
2 1/2  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
      Arrange lettuce in bottom of trifle bowl.  In order and in layers, add cucumbers, celery, peppers, onions and peas.  Do not toss; leave in layers.  Spread mayonnaise evenly over layers of peas.  Sprinkle with sugar and cheese.  Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours.  Sprinkle bacon over salad dressing before serving. Makes 10 to 12 servings.

CORN SALAD
ingredients
12  ears of fresh corn, cut off the cob
1  bunch of celery, cut into small pieces
1  small head of cabbage, cut as for slaw
2  c. sugar
1  pt. mustard
2  Tbsp. celery seed
2  Tbsp. salt
3  green peppers, cut up
3  red peppers, cut up
1  pt. cider vinegar
1  tsp. turmeric (optional, it will make it more yellow)
1  c. water (if needed)
preparation
      Put into large kettle and stir often, as it will stick easily.  Cook for 30 minutes after it starts to boil.  Put into jars and seal.
      Note:  if cider vinegar is really strong, adjust amounts of sugar, mustard, water and vinegar.

APPLE SALAD
ingredients
1/2  c. evaporated milk, chilled
3/4 small  pkg. lemon Jell-O
1  c. hot apple cider
1/4  tsp. salt
2 1/4  c. shredded apple
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in hot cider.  Add salt and shredded apples. Whip chilled milk with electric mixer at high speed until stiff. Fold into Jell-O mixture; pour into 4 to 6 individual molds or cups.  Unmold; serve at once on lettuce leaves.

POTATO SALAD
ingredients
2 1/2  c. sugar
1  c. water
3/4  c. white vinegar
1  tsp. pepper
  celery salt
4  eggs, beaten
4  Tbsp. flour
2  tsp. salt
  dill seed
2  Tbsp. mustard
1  qt. Miracle Whip
10  lb. potatoes, cooked and peeled
12  to 18 boiled eggs
preparation
      Cook the first 9 ingredients together and stir until thick. Remove from heat. Stir in the mustard. When cool, add the Miracle Whip.

CRAB SALAD
(Krabbesalat)  
ingredients
1  c. mayonnaise
  tarragon vinegar to taste
  salt to taste
  paprika to taste
1  Tbsp. tomato puree
1/2  lb. crabmeat
1  stick celery, diced
4  large tomatoes
  alfalfa sprouts
preparation
      Mix mayonnaise with vinegar, salt and paprika to taste.  Add tomato puree, then crabmeat and celery.  Neatly slice tops off tomatoes and scoop out seeds.  Fill with salad and sprinkle alfalfa sprouts on top.
      Serves four.  Good with hot French Bread.

GARDEN SALAD
ingredients
3/4  c. cider vinegar
1  c. sugar
1/2  c. oil
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Bring to boil.  Cool thoroughly.
Mix:
ingredients
1  c. celery, chopped
2  bunches green onions, chopped
1 small  jar pimentos, chopped
1  can LeSueur peas
1  can shoepeg corn
1  can French style green beans
1/2  c. regular onion, chopped (optional)
preparation
      Mix vegetables together and pour cooled dressing over mixture. Refrigerate overnight.  If you can't find LeSueur peas or shoepeg corn, use small peas and regular kernel corn.

BETSY'S PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  box spaghetti
1  head broccoli, washed and drained
1  small container cherry tomatoes, washed
4  oz. sliced black olives, drained
1/2  c. Parmesan cheese
1 small  bottle Italian dressing
preparation
      Prepare spaghetti according to package instructions.  Rinse in cool water.  Add broccoli florets, cherry tomatoes and black olives to spaghetti.  Pour Italian dressing over pasta and vegetables.  Cover and marinate in refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Toss mixture occasionally.  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese before serving.

WATERGATE SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. Jell-O pistachio pudding mix (large)
1 (20 oz.)  can crushed pineapple
1  large container Cool Whip
1/2  c. miniature marshmallows
preparation
      Mix dry pistachio pudding mix in medium-large bowl with crushed  pineapple.  Add Cool Whip and marshmallows.  Mix well and chill before serving.  Refrigerate.  Serves 8 to 10.

CHICKEN, ARTICHOKE AND RICE SALAD
ingredients
1  box chicken Rice-A-Roni
1 (6 oz.)  jar marinated artichoke hearts
1  onion, thinly sliced
1/2  c. sliced celery
1/2  chopped green pepper
1/2  c. sliced green olives
1  c. diced, cooked chicken
preparation
      Cook rice according to directions, omitting butter, and allow to cool.  Drain artichokes, saving juice for dressing.  Cut artichokes in halves or slice and add to rice with remaining ingredients.
Dressing:
ingredients
1/2  c. mayonnaise
  marinade from artichokes
3/4  tsp. curry powder
preparation
      Blend dressing ingredients.  Toss with rice mixture and chill.

TURKEY CHIP SALAD
ingredients
2  c. diced, cooked turkey or chicken
1  c. chopped celery
2/3  c. mayonnaise or salad dressing
2  Tbsp. chopped canned pimento
2  tsp. prepared mustard
1/2  tsp. ground ginger
1/4  tsp. salt
  dash of pepper
1/2  c. coconut chips, toasted
preparation
      Combine first 8 ingredients.  Chill until serving time.  Stir in coconut chips.  Pile on salad greens and garnish with additional chips.  Makes 6 servings.

TOMATO AND FETA SALAD
ingredients
3  pt. cherry tomatoes, halved
12  oz. Feta cheese, cut into 1/4-inch dices
1/4  c. extra virgin olive oil
3  Tbsp. white wine or champagne vinegar
2  Tbsp. minced fresh basil
2  Tbsp. minced fresh parsley
1/4  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. freshly ground pepper
  pita bread, cut in wedges
preparation
      In serving bowl, gently toss together all ingredients. Warm pita bread, cut into wedges. Serve immediately or chill, covered, until ready to serve. Makes 8 servings.
      Presentation: Put tomatoes and Feta in bowl. Place in center of plate. Place pita wedges around bowl.

CONGEALED SALAD
ingredients
1 small  box lime jello
1  c. water (boiling)
1 (8 oz.)  can pineapple tidbits or crushed
2  c. cottage cheese
1/2  c. salad dressing
1  c. juice from drained pineapple and/or water
preparation
      Drain pineapple (save juice to use later with water).  Heat water to boiling; add jello and when dissolved, add 1 cup juice and/or water.  Let set to a jelly like consistency.  Add cottage cheese, salad dressing and pineapple.  Stir well.  Place in mold and set in refrigerator until ready to eat.

PICKLED BEET SALAD
ingredients
3  c. canned beets in juice
1/4  c. vinegar
2  Tbsp. sugar
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/8  tsp. ground cloves
  dash of pepper
preparation
      Drain beets.  Place in a medium bowl.  Reserve juice in a saucepan.  Add vinegar and remaining ingredients to beet juice. Bring juice mixture to a boil.  Immediately remove from heat. Pour juice mixture over beets.  Cover and chill.  Drain beets before serving.  Serve Vidalia sliced onion.  Yield: 6 servings.

PRETZEL SALAD
ingredients
2 2/3  c. crushed pretzels
3/4  c. butter
1  c. sugar
6  oz. pkg. strawberry jello
1  pt. frozen strawberries
3  Tbsp. sugar
1  pt. Cool Whip
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
2  c. boiling water
preparation
      Cream butter and 3 tablespoons sugar.  Blend in pretzels. Press in a 9 x 13-inch pan and bake at 350° for 10 minutes.  Cool. Cream together cream cheese and 1 cup sugar.  Fold into Cool Whip. Pour into cooled crust.  Dissolve jello in boiling water and add undrained strawberries.  When jello mixture is partially set, pour it over the cream mixture in shell.  Chill.  Serves 12.

MEXICAN CHICKEN PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. Suddenly Salad Italian pasta
1/4  c. dairy sour cream
1/8  tsp. ground red pepper
1 (6 3/4 oz.)  can chunk chicken, drained or about 1 c. cut-up, cooked chicken
  tortilla chips
1  medium tomato, seeded and chopped
1/2  c. shredded Cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese
  guacamole (for garnish)
  sliced ripe olives (for garnish)
preparation
      Prepare salad as directed on package except omit oil from dressing and mix in sour cream and red pepper.  Stir in chicken. Line serving plate with tortilla chips.  Mound salad onto chips; top with tomato and cheese.  Garnish with guacamole and sliced ripe olives, if desired.  Serves 4.

CAULIFLOWER - LIMA BEAN SALAD
ingredients
1  large cauliflower
2  Tbsp. Fruit Fresh
  water (8 ice cubes)
1 (10 oz.)  box frozen baby lima beans
1  envelope original Hidden Valley Ranch salad dressing mix (do not add milk)
1  c. mayonnaise
1  (2 oz.) diced pimento (optional)
preparation
      Break cauliflower in small flowerets.  Add to Fruit Fresh, ice cubes and enough water to cover for about 2 hours.  Drain. Cook lima beans.  Drain.  Mix mayonnaise and dressing mix.  Blend with vegetables.  Refrigerate.  Better if made at least 12 hours before serving.

DUCK POND SALAD
ingredients
3  large chicken breasts
1  pkg. chicken flavored Rice-A-Roni
2 small  jars Cara Mia artichoke hearts (6 oz. jars), drained (save juice)
1 or 2  bunches green onions, sliced
3/4  c. diced celery
1/2  c. diced green bell pepper
1  Tbsp. curry powder
1/2  c. mayonnaise or Miracle Whip
preparation
      Mix thoroughly the curry, mayonnaise and juice from artichokes. Bake chicken until tender and then cut up into bite size pieces. Cook rice according to the package directions; let cool. Cut artichoke hearts into pieces. Mix ingredients together and refrigerate overnight for maximum flavor.

MOLDED CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
1 (No. 2)  can crushed pineapple, drained (save juice)
1 1/2  c. boiling liquid
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lemon jello
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
3/4  c. Miracle Whip
1 1/2  Tbsp. sugar*
4 to 5  c. cooked chicken breast meat, cut up
3/4  c. grated carrots
3/4  c. chopped celery
1  c. whipped cream or 1 pkg.  Dream Whip, prepared
preparation
      *If you use Dream Whip, reduce sugar to 1 1/2 teaspoons.
      Drain crushed pineapple.  Add enough water to juice to make 1 1/2 cups.  Heat to boiling.  Stir in jello.  Refrigerate.  When jelled, whip.  Blend in cream cheese, Miracle Whip and sugar.  Fold in chicken, carrots, celery and drained pineapple with whipped cream or Dream Whip.  Put in 9 x 13-inch pan.  Refrigerate.

TRUE-BLUE POTATO SALAD
ingredients
2 1/2  lb. small red potatoes, cooked and cubed
3/4  c. chopped green onions
3/4  c. chopped celery
3/4  c. fat-free sour cream
1/4  c. reduced-fat mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. minced fresh parsley
1  Tbsp. white wine vinegar or cider vinegar
1 1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/4  tsp. celery seed
1/2  c. (2 oz.) crumbled Blue cheese
preparation
      In a large bowl, toss the potatoes, onions and celery. In a small bowl, combine the sour cream, mayonnaise, parsley, vinegar, salt, pepper and celery seed. Pour over potato mixture; toss to coat. Sprinkle with Blue cheese. Cover and refrigerate for several hours before serving. Yield: 8 servings.

PEA SALAD
ingredients
1  medium head lettuce
1  c. chopped celery
1  c. thin sliced green pepper
1  c. onion, chopped
1  can green peas, drained
1 1/2  c. salad dressing
1  Tbsp. sugar
1  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
      Place in dish in order.  Refrigerate for 24 hours.  Sprinkle with bacon bits.

FRESH CORN SALAD
ingredients
8 to 10  ears fresh white corn
4  c. water
1/2 to 1  tsp. sugar
1/3  c. finely chopped purple onion
1  large green pepper, seeded and chopped
1  large red pepper, seeded and chopped
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. Monterey Jack cheese, cut into small cubes
2  Tbsp. olive oil
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. ground cumin
1/4  tsp. ground black pepper
1/8  tsp. ground red pepper
preparation
      Cut off corn kernels; set aside.  Combine water and sugar in a large saucepan; bring to a boil.  Add corn and return to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 to 12 minutes.  Drain and rinse with cold water.  Drain on paper towels, patting dry.  Combine corn, onion and remaining ingredients; let stand 30 minutes or cover and refrigerate 8 hours.  Yields 12 servings.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

BEEF `N' CHEESE WRAPS
ingredients
4  flour tortillas (10-inch)
1 (8 oz.)  carton onion and chive cream cheese spread
1  c. shredded carrots
1  c. (4 oz.) shredded Monterey Jack cheese
1  lb. thinly sliced cooked roast beef
  leaf lettuce
preparation
      Spread one side of each tortilla with cream cheese.  Top with carrots and Monterey Jack cheese.  Layer with beef and lettuce. Roll up tightly and wrap in plastic wrap.  Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.  Cut into 1-inch slices.

BEEF BRISKET
ingredients
3  lb. to 5 lb.  Brisket
1/2  c. brown sugar
  garlic salt
1  pkg. onion soup mix
2/3  c. ketchup
preparation
	Preheat oven to 325°.  Place Brisket in heavy foil pan. Mix other ingredients and pour over top.  Seal foil.  Bake 3 hours. Enjoy!

PEGGY'S BEEF SPREAD
ingredients
8  oz. cream cheese
1/4  c. sour cream
1  tsp. horseradish
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1/2  c. chipped beef (buy 2 1/2 oz. jar), remove rind and chip into pieces
preparation
      Mix cream cheese, sour cream, horseradish, Parmesan cheese and chipped beef all together.  Spread on Wheat Thins or Ritz crackers.

CORNED BEEF HOT SANDWICHES
ingredients
1  can corned beef
1/4  c relish
2  eggs, hard-boiled
  dash of black pepper
1/2  can cream of chicken or mushroom soup
preparation
      Mix all ingredients very well.  Spread on sandwich buns. Wrap buns in aluminum foil.  Put in oven at 325° until warm.

BARBECUED BEEF SANDWICHES
ingredients
1  1/2 lbs. ground beef
3/4  c. chopped onion
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato sauce
1/2  c. finely chopped green pepper
1/4  cup ketchup
1 1/2  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. brown sugar
2  Tbsp. barbecue sauce
2  Tbsp. vinegar
1  Tbsp. prepared mustard
1  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Brown meat in large skillet; drain. Add onion and green pepper. Cook 5 minutes. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and simmer for 1 hour. Serve on buns.

CHIPPED BEEF IN GRAVY (WHITE SAUCE)
ingredients
2  Tbsp. butter or margarine
2  Tbsp. flour
1  c. milk
1/4  tsp. salt
1/4 to 1/2  lb. chipped beef, quartered
preparation
      To make a medium white sauce, combine butter, flour, milk and salt in double boiler.  Stir with slotted spoon until flour, butter, milk and salt are stirred in and melted.  (Double recipe for more gravy.)  After white sauce has thickened, add chipped beef.  Pour over toast, corn bread or potatoes.  It's your choice.

BEEF STEW
ingredients
2  lb. beef stew meat
2  Tbsp. shortening
1  c. tomatoes
1  bay leaf
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. pepper
6  potatoes, peeled and halved
4  carrots
1  large onion
1  c. water (or tomatoes)
  flour, optional
preparation
      Cube stew meat in 1 1/2 inch cubes; flour and brown. Add tomatoes, bay leaf, salt and pepper. Simmer gently for 30 minutes; add potatoes, carrots, onions, and another c. of tomatoes or water; cover and cook slowly until vegetables are tender. If desired, gravy may be thickened with a little flour.

GROUND BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
1  Tbsp. vegetable oil
8  oz. lean ground beef
2 1/4  c. very hot tap water
1  c. milk
1/2  c. frozen or fresh chopped green pepper
1/2  envelope (from 2.5 oz. box) onion soup mix
1/4  tsp. salt
  black pepper to taste
6  oz. capellini or angel hair (extra thin spaghetti), broken in thirds
2  c. frozen green peas and sliced carrots or fresh
preparation
      Heat oil in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over high heat. Add beef, stirring to break up pieces; cook 3 minutes or until no longer pink. Add 2 cups hot water, milk, green pepper, soup mix, salt and pepper; stir to mix. Scatter pasta over top; cover and bring to a boil. Boil 2 minutes, stirring 3 to 4 times with a fork to separate strands of pasta. Stir in peas and carrots; cover, reduce heat and simmer 4 minutes or until vegetables and pasta are tender. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup hot water. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

BEEF WITH WHEAT
ingredients
1- 1 1/2  lb. boneless chuck
1/2-3/4  c. cracked wheat #2, washed, drained
1  can beef broth
  Salt, pepper, cumin
preparation
      Wash meat, pat dry.  Cover with water and bring to a boil. Cook 10 mins., discard water.  Add fresh water and boil meat until tender.  Shred meat, put back in water, add beef broth if needed for flavor.  Wash wheat, add to beef  with spices. Stir until wheat is cooked.  1-2 tbsp. of margarine or butter gives extra flavor.
      This can be made with chicken instead of beef.  (I always use a small onion or clove of garlic to initial water then discard).

QUICK BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
2 1/2  c. wide noodles
1  lb. lean ground beef
  garlic to your taste
  pepper to your taste
1  c. shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided
1  can tomato soup
1/2  can peas and carrots
1/2  can corn
1/3  can water
1/2  c. French fried onions (regular or cheese)
preparation
	Cook the noodles in boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water to prevent noodles from sticking together. Brown the ground beef. Season meat with garlic and pepper. Add 1/2 cup of the cheese. Add the tomato soup, peas, carrots, corn and water.
	Place the beef mixture in a casserole dish and fold in the noodles. Sprinkle the noodle mixture with the remaining cheese and the French fried onions on top. Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes or until bubbling.

BEEF STEW
ingredients
2  lb. beef stew meat
1  large onion, chopped
1 large  can tomatoes
2  cans tomato sauce
4  medium potatoes, diced
1 small  can whole kernel corn
1  pkg. frozen mixed veg.
2  fresh carrots, sliced thin and round
  Salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      In a large pot cook stew meat, onions, salt and pepper until beef is very tender (about two hours). Add all other ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.

ITALIAN BEEF SANDWICHES
ingredients
5 or 6  lb. beef roast
1 1/2  c. water
1  Tbsp. salt
3  large onions, sliced
1  tsp. garlic powder
1  tsp. oregano
1/2  tsp. basil
1  tsp. Italian seasoning
3  hot peppers, chopped
2  tsp. Accent
preparation
      Combine beef roast, water, salt and onions in a large roasting pan. Cover and cook at 325° for 2 hours until done. Remove roast and cool (save the juice). Slice, then layer in a covered  dish. Add all spices to the juice you saved from the roast. Bring to a boil and pour over meat. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Serve on French bread.

ROAST BEEF WITH PENNE PASTA
ingredients
1  lb. deli roast beef, thinly sliced
1 (12 oz.)  pkg. penne pasta
2  Tbsp. olive oil
1 small  clove garlic, minced
1  each yellow, green and red pepper (Cored, seeded and thinly sliced)
1  small red onion, chopped
1  c. black olives, halved or whole
1  tsp. red pepper, (optional)
1/2  c. citrus salad dressing or dressing to taste
preparation
      Cook pasta according to package directions.  Cut roast beef into strips.  Sauté garlic, peppers and onions in olive oil until tender.  Combine roast beef strips with all ingredients and toss. Serve warm or cold.

MARINADE FOR BEEF STRIPS
ingredients
1/4  c. orange juice
2  Tbsp. molasses
3  Tbsp. soy sauce
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
preparation
      Marinate meat for 1/2 hour.  Cook on grill.  Very good.

BEEF-NOODLE SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1/2  c. chopped onion
2 large  cans stewed tomatoes
2  cans (10 1/2 oz.) beef broth (undiluted)
1 large  can mixed vegetables, drained
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. black pepper
1/2  tsp. sugar
1/4  tsp. celery seed
1  c. medium egg noodles (uncooked)
1  tsp. dried oregano (optional)
preparation
      In a Dutch oven, brown beef and onion; drain. Add tomatoes, beef broth, mixed veggies, salt, black pepper, sugar, celery seed and oregano, if using. Let mixture come to a boil; add noodles. Reduce heat and cover. Let cook on medium-low for 15 minutes, until egg noodles are tender.

ITALIAN BEEF
ingredients
4  lb. rump roast
2  cans beef broth (low sodium)
1  pkg. Good Seasons Italian dressing
2  tsp. oregano
1  tsp. basil
  sliced onions (optional)
preparation
      Cook all ingredients except onions on top of stove for 3 to 4 hours in covered pan.  During last 1/2 hour, remove meat; slice thinly with electric knife.  Return sliced meat to broth.  Add sliced onion and cook another 1/2 hour or until onions are soft. Serve as roast or make sandwiches when served on kaiser rolls.

GROUND BEEF AND OKRA
ingredients
1  lb. ground meat
  TexJoy Steak seasoning
1/2  onion, chopped
1  can Rotel tomatoes with green chilies
1 or 2  cans tomato sauce
16  oz. frozen okra (or more)
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Season ground meat and place in a cast iron pot; add onions and brown; drain off excess grease. Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, and frozen okra. Add enough water to cover okra and simmer over medium heat until okra is tender. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve over rice with a slice of cornbread. Lip smackin' good!
      Tip: If you do not like for your ground meat to be in large clumps, try putting in on to brown with a small amount of water. Stir as the water cooks out. The meat will resemble a fine crumble. An excellent method for making chili etc.

BEEF WITH SOUR CREAM
ingredients
1  lb. lean round steak
1/4  c. flour, seasoned with salt, pepper and garlic powder
  flour
2  Tbsp. vegetable oil
3/4  c. chopped onion
1  c. beef broth
1/2  tsp. thyme
1 (4 oz.)  can sliced mushrooms with liquid
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen peas
1/2  c. sour cream
3 to 4  c. hot cooked rice
preparation
      Remove bone and fat from steak.  Cut meat into thin, narrow strips.  Dredge in flour; using large skillet, quickly brown meat on all sides in hot oil.  Add onions, broth, thyme, mushrooms and liquid from mushrooms.  Cover and cook 5 to 7 minutes.  Stir in sour cream.  Heat through; do not boil.  Serve over hot rice.

COKE ROAST BEEF
ingredients
2 to 3  lb. beef roast
1  can Coca-Cola
1  can cream of mushroom soup, or other flavor
preparation
      Preheat oven to 400°.  Place roast in bean pot (or covered roasting pan); cover with Coke and soup.  Bake, covered, for 2 1/2 to 3 hours until internal temperature reaches 170°.
      Note: Pork, turkey or chicken may be substituted for beef. Carrots, celery and potatoes may be added.

EASY CHIPPED BEEF
ingredients
8  oz. cream cheese
1  Tbsp. mayonnaise
1  Tbsp. Accent
1  Tbsp. sour cream
1  tsp. chives (dried)
1  Tbsp. onion flakes (dried)
1  pkg. chopped beef
preparation
      Soften cream cheese.  Slice beef into very small pieces.  Mix thoroughly all ingredients.  Cool until stiff.  Form into a ball.

FABULOUS BEEF FAJITAS
ingredients
1/2  c. prepared Italian salad dressing, divided
1/2  tsp. chili powder
1  lb. boneless sirloin steak, cut into 1/4 inch strips
1  medium sweet pepper, sliced
1  medium green pepper, sliced
1  medium onion, sliced and separated into rings
  flour tortilla
preparation
	In a large resealable plastic bag, combine 1/4 cup salad dressing and chili powder; add steak.  Seal and turn to coat; refrigerate for 30 minutes.  In a skillet, sauté peppers and onion in remaining salad dressing until crisp and tender.  Remove and keep warm.	Drain steak, discarding marinade in skillet, sauté steak for 6-10 minutes or until no longer pink.  Return vegetables to pan.  Heat through and spoon meat and vegetables down center of tortillas; fold in sides.  Yield:  4-6 servings.

BEEF ENCHILADAS
ingredients
1  lb. ground meat
1  small onion, chopped
2  Tbsp. chili powder
1  tsp. ground comino (same as ground cumin)
1  can Wolfe Brand chili
1  pkg. corn or flour tortillas
1  pkg. grated cheese
  salt to taste
preparation
      Brown ground meat with chopped onions, chili powder, ground comino and salt.  Drain.  On the side, pour about 1/2 can Wolfe's chili into a bowl or Pyrex pie dish; add small amount of water (make it a little runny); stir and warm in a microwave.  Dip flour or corn tortillas into warm chili; add a couple of spoons of meat, onions and cheese, then roll it up and place into an oblong pan. When all are rolled up, pour any remaining chili on top; add cheese and onions.  Cook at 400° to 425° until cheese melts.

BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
1  lb. sirloin steak, cut into thin strips
1  med. onion, sliced
2  c. sliced fresh mushrooms
1/4  c. oleo or butter
1  tbsp. flour
1  c. water
1  tbsp. beef flavor boullion or 3 cubes
1/2  c. sour cream
preparation
      In large skillet, over medium heat, cook and stir steak, mushrooms, onions in oleo until steak is browned and vegetables are tender.  Reduce heat, add flour. Cook and stir 1 minute.  Add water and boullion.  Cook and stir until thick and bubbly.  Stir in sour cream.  Heat through. DO NOT BOIL.  Serve with hot noodles.

BARBECUED BEEF
ingredients
3 or 4  lb. beef roast
1/2  c. brown sugar
1  Tbsp. chili powder
1/2  tsp. horseradish
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/2  c. catsup
1/3  c. vinegar
3  Tbsp. mustard
1  onion, chopped
  salt to taste
preparation
	Boil roast beef until it falls apart. Sauté onions. Combine all ingredients. If too dry, add beef broth. Serve on buns with coleslaw.

BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
1  lb. boneless sirloin
1  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1  c. thinly sliced onions
1  garlic clove, minced
2  c. thinly sliced mushrooms
1/4  c. flour
1/4  c. chopped parsley
1/4  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  c. beef broth
2  Tbsp. tomato paste
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
2/3  c. nonfat yogurt
preparation
      Trim fat from the beef; slice beef into thin strips, about 2-inches long. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet. Add beef and cook over high heat until meat is lightly browned; add onions, garlic and mushrooms. Cook over medium heat until onions are soft. Remove from heat. Stir in flour, parsley, salt and pepper. Gradually add beef broth and tomato paste. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil and thickens. Remove from heat.
       In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of yogurt, then stir in remaining yogurt. Stir yogurt into meat mixture; simmer over low heat 3 to 4 minutes. If mixture is too thick, add additional broth. Makes  6 servings.
Tips:
preparation
      Adding cornstarch to the yogurt helps stabilize it to prevent curdling.
      Serve over hot cooked noodles accompanied by asparagus, combination salad and crusty bread.

SPAGHETTI AND BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. box spaghetti, cooked and drained
1  lb. ground beef, cooked and drained
1  lb. jar Ragu or Prego spaghetti sauce
1  c. cheddar cheese, grated
1  c. mozzarella cheese, grated
preparation
      Mix spaghetti, beef and sauce together.  Pour into a 9 x 13 inch pyrex dish. Top with cheddar and mozzarella cheese.  Bake at 350° until cheese melts.

BEEF STROGANOFF I
ingredients
1  lb. round steak, cut into thin strips
1/2  c. chopped onions
2  Tbsp. butter or margarine
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1/4  c. water
1/2  c. sour cream
1/2  tsp. paprika
2  c. cooked noodles
preparation
	Brown steak and onions in butter or margarine.	Stir in soup, water, sour cream and paprika.  Cover.  Cook over low heat for 45 minutes or until meat is tender.  Stir often.  Serve over noodles. Can freeze.  Serves 4.

ANDREA'S BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
2  lb. ground beef
1  onion
1  green pepper
16  oz. (2 small cans) tomato sauce
16  oz. (1 can) tomatoes, stewed
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
8  oz. macaroni
1  c. sour cream
8  oz. (1 pkg.) cream cheese
1 1/4  c. Cheddar cheese, shredded
preparation
      In a skillet, brown ground beef until crumbly.  Sauté onion and pepper then add to ground beef.  Add tomato sauce and tomatoes to ground beef mixture.  Season with garlic salt and simmer.  Pour hamburger mixture into a buttered 9x13-inch casserole dish.
      Cook macaroni according to package directions and drain.  Add sour cream and cream cheese to macaroni while still hot.  Spread macaroni mixture on top of hamburger mixture.  Sprinkle with cheese.
      Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes.

BEEF TACO BAKE
ingredients
1  lb. ground meat
1  can Campbell's tomato soup
1  c. Pace thick and chunky salsa
1/2  c. milk
6  flour tortillas or 8 corn tortillas (6 to 8-inch), cut into 1-inch pieces
1  c. Cheddar cheese or a little more
preparation
	In skillet over medium to high heat, cook beef until brown, stirring to separate meat. Drain well to get rid of fat. Once this is done, add soup, salsa, milk, tortillas and half the cheese. Spoon into 2-quart shallow baking dish and cover. Bake at 400° for 30 minutes or until hot. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and serve.
	If you want it cheesier, add a whole cup instead of 1/2 cup in the beginning.

BEEF AND BARLEY SOUP
ingredients
5  slices bacon
1  lb. beef chuck roast or steak, cut into 1-inch pieces
2  large onions, chopped (about 2 c.)
2  cloves garlic, finely chopped
2 (10 1/2 oz.)  cans condensed beef broth
2  c. water
1/4  c. regular barley
1 1/2  tsp. paprika
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. caraway seed
1/8  tsp. dried marjoram leaves
3  medium potatoes, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
2  medium carrots, sliced (about 1 c.)
2  medium stalks celery, sliced
1 (16 oz.)  can stewed tomatoes
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen green peas, broken apart
1 (4 oz.)  can mushroom stems and pieces
preparation
      Fry bacon in Dutch oven over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon and drain on paper towel. Cook and stir beef pieces, onions and garlic in bacon fat in Dutch oven until beef is brown. Stir in broth, water, barley, paprika, salt, caraway seed and marjoram. Heat to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer 1 1/2 hours.
      Stir in potatoes, carrots, celery, tomatoes, frozen peas and mushrooms (with liquid). Heat to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer until vegetables are tender, 30 to 40 minutes. Crumble bacon; sprinkle over soup.

BEEF BARBECUE SANDWICHES
ingredients
3  lb. chuck roast
1  c. catsup
2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  c. water
2  Tbsp. vinegar
1  tsp. sugar
1  tsp. onion salt
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Cook the chuck roast until tender; shred into small pieces. Combine the remaining ingredients. Boil for 10 minutes, stirring constantly. Add beef and simmer for 1/2 hour in covered pan. Serve on buns.

BEEF TIPS IN MUSHROOM SAUCE
ingredients
2  lb. lean chuck steak, cut in 1-inch pieces
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1  pkg. onion soup mix
1  can diet Sprite or diet 7-Up
preparation
	Put meat in crock-pot.	Pour soup and onion soup mix over meat. Add Sprite or 7-Up.  Cover and cook all day on low or for at least 4 hours on high or until meat is tender. Turn off and let sit for 30 minutes before serving. Serve over hot noodles or rice.

BEEF GOULASH
ingredients
8  oz. noodles, cooked and drained
3  Tbsp. oil
1  lb. cubed beef
2  c. thinly sliced onion
1  Tbsp. flour
1  Tbsp. paprika
1 (16 oz.)  can tomato puree
1/2  c. water
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. sugar
1  bay leaf
2  Tbsp. butter (to toss with noodles)
preparation
      Heat oil in deep saucepan.  Add beef cubes and onions. Sprinkle with flour and cook until lightly browned.  Stir in paprika and cook 3 minutes.  Add tomato puree, water, salt, sugar, pepper, bay leaf and pepper.  Cover and simmer 1 hour or until meat is tender.  Serve over buttered noodles.

ROAST BEEF IN CROCK-POT
ingredients
2  lb. thinly sliced deli roast beef
1  pkg. Lipton onion soup mix
1  can cream of mushroom soup
preparation
      Combine in crock-pot and cook 1 1/2 hours on high or 3 hours on low. Serve on buns if desired.

VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. stew meat, cut in small pieces
7  c. water
2  Tbsp. dried parsley
  Salt to taste
2 (16 oz.)  cans tomatoes and 2 8-oz. cans tomato sauce
1  can Rotel
1  onion, chopped
  1-1 1/2 c. fresh carrots, chopped
1  can LeSueur peas
1 1/2  c. frozen corn
3/4  c. barley
1  can butter beans
preparation
      Flour stew meat and brown in oil.  In large pot on stove, put water, parsley, salt, and stew meat, cover and simmer one hour.
      Add tomatoes, sauce, Rotel, onion and carrots, cover and simmer for another hour.   Add peas, corn, barley, and butter beans or whatever vegetable you prefer.  Cover and simmer 1 hr. (I usually add another can of tomatoes and another can of tomato sauce if I think I need it.)

BEEF FAJITAS
ingredients
3  lb. tri-tip or bottom sirloin beef
1/3  c. margarine
2  medium sized onions, cut into 1/4-inch slices
2  medium sized green peppers, cut into 1/4-inch slices
1  Tbsp. seasoning salt
8  medium tomatoes, cut into wedges
  lemon wedges to garnish
preparation
      Place meat in shallow pan.  Pour marinade over and refrigerate 3 hours.  Remove meat from marinade and cut into 1/2 x 3-inch strips.  Melt margarine in 1 large skillet.  Add onions, peppers and seasoning salt; sauté until tender.  Place meat into large cast-iron skillet and sear over medium heat until browned.  Add vegetables.  Place tomatoes over both meat and vegetables.  Garnish with lemon wedges.  Serves 6.
      For Chicken Fajitas, use 3 pounds of chicken breasts.  Marinate and cut as before.
Marinade for Chicken or Beef Fajitas:
ingredients
2 1/2  c. soy sauce
1 1/4  c. water
1 1/4  c. white vinegar
1  tsp. minced garlic
1  tsp. white pepper
preparation
      Combine in large pot and make sure it's well blended.
      On the side, serve hot corn or flour tortillas, refried beans, guacamole and hot pepper relish.

BEEF STEW
ingredients
  beef roast or beef cubes
2  packets beef stew seasoning
10  lb. potatoes
1  onion, chopped
2  cans corn
2  cans peas
2  cans green beans
1  lb. bag carrots, sliced
preparation
      Brown meat; cut up into cubes. Cut up potatoes, onions and carrots. Mix with meat in soup pot; add water to cover. Cook approximately 25 minutes, then add vegetables and beef stew seasoning.

BEEF ROULADEN
ingredients
3  slices bacon, cut in half
1 1/2  lb. thinly sliced round steak (1/4-inch thick)
2  Tbsp. mustard
1/4  c. finely chopped onions
3  medium dill pickles, cut in quarters lengthwise
6  medium carrots (about 1 lb.), cut in quarters lengthwise (optional)
preparation
      Salt and pepper steak.  Spread with mustard, sliced bacon, onion and dill pickle.  Roll up and fasten with nails or toothpicks.  Then brown in skillet.  Put in roaster and cover with hot water.  Bake at 350° for 2 1/2 to 3 hours.  Thicken gravy with cornstarch.

ALL-DAY-LONG CROCKPOT BEEF
ingredients
1  1/2 lbs beef roast (any type of beef roast)
1/2  tsp black pepper
2  garlic cloves, minced
1/2  pkg onion soup mix
2  tsp worcestershire sauce
1  tsp steak sauce
3  carrots, sliced
2  celery stalks, diced
1  green pepper, chopped
1  yellow onion
1/2  cup water
1/2  cup tomato juice
preparation
      Cut beef roast into serving sized portions.  Use more beef if you need more that 6 servings.  Brown beef in a bit of vegetable oil, although you can skip this step if you're rushed for time. Slice onion and separate into rings.  Dice the peeled carrots, dice the celery and slice the peppers into thin strips or circles. Place these into bottom of the Crockpot.  Sprinkle the beef pieces with fresh ground black pepper, minced garlic and the onion soup mix.  Place on top of the vegetables.  Mix the steak sauce and worcestershire sauce in a small bowl with about 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup tomato juice.  Pour this over the meat.  Turn the crockpot to high for 30 minutes, or if you're in a hurry, skip this step. Turn to low cover and let cook for 7 - 9 hours.  Keep the crockpot covered as much as possible through out cooking time.  When ready to serve, dip meat and vegetables out with a slotted spoon, use the liquid in the crockpot as is or turn the crockpot to high and thicken liquid with a little flour or cornstarch.

CHIPPED BEEF DIP
ingredients
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
4  Tbsp. milk
5  oz. dried beef, grated
4  Tbsp. grated onions
1  Tbsp. garlic salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  pt. sour cream
4  Tbsp. melted butter
  chopped pecans
preparation
      Mix ingredients thoroughly in baking dish.  Drizzle butter on top and sprinkle with pecans.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.  Serve with chips or crackers.

BEEF STEW DELUXE
ingredients
3  lb. beef stew meat (cut into cubes)
1  c. port wine
1  tsp. salt
1  can onion soup, undiluted
1  can mushroom soup, undiluted
1- 8  oz. can sliced mushrooms, drained
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      IT IS NOT NECESSARY TO BROWN MEAT. Mix all ingredients in a covered casserole dish and bake at 300° for 3 hours. Serve over fluffy rice, noodles or whipped potatoes. Thicken gravy if necessary. Raise temperature of over to 400°.  Remove cover from pan and add 1 can of refrigerated canned biscuits to top of stew. Bake until biscuits are browned. Bake extra biscuits to serve stew over biscuit.

CHEESY BEEF TACO DIP
ingredients
2  lb. ground beef
1  large onion, finely chopped
1  medium green pepper, chopped
1  lb. cubed Velveeta cheese
1  lb. cubed pepper Jack cheese
1  (16 oz.) taco sauce
1 (10 oz.)  can diced tomatoes and chilies, drained
1 (4 oz.)  can mushroom stems
1 (2 oz.)  can sliced ripe olives, drained
  tortilla chips
preparation
	In a large skillet, cook beef, onion and green pepper over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. Stir in the cheeses, taco sauce, tomatoes, mushrooms and olives. Cook and stir over low heat until cheese is melted. Serve warm with tortilla chips.

MARINADE FOR BEEF
ingredients
1/2  c. Wesson oil
1/2  c. red wine or wine vinegar
2  Tbsp. A.1. steak sauce
1/2  tsp. onion powder
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1/2  tsp. thyme
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  tsp. sugar
  London Broil or sirloin tip roast
preparation
      For marinade combine first 9 ingredients.  Pour over beef; cover and refrigerate for several hours or overnight.  Cook beef on a grill, using the marinade as a basting sauce.

MARINATED BEEF SLICES
ingredients
1  lb. lean beef sirloin, sliced very thin
1/2  c. lemon juice
1  c. thinly sliced mushrooms
1/2  c. chopped green onions
2  Tbsp. oil
1/2  c. thinly sliced bell pepper
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Marinate beef in lemon juice for 10 minutes. While meat is marinating, heat oil in large skillet; add fresh mushrooms, onions and green pepper. Cook until tender. Remove vegetables from skillet and keep warm. Drain meat, reserving lemon juice marinade. Place meat slices in skillet and brown. Return vegetables to skillet. Add reserved lemon juice and pepper. Heat through. Serve over rice. Makes 4 servings.

HOT BEEF SPREAD
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
2  Tbsp. milk
1 (2 1/2 oz.)  jar dried beef, snipped into small pieces
2  Tbsp. instant minced onion
1/8  tsp. pepper
1/2  c. sour cream
  Chopped walnuts
preparation
      Mix cream cheese and milk until creamy.  Add dried beef, onion, pepper and sour cream.  Put in an 8 inch pie pan. Sprinkle with nuts.  Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.  Serve warm with crackers.

BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  can beef consomme soup
1  can French onion soup
1  c. uncooked rice
1  lb. ground beef
preparation
      Brown beef; drain well. Add all other ingredients to meat and mix well. Pour into casserole dish and bake at 350° for about 45 minutes.

ROAST BEEF
ingredients
3  lb. beef roast
1/2  cup vinegar
1/2  cup lemon juice
1/4  cup soy sauce
2  tsp. each garlic and ginger paste
1  cup yogurt
  Salt to taste
preparation
      Wash meat and dry thoroughly using paper towels.  Pierce the meat and make a few gashes with a knife.  Marinate with all the ingredients and refrigerate for 3 hours.
      Place the meat in a pressure cooker or a pot with a tight-fitting lid and add 2 cups of water.  Cook over medium-low heat until meat is tender and the water has dried up.
      Cut into slices and serve with ketchup and fries.
