Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

GROUND BEEF 'N TATER CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
14  oz. can cut green beans
10  oz. can tomato soup
1/2  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. black pepper
2  cups prepared mashed potatoes
1  can (2.8 oz.) French Fried Onions
1/2  C. (2oz) shredded cheddar cheese
preparation
      Brown beef in skillet, drain. Combine beef, green beans, soup, salt & pepper. Pour into 1 1/2 qt. casserole.  Combine mashed potatoes and 1/2 can onions.  Spoon potato mixture in a mounded ring around top of outer edge of casserole. Bake, uncovered at 350 degrees for 25 min. Top potatoes with cheese and remaining onions and bake 5 minutes longer.

BEEF CHIMICHANGA
ingredients
1  doz. large flour tortillas
1  lb. ground beef, cooked and drained
1  lb. grated yellow and Jack cheese, mixed
1 small  can chopped green chilies
1 medium size  can refried beans
preparation
      Add small amount of each ingredient in the middle of a flour tortilla and roll into a 2-inch diameter size (makes a burrito). Deep-fry each burrito in light oil until brown and crisp.  Drain on paper towels.  Top each serving with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, chopped green onions (optional) and more grated cheese. Garnish with pitted ripe olives (sliced), avocados (optional) and sour cream.
      Prepare for many compliments!  Also, if you like it spicy, add more green chilies to topping.

CHICKEN OR BEEF MARINADE
ingredients
3  c. orange juice
1/2  c. green onion, chopped
2  Tbsp. dried oregano
2  Tbsp. coarse black pepper
1  Tbsp. minced garlic
1  Tbsp. meat tenderizer
1  Tbsp. salt
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together and put in a large ziploc bag with 2 1/2 pounds of meat. Whole tri-tip or whole skinless chicken breasts work best). Marinate for a minimum of 1-2 days.
      Note: Meat is perfect for beach barbecues. Makes great fajitas, too. Freeze the marinated meat and take it along camping!

CORNED BEEF RED FLANNEL HASH
ingredients
1  lb. cooked corned beef
2  medium white potatoes, boiled, peeled, and diced
1  medium onion, diced
1 (15 oz.)  can sliced beets
1  fresh jalapeno pepper, diced (optional, but if you like a little spice, the potatoes mellow it)
preparation
      Boil potatoes until tender, peel and dice.  Dice the meat. Dice the onion.  Carefully take the seeds out of the jalapeno pepper, if you are using it (I like hot food, the spice makes my saliva glands work and since they don't most of the time, I use a lot of hot spices) and chop it fine.
      Put some oil in a pan that can hold the volume of the preceding ingredients.  Add the onions and the jalapenos if you are using them.  Sauté for a bit, until the onions begin to brown (add a little garlic at this point, if you like garlic).
      Add the rest of the ingredients, including the juice from the can of beets (this takes up the place of the cream that would make this non-kosher).

GOLDEN BEEF QUICHE
ingredients
1  (9-inch) pie crust
1  medium onion, minced
6  eggs
1/2  c. milk
1/4  tsp. thyme leaves
3/4  lb. ground beef
1 (11 oz.)  can condensed Cheddar cheese soup
1/2  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°. Spread crust with butter. Cook beef and onion until meat is browned. Spoon into pie crust. Whisk undiluted soup, eggs, milk, salt, pepper and thyme. Pour mixture into pie crust. Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.

DRIED BEEF DIP
ingredients
1  (8 oz) pkg cream cheese
1  Tbsp chopped onion (fine)
1  Tbsp mayonnaise
1  (4 oz) pkg dried beef, finely chopped
2  tsp mustard
  dash hot sauce
preparation
      Mix all ingredients well, let chill 4 hours.  Serve with vegetables, crackers or chips.

GROUND BEEF AND CABBAGE CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  large onion, chopped
  salt and pepper to taste
4  c. chopped cabbage
4  Tbsp. rice
1  can tomato soup
1  can water
preparation
      Cook ground beef and onion until browned. Drain and add rest of ingredients. Pour into baking dish and bake at 325 degrees for 35-40 minutes.

BEEF BOURGUIGNON
ingredients
2 1/2  lb. boneless beef chuck, cut in 1 1/2-inch cubes
  butter or margarine
3  Tbsp. brandy
1/2  lb. small white onions, peeled (about 12)
1/2  lb. small fresh mushrooms
2 1/2  Tbsp. potato flour
2 1/2  tsp. meat extract paste
2  Tbsp. tomato paste
1 1/2  c. Burgundy
3/4  c. dry sherry
3/4  c. Ruby Port
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  bay leaf
1 (10 oz.)  can condensed beef broth (undiluted)
preparation
      Slowly heat 4-quart Dutch oven with tight fitting lid.  Add 2 tablespoons butter.  Heat, do not burn.  In hot butter over high heat, brown beef cubes well, using a fourth at a time or just enough to cover bottom of Dutch oven.  Lift out beef as it browns. Continue until beef is browned.  Add butter as needed.  Return beef to Dutch oven.  In small saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons brandy just until vapor rises.  Ignite; pour over beef.  As flame dies, remove beef.  Add 2 tablespoons butter to Dutch oven.  Heat slightly.  Add onions.  Cook over low heat, covered, until onions brown slightly. Add mushrooms.  Cook, stirring, 3 minutes.  Remove from heat.  Stir in flour, meat extract paste and tomato paste until well blended. Stir in Burgundy, sherry, Port and broth.  Preheat oven to 350°. Bring wine mixture just to boiling, stirring.  Remove from heat. Add beef, pepper and bay leaf.  Mix well.  Bake, covered, stirring occasionally, 1 1/2 hours or until beef is tender.  Add remaining brandy, little by little.  Serves 6.

BEEF AND BACON ROLL-UPS
ingredients
1  lb - bacon halved lengthwise
2  lb - smoked cocktail sausage
1  lb - light brown sugar
preparation
      Wrap a slice of bacon around each sausage and secure with a toothpick.  Layer the wrapped franks and brown sugar half at a time in a slow cooker.  Cook on low for 3 to 4 hours stirring occasionally.

COMPANY BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
2  Tbsp. shortening
1  medium onion, chopped
2  c. canned tomatoes
1  Tbsp. steak sauce
1  Tbsp. catsup
  salt and pepper to taste
1/4  c. green pepper, chopped
2  Tbsp. parsley, chopped
6  oz. spaghetti
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1  c. Cheddar cheese, grated
preparation
      In a heavy skillet, brown beef in shortening.  Add onions, tomatoes, steak sauce, catsup, green pepper and parsley.  Simmer for 30 minutes.  Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Combine spaghetti and beef mixture in large greased baking dish. Salt and pepper to taste.  Mix in the cream of mushroom soup. Sprinkle cheese over top.  Bake in a 350° oven for 30 minutes, until bubbly and browned.  Serves 8.

HOT BEEF DIP
ingredients
1/2  cup chopped onion
1  Tbsp margarine
2  Tbsp dry white wine
  1-8 oz package of cream cheese, softened
1/2  cup sour cream
1/2  cup mayonnaise
1- 2 1/2 oz  jar dried beef, finely chopped
1/2  cup chopped pecans
preparation
      Sauté onion in margarine until tender.  Add wine; simmer a couple minutes.  Add remaining ingredients except pecans.  Spoon mixture into a 8 inch square baking dish and sprinkle with pecans. Bake at 350°.  Serve hot with your favorite crackers.

ANN'S BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
8  oz. (1 pkg.) macaroni
1  lb. ground beef
1  small onion, chopped
1  bell pepper, chopped
2 to 3  tsp. parsley flakes
1  Tbsp. Heinz 57 sauce
8  oz. (1 can) tomato sauce
1  tsp. salt (approx.)
1/2  tsp. pepper (approx.)
1  Tbsp. sugar (approx.)
10  oz. (1 can) soup, cream of mushroom
1  c. Cheddar cheese, shredded
preparation
      Cook macaroni according to package directions.  Drain and set aside.
      In a skillet, cook beef, onion and green pepper until beef is browned.  Drain off fat.  Stir in parsley flakes, Heinz 57 sauce, tomato sauce, salt, pepper and sugar.
      Place macaroni in a lightly greased 9x13-inch dish.  Add meat mixture and toss together. Spoon mushroom soup over meat and macaroni.  Sprinkle cheese over top.
      Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes, until heated through and cheese is melted.
      Makes 6 to 8 servings.

MALAYSIAN BEEF
ingredients
2  lb. beef sirloin
1  tsp. chili powder
3  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/2  lemon rind, grated
1  tsp. sugar
1 1/2  tsp. salt
1  tsp. powdered ginger
2  Tbsp. plum jam
  butter
1  tsp. garlic powder or 2 cloves garlic, crushed
preparation
      Cut meat into 1/2-inch strips.  Mix together ginger, chili powder, garlic and lemon rind.  Dip meat into mixture and brown in butter.  Combine sugar, jam, lemon juice, salt and 1 1/2 cups water.  Add meat and simmer 30 minutes.  Serve with rice.

TORTILLA BEEF BAKE
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. ground beef
1  onion, chopped
1  bell pepper, chopped
1  can cream of chicken soup, undiluted
1 (16 oz.)  jar of salsa or 1 (14.5 oz.) can of Rotel tomatoes
1  can whole kernel corn, drained
1 1/2  c. shredded cheese
2 1/2  c. crushed tortilla chips
preparation
      Cook meat and drain. Add onion and bell pepper. Cook for five minutes; add soup, salsa (or Rotel tomatoes), and corn. In a 2 qt. oiled baking dish, layer meat mixture, cheese, and chips until all is used. Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes. If desired, you may top with cheese or chips and bake for a few minutes longer.

CHOPPED BEEF SPREAD
ingredients
4  oz. died beef
8  oz. cream cheese
1/2  c. sour cream
1/4  c. chopped green onion
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
preparation
      Mix together and serve with bagels, crackers, etc.

QUICK HOMEMADE BEEF STEW
ingredients
1  lb. beef stew meat, cubed
1  Tbsp. oil
1 (14.5 oz.)  can stewed tomatoes
1  can sliced potatoes (optional)
1 (14.5 oz.)  can mixed vegetables
1 (12 oz.)  jar beef gravy
preparation
      Brown beef stew meat in oil until tender.  Add rest of vegetables and gravy and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Very good with warm rolls.

ITALIAN BEEF
ingredients
3 to 5  lb. beef roast
2 to 3  c. water
2 to 3  pkg. beef bouillon
1/2  c. chopped green pepper
  garlic powder to taste
1  tsp. marjoram
1  tsp. thyme
1  tsp. oregano
2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
  hot pepper sauce to taste
preparation
      Roast meat uncovered at 350° until internal reading is 150°, about 2 to 2 1/2 hours.  Cool and slice.  Add water and bouillon to pan drippings; stir in seasonings and green peppers.  Simmer 15 minutes (do not allow to boil).  Put sliced beef into marinade and refrigerate overnight.  Reheat to serve.  Can be frozen.

CORNED BEEF AND CABBAGE CASSEROLE
ingredients
5  medium potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced
1  small onion, chopped
4  c. shredded cabbage
1  can cream of celery soup
1 1/2  c. milk
1 (12 oz.)  can corned beef
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Lightly grease a 9 x 13 pan.  Layer potatoes.  Cover with chopped onion and shredded cabbage.  Crumble corned beef over this.  Mix cream of celery soup with milk.  Pour over the layers. Bake at 350° for approximately 1/2 hour.

NANA'S HOT GROUND BEEF DIP
ingredients
2  lb. ground beef
1  large onion, chopped
2  lb. Velveeta cheese, chopped
8  oz. (1 jar) Cheez Whiz
10  oz. (1 can) soup, cream of chicken
10  oz. (1 can) soup, cream of mushroom
8  oz. (1 jar) taco sauce, mild or hot
8  oz. (1 jar) salsa, mild or hot
preparation
      Brown ground beef with onion in a skillet, stirring until ground beef is crumbly.  Drain and set aside.
      In a sauce pan combine Velveeta cheese, Cheez Whiz and soups. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.  Stir in ground beef mixture.  Spoon into a slow cooker.  Stir in taco sauce and salsa. Cook until heated through, stirring occasionally.  May add milk if mixture is too thick.
      Serve with corn chips or tortilla chips.

ZUCCHINI AND BEEF ITALIANO
ingredients
4  c. sliced zucchini
1  lb. ground beef
1  c. chopped onion
1   clove garlic, crushed
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. basil
1/2  tsp. oregano
1/4  tsp. pepper
2  c. cooked rice
1  c. tomato sauce
1  c. cottage cheese
2  eggs, beaten
1  c. grated cheddar cheese
preparation
      Cook zucchini in boiling salted water 2 or 3 minutes. Drain well. Cook ground beef, onion, garlic and seasonings in skillet until onions are transparent. Stir in cooked rice and tomato sauce. Blend cottage cheese and eggs. Put half of zucchini slices in buttered, shallow two quart casserole; spoon on ground beef mixture. Spread cottage cheese over beef. Top with remaining zucchini. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese.
       Bake 350°F. 25-30 minutes (or until hot and bubbly).

GINGER BEEF STIR-FRY
ingredients
8  oz. beef top round steak
1/2  c. beef broth
3  Tbsp. reduced-sodium soy sauce
2 1/2  tsp. cornstarch
1  tsp. sugar
1/2  tsp. grated fresh ginger
  nonstick spray coating
12  oz. asparagus spears, trimmed and cut in 1-inch long pieces (2 c.)
1 1/2  c. sliced fresh mushrooms
1  c. small broccoli flowerets
4  green onions, bias sliced into 1-inch lengths (1/2 c.)
1  Tbsp. cooking oil
2  c. hot cooked rice
preparation
      Trim fat from beef. Partially freeze beef; thinly slice across the grain into bite size strips. Set aside.
      For the sauce, in a small bowl, stir together the broth, soy sauce, cornstarch, sugar and ginger; set aside. Spray a cold wok or large skillet with nonstick coating. Preheat over medium-high heat. Add asparagus, mushrooms, broccoli and green onions. Stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Remove from wok or skillet.
      Carefully add the oil to wok or skillet. Add beef and stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes or until slightly pink in center. Push the beef from center of wok or skillet. Stir sauce; add to wok or skillet. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly.
      Return vegetables to wok or skillet. Stir in all ingredients together to coat with sauce; heat through. Serve immediately with hot cooked rice. Makes 4 servings.
      Cal-325, CHO-57, Pro-16, Fat-3.

BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
1  onion, chopped
1  stalk celery, chopped
1/4  c. oleo
1  lb. ground beef
2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/4  c. catsup
2  tbsp. flour
1  can mushroom pieces
1  can cream of chicken soup
1  c. sour cream
preparation
      Sauté onion and celery in butter, stir in ground beef, flour, salt and pepper. Sauté for 5 minutes. Add soup, mushrooms and catsup. Simmer for 20-30 minutes. Stir in sour cream when ready to serve. Serve over noodles. I like to use rice too.

CREAMY HOT BEEF DIP
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1  c. (8 oz.) sour cream
3  oz. dried beef, rinsed and finely chopped
2  Tbsp. chopped green pepper
1 1/2  Tbsp. minced onion
1  tsp. dried green pepper flakes (optional)
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
  pepper to taste
  raw vegetables or crackers
preparation
      Combine first 8 ingredients in a 1-quart baking dish. Bake at 375°, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve with raw vegetables or crackers. Yield: About 2 cups.

VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP
ingredients
1  can corned beef
6  medium potatoes
2  stalks celery
1  onion
8  mini carrots, cut in half lengthwise
1  can green beans
1  can corn
1/2  bag frozen or canned peas
  V-8 juice or tomato juice (large can)
preparation
      Cook potatoes, celery and onion for 10 minutes in water; add drained corn, green beans, peas and corned beef.  Cook 10 minutes. Drain off excess water.  Add juice to cover vegetables.  Heat just enough to get juice hot.

BEEF LOG
(Or Summer Sausage)  
ingredients
5  lb. hamburger (not lean)
2 1/2  tsp. whole mustard seed
2 1/2  tsp. coarse pepper
2 1/2  tsp. Liquid Smoke
5  tsp. (rounded) Morton Tender Quick salt (do not substitute)
2 1/2  tsp. garlic salt
preparation
      Mix  all  ingredients  in  bowl.  Cover and refrigerate overnight.  Remove  once  a  day for 3 days.  Knead well for 5 minutes.  On 4th day divide into 6 or 7 rolls.  Lay on broiler pan with drip pan under it.  Bake 9 hours at 160°.  Turn over rolls in  4 1/2 hours.  At 9th hour, remove and wrap in paper towel to remove grease.  Roll in handy wrap, freeze or refrigerate.  Will keep in refrigerator 3 weeks.
      Note:  You  can use 1 pound of sausage for hamburger if lean.

GROUND BEEF & MACARONI MEDLEY
ingredients
1  lb ground beef
1  tbsp butter or margarine
1  small onion, minced
1  can (1 lb 12 oz.) tomatoes with liquid
1/2  cup uncooked macaroni
1  pkg (10 oz.) frozen mixed vegetables (Optional)
1  tsp salt
1/2  tsp dried oregano leaves
1/2  tsp dried basil leaves
1/4  tsp pepper
preparation
      Crumble beef into a large skillet with butter, over high heat stir until meat is no longer pink, add onion, turn heat to low, add tomatoes with liquid and macaroni.  Stir to blend, heat to simmering.  Add mixed vegetables, cover and cook until vegetables are done and macaroni is tender, about 20 minutes.  Sprinkle with salt, oregano, basil and pepper.  Serve with parmesan cheese to spoon over individual servings.  Good served with a tossed salad and hot bread.
      For 8 servings: Double ingredients but use liquid from only 1 1/2 cans of tomatoes.

CRUNCHY BEEF BAKE CASSEROLE
ingredients
1 (7 oz.)  pkg. macaroni (2 c. uncooked)
1  lb. ground beef
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can cream of mushroom soup
3/4  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
1 (14 1/2 oz.)  can whole tomatoes, cut up
1/4  c. chopped green pepper
3/4  tsp. seasoned salt
1 (3 oz.)  can French fried onions
preparation
      Prepare macaroni as directed on package; drain.  Brown ground beef; drain.  Combine all ingredients except onions.  Pour half the mixture into a 2-quart casserole.  Add 1/2 can onions.  Pour remaining mixture over onions.  Cover; bake at 350° for 30 minutes.  Top with remaining onions and bake, uncovered, for 5 minutes longer.

EASY CHEESY BEEF ENCHILADAS
(20 Minutes To Make)  
ingredients
1  lb. lean ground beef
1  pkg. taco seasoning
1  c. water
  flour tortillas
  canned salsa con queso (we like the Taco Bell brand)
  shredded Colby or Cheddar cheese
preparation
      Brown the beef in a large skillet. Drain the meat. Mix in the taco seasoning. Add the water and simmer over low heat. Place 3 to 4 tablespoons of meat in each flour tortilla. Roll and place seam down in a glass pan. Continue until all meat is gone and pan is full. Then top with salsa con queso and cheese. Microwave 6 to 8 minutes. Serve with hot sauce, chips, beans and fresh tomatoes, if they like 'em. Serves 6 to 8.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
1  Tbsp. flour
1/2  tsp. salt
1  lb. beef sirloin, cut in 1/4-inch strips
2  Tbsp. butter
1  can (3-oz.) sliced mushrooms, drained
1/2  c. chopped onion
1  clove garlic, minced
2  Tbsp. butter
3  Tbsp. flour
1  Tbsp. tomato paste
1 1/4  c. cold beef stock or 1 can (10 1/2-oz.) condensed beef broth
1  c. sour cream
2  Tbsp. dry white wine
  Hot buttered noodles
preparation
      Combine the 1 tablespoon flour and the salt; coat meat.  Melt 2 tablespoons butter in skillet; add meat and brown quickly on both sides.  Add mushrooms, onion, and garlic; cook till crisp-tender, 3 or 4 minutes.  Remove meat and mushrooms from pan. Add 2 tablespoons butter to pan drippings.  Blend in the 3 tablespoons flour.  Add tomato paste; stir in beef stock.  Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.  Return browned meat and mushrooms to skillet.  Stir in sour cream and wine; cook slowly until hot; do not boil.  Serve over noodles. Serves 4 or 5.

SPANISH RICE (BEEF AND RICE CASSEROLE)
ingredients
1  lb. 90% lean ground beef
1  can stewed tomatoes (undrained)
1  can cut green beans (undrained)
1  c. rice
1/2  tsp. dry mustard
1/8 to 1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1  Tbsp. minced onion
1  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  Tbsp. sugar
1/2  tsp. fresh ground pepper
1  red pepper, chopped (I added this part)
preparation
      In at least a 2 1/2-quart microproof dish with cover, crumble beef and cook on High for 3 minutes.  Stir and cook for 3 more minutes.  Drain if you wish.  Make sure the cooked meat is crumbled well.  Add remaining ingredients and cut up the tomatoes and stir. Microwave on High for 10 minutes.  Stir and cook on 20% for 10 minutes.  Stir and cook on 70% for 5 to 6 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is soft.  Let stand for a few minutes before eating or you might burn the roof of your mouth.

DRIED BEEF DIP
ingredients
1 small  jar dried beef
8  oz. cream cheese
1  c. sour cream
1/4  c. milk
1/4  tsp. black pepper
1/4  c. chopped onions
2  Tbsp. chopped green pepper
preparation
      Soften cream cheese. Add milk and mix. Add sour cream and mix. Add remaining ingredients and mix. Cook for appropriate time. Bake in oven at 350° for 15 minutes.
      Microwave:  Cook at High power for 3 minutes.  Stir.  Cook on High power again for 3 minutes.  Continue cooking until it becomes slightly thick.

BEEF STEW
(Tomato Gravy)  
ingredients
1 - 1 1/2  lb. stew beef
5  medium to large potatoes
  Carrots
1/3  medium onion
15  oz. tomato sauce
preparation
      Brown meat in oil, in pan you are going to cook stew in. Drain grease and add tomato sauce (plus 1 & 1/2 cans water), carrots, onion, & potatoes that have been cut into cubes. Salt & pepper. Cook with lid at medium temp. until tender.

BARBECUE SHREDDED BEEF
ingredients
3  lb. chuck roast
  water
  salt to taste
2  Tbsp. shortening
1  c. chopped onions
2  tsp. paprika
1  tsp. pepper
1  tsp. dry mustard
  dash of cayenne pepper
3  Tbsp. sugar
3  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  clove garlic, minced
1 (6 oz.)  can tomato paste
  hamburger buns
preparation
      Cook meat until very tender in water to which salt has been added.  While meat is cooking, make sauce.  Melt shortening and add onions; cook until tender, but not browned.  Add remaining ingredients and cook over low heat for 20 minutes.  Add shredded meat and liquid to the sauce and mix well.  Cover and cook very slowly for 30 minutes.  If mixture becomes too thick, add a little water.  Serve on hamburger buns.

DRIED BEEF CHEESE BALL
ingredients
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  c. small curd cottage cheese, drain
2  Tbsp. ripe olives, chopped and dry a little
2  tsp. grated onion
2  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
  dash of hot sauce
3  oz. dried beef, snip with scissors into small pieces
preparation
      Soften cream cheese to room temperature. Combine cream cheese with cottage cheese. Add olives, onions and the sauces; mix well. Add 1/3 of snipped beef. Shape into a large ball. Wrap in foil and refrigerate.
      To serve, roll ball in rest of the beef. Center in serving plate and surround with crisp crackers, celery, tiny tomatoes and stuffed olives. Serves 8.

BAKED BEEF STEW
ingredients
1  can diced tomatoes, undrained
1  c. water
3  Tbsp. quick-cooking tapioca
2  tsp. sugar
1 1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
2  lb. lean beef stew meat
4  medium carrots, cut into 1 inch cubes
3  medium potatoes, peeled and quartered
2  celery ribs, cut into 3/4 inch chunks
1  medium onion, quartered
preparation
      Combine the tomatoes, water, tapioca, sugar, salt and pepper in large bowl.  Add remaining ingredients; mix well.  Pour into greased 13 X 9 inch baking dish.  Cover and bake at 375 degrees for 1 3/4 to 2 hours.

BEEF TACO-MAC
ingredients
1  lb. beef cubed steaks
1  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1  medium onion, chopped
1/4  tsp. salt
1 1/4  oz. pkg. taco seasoning mix
2 (14 1/2 to 16 oz.)  cans diced tomatoes (undrained)
1 1/2  c. uncooked rotini (spiral) pasta
1/2  c. water
1/2  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
      Cut beef steaks lengthwise into 1-inch wide strips and then crosswise into 1-inch pieces. In Dutch oven, heat oil over medium-high heat until hot. Add beef and onion. Cook and stir 3 minutes. Season with salt. Stir seasoning mix, tomatoes, pasta and water into beef. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover tightly and simmer 20 minutes or until pasta is tender. Sprinkle cheese before serving.

BEEF PIE
ingredients
6  serving recipe for instant mashed potatoes
1  egg
1  lb. ground beef
1  c. chopped celery
1/2  c. water
1 (6 oz.)  can tomato paste
1  Tbsp. sugar
1  tsp. salt
  Crisp Topping
preparation
      Prepare mashed potatoes, except reduce water to 1 cup. Stir in egg; spread on bottom and sides of a well-greased 9-inch pie pan. Bake in 400° oven 15 minutes. Brown beef and celery (some like a little onion, too) in large skillet. Pour off liquid. Stir in water, tomato paste, sugar and salt. Bring to boil. Spoon into potato crust. Sprinkle with topping. Continue baking at 400° for 10 to 15 minutes, until top is brown.
Crisp Topping:
ingredients
1  Tbsp. melted butter
1/4  c. instant potato flakes
2  Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Combine butter with potato flakes and cheese.

SAVORY ITALIAN BEEF
ingredients
1  (3 to 4 lb.) beef roast
2 (1 oz.)  pkg. Italian dressing mix
1 (12 oz.)  can beer or beef broth
1  pkg. dried onion soup mix
1  Tbsp. cornstarch (optional)
2  Tbsp. water (optional)
preparation
      Brown roast in hot skillet.  Place roast in crock-pot. Sprinkle dressing and soup mixes over meat.  Pour beer or broth over meat.  Cover and cook on low 8 to 10 hours.  Remove meat from cooker and shred.  If thicker gravy is desired, stir cornstarch into water until all lumps are gone.  Return shredded meat to pot. Cover and cook on high another 15 to 30 minutes.
      Note: Sometimes I marinate the roast overnight in Italian dressing as well. Serve on sandwich buns with mild or hot pepperoncini.

BEEF STEW
ingredients
2  lb. stew beef
3  medium potatoes
3  onions
1  qt. can Campbell's tomato juice
1  Tbsp. sugar
  desired amount of carrots
preparation
      Cook beef until tender.  Add carrots after beef is tender, along with the rest of the ingredients.  Simmer until all added ingredients are done.  Salt and pepper to taste.

BEEF DIP
ingredients
1 large  pkg. dried pressed beef (finely chopped)
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
2  Tbsp. milk
1/2  c. sour cream
1/4  c. chopped green pepper
2  Tbsp. onion flakes
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/4  tsp. garlic salt
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  Turn into 1 qt. casserole dish.
      Bake at 350° for about 20 minutes.  Serve warm with bread, crackers, chips.
Topping:
ingredients
1/2  c. chopped pecans
2  Tbsp. butter or margarine
preparation
      Mix together and either microwave for 1 minute or saut. Spoon over dip.

BEEF CHEESE BALL
ingredients
1  bunch green onion tops, chopped
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1  pkg. dried chipped beef, cut in small pieces
1  tsp. Accent
3/4  tsp. horseradish (optional)
preparation
      Leave out enough beef to roll cheese ball in.  Mix all ingredients together. Form into ball and roll in remaining dried beef. Serve on your favorite crackers.

BAKED BEEF STEW
ingredients
1 (14 oz.)  can diced tomatoes
1  c. water
3  Tbsp. quick cooking tapioca
2  tsp. sugar
1 1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
2  lb. beef stew meat (1-inch pieces)
4  medium carrots (1-inch chunks)
3  medium potatoes (1-inch chunks)
2  celery ribs (3/4-inch chunks)
1  medium onion
1  slice bread, cubed
preparation
      In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, water, tapioca, sugar, salt and pepper. Add remaining ingredients; mix well. Pour in greased 13 x 9 baking dish. Cover and bake at 375° for 1 3/4 to 2 hours or until tender.

BARLEY, BEEF AND KALE SOUP
(Serves 8)  
ingredients
1  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1  onion, chopped
1  lb. lean boneless beef, cut in 1/2-inch cubes
4  c. low-sodium beef broth
1/2  c. medium grain barley
1  tsp. dried thyme
1/2  tsp. salt (optional)
1/2  lb. sliced mushrooms
1  c. fresh kale, chopped or 10 oz. pkg. frozen kale
preparation
      Heat oil in Dutch oven or large heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and meat; cook until well browned. Add broth, barley, thyme and salt. Bring to boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer about 1 hour or until barley and meat are almost tender. Add mushrooms and kale or other greens. Cover and cook 5 to 10 minutes more until kale is cooked and meat and barley are tender.
      Note: A like amount of chard, spinach, collards or other greens may be substituted for the kale.

MEXICAN BEEF STIR FRY
ingredients
1  lb. beef flank steak
2  tbsp. vegetable oil
1  tsp. ground cumin
1  tsp. dried oregano leaves
1  clove garlic, crushed
1  red or green bell pepper, cut in thin strips
1  medium onion, cut in thin wedges
2  jalapeno peppers, thinly sliced
3  c. lettuce, thinly sliced
preparation
      Cut beef steak into 1/8 inch thick strips.
      Combine oil, cumin, oregano and garlic; reserve half.
       Heat half the seasoned oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add bell pepper, onion and jalapeno pepper, stir-fry 2 to 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Remove and reserve.
      In same skillet, stir-fry beef strips (1/2 at a time) in remaining oil 1 to 2 minutes. Return vegetables to skillet and heat through. Serve beef mixture over lettuce.

CORNED BEEF CHEESE BALL
ingredients
2  (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
3  pkg. corned beef (found in deli section of grocery store), chopped fine
1  small onion, minced
  dash of garlic salt
  crushed walnuts
preparation
      Mix thoroughly all together (except nuts) and shape into a ball. Roll in crushed walnuts. Chill about 4 hours or overnight. Serve with snack crackers.

GROUND BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. Ground Beef
1  sm. Onion, chopped
1  (8 oz.) pkg Cream Cheese
  Salt
  Pepper
1  can cream of mushroom Soup
1/2  c. Milk
1/4  c. Ketchup
1  can Biscuits (optional)
preparation
      Brown ground beef and onions.  Drain.  Add mushroom soup, cream cheese, milk, ketchup, salt and pepper.  Stir often until cream cheese is melted.  Pour in baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes at 350 degrees.  If using biscuits on top, bake until brown.

DRIED BEEF LOG
ingredients
  1-8 oz package of cream cheese
1/4  cup grated Parmesan cheese
1  Tbsp prepared horseradish
1/3  cup chopped stuffed green olives
2  - 1/2 oz dried beef, finely snipped
preparation
      Blend cream cheese, parmesan and horseradish, stir in olives and dried beef. Wrap and chill several hours. Roll in snipped beef if desired.

BEEF CREAM CHEESE SPREAD
ingredients
1  jar chipped beef, wash and drain out salt
1 small  can of black olives, chopped
3 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, room temperature
1  Tbsp. onion powder
1 small  can of mushrooms, chopped
preparation
	Chop the chipped beef and mix with all the ingredients. Chill and serve with assorted crackers.

VEGETABLE AND DRIED BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
2  c. diced potatoes
1  c. celery
1/4  c. onion, sliced
1  c. corn or peas
1  c. carrots, shredded
  dried beef gravy
  Cheddar cheese for topping
preparation
      Partially cook celery, onion, peas or corn and carrots. Drain.  Put part of each vegetable in casserole, then pour some of your homemade dried beef gravy (or frozen creamed chipped beef, thawed) over it and continue with layers.  Sprinkle Cheddar cheese on top.  Bake for 1/2 hour at 325°.  Serves 4 to 6.

GROUND BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
2  cans tomato sauce
1  tsp. garlic juice
  5-6 oz. pkg. noodles, cooked
  Sour cream
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
3  green onions, chopped
  Grated cheddar cheese
preparation
      Brown ground beef and drain.  Add tomato sauce and garlic juice.  Simmer for about 25 minutes.  Cook a 5 or 6 oz. package of noodles as directed.  Make a white sauce of sour cream,  cream cheese and chopped green onions (can use white onions).  Put layers of noodles, ground beef, and sauce into a casserole dish. Sprinkle with grated cheddar cheese.  Bake for 25 minutes at 350°.
      This makes a huge casserole.  I usually divide this into two casserole dishes and freeze one.

CROCK-POT BEEF AND VEGGIES
ingredients
1 1/2 to 2  lb. extra lean ground beef
1  green bell pepper, chopped
1  medium onion, chopped
3  ribs celery, chopped
2  carrots, shredded
3  cloves garlic, chopped
1  can black beans (16 oz.), drained and rinsed
1  can corn (16 oz.), drained
1  can diced tomatoes (16 oz.; undrained)
1/4  c. chopped green pimiento stuffed olives
1/2  tsp. cinnamon
1/2  tsp. salt
2  to 3 dashes hot pepper sauce
  pepper to taste
preparation
      Brown the ground beef. Transfer to crock-pot. Add remaining ingredients. Mix to combine. Cover and cook on low 7 to 9 hours (or high for 3 1/2 to 4 1/2 hours). Serve with brown rice. Serves 4 to 6.
      Cal-459, CHO-33, Pro-36, Fat-21.

STIR-FRY BEEF WITH BROCCOLI
ingredients
14  oz. flank steak
4  tsp. soy sauce
2  garlic cloves, finely chopped
1/4  c. beef broth
1  head broccoli, separated into stalks and flowerets
2  carrots, pared and cut into thin strips and sliced thinly
1  large onion, cut into eighths
preparation
      Cut steak into thin strips; combine with soy sauce, garlic and 2 tablespoons of broth.  Marinate while preparing the vegetables.  Cut and wash broccoli flowerets. I don't use the large stalk part of the broccoli but if you do use them, you need to peel them and cut crosswise into 1/4-inch slices.  Wash, peel and cut carrots into strips or slice thinly crosswise.  Cut onion.
      Heat  a little oil in a skillet or wok over medium heat.  Add beef with soy mixture; stir-fry 3 to 5 minutes until beef is almost cooked through.  Remove with slotted spoon to platter, leaving any liquid in the pan.  Add broccoli, carrot and onion. Add remaining broth. Cover; cook about 5 minutes.  Add beef; stir-fry 2 to 3 minutes or until cooked through. Serve. Serves 4.

ROAST (PORK OR BEEF)
ingredients
1  beef or pork roast
1  onion, chopped fine
1/4  tsp. cayenne pepper
  Tony's
1/2 to 1  tsp. minced garlic (depends on size of roast)
1  to 2 potatoes, quartered (if wanted)
preparation
	Add your seasoned roast to pot and brown. It will make water so don't add any now. Once the water cooks out and the roast browns real good on both sides, add onions and smother down (don't worry, they will brown too). Add small amounts of water (about 1 cup) at a time until tender. Cook on medium to low heat until done. Add potatoes when you see the roast is tender and cook until they are done.
	 If you are cooking a pork roast, don't use onions, but fry down the same way. You can also stuff your roast (pork) with garlic. Just make a hole with a knife and push the garlic in.

LITTLE BEEF ROLLS
ingredients
1  round steak (about 1/2-inch thick)
  bacon (several strips)
1  can mushroom soup
preparation
      Trim round steak of all fat. Cut into strips, about 1 1/2 x 3-inches. Salt and pepper meat. Place a sliver of garlic and a very small piece of bacon on meat. Roll up and secure with a toothpick. Roll in flour and brown in melted shortening. After all rolls are browned, drain off all fat from pan. Push meat aside and pour in mushroom soup. Add 1 can of water. Cover and cook over low heat until tender, about 1 hour, scraping bottom of skillet to keep from sticking. Add water when necessary. Very good served with mashed potatoes.

ZESTY BEEF ENCHILADAS
(With Variations)  
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  jar (17 1/2 oz.) Pace Enchilada Sauce, divided
2  c. (8 oz.) shredded cheddar cheese or 4 cheese Mexican blend, divided
10  to 12 corn or flour tortillas (6 inches)
preparation
      In a skillet, cook beef until no longer pink; drain.  Stir in 1/2 c. sauce and 1 c. cheese.  Warm tortillas according to package directions.  Spread 1/2 c. sauce in a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish. Spoon about 2 tablespoons meat mixture down the center of each tortilla.  Roll up and place seam-side down in baking dish.  Top with remaining sauce and cheese.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until cheese melts.  Yield: 10-12 enchiladas.
Variations:
preparation
      Beefy Corn and Chile Enchiladas:  Use 1/2 lb. ground beef. After browning ground beef, add 1 cup whole kernel corn and 1/2 c. drained, canned green chilies.  Prepare as above.
      Cheesy Chili Enchiladas:  Omit ground beef and increase cheese to 3 cups.  Mix 2 c. of the cheese and 1 can (4 oz.) drained, chopped green chilies for filling.  Prepare as above.
      Seafood Enchiladas:  Omit ground beef.  Use 2 c. chopped cooked shrimp.  Prepare as above. Garnish with fresh cilantro.
      Beefy Skillet Enchiladas:  Use 8 corn tortillas (6 inches) and cut into 1 inch squares.  After browning ground beef, add enchilada sauce, tortillas and 1 c. cheese. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook over low heat 5 minutes or until hot.  Top with remaining cheese.

HUNGRY JACK BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  tsp. salt
1 (16 oz.)  can pork and beans
3/4  c. barbecue sauce
2  Tbsp. brown sugar
1  Tbsp. onion, minced
1  can Hungry Jack biscuits (10 count)
1  c. Cheddar cheese
preparation
	Preheat oven to 375°. Brown beef. Stir in next 5 ingredients and heat until bubbly. Pour in 2-quart casserole. Cut biscuits in half to form 20 half circles. Place cut side down around edge of casserole. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 25 to 30 minutes.

BEEF BURGUNDY
ingredients
4 to 4 1/2  lb. beef (rump roast)
1  can beef broth
1  c. red wine
1  can cream of mushroom or celery soup
preparation
      Brown beef and onion. Add beef broth. Bake, covered, 1 1/2 hours at 350°. Add wine and continue baking for 2 hours. Add soup the last  hour of baking. Very good served over noodles or rice.

ITALIAN BEEF
ingredients
3  lb. chuck roast
1  Tbsp. garlic salt
1  Tbsp. onion salt
1  Tbsp. basil leaves, chopped
1  Tbsp. oregano
1  Tbsp. black pepper
1  jar pepperoncini peppers (and juice)
1/4  c. soy sauce
  Mozzarella cheese
  hoagie buns
preparation
      Place meat, seasonings, peppers and juice in crock-pot. Cover with water.  Cook for at least 4 hours before you shred meat into small pieces.  Cook for 2 more hours, until tender.  Serve shredded meat on buns with cheese on top.

BROCCOLI BEEF SQUARES
ingredients
2  c. chopped, thawed and drained broccoli
1  lb. ground beef
4  g. mushroom pieces
2  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
1/3  c. chopped onion
2  c. Bisquick
1/2  c. cold water
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1  tsp. salt
  dash of pepper
1/2  c. milk
4  eggs
preparation
      Heat oven to 400°.  Grease 13 x 9 x 2 baking dish.  Heat 1-inch salted water to boiling.  Add broccoli.  Cover and cook until almost tender, about 5 minutes.  Drain thoroughly.  Cook and stir beef until brown.  Drain.  Stir in mushrooms, 1 1/2 cups Cheddar cheese and onion.  Mix Bisquick, water and remaining cheese until soft dough forms.  Beat 20 strokes.  Pat dough in dish with floured hands, pressing 1/2-inch up sides.  Spread beef mix over dough.  Sprinkle with broccoli.  Mix remaining ingredients.  Pour over broccoli.  Bake until knife comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes.

BEEF ROLL-UPS
ingredients
1/2  c. chopped onions
2  Tbsp. butter or margarine
1  c. finely diced carrots
1  c. finely diced potatoes
1  can mushroom soup
2  Tbsp. chopped parsley
1/2  tsp. dill (optional)
4 cube steaks or 1 1/2  lb. round steak, 1/8-inch thick
  salt and pepper to taste
2  Tbsp. shortening
1 medium size  can tomatoes, cut up
1/2  glass apple juice (optional)
preparation
      In a saucepan, sauté onions in butter.  Add carrots, potatoes, 1/2 can of soup, parsley and 1/4 teaspoon dill.  Cook until partially tender.  Sprinkle meat with salt and pepper.  If using round steak, cut into 4 or 5 pieces and flatten.  Place stuffing in center of meat.  Roll up, tuck in ends and skewer with toothpicks. Using a skillet, brown roll-ups on all sides in shortening.  Remove excess fat.  Pour in soup, dill, tomatoes and remaining stuffing. Simmer about an hour, but stir frequently.  Add apple juice and simmer for 15 minutes more.

KOREAN BARBECUED  BEEF
ingredients
1  lb. thinly sliced rump roast
2  Tbsp. sesame oil
2  Tbsp sugar
4  Tbsp soy sauce
4  minced green onions
2  tsp. minced fresh garlic
1  tsp. minced ginger
  dash of pepper
1  tsp. sesame seed
2  Tbsp. Sherry wine or coke
preparation
	Mix all ingredients but rump roast to make sauce. Marinate beef for several hours or longer in the sauce. Barbecue or broil in oven and serve immediately.

OVEN BARBECUE BEEF
ingredients
5 to 6  lb. chuck roast
1  large onion, chopped
1  garlic clove, minced
3  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
  dash of Tabasco sauce
2  Tbsp. white vinegar
3  c. catsup
1/2  tsp. dry mustard
1/2  tsp. black pepper
4  c. ginger ale
1/4  tsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Place roast in large roasting pan.  Combine the remaining ingredients.  Mix well.  Pour over roast.  Cover with top to the roaster or heavy-duty aluminum foil.  Bake at 300° for 6 to 7 hours.  Cool.  Slice very thin or shred in food processor for sandwiches.

QUICK AND EASY BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
16  oz. egg noodles
8  oz. (2 pkg.) mushrooms (fresh)
7  (2/3 c.) green onions with tops
2  Tbsp. oil
30  oz. (1 pkg.) Beef Tips with Gravy (Hormel brand)
8  oz. (1 tub) sour cream
preparation
      Cook noodles according to package directions and drain.
      Slice mushrooms.  Thinly slice green onions.
      Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat.  Add mushrooms. Cook 5 minutes until tender, stirring frequently.  Add Beef Tips with Gravy.
      Cover and cook over medium heat 8 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Remove from heat.  Stir in green onions and sour cream.
      Serve over hot noodles.

BEEF TIPS IN WINE SAUCE
ingredients
3  lb. round steak, cut into bite-size pieces
1  pkg. dry onion soup mix
12  oz. pkg. egg noodles
2  cans golden mushroom soup
1  c. red wine
preparation
      Mix all ingredients. Pour in oven-proof baking dish and bake at 300° to 325° for 3 1/2 hours. Add pepper to taste and stir.

MOLDED CORN BEEF SALAD
ingredients
1  can corned beef
1 small  can peas, drained
1  medium onion, chopped
2  hard boiled eggs, chopped
1  pkg. lemon Jello (dissolved in 2 cups boiling water)
1  c. celery, diced
1  green pepper, chopped
1  c. mayonnaise
  Salt
  Pimento
preparation
      Make Jello and set aside to cool.  Break corn beef apart with a fork and add chopped vegetables, eggs, salt and mayonnaise.  Mix all with Jello and garnish with chopped pimento and chill until set.

CHIPPED BEEF CRACKER SPREAD
ingredients
1 8  oz. pkg. cream cheese
1/4  c. walnuts
1  pkg. chipped beef, dried beef
1/4  c. Miracle Whip
2  Tbsp. onion
  green pepper, optional
2  Tbsp. milk
1  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Mix all ingredients except for nuts. Bake at 250° for 10 to 15 minutes or microwave. Top with chopped nuts.

BEEF STEW
ingredients
6  to 8 medium potatoes
3  to 4 carrots
1  medium onion
1  Tbsp. margarine
  dash of red pepper
1  beef bouillon cube
1  c. hot water
  salt to taste
1  can Bunker Hill rib eye gravy
preparation
      Peel and dice potatoes, carrots and onion.  Cover with water and cook until done.  Add remaining ingredients and simmer a few minutes.  Serve over cooked rice or sliced bread.

HAMBURGER BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
2  lb. ground beef
2  medium onions, chopped
20  oz. (2 cans) soup, cream of mushroom
1 soup  can of water
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. black pepper
2  Tbsp. flour
3  Tbsp. sour cream
  rice OR noodles (for serving)
preparation
      In a skillet, brown ground beef and add onions; cooking until tender.  Stir in soup and 1 soup can of water.  Add salt and pepper.
      Remove 1 cup of stroganoff mixture and blend with flour.  Stir flour mixture and sour cream into stroganoff, mixing well.
      Serve over rice or noodles.
      Makes 6 servings.

BEEF STEW
ingredients
10  (about 1/2 lb.) small new potatoes,  halved but not peeled
12  small white onions, peeled
30  (about 1/2 lb.) baby carrots
1  red or green bell pepper, cut into 1 inch pieces
1-1/2  lbs. Beef stew meat, cut into 1- to 1-1/2-inch cubes
2  c. beef broth or bouillon
2  tsp. chopped fresh oregano leaves
1/4  tsp. paprika
1  Tbsp. chopped fresh parsley
1  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/2  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
3  Tbsp. cornstarch
3  Tbsp. cold water
preparation
      Place potatoes, onions and baby carrots in slow-cooker.  Add bell pepper and beef.  In small bowl, combine broth or bouillon, oregano, paprika, parsley, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. Pour over meat and vegetables.  Cover and cook on LOW 9-10 hours. Turn pot on HIGH.  In small bowl, dissolve cornstarch in water; stir into cooked stew mixture.  Cover and cook on HIGH 15-20 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally.  Makes 6 or 7 servings.

BARBECUED BEEF
ingredients
3  lb. stew meat
1  bottle chili sauce
1  qt. Vernor's ginger ale
preparation
      Place meat and ginger ale in pan and simmer until liquid is about gone and meat is tender.  Flake meat with fork and add chili sauce and heat through.

MACARONI AND BEEF
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. ground beef
1  medium chopped onion
1 (16 oz.)  can whole tomatoes, chopped
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato paste
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
2  c. macaroni noodles
preparation
      In skillet, brown beef and onions. Drain off excess fat. Add tomatoes, salt and pepper. Simmer over low heat for 30 minutes. Cook macaroni according to directions; drain. Combine cooked macaroni and beef into large serving bowl.

GARLIC BEEF ENCHILADAS
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef, cooked, drained and crumbled
1  medium onion, chopped
2  Tbsp. all-purpose flour
1/2  Tbsp. chili powder
1/2  tsp. salt
1  tsp. garlic powder
1/2  tsp. ground cumin, optional
1 (14.5 oz.)  can stewed tomatoes
1  can enchilada sauce
10  flour tortillas
2  c. shredded Co Jack or Mexican melting cheese
preparation
      In saucepan over medium heat, combine beef, onions and about 1/2 cup water; cook until onions are translucent.  Add flour and seasonings; mix well.  Stir in tomatoes; bring to a boil.  Reduce heat; simmer about 15 minutes, until most of liquid is absorbed. Pour about 1 1/2 cups sauce into an ungreased 9 x 13 inch baking dish.  Spread about 1/4 cup beef mixture down the center of each tortilla shell; top with 1 to 2 Tbsp. cheese.  Roll up tightly; place seam side down over sauce.  Repeat with each tortilla shell. Top with remaining sauce and cheese.  Broil on LOW until cheese is melted and bubbly.  Yield: 4 to 6 servings.

BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
1  lb. beef stew or round steak
1  large onion, chopped
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1 (8 oz.)  carton sour cream
1 small  pkg. egg noodles
preparation
      Salt, pepper, & flour meat.  Brown in small amount of shortening.  Add onions & cook until soft; then add 3 or 4 cups water & cook until tender.  Add soup & cook 5 minutes longer.  Add sour cream.  Cook noodles & drain.  Then pour into meat mixture.

SPICY VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. ground beef
1/2  to 1 onion
1  clove garlic
28 to 30  oz. spaghetti sauce (garden vegetable)
2  c. water
1  c. beef bouillon
  salt and pepper to taste
1  c. chopped celery (if desired)
1  can Ro-Tel tomatoes and chili pepper (mild or hot, whatever your preference is)
1  pkg. frozen vegetables
preparation
      Sauté beef, onion and garlic, then drain. Add remaining ingredients and simmer 1 hour or until vegetables are cooked.

CORNED BEEF/CABBAGE
ingredients
1  medium onion, cut in wedges
4  medium potatoes, peeled and quartered
1  lb. baby carrots
3  c. water
3  garlic cloves, minced
1  bay leaf
2  Tbsp. sugar
2  Tbsp. cider vinegar
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  corned beef brisket/spice packet
2 1/2 to 3  lb. cabbage, cut in half
preparation
      Place onion, potatoes and carrots in a 5-quart slow cooker. Combine water, garlic, bay leaf, sugar, vinegar, pepper and contents of spice packet.  Pour over vegetables. Top with brisket and cabbage.  Cover and cook on low 8 or 9 hours or until meat and vegetables are tender.  Remove bay leaf before serving.

VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
2  large onions, chopped
3  medium potatoes, chopped
1  Tbsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  stick margarine
10  oz. pkg. frozen peas
10  oz. pkg. frozen carrots
10  oz. pkg. frozen corn
10  oz. pkg. frozen lima beans
64  oz. tomato juice or 15 oz. tomato sauce
1 large  can tomatoes
3 to 4  c. water
1/4  c. sugar (if desired)
preparation
      Saut ground beef in large Dutch oven until browned, stirring to separate. Drain off fat. Add remaining ingredients and simmer, covered, for 45 minutes or until all vegetables are very tender. Any leftover meat, vegetables or pasta may be added, if desired.
       (Do not use potatoes if freezing the soup.) Great served with cornbread!

GROUND BEEF CHILI
ingredients
3  lb. ground beef
1  large onion, chopped
1  medium green pepper, chopped
2  celery ribs, chopped
2 (16 oz.)  cans kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1 (29 oz.)  can tomato puree
1 (16 oz.)  jar salsa
1 (14 1/2 oz.)  can diced tomatoes (undrained)
1 (10 1/2 oz.)  can condensed beef broth (undiluted)
1 to 2  c. water
1/4  c. chili powder
2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  Tbsp. dried basil
2  tsp. ground cumin
2  tsp. steak sauce
1  tsp. garlic powder
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. coarsely ground pepper
1 1/2  tsp. browning sauce (optional)
  additional chopped onion (optional)
preparation
      In a Dutch oven, cook beef, onion, green pepper and celery over medium heat until meat is no longer pink and vegetables are tender. Drain. Stir in the beans, tomato puree, salsa, tomatoes, broth, water, seasonings and browning sauce, if desired. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until chili reaches desired thickness. Garnish with chopped onion, if desired. Yield: 16 servings.

GROUND BEEF CUPS WITH CREAMED POTATOES
ingredients
3/4  lb. ground beef
1/4  c. bread crumbs
2  c. milk
  salt and pepper to taste
6  medium potatoes, diced
preparation
      Combine beef, bread crumbs, 1/2 cup milk, 1 teaspoon salt and dash of pepper; mix well. Line ungreased muffin cups with meat mixture about 1/4-inch thick. Place potatoes and remaining milk in saucepan; cover and cook slowly until thick. Season with salt and pepper. Fill meat cups with potatoes; bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

BEEF TIPS
ingredients
3  lb. stew beef
1  tsp. celery salt and garlic salt
1/4  c. tomato paste
1/4  tsp. cloves
  flour (for coating)
1  tsp. allspice
3  Tbsp. vinegar
  salt and pepper
1/4  tsp. red pepper
1  medium onion, chopped
5  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
3  c. bouillon
preparation
      Add salt and pepper to flour before coating meat. Sauté beef coated in flour in a small amount of cooking oil. Add red, pepper, cloves, onions, allspice, Worcestershire sauce and bouillon. Bake at 350° for 2 to 3 hours.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

BEEF NOODLE SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  can (46 oz.) V8 juice
1  envelope onion soup mix
1  pkg. (3 oz.) beef ramen noodles
1  pkg. (16 oz.) frozen mixed vegetables
preparation
      In a large saucepan, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.  Stir in V8 juice, soup mix, contents of noodle seasoning packet and mixed vegetables.  Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer uncovered until vegetables are tender.  Return to a boil; stir in noodles.  Cook 3 minutes or until noodles are tender.

HOT BEEF-MUSHROOM APPETIZER
ingredients
2  medium onions, chopped
1/4  c. butter or margarine
1  pkg. (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
1/2  lb. fresh mushrooms, chopped
1  pkg. (4 1/2 oz.) dried beef, chopped
1/2  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
  Crackers or party rye bread
preparation
      In a skillet, sauté onions in butter until tender. Stir in cream cheese until smooth. Add mushrooms, beef, Worcestershire sauce and garlic powder; mix well. Spoon into an ungreased 9 inch pie plate. Bake at 375° for 15-20 minutes. Serve warm with crackers or rye bread.

BEEF STROGANOFF AND NOODLES
ingredients
3/4  lb. beef round steak (boneless, 3/4-inch thick)
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can cream of mushroom soup
1 (14 1/2 oz.)  can beef broth
1/2  c. water
1  medium onion, diced
3  c. egg noodles
1/2  c. plain yogurt
preparation
	Slice beef into very thin strips. In skillet over medium-high heat, cook beef until browned, stirring often. Set aside. Add soup, water, onion and broth. Heat to boiling. Stir in noodles. Cook over low heat until noodles are done, stirring often. Stir in yogurt. Return beef to pan and heat thoroughly.

STUFFED BEEF SHELLS
ingredients
12  pasta stuffing shells
1  lb. ground beef
1  jar picante sauce (your choice, medium or hot)
1/2  c. water
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato sauce
1 (4 oz.)  can green chilies, drained
1  c. Monterey Jack cheese
1  can Durkee French onions
preparation
      Brown ground beef.  Combine picante sauce, water and tomato sauce.  Stir 1/2 of chilies, 1/2 cup of cheese and 1/2 can of onions; mix well.  Pour 1/2 of remaining sauce on bottom of a 10-inch round baking dish.  Stuff shells with beef mixture.  Top with remaining cheese and chilies.  Bake, covered, at 350° for 30 minutes.  Bake, uncovered, for 5 minutes longer.

SHREDDED BEEF SANDWICHES
ingredients
1  roast
1  pkg. Au Jus Gravy mix
1  jar pepperoni peppers
1  pkg. Italian dressing
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Place roast in a baking dish and add remaining ingredients. Bake at 270° until tender. When tender, shred beef with a fork. Serve on rolls or buns. M-mmm!

EASY BEEF TIPS
ingredients
2  lbs. beef chuck roast, cubed
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1  envelope dry onion soup mix
1  C. lemon-lime soda
3  Tbsp. quick cooking Tapioca
preparation
      Place beef in 2 qt. baking dish.  Pour mushroom soup, dry onion soup mix, lemon-lime soda and tapioca over beef; stir until blended.
      Cover and bake at 275 degrees for 4 hours.
      Serve over noodles, rice or mashed potatoes.

GROUND BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1/2  C. chopped onion
2  Tbsp. flour
2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
8  oz. can mushrooms, undrained
10 3/4  oz. can cream of chicken soup
1  C. sour cream
  Cooked noodles
preparation
      Brown meat and onion;  drain.  Add flour, salt, pepper and mushrooms.  Cook 5 minutes over medium heat, uncovered.
      Add soup and simmer uncovered 10 minutes.  Stir in sour cream and cooked noodles.
      If desired, serve noodles separately and let each person spoon on the stroganoff.
      Makes 4 servings.

BEEF-AND-SPINACH DIP
ingredients
1  lb. lean ground beef
1  small onion, chopped
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
2 (9 oz.)  pkg. frozen creamed spinach, thawed
1 to 1 1/2  tsp. hot sauce
1/4  tsp. ground nutmeg
1/3  c. refrigerated shredded Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Cook beef and onion in a large skillet, stirring until beef crumbles and is no longer pink; drain. Stir in cream cheese and next 3 ingredients; cook over low heat, stirring often until cream cheese melts. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Serve with tortilla chips. Yield: 4 cups.
      Prep: 10 minutes. Cook: 20 minutes.

CHEESY BEEF ENCHILADAS
ingredients
1  lb. ground meat
1 (16 oz.)  jar salsa, divided
2  c. (8 oz.) Kraft natural shredded Colby and Monterey Jack cheese
12  flour tortillas (6 to 8-inch)
preparation
	Brown ground meat and drain well. Stir in half the salsa and 1 cup of the cheese. Spread 1 cup of the salsa in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Place 1/4 cup meat mixture in the center of each tortilla, then roll up. Place seam side down in the pan on top of the salsa. Top with remaining salsa and the rest of the meat mixture if any is left. Then put the remaining cheese on top. Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes or until cheese is melted and the dish is hot.

BEEF OR PORK SAUCE
ingredients
5  oz. Worcestershire sauce
5  oz. A.1.
1  stick butter
1/2  c. brown sugar
  juice of 1 lemon
preparation
      Add all ingredients.  Bring to a boil.  Pour over uncooked meat and let set (as little as 30 minutes or as long as all day). Use remaining sauce with meat after it's cooked!  I recommend using this sauce with pork tenderloin.

WHERE'S THE BEEF?
ingredients
1  round loaf bread (Hawaiian bread is good)
2  pkg. (8 oz. each) cream cheese
2  c. sour cream
1  jar (5 oz.) dried beef, chopped fine
1/2  cup chopped green onion
3  Tbsp. chopped bell pepper
  Worcestershire sauce
  Louisiana hot sauce
  Tabasco sauce
  cayenne
preparation
  Cut and remove top of bread loaf and hollow out the bread, leaving about 1-inch thick sides, reserving the top to be used as a lid. Mix all other ingredients together, seasoning with Worcestershire, Louisiana hot sauce, Tabasco and cayenne to taste.  Put the filling ingredients inside bread.  Top with the bread lid.  Wrap the loaf in foil and bake at 300° on a cookie sheet for 1 1/2 hours.  Remove from oven.  Remove foil.  Take off top of loaf.  Serve on platter. Surround with Fritos or crackers.  Serves 10 to 12.  Round bread keeps filling warm for quite awhile.

TEXAS BEEF FAJITAS
ingredients
4 or 5  Tbsp. lime juice (fresh or reconstituted)
1  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
2  cloves garlic, finely minced
1 1/2  lb. skirt steak
3  Tbsp. vegetable oil
2  medium onions, sliced (not chopped)
2  large green peppers, cut into 1/4-inch strips
12  flour tortillas
  fresh cilantro (optional)
preparation
      Combine lime juice, garlic and Worcestershire sauce. Marinate steak in this mixture at least 3 hours or overnight. Drain meat well and grill over charcoal until barely medium-rare.
      Meanwhile, sauté green peppers and onions in the vegetable oil in a large skillet. Can use an electric skillet which is just put in the middle of the table. Set on "warm, " as a serving dish. Cut the grilled meat into very narrow strips (about 1/4-inch). Add to skillet when peppers and onions are about cooked. Stir and cook a little longer until all is done.
      Serve sizzling hot with flour tortillas (also heated), salsa, guacamole and refried beans. The fresh cilantro is optional but makes the fajitas even better.
       Everyone makes their own. Just place about 2 tablespoons of meat mixture on a flour tortilla and add salsa and a few leaves of fresh cilantro; roll and eat! Good! Serves 6.
Fresh Tomato Salsa:
ingredients
2  large ripe (firm) tomatoes, peeled and seeded
  salt and pepper to taste
1/4  c. onion, finely chopped
1  jalapeno pepper, finely chopped (fresh or canned)
preparation
      Chop tomatoes to fine pieces and add all other ingredients. Let set at least an hour.

BEEF NOODLE CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  Tbsp. fat
1/2  lb. ground beef
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/4  c. onions, sliced
1 (4 oz.)  can mushrooms, sliced
1  c. wide noodles (uncooked)
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato sauce (1 c.)
1 (8 oz.)  can water (1 c.)
1 1/2  Tbsp. flour
1/4  c. water
preparation
	Brown meat in hot fat in Mirro-Matic. Add other ingredients and stir, except for the last 2 ingredients. Cover; set control at 15 and cook for 5 minutes after control jiggles. Reduce pressure instantly. For a heavier consistency, this mixture may be thickened by cooking, uncovered, with mixture of flour and water, stirring constantly. Quantity of ingredients: 2 1/2 to 4 quarts. Serves 4.

GROUND BEEF WITH MACARONI
ingredients
1  pkg. macaroni pasta
1  large onion
  2-3 tsp. oil
2  tsp. all-spice
1  lb. beef
1/2  cup water
1 small  can tomato sauce
1  tsp. salt
6  Tbsp. flour
4  cups milk
1  egg, beaten
preparation
      Cook the pasta as per package instructions.  Cut the onion and fry it with 2-3 tsp. oil.  Add all-spice and the beef.  Braise until meat turns brown.  Then add water and tomato sauce and salt. Cook meat for 10 minutes.
      Mix the flour and the milk in a blender.  Cook over medium heat, while continuously stirring, until it becomes thick like Tahina sauce. Mix the pasta with 2-3 Tbsp. of this white sauce.
      Grease a baking tray and layer 1/2 of the pasta.  Add the meat and top with the remaining pasta.  Pour the remaining white sauce over the pasta.  Evenly pour the beaten egg over the top.  Bake in 350°F oven for 30 minutes.

BEEF BARLEY SOUP
ingredients
2  lbs. of stir fry beef
1  onion
1  bag of frozen peas and carrots
32  oz. Beef Broth
2  sm. potatoes
1/2  bag of baby carrots
1/2  c. corn
1  c. uncooked barley
  garlic powder
  onion powder
  salt
  pepper
  water as needed
preparation
      Cook meat, onion, broth and seasonings in slow cooker on 250 degrees for 8 hours until meat is tender.
      Add vegetables, more seasonings if needed, and water depending on how thick you want the soup.  Cook for another 4 hours.  Add dry barley and liquid (water or broth).  Cook until barley is tender and fluffy.  Season again and eat.

BEEF ROLL-UP
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. thin sirloin or rd. steak, cut into rollable pcs.
  Garlic paste or smashed garlic
  Salt, pepper
  Parsley
  Grated cheese
  Bread crumbs
1  can beef broth
1/4  c. wine
preparation
      Spread a thin layer of garlic paste on meat.  Season with salt, pepper, parsley and grated cheese.  Add bread crumbs.  Roll up meat jelly roll style and secure with toothpicks.  Brown in oil and transfer to casserole dish sprayed with Pam.  Add beef broth and wine to drippings.  Strain and pour over rolls.  Bake covered at 350° for 1 - 1 1/2 hr., depending on cut of meat.

GROUND BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
2  Tbsp. chopped onions
1  lb. ground beef
1 small  can tomato sauce
1 medium  can mixed vegetables
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Brown onions and ground beef in hot fat in a skillet. Mix tomato sauce, mixed vegetables, salt and pepper in casserole dish. Add browned onions and beef. Cook in 350° oven for about 1 hour.

HEARTY BEEF 'N CHEESE CRESCENT PIE
ingredients
1-1/4  lbs ground beef
1/3  c onion, chopped
1/4  c green bell pepper, chopped
1/4  tsp cumin seed, if desired
1/4  tsp garlic salt
1/4-1/2  tsp salt
8  oz tomato sauce
8.25  oz sliced green beans, drained
8 oz  can crescent dinner rolls
1  egg, slightly beaten
8  oz cheddar cheese, shredded
  paprika
preparation
      Heat oven to 375°.  In large skillet, brown ground beef with onion and green pepper.  Drain.  Stir cumin seed, garlic salt, salt, tomato sauce, and green beans.  Simmer uncovered while preparing crust.  Separate dough into 8 triangles.  Place in ungreased 9 inch pie pan.  Press firmly over bottom and up sides to form crust.  Seal perforations.  In small bowl, combine egg and cheese.  Spread over bottom of crust.  Spoon hot meat mixture over cheese mixture.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese and paprika.  Bake at 375° for 20-25 minutes or until crust is golden brown.  Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
      Makes 6 servings.

BEEF VEGETABLE SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. beef stew, cubed
1  tsp. minced garlic
1  can steak sauce with mushrooms
1  lb. frozen mixed vegetables
2  c. water
2  medium potatoes, chopped bite size
1  tsp. black pepper
1 small  can mushrooms
1  medium onion
5  beef bouillon cubes
1  can diced tomatoes
1  tsp. Italian seasoning
  salt to taste
preparation
      Brown beef, onion and garlic. Add rest of ingredients. Bring to boil. Turn heat to simmer and cook until all vegetables are done. Use a 4-quart cooking pot.

JUMBO STUFFED SHELLS (BEEF)
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. ground beef or 1/2  beef and 1/2	pork
1  egg
1/2   lb. Mozzarella cheese, diced
1/2   c. milk
2  slices bread
1  Tbsp chopped parsley
  salt and pepper
  jumbo shells
  pasta sauce
  grated cheese
preparation
	Break ground beef into small particles and sauté in butter or olive oil.	Mix thoroughly meat, egg, Mozzarella, milk, bread, chopped parsley, salt and pepper.  Fill cooked shells.  Cover bottom of baking dish with pasta sauce.  Arrange filled shells side by side in single layer in baking pan.  Pour remaining sauce over filled shells and bake at 350° for about 30 minutes. Sprinkle with grated cheese and serve.
