CHIPPED BEEF DIP
ingredients
2  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1/4  c. milk
1  (8 oz.) sour cream
1/4  c. dried minced onion
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1/2  tsp. pepper
1/2  c. green peppers, chopped
1 (2 1/2 oz.)  jar dried beef, chopped
1  Tbsp. butter
1/2  c. pecans
1  tsp. Texas Pete
preparation
      Place cream cheese in bowl. Microwave 1 minute. Stir in milk, sour cream, onion, garlic powder, pepper, green peppers and beef. Mix well. Melt butter. Stir in pecans and Texas Pete. Mix well and serve on crackers as dip.

BROTHER JOHN'S BEEF STEW
ingredients
1  large onion, chopped
  vegetable oil
2  lb. beef for stew, cut into 2-inch chunks
3  Tbsp. flour
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
3  Tbsp. beef bouillon powder
1  lb. carrots, peeled and cut into bite-size chunks
4  large potatoes, peeled and cut into bite-size chunks
1  c. frozen peas
preparation
      In a 5-quart Dutch oven over medium-high heat, in 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, cook onions, stirring often, until lightly browned, about 10 minutes; with slotted spoon remove to bowl.  In a large bowl, toss beef with flour, salt, and pepper. In the same Dutch oven, over high heat in 2 tablespoons hot oil, cook beef, half at a time, until well browned on all sides.  With slotted spoon, remove beef to another bowl as it browns.
      Return beef to Dutch oven; add beef-flavor bouillon and 4 cups water.  Over high heat, heat to boiling.  Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 1 1/2 hours or until beef is almost fork-tender. Add onions, carrots, and potatoes to Dutch oven; over high heat, heat to boiling.  Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 1 hour longer until beef and vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.  Stir in peas; heat through.  Makes about 8 servings.  Serve with freshly baked corn bread.

CORNED BEEF CRACKER SPREAD
ingredients
1  can corn beef
2  cans mixed vegetables, drained
1  small onion, diced fine
2  boiled eggs
  mayonnaise
  pepper
  mustard
  salt
preparation
      Mix all ingredients until well mixed.  Let sit for several hours or overnight.  Serve with a variety of crackers.  Keep well for several days.

SAUCY BEEF OVER RICE
ingredients
2  Tbsp. flour
1 (14 1/2 oz.)  can stewed tomatoes
1  envelope onion soup mix
1/2  c. water
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  lb. beef sirloin steak, cut in thin strips
2  c. hot cooked rice
preparation
      You will need 1 Reynolds oven bag.
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Shake flour in bag.  Place in 9 x 13 baking pan.  Add undrained tomatoes, soup mix, water and pepper. Squeeze bag to mix.  Add beef strips.  Turn bag to coat meat. Arrange in an even layer.  Close bag with bag tie.  Cut 6 (1/2-inch) slits on top.  Bake until beef is tender, 40 to 45 minutes.  Serve over hot rice.

BEEF STROGANOFF II
ingredients
3  lb. stew meat
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can golden mushroom soup
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can cream of mushroom soup
1/2  c. water
1  pkg. of dried onion soup
preparation
	Brown beef in skillet.	Do not drain.  Place beef and all ingredients in 13 x 9-inch baking pan.  Mix together thoroughly. Cover and bake at 350° for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.

BEEF TACO BAKE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  (10 3/4 oz.) cream of tomato soup
1  c. Pace thick and chunky salsa
1/2  c. milk
6  flour tortillas or 8 corn tortillas (6 to 8-inch), cut into 1-inch pieces
1  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
      In skillet over medium-high heat, cook beef until browned, stirring to separate meat.  Pour off fat.  Add soup, salsa, milk, tortillas and half the cheese.  Spoon into 2-quart shallow baking dish.  Cover.  Bake at 400° for 30 minutes or until hot.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese.  Serves 4.

ONE POT BEEF ROAST AND GRAVY
ingredients
  beef roast (your choice)
1  pkg. Lipton dry onion soup mix
1  can cream of mushroom or cream of chicken soup
1/2  c. milk
2  Tbsp. cornstarch
  Gravy Master (optional)
preparation
	Place roast in a large baking dish with a cover. Sprinkle roast with dry onion soup mix. In a small bowl, add 1/2 cup of water to soup and pour over roast. Cover and bake roast at a low temperature of 200° or 250° for 3 to 4 hours. Roast will be exceptionally tender. Take roast out of pot and place baking dish on top of stove. Heat the liquid mixture from roast until bubbly.
	Meanwhile, mix the milk, cornstarch and Gravy Master in a small bowl until smooth. Add this mixture to the bubbling liquid and stir until gravy has thickened.

GROUND BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
1/2 to 2  lb. ground chuck
1  clove garlic
2  cans tomatoes sauce
1  tsp. sugar
1  tsp. salt, optional
  black pepper
8  oz. noodles
3  oz. cream cheese
1  c. sour cream
1  medium onion, chopped
1/2  c. grated cheese
preparation
      Brown beef.  Add next five ingredients and simmer for 15 minutes.  Cook noodles in boiling water.  While noodles are cooking, mix the cream cheese, sour cream, and chopped onions. After meat cooks and noodles are done, mix all the ingredients together, except the grated cheese.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Top with grated cheese.  Put back in oven for a few seconds to let the cheese melt.

CORNED BEEF SPREAD
ingredients
1  can corned beef
1  pkg. lemon jello
1  c. boiling water
1  onion
1  green pepper
  celery
1  c. mayonnaise
preparation
      Mix jello and water. Set aside. Cut up or blend other ingredients. Add to jello. Refrigerate. Serve with crackers.

BEEF RICE CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  can onion soup
1  can beef consomme
1  c. rice (Uncle Ben's converted rice)
  garlic powder
1  can mushrooms
1/2  stick butter
preparation
      Combine onion soup, consomme and rice; sprinkle with garlic powder.  Add mushrooms.  Melt butter and pour over casserole.  Bake 1 hour at 350°, uncovered.

EASY ITALIAN BEEF
ingredients
2 to 3  lb. beef roast
1  pkg. Italian dressing mix
  jalapeno pepper slices
  celery
preparation
      Place roast in crock-pot.  Sprinkle with dry Italian dressing mix.  Cook on low for about 10 to 12 hours.  Halfway through cooking, add jalapeno pepper slices (to taste) and chopped celery. Remove from crock-pot and pull apart.

BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
2  lbs. tenderloin or sirloin tips
1/4  C. oil
1  lrg. onion, diced coarse
1/2  lb. mushrooms, sliced
2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp pepper
1/2  tsp. thyme leaves
1/2  tsp. galic powder or 1 clove fresh garlic
1  C. water or beef broth
1/2  C. Heinz 57 Sauce
1/2  C. Burgundy (optional) or water
16  oz. sour cream
preparation
      Sauté beef tips in a skillet until browned.  Add onions and mushrooms and sauté another 5 minutes.  Add water, salt, pepper, thyme, and garlic.
      Place in 350 degree oven for 1 hour or until tender.  Stir every 20 minutes.  Add Heinz 57 Sauce and wine.  Blend and cook another 15 minutes.
      Thicken with flour and water mixture.  Add sour cream and blend in.  Cook another 5 minutes.
      Serve at once.
      Serve stroganoff over noodles.

BEEF BACON CHOWDER
ingredients
12  slices bacon, cut in pieces
1  lb. hamburger meat
1/2  c. onion
2 - 3  c. celery
2 small  cans or 1 large can mushroom soup
  salt & pepper to tasted
4  c. milk
4  c. diced potatoes
2  c. diced carrots
preparation
      Fry bacon till crisp and drain.  Cook celery and onion with meat.  When meat is done, drain and add all ingredients and heat on low so it won't burn on.
      Serves about 6 - 8 people.

BEEF STEW SUPREME
ingredients
4  carrots, sliced
3  potatoes, cut up
2  lb. beef stew meat, cubed
1  c. consomme
1  tsp. garlic salt
1  tsp. each: pepper, fine herbs and onion powder
1  stalk celery, cut up
preparation
      The above ingredients should be place in the crock-pot in the order given. Stir several times; cover and cook.
       Cooking time: Low 10 to 12 hours; high 5 to 6 hours.
      Optional: Add small can of peas, drained, the last 1/2 hour.

BEEF TACO BAKE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef, turkey or venison
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can condensed tomato soup
1  cup salsa
1/2  cup milk
1  cup shredded cheddar cheese
6  flour tortillas (cut into 1 inch pieces)
preparation
      In skillet, over medium heat, cook meat until brown. Drain. Add soup, salsa, milk, tortillas and half of the cheese.  Spoon into 2 quart shallow baking dish.  Cover.  Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes or until hot.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Serves 4.

MONGOLIAN CHINESE BEER BEEF DUKIYAKI
ingredients
4  c. hot cooked rice
2  lb. beef sirloin steak, thinly sliced in 1-inch strips
3  Tbsp. vegetable oil
2  c. sliced onion (2 medium size)
2  c. diagonally sliced celery
1  large green pepper, cut in thin strips
2 beef bouillon cubes, dissolved in 1 3/4  c. hot water
1 (4 oz.)  can sliced mushrooms
1 1/2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. garlic salt
1/4  tsp. black pepper
1/2  c. soy sauce
1/2  c. beer
1  Tbsp. sugar
2  Tbsp. cornstarch, dissolved in 1/4 c. cold water
1  can Chinese vegetables
preparation
      Brown beef in oil. Add vegetables, broth and other seasonings. Simmer 20 minutes. Add cornstarch and cook until thick.

HEARTY BEEF AND VEGETABLE CASSEROLE
ingredients
4  c. thinly sliced potatoes
2  or 3 carrots, diced
1/4  c. chopped onion
1  lb. hamburger
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1/2  c. milk
2  Tbsp. catsup
preparation
      Boil  potatoes and carrots in salted  water  15  to  20 minutes.   Combine  soup,  milk and  catsup.  Brown  meat  and onion.   (With  canned  hamburger, heat  hamburger,  cook  the onions with potatoes.) In 2 1/2 quart dish alternate layers of vegetables, soup mixture and meat,  ending  with soup mixture. Cover and bake in a preheated 325° oven  for  30 to 35 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

SPICY BEEF AND CABBAGE
(8 Carbs/Serving)  
ingredients
1/4  lb. beef or turkey sausage
1  lb. ground beef
1/2  c. onion, chopped
2/3  lb. chopped tomatoes
1/4  c. tomato sauce
5  Brothers tomato alfredo
1 1/2  tsp. chili powder
1  tsp. garlic powder
  dash of red pepper flakes
2  c. shredded cabbage
preparation
      In a large Dutch oven, brown sausage, beef and onion; drain well. Add the remaining ingredients, except cabbage; mix well. Stir in the cabbage and simmer 20 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Serves 4.

MIXED BARBECUE BEEF AND PORK
ingredients
2  lb. lean beef
1  lb. pork
1/2  c. sugar
1/4  c. Worcestershire sauce
1  chopped medium onion
1  can tomato soup
1  can water
preparation
      Put in Dutch oven and bake at 350° for about 3 hours.  Mash and serve on hamburger buns.

BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
1  lb. lean round steak
3  Tbsp. all-purpose flour
1/4  tsp. pepper
  vegetable cooking spray
1  tsp. vegetable oil
1/2  lb. fresh mushrooms, halved
1  large onion, sliced
2  c. beef broth
2  Tbsp. dry sherry
2  Tbsp. tomato paste
1  tsp. dry mustard
1/4  tsp. dried whole oregano
1/8  tsp. dried whole dill weed
1/3  c. plain low-fat yogurt
3  c. hot cooked noodles
preparation
      Trim excess fat from steak.  Partially freeze steak.  Slice across grain into thin strips.  Combine flour and pepper, mixing well.  Dredge meat in flour mixture; set aside.  Coat a small Dutch oven with cooking spray.  Add oil and place over medium heat until hot.  Add mushrooms and onions to Dutch oven.  Cover and cook 5 minutes or until onion is tender, stirring frequently.  Remove vegetables from Dutch oven and set aside.  Add meat to Dutch oven. Increase heat to medium-high and cook until browned.  Stir in mushrooms, onion and remaining ingredients, except yogurt and noodles.  Bring to a boil.  Cover.  Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes.  Uncover and simmer an additional 15 minutes.  Remove from heat and stir in yogurt.  Cook meat and sauce until thoroughly heated (do not boil).  Serve over noodles.
      Yield:  6 servings (about 162 calories per serving plus 100 calories per 1/2 cup cooked noodles).

JUNE'S BEEF BRISKET
ingredients
3 to 4  lb. beef brisket
1  large onion
  pepper and paprika
preparation
      Preheat oven to 425°.  Slice onion and place in the bottom of a Dutch oven or heavy pan.  Wipe beef brisket with a damp cloth and season with pepper and paprika to taste.  Place beef in pan on top of onions.  Bake in open pan for 45 minutes.  Remove from oven and decrease heat to 325°.  Pour can of Coke over beef and seal pan with heavy aluminum foil.  Return to oven.  Cook for 3 1/2 hours.  Remove beef from pan.  Wrap in foil to let cool.  Pour juice from pan into bowl and place in refrigerator.  When cool and fat has formed on top, remove fat and reserve   juice for serving with meat.  When ready to serve, trim fat from meat and slice across the grain. A sauce of mayo and horseradish to taste may be served on the side.

BEEF RAGOUT
ingredients
2  lb. sirloin steak (bite size pieces)
1  large onion, chopped
1  can beef bouillon
1  c. non-alcoholic cooking sherry
1  bay leaf
2  Tbsp. grated lemon rind
  salt and pepper to taste
1/4  c. cornstarch
3  Tbsp. water
preparation
      Put all ingredients, except cornstarch and water, into slow cooker (crock-pot) for six hours or so.  (I cook mine during work hours.)  Bring to a boil just before serving.  Mix cornstarch and water and add to meat mixture.  Boil until thickened.  Delicious served over rice or noodles.

TENNESSEE BEEF SKILLET
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
3/4  c. chopped onion
1 (16 oz.)  can tomatoes, cut up and drained
1 (15 oz.)  can kidney beans (undrained)
1/2  c. uncooked rice
1/2  c. water
3  Tbsp. chopped green pepper
1 1/2  tsp. chili powder
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
3/4  c. shredded cheese
  corn chips
preparation
      In a skillet, fry ground beef and onions.  Drain.  Stir in remaining ingredients except cheese and corn chips.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Serve over corn chips, then top with cheese.

ITALIAN BEEF IN THE CROCK-POT
ingredients
4 to 5  lb. roast, cut up in small squares
2  to 3 beef bouillon cubes
1  tsp. garlic salt
2  Tbsp. Italian dressing
  garlic bread or French bread
preparation
      Place roast, bouillon cubes, garlic salt and Italian dressing in crock-pot.  Add enough water to cover beef.  Cook on low for 8 hours.  Heat up garlic bread or spread garlic spread on French bread.  Wrap in foil and heat in oven for about 10 minutes.  Shred beef with fork and knife; serve with gravy on garlic bread.  Add a salad and a vegetable to this "delicious" sandwich.

BEEF STEW
ingredients
1  lb. beef stew meat, cut in small chunks
1  pkg. onion soup mix
1 (15 oz.)  can green beans, drained
1 (15 oz.)  can black beans, drained
1 (15 oz.)  can peas, drained
1 (15 oz.)  can whole kernel corn, drained
2  large potatoes, cubed
3  c. water
preparation
	Put in crock-pot and simmer approximately 8 hours.

BAR-B-Q BEEF
ingredients
3 1/2 to 4  lb. chuck roast
1/4  tsp. cayenne pepper
1/2  tsp. minced garlic
2  small onions
2  tsp. horseradish
4  Tbsp. vinegar
4  Tbsp. Worcestershire
1  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. flour
1  c. ketchup
3  c. water (2 c. first)
preparation
      Sear roast at 400° 1/2 hour to brown.  Mix all remaining ingredients and cook 45 minutes.  Pour over seared roast.  Bake slow and covered until meat shreds, about 3 1/2 hours. Take meat out of pan. Cool enough to handle.  Shred meat into large bowl. Pour sauce from pan over meat and mix.  Reheat as needed.  Serve in hamburger buns.

BEEF-CHICKEN MAGNIFICENT
ingredients
4  oz. dried beef, chopped
8  halved chicken breasts
8  slices bacon
3  oz. cream cheese
1  can Cream of Mushroom soup
1 1/4  c. water
preparation
      Spread beef in greased baking dish.  Wrap each chicken breast in slice of bacon.  Place on top of beef.  Combine cheese, soup, and water; pour over chicken.  Cover & bake 1 1/2 hours at 325°. Uncover and bake 1 hour.

BEEF HASH
ingredients
1  c. hot water
1  beef bouillon cube
3  medium potatoes, peeled and cubed
1  medium onion, chopped
1  garlic clove, minced
2  Tbsp. vegetable oil
2  c. chopped, cooked eye of round roast
1/2  tsp. salt
1  tsp. pepper
2  Tbsp. chopped, fresh parsley (optional)
preparation
      Stir together hot water and beef bouillon cube until cube dissolves. Saut potatoes, onion and garlic in hot oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat 10 minutes. Add beef; cover, reduce heat and cook, stirring occasionally, 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir in bouillon mixture, salt, pepper, and if desired, parsley. Cover and simmer 5 minutes. Yield: 4 servings.
      Prep: 10 minutes. Cook: 30 minutes.

HEARTY VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. lean ground beef
1/2  c. onion, chopped
2 (14 oz.)  cans beef broth
1 (14.5 oz.)  can Del Monte mixed vegetables, drained
2 (14.5 oz.)  cans Del Monte original recipe stewed tomatoes
2 (14.5 oz.)  cans Del Monte fresh-cut whole new potatoes, drained and cubed
preparation
	Brown meat with onion in a large pot. Cook until onion is tender and drain. Stir in remaining ingredients. Salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Yield: 6 to 8 servings.

CORNED BEEF HASH
ingredients
  leftover corned beef
  boiled potatoes
  cooked carrots
1  or 2 cubes butter
  yellow onions
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
	(Note:	Amount of potatoes, carrots and onions will depend on amount of meat).
	Cut up corned beef, potatoes and carrots into pieces.  Put all through meat grinder.  Melt butter; add chopped onions.  Brown and add beef, potato and carrot mixture.  Cook and stir until hot enough to serve; season with salt and pepper to taste.  Maybe served with poached egg and ketchup.  Any leftover meats may be used instead of corned beef.

HOT MADRAS BEEF CURRY
ingredients
1 1/2 to 2  lb. round steak, cubed
1/2  c. butter
2  large onions, chopped
2  Tbsp. tomato paste
6  green chili peppers, chopped (jalapeno or other)
2  garlic pods, crushed
2  tsp. turmeric
4  tsp. chili powder
1  tsp. ground cumin
2  Tbsp. curry powder, more as desired
2  tsp. coriander
3  bouillon cubes
1  tsp. lemon juice
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Heat the butter in large saucepan and fry the onions until golden brown.  Next add green chilies, turmeric, chili powder, cumin, garlic, coriander, curry and tomato paste.  Fry for 10 minutes, stirring constantly, making sure the masala does not stick to the bottom of the pan.  Add lemon, salt and pepper.  In large pan, brown the round steak in butter.  Add water and bouillon cubes.  Let simmer for 20 to 30 minutes.  Mix in the masala sauce.  Simmer for 2 or more hours, adding water as needed. Serve over rice or noodles.  This is a very spicy dish.  You can use more or less chilies to suit your personal taste.

BEEF AND RICE FIESTA
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  medium onion, sliced
1 1/2  c. water
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can condensed golden mushroom soup
1 (7 oz.)  can whole kernel corn
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. chili powder
1 1/3  c. Minute rice
1  medium tomato, cut into eighths
1  green pepper, cut into strips or rings
preparation
	Brown ground beef in a skillet; leave meat in chunks. Add onion slices and cook until tender. Add water, mushroom soup, whole kernel corn, salt and chili powder. Bring to a boil. Stir in Minute rice. Add tomato and green pepper. Cover and simmer 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Makes about 6 cups or 5 servings.

BEEF STEW
ingredients
2  lb. beef stew meat cubed (chuck or round)
1  c. tomatoes
1  slice bread, cubed
1  onion
3  Tbsp. tapioca
6  carrots, cut up
1  c. celery, cut up
4  potatoes, cut up
  salt and pepper
preparation
      Bake at 250 for 5 hours.

POT ROAST OF BEEF
ingredients
3  medium potatoes, thinly sliced
2  large carrots, thinly sliced
1  onion, sliced
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  (3 to 4 lb.) boneless beef rump roast or brisket of shoulder
1/2  c. water or beef broth
preparation
	Put vegetables in bottom of crock-pot. Salt and pepper meat, then put in pot. Add liquid. Cover and cook on low for 10 to 12 hours (on high for 5 to 6 hours). Makes 12 to 14 servings.
	For 5 1/2-quart unit, you may cook a 4 to 5 pound roast. Add listed amounts of vegetables and cook as directed.

STEW BEEF
ingredients
  chunks of beef or venison
1  pkg. beef Polish sausage
  onions, diced
  carrots, cut in 1-inch cubes
  potatoes, cubed
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Brown beef or venison; add Polish sausage.  Add potatoes, onions and carrots.  Cover with water and bring to a boil.  Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally.  When meat is tender and vegetables are done, thicken stew with flour or cornstarch.  Add pastry, if desired.

CHEESY BEEF ENCHILADAS
ingredients
2  c. cottage or ricotta cheese
1  c. grated Monterey Jack cheese
1  can (4 oz.) chopped chiles
1  egg, beaten
1  tsp. chili powder
1/2  tsp. onion salt
1/2  tsp. paprika
8  to 10 tortillas
2  cans enchilada sauce (mild or hot to your taste)
1  can refried beans
1  lb. hamburger
1  pkg. taco seasoning
2  c. grated cheddar cheese
  sour cream
  chopped green onion
preparation
      Prepare hamburger with taco seasoning according to package directions.  Heat refried beans.  Mix together cottage cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, chopped chiles, egg and seasonings. Microwave tortillas on HIGH for 30 to 45 seconds or until pliable. Place refried beans evenly on each tortilla; next place hamburger mixture on each tortilla, then Monterey Jack cheese filling on each tortilla.  Roll the tortillas up in jellyroll fashion; place seam side down in an 11 3/4 x 7 1/2 x 1 3/4 inch baking dish. Cover with enchilada sauce.  Microwave on HIGH for 10 to 12 minutes or until hot and bubbly.  Sprinkle with cheddar cheese; microwave for an additional 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese is melted.  Garnish with sour cream and green onions.

BEEF BARLEY SOUP
ingredients
1/2  lb. ground beef
2 1/2  c. cold water
1 (14 1/2 oz.)  can stewed tomatoes, cut up
1/4  c. sliced carrots
3/4  c. sliced mushrooms
1/2  c. quick barley (uncooked)
2  cloves garlic, minced
1  tsp. dried oregano leaves
  salt and pepper to taste
1/2  lb. Velveeta pasteurized process cheese spread, cubed
preparation
      Brown meat in large saucepan; drain. Stir in water, tomatoes, carrots, mushrooms, barley, garlic and oregano. Bring to a boil; reduce heat. Cover and simmer 10 minutes or until barley is tender. Season to taste. Stir in cubed cheese spread until melted. Garnish as desired. Serve with sliced Italian or French bread.

REALLY GOOD HOT BEEF
ingredients
6  lb. chuck roast
2  cans cream of mushroom soup
1  envelope Lipton dry onion soup mix
1  can golden mushroom soup mix
  salt and pepper to taste
1/2 to 3/4 soup  can water
preparation
      Put roast in a 9 x 13-inch pan. Mix soups and water; pour over meat. Cover tight with foil and bake at 350° for 1 hour per pound. Pull with fork when done and serve on buns.
       Can easily cut recipe in half or freeze half for a later meal.

BEEF STEW
ingredients
3  lb. Chuck Steak, fat trimmed off and cut up
1  pkg. dry Onion Beef Soup Mix
1  lb. Carrots
2  lb. Potatoes
preparation
      Cook steak in pan until tender.  Pour all ingredients into pot with steak until vegetables are tender.  Thicken with corn starch or flour.

CABBAGE BEEF SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. lean ground beef
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
2  stalks celery, chopped
1 (16 oz.)  can kidney beans (not drained)
1/2  head cabbage (medium size), chopped
1 (28 oz.)  can chopped tomatoes
1 (28 oz.)  can water
4  beef bouillon cubes
1  tsp. sugar
preparation
      Brown beef in skillet and add to ingredients.  Bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer for one hour (covered).

BEEF CHEESE BALL
ingredients
2 large  pkg. cream cheese
2  Tbsp. parsley
1  Tbsp. milk
1  tsp. mustard
1  pkg. dried chipped beef, cut up
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together. Shape into ball and chill.

SWEET AND SOUR BEEF
ingredients
1/2 to 1  lb. beef stew meat or hamburger
  salt and pepper to taste
  soy sauce
1  bag frozen Chinese veggies
3 to 4 heaping  Tbsp. apricot jelly
1 to 2  Tbsp. cornstarch (in cold water)
preparation
      In 10-inch skillet, brown meat, adding salt, pepper and soy sauce to taste. Drain excess grease. Add frozen veggies and as much water as the veggie bag recommends. Simmer with lid on. When veggies are nearly done, add jelly and cornstarch mixed in cold water. Stir regularly until sauce starts to gel. Serve over noodles or rice.
      Note: This recipe works equally well with cubed chicken. Also, apricot preserves can be used for richer flavor, but any large chunks of apricot will need to be diced.

EASY OVEN BEEF AND VEGETABLE STEW
ingredients
1  1/2  pound beef round
1/2  cup flour
6  small onions
2  large potatoes - chunks
3  large carrots - chunks
3  cloves garlic - minced
2  cups diced turnip
3  cups water
1 1/4  cup beef stock
1 8  oz. can tomato sauce
1/4  tsp. thyme
1  tsp. dried oregano
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  bay leaf
1/2  tsp. grated orange rind (optional)
preparation
      Remove all visible fat from beef; cut beef into 1 inch cubes. In large casserole, toss beef with flour.  Add onions, potatoes, carrots, garlic, turnip, water, beef stock, tomato sauce, thyme, oregano, pepper, bay leaf, and orange rind.  Stir to mix.  Bake uncovered in 325 degree oven for 3 hours, stirring occasionally. Remove bay leaf.  Serve.

GRANDMA DULA'S ROAST BEEF
ingredients
5 or 6  lb. roast beef
1  medium onion, chopped
1/2  bell pepper
4  cloves garlic
1/2  c. celery
  salt and pepper
2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
2  jalapeno peppers (without seeds)
  few drops of hot sauce
preparation
      Mix all ingredients well.  Cut about 1 or 1 1/2-inch holes all over in roast.  Stuff ingredients in holes and bake in oven for about 1 1/2 or 2 hours at 350°.

CHICKEN AND BEEF CASSEROLE
(Low-Fat)  
ingredients
4  chicken breasts (boneless, skinless)
1  can Healthy Request mushroom soup
1  c. light sour cream
1  jar dried beef
preparation
      Spray a 9 x 13-inch dish with cooking spray. Cut dried beef into strips and put onto bottom of dish. Add chicken breasts. Mix soup and sour cream. Spoon on top of chicken. Bake at 275° for 1 hour.

BARBECUED BEEF CHILI
ingredients
7  tsp. chili powder
1  Tbsp. garlic powder
2  tsp. celery seed
1  tsp. coarsely ground pepper
1/4 to 1/2  tsp. cayenne pepper
1  fresh beef brisket (3 to 4 lb.)
1  medium green pepper, chopped
1  small onion, chopped
1 (12 oz.)  bottle chili sauce
1  c. ketchup
1/2  c. barbecue sauce
1/3  c. packed brown sugar
1/4  c. cider vinegar
1/4  c. Worcestershire sauce
1  tsp. ground mustard
1 (15 1/2 oz.)  can hot chili beans
1 (15 1/2 oz.)  can Great Northern beans, rinsed and drained
preparation
      Combine the first 5 ingredients. Rub over brisket. Cut into 8 pieces. Place in a slow cooker. Combine the green pepper, onion, chili sauce, ketchup, barbecue sauce, brown sugar, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce and mustard. Pour over meat. Cover and cook on high for 5 to 6 hours or until meat is tender. Remove meat. Cool slightly.
       Meanwhile, skim fat from cooking juices. Shred meat with 2 forks. Return to slow cooker. Reduce heat to low. Stir in the beans. Cover and cook for 1 hour or until heated through. Yield: 12 servings.
      Editor's Note: This is a fresh beef brisket, not corned beef.

CORNED BEEF CHEESE BALL
ingredients
3 8  oz. pkg. cream cheese, softened
4  pkg. cooked, thin sliced corn beef, diced
4  green onions, grated
2  Tbsp. worcestershire sauce
1  Tbsp. Accent
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together except for 1 package of corned beef. Form into ball and roll in the remaining corned beef.

BEEF SKILLET FIESTA
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1/4  c. diced onions
1  tsp. chili powder
1 (2 oz.)  can whole kernel corn
1 1/4  c. bouillon (use 1 cube and water)
1/2  c. green pepper
1  Tbsp. salad oil
2  tsp. salt
1 (1 lb.)  can tomatoes
1 1/3  c. Minute rice
preparation
      Brown meat in oil over high heat in skillet, leaving meat in coarse chunks. Add onions; reduce heat to medium and cook until onion is tender, but not brown. Add seasonings, tomatoes, corn and bouillon; bring to a boil. Stir in green peppers. Bring to a boil again. Stir. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Makes 4 servings.

BEEF CASSEROLE WITH WATER CHESTNUTS
ingredients
1  1/2 lbs. ground beef
1  med. onion, chopped
1  clove garlic, pressed
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. pepper
4.5  oz. can chopped ripe olives
5  oz. can water chestnuts, sliced
4 - 5  oz. thin noodles
4  oz. can mushrooms, drained
10.5  oz. can cream of chicken soup
1/4  C. dry red wine, optional
2  C. dairy sour cream
preparation
      Sauté meat with onion and garlic.  Drain off fat.
      Add salt, pepper, olives and water chestnuts; heat together.
      Cook noodles and drain.
      Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  In a large bowl, combine noodles, meat mixture, mushrooms, soup, 1/2 can water, wine and sour cream.  Pour into 2 qt. casserole and bake 30 minutes.
      Makes 8 servings.

CHIPPED BEEF DIP
ingredients
1 - 16  oz. sour cream
1 - 8  oz. cream cheese
  3-4 serving spoons of Miracle Whip
1  tsp. garlic powder
2  pkgs. chipped beef, chopped
4  - 5 dill pickles, finely chopped
preparation
      Blend cream cheese until softened.  Add sour cream and Miracle Whip; blend until well mixed.  Add garlic powder; fold in chopped chipped beef and dill pickles.
      Chill and serve with Fritos or your favorite chips.

GROUND BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  can cream of mushroom soup
3/4  c. milk
1 to 2  Tbsp. instant minced onion
1  c. sharp Cheddar shredded cheese
1/4  c. chopped green pepper
1  tsp. salt
4  oz. elbow macaroni
2/3  c. ketchup
  dash of black pepper
preparation
      Heat oven to 350°. Cook and stir meat until done. Drain meat. Cook macaroni as directed on package. Drain. Mix remaining ingredients. Pour in ungreased casserole dish. Cover. Bake 40 to 45 minutes.

BEEF ENCHILADA CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground meat
1  large onion, chopped
1/2  c. bell pepper, chopped
2  or 3 pods garlic, chopped (I use some garlic powder)
  salt and pepper to taste
1  Tbsp. chili powder
1/2  c. water
1  tsp. oleo
1  pkg. corn or flour tortillas
preparation
      Cook veggies until clear. Add meat and cook until pink is gone. Add water, chili powder and oleo and simmer about 30 minutes or until thickened.
Sauce for Enchiladas:
ingredients
2  cans cream of chicken soup
3/4  can milk (soup can)
1/2  lb. Velveeta cheese (melt cheese in soup)
3  Tbsp. hot sauce or 1 can Ro-Tel tomatoes (I use tomatoes)
preparation
      Heat all ingredients until cheese is melted. Grease large casserole dish. Put small amount of sauce in pan, then break up tortillas and spread 1/2 of meat and then sauce and repeat layer. Heat about 30 minutes in 350° oven.

BEEF STROGANOFF III
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. fresh mushrooms
3  lb. sirloin, good cut steak, cut in strips
2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
  salt and pepper to taste
3/4  tsp. nutmeg
1/2  c. Sherry (optional)
1  stick butter or margarine
2  Tbsp. flour
1  pt. sour cream
preparation
	Wash and cut mushrooms.  Season meat and brown in butter. Transfer to casserole.  Brown mushrooms in same pan and put them in casserole.  Put flour into remaining juices in pan and add sour cream.  Cook over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly.  Pour sauce over meat.	This can be prepared the day before.  Casserole should be heated in a very low oven (250° to 300°) for 1 hour.  Serves 8.  Serve with rice or English muffins.

BEEF-BARLEY SOUP
ingredients
2  lb. lean ground beef
1 (16 oz.)  can tomatoes
6  oz. tomato juice
7  c. water
1/2  lb. green beans, drained
1  green pepper, diced
1  c. diced celery
1/2  Tbsp. salt
  pepper to taste
2  tsp. garlic powder
2  Tbsp. soy sauce
1  bay leaf
1/2  tsp. paprika
1/2  tsp. thyme
1/2  c. pearl barley
2  sliced carrots
2  to 3 potatoes
preparation
      Brown ground beef.  Put all ingredients in a large cooking pot.  Boil.  Turn down heat and let simmer 1 hour.

CHIPPED BEEF BALL
ingredients
8  oz. pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/4  c. dairy sour cream
1  tsp. horseradish
1/4  c. Parmesan cheese
3  oz. pkg. chipped dried beef, chop finely
preparation
      Mix cream cheese, sour cream, horseradish and cheese with 1/2 cup dried beef.  Refrigerate at least 15 minutes for easier handling.  Shape into a ball and roll in remaining dried beef. Refrigerate at least 20 minutes before serving.  Makes a 4-inch ball.

BEEF BRISKET ANNA
ingredients
4  lb. beef brisket
  flour (for dusting)
2  Tbsp. olive oil
2  large onions, chopped thin
1  lb. can tomatoes
1/2  c. raisins
1/4  c. sugar
1  lemon
1  clove garlic
preparation
      Dust beef with flour; season with salt and pepper. In large skillet, sear beef on all sides in olive oil. Add onions and sauté until they begin to color.
       In blender, puree tomatoes. Combine with raisins, sugar and lemon, peeled, seeded and quartered, and 1 clove garlic, pressed. Pour sauce over meat and simmer, covered, 2 to 2 1/2 hours. Slice diagonally and serve with noodles. Serves 6 to 8.

GRAMA JULIA'S BEEF SOUP
(Hungarian Style)  
ingredients
1  lb. beef chuck
2  knuckle bones, cracked
2  qt. cold water
2  Tbsp. salt
1/2  tsp. paprika
2  large carrots
2  parsley roots and greens
2  stalks celery
1  fresh tomato
1  medium onion
2  cabbage leaves
2  medium potatoes
8  whole black peppercorns
preparation
      Wash meat and bones.  Place in large pot.  Add water.  Let it come to a boil; skim off fat.  Prepare vegetables by washing and paring as necessary.  Add seasoning and vegetables except potatoes.  Simmer for 2 1/2 hours.  Add whole potatoes; simmer for another 1/2 hour.  When done, strain soup.  Serve as consomme or with Crum Noodles.
Crum Noodles:
ingredients
1  egg
1/4  tsp. salt
1  c. flour
1/2  eggshell of water
preparation
      Sift flour and salt into bowl. Add egg and 1/2 eggshell of water.  Mix thoroughly by hand to form a ball (hard).  Grate on potato grater.  Dry on pastry board.

DRIED BEEF CHEESE BALL
ingredients
1  large cream cheese, softened
1 (3 oz.)  jar dried beef, chopped thin
1  Tbsp. milk
1  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  tsp. chopped chives
  chopped nuts
preparation
      Mix well and form into a ball.  Roll into finely chopped nuts.  Top with pimento olives.

COMPANY BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. hamburger
2  Tbsp. melted Crisco
1  medium onion, chopped
2  cans tomatoes
1  Tbsp. ketchup
1  Tbsp. steak sauce (optional)
1/4  c. green peppers
2  c. cooked macaroni noodles
2  c. grated cheese
preparation
	Brown hamburger in Crisco. Add onions, tomatoes, ketchup and steak sauce and simmer for 30 minutes. Add cooked macaroni. Put in a casserole dish. Sprinkle grated cheese over top and bake in a 350° oven for about 30 minutes or until cheese is melted.

SLOW-COOKED CHUNKY BEEF STEW
ingredients
2  lb. top round steak, cut into 1-inch pieces
5  small round red potatoes
1  large onion, chopped
4  large carrots, cut into 3/4-inch pieces
8  stalks celery, chopped
1 (7 oz.)  can sliced mushrooms, drained (optional)
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. frozen peas
2 1/2  c. tomato juice
1/4  c. plus 1 Tbsp. quick cooking tapioca (uncooked)
preparation
      Preheat the oven to 250°. Combine all ingredients except tomato juice and peas in a large roaster or Dutch oven. Stir well. Pour tomato juice over mixture. Cover and bake at 250° for 5 hours. Stir in peas and return to oven for 10 more minutes. Makes 6 servings.

DRIP BEEF ON BUNS
ingredients
5  lb. boneless rump roast (lean)
1  Tbsp. garlic salt
1/2  tsp. oregano
2  beef bouillon cubes
1/2  tsp. rosemary
1  pkg. au jus mix
1  Tbsp. minced onion
3/4  Tbsp. seasoned salt
1  pkg. wheatberry rolls
preparation
      Remove excess fat; the leaner, the better. Place in Dutch oven or crock-pot. Put in seasonings; barely cover with water and simmer 8 to 10 hours covered in slow oven. When done, lift meat to platter; shred with fork and return to pot. Serve on warm buns. Serves 12.
