Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

GAIL'S ITALIAN BEEF
ingredients
4 to 5  lb. pot roast
1  can beef broth
1  can beer
7  oz. Good Seasons Italian dressing mix
2  c. water
1  tsp. oregano
  pepper to taste
1 small  jar pepperoncini
1  can mushrooms
preparation
      Place roast in covered baking dish.  Add beef broth, seasoning mix, water, oregano and pepperoncini.  Cover and bake at 275° for 5 hours until tender.  Remove meat from pan and shred.  Place meat back in pan, add pepperoncini and mushrooms.  Cook 30 minutes more.

CHEESE BEEF SPREAD
ingredients
2  Tbsp. Dijon mustard
2  Tbsp. horseradish
1  small onion, minced or chopped green onions
1  pkg. corned beef
1  pkg. cream cheese, softened
preparation
      Chop corned beef in food processor, then blend all together. Serve on crackers.

LAYERED BEEF VEGETABLE CASSEROLE
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. ground beef
1  c. chopped green pepper
1  large (1/2 lb.) potato, peeled and sliced
1 (28 oz.)  can tomatoes, mashed
1  c. sliced onion
2  tsp. salt
1  c. thinly sliced carrot
1/3  c. long grain rice (uncooked)
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°. Sauté ground beef, onions and green pepper until beef is browned. Drain fat. Add salt and mix well. Place sliced potato in bottom of 2 1/2-quart baking dish. Alternate layers of carrots, rice and meat. Pour mashed tomatoes over casserole and cover. Bake for 2 hours.

CHICKEN BREAST AND DRIED BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
6  boneless chicken breasts
1 (8 oz.)  carton sour cream
2  cans cream of chicken soup
1  jar or pack dried beef
preparation
	Pound chicken breasts to flatten them. In a 2-quart casserole dish, line bottom with dried beef. Place chicken breasts on top of dried beef. Place layer of dried beef on top of chicken breasts. Mix together sour cream and cream of chicken soup. Spread over all ingredients. Bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  onion, chopped
1  c. sour cream
1  can cream of mushroom soup
2  Tbsp. flour
  salt and pepper
1/2  lb. fresh mushrooms, sliced or 1 small can sliced mushrooms
preparation
      Brown ground beef and onion; drain off excess fat. Stir in flour, salt and pepper. Stir in cream of mushroom soup and sour cream. Add mushrooms and let simmer for a few minutes.
      Serve over noodles or rice.

BARBECUE BEEF BRISKET
ingredients
1  tsp. hickory smoke
  garlic salt
  seasoned salt
  celery salt
1/2  bottle Open Pit barbecue original sauce
preparation
      Brush brisket with hickory smoke on both sides.  Rub well with the 3 salts.  Marinate overnight.  Cover tightly in refrigerator. Bake, covered, at 250° for 3 hours.  Pour off half the juice and turn and bake 1 hour longer.  Pour barbecue sauce over and bake 1 hour longer.  Let cool and slice thinly.  Put in shallow baking dish covered with foil and freeze.  Reheat to serve.  This is so good to prepare and put into as many servings as you need for company later and freeze.

BEEF SOUP
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. lean ground beef
1  garlic clove, minced
1  large onion, chopped
1  qt. vegetable juice
1  Tbsp. brown sugar
1  bay leaf
2 (10 3/4 oz.)  cans cream of celery soup (do not dilute)
2  c. carrots, thinly sliced
1  c. celery, thinly sliced
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
	Steam ground beef, garlic and onion together. Drain and put in a large soup pot. Add juice, sugar, bay leaf and cream of celery soup. Microwave carrots and celery until tender. Add to soup mixture. Simmer for 1/2 hour. Add salt and pepper. Serves 6 to 8.
	Tip: You could add almost any vegetable you'd like to this soup or add some pasta the last 7 minutes of cooking.

GROUND BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1 (4 oz.)  can mushrooms, drained
1  tsp. salt
1 (10 1/2 oz.)  can cream of chicken soup
8  oz. sour cream
1/2  c. onion, finely chopped
2  Tbsp. flour
1/2  tsp. paprika
preparation
      Brown ground beef and onion in skillet. Add mushrooms, flour, salt and paprika. Stir in soup. Cook slowly, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently. Add sour cream and cook for about 8 minutes. Serve over cooked noodles or rice.

BILL'S BEEF DIP
ingredients
2  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1/2  c. sour cream
1  large onion, chopped
1/4  tsp. black pepper
  crushed red pepper to taste
5  oz. pack/jar sliced dried beef
  walnuts or pecans, chopped (optional)
preparation
      Mix all the ingredients with the cream cheese. If desired, sprinkle nuts on top. Serve with wheat crackers.

BEEF STROGANOFF SANDWICH
ingredients
2  lb. ground beef
1/2  c. chopped onion
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  loaf French bread
  butter or margarine, softened
2  c. (16 oz.) sour cream
2  tomatoes, seeded and diced
1  large green pepper, diced
3  c. (12 oz.) shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
      In a skillet, brown ground beef and onion; drain. Add salt, garlic powder and pepper. Cut bread lengthwise in half; butter both halves and place on baking sheets. Remove meat mixture from the heat; stir in sour cream. Spoon onto the bread. Sprinkle with tomatoes, green pepper and cheese. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. (Bake longer for crispier bread.) Yield: 8 to 10 servings.

PERUVIAN GROUND BEEF (CAPOS)
ingredients
1  head cabbage
1  lb. ground beef
1/2  lb. white rice, cooked
4  cans of tomato sauce
3  onions, chopped
5  bay leaves
2  long sausages, pork or beef
preparation
	Boil cabbage about 30 minutes.	Take cabbage and start peeling the leaves.  Cook ground beef until brown.	Cook rice. Mix tomato sauce and chopped onions together with bay leaves.  Cut sausages in small portions. Mix sauce and meats together.  Stuff into cabbage leaves.  Let cook for 45 minutes; then ready to eat.

BEEF ROAST
ingredients
1  pkg. Lipton dry onion soup
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1  can cream of chicken soup
  potatoes
  carrots
1  (3 to 3 1/2 lb.) roast
preparation
      Butter bottom and 1/2 way up sides of pan.  Sprinkle onion soup in bottom of pan.  Lay roast on top of soup.  Put potatoes and carrots around roast.  Mix soups and 1 1/2 to 2 soup cans of water.  Pour on top of roast.  Cover and cook at 350° for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.

ROAST BEEF ROLL UPS
ingredients
  One pkg. (8-10 qty.) of 10-inch flour tortillas
  Ten large slices of deli roast beef, thin, but not "see through"
  One large head of green leaf lettuce (Does not work well with iceberg or romaine)
  One jar of horseradish sauce or mayonnaise
preparation
      Determine how many sandwiches you will need, and buy beef and tortillas accordingly.  These are made with the 10-inch fajita tortilla and can be cut in half if you want.  Spread each of the tortillas liberally with the horseradish sauce.  If you have folks that don't care for horseradish, I have used plain mayonnaise.  It just doesn't have the same zip!  Place one slice of roast beef in the center of the tortilla and top with a large leaf of lettuce. Roll up and place face down in a 9 x 13 pan to keep from unrolling.  Repeat with the remainder of tortillas and beef. Cover with Saran Wrap and refrigerate.  These are actually better if you can make them a day ahead.  Slice in half if you want before serving.

BEEF TACO CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  medium onion, chopped
1  pkg. taco seasoning mix
1  c. crushed corn chips
1 15  oz. can chili beans
1/2  c. shredded cheddar cheese
  Chopped lettuce and tomatoes
preparation
      Place corn chips in greased baking dish. Mix taco seasoning with meat and pour over chips. Spoon beans over beef and bake at 350°F. for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle cheese on top. Place back in oven for 5 minutes. Remove and garnish with lettuce and tomatoes.

CORNED BEEF AND CABBAGE
ingredients
3  carrots, cut into thick slices
1  (3 lb.) corned beef brisket
2  medium onions, quartered
1  c. water
1/2  to 1 small head cabbage, cut into wedges
preparation
	Put all ingredients, except cabbage wedges, in crock-pot in order listed. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours (on high for 5 to 6 hours). Add cabbage wedges to liquid, pushing down to moisten. Turn to high and cook an additional 2 to 3 hours. Makes 12 to 14 servings.
	For a 5 1/2-quart unit, you may cook a 2 to 3 pound corned beef brisket. Add listed amounts of vegetables and cook as directed.

CORNED BEEF SALAD
ingredients
2  c. curly macaroni
3  c. chicken or 1 can tuna or corned beef
4  or 5 medium shredded carrots
3  c. celery
4  boiled eggs
1 small  can peas, drained
1/2 small  can chopped pimento
1  medium onion
1  c. green grapes, cut in half
  Miracle Whip, with about 1/2 c. sugar
preparation
      Mix together.

NO PEEK BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
2  lb. beef stew meat (1-inch pieces)
1 (1 3/8 oz.)  envelope dry onion soup mix
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can cream of mushroom soup
1 (4 oz.)  can whole mushrooms
1/2  c. quick cooking tapioca (red and white box)
preparation
	Combine all ingredients in crock-pot. Stir together well. Cover and cook 5 hours on high or 8 to 12 hours on low.

BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
1  lb. stewing beef, cut in strips
1 large  can beef broth
1/2  c. water
1  c. sour cream
1  c. chopped onion
1  can mushroom soup
3  c. noodles (uncooked)
preparation
      In large pan, cook beef with onions until tender.  Add broth, mushroom soup and water.  Cover and heat to boiling (stir often). Reduce heat to low.  Add noodles and sour cream.  Simmer about 10 to 15 minutes until noodles are tender.

SPICY BEEF SALAD
ingredients
1/2  lb. boneless sirloin steak
1/3  c. fresh lime juice
1  Tbsp. brown sugar
1  Tbsp. soy sauce
1  Tbsp. minced fresh basil, or 1 tsp. dried basil
2  tsp. minced fresh mint or 3/4 tsp. dried mint
1  jalapeno pepper, minced
2  to 3 garlic cloves, minced
1  tsp. grated fresh gingerroot or 1/4 to 1/2 tsp. ground ginger
1  large sweet red pepper, julienned
1/2  medium cucumber, chopped
6  c. torn mixed salad greens
preparation
      Partially freeze beef. Slice across the grain into thin strips; set aside. For dressing, combine lime juice, sugar, soy sauce, basil and mint; set aside. In a medium nonstick skillet that has been coated with nonstick cooking spray, sauté jalapeno, garlic and ginger for 30 seconds. Add beef; stir fry until cooked as desired. Remove beef from pan; gently toss with red pepper and cucumber. Place greens in a large bowl or divide among individual bowls or plates; top with beef mixture. Add dressing to pan and bring to a boil; remove from heat and drizzle over salad. Serve immediately. This has 11 grams carbohydrate.

TEXAS BEEF SKILLET
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
3/4  c. chopped onion
1 (16 oz.)  can tomatoes, cut up
1 (15 1/2 oz.)  can red kidney beans
1/2  c. quick-cooking rice
3  Tbsp. chopped green pepper
1 1/2  tsp. chili powder
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
3/4  c. shredded American cheese
  corn chips, crushed
preparation
      In a skillet, cook ground beef and onion until meat is browned and onion is tender. Drain off fat. Stir in the undrained tomatoes, undrained beans, uncooked rice, green pepper, chili powder, garlic salt, 1/2 cup water and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Top with cheese. Cover and heat about 3 minutes or until cheese melts. Sprinkle corn chips around the edge. Serves 6.

THE BEST BEEF STEW
ingredients
2  lb. boneless stew beef
2  onions, chopped
1  or 2 garlic cloves, to taste
1  Tbsp. salt
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  tsp. sugar
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/2  tsp. black pepper
1/2  tsp. paprika
2  bay leaves
  dash of cloves
4  cups water
4  carrots, sliced
6  medium potatoes, cubed
15  oz. can peas
15  oz. can whole kernel corn
  quart tomatoes
preparation
      Add to meat mixture and cook until vegetables are tender.

ITALIAN BEEF SANDWICHES
ingredients
1 14 1/2  oz. can beef broth
2  garlic cloves, minced
1  tsp. dried oregano
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  medium green pepper, thinly sliced into rings
1  lb. deli roast beef, thinly sliced
6  hoagie or submarine sandwich buns, split
preparation
      In skillet, bring broth, garlic, oregano and pepper to a boil.  Add green pepper.  Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered until tender, about 5 minutes.  Remove green pepper with slotted spoon; keep warm.  Return broth to boil; add beef and cover and remove from heat.  Let stand for 2 minutes or until heated through. Place beef and green pepper on buns.  Serve with broth for dipping.

TORTILLA BEEF ROLL-UPS
ingredients
8  oz. thinly sliced deli beef
3  Roma tomatoes, thinly sliced
1 1/2  c. curly leaf lettuce, torn into small pieces
1/2  c. fresh cilantro, chopped
3  (10-inch) soft flour tortillas
4  oz. cream cheese, softened
1  Tbsp. Dijon mustard
1  tsp. prepared horseradish
preparation
      Mix cream cheese, mustard and horseradish together until smooth; spread over the tortillas. Top each with lettuce, cilantro, beef and tomatoes. Roll up and then wrap with plastic wrap for at least 2 hours. Cut each roll into slices and serve.

ITALIAN BEEF
ingredients
3 to 4  lb. beef roast
1  onion, chopped
1/2  tsp. onion salt
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
1  Tbsp. Italian seasoning
1/2  tsp. oregano
1/4  tsp. basil
1/2  tsp. seasoned salt
1  tsp. accent
preparation
      Put roast in covered roaster and fill halfway with water. Add remaining ingredients. Bake covered at 325° for 4 to 5 hours or in crockpot  until well done and tender.
      If using crockpot method, begin on high temperature until it starts to simmer then turn to low and proceed.

MEXICAN CHICKEN/BEEF SOUP
ingredients
5  lb. chicken
6  to 8 corn-on-the-cob (yes, cobs, 3 to 4-inches wide)
1/2  cabbage, cut in wedges
5  potatoes, cut in 1/4 pieces
1 (14.5 oz.)  can diced tomatoes
2  onions, sliced in strips
1  bundle cilantro, chopped
1  green pepper
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato sauce
2  zucchini, diced
2  big carrots, sliced chunky
1  lime (optional)
1 1/2  gal. water
2  Tbsp. salt
preparation
      Cook chicken in 1 1/2 gallons water.  When chicken is half cooked, add potatoes and carrots.  When potatoes and carrots are cooked, add rest of ingredients with salt.  Soup should be cooked at least 1 hour and 30 minutes on medium flame.  When serving, squeeze lime into soup in bowl.

MOM'S COMPANY BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. noodles
1  lb. ground round
2 (8 oz.)  cans tomato sauce
1  c. cottage cheese
1 (8 oz.)  sq. Philadelphia Cream Cheese
1/4  c. sour cream
1/3  c. green onions, chopped
1  Tbsp bell pepper, minced
preparation
	Boil noodles; drain and rinse.	Brown meat lightly.  Add tomato sauce and set aside.  Mix cottage cheese, cream cheese, sour cream, onion and bell pepper with electric mixer until smooth.  Put 2/3 of noodles in 2 1/2 quart casserole.  Add all of cheese mixture (layer on top).  Add rest of noodles and meat (layer over top).  Cover and chill overnight.  Cook 1 hour at 375°, covered.

INMATE ROAST BEEF SPREAD
ingredients
2  cans roast beef
2  cans chili with beans
1/4  bottle cheese (squeeze type)
4  jalapeno peppers
1/2  bag corn chips
2  pkg. Ramen noodles
1  pkg. flour tortillas
preparation
      Mix everything except the flour tortillas together and heat thoroughly. Place mixture in flour tortillas and enjoy. Serves 4.

BEEF GOULASH
ingredients
4  lb. beef chuck roast, trimmed and cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes
3  medium large onions, chopped coarse
6 medium  cloves garlic, minced
5  Tbsp. sweet paprika
1/2  c. flour
3  c. homemade chicken stock or canned stock
2  Tbsp. tomato paste
2  bay leaves
1  tsp. dried marjoram
2  large red bell peppers, stemmed, seeded and chopped coarse
1/2  c. sour cream
1/2  c. minced fresh parsley leaves
preparation
      Brown meat in skillet, making sure to brown on all sides and not to crowd pan. Meat should not touch other meat. Place in slow cooker. Place onion in skillet and cook until translucent. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Place in slow cooker. Add stock to skillet and scrape up brown pieces. Take 2 3/4 cups of the stock and put in slow cooker. Add flour to remaining stock and whisk until thickened. Add to slow cooker. Add remaining ingredients, except for sour cream and parsley leaves, and stir. Set slow cooker for desired time. Serve with buttered egg noodles, preferably wide. Garnish with sour cream and parsley.

BEEF AND VEGETABLE STIR-FRY
ingredients
3/4  c. beef broth
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
1/4  c. teriyaki sauce
2  Tbsp. vegetable or peanut oil
1/2  c. red pepper, cut in 1-inch by 1/4-inch strips
1  c. diagonally sliced asparagus cut in 1/2-inch pieces
1/4  c. sliced green onions
1/2  lb. sirloin steak, cut in 1/2-inch strips
1  pkg. Pepperidge Farm frozen puff pastry shells, baked according to package directions
preparation
      In a small bowl, mix beef broth with cornstarch and teriyaki sauce.  In a large skillet or wok, heat 1 tablespoon oil over high heat; add asparagus, pepper and onions; stir-fry until tender-crisp.  Remove to bowl.  Add remaining oil and beef; stir-fry until cooked.  Add beef broth mixture and cook, stirring constantly until thickened; add vegetables and toss.  Serve in warm pastry shells.

BEEF AND BEAN BURRITO
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  jar thick 'n chunky salsa
1  pkg. taco seasoning mix
1  can refried beans
1  can green chilies, chopped
10  flour tortillas
1  c. shredded cheese
preparation
      Brown ground beef; drain fat.  Drain salsa; reserve liquid. Add seasoning mix, beans, chilies and liquid from salsa.  Simmer, uncovered, 5 minutes.  Prepare flour tortillas.  Top with lettuce and cheese and 1 tablespoon of salsa.  Fold edge of tortillas over to cover filling.  Fold envelope style and roll.  Serves 10.

BEEF AND DRESSING CASSEROLE
ingredients
1/2  pkg. sage and onion dressing (Brownberry Farms)
1 1/2  lb. ground beef
3  stalks celery
1  medium onion
1  can cream of chicken soup
1  can cream of celery soup
1  can mushrooms (optional)
preparation
      Put dressing in a bowl with 1 cup hot water.  Cover and let stand (set aside).  Brown hamburger with chopped celery and onion - no salt.  Add cream of chicken soup and put in bottom of a casserole.  Spread dressing on top of meat.  Add 1/2 cup water to cream of celery soup and pour over all.  May add mushrooms to this if desired.  Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes.

CRUSTY BEEF, CHEESE AND NOODLE CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1  onion, chopped
2  lb. ground beef
4 (10 1/4 oz.)  cans meatless mushroom sauce
  salt and pepper to taste
1  lb. fine noodles, cooked and drained
1  lb. shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
preparation
	Preheat oven to 325°.  Heat oil. Brown meat and onions. Add mushroom sauce, salt and pepper. Heat thoroughly.  Arrange in a casserole dish a layer of noodles, sauce and cheese. Repeat layers. Bake for 1 hour. Serves 8 to 10.

FLEMISH BEEF-AND-BEER STEW
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. boneless chuck or round steak (1-inch thick)
1/4  lb. bacon
4  medium onions, sliced
1  clove garlic, chopped
3  Tbsp. flour
1  c. water
1  can light or dark beer (12 or 16 oz.)
1  bay leaf
1  Tbsp. brown sugar, packed
2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. dried thyme leaves
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  Tbsp. vinegar
  snipped parsley
  hot cooked noodles
preparation
      Cut beef into 1/2-inch slices; cut slices into 2-inch strips. (For ease in cutting, partially freeze beef about 1 1/2 hours.) Cut bacon into 1/4-inch pieces; fry in Dutch oven until crisp. Remove bacon with slotted spoon; drain on paper towels.  Pour off fat and reserve.  Cook and stir onions and garlic in 2 tablespoons of the reserved bacon fat until tender, about 10 minutes.  Remove onions.  Cook and stir beef in remaining bacon fat until brown, about 15 minutes.  Stir in flour to coat beef; gradually stir in water.  Add onions, beer, bay leaf, brown sugar, salt, thyme and pepper.  Add just enough water to cover beef if necessary.  Heat to boiling; reduce heat.  Cover and simmer until beef is tender, 1 to 1 1/2 hours.  Remove bay leaf.  Stir in vinegar; sprinkle with bacon and parsley.  Serve with noodles.  Yield:  6 servings.

BEEF OR CHICKEN GRAVY
ingredients
4  c. beef broth or chicken broth
3  Tbsp. cornstarch
1/4  c. water
1/2  tsp. dry thyme
1/4  tsp. black pepper
preparation
      Bring the broth to a boil in a medium saucepan.  Boil until reduced by one third volume or approximately for 10 minutes.  In a small bowl combine cornstarch and water.  Gradually add to the hot broth, stirring constantly.  Cook over low heat, stir constantly for 5 minutes or until thickened.  Add the thyme or pepper.  Stir to mix.

RICE AND BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
2  c. rice
1 1/2  lb. ground beef
1/2  c. onion, chopped
1/2  c. celery, chopped
1/2  c. green pepper, chopped
10  oz. (1 can) soup, cream of chicken
1  lb. Velveeta cheese
1  tsp. garlic salt
preparation
      Cook rice according to package directions and set aside.
      In a skillet, brown together:  beef, onion, celery and green pepper.  Drain and set aside.
      In a sauce pan, mix together:  soup, cheese and garlic salt. Cook over medium heat until cheese melts.  Pour cheese mixture over rice and mix well.  Add ground beef mixture and mix well. Pour into a 9x13-inch casserole dish.
      Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.  Serve hot.

CABBAGE BEEF ROLLS
ingredients
10  to 12 cabbage leaves
1  lb. ground beef
3  Tbsp. onions, chopped
3  Tbsp. sweet pepper, chopped
3  Tbsp. celery, chopped
1  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/2  c. cooked rice
1  tsp. salt
  dash of pepper
preparation
      Wilt cabbage. Cover and set aside. Mix remaining ingredients. Drain leaves and spoon meat mixture in each leaf. Roll up and place in baking dish.
Sauce:
ingredients
1  c. tomato juice
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/8  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. seasoning salt
1  Tbsp. butter
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato sauce (optional)
preparation
      Heat all ingredients. Pour over rolls. Cover. Bake for 1 hour at 350°.
      Variations: If you use tomato sauce, use less tomato juice. Cabbage may be cut in small chunks and placed in bottom of dish, then top with meat mixture and grated cheese.

SAVORY BEEF STEW
ingredients
16  oz. (2 pkg.) stew vegetables (frozen)
1/4  c. water
30  oz. (1 pkg.) Beef Tips with Gravy (Hormel brand)
1/4  c. ketchup
preparation
      Place frozen stew vegetables and water in large microwave-safe casserole dish.  Cover and cook on high for 12 to 14 minutes, or until vegetables are cooked through.  Stir in Beef Tips with Gravy and ketchup.  Cover and return to microwave.  Heat 8 minutes, or until warmed thoroughly.

CROCK POT BEEF STEW
ingredients
1  1/2 lbs. stew meat
1  onion, chopped
2  c. chopped celery
2  c. chopped carrots
2  c. cubed potatoes (red potatoes)
1  can tomato soup
1  can cream of mushroom soup
  Salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Put all in crock pot and cook on low 6-8 hours.  (Do not dilute soups.)

DELUXE BEEF ROAST
ingredients
4 - 5  lb. top round or boneless rolled rump roast
1/2  C. light dry sherry
3/4  lb. lrg. sweet onion, sliced
2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/2  C. butter or margarine
1 1/2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/2  tsp. salt
8  oz. can sliced mushrooms
3 beef bouillon cubes dissolved in 1 1/2  C. hot water
preparation
      Bake roast in covered roaster at 325 degrees for 3 - 4 hour or until done.
      In large skillet heat butter and sauté onions until tender. Add sherry, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, salt, mushrooms, bouillon liquid and roast juices.  Simmer for 5 minutes.
      After meat is done cooking, slice meat thinly and put the slices in a slow cooker.  Pour above liquid over the meat slices. Refrigerate meat and liquid overnight.  The day you are ready to serve, just heat in the slow cooker until warm.

DRIED BEEF SPREAD
ingredients
1 (2 1/2 oz.)  jar dried beef
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
2  Tbsp. milk
1/2  c. chopped green onions
1/2  tsp. dried dill weed
1/4  tsp. salt
preparation
      Chop dried beef into small pieces. Combine with softened cream cheese, milk, onions, dill weed and salt, mixing until smooth. Chill and serve with crackers.

BEEF-TOMATO-POTATO CASSEROLE
ingredients
3  large potatoes, sliced
  salt and pepper to taste
1  lb. ground beef
1 medium  can tomatoes
1/4  tsp. oregano (optional)
  onion, sliced (optional)
preparation
      Arrange layer of potatoes in buttered 1 1/2-quart casserole; season with salt and pepper. Put ground beef on top of potatoes; pour tomatoes over beef. Sprinkle with oregano and spread with slices of onion. Cover and bake at 350° about 45 minutes. Remove lid and brown.

CORNED BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  pkg. dry onion soup mix
1  can corned beef
1  can refrigerated biscuits
preparation
      Add water required on envelope of dry soup mix.  Add the corned beef into chunks.  Bring to boil.  The corned beef will separate as it cooks.  Put into a casserole dish.  Top with biscuits and bake until they are done.  Bake at 350°.

VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP
ingredients
2 1/2  lb. diced potatoes
2  c. thin sliced carrots
3  c. baby lima beans
2 1/2  lb. lean hamburger
2  cans yellow corn
1  (46 oz.) tomato juice
1 medium  can tomato sauce
1/2  c. fine chopped onion
  water (enough to cover potatoes, carrots and beans)
preparation
	Cook potatoes, carrots and lima beans until slightly cooked. Brown and drain hamburger and add to vegetables. Add corn, juice, onion and sauce. Salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for about 2 hours.

CAMPBELL'S BEEF TACO BAKE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can Campbell's condensed tomato soup
1  c. Pace thick and chunky salsa
1/2  c. milk
6  flour tortillas or 8 corn tortillas (6 to 8-inch) cut into 1-inch pieces
1  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
      In a skillet over medium-high heat, cook beef until browned, stirring to separate meat. Pour off fat. Add soup, salsa, milk, tortillas and 1/2 of the cheese. Spoon into a 2-quart shallow baking dish. Cover. Bake at 400° for 30 minutes or until hot. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Yield: 4 servings.

BEEF AND BEANS
ingredients
3 1/2  lb. roast
2 1/2  c. pinto beans (dried)
1  can Ro-Tel tomatoes, mashed
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1  can beef broth
1  large onion, chopped
  salt and pepper
preparation
      Put roast in slow cooker and add everything around it. Cover. Cook at 250° for 10 to 12 hours.

TANGY GRILLED BEEF
ingredients
1  can tomato soup
2  Tbsp. packed brown sugar
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  tsp. garlic powder
1/4  tsp. dried thyme leaves, crushed
1 1/2  lb. boneless beef sirloin steak, 3/4 inch thick
preparation
      Mix soup, sugar, lemon juice, oil, Worcestershire, garlic powder & thyme. Place steak on lightly oiled grill rack over medium- hot coals. Grill uncovered to desired doneness (allow 15 minutes for medium), turning once & brushing often with soup mixture. Heat remaining soup mixture to a boil & serve with steak.

BEEF LOG
ingredients
2  lb. hamburger meat
1  c. water
2  Tbsp. Morton Tender Quick curing salt
1 1/2  tsp. liquid smoke
1/2  tsp. powdered garlic
1  Tbsp. coarse ground pepper
  dash of ground red pepper or cayenne (optional)
preparation
      Mix well. Roll in 1/2-inch rolls (this makes about 5 rolls). Wrap tightly in plastic wrap. Store in refrigerator for 24 hours; place on broiler pan. Bake at 300° for 1 1/2 hours. Cool. Keep refrigerated or frozen.

SOFT BEEF TACOS
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  small onion, minced
2  cloves garlic, minced
1/2  green pepper, chopped
1  jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced
1  c. water
1  tsp. ground cumin
1  tsp. chili powder
1/2  tsp. dried whole oregano
1/4  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
8  (7-inch) flour tortillas
2  c. shredded lettuce
2  tomatoes, chopped
1  c. (4 oz.) shredded Cheddar cheese
1 (8 oz.)  carton commercial guacamole
  commercial taco or picante sauce
preparation
      Cook first 5 ingredients in a large skillet until meat is browned, stirring to crumble. Drain well. Stir in water, cumin, chili powder, oregano, salt and pepper. Cover and simmer over low heat 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Uncover and cook 8 to 10 minutes.
       Wrap tortillas securely in aluminum foil. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Spoon about 1/8 of meat mixture lengthwise down center of a tortilla. Top with about 1/8 each of lettuce, tomato, cheese, guacamole and desired amount of taco sauce. Fold bottom third of tortilla over filling. Fold sides of tortilla in toward center, leaving top open. Secure with wooden picks, if necessary. Repeat with remaining tortillas and fillings. Serve with additional taco sauce, if desired. Yield: 8 tacos.

ITALIAN BEEF IN THE CROCK-POT
ingredients
4 to 5  lb. roast, cut up in chunks
2  to 3 beef bouillon cubes
1  tsp. garlic salt
2  Tbsp. Italian dressing
preparation
      Place meat, bouillon cubes, garlic salt and Italian dressing in crock-pot.  Add enough water to cover beef.  Cook on low for 8 hours.  Serve with garlic bread and salad.

MARIE CHOPLIN'S CORNED BEEF MOLD
("The Best")  
ingredients
1  pkg. lemon Jell-O
1  c. chopped celery
1  small onion, minced
1  c. mayonnaise
1  small green pepper, diced
1  can corned beef
preparation
      Stir lemon Jell-O into 1 cup of boiling water until dissolved. Remove from stove and let mixture cool. Mix with the remaining ingredients and pour into a mold. Refrigerate overnight.

HOMEMADE VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP
ingredients
3  lb. chuck roast
  beef suet (if roast is lean)
4  carrots
4  ham hocks with bone
2 1/2  lb. red potatoes, finely cubed (about 2 1/2 cups cooked)
1  lb. sliced okra (frozen or fresh, but thaw if frozen)
2  Tbsp. vegetable oil
3  cans (28 oz. each) whole tomatoes
2  c. onions, coarsely chopped
4  large sections garlic, minced
1  Tbsp. salt
1  tsp. ground black pepper
  baby lima beans
  speckled butter beans
  green beans
  purple hull peas
  whole kernel corn
preparation
      Clean and cut carrots crosswise in 2 inch pieces;  place in 5 quart cooking pan.  Wash roast, cut up in large pieces, season with salt, ground black pepper and garlic salt.  Transfer meat to 5 quart pan with carrots; add water to top of meat.  Cook covered for 2 hours or longer until very tender.  OR, cook in pressurized cooker (i.e., Presto cooker) with water up to top of meat for 40 minutes.  Remove meat to large bowl or rectangular pan, reserving broth.  Discard suet.  Trim fat from meat and cut into small pieces.  Remove carrots to a small bowl.  Set meat and carrots aside.  Strain beef broth into separate bowl, add water, if necessary, to make 2 cups; set broth aside.
       While beef is cooking, cook vegetables (except corn) separately on cook top, each with a ham hock, as directed on package if frozen (season with salt).  OR, when meat is done, cook each vegetable (except corn) with a ham hock and salt in Presto cooker for 12 minutes each.  Transfer each vegetable to a separate small bowl.  Separate meat from ham hocks and place in a small bowl; discard bones and fat and skin.  Season corn with butter and salt; cook in microwave or stovetop per package directions...fresh corn is great.
      Pour cubed raw potatoes in a 3 quart pan; add water to top of potatoes and cook until done.  Set aside.
      Fry okra in vegetable oil until light tan.  Pour into small bowl and set aside.
      Coarsely chop tomatoes and pour into a 5 quart stockpot; add chopped onions,  garlic and okra.  Cook on medium heat, for about 1 1/2 hours.  Stir in broth, add vegetables to measure 1 cup each (add corn last, as it sticks easily), add 2 1/2 cups potatoes, beef and ham hock meats.
      Slice carrots into soup mixture.  Add salt and pepper; adjust seasoning to taste.  Cook for about 30 minutes;  stir in 1 cup corn.   Reserve leftover vegetables for another use.

EL DORADO BEEF-CHEESE CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  Tbsp. instant minced onion
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
2 (8 oz.)  cans tomato sauce
1  c. sliced ripe olives
1  c. (1/2 pt.) dairy sour cream
1  c. small curd cottage cheese
3 to 4 canned chiles, seeded and chopped (you  can use 2 or 3 depending on how hot you like it)
1  pkg. crisp tortilla chips (corn flavor)
2  c. (1/2 lb.) grated Monterey Jack cheese
preparation
      Place beef in cold skillet and brown. Add onion, garlic salt and tomato sauce. Combine sour cream and cottage cheese with green chilies. Crush tortilla chips in bottom of well-buttered 2 1/2-quart casserole. Add half the meat mixture; cover with half the sour cream mixture. Sprinkle with half the grated cheese. Repeat layers. Bake, uncovered, in 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes. Garnish with reserved tortilla chips.

CORNED BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  can Libby's corned beef
1  can mushroom soup
1  can milk
1 1/2  c. grated cheese (Cheddar)
1 medium size  pkg. egg noodles
2  slices bread
preparation
      Boil noodles. Mix meat, soup, milk and 1 cup cheese. Pour over noodles. Dice and crumble bread on top and sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.

EASY BEEF STROGANOFF
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. ground beef
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
4  Tbsp. butter
1/2  lb. sliced mushrooms
1  medium onion, thin sliced
1  Tbsp. flour
2/3  c. evaporated milk
preparation
	Brown beef and drain. Season with salt and pepper. Add onions and mushrooms and cook until tender. Mix milk and flour. Add to meat mixture. Cook until thick. Serve over buttered noodles.

NO FUSS BEEF LASAGNA
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1/4  tsp. salt
1 (26 oz. to 30 oz.)  jar spaghetti sauce
1 (14 1/2 oz.)  can Italian diced tomatoes
1/4  tsp. total red and/or black pepper
1  carton Ricotta cheese
1/4  c. Parmesan cheese
1 1/2  c. grated Mozzarella cheese
1  egg, beaten
10  Lasagna noodles
preparation
      Brown meat (8 to 10 minutes).  Mix spaghetti sauce, tomatoes, salt and pepper.  In medium bowl, beat egg.  Add Ricotta and Parmesan cheeses.  Spread 2 cups of meat and sauce on 13 x 9-inch pan.  Arrange 5 noodles one at a time, pressing into meat mixture. Spread cheese mixture on noodles.  Sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese and top with 1 1/2 cups meat sauce.  Arrange another layer of noodles, pressing into meat.  Sprinkle Mozzarella cheese on top. Tent foil lightly.  Bake 45 minutes at approximately 350°. Remove from oven and let sit 15 minutes.  Cut into 3-inch squares. Serve.

CHIPPED BEEF DIP
ingredients
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1  c. sour cream
1  green pepper, chopped
1 large  jar dried chipped beef
preparation
	Chop beef. Add all ingredients and heat on low until cream cheese is smooth. Serve with crackers.

TEXAS BEEF SKILLET
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
3/4  c. chopped onions
1 (16 oz.)  can tomato catsup
1 (15 1/2 oz.)  can red kidney beans
1/2  c. quick cooking rice
3/4  c. shredded American cheese
1/2  c. water
3  Tbsp. chopped green peppers
1 1/2  tsp. chili powder
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
  corn chips, crushed
preparation
      Cook ground beef and onions until ground beef is brown and onions tender.  Drain fat.  Stir in undrained tomato, beans, rice, water, green pepper, chili powder, salt and garlic salt.  Bring to boil.  Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Top meat mixture with shredded cheese.  Cover and heat about 3 minutes or until cheese is melted.  Sprinkle corn chips around edges.  Makes 6 servings.

HOMEMADE BEEF SOUP
ingredients
  beef soup bones, or ribs or brisket
1  onion, sliced
1  can cream of potato soup
1  can drained English peas
1  c. chopped celery
1  c. sliced carrots
2  c. tomatoes or juice
1 or 2  tsp. picante sauce to taste
preparation
      Cover beef with  water;  add  salt  and slice of onion. Cook under pressure slowly 1 hour.  Debone and chip lean meat. Skim off fat and  add  other  ingredients.  Bring  to boil and cook slowly about  30  minutes,  until  celery and carrots are done.  (If soup is  too watery, add another can of potato soup to thicken.)

COMPANY BEEF
ingredients
2  lb. ground beef
5  oz. macaroni
1  Tbsp. catsup
  dash of oregano
  salt
1  c. grated cheese
1  medium onion, chopped
1 (15 oz.)  can tomatoes, blended
1  Tbsp. steak sauce
  dash of chili powder
  pepper
1  can mushroom soup
preparation
      Brown meat and onions; drain. Boil 5 ounces of macaroni; drain. Mix all together with everything except cheese. Sprinkle cheese on top. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

BEEF TACO BAKE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can tomato soup
1  c. salsa
1/2  c. milk
6  flour tortillas or 8 corn tortillas, cut into 1-inch pieces
1  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
      In skillet over medium heat, cook beef until browned, stirring to separate meat. Pour off fat. Add soup, salsa, milk, tortillas and 1/2 the cheese. Spoon into 2-quart shallow baking dish. COVER. Bake at 400° for 30 minutes or until hot. Sprinkle remaining cheese. Serves 4.

PARTY BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
3  Tbsp. all-purpose flour
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
2  lb. boneless round steak, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
2  Tbsp. cooking oil
1  c. water
1/2  c. beef broth
1  garlic clove, minced
1  Tbsp. dried minced onion
1/2  tsp. dried thyme
1/4  tsp. dried rosemary, crushed
2  c. sliced, fresh mushrooms
2  c. frozen peas, thawed
3  c. mashed potatoes (mashed with milk and butter)
1  Tbsp. butter or margarine, melted
  paprika
preparation
      In a large resealable plastic bag, combine flour, salt and pepper; add beef cubes and shake to coat. In a skillet over medium heat, brown beef in oil. Place beef and drippings in a greased, shallow 2 1/2-quart baking dish.
       To skillet, add water, broth, garlic, onion, thyme and rosemary; bring to a boil. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Stir in mushrooms. Pour over meat; mix well. Cover and bake at 350° for 1 1/2 to 1 3/4 hours or until beef is tender. Sprinkle peas over meat. Spread potatoes evenly over top. Brush with butter. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake 15 to 20 minutes more. Yield: 6 to 8 servings.

BEEF GOULASH
ingredients
1  lb. pkg. of pasta, your choice
2  lb. ground beef
1  medium onion, chopped fine
1  medium green pepper, chopped fine
1  Tbsp. garlic, chopped
  salt to taste
  pepper to taste
1 (10 1/2 oz.)  can of tomato soup
2 (1 lb.)  cans of chopped tomatoes, your choice
preparation
	Cook pasta according to directions on pkg.  Then drain. Brown ground beef along with onion, green pepper, garlic, salt and pepper.  Drain off as much fat as possible from cooked meat mixture.  Add the cooked meat mixture to cooked pasta.  Add the tomato soup and both cans of chopped tomatoes. (Do not drain the chopped tomatoes.)	Mix all ingredients together.  Heat on low on top of stove until good and hot.  Before serving, you may sprinkle on cheese.	Makes 4 generous servings.  Goes well with a salad and hot corn bread.

CORN BEEF BALL
ingredients
1 (10 oz.)  can corned beef
1/4  c. mayonnaise
8  oz. cream cheese
1  envelope onion soup (dry)
  dash of Worcestershire sauce
preparation
      Mix well and shape into a ball.  Serve with crackers of your choice.

SPINACH BEEF BISCUIT BAKE
ingredients
2  (7 1/2 oz.) tubes refrigerated buttermilk biscuits
1 1/2  lb. ground beef
1/2  c. finely chopped onion
2  eggs
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
1 (4 oz.)  can mushroom stems and pieces, drained
4  oz. crumbled Feta or shredded Monterey Jack cheese
1/4  c. Parmesan cheese
1 1/2  tsp. garlic powder
  salt and pepper to taste
1 to 2  Tbsp. butter or margarine, melted
preparation
      Press and flatten biscuits onto bottom and sides of a greased 11 x 7 x 2-inch baking dish; set aside.  In a skillet over medium heat, cook beef and onion until meat is no longer pink; drain.  In a bowl, beat eggs.  Add spinach and mushrooms; mix well.  Stir in cheese, garlic powder, salt, pepper and beef mixture; mix well. Spoon into prepared crust.  Drizzle with butter.  Bake, uncovered, at 375° for 25 to 30 minutes or until crust is lightly browned. Yield:  6 servings.

BEEF ROLL-UPS
ingredients
1  box stuffing mix
2  lb. round steak
2  c. water
8  Tbsp. butter
  salt and pepper
  chopped parsley
preparation
      Make stuffing according to directions on box.  Cut steak into thin pieces, about 4 1/2 x 2-inches; score.  Sprinkle with salt and pepper.  Spread some dressing on each piece of meat.  Roll up and fasten with skewer or toothpicks.  Roll in flour and brown in butter.  Add 2 cups water (meat stock is better) and simmer for 1 1/2 hours until tender.  Remove toothpicks.  Pour gravy over meat. Garnish with chopped parsley.  Serve with mashed potatoes.

BEEF BOURGUIGNON
ingredients
3  lb. beef sirloin steak
1/3  c. butter
3/4  lb. small mushrooms
1  c. small pearl onions, peeled
1/4  c. flour
2  c. beef bouillon
2  c. red wine
1  can (5 1/2-oz.) tomato paste
4  cloves garlic, minced
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. thyme
1  bay leaf
  Pepper
preparation
      Cut beef into bite-sized cubes.  In a large skillet heat half of the butter.  Add the mushrooms and brown very lightly.  Remove and set aside.  Add the remaining butter to the pan and brown the onions.  Remove and set aside.  Add the beef cubes to the pan in batches, browning on all sides.  Remove cubes as done, and continue until all beef has been browned.  Remove all beef cubes and set aside.  To the remaining fat in the pan stir the flour, then add the bouillon, wine, and tomato paste.  Bring to a boil and stir until thickened.  Add garlic, salt, thyme, bay leaf and pepper.
      Mix sauce and meat cubes together in a large casserole dish. Cover and bake at 350° for about 2 hours, until the meat is very tender.  Add the onions for the last half hour or cooking time, and the mushrooms for the last 15 minutes.  Remove from oven and discard bay leaf.  Makes 6-8 servings.

BEEF ENCHILADAS WITH CHEESE
ingredients
1  lb. lean ground beef or cooked and cubed chicken
1  c. grated Monterey Jack or Cheddar cheese
1 (2 1/2 oz.)  can sliced ripe olives, drained
1 (6 oz.)  can tomato paste
1 (1 5/8 oz.)  pkg. enchilada sauce mix
2  c. warm water
8  corn or flour tortillas (6 to 7-inch size)
1 1/2  c. grated Monterey Jack or Cheddar cheese
preparation
      In a 1 1/2-quart casserole, crumble meat.  Cook by microwave 4 minutes, stirring twice.  Drain fat.  Add 1 cup cheese and olives to meat.  In a 2 1/2-quart casserole, blend tomato paste with enchilada sauce mix.  Stir in water.  Cover and cook by microwave for 8 minutes.  Pour 1 cup prepared enchilada sauce in 7 1/2 x 12-inch baking dish.  Dip each tortilla into remaining heated sauce.  Spoon beef mixture in center of each tortilla.  Fold sides of tortilla over filling and place in baking dish, seam side down. Pour remaining sauce over the top.  Then top with 1 1/2 cups cheese; cover with plastic wrap.  Heat by microwave for 3 minutes. Makes 8 enchiladas.

BEEF STEW
ingredients
1  1/2 lbs. boneless beef
3  Tbsp. shortening
1 3/4  tsp. salt
  a few dashes of pepper
1  onion, the size of a large egg
4  to 5 carrots
4  or 5 potatoes
3  Tbsp. flour
1/3  c. water and more when needed
preparation
      Cut meat up into small pieces.  Heat shortening in a large pot on the stove.  Add meat, turning often till brown.  Add sliced onion to the last 5 minutes of browning.  When brown, sprinkle with 1 tsp. salt and pepper.  Add water, cover and heat to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer until meat is done, about 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Add more water if needed.
      Slice carrots and potatoes and add to meat.  Pour in enough water to cover vegetables.  Add rest of salt and cook until vegetables are done.  Then stir together flour and 1/3 cup water to make a thickening.  Pour into stew and cook about 2 to 3 minutes.

NO PEEP BEEF CASSEROLE
ingredients
2  lb. lean stew meat, cut in 1-inch pieces
1  envelope onion soup mix
1/2  c. red wine
1  can mushroom soup
1 (4 oz.)  can mushrooms
preparation
      Combine all ingredients and put in covered casserole. Bake at 300° for 3 hours. Do not peep until 3 hours have passed. Serve over rice or noodles. Meat will be very tender.

CHRISTMAS ROCKS
ingredients
4  eggs
3  sticks butter
1 1/4  c. sugar
3  c. flour
1/2  tsp. cinnamon
1/2  tsp. nutmeg
1/2  tsp. ground cloves
3  tbsp. orange juice
1  lb. candied cherries
1  lb. candied pineapple
2  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Chop cherries, pineapple and pecans.  Pour orange juice over fruit and let stand 1 hour.  Sprinkle 1 1/2 c. flour over fruit & nut mixture.  Mix eggs, butter, sugar, 1 1/2 c. flour, cinnamon, nutmeg and cloves.  Add fruit mixture and mix well.  Spoon onto cookie sheet.  Bake at 350 degrees until edges are brown.  Cookies will be soft.

CHRISTMAS FUN FOR THE KIDS
ingredients
2  c. flour
1/2  tsp. baking soda
1/2  tsp. salt
2  c. warm water
  cookie cutters
  small paint brush
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Blend all ingredients until well mixed. You may have to add more flour if too wet or more water if too dry. Flour working area and roll dough out until 1/4 inch thick.  Dip cookie cutter in the flour and cut out ornaments.  Place on lightly greased cookie sheet.  Use the end of the paint brush to punch a hole in the top to hang by.  Decorate with paints, glitter and ribbon.

CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  pkg. hash browns (or shredded baked potato)
1  stick margarine
  salt and pepper
4  eggs (I use Eggbeaters for cholesterol free)
1  can chopped green chiles
1/2  chopped green pepper
1/2  chopped onion
1/2  chopped Polish sausage (I use turkey-fat free)
1/2  c. chopped ham
3/4  c. shredded cheese (cheddar or Monterey Jack)
preparation
      Mix hash browns, margarine, salt and pepper and press into 8 x 12 pan.  Bake at 400 until golden brown.  I do this the day before and store in refrigerator.  Combine remaining ingredients and pour into cooked hash brown crust.  Bake until eggs are set, about 20 minutes, in 375 degree oven.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
1 46 oz  can pineapple juice
1 46 oz  can of water
2  c sugar
4  pkg any flavor Kool Aid
1/4  c lemon juice
1  quart ginger ale
preparation
      Mix well,  all but ginger ale.  Add ginger ale just before serving.

CHRISTMAS MORNING BREAKFAST PIE
ingredients
1  lb. sausage
9  inch pie shell
1 1/2  c. grated swiss cheese
1/2  c. bell pepper
1/2  c. red pepper
2  tsp. onion chopped
4  eggs beaten
1  c. light cream
preparation
	Cook sausage, drain, add cheese, mix well.  Sprinkle  mixture in pie shell.  Beat eggs, add onions, peppers, and cream.  Pour in pie shell bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes.  Cool 10 minutes. Serve. Garnish with red and bell peppers. Can be refrigerated overnight and baked the next morning. This is great for a quick breakfast on Christmas morning.
