CHRISTMAS FRUIT SALAD
ingredients
3  egg yolks, beaten
3  Tbsp. water
3  Tbsp. vinegar
1/2  tsp. salt
2  c. whipping cream, whipped
3  c. miniature marshmallows
2  c. halves green grapes
1 (20 oz.)  can pineapple tidbits, drained
1 (11 oz.)  can mandarin oranges, drained
1 (10 oz.)  jar red maraschino cherries, drained and sliced
1  c. chopped pecans
3  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      In a large saucepan, combine egg yolks, water, vinegar and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and reaches 160°. Remove from heat and cool. Fold in whipped cream.
       In a large bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Add dressing. Toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Yield: 12 to 14 servings.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1 1/2  c. brown sugar
1/4  c. shortening
4  eggs
3  Tbsp. buttermilk
1  tsp. baking soda
2  c. all purpose flour
1  lb. candied pineapple
1  lb. candied cherries
1  lb. candied dates
1  c. flour, to dredge fruit in
6  c. pecans
1/4  c. grape juice
preparation
      Cream sugar and shortening; add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.  Add buttermilk, soda and 2 cups of flour.  Cut candied fruits into small pieces and dredge pieces in 1 cup flour.  Mix in fruits and nuts; add grape juice.  Drop on cookie sheet with spoon.  Bake at 300 for 20 minutes.  Makes 4-5 dozen.

CRANBERRY BANANA CHRISTMAS BREAD
ingredients
1 1/2  c. self-rising flour
1  tsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. baking soda
1  c. cranberries, chopped
1  1/2 ripe banana
1/2  c. sugar
1/3  c. oil
1  large egg
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together.  Spray a loaf pan with nonstick spray.  Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.  Serves 16.

CHRISTMAS CANDY
(Makes 24 Servings.  Prep Time:  10 Minutes.)  
ingredients
24  oz. almond bark
2  c. Rice Krispies
1  c. peanuts or cashews
1 1/2  c. miniature marshmallows
preparation
      Melt almond bark. Add Rice Krispies, nuts and marshmallows. Mix and drop onto waxed paper.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  c. margarine
1  c. light brown sugar
3  c. plain flour
1/2  c. milk
3  eggs
1  tsp. soda
1  tsp. cinnamon
1  tsp. salt
3  tsp. vanilla
1  box white raisins
6  slices crystallized pineapple
1/2  lb. crystallized cherries
1  lb. chopped dates
7  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Cream  margarine  and  sugar.  Add eggs, one at a time. Add flour, milk, cinnamon, salt, soda and vanilla.  Pour over fruit and  nuts.  Mix  well.  Drop by spoon onto cookie sheet. Bake 25 minutes at 300°.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  c. butter or margarine
1 1/2  c. sugar
3  eggs
3  c. flour
1  tsp. cinnamon
1  tsp. soda
  pinch of salt
1  tsp. vanilla
1/2  lb. pineapple (4 slices)
1/2  lb. candied cherries
1 1/2  lb. (qt.) chopped pecans
1/2  lb. dates
preparation
      Chop all fruit and nuts. Cream together butter and sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Sift all flour, salt, cinnamon and soda together. Add flour and vanilla.  Gradually stir in all fruit and nuts. Drop from teaspoon on greased cookie sheet and bake 20 minutes at 300°.

CHRISTMAS CHEESE BALL
ingredients
2  (8 oz) cream cheese
1  (8 oz) sharp yellow cheese
1  T pimento, chopped
1  hunk Velveeta
1  T green pepper, chopped
1  T grated onion
1  tsp lemon juice
2  tsp Worcestershire sauce
  Dash of red pepper
  Dash of salt
  Pecans (to roll in)
preparation
      Mix altogether and put in freezer about 20 minutes.  (Chunk all cheese to mix.)  Shape into ball and roll in pecans.  (Put pecans in blender).  Refrigerate until served.
       Serve with Ritz or your choice crackers.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
2 small  pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
2  c. sugar
2  qts. water
1 lg.  can pineapple juice
1  qt. ginger-ale
1/2  gal. pineapple sherbet
preparation
      Mix all ingredients; adding sherbet last.

CHRISTMAS GOLD FRUIT CAKE
ingredients
1 1/2  c. butter or margarine
2  c. sugar
6  eggs, separated
1/2  tsp. cream of tartar
1  c. milk
1  tsp. brandy extract or 3/4 c. milk and 1/4 c. brandy
1  tsp. vanilla
3 1/2  c. flour
1/2  tsp. salt
2  c. golden raisins
1  c. chopped dried apricots
1/2  c. chopped, candied orange peel
1  c. coarsely chopped walnuts
preparation
      Beat butter until light and creamy.  Gradually add the sugar, beating until smooth.  Beat egg yolks together lightly and add to mixture.  Combine milk, brandy and vanilla.  Mix flour and salt together.  Alternately add milk mix and flour mix to butter mix. Fold in fruits and nuts.  Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff, but not dry.  Fold whites into batter gently, but thoroughly.  Pour mixture into two buttered and floured six-cup molds.  Bake at 275° for 2 1/2 hours or until they test done.  Cool and unmold.

CHRISTMAS RIBBON SALAD
ingredients
2   cans (16 oz. each) pitted dark sweet cherries
2 (3-oz)  pkg. cherry-flavored gelatin
1  envelope unflavored gelatin
2  c. boiling water
1/3  c. sugar
1/2  c. port or sweet red wine
1/4  c. lemon juice
1 (8-oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/2  c. pecans, chopped and toasted
  Garnishes:  whipped cream, fresh cranberries (optional)
preparation
      Drain cherries, reserving 1 cup juice.  Chop cherries.  Stir together gelatins and 2 cups boiling water until completely dissolved.  Stir in reserved cherry juice, sugar, port, and lemon juice.  Stir in cherries.  Lightly spray a 10-cup ring mold or Bundt cake pan with vegetable cooking spray, and pour half of gelatin mixture into mold.  Chill 2 hours or until almost set. Stir together remaining gelatin mixture, cream cheese, and pecans, blending well.  Pour over slightly set gelatin mixture in mold. Chill 6 hours or until firm.  Garnish, if desired.

CHRISTMAS TEA
ingredients
1  qt. or 1/2 gallon apple cider
2  qts. ginger ale
4  sticks cinnamon
1  pkg. red hots
preparation
      Mix ingredients in large saucepan or coffee maker.  Heat apple cider and ginger ale adding cinnamon sticks and red hots until they dissolve.  Stir before serving.  May heat again if necessary.

CHRISTMAS PIE
ingredients
1  can pie cherries
1  can crushed pineapple
1  c. sugar
2  Tbsp. cornstarch
1  box orange jello
1  c. sliced bananas
1  c. chopped nuts
2  baked pie shells
preparation
      Mix cherries, pineapple, sugar, cornstarch together and cook until thick. Stir in dry jello and let cool. Add bananas and nuts. Pour into pie shells and refrigerate until ready to serve.

CHRISTMAS MORNING STICKY BUNS
ingredients
1/2  Cup Chopped Pecans or Walnuts
1 (25 oz.)  Package Frozen Roll Dough, Thawed
1 (3.4 oz.)  Package Butterscotch instant Pudding Mix
1/2  Cup Butter or Margarine, Melted
1/2  Cup Firmly Packed Brown Sugar
3/4  tsp. Ground Cinnamon
preparation
      Sprinkle nuts in the bottom of a buttered 12 cup bundt pan. Arrange dough in pan; sprinkle with dry pudding mix. Stir together butter, brown sugar and cinnamon; pour over rolls. Cover and chill 8 hours.
      Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Invert into a serving plate and serve immediately.

M&M CHRISTMAS TREES
ingredients
1  can vanilla frosting
1  bottle green food coloring
1  pkg. pointed sugar ice cream cones
1  pkg. 4 inch sugar cookies
1  pkg. mini M&Ms
1  pkg. Holiday M&Ms
1  pkg. wrapped candy for the trim
preparation
      Set aside 1/3 c. of frosting.  Add food coloring to the remaining frosting.  Stir until well blended.  Cover cookie with white frosting.  Stick the cone to the cookie.  Cover entire cone with green frosting.  While frosting is moist, stick the Holiday M&Ms to the cone.  Use mini M&Ms to decorate as colored lights. Use wrapped candy to decorate around the bottom of the tree.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  c. (2 sticks) butter
2/3  c. sugar
1  egg
1  tsp. vanilla
2 1/2  c. flour
1  c. oats
preparation
      Beat butter until creamy. Gradually add sugar; beat until fluffy. Add egg; beat until light and fluffy. Blend in vanilla. Gradually add flour to creamed mixture; blend well. Stir in oats. Chill dough.  Roll out to 1/8-inch thickness on board or canvas which has been lightly coated with xxx sugar. Cut into desired shapes with floured cookie cutters. Place on buttered cookie sheets. Bake in preheated moderate oven (350°) 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from cookie sheet immediately with metal spatula; cool on wire racks. Decorate with xxx frosting and red and green candied cherries.

WHITE CHRISTMAS CHIFFON PIE
ingredients
1 1/2  c. milk
4  Tbsp. flour
1  c. sugar
1/4  c. cold water
1/2  c. heavy cream
3  large egg whites
1 1/2  c. freshly shredded coconut
1  envelope unflavored gelatin
3/4  tsp. vanilla
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. almond extract
1/4  tsp. cream of tartar
2  baked pie shells
preparation
      Soften gelatin in cold water.  Mix together in a saucepan the milk, flour and sugar; cook to slightly thicken and dissolve the gelatin in that.  Cool.  Then whip the cream.  Beat the egg whites until stiff and add the cream of tartar.  To the gelatin mixture, fold in the whipped cream and the egg whites.  Add the vanilla and almond extract.  Then fold in the coconut.  Spoon into the pie shells and chill in the refrigerator.

CHRISTMAS NUT THIN COOKIE
ingredients
1  c. butter
1  c. sugar
1 1/2  c. flour
2  eggs
1  c. nuts, chopped
1  tsp. vanilla
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
      Mix sugar and butter together, mix well.  Add well beaten eggs, sift in flour and salt, add nuts and vanilla.  Mix until smooth and light.  Drop on greased baking sheet.  Space well apart.  Place half nut meat in center of each cookie.  Bake at 375° about 10 minutes.

MERRY CHRISTMAS FREEZE
ingredients
3  c. cranberries, finely chopped
1 1/2  c. sugar
1  (8 1/2 oz.) crushed pineapple (undrained)
1/2  c. nuts, chopped
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
2  c. Cool Whip, thawed
preparation
      Mix all ingredients until well blended.  Pour into slightly greased mold.  Freeze.  Garnish with mint leaves and serve with holiday dinners.

CHRISTMAS GELATIN SALAD
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. strawberry gelatin
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. raspberry gelatin
3  c. boiling water
1  c. pineapple juice
1  lb. cranberries, mashed (canned may be used)
1  small apple, chopped
1  (15.5 oz.) crushed pineapple, drained
1  c. sugar
1  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in boiling water; add pineapple juice; cool. Combine remaining ingredients and add to gelatin mixture. Pour into an oblong pan; Chill until firm. Cut into squares to serve.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  c. snowdrift
1  c. packed brown sugar
1  egg
1/4  c. buttermilk
2  c. sifted Red Band self rising flour
1/2  tsp. salt
1  c. chopped pecans
1  c. chopped dates
2  c. candied cherries (1 red, 1 green)
preparation
      Mix snowdrift, brown sugar and eggs well. Add buttermilk, sift together dry ingredients and stir into mixture. Add pecans, dates and candied cherries. Chill dough one hour. Drop with teaspoon about 2 inches apart on lightly greased baking sheet. Top cookie with pecan halve or half of cherry. Bake at 400° for 10 - 12 minutes. Makes 4 dozen.
      Note:  If self-rising flour not used, use plain all-purpose flour and add 1/2 tsp. soda and 1/2 tsp. baking powder.

CHRISTMAS SALAD
ingredients
1 lg.  box orange jello
1 lg.  can crushed pineapple
1 lg.  can fruit cocktail
1 sm.  jar cherries
1  bag mini-marshmallows
1 - 12  oz. tub Cool Whip
  Walnuts if you wish
preparation
      Drain fruit well, add jello, marshmallows and walnuts.  Blend in Cool Whip and chill.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
3  c. flour
1  tsp. baking powder
1/4  tsp. salt
1 1/4  c. sugar
1  c. shortening
3  eggs
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      Sift dry ingredients. Add shortening and mix with fork. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix. Roll out thin and cut into desired shapes. Bake at 375° for 8 minutes. Yields 4 dozen.

SEVEN LAYER CHRISTMAS RIBBON CAKE
Layers:
ingredients
1  box Duncan Hines yellow cake mix
preparation
      Mix as directed on box. Add different cake coloring to each layer. Can use 2 layers of green, red, chocolate and leave one plain as long as you alternate layers. Pour thin layers of batter onto 8-inch skillet, about enough to cover bottom of pan and bake in 500° to 550° oven for about 2 1/2 to 3 minutes per layer. Spray skillet with nonstick spray each time. An 8-inch cake pan may be used to cook layers.
Chocolate Icing:
ingredients
2  c. sugar
1/2  c. milk
1  stick butter or margarine
3  Tbsp. cocoa
1/2  tsp. vinegar (vinegar will keep sugar from crystallizing)
preparation
      Mix together and bring to a boil. Cook 1 minute. Add teaspoon vanilla extract. Ice each layer of cake.

CHRISTMAS FRUIT CAKE
ingredients
1  lb. walnuts
1  lb. pecans
1  lb. bag marshmallows
1/3  c. milk
1  lb. box graham crackers
1  lb. jar cherries
1  lb. box raisins
preparation
	Crush graham crackers to a powder. Chop cherries, leaving 5 or 6 for decoration. Melt marshmallows in milk. Mix all ingredients, a little at a time, into hot marshmallows. When mixture becomes cool, you can begin mixing with your hands. You will need to add cherry juice as you mix to keep ingredients moist. Place a drinking glass on cake plate and pat the cake mixture around glass until you "make a cake" around it. Set in the refrigerator until firm. Remove glass.
	 Can freeze for later. Slice leftover cherries to decorate top.

CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS
ingredients
1 bag  dozen dinner rolls
1  box butterscotch pudding (not instant)
1/2  c. butter or oleo
3/4  c. brown sugar
3/4  tsp. cinnamon
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Arrange rolls in greased 9 x 13 pan.  Sprinkle dry pudding mix over rolls.  Cook butter and remaining ingredients over low heat until sugar dissolves and mixture bubbles.  Pour over rolls.  Cover lightly with foil and let stand on counter overnight.  Next morning, bake at 350° for 20 minutes.  Let stand 5 minutes, then invert carefully on serving dish.

CHRISTMAS COOKIE BALLS
ingredients
6  c. flour
1  lb. butter
4  Tbsp. powdered sugar
1 1/2  c. nuts
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
      Mix flour, butter, nuts and salt; form balls. Bake 20 to 25 minutes at 325°. Cool and roll in powdered sugar.

CHRISTMAS CAKE
ingredients
1  white cake mix
2  pkg. instant pistachio pudding
4  eggs
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1/2  c. oil
1  c. club soda
1/2  c. cherries
preparation
      Beat cake mix, eggs, oil and pudding for 4 minutes, gradually adding the soda. Add nuts and cherries. Bake at 350° for 1 hour in a well-greased tube pan.

CHRISTMAS STRAWBERRIES
ingredients
1  c. finely chopped almonds
1  c. Eagle Brand milk
1 family size  pkg. strawberry jello
1  c. coconut
1  tsp. vanilla
  red and green sugar
preparation
      Mix almonds, Eagle Brand, jello, coconut and vanilla. Form into strawberry shape. Roll in red sugar. Roll top in green sugar.

CHRISTMAS PARTY PINWHEELS
ingredients
2  pkg (8 oz. each) cream cheese, softened
1  pkg (4 oz.) ranch salad dressing mix
1/2  cup minced sweet pepper
1/2  cup minced celery
1/4  cup sliced green olives
1/4  cup sliced green onions
2  to 4 (10 inch) flour tortillas
preparation
      In mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and dressing mix until smooth.  Add red pepper, celery, onions and olives:  mix well. Spread about 3/4 cup on each tortilla.  Roll up tightly; wrap in plastic wrap.  Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.  Slice into 1/2 inch pieces.  Yield 15 - 20 servings.

WHITE CHRISTMAS FUDGE
ingredients
2 1/4  c. sugar
1/2  c. dairy sour cream
1/4  c. milk
2  Tbsp. butter
1  Tbsp. light corn syrup
1/4  tsp. salt
2  tsp. vanilla
1  c. coarsely chopped walnuts
preparation
      Combine sugar, sour cream, milk, butter, corn syrup and salt in heavy 2-quart saucepan.  Stir over moderate heat until sugar is dissolved and mixture reaches a boil.  Boil over moderate heat 9 to 10 minutes to 238°, soft-ball stage.  Remove from heat and allow to stand until lukewarm (110°), about an hour.  Add vanilla and beat until mixture just begins to lose its gloss and hold its shape. Quickly stir in walnuts and turn into oiled pan.  Let stand until firm before cutting.  Makes 1 1/2 pounds.

CHRISTMAS CIDER
(Makes 1 Gallon)  
ingredients
1  Aspen mulling spices
1  gal. apple cider
1  large cran-grape frozen concentrate
1  large lemonade frozen concentrate
2/3  amount water (that concentrate calls for 2)
preparation
      Heat all together.
       For Cold Drink:  Omit water. Add club soda.
      Good fall beverage.

CHRISTMAS LIZZIES
ingredients
4  eggs
1 1/2  c. brown sugar
1  stick butter
3  tsp. soda
3  c. flour (plain)
1  tsp. cloves
1  tsp. nutmeg
1  tsp. salt
1 1/2  lb. chopped nuts
1  lb. glazed pineapple
1  lb. glazed cherries
1  lb. raisins
3/4  c. cherry juice
3  Tbsp. milk
1  lb. dates, chopped
2  c. coconut
preparation
      Line cookie sheet with freezer paper. Do not grease. Sift all dry ingredients together. Cream sugar and butter. Add dry ingredients alternately with juice to butter and sugar mixture. Add fruit and nuts which have been lightly floured. Drop on cookie sheet and bake at 275° until brown (about 25 minutes).

CHRISTMAS SALAD
(3 Layer Salad)  
Layer 1:
ingredients
1  c. boiling water
1/2  c. cold water
1 (3 oz.)  box lime jello
  small jar maraschino cherries, drained
preparation
      Mix lime jello with boiling water; dissolve.  Then add 1/2 c. cold water; let get syrupy.  Add maraschino cherries; pour in mold and jell.
Layer 2:
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  box lemon jello
1  c. boiling water
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
preparation
      Mix lemon jello with boiling water; dissolve.  Add cream cheese; let get syrupy.  Add to the first layer and jell that layer.
Layer 3:
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  box strawberry jello
1  c. boiling water
1/2  c. cold water
1 (20 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
preparation
      Mix strawberry jello with boiling water; dissolve.  Add cold water; let it get syrupy.  Add drained crushed pineapple; pour over lemon layer.  Congeal for several hours.  Turn out of mold on platter.

Christmas Toffee
ingredients
2  cups Sliced Almonds (about 8 oz.)
12  oz. Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips (2 cups)
2  sticks Butter, cut into bits
1  1/2 cups Packed Dark Brown Sugar
preparation
      1. Preheat oven to 325°. Spread out almonds on a baking sheet and bake, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned, 5-7 minutes.  Let cool.
      2. Coarsely chop chocolate chips in a food processor, pulsing on and off.  Transfer to a medium bowl.  In same processor bowl, coarsely chop almonds, pulsing on and off. Add to chocolate chips, tossing to combine  Spread half of mixture evenly over bottom of a well-greased baking sheet.
      3. In a heavy saucepan, bring butter and brown sugar to a boil, stirring constantly, over medium heat.  Cook 5-7 minutes or until syrup is golden brown and just reaches the hard crack stage (300° on a candy thermometer).  At that point, a bit of syrup, when dropped into a bowl of ice water, should separate into threads that are hard and brittle.
      4. Pour hot syrup evenly over nut mixture.  Top with remaining nut mixture, smoothing and pressing down gently with a spatula. Refrigerate until toffee is set and chocolate is firm, about 1 1/2 hours.  Cut into irregular pieces with tip of a sharp knife. Store in tightly covered container in refrigerator up to 2 weeks.

CHRISTMAS CUSTARD
ingredients
3  qt. milk
3  boxes vanilla instant pudding
1  pt. whipping cream
1 1/2  c. sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      Mix pudding with pint of  milk and beat with mixer 5 minutes. Add cream (unwhipped) and beat 3 minutes. Add other ingredients and mix well while scraping side of the bowl. Refrigerate.

CHRISTMAS MORNING STRATA
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. Italian sausage, casing removed -chop meat
1- 12  oz. loaf French bread (or Italian bread)
2 - 4  oz. cans sliced mushrooms
6  extra large eggs
1  quart milk
2  tsp. Italian seasoning
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
1/4  tsp. pepper
2  cups shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Night before serving, grease 13 x 9 glass baking dish.  Cook sausage meat, using slotted spoon remove sausage to paper towel to drain.  Cut bread into 1/2 inch cubes.  Drain and chop mushrooms. In baking dish combine meat, bread and mushrooms.  In large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk and seasonings.  Pour egg mixture over sausage mixture.  Cover baking dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
      About 1 1/2 hours before serving preheat oven to 350°.  Bake uncovered 1 hour.   Remove from oven and sprinkle evenly with cheese.  Bake 15 minutes longer or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.  Remove from oven and let stand 10 minutes before serving.  Serves 8.

CHRISTMAS ANISE DROPS
ingredients
1 1/2  c. sifted flour
1/4  tsp. baking powder
2  eggs
1  c. sugar
1/4  tsp. anise flavoring
preparation
	Generously grease cookie sheets.
	Sift together and set aside the flour and baking powder.  Put eggs into a liquid measuring cup.  Add water, if necessary (enough to make 1/2 cup liquid).  Put into a mixing bowl with sugar and anise flavoring.
	Beat until very thick and piled softly.  Fold in the dry ingredients, sifting in about 1/4 at a time. Use a pastry bag or drop by teaspoonfuls onto the cookie sheets, about 2-inches apart. Set cookie sheets aside in a cool place (not in refrigerator) 8 to 10 hours or overnight.  Do not cover cookies and do not disturb!
	Bake at 350° for 5 to 6 minutes. Remove to cooling racks to cool completely.  Cookies form a cake like layer on the bottom with a crisp "frosting" on the top. Makes about 4 dozen.
	 Recipe may be doubled.

CHRISTMAS M&M'S COOKIES
ingredients
1  c. margarine, softened
1  c. light brown sugar
1/2  c. sugar
2  eggs
2  tsp. vanilla
2 1/4  c. flour
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. baking soda
2  c. M&M's miniature semi-sweet (red and green)
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°. Beat together butter, brown sugar and white sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Blend in eggs and vanilla. Combine flour, salt and baking soda in a small bowl. Add to butter mixture. Mix well. Add M&M's. Drop by teaspoons and bake for 10 to 12 minutes.

WHITE CHRISTMAS CAKE
ingredients
3  c. chopped mixed candied fruits
2 2/3  c. flaked coconut
1 1/2  c. coarsely chopped almonds
1 1/2  tsp. grated orange rind
1 1/2  c. golden raisins
1/3  c. orange juice
1/2  c. apple juice
3/4  c. margarine
3 3/4  c. cake flour
1 1/2  tsp. baking powder
3/4  tsp. salt
1 1/2  c. sugar
6  eggs
1/2  c. apple juice
preparation
      Combine candied fruits, coconut, raisins, almonds and orange rind in a large bowl.  Sift flour, baking powder and salt over fruit.  Mix well.  Cream margarine with sugar in medium bowl.  Beat in eggs; stir in apple and orange juice.  Pour over fruit mixture; fold and mix thoroughly.  Spoon batter into a greased and floured 8-inch pan.  Bake at 375° for 3 hours.  Cool completely in pan.  On serving day, put on an Orange Glaze.  Makes an 8-inch round cake.
Orange Glaze:
ingredients
1  Tbsp. melted margarine
1  Tbsp. orange juice
2 1/2  c. powdered sugar
preparation
      Beat all until smooth and creamy.  Makes about 3/4 cup.

FRESH CHRISTMAS EGGNOG
ingredients
1  doz. eggs, separated
1 1/2  c. sugar
4  c. milk
1  c. whipping cream, whipped
1/4  c. rum flavoring
1/2  tsp. vanilla extract
1/2  tsp. ground nutmeg
preparation
      Beat egg yolks in bowl until smooth.  Combine egg yolks and sugar in top of double boiler over hot water.  Stir in milk gradually.  Cook, stirring constantly, until mixture coats spoon. Remove from heat.  Refrigerate until chilled.  Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.  Fold egg whites and whipping cream into chilled egg yolk mixture.  Stir in rum flavoring.  Chill for several hours to blend flavors.  Stir in vanilla just before serving; sprinkle with nutmeg.  Yield:  24 (1/2 cup) servings.

ROLLED CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  C. butter
1 1/2  C. powdered sugar
1  egg
1  tsp. vanilla
2 1/2  C. flour
1  tsp. baking soda
1  tsp. cream of tartar
1/4  tsp. salt
preparation
      Mix ingredients in order.  Cream together first four ingredients. Mix together the dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture.
      Chill; roll; cut out shapes.
      Bake at 375 degrees for 5 minutes.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
1  can pineapple juice
2  cans frozen orange juice, will make 2 qt
2  pkg strawberry kool aid, will make 4 qt
preparation
      Mix ingredients. Add 2 qt chilled ginger ale before serving. Top with pineapple sherbet.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. cranberry juice
3  c. pineapple juice
1 1/2  c. water
1/3  c. brown sugar
3  sticks cinnamon, broken
2  tsp. whole cloves
2  tsp. allspice
preparation
	Combine juices and water in bottom part of percolator. Place all other ingredients in basket of percolator. Perk 5 to 10 minutes. This makes a delicious drink for a party or just to serve on cold days at home.

CHRISTMAS SCENT
ingredients
3 (4-inch)  sticks cinnamon
3  bay leaves
1/4  c. cloves
1/2  lemon, halved
1/2  orange, halved
1  qt. water
preparation
      Combine all ingredients in tea kettle or saucepan and bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer as long as desired. Check often and add additional water, if needed. Mixture may be stored in refrigerator for several days and reused. Yield: 4 cups.

CHRISTMAS FRUIT COOKIES
ingredients
1 1/2  c. chopped dates
1/4  lb. chopped candied cherries
2  slices chopped candied pineapple
3  c. chopped pecans
3/4  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. white sugar
1/4  tsp. salt
1  c. flour
3  beaten egg whites
1  tsp. vanilla
1/2  c. margarine, melted
preparation
      Mix fruit, nuts, flour, sugars and salt.  Add beaten egg whites and vanilla.  Mix well.  Add melted margarine and mix again.  Grease and flour cookie sheets.  Drop mixture by scant teaspoonful on cookie sheets.  Bake at 325° for 15 minutes until golden brown.  Store baked cookies in airtight container.  Yield: 4 dozen.

CHRISTMAS RAMEKIN
ingredients
  4-5 cloves of garlic, chopped
3/4   c. red pepper, chopped very small
2  jars of marinated artichoke hearts
  olive oil
  1-2 Tbsp. diced hot jalapeno peppers
1/4  lemon (squeezed)
1/2-1  c. mayonnaise
3/4  lb. parmesan cheese, grated
preparation
      Cut bread down the middle and slice into strips. Drizzle with butter (and garlic if you desire) and bake at 350° for 8-10 minutes.
      Meanwhile, saut garlic in oil. In bowl mix artichokes, red pepper, hot jalapeno pepper, cheese, and garlic.  Add enough mayonnaise so it all holds together.  Add the lemon juice. Bake at 350 uncovered for 30-35 minutes until it bubbles and the top is golden.
      Serve with the French bread immediately.

FUDGY CHRISTMAS WREATH
ingredients
1  can sweetened condensed milk (14 oz.)
1  c. nuts, chopped
2  c. (12 oz.) chocolate chips, semisweet or milk chocolate
1/2  tsp. vanilla
  red and green maraschino cherries
preparation
      In a sauce pan over low heat cook and stir milk and chocolate chips until chocolate melts and mixture is slightly thickened (about 6 minutes).  Remove from heat and stir in nuts and vanilla. Cool until it starts to set, about 15 minutes.  Line a baking sheet with wax paper.  Spoon mixture by 2 tablespoons full into small mounds to form a wreath.  Decorate with cherries.  You can just pour it out on  wax paper and then cut into pieces when firm. Chill until firm.  This makes a soft fudge.  Keep refrigerated.

CHRISTMAS SALAD
ingredients
8 to 10  c. lettuce
1  avocado, thinly sliced
1/4  c. red onion, thinly sliced
1/2  c. dried cranberries
1 large  can mandarin oranges, drained
4  Tbsp. cranberry juice concentrate
4  Tbsp. rice wine vinegar
1 1/2  tsp. Dijon mustard
1/4  tsp. freshly ground pepper
1/2  c. canola or vegetable oil
preparation
      Toss lettuce, avocado, red onion, cranberries and mandarin oranges together. Mix cranberry juice concentrate, rice wine vinegar, mustard, pepper and oil. Pour over salad and toss.

OLD FASHIONED CHRISTMAS CHOCOLATE
ingredients
4  c. sugar
2  c. butter
2  c. milk
1  c. cocoa
2  Tbsp. vanilla
3  c. crushed peanuts
  3-4 c. flour
preparation
      Mix & cook sugar, butter, milk, and cocoa for 20 min., stirring occasionally.  Add vanilla, peanuts (crushed), and flour.
      Mix well & pour into a greased cookie sheet.  When almost cold, cut into your size squares.

PECAN CHRISTMAS CAKE
ingredients
2  c. butter
2  c. sugar
6  eggs
1  Tbsp. vanilla
1 1/2  c. golden raisins
4  c. chopped pecans
3  c. all-purpose flour
1/4  tsp. salt
1  tsp. baking powder
preparation
      Cream butter and sugar.  Beat in eggs, one at a time.  Add vanilla.  Mix raisins, nuts and 1/4 cup flour.  Sift remaining dry ingredients.  Alternately fold in raisins, pecan mixture and dry ingredients into creamed mixture.  Spoon into greased and paper lined pan.  Bake at 300° for 1 hour and 50 minutes in 10-inch tube pan.  Cool and remove from pan.

CHRISTMAS FRUIT SALAD
ingredients
3  egg yolks, beaten
3  Tbsp. water
3  Tbsp. vinegar
1/2  tsp. salt
2  c. whipped cream
3  c. miniature marshmallows
2  c. halved green grapes
1  (20 oz.) an pineapple tidbits, drained
1 (11 oz.)  can mandarin oranges, drained
1 (10 oz.)  jar red maraschino cherries, drained and sliced
1  c. chopped pecans
3  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      In large saucepan, combine egg yolks, water, vinegar and salt.  Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and reaches 160°.  Remove from heat.  Fold in whipped cream.  In large bowl, combine remaining ingredients.  Add dressing and toss to coat.  Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Makes 12 to 14 servings.

CHRISTMAS BONBONS
ingredients
1  can sweetened condensed milk
2  lb. powdered sugar
1  c. oleo or butter
1  pkg. (7 oz.) flaked coconut
2  c. chopped nuts
1  c. glace cherries
4  pkg. (8 oz.) semi-sweet chocolate
preparation
      Combine milk, powdered sugar and oleo.  Mix until smooth and creamy.  Add coconut, walnuts and cherries; mix thoroughly.  Chill 1 hour.  Form into small balls.  Chill another 2 hours.  Melt chocolate.  Dip individually into chocolate.  Place on waxed paper to cool.  Chill in refrigerator.  Makes about 150 pieces.
      Can use any dipping chocolate.

CHRISTMAS CRUNCH CANDY
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  pkg. chocolate chips
3/4  c. salted peanuts
3/4  c. raisins
1/2  c. miniature marshmallows
preparation
      Melt chocolate chips over simmering water in top of double boiler.  Let cool.  Stir in salted peanuts, raisins and marshmallows.  Line cookie sheet with wax paper.  Drop by teaspoonfuls on paper.  Refrigerate overnight.

AROMA OF CHRISTMAS
ingredients
3  sticks cinnamon
1/4  c. whole cloves
  peel one orange
2  bay leaves
2  lemon wedges
1  quart water
preparation
      Combine spices and fruit with water in sauce pan or crockpot. Bring to a boil and simmer.  Check hourly; add water as needed.

CHRISTMAS RASPBERRY CAROUSEL
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. raspberry Jell-O
2  c. boiling water
1  c. diced apple
1/4  c. nuts
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime or lemon Jell-O
1  (4 1/2 oz.) container Cool Whip
1/2  c. mayonnaise
3/4  c. cranberry juice cocktail
1/4  c. diced celery
preparation
      You will also need 1 Jell-O mold.
      Dissolve raspberry Jell-O in 1 cup of boiling water. Add cranberry juice and chill until slightly thickened (about 1 hour). Fold in apple, celery and nuts and put in ring mold to set.
       Dissolve lemon or lime Jell-O in cup of boiling water and chill until slightly thickened. Combine Cool Whip with mayonnaise and fold into lemon or lime Jell-O and spoon into center of mold. Chill until firm. Remove from mold and garnish with salad greens and sliced apples.

SPICY CHRISTMAS PICKLES
ingredients
1  gal. jar dill pickles
5  lb. bag sugar
1  bottle Louisiana hot sauce
3  garlic cloves, chopped
preparation
      Drain juice from pickles and discard. Slice pickles into spears and put in jar. Add hot sauce, garlic and 1/3 of sugar. Screw on lid tightly. Gently mix pickles with sugar and spices by tipping jar back and forth. Leave on counter at room temperature for 1 week. As sugar dissolves, add more sugar until all sugar is used. Mix pickles daily. Pickles will be dark green when all sugar is absorbed.

CORN FLAKE CHRISTMAS WREATH COOKIES
(Holiday)  
ingredients
3  Tbsp. butter, melted
40  large marshmallows
  green food coloring
6  c. corn flakes
  "Red Hot" candies
preparation
      Melt butter over medium heat. Stir in marshmallows until melted. Add green food coloring. Turn off heat and add corn flakes. Fold into mixture with a spoon. Run hands under cold water and form wreaths on wax paper. Place red hots on top to look like berries and let stand until firm.

CHRISTMAS SALAD
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime jello
1  c. boiling water
3/4  c. cold water
1 (5 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
8  oz. Philadelphia cheese
  pecans or walnuts
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cherry jello
preparation
      Prepare jello with boiling water and cold water.  Add pineapple.  Pour into 9 x 12 dish and refrigerate until set.  To the cream cheese (room temperature), add milk and mix until like soft butter.  Spread over lime jello and chill thoroughly.
      Meanwhile, make cherry jello; cool until syrupy. Pour over layer of cheese. Chill. Cut into squares to serve.
      Change color of jello for other holidays.

CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST
(Make Ahead Breakfast)  
ingredients
7  slices white bread
2  pkg. (4 oz. each) shredded Cheddar cheese
6  eggs
3  c. milk
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  tsp. dry mustard
3  strips bacon, cut up
preparation
      Trim crusts from bread. Crumble bread. Mix bread and cheese and spread in bottom of greased 7 1/2 x 12-inch flat baking dish. Beat eggs and milk together and stir in salt, pepper and mustard. Pour over bread and cheese. Lay bacon on top. Refrigerate overnight. Next morning, bake uncovered, at 350° for 50 to 55 minutes. Serves 6. Make this the day before.

OLD TIME CHRISTMAS SALAD (SLAW)
ingredients
1 (15 oz.)  can baby lima beans (Veg-All brand is good)
1 (15 oz.)  can tiny English peas (LeSueur brand is good)
1  med. cabbage
1 (7 oz.)  bottle horseradish
1  c. mayonnaise or salad dressing
1  tsp. salt
preparation
      Grate cabbage on coarse side of grater.  Drain peas and beans thoroughly.  Mix cabbage, peas and beans together and add 7 tablespoons of horseradish (or more to taste) and mayonnaise. Store in refrigerator until ready to serve.  Will keep for several days.  Garnish with olives or sliced pimentos.

White Christmas Salad
ingredients
1  pkg. Lemon jell-o
1 1/4  c. hot water
1/2  c. pineapple juice
1/2  c. whipping cream (whipped)
1/2  c. mayonnaise
1/2  c. diced apples (unpeeled)
1/2  c. diced pineapple
1/2  c. diced celery
6  marshmallows, cut in small pieces
preparation
      Dissolve jell-o in hot water, adding pineapple juice. When it begins to congeal, fold in whipped cream and remaining ingredients. Chill until firm. Serves 10.

CHRISTMAS EGG CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. pork sausage
6  eggs
2  c. milk
2  slices bread, cubed
1  c. sharp cheddar cheese, grated
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. dry mustard
preparation
      Sauté the sausage, drain all the grease and set aside. Beat the eggs, add milk, salt and mustard, stir. Layer the bread cubes on the bottom of a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Then layer the sausage, followed by cheese. Pour the egg mixture over the top, cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes. Serves 6 to 8.

RUBY CHRISTMAS SLUSH
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed and undiluted
4 1/2  c. water
2 (46 oz.)  cans RED fruit punch
1 (46 oz.)  can unsweetened pineapple juice
1 (48 oz.)  bottle cranapple juice
2 (33.8 oz.)  bottles ginger ale, chilled
preparation
      Combine thawed orange juice concentrate and water, mixing well. Stir in fruit punch, pineapple juice and cranapple juice.  Freeze in a large container stirring occasionally.  Remove from freezer 3-4 hours before serving, stirring occasionally as mixture thaws. Stir in ginger ale just before serving.  Yield:  about 2 1/4 gallons.

PRETTY PEARS FOR CHRISTMAS
ingredients
1 large  can pear halves, drained
  red and green food coloring
preparation
      Divide juice 1/2 and 1/2 in bowls. Add green coloring to one; add red coloring to other. Darken to your liking. Add pears and refrigerate overnight.
Filling:
ingredients
1  brick cream cheese
1  c. mayonnaise
1  c. ground nuts
preparation
      Mix together and scoop into colored pear halves, about 1 teaspoon each. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

HAZEL'S CHRISTMAS PICKLES
ingredients
4  tbsp salt
6  tbsp pickling spice
4  tbsp alum
4  c. vinegar
preparation
      Fill a one gallon glass jar with small to medium cucumbers which have been thoroughly washed.  Add all the preceding ingredients and finish filling the jar with water.  Put lid on and shake well, let stand in cool place till December, (standing longer will not affect quality).  Open jar; drain and wash pickles.  Cut into bite size chunks and put back into jar.  Dissolve 7 cups of sugar in a quart of water and pour over cucumbers.  If necessary, add more water to cover pickles; let stand for 2 weeks in the refrigerator.

CHRISTMAS WREATHS
ingredients
1/2  c. margarine
1  tsp. vanilla
5  c. corn flakes
35  lg. marshmallows
1 1/2  tsp. green food coloring
preparation
      Melt margarine with marshmallows and add vanilla and food coloring.  Pour over corn flakes and mix.  Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper.  Put red hots or cherry halves in middle to form wreaths.  Chill 40 minutes.  Makes 2 dozen.

CHRISTMAS FANTASY FUDGE
ingredients
3  c. sugar
3/4  c. butter (1 1/2 sticks)
2/3  c. evaporated milk
1 (12 oz.)  pkg. semi-sweet chocolate pieces
1 (7 oz.)  jar Kraft Marshmallow Crme
1  c. nuts
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      You will also need 1 candy thermometer.
      Using a heavy pot, mix sugar, butter and milk; bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil for 5 minutes over medium heat or until candy thermometer reaches 238°. Stir constantly; mixture scorches easily. Remove from heat. Stir in chocolate pieces until melted, then add marshmallow, nuts and vanilla; beat well. Pour in greased 9 x 3 pan. Cool and cut into small squares. "Mark off" while still warm.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. butter or oleo
4  eggs
1  tsp. soda
3  Tbsp. milk
1 1/2  lb. pecans
1/2  lb. candied pineapple
1/2  lb. candied cherries
1  glass jelly (plum, grape or apple)
1  lb. white raisins
4  c. flour
1  tsp. each: allspice, cinnamon and nutmeg
preparation
      Chop pecans, pineapple and cherries.  Use 1 cup flour to coat them.  Mix in order given; drop on greased cookie sheet.  Bake at 300° about 25 to 30 minutes.

CHRISTMAS WHITE CAKE
ingredients
1  lb. Brazil nuts
1  lb. walnuts
1  lb. dates
2  jars maraschino cherries
1  1/2 cups  flour
1  1/2 cups sugar
4  well beaten eggs
1/2  c. butter
preparation
      Combine Brazil, walnuts, dates and cherries.  Sprinkle with flour.  Take juice from cherries and mix flour, sugar, eggs and butter.  Combine all ingredients and bake at 270 degrees for 1 1/2 hours.

RETHA'S CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY
ingredients
3 1/2  c. sugar
1  c. hot water
1  c. white corn syrup
preparation
      Add drops of food coloring while cooking.
      Combine all ingredients and cook to 300°. Stir in small bottle of flavored oil to coordinate with the color of candy.
       Pour out onto a cookie sheet dusted with powdered sugar.
       Cut into strips and then pieces when cool enough to handle.

CHRISTMAS WREATH COOKIES
ingredients
1 1/2  c. butter, softened
3/4  c. sugar
1  large egg
3  c. all-purpose flour
1/4  c. orange juice
1  (4 1/4 oz.) tube green decorator frosting
  red cinnamon candies
preparation
      Beat butter at medium speed of mixer until creamy.  Add sugar gradually.  Mix well.  Add flour and orange juice alternately.
      Use cookie gun fitted with proper dish to shape wreaths. Place on ungreased cookie sheet.   Bake at 375° for 8 minutes or until edges just begin to turn brown.  Remove to wire rack.  Cool completely.
      Using decorator frosting, shape leaves at one point of wreath cookie.  Embed cinnamon candies for berries.

CHRISTMAS REINDEER COOKIES
ingredients
2 1/2  c. flour
1  tsp. baking powder
1  tsp. vanilla
1/2  tsp. salt
1  c. sugar
3/4  c. soft butter or margarine
2  eggs
preparation
      Mix all ingredients except flour.  Slowly add flour until makes a ball.  For best results, chill half hour or more.  Roll out on floured surface.  Use any type cookie cutter (we prefer reindeer in our family).  Place on cookie sheets sprayed with Pam.  Bake at 350° until edges are brown.  Cool on rack for frosting.

WHITE CHRISTMAS PIE
ingredients
1  pkg, unflavored gelatin
1/4  c. hot water
1  c. sugar
5 level  Tbsp. flour
2  c. milk
1  c. whipped cream
1  tsp. vanilla
1  tsp. almond extract
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in water and let stand. Combine sugar, flour and milk in a small saucepan. Over medium heat let boil and thicken while constantly stirring. Remove from heat, stir in gelatin and let cool. Add whip cream, vanilla and almond extract. Mix well and pour into a graham cracker crust. Refrigerate.

CHRISTMAS WREATHS
ingredients
4  cups frosted flakes
1 1/2  sticks margarine
1  bag large marshmallows
1  tsp. vanilla
2  tsp. green food coloring
  cinnamon candies
preparation
      In 5 qt.  Dutch oven melt margarine and marshmallows.  Mix in vanilla and food color.  Stir in frosted flakes until well coated. Spoon onto greased pan and decorate with 3 cinnamon candies.  May also make 1 large wreath.

CHRISTMAS CRUNCH SALAD
Main Part:
ingredients
4  c. fresh broccoli florets
4  c. fresh cauliflower
1  medium red onion (chopped)
1  c. cherry tomatoes 9 Halved
preparation
      Mix with Dressing.
Dressing:
ingredients
1  c. mayonnaise
1/2  c. sour cream
1 to 2  Tbsp. sugar
1  Tbsp. vinegar
  Salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Pour dressing over veggies.  Mix - Chill about 2 hours.

CHRISTMAS ROCKS
ingredients
1  c. butter, softened
1 3/4  c. light brown sugar
3  eggs
1  tsp. vanilla
1 1/2  tsp. baking soda
2  tsp. cinnamon
1  tsp. ground cloves
3  c. flour
1  lb. light raisins
1  lb. pecan pieces
1  c. diced red candied cherries
preparation
      Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs, vanilla and dry ingredients, mixing well. Add fruit and nuts; mix well. Spoon onto cookie sheet covered with parchment paper. Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  can frozen pink lemonade
3 large  cans water (use lemonade can)
1 (46 oz.)  can pink grapefruit-pineapple juice
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 large  bottle cranberry juice cocktail
2 large  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      Combine all ingredients (except ginger ale). The ginger ale should be added just prior to serving. If more color is desired, add a few drops of food coloring. This mixture may be made ahead of time and frozen. Serves 35 to 40.

RED CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
2  pts. cranberry juice
1  qt. apple juice
10 (7 oz.)  bottles of 7-UP
2  trays 7-Up ice cubes
preparation
      Chill fruit juice and 7-Up.  Prepare 7-Up ice cubes by pouring  7-Up into 2 ice trays.  Freeze.  At serving time, combine cranberry and apple juice in a punch bowl.  Slowly pour in 7-Up. Add "ice cubes".  Serve.  Makes 35 punch cup servings.

CRANBERRY CHRISTMAS MOLD
ingredients
1  can (13 1/2 oz.) crushed pineapple
  water
2  pkg. (3 oz. each) strawberry gelatin
3/4  c. cold water
1  can (16 oz.) jellied cranberry sauce
1/3  c. coarsely chopped pecans
1  Tbsp. butter or margarine
preparation
  Drain pineapple juice into measuring cup; reserve pineapple.  Add water to juice to make 1 cup.  Bring to a boil in saucepan over moderate heat.  When boiling, remove from heat, stir in gelatin and stir until dissolved.  Add cold water; chill until mixture is consistency of unbeaten egg whites.  In medium bowl combine drained pineapple and cranberry sauce; when well mixed stir into gelatin mixture.  Pour into 9 inch square pan.  Cover and chill until firm. Meanwhile, heat oven to 350°.  Place pecans and butter in a shallow pan and bake about 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until pecans are toasted.  Cool nuts.  When gelatin mixture is firm, spread Creamy Cheese Topping over the top.  Sprinkle pecans over frosting.  Chill 3 to 4 hours until frosting is firm.  Using wet knife, cut salad into 9 squares.  With small pancake turner lift squares onto a serving plate.  Chill until serving time.  Decorate with salad greens if desired.  Makes 9 servings.
Creamy Cheese Topping:
ingredients
1  pkg. (3 1/2 oz.) vanilla flavored whipped dessert mix
1/2  c. heavy cream
1/2  c. milk
1  pkg. (3 oz.) cream cheese, at room temperature
preparation
  Place the whipped dessert mix in small bowl of electric mixer. Prepare according to package directions but substitute 1/2 cup heavy cream for the milk and 1/2 cup milk for the water.  When mixed add the cream cheese and blend well.  Use to frost Cranberry Christmas Salad.

CHRISTMAS A.M. CASSEROLE
ingredients
12  pieces bread
2 1/2  c. milk
6  oz. cheese
1  lb. sausage
6  eggs
  salt and pepper
preparation
      First Layer:  6 pieces bread, 1/2 cup cooked sausage, 1/2 egg, milk mixture and 1/2 of cheese; repeat layer.
      Beat milk, eggs, salt and pepper together. Brown sausage and drain. Bake at 350°  covered for 25 minutes uncovered 25 minutes. Make day before. Then pop into oven.

CHRISTMAS WREATHS
ingredients
1/2  cup oleo
40  large marshmallows
4  1/2 cups corn flakes
1/4  tsp. green food coloring
  red hots
preparation
      Melt oleo and marshmallows.  Add food coloring and pour over corn flakes.  Stir until flakes are coated.  Using a 1/4 cup measure, coated with cooking spray, portion out warm cereal mixture onto cookie sheet.  With buttered fingers, mold into wreaths.  Dot with red hot candies.

OMA'S CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
2  tsp. powdered sugar
2  sticks butter or margarine
1  c. chopped nuts
2  c. flour
preparation
      Cream butter and sugar together.  Add nuts and flour.  Make little balls and bake at 350° until done.  Roll them in the powdered sugar after they have cooled.

CHRISTMAS WREATHS
ingredients
40 large marshmallows or 4  c. small marshmallows
1/2  c. butter
1  tsp. vanilla
  few drops green food coloring
4 1/2  c. corn flakes
  red cinnamon candies
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
      Melt butter and marshmallows.  Add salt, vanilla and coloring. Pour over corn flakes.  Drop by spoon onto waxed paper.  Decorate with red candies.  Let set 24 hours.

CHRISTMAS DATE SQUARES
ingredients
1  pkg. dates
1/2  c. sugar
1  c. water
2/3  c. butter
1  c. brown sugar
1 1/2  c. rolled oats
1/2  tsp. vanilla
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
      Combine dates, sugar and water; cook all together until thick and put aside. Combine remaining ingredients thoroughly to make oat mixture. Put 1/2 of oat mixture into a pan and pat down. Layer the date mixture on top. Pour remainder of oat mixture on top. Bake in moderate oven until light brown.

CHRISTMAS EGGNOG
ingredients
6  c. cold milk
6  eggs
12  tsp. sugar
3  Tbsp. vanilla
6  scoops vanilla ice cream
  nutmeg
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together in a bowl or blender. Mix until smooth. Store in refrig. until time to serve. Pour into punch bowl and sprinkle with nutmeg.

CHRISTMAS SALAD
ingredients
1  can cherry pie filling
1  can Eagle Brand milk
1 (15 1/2 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
1  c. chopped pecans
1  c. mini marshmallows
1  c. Angel Flake coconut
1  (12 oz.) tub Cool Whip
preparation
      Combine all ingredients and fold into  Cool Whip. Let set and chill 4 to 5 hours or overnight.

CHRISTMAS PUDDING CAKE
ingredients
1  whole orange
1  cup raisins
1  cup sugar
2  Tbsp. butter
1  egg
2  cups flour
1  tsp. baking soda
1/2  tsp. salt
1  cup sour milk (buttermilk)
preparation
      Grind the entire orange and the raisins (use the orange peel too).  Mix the ground mixture with the sugar, butter, egg, flour, soda, salt, and milk.
      Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
      Mix 1/2 cup orange juice and 1/2 cup sugar.  Pour over the cake while still warm.

CHRISTMAS CHEESE BALL
ingredients
  equal amounts of cream cheese and Cheddar cheese
  dash of Worcestershire sauce
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
  dash of cracked pepper
1/4  c. chives
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Mix equal amounts of cream cheese and Cheddar cheese. Roll into log or ball. Place line of chili powder on wax paper and roll. Sprinkle top with chives, paprika and pepper.

CHRISTMAS BREAD
ingredients
4  c. all-purpose flour, divided
1/2  c. sugar
1 (1/4 oz.)  pkg. RapidRise yeast
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/2  c. butter or margarine
1/2  c. milk
1  tsp. vanilla extract
2  eggs
3  egg yolks, divided
2/3  c. chopped candied fruit
1/2  c. golden raisins
1  tsp. grated lemon
preparation
      Preheat oven to 325°. Butter large bowl; set aside. Butter an 8-inch round cake pan. Line inside of pan with double layer of heavy-duty foil so that foil extends 2-inches above top edge. Secure ends with paper clips. Butter inside of foil.
      In large bowl, combine 2 1/2 cups flour, sugar, yeast, salt and cinnamon. In a pot, heat butter, milk, 1/2 cup water and vanilla over low heat until warm (120° to 130°). Add butter mixture to flour mixture. At medium-high speed, beat until combined. Beat in eggs and 2 yolks, one at a time. Stir in candied fruit, raisins and zest. Beat in remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, until soft, wet dough forms. Transfer to buttered bowl; cover and let rest 10 minutes. Transfer dough to pan. Cover and let rise in warm place until dough has doubled, about 1 hour.
       Beat remaining yolk with 1 teaspoon water; brush over dough. Cut 1/2-inch deep X across center. Bake 55 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool on rack 10 minutes. Remove from pan; cool completely on rack.

CHRISTMAS BREAD
ingredients
1  pkg. active Bakers yeast (14 oz.)
3/4  c. warm water
3/4  c. evaporated milk
1/3  c. sugar
1/3  c. shortening
1/2  tsp. salt
2  large eggs
4  c. flour (extra flour may be needed)
1  c. chopped mixed candied fruit
1  c. confectioners sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      Dissolve yeast in water.  Add evaporated milk, sugar, shortening, salt and 2 cups flour.  Beat until smooth.  Stir in fruit and enough remaining flour to form a soft dough.  Do not knead.  Place in greased bowl, turning once to grease top.  Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 1/4 hours.  Punch down.  Turn onto a floured surface; knead 3 to 4 minutes.  Pat evenly into a greased 10-inch tube pan.  Cover and let rise in a warm place until nearly double in size, about 45 minutes.  Bake at 375° for 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from pan to cool on a wire rack.  Combine confectioners sugar,  milk and vanilla; drizzle over bread.  Garnish with candied fruit, if desired.  Servings: 1.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
3 small  cans frozen lemonade
1  pkg. frozen strawberries, thawed
1  pkg. lemon Kool-Aid
  water and sugar (for Kool-Aid)
1 to 2  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Make lemonade and Kool-Aid as directed. Add in strawberries. Add ginger ale just before serving. Serves 35 to 40.
      Preparation time: 5 minutes.

CHRISTMAS BRAID
ingredients
1  (16 oz.) loaf frozen bread dough
2  Tbsp. butter or margarine, softened
1/4  c. brown sugar
1/2  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/4  c. chopped pecans
1  c. confectioners sugar
4 to 5  tsp. milk
  red sugar
  pecan halves
preparation
      Thaw frozen dough; roll to 12-inch square.  Cut in 3 strips. Spread butter or margarine down lengthwise center of each strip. Combine brown sugar and cinnamon; sprinkle over butter.  Top with chopped pecans.  Bring dough up around filling, sealing edges to form 3 ropes.  Place on greased baking sheet and loosely braid. Let rise until double (about 30 minutes).  Bake at 375° for 30 to 35 minutes.  Combine confectioners sugar and enough milk to make a thin glaze.  Drizzle over braid while it is still warm. Sprinkle top with red sugar and trim with pecan halves.

CHRISTMAS SIX LAYER COOKIES
ingredients
1  stick butter
1  pkg. chocolate pieces
1  pkg. butterscotch pieces
1  can condensed milk
2 to 3  c. graham cracker crumbs
1 to 2  c. nuts, chopped
1 to 2  c. coconut
preparation
      You will also need a glass pan with greased sides.
      Melt butter and mix with graham cracker crumbs to make bottom crust. Layer chocolate, nuts, butterscotch and coconut. Pour milk over all and bake 30 to 35 minutes at 350°.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
2 (6 oz.)  cans frozen lemonade concentrate
2 (6 oz.)  cans frozen limeade concentrate
1 (46 oz.)  can unsweetened grapefruit juice
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1  qt. (32 oz.) water
3  qt. ginger ale
  lime sherbet
preparation
      Blend juices and water; chill.  Add ginger ale just before serving.  Float a half gallon of lime sherbet on top of punch mixture.

CROCK POT CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
1  can (32 oz.) pineapple juice
1  bottle (32 oz.) cranberry juice
1/3  c. red-hot candies
1 cinnamon  stick (3-1/2 inch)
  Additional cinnamon sticks, optional
preparation
      In a crockpot, combine juices, red-hot candies and cinnamon stick. Cook on low for 2-5 hours. Remove cinnamon stick(s) before serving. Yields 2 quarts.

CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS
ingredients
1  pkg. 24 frozen rolls
1  box cook and serve butterscotch pudding
1/2  c. butter or margarine
3/4  tsp. cinnamon
3/4  c. brown sugar
preparation
      Place rolls in greased tube pan.  Sprinkle dry pudding over rolls.  Cook butter, brown sugar and cinnamon until it bubbles and sugar dissolves.  Pour over rolls.  Cover tightly with foil and let sit on counter overnight, or 6 - 8 hours.  Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.  Let stand 5 minutes.  Invert onto serving plate.

CHRISTMAS SALAD
ingredients
1  can cherry pie filling
1 small  can crushed pineapple, well drained
1  can sweetened condensed milk
1 1/2  c. miniature marshmallows
1  medium container whipped topping
1/2  c. chopped pecans or walnuts
preparation
	Mix in order listed. This dessert freezes well.

CHRISTMAS SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. lime jello
1  c. boiling water
1 small  can crushed pineapple
8  oz. pkg. cream cheese
3/4  c. salad dressing
1/2  c. chopped pecans
1  pkg. strawberry jello
1  c. boiling water
1  c. cold water
preparation
      Mix lime jello, boiling water and pineapple.  Allow to congeal.  Meanwhile, soften cream cheese.  Spread cream cheese, salad dressing and pecans over lime mixture and allow to cool. Mix jello and boiling water.  Add cold water.  After mixture is cool, pour over the layer of cream cheese.  This salad is pretty and colorful as well as delicious.

CHRISTMAS CAKE
ingredients
1/2  lb. butter
1  cup sugar
5  eggs
1  tsp. vanilla extract
1  tsp. lemon extract
2  cups plain flour
1  (18 oz or 16 oz.) pineapple  preserves
1  lb. glazed cherries
4  cups nuts (chopped)
preparation
      Cream butter, add sugar gradually, beating well after each addition.  Add eggs one at a time.  Add flavorings.  Add flour and mix.  Add pineapple preserves, cherries and nuts last.  Bake 250° until done. At least 2 hours.

FAVORITE CHRISTMAS OR EASTER CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  qt. medium white sauce or 4 cans Aunt Penny's White Sauce
1  dozen hard boiled eggs
3  pkg. brown and serve sausage
2  cans sliced mushrooms
1/2  lb. Tillamook cheese
1/4  c. white wine
  bread crumbs
  chopped parsley
1  Tbsp. prepared mustard
  marjoram
  pepper
  few drops of worcestershire sauce
preparation
      Brown and drain sausage.  Cut in large pieces.  Cut eggs and cheese in large pieces.  Season white sauce with marjoram, pepper, few drops of Worcestershire.
      Put sausage, egg, cheese and mushrooms into sauce.  Put in casserole and top with bread crumbs.  Cook on high in microwave 10 to 12 minutes.  Serve on toast or English muffins.  Make day before and refrigerate.  Serves 8 to 12 people.
      Variations: Add curry, onions, bell pepper, sherry, ham or chicken.

CHOCOLATE COVERED CHRISTMAS BALLS
ingredients
1  can condensed milk
2  boxes powdered sugar
1  stick oleo
2  c. grated coconut
2  c. chopped pecans
1 large  pkg. semi-sweet chocolate pieces
2/3  cake paraffin wax
preparation
      Combine milk, sugar and oleo.  Add grated coconut and chopped pecans.  Roll into small balls and freeze hard.  Melt chocolate and wax in a double boiler.  Dip frozen balls into chocolate.  Let cool on waxed paper.  (Stick toothpick in ball to dip in chocolate and wax mixture.)  Let cool on waxed paper.

CHRISTMAS FRUITCAKE
ingredients
6  cups raisins or 2 cups white raisins or currants
2  cups prunes
8  1/2 cups mixed candied fruit
3  cups walnuts
1  Tbsp orange rind
1/2  cups fruit juice
5  cups flour
1 1/2  teaspoon salt
3  teaspoons baking powder
1  lb. shortening crisco
2  cups white sugar
1  cup brown sugar
3  teaspoons cinnamon
2  teaspoons cloves
1  teaspoon allspices
2  teaspoons mace
1  teaspoon vanilla
10  well beaten eggs
preparation
      Rinse raisins and drain on towel.  Pour boiling water over prunes.  Let stand 10 minutes.  DRAIN DRY, use scissors and cut up.  Combine nuts, rind, all fruits.  Pour juice over and let stand.
      *Mix separate.  Sift flour, salt and baking powder together. Cream shortening, sugars and eggs and spices.  Mix well and add flour mixture and vanilla.  Stir well and add to fruit.  Mix well until all fruit is evenly distributed.  Pour into loaf pans that are well lined with well greased brown paper.   Bake at 275° from 3 3/4 to 4 hours.  Makes 10 pounds.  Wrap in juice (wring out) soaked gauze (cheesecloth).  Place in foil and cool place to ripen.

CHRISTMAS PARTY PINWHEELS
ingredients
2  pkg 8 oz cream cheese, softened
  pkg 4 oz ranch salad dressing mix
1/2  c minced sweet peppers
1/4  c sliced stuffed olives
1/4  c sliced green pepper
  3-4 flour tortillas
preparation
      In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and dressing; mix until smooth.  Add red peppers, celery, onion, olives, mix well.  Spread about 3/4 c on each tortilla.  Roll up tightly wrap in plastic wrap.  Refrigerate 2 hours; slice 1/2 inch pieces.

BISCUIT CHRISTMAS TREE
ingredients
2  cans refrigerated biscuits
  powdered sugar
  green food coloring
  maraschino cherries or candied cherries
  green colored decorated sugar
preparation
	Preheat oven to 450°.  Separate biscuits from two cans of biscuits.  At center top of ungreased baking sheet, place a biscuit, then make two rows of 2 below, then two rows of 3 and two rows of 4 biscuits, making "tree" shape as you go along.  Final biscuit is made into oval and placed at center bottom of base. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.  Frost while hot with light green powdered sugar glaze.  Put large whole maraschino or candied cherries in hollows where biscuits come together and cherry halve on edges and at peak of tree.  Sprinkle with green colored sugar.
	 Recipe can be cut in half for a smaller tree.

CHRISTMAS CAULIFLOWER
ingredients
1  large head cauliflower (florets)
1/4  c. diced green pepper
1 (7.3 oz.)  jar sliced mushrooms, drained
1/4  c. butter or margarine
1/3  c. all-purpose flour
2  c. milk
1  c. (4 oz.) shredded Swiss cheese
2  Tbsp. diced pimientos
1  tsp. salt
  paprika
preparation
      In large saucepan, cook cauliflower in a small amount of water 6 to 7 minutes until crisp-tender; drain well. In medium saucepan, sauté green pepper and mushrooms in butter 2 minutes. Add flour. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese until melted. Add pimientos and salt. Place half of cauliflower in a greased 2-quart baking dish. Top  with half of sauce. Repeat layers. Bake at 325° for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika.

CHRISTMAS MORNING BREAD
ingredients
1  pkg. frozen bread rolls
1  small pkg butterscotch flavored cook and serve pudding
1 1/2  stick butter
1  c. brown sugar
1 1/2  tsp. cinnamon
1  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Grease bundt pan.  Place frozen bread rolls, 18 small squares into pan evenly.  Shake 1 small dry pudding mix over bread.  Melt butter and mix with brown sugar.  Put mixture over bread.  Shake cinnamon and pecans over rolls.  Place towel over bundt pan and set it out overnight.  In the morning, preheat oven, bake for 30 minutes in a 350° oven.  Cool for 10 minutes; turn out onto serving dish and serve.

CHRISTMAS CIDER
ingredients
2  qt. apple cider
1  c. brown sugar
3  3 inch cinnamon sticks
1  tsp. whole cloves
1  tsp. salt
preparation
      Heat to boiling point. Add remaining ingredients and simmer about 15 minutes. Strain and serve warm.

CHRISTMAS FUDGE
ingredients
1 (7 oz.)  jar marshmallow cream
1 (13 oz.)  can Carnation milk
1 1/2  lb. chocolate kisses
5  c. sugar
1/2  c. butter
6  c. pecan halves
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      Mix sugar,  milk  and butter.  Bring to a boil.  Cook 8 minutes.  Pour  mixture  over  marshmallow  cream  and kisses. Stir  until kisses melt.  Stir in nuts.  Makes approximately 5 pounds of candy.  Great for gifts.

CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST
ingredients
2 1/4  c. seasoned croutons
1 1/2  lb. pork sausage
4  eggs, beaten
2 1/4  c. milk
1 (10 oz.)  can cream of mushroom soup (undiluted)
1 (4 oz.)  can mushrooms, drained
3/4  tsp. dry mustard
2  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
      Spread croutons in a lightly greased 13 x 9 pan. Cook sausage well until brown, stirring to crumble. Drain well. Sprinkle sausage over croutons. Combine eggs, milk, soup, mushrooms and mustard; mix well and pour over sausage. Cover and refrigerate at least 8 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator and let stand 30 minutes. Bake uncovered at 325° for 50 to 55 minutes. Sprinkle cheese over top and bake an additional 5 minutes.

CHRISTMAS BIRD SEED
ingredients
15  oz pkg Sugar Smacks
16  oz pkg M&M's
16  oz pkg Raisins
16  oz pkg Roasted Peanuts
preparation
      Mix all ingredients well. Store in airtight container.

CHRISTMAS SPREAD
ingredients
1  pkg. chipped beef
1  egg
1  can tomato paste
1  onion
1/4  lb. velveeta cheese
  crackers
preparation
      Put beef through grinder. Place in double boiler with egg, cheese and tomato paste. Cook until mixed. Chill spread. When ready to serve, spread on crackers.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

CHRISTMAS SALAD
ingredients
2  c. water
1  can (1 lb.) whole cranberry sauce, mashed
2  pkg. (3 oz.) raspberry Jello
1  c. orange sections, well drained
2  c. creamed cottage cheese
preparation
      Bring 1 c. water to a boil.  Add cranberry sauce and heat until it melts.  Add jello and stir.  Add 1 c. cold water.  Chill until mixture is syrupy.  Add orange sections to jello.  Pour into ring mold.  Chill until firm.  Unmold on lettuce leaves and fill center with creamed cottage cheese.  One c. canned mandarin oranges can be used.

CHRISTMAS PICKLES
ingredients
1  gal. medium whole cucumbers
4  c. vinegar
4  Tbsp. alum
4  Tbsp. salt
4  Tbsp. pickling spice
6  c. sugar
preparation
      Wash whole cucumbers and pack tightly in wide-mouth gallon jar (glass).  Combine vinegar, alum, salt and pickling spice.  Pour this solution over cucumbers in jar.  Put lid on tight and set in a cool place for 2 weeks or more or can leave until a few weeks before Christmas.
      Turn jar upside-down every few days so brine will cover pickles. When ready to use, pour off brine.  Take out cucumbers and rinse off.  Rinse out jar.  Now slice or cube the cucumbers and put back into jar.  Add 6 cups sugar.  Mix by turning or shaking the jar, so sugar will dissolve.  Put lid on tight.  Let set overnight. Can be used as soon as you desire.  Use right from the jar, no canning to do.  Can let set on counter or cabinet top or put in the refrigerator for cooler, crisp pickle taste.  Yummy!

CHRISTMAS SALAD
ingredients
1  can applesauce
1  pkg. raspberry jello
1 small  can crushed pineapple
1/2  c. nuts
preparation
      Boil applesauce in saucepan. Stir in small jello. Mix well. Add crushed pineapple and chopped nuts. Mix well. Pour in jello mold. Chill.

MOM'S CHRISTMAS PIE
ingredients
2  Tbsp. butter
3/4  c. sugar
2  c. milk
2  egg whites, well beaten
1/4  c. cornstarch
1/2  tsp. salt
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
	Scald milk. Melt butter and blend in cornstarch, sugar and salt. Gradually add milk to melted butter mixture. Cook mixture until fairly thickened. Remove from fire; add gradually to beaten egg whites. Stir in vanilla. Pour into baked 9-inch pie shell and bake in 350° oven for 5 minutes. When cool, top with whipped cream. Garnish with chopped nuts.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1/2  c. butter
1/2  c. shortening
1 1/2  c. sugar
2  eggs
1  tsp. vanilla
2  tsp. baking powder
3  c. flour
preparation
      Mix butter, shortening, sugar, eggs and vanilla thoroughly. Add dry ingredients, mix until the dough  is firm enough to handle. This can be used in a cookie press or rolled out and cut with cookie cutters. Decorate with powdered sugar frosting.

BEST CHRISTMAS DRESSING
ingredients
  whole chicken, (cooked & deboned), save broth
4  frozen biscuits, cooked
1  pan of cornbread
3  eggs
  celery
  onion
preparation
      Mix all ingredients with plenty of broth.  Pour in large casserole dish.  Cover and bake in 350 degree oven for 1 hour.

CHRISTMAS FRUITCAKE
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. nuts (walnuts, pecans or almonds)
1  lb. raisins or dates
1/2  tsp. salt
1  tsp. baking powder
1  c. flour
1/2  c. sugar
4  eggs
1  tsp. vanilla
1  jar maraschino cherries, drained
preparation
      Make batter mixing all ingredients but fruit and nuts. Stir in fruit and nuts last. Pour into lightly greased pans and bake at 300° for following time: two 9 x 5-inch loaf pans, bake for 1 hour and 45 minutes; eight 4 x 2-inch pans, bake for 55 minutes and for 48 tart size pans, bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES AND ICING
ingredients
3  eggs
2  sticks butter
2  cups sugar
1/2  cup evaporated milk
1  tsp. baking soda
1  Tbsp. almond extract, or 2 tsp. nutmeg, or 1 1/2 Tbsp. vanilla
2  tsp. baking powder
7  1/2 cups flour
preparation
      Beat eggs. Add butter, sugar, milk and mix.  Mix soda and a little water (enough to stir) and add to mixture.  Sift flour and baking powder together and blend gradually into cookie mixture. Grease and flour cookie sheets.  Roll dough into 1/4 inch thickness and cut with Christmas cookie cutters and place on cookie sheets.  Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes.
Icing:
ingredients
2  cups powdered sugar
3  Tbsp. evaporated milk
1  tsp. vanilla
  1-3 drops of food coloring
preparation
      Sift powdered sugar and stir in milk until mixture reaches icing consistency.  Add vanilla extract for flavor and stir. Divide icing into containers and add food coloring to each container to obtain desired colors.  Ice cookies after they have cooled.  Allow icing to dry before moving cookies.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1 1/2  c. sugar
1  c. shortening
2  eggs
1  c. milk
2  tsp. vinegar
3  c. flour
1  tsp. nutmeg
1  tsp. baking soda
1  tsp. vanilla
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
      Cream sugar, shortening, eggs until fluffy. In another bowl, add nutmeg, salt, flour; stir baking soda and vinegar into milk. Then add to dry ingredients with creamed mixture, stirring briskly until well mixed, add vanilla. Drop by teaspoonful on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375°  for 10 minutes. Sprinkle top with red or green colored sugar to decorate.
       Very festive during the Holiday Season.

CHRISTMAS PIE
ingredients
5  eggs
2 1/2  c. hash  browns
1/2  c. cottage cheese
1 1/2  c. shredded swiss cheese
1/3  c. milk
1  tsp. salt
8  slices crumbled bacon
1/8  tsp. pepper
1  Tbsp. bacon fat
2  chopped green onions
1/2  c. corn flake crumbs
preparation
      Beat eggs until foamy.  Stir in hash browns, cheese, milk, onions and seasoning.  Pour into 9 inch pie tin.  Cook bacon until crisp.  Save 1 Tbsp. of fat.   Crumble bacon over egg mixture. Combine cornflakes and bacon fat.  Sprinkle over egg mixture. Cover and refrigerate over night.  Bake uncovered at 325 degrees for 50 minutes or until golden brown.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
2  c. light brown sugar
2  eggs
4  c. plain flour
1  c. oleo
2/3  c. buttermilk
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. soda
2  tsp. vanilla
1  lb. chopped dates
1/2  lb. candied cherries, chopped
1/2  lb. candied pineapple, chopped
1 (7 oz.)  pkg. flaked coconut
3  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Mix sugar and oleo, then add eggs.  Dredge chopped fruit with flour. Put soda in buttermilk and mix all together.  Bake on ungreased cookie sheet at 350° for 10 to 15 minutes until slightly brown.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  c. light brown sugar
1  c. butter
4  eggs
3  c. flour
1/2  tsp. salt
1  tsp. soda
1  tsp. cinnamon
2  tsp. vanilla
1  tsp. cherry flavoring
1  lb. pineapple
1  lb. cherries
1  c. white raisins
1  lb. dates
7  c. nuts
preparation
      Mix together and drop from teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 275° until light brown. Makes about 200 cookies.

CHRISTMAS FRUITCAKE
ingredients
1  lb butter
1  1/2 lb brown sugar
1  1/2 lbs flour
2  tsp nutmeg
1  tsp mace
1  tsp cloves
2  tsp cinnamon
1  tsp baking soda
3  tsp baking powder
3  lbs raisins
2  lbs currants
1  lb citron, sliced
1  lb dates, sliced
10  eggs, well beaten
1  c molasses
1  c strong cold coffee
  Juice and grated rind of 1 lemon
1  c tart jelly
1/4  lb almonds, sliced
preparation
      Cream butter and sugar until fluffy.  Sift dry ingredients together 3 times and mix with fruit.  Add eggs to creamed mixture. Add flour-fruit mixture alternately with next 5 ingredients and beat thoroughly.  Pour into pans lined with greased paper. Sprinkle almonds on top.  Cover cakes with greased paper.  Steam for 2 hours, then bake in slow oven 300° 1 1/2 to 2 hours, removing paper last 1/2 hour to dry surface.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  c. butter
1 1/2  c. sugar
2  eggs
2  tsp. vanilla
1  tsp. almond extract
3 1/2  c. all-purpose flour
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. baking soda
preparation
      Cream together butter, sugar and eggs. In separate bowl, combine flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda. Add flour mixture gradually to butter mixture. Mix well. Add vanilla and almond extracts.
       Option 1:  You may add 1/3 cup pistachios.
      Option 2:  You may add 2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips.
      Option 3:  Roll out each cookie into a ball. Make thumbprint in the center of each cookie. Fill hole with a drop of seedless raspberry preserves.
Option 4:
ingredients
1  oz. red food coloring
1  Tbsp. milk
1  oz. green food coloring
1  Tbsp. milk
preparation
      You may halve cookie dough and add red food coloring and 1 tablespoon milk to one half of dough and green food coloring and 1 tablespoon milk to the other half. Roll out each half to equal lengths. Braid together and cut to desired size.
       Bake at 350° until done.

CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST
ingredients
1  lb. sausage
8  slices bread, cubed
2 1/2  c. grated cheese
1  can mushroom soup
4  eggs, beaten
3/4  tsp. dry mustard
3  c. milk
preparation
      Brown sausage and layer sausage, bread and cheese in 9 x 13 pan. Mix together mushroom soup, eggs, mustard and milk.  Pour over other ingredients and bake for 350° for 1 hour. Top will be raised and slightly brown.  Best if fixed night before and baked in the morning.

GRAM CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
2  pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid, chilled
2  cans Hawaiian Punch, chilled
3  liters ginger ale, chilled
2  qt. rainbow sherbet
preparation
      Premix Kool-Aid according to directions on pack.  Makes 1 gallon.  Pour 1/2 Kool-Aid in punch bowl.  Add 1/2 ginger ale and 1/2 sherbet.  This will make 2 punch bowls full.

WHITE CHRISTMAS FUDGE
ingredients
2  c. sugar
2/3  c. milk
1/4  c. butter or margarine
12  oz. white chocolate, coarsely chopped
1/2  tsp. almond extract (optional)
3/4  c. dried cherries or cranberries, coarsely chopped
3/4  c. toasted almond slices
preparation
      Line 8-inch square pan with foil, then grease foil. Mix sugar and milk in 3-quart saucepan. Over medium heat, add butter and bring to boil, stirring constantly. Boil for another 5 minutes without stirring. On low heat, add chocolate and almond extract. Stir, then whisk until chocolate melts and mixture is smooth. Stir in dried cherries (or cranberries or apricots) and toasted almonds. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Refrigerate 2 hours until firm. Invert pan; peel off foil and cut into 1-inch squares. Garnish as desired.

CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  bag partially thawed hash browns
4  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
1  c. Parmesan cheese
10  eggs
4  c. milk
2  bottles Hormel "real" bacon bits
  dash of pepper
1  tsp. dry mustard
preparation
      Prepare 24 hours ahead of time.
      Put thawed frozen hash browns in bottom of greased pan.  Beat eggs until well blended.  Add other ingredients and mix by hand well.  Pour over hash browns.  Cover and put in refrigerator.
       Next morning, bake at 350° for an hour or until eggs are set.

CHRISTMAS DANISH PUFF PASTRY
ingredients
1/2  c. butter
2  Tbsp. ice water
1  c. flour
1/2  c. butter
1  c. flour
1  c. water
3  eggs
preparation
      In a bowl, cut 1/2 cup butter into 1 cup flour.  Sprinkle the cold water over the mixture.  Stir until blended.  Shape into a ball and divide in two.  Roll each piece into a 3 x 12-inch oblong.  Place them on a baking sheet.  Spread with your favorite jam and refrigerate.
      In a saucepan, bring 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup water to a rolling boil until the butter is melted.  Stir in all the flour at once.  Beat vigorously over low heat until mixture leaves the pan and forms a ball.  Remove from heat.  Beat in the eggs, one at a time.  Mixture should be smooth and satiny.  Spread over the pastries (seal the edges so that the jam will not seep out).  Bake in a 425° oven until puffed and golden (about 30 minutes).  Remove to a rack and cool.
Icing:
ingredients
1  c. confectioners sugar
2  Tbsp. hot milk
1/2  Tbsp. butter
1/2  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      Mix these ingredients together.  Spread over pastry just before serving.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
3   6  oz   cans frozen lemonade concentrate
1  pound box frozen strawberries
1  quart ginger ale
preparation
      Prepare lemonade as directed, add thawed strawberries and ice cubes. Add ginger ale just before serving. Makes 1 1/2 gallons of punch.

DICKENS CHRISTMAS GREAT CAKE
ingredients
2 1/4  c. sifted cake flour
1  tsp. baking powder
1/4  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. ground nutmeg
1/2  tsp. ground cinnamon
3/4  c. butter
1 1/4  c. sifted confectioners sugar
4  eggs
2  Tbsp. each light corn syrup and water
1/2  c. extra strength coffee
1/2  c. white raisins
1  c. seedless raisins
1  c. currants
1  c. chopped mixed candied fruit
1  c. finely slivered almonds
preparation
      Sift flour with baking powder, salt, nutmeg and cinnamon. Cream butter; gradually add sifted confectioners sugar and cream until light and fluffy.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition.  Then add flour mixture alternately with extra strength coffee, beginning and ending with flour and beating after each addition until smooth (batter will look curdled).  Fold in white raisins, seedless raisins, currants, mixed candied fruit and slivered almonds.  Spread in well-greased 9-inch tube pan.  Bake in moderate 350° oven 30 minutes.  Then sprinkle almonds on top of cake.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes longer.  Simmer corn syrup and water for 1 minute and brush over top of cake to hold almonds in place and to give a gloss.  Cool cake 15 minutes in pan, then turn out on rack to finish cooling.  Cake will slice best when chilled.  Eat at room temperature.

CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. fresh cranberries
2  pkg. cherry flavored gelatin
1  c. sugar
1  c. chopped celery
1  can no. 2 crushed pineapple
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1  c. chopped grapes
preparation
      Cook the cranberries in 3/4 cup water a few minutes, until tender.  While still hot, dissolve the gelatin and sugar in this mixture.  Let cool to lukewarm.  Add the grapes, celery, undrained crushed pineapple and nuts.  Chill in a 1 1/2 qt. ring mold. Serve with Snowy Dressing.
Snowy Dressing:
ingredients
1  c. whipped cream
120  miniature marshmallows
3  oz. cream cheese
preparation
      Whip the cream and whip in the softened cream cheese.  Fold in the marshmallows.

MIMI'S CHRISTMAS WREATHS
ingredients
1/2  c. margarine
1  tsp. vanilla
5  c. corn flakes
35  large marshmallows
1 1/2  tsp. green food coloring
preparation
      Melt margarine with marshmallows. Add vanilla and food coloring. Pour over corn flakes and mix. Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper. Put "red hots" or cherry halves in middle to form wreath. Chill about 40 minutes. Makes 2 dozen.
