CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  c. soft shortening
2  c. brown sugar
2  eggs
3 1/2  c. flour
1  tsp. soda
1  tsp. salt
1 1/2  c. pecans, broken
2  c. candied cherries
2  c. dates, cut up
preparation
      Mix shortening, brown sugar and eggs.  Add flour, soda and salt.  Then add fruits: cherries and dates, then pecans.  Chill at least one hour.  Drop by teaspoon 2 inches apart on greased cookie sheet.  Bake in 400° oven until lightly browned.

CHRISTMAS COKE-CHERRY SALAD
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. raspberry Jell-O
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cherry Jell-O
1  can cherries or seedless grapes, drained
1 large  can crushed pineapple, drained
1  c. pecans, chopped
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, frozen
2  (6 1/2 oz.) cokes, partially frozen
preparation
      Dissolve jello in juice heated from cherries and pineapple. This is all the liquid.  Add coke, cherries (or grapes), pineapple and nuts.  Grate frozen cream cheese on top.  Place in refrigerator.  Serve cold.

CHRISTMAS CRUNCHERS
ingredients
2  c. pretzel pieces, broken
1  can (3 oz) chow mein noodles
1 1/2  c. salted roasted peanuts
5  c. miniature marshmallows
6  tbsp. butter or margined
  red and green candy melts, melted
preparation
      Line baking sheets with waxed paper, coat with cooking spray. In large mixing bowl, combine pretzels, noodles and peanuts; set aside. In pot over medium heat, melt marshmallows with butter; cook, stirring until smooth. Pour over reserved pretzel mixture; stir until well coated. Coat hands with cooking spray, shape mixture into 1 1/2 in. mounds, place on baking sheets. Using fork drizzle stacks with melted candy melts.

CHRISTMAS COOKIE CANES
ingredients
1  c. soft butter
1/2  tsp. salt
2  tsp. vanilla
1/2  c. sifted powdered sugar
2  c. sifted all-purpose flour
1  c. uncooked quick oats
  candied cherries, halved
preparation
      With electric mixer, cream together butter, salt, vanilla and powdered sugar until light and fluffy. At low speed, add flour and oats until just mixed. Form dough into large or small canes. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Place cherry halves on canes and bake in a preheated 325° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly golden brown.

CHRISTMAS OPEN HOUSE PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
1  qt. water
2  pkg. lime Kool-Aid
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve water and sugar, add Kool-Aid and pineapple juice. When ready to serve, add the ginger ale.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES-SINGLE BATCH
ingredients
1  c. shortening
1  c. powder sugar
2  c. flour
1  egg
2  Tbsp. milk
1  tsp. baking soda
1  tsp. cream of tartar
1  tsp. vanilla
2  c. sugar
2  tsp. cinnamon
2  c. shredded carrots
  1-7 oz. pkg. coconut
1  c. chopped nuts
2  c. unsifted flour
2  tsp. baking soda
1  tsp. salt
3/4  c. oil
3  eggs, unbeaten
2  tsp. vanilla
1 small  can crushed pineapple, drain
preparation
      Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees in a 9 x 13 pan.  Test for doneness with a toothpick.

CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST
ingredients
1-1/2  lbs sausage
9  slices white bread
1  stick butter, softened
2  c cheddar cheese, shredded
8  eggs
2-1/2  c half & half
1-1/2  tsp salt
1-1/2  tsp dry mustard
preparation
      Butter the bread and cut into cubes.  Put in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.  Brown the sausage.  Drain and crumble over the bread.  Put cheese over the sausage and bread.  Mix together eggs, half & half, salt and dry mustard.  Pour over the cheese. Cover and refrigerate overnight (8 hours).  Heat oven to 350°. Bake for 40-50 minutes or until lightly browned.  Serve with biscuits and fresh fruit.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
1  Pkg. Cherry or Raspberry Kool-Aid
2  C. Water
1  1/2 to 2  C. Sugar
1/4 to 1/2 of (2 liter)  bottle 7-UP
7  to 8 Scoops Vanilla Ice Cream
preparation
      Mix all ingredients in order listed in punch bowl.
      Makes about one gallon.

CHRISTMAS PICKLES
Step 1:
ingredients
2  gal. cucumbers
2  c. lime
2  gal. water
1  c. vinegar
1  tsp. alum
1  bottle red food coloring
preparation
      *See step 2 for the rest of the ingredients.
      DAY 1 - Step 1:  Slice, peel, and cut cucumbers into rings, taking out seeds.  Mix ingredients - covering rings and simmer 2 hours.  DO NOT BOIL.  Drain.
       Go to step 2.
Step 2:
ingredients
3  c vinegar
15  c sugar
1  lb red hots candy
3  c water
10  cinnamon sticks
preparation
      Boil mixture, pour over cucumbers and let stand over night.
      Day 2:  Drain cucumbers and bring syrup to a boil.  Pour over rings and set stand over night.
      Day 3:  Repeat (day 2 process).
      Day 4:  Put all into sterilized jars and seal.

WHITE CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
1  c. water
1 (12 oz.)  can evaporated milk
1  Tbsp. almond extract
3 (1/2 gal.)  cartons vanilla ice cream, softened
6 (2 liter)  bottles Sprite, chilled
preparation
      Combine sugar and water in a saucepan.  Cook over medium heat until sugar dissolves, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat. Add evaporated milk and almond extract. Let cool. Chill until ready to serve.
      Combine milk mixture and remaining ingredients in punch bowl, just before serving, stirring to break ice cream into small pieces. Yield: About 3 1/2 gallons.
      Can add ice chips to make it colder.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

CHRISTMAS CHEESE BALL
ingredients
2  (8 oz.) packages cream cheese
3  green onions, chopped
1 (2 1/2 oz.)  jar dried beef, chopped
1 (4 oz.)  can mushrooms, chopped
1 (2 1/4 oz.)  can chopped ripe olives
2  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Mix all but pecans.  Shape into ball (cone for a tree) with Saran wrap and refrigerate.  To serve, roll ball in pecans or slice stuffed green olives for tree decorations.  Top with a cinnamon star cookie.

CHRISTMAS (OR ANYTIME) COOKIES
ingredients
1  c. butter
1  c. sugar
2  Tbsp. milk
1  tsp. flavoring of your choice
2 1/2  c. self-rising flour
3/4  c. flaked coconut
1/2  c. finely chopped pecans
3/4  c. finely chopped red and green candied cherries
preparation
      In a mixing bowl, combine softened butter with sugar and cream. Add milk and flavoring. Stir in flour, candied cherries and pecans. Form in 2 rolls. Roll in coconut; wrap in wax paper and chill overnight.
      Slice 1/4-inch thickness; place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake in 375° oven for 12 minutes, until edges begin to brown.

MEDITERRANEAN  CHRISTMAS BREAD
ingredients
1/4  oz. pkg. (2 1/2 tsp.) dry yeast
1/4  c. warm water
2  tsp. cardamom
1/4  tsp. salt
2  egg whites, room temperature
1/3  c. sugar
1/4  c. skim milk, room temperature
1/8   c. vegetable oil
1 1/2  c. whole wheat flour
1  c. white flour
1/4  c. raisins
1/4  c. chopped walnuts
preparation
      Dissolve yeast, 1/3 of sugar, in small bowl with warm water. In a large bowl, mix rest of sugar with cardamom, salt, egg whites, milk, and oil. Add yeast and rest of ingredients. Mix well to blend. Knead on floured board 5 minutes until smooth, elastic. Shape into ball, place in sprayed 8 inch round cake pan. Cover with damp cloth, let dough rise to double. Bake 350° 35-40 minutes until golden brown.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
2  pkg. Kool-Aid (sugar sweetened)
1  can frozen orange juice, thawed
1 lg.  can pineapple juice
preparation
      Mix all ingredients in a gallon jug.  Fill remainder of jug with water.

CHRISTMAS CHILI ROLL
ingredients
1  pound longhorn cheese (ground)
2  tablespoons worcestershire sauce
8  ounce package cream cheese
1/3  cup chopped pecans
  Chili powder, Salt, pepper, garlic powder to taste
preparation
      Thoroughly mix cheese with ground cheese.  Add all other ingredients and mix well.  Shape into 4 rolls.  Put chili powder on wax paper.  Wrap rolls in aluminum foil and refrigerate until used. Slice before serving or cheese can be made into balls and at room temperature can be used as spread.  Sharp cheddar cheese can be substituted instead of longhorn.

CHRISTMAS TEA
ingredients
1  qt. water
3  c. sugar
  cinnamon sticks
  whole cloves
  whole allspice
8  tea bags
2 large  cans pineapple-orange juice
1 large  can grapefruit juice
1 large  bottle apple juice
1/2  c. lemon juice
1/2  pt. apricot brandy
preparation
      Syrup:  Combine 1 quart water, sugar, cinnamon sticks, whole cloves and allspice.  Boil rapidly for at least 10 minutes.
      Meanwhile, steep tea bags in 6 cups water until very strong. Remove spices from syrup except for a couple cinnamon sticks.  Pour juices in with syrup in very large pan.  Use only 1/2 can of grapefruit juice.  Add tea and 1/2 teaspoon salt.  Then add apricot brandy, if desired.  Makes about 2 gallons.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
1  gal. apple cider
6  lemons
6  small oranges
1  qt canned pineapple juice
1 3-inch  stick cinnamon
8  whole cloves
3  pieces ginger
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
	Place the spices in a bag of fine cheesecloth.	Peel & cut into thin slices the lemons and oranges, mixing with the apple cider and pineapple juice.  To this add the bag of spices and bring to a very low simmering boil.  Stir as it simmers for approximately 15 minutes, then add salt and stir vigorously.  Just prior to serving, add as much rum as preferred.

CHRISTMAS RAINBOW POKE CAKE
ingredients
1 (18.25 oz.)  pkg. Betty Crocker SuperMoist white cake mix
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. raspberry gelatin
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime gelatin
2  c. boiling water
1  (8 oz.) container Cool Whip, thawed
preparation
      Prepare cake mix as directed on package. Pour into two 8 or 9-inch round pans. Bake as directed. Cool 10 minutes; remove from pans. Cool completely. Place cake layers, top side up, back in cleaned pans. Prick each with a utility fork at about 1/2-inch intervals. Pour 1 cup of the boiling water over the raspberry gelatin; stir until dissolved. Spoon over one layer. Repeat with lime gelatin over other layer. Refrigerate 3 to 4 hours. Dip one layer in pan of hot water for 10 seconds; invert on serving plate. Spread with 1 cup Cool Whip. Repeat with remaining layer, inverting it onto the Cool Whip. Frost with remaining Cool Whip. Refrigerate. Garnish with flattened gumdrops out to resemble holly, if desired.

CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY
ingredients
3 1/2  c. sugar
1  c. light corn syrup
1  c. water
1/4 to 1/2  tsp. peppermint oil
1  tsp. red or green food coloring
preparation
      In a large heavy saucepan, combine sugar, corn syrup and water. Cook on medium heat until candy thermometer reads 300° (hard-crack stage), stirring occasionally.  Remove from heat.  Stir in oil and food coloring.  Pour onto a greased cookie sheet.  Cool.  Break into pieces.
       Peppermint oil is available in cake decorating and candy supply stores.

WHITE CHRISTMAS PIE
ingredients
1  Tbsp. unflavored Knox gelatine, softened in 1/4 c. cold water and set aside
1/2  c. sugar
4  Tbsp. flour
1/2  tsp. salt
1 1/2  c. milk
1/4  tsp. vanilla
1/4  tsp. almond extract
1/2  c. heavy whipping cream
3 egg whites, beaten with 1  tsp. cream of tartar
1/2  c. more sugar
1  c. moist coconut
1  (9-inch) pastry shell, baked
preparation
      In saucepan, combine 1/2 cup sugar, flour and salt. Gradually stir in milk. Cook over low heat until boils 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in gelatine. Beat until smooth. Cool. Blend in flavors. Fold in whipped cream (already whipped) and carefully fold in meringue, then coconut. Put in baked pastry shell and sprinkle top with coconut. Garnish with maraschino cherries, if desired.

CHRISTMAS CAULIFLOWER
ingredients
1  large head cauliflower broken into florets
1/4  c. diced bell pepper
1  jar (7.3 oz.) sliced mushrooms, drained
1/4  c. butter
1/3  c. all purpose flour
2  c. milk
1  c. (4 oz.) shredded swiss cheese
2  Tbsp. diced pimentos
1  tsp. salt
preparation
      In a large saucepan cook cauliflower in a a small amount of water for 6 to 7 minutes until crisp and tender. Drain well. In a medium saucepan sauté bell peppers and mushrooms in butter for 2 minutes. Add flour and gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil and boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in cheese until melted. Add pimentos and salt. Place half of the cauliflower in a greased 2 quart  baking dish. Top with half of sauce. Repeat layers. Bake uncovered at 325 degrees for 25 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with paprika if desired.
      Yields 8 to 10 servings.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
  pineapple juice
  cranberry juice
  Sprite
preparation
      Mix equal parts pineapple juice, cranberry juice, and Sprite in a large punch bowl.

WHITE CHRISTMAS CANDY
ingredients
2  lbs. white candy coating, cut into small chunks
1/2  lb. crushed candy canes or crushed peppermint candies
preparation
      Melt candy coating over medium low heat, stirring until smooth.  Stir in peppermint candy.  Spread on waxed paper lined baking sheets; refrigerate for 8 to 10 minutes.  Break into small pieces; store in an airtight container.

CHRISTMAS RIBBON SALAD
ingredients
2 (16 oz.)  cans pitted, dark, sweet cherries, chopped
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. cherry flavored Jell-O
1  pkg. unflavored gelatin
2  c. boiling water
1/3  c. sugar
1/2  c. Port wine or other sweet flavored red wine (sweet vermouth works)
1/4  c. lemon juice
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/2  c. pecans, chopped
preparation
      Drain cherries, reserving 1 cup juice. Chop cherries. Stir together gelatins and 2 cups boiling water until dissolved. Stir in reserved cherry juice, sugar, wine and lemon juice. Stir in cherries. Pour half of the mixture into a lightly greased 10-cup ring mold or Bundt pan. Chill 2 hours or until almost set.
       Stir together remaining Jell-O mixture, softened cream cheese and pecans. Blend well. This is the tricky part. Make sure the cream cheese is really soft and blend the Jell-O into the cream cheese a little at a time. Pour over slightly set Jell-O mixture in mold. Cover and chill 6 hours or overnight. Unmold before serving and garnish with whipped cream and/or cranberries if desired.

CHRISTMAS PARTY PINWHEELS
ingredients
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1 (4 oz.)  pkg. Ranch salad dressing mix
1/2  c. sweet red pepper, minced
1/2  c. celery, minced
1/4  c. green onions, sliced
1/4  c. stuffed olives, sliced
3  to 4 (10 inch) flour tortillas
preparation
      In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and dressing mix until smooth.  Add red pepper, celery, green onions and olives; mix well. Spread about 3/4 cup on each tortilla.  Roll up tightly; wrap in plastic wrap.  Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.  Slice into 1/2 inch pieces.

CHRISTMAS CASSEROLE COOKIES
ingredients
2  eggs
1  c. sugar
1  c. walnuts
1  c. chopped dates
1  c. flaked coconut
1  tsp. vanilla
1/4  tsp. almond extract
preparation
      Beat eggs well and gradually add sugar. Beat until fluffy. Stir in remaining ingredients. Place in a 2-quart casserole. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. While hot, stir well with a wooden spoon. Cool and form into small balls; roll in granulated sugar.

YUGOSLAVIAN CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  cup butter, softened
1  - 1/2 cups sugar, divided
1  egg yolk
1/2  teaspoon salt
2  - 1/2 cups flour
4  egg whites
3/4  cup nuts, chopped
1  teaspoon lemon extract
1  cup blackberry jelly
preparation
      Cream butter with 1/2 cup sugar; add egg yolk and salt. Stir in flour. Pat mixture into 10 x 15 inch pan. Stir jelly over dough. Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry.  Add remaining cup of sugar, beating slowly. Fold in most of nut and the lemon extract. Spread meringue over jelly. Top with the rest of the nuts.

CHRISTMAS SCONES
ingredients
2 1/4  C. self-rising flour
1/3  C. sugar
1/2  tsp. baking soda
1  C. cranberries, chopped
1/2  C. buttermilk
2  Tbsp. grated orange peel
1/2  C. butter
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      Combine flour sugar, orange peel and baking soda. Cut in butter until resembles crumbs. Add cranberries. Add buttermilk and vanilla. Form dough into 2 equal balls. On floured surface work ball into 6 inch circle 1/2 inch thick. Cut circle into 6 wedges. Place on nonstick baking sheet, leaving 1 inch between each one. Repeat using remaining dough. Bake until lightly brown, about 10-15 minutes. Serve with whipped cream and orange marmalade. Makes 12 servings

CHRISTMAS WREATHS
ingredients
1/2  c. lightly salted butter or margarine
1 to 1 1/2  tsp. green food color
4  c. corn flakes
30  large marshmallows
1 1/2  tsp. vanilla extract
  Red cinnamon candies
preparation
      In a 2 quart saucepan melt butter and marshmallows over moderately low heat, stirring constantly. When melted, remove from heat and stir in 1 tsp. of the food color and the vanilla. Add more food color if desired. Stir in corn flakes. Drop mixture onto waxed paper, 1 Tbsp. at a time. Decorate with red cinnamon candies. Let stand 30 minutes until cool. Makes 40 wreaths.

CHRISTMAS BREAD WREATH
Frosting:
ingredients
2  c. powdered sugar
1/2  tsp. almond flavoring
  milk (small amount)
  nut halves
  candied cherries (both red and green)
preparation
      Place defrosted bread in oiled bowl and cover with tea towel. Let rise in warm place 3 to 4 hours.  Punch down (do not knead). Stretch onto an oiled cookie sheet to approximately 8 1/2 x 12-inch rectangle.  Spread with soft butter or oleo.  Sprinkle with brown sugar, white sugar, cinnamon, raisins, ground nuts and candied fruits.  Roll like a jelly roll.  Wet hands and pinch ends together securely, making a large ring.  Cut with scissors every 1/2-inch around the ring.  Using hands, twist each section to lay flatter and hide the cookie sheet.  Let rise until almost double in warm place.  Bake 1/2 hour at 350° until lightly browned.
      Immediately frost with the powdered sugar, almond flavoring and small amount of milk. Decorate the top with nut halves and candied cherries. Put a large candle in the middle. Light candle and serve on large round platter.

CHRISTMAS COFFEE CAKE
ingredients
2 1/4  oz. pkg. dry active yeast
1/2  c. warm water
1 1/2  c. butter, softened
1  c. sugar
1  doz. egg yolks
5  c. flour
3/4  tsp. salt
1 1/2  c. scalded milk
1 1/2  c. golden raisins
1  c. slivered almonds
  confectioners sugar
preparation
      Dissolve yeast in water.  Cream butter and sugar.  Slowly add egg yolks and beat well.  Add yeast mixture to batter.  Combine flour and salt.  Beat slowly into the batter, alternating with the scalded milk.  Coat raisins in flour to prevent "sinking" in batter.  Add raisins and almonds to batter.  Divide into three 1 1/2-quart tube pans.  Each pan should be 1/2 full.  To rise, cover and let sit in a warm place for 3 hours.  Batter will almost double in size.  Bake at 325° for 35 minutes.  Cool 10 minutes. Remove cakes from the pans and sprinkle with confectioners sugar. Yield:  3 pans.

CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  doz. eggs
4  c. milk
1  lb. sausage
6  pieces of bacon
10  pieces crumbled bread
16  oz. shredded cheddar cheese
preparation
      Cook sausage and bacon.  Mix eggs, milk, crumbled bread and cheese in a large bowl.  Add crumbled sausage and bacon.  Place in 9x13 greased dish.  Place in refrigerator overnight.  Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour.

CHRISTMAS ROCKS
ingredients
1  c. margarine
1 1/2  c. brown sugar
1  tsp. cinnamon
1  lb. chopped nuts
1  lb. golden raisins
1  lb. chopped dates
3  jars red cherries
3  jars green cherries
3  eggs
3  c. self-rising flour
1  tsp. soda, dissolved in water
preparation
      Mix all dried fruit and nuts in flour.  Then mix together with eggs, sugar, cinnamon and margarine.  Add drained cherries and soda.  Add some juice of red cherries, this adds taste and color.  Bake 350° for 12-15 minutes.  Let cool.

CHRISTMAS SALAD
ingredients
6  chopped (unpeeled, red) apples
1 #2  can crushed or small tidbits pineapple (drain, reserve juice)
1  pkg. miniature marshmallows
3  eggs, beaten
1  c. sugar
1  tsp. mustard
  pineapple juice (reserved from pineapple)
  juice from one lemon
  dash of salt
3  Tbsp. flour
preparation
      Combine apples, drained pineapple and marshmallows. Set aside. Cook the remaining ingredients, include the reserved pineapple juice, until thick. Allow the mixture to cool and pour over fruit. Do not mix. Top with coconut.

FUDGY CHRISTMAS WREATH
ingredients
1 (14 oz.)  can sweetened condensed milk
2  c. (12 oz.) semi-sweet chocolate chips
1  c. chopped walnuts
1/2  tsp. vanilla extract
  red and green maraschino cherries
preparation
      In a saucepan over low heat, cook and stir milk and chocolate chips until chocolate melts and mixture is slightly thickened, about 6 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in nuts and vanilla. Cool until it starts to set, about 15 minutes. Line a baking sheet with waxed paper. Spoon chocolate mixture by 2 tablespoonfuls into small mounds to form a wreath. Decorate with cherries. Chill until firm. Serve chilled. Yield: about 24 servings.

CHRISTMAS WREATHS
ingredients
1/2  c. butter
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. marshmallows
1  tsp. green food coloring
6  cups cornflakes
  Red cinnamon candies or red Mini M&M's
preparation
      Melt butter in saucepan over low heat.  Add marshmallows. cook until marshmallows melt and mixture is syrupy, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.
       Add food coloring.  Blend well.  Add cornflakes.  Stir until coated.  Divide into 1/4  c. portions on wax paper.  Shape into wreaths with buttered fingers.  Decorate with red candies.  Let stand until cool.  (May press entire warm mixture into an 8 cup buttered ring mold to make a large wreath.)

CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS
ingredients
1  bag (24) frozen dinner rolls
1 (3 3/4 oz.)  pkg. butterscotch pudding mix (not instant)
1/2  c. butter
3/4  c. brown sugar
3/4  tsp. cinnamon
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Arrange rolls in greased, fluted tube pan.  Sprinkle dry pudding mix over rolls.  Cook butter and remaining ingredients over low heat until mixture bubbles; pour over rolls.
      Cover tightly with foil and let stand on countertop overnight. Next morning, bake at 350° for 30 minutes.  Let stand 5 minutes, then invert carefully onto serving dish.

CHRISTMAS CHERRY TARTS
ingredients
2/3  c. graham cracker crumbs
2  Tbsp. butter or margarine, melted
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1  tsp. vanilla extract
1  egg
1/3  c. sugar
24  cherries (from 1 can cherry pie filling)
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°. Grease two 1 3/4-inch tartlet or small cupcake pans. Combine graham cracker crumbs with butter or margarine; press a rounded teaspoonful of crumb mixture into each cupcake pan. Beat cream cheese, vanilla, egg and sugar until well blended. Fill each cupcake pan. Bake 10 minutes. Chill thoroughly. When ready to serve, run a thin knife around each tart and lift out of pan. Top with a pie cherry. Makes 24.
      To store: Refrigerate in airtight covered container up to 1 week. Or omit cherry; wrap well, label and date. Freeze up to 3 months. To serve, thaw; top with cherry.

CHRISTMAS CRUNCH
ingredients
1  large bag M&M's  (in Christmas colors)
1  jar dry roasted peanuts (with salt)
1/2  box Golden Grahams cereal
  pretzel sticks (optional)
1  lb. vanilla almond bark
preparation
      Mix together all of the ingredients and spread mixture out on waxed paper. Melt almond bark in microwave and pour over mixture. Let cool and crumble up. Store in covered container.

CHRISTMAS SALAD
ingredients
12  oz. Cool Whip
1 large  can crushed pineapple, drained
1  c. chopped nuts
1  can cherry or strawberry pie filling
1  can sweetened condensed milk
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together. Chill overnight.

CHRISTMAS DAY PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. apple cider
2  c. orange juice
2  c. cranberry juice
2  broken cinnamon sticks
2  tsp. whole cloves
2  tsp. allspice
preparation
      Perk & serve.

GRANNY'S CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  can pineapple juice
1  Tbsp. almond flavoring
1 1/2  c. sugar
1  carton lime sherbet
18  oz. bottle real lemon juice
1  pkg. lime jello
1  jar maraschino cherries
preparation
      Place all ingredients in gallon jug and fill up with water. When ready to serve, pour into punch bowl and add lime sherbet and maraschino cherries.

CHRISTMAS MIX
ingredients
3  c. Corn Chex cereal
3  c. Rice Chex cereal
3  c. Cheerios (plain)
1  (12 oz.) bag red and green M&M's
1 (12 oz.)  jar or 2 1/2 c. salted peanuts
3  c. thin pretzel sticks, broken in half
1 to 1 1/2  lb. white chocolate
preparation
	Mix all ingredients except chocolate. Melt white chocolate and pour over mixed ingredients. Mix all together, then spread on wax paper or cookie sheet. Once completely cooled, break into little clusters.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
1  pkg. presweetened strawberry drink mix, dissolved in 1 qt. water
1 (13 oz.)  can orange juice (3 cans water added)
1 (6 oz.)  can lemonade (4 cans water added)
1 large  can pineapple juice
1  c. sugar
2  qt. water
preparation
      For carbonated punch, use Sprite or ginger ale or 7-Up in place of water.  For really sweet punch, use white grape juice in place of water.

CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD
ingredients
2  c. cranberries (fresh or frozen)
3  c. miniature marshmallows
3/4  c. granulated sugar
2  c. diced apples (unpeeled)
1/2  c. chopped pecans
1  c. heavy cream, whipped
1/2  c. seedless grapes
preparation
      Blend cranberries well in blender. In a mixing bowl, combine cranberries, marshmallows and sugar. Refrigerate overnight. Add apples, grapes and pecans to cranberry mixture. Mix well. Fold in whipped cream. Serve immediately. This salad looks pretty served in a glass bowl.

CHRISTMAS NIBBLINGS
ingredients
1 large  box pretzels, broken
1 large  box Rice Chex
1 large  box Corn Chex
1  can peanuts
  pecans
1/2  c. bacon or ham grease
1 1/2  sticks oleo
1  Tbsp. garlic salt
1  Tbsp. savory salt
1 to 2  tsp. chili powder
1  tsp. red pepper
1  Tbsp. Tabasco sauce
1/4  c. Worcestershire sauce
preparation
      Melt grease and oleo and add seasonings.  Pour over other ingredients and mix well.  Mix often while baking in slow oven for 1 1/2 hours at 200°.

BUCHE DE NOEL (CHRISTMAS CHOCOLATE ROLL)
(Holiday)  
ingredients
6  egg whites (at room temperature)
1/2  c. sugar
6  egg yolks
1/2  c. sugar
1 1/2  c. finely chopped (grated) walnuts
4  Tbsp. sifted cocoa
1  tsp. baking powder
  powdered sugar for topping
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°. Butter a 10 x 15-inch jelly roll pan. Line it with waxed paper, extending 4-inches beyond the ends of the pan. Butter the waxed paper and set it aside. Wet a towel and squeeze it until it is damp-dry.
      In a large mixing bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. Continue beating and adding 1/2 cup sugar slowly, until whites are stiff and glossy.
      Beat yolks with 1/2 cup sugar until mixture is very thick. Beat in the walnuts, cocoa and baking powder until blended. Fold in beaten egg whites.
      Pour batter into prepared pan and spread evenly. Bake at 350° for about 25 minutes, or until top is golden and a cake tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Immediately cover cake with slightly dampened towel. Allow cake to cool and then refrigerate. Leave towel on cake. This can be done 2 days ahead.
      The day before serving, turn cake out on 2 overlapping strips of waxed paper. Remove the baking paper and trim edges of cake. Spread Chocolate Whipped Cream mixture over the cake. Using the waxed paper to help you, roll cake up from long end, ending seam side down. Sprinkle top with sifted powdered sugar to resemble snow. Serve 10-12.
Chocolate Whipped Cream:
ingredients
1 1/2  c. cream
1/3  c. sugar
3  Tbsp. sifted cocoa
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      Beat all ingredients together until stiff.

CHRISTMAS MORNING SAUSAGE RING
ingredients
2  lb. sausage
1 1/2  c. cracker crumbs
2  eggs, lightly beaten
1/2  c. milk
1/4  c. minced onion
1  c. finely chopped apple
preparation
      Combine ingredients; Mix well.  Pack lightly into greased 6-cup ring mold; Chill several hours.  Unmold into jelly roll pan.  Bake in 325° gas oven for 1 hr.  Serve with scramble eggs in center. Makes 12 servings

GRANDMA'S CHRISTMAS BREAD
ingredients
5 - 6  c. all purpose flour
1/2  c. sugar
2  tsp. ground cardamom
1  tsp. salt
2  pkg. active dry yeast
1  c. milk
2/3  c. butter or margarine
2  eggs
1- 15  oz. pkg. light seedless raisins
1- 6  oz. candied fruit
1  egg white, slightly beaten
preparation
      In large bowl, combine 2 cups of flour, sugar, cardamom, salt and yeast.  In medium saucepan over low heat, heat milk, butter/margarine, and 1/2 cup water until very warm (120 - 130 degrees), butter/margarine does not need to totally melt.  With mixer at low speed, gradually pour liquid into dry ingredients. Increase speed to medium; beat two minutes, occasionally scraping bowl with rubber spatula.  Beat in eggs and 3/4 c. flour or enough to make a thick batter.  Continue beating 2 minutes, occasionally scraping bowl.  With spoon, stir in enough additional flour, about 1 1/2 - 2 cups, to make a soft dough.
      Turn dough onto lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.  Shape dough into ball and place in greased large bowl, turning over so that top of dough is greased. Cover with towel and let rise in warm place (80 - 85 degrees) away from draft, until doubles, about 1 1/2 hours.  Dough is doubled when two fingers pressed lightly into dough leaves a dent.  Punch down dough by pushing down center with fist, then pushing edges of dough into center.  Turn dough on to lightly floured surface.  Put fruit in a ziploc bag with a small amount of flour.  Knead fruit into dough.  Cut dough in half and cover with bowl for 15 minutes. Grease 2- 9 inch x 5 inch loaf pans.
      With a lightly floured rolling pin, roll dough half into 12 inch x 8 inch rectangle.  Starting with 8 inch end, roll dough jelly-roll fashion.  Pinch seams to seal.  Press ends to seal and tuck under.  Place seam side down in loaf pan.  Repeat with remaining dough.  Cover with towel and let rise 1 hour until doubled.
      Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Brush tops of loaves with egg white, or melted butter.  Bake 45 - 50 minutes until loaves sound hollow when lightly tapped with finger.  Remove from pans immediately and cool on racks.

CHRISTMAS BREAD
ingredients
1  loaf frozen shiite bread
1/3  c. powdered sugar
3  tbsp. softened butter
1/2  c. chopped walnuts, almonds or pecans
1/4  c. chopped candied cherries
1/4  c. seedless raisins
1/2  tbsp. lemon extract
preparation
      Thaw and soften dough.  In a small mixing bowl, cream together the powdered sugar and butter.  Mix in nuts, cherries, raisins and lemon extract.  Set aside.  Roll dough into a 14x8 inch rectangle.  Spread filling to within 1 inch of edge. Beginning from the longest side, roll dough in jelly roll fashion. Pinch to seal seam.  Place on a greased baking sheet with seam side down.  Cut slashes alternately to the right and the left. Turn each slice on its side to show the filling.  Cover, let rise until doubled in size.  Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until done.  Cool on a wire rack.  If desired, garnish with red and green candied cherries.

CHRISTMAS CAULIFLOWER
ingredients
1  large head cauliflower, broken into florets
1/4  cup diced green pepper
1  jar (7.3 oz.) sliced mushrooms, drained
1/4  cup butter or margarine
1/3  cup all purpose flour
2  cup milk
1  cup shredded Swiss cheese
2  Tbsp. diced pimientos
1  tsp. salt
  Paprika, optional
preparation
      In a large saucepan, cook cauliflower in a small amount of water for 6-7 minutes or until crisp-tender;  drain well.  In a medium saucepan, sauté green pepper and mushrooms in butter for 2 minutes.  Add flour; gradually stir in milk.  Bring to a boil; boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat; stir in cheese until melted.  Add pimientos and salt.  Place half of the cauliflower in a greased 2 qt. baking dish; top with half of the sauce.  Repeat layers.  Bake, uncovered, at 325° for 25 minutes or until bubbly.  Sprinkle with paprika if desired.
      Yield: 8-10 servings.

STRAWBERRY CHRISTMAS SALAD
ingredients
2  pkg. strawberry gelatin
1 1/2  c. hot water
2 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen strawberries, thawed
1 (No. 303)  can crushed pineapple
2  bananas, mashed
1  pt. sour cream
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.  Add strawberries and pineapple.  Chill until thickened.  Add bananas.  Pour 1/2 of mixture into a 9 x 11-inch pan.  Chill until firm.  Spread with sour cream.  Pour remaining gelatin mixture on top.  Chill until firm.  Cut into squares to serve.  Yield:  9 servings.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  lb. white raisins
1  lb. assorted dried fruit
1  lb. pecans
1  lb cherries
1/2  c. shortening
1 1/2  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. fresh orange juice
3  c. plain flour
1  tsp nutmeg
1  tsp. clover
1  tsp. cinnamon
3  Tbsp. Sour Milk
1  tsp. soda
1/2  tsp salt
4  eggs
preparation
      Melt shortening and cream with sugar.  Add 1 egg at a time, mixing well.  Have spices, soda and salt sifted together saving 1 c. flour to pour over fruit, raisins, pecans and cherries.  Add O.J. and milk then add fruit, raisins, nuts and cherries.  Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Bake 15 - 20 minutes.  Makes 5 dozen cookies dropped by heaping spoon full onto cookie sheet.

CHRISTMAS AROMA
ingredients
1  qt pineapple juice
1  qt water
1  qt apple cider
4  pieces ginger
3 (3 inch)  sticks cinnamon
16  whole cloves
1  tsp allspice
1  or 2 tsp pickling spice
preparation
      Place all ingredients in a large cooking kettle and allow to come to a boil for several minutes, then turn down heat and allow ingredients to simmer. The room will fill with a wonderful Christmas time odor. Add water and stir as needed.
      *DO NOT DRINK. FOR AROMA ONLY.

CHRISTMAS FUDGE
ingredients
3  c. sugar
1 1/2  c. light cream
1  c. light corn syrup
1  tsp. salt
2  tsp. vanilla
1  c. diced candied pineapple
1  c. halved candied cherries
1 1/2  c. broken walnuts
1 1/2  c. shaved Brazil nuts
2  c. pecan halves
preparation
      Combine sugar, cream, corn syrup and salt.  Boil to soft ball stage (260°).  Add vanilla.  Do not cool, but beat immediately with electric mixer until creamy and begins to hold its shape (about 10 minutes).  Thoroughly mix in remaining ingredients.  Press into buttered 9 X 13 pan.  Chill until firm enough ro cut.  Let stand 24 hours before serving.  This keeps very well.

IRENE'S CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  lb. dates
1/2  lb. candied cherries
1/2  lb. candied pineapple
1/2  lb. walnuts
1  c. butter
1 1/2  c. sugar
2  eggs
2 1/2  c. flour
1  t. baking soda
1  t. salt
1  t. cinnamon
preparation
      Chop the dates, candied cherries and pineapple and walnuts. Cream thoroughly the butter and sugar. Beat in eggs. Add sifted dry ingredients and fruit and nuts. Drop on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 325-350° for 10 minutes.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

7-POUND CHRISTMAS FUDGE
ingredients
3  large (8 oz.) bars milk chocolate, broken in small pieces
2 (11.5 oz.)  pkg. milk chocolate bits
1 large (13 oz.)  jar Marshmallow Creme
4  c. sugar
1 tall (13 oz.)  can evaporated milk
1/2  lb. butter
2  tsp. vanilla
1  c. chopped black walnuts, walnuts or pecans
preparation
      In large mixing bowl of heavy-duty electric mixer, combine broken chocolate bars, chocolate bits and Marshmallow Creme; set aside.  In large heavy saucepan, combine sugar, evaporated milk and butter.  Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture boils; boil 5 minutes.  Pour hot mixture over chocolate mixture.  Beat until ingredients are thoroughly blended; beat in vanilla.  Remove beater and stir in chopped nuts.  Quickly pour mixture into buttered 9 x 13 x 2-inch pan.  Cool.  Cover tightly and refrigerate until firm enough to cut into small squares.  (Flavor will be best after a week or two of storage.)  Makes about 7 pounds fudge.

CHEESE CHRISTMAS TREE
Tree:
ingredients
2  (8 oz.) pkgs. cream cheese, softened
1/2  c. chopped green onions
1/2  c. pimento olives chopped
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
  4-5 slices dried beef (optional)
preparation
      Mix first 5 ingredients together; press out on tray and form "tree."
"Decorations":
ingredients
  Green bell pepper for star
  Pimentos for garland
  Chopped parsley and/or green onions
preparation
      Star at top -- cut out of a green bell pepper.  Garland -- pimentos zig-zagged from one side to the other.  Then sprinkle chopped parsley and/or green onions.  Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.  The longer it sets, the better it is.  (Put toothpicks in it to keep cover off cheese.)

CHRISTMAS MORNING STICKY BUNS
ingredients
1  cup chopped pecans or walnuts
1  package frozen rolls, thawed
1  package butterscotch instant pudding mix
1/2  cup margarine melted
1  cup firmly packed brown sugar
1  teaspoon cinnamon
preparation
      Sprinkle pecans in bottom of buttered 12 cup Bundt pan. Arrange dough in pan (I cut rolls in half), sprinkle with dry pudding mix.  Stir together melted margarine, brown sugar, cinnamon- pour over rolls.  Cover and chill for 8 hours.  Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown.  Serve immediately.

CHRISTMAS CANDY WREATH
ingredients
1  wire coat hanger
5  yards (2-inches wide)
  material (an old piece of cotton sheet works well)
4  feet aluminum foil
1  spool fine wire
4  lb. individually wrapped assorted candies
1  ribbon bow
1  pair scissors
preparation
      Cut coat hanger in center of wire base and then bring ends together.  Shape into approximately 10-inch circle; wire ends together with fine wire.  Cover circle by winding the 2-inch material using the entire 5 yards to form the base.  Then, wrap the foil around the material.  The fine wire for putting candy on the wreath should be in about 4 foot lengths or whatever length is convenient to work with.  When the preferred length is used, make a loop on the end by bending the end back and then twisting.  Place next wire through loop; bend end over and twist, thereby fastening ends.
      Begin by fastening fine wire at base of hook.  Twist wire around candy wrapper as tight and close to candy as possible. Twist around candy wrapper twice.  Place pieces as close together as possible.  This will make the wreath fuller.  Foil should not show through.  Repeat this until complete.
      Place scissors on a narrow piece of ribbon and tie to wreath hanger on top.  These will be used for cutting candy off rather than to pull or tear.  Use large bow over hook and hang wreath in well observed position.

PINEAPPLE-CHEESE CHRISTMAS CASSEROLE
ingredients
2 large  cans pineapple chunks
2  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
1  c. sugar
6  Tbsp. flour
1  tube Ritz crackers, crushed
4  oz. butter, melted
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Mix together pineapple and cheese. Set aside.  Mix together sugar and flour.  Add to the fruit and cheese mixture.  Spread mixture in an 8 x 11-inch or a 9 x 12-inch casserole dish.  Spread crushed crackers over top.  Pour melted butter over all.  Bake for 35 to 40 minutes.  Serves 12.

CHRISTMAS BALLS
ingredients
2  lb confectioners sugar
1  can sweetened condensed milk
1/2  cup or 2 sticks butter
  Chocolate chips
  paraffin wax
preparation
      Mix together sugar milk and butter.
      Melt chips and wax.
      Roll sugar mixture into balls and dip in melted chocolate mixture.

CHRISTMAS TOFFEE
ingredients
1  C butter
1  C sugar
1  Tbsp white corn syrup
3  Tbsp water
1  pkg almonds or walnuts
1  6 oz pkg semi-sweet chocolate morsels (melted)
preparation
      Butter a cookie sheet. Melt butter in 2 qt. sauce pan, stir in sugar gradually. Add syrup and water. Cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally until a little bit in cold water becomes very brittle.
      Add 1 C nuts. Pour onto pan. When cool, pour melted chocolate over the toffee. Break into bite size pieces.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
4  eggs
3  Tbsp. milk
1  c. butter
1  box brown sugar
1  Tbsp. cinnamon
1  Tbsp. nutmeg
1  Tbsp. cloves
2  Tbsp. soda
3  c. flour
1  pkg. white raisins
1/2  lb. candied pineapple
1  c. liquor
6  c. pecans
preparation
      Beat eggs and milk. Cream butter, sugar and spices. Add flour; mix well. Add soda to liquor and mix. Add fruit and nuts. Dough is easier to work with if refrigerated overnight.

CHRISTMAS MORNING BREAKFAST CASSEROLE
ingredients
6  slices white bread or low-carb wheat
  butter or margarine
1  lb. pork sausage
2  c. Cheddar cheese, grated
6  eggs, beaten
2  c. half and half
1  tsp. salt
preparation
      Remove crusts from bread and spread with butter. Place them side by side in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Brown sausage and crumble; drain. Layer over bread slices. Sprinkle with cheese. Combine eggs, half and half and salt and mix well. Cover and chill Christmas Eve night. Bake, uncovered, Christmas morning at 350° for 40 to 55 minutes.
       Note: This is an easy breakfast for a busy morning.
      Yield: 8 servings.

CHRISTMAS BREAD
ingredients
1  pkg. dry yeast
1/2  c. warm water
2 1/2  c. biscuit mix
1  Tbsp. sugar
1  egg, beaten
1  pkg. cream cheese (8 oz.)
1/2  c. sugar
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/4  c. cherry preserves
preparation
      Proof yeast in warm water for 5 minutes. Add biscuit mix, 1 tablespoon sugar and egg. Stir well. Knead dough on floured surface until smooth. Place in buttered bowl. Turn to grease top and chill 8 hours. Punch dough down and turn into greased 14 x 9-inch baking sheet. Roll dough out to fit sheet. Combine cream cheese, sugar and lemon juice. Beat together until smooth. Spread mixture 2 inches wide down the length of the dough. Make 3-inch cuts in dough at 1-inch intervals along the edges. Fold and overlap strips diagonally to make a braid. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled in bulk. Bake 20 minutes at 350°. Remove from oven and spoon preserves down the center. Return to oven for 5 minutes to melt. Cool 10 minutes before serving.

CHRISTMAS SUGAR COOKIES
ingredients
1  c. shortening
1  egg
1  c. sugar
1  c. sour cream
2  tsp. vanilla
3  c. flour
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. soda
1/2  tsp. nutmeg (if desired)
preparation
      Thoroughly mix shortening, egg, sugar, sour cream and vanilla.  Then add flour, salt, soda and nutmeg that have been sifted together.  Let dough chill 1 hour in refrigerator.  When chilled roll out and cut out with your favorite cutters.  Put on aluminum foil lined cookie sheet and bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until lightly brown around edges.  Makes 3 1/2 dozen.

CHRISTMAS BREAD OR FRUIT BREAD
ingredients
2  pkg. active dry yeast
1  Tbsp. sugar
1/3  c. lukewarm water
3  c. milk
1/2  c. butter
3  Tbsp. sugar
1 1/2  tsp. salt
3  c. all-purpose flour
3  eggs
1  c. white raisins
1  c. currants
1  c. candied cherries
1 1/2  c. mixed candied fruit
6 1/2  c. flour
1/2  tsp. ground cardamon seeds or 1/2 tsp. lemon rind, grated (may add)
preparation
      Soften yeast and one tablespoon sugar in warm water.  Scald milk and pour over the butter, sugar and salt.  When lukewarm, add the yeast and three cups flour.  Beat thoroughly.  Add rest of ingredients and stir until well mixed.  Beat until smooth and elastic.  Brush with melted butter; cover and let rise until light, 1 1/4 hours.  Beat well and fill buttered bread pans 2/3 full. Brush with melted butter.  Cover and let rise until light, 3/4 hour.  Brush lightly with milk and sprinkle with sugar.  Bake at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes.  Makes 3 or 4 loaves, depending upon size of bread pans.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
1  gal Apple Cider
6  lemons
6  small oranges
1  qt canned pineapple juice
1 (3 inch)  stick cinnamon
8  whole cloves
3  or 4 cardamon seed
1/2  tsp salt
3  pieces ginger
preparation
      Place the spices in a bag of fine cheesecloth.  Peel and cut into thin slices, the lemons and oranges, mixing with the apple cider and pineapple juice.  To this add the bag of spices and bring to a very low simmering boil.  Stir as it simmers for approximately 15 minutes, then add salt and stir vigorously.

CHRISTMAS MORNING PANCAKES
ingredients
2  c. self-rising flour
2  c. buttermilk
2  eggs
  Option:  Add food coloring (red or green) if desired
preparation
      Preheat griddle to 400 degrees.  Spray with pam.  Mix all three ingredients until smooth.  Pour batter on griddle and flip when pancake starts to look dry on top.  Top each one with a pat of butter.  Serve with syrup or honey.  Can top with powdered sugar.

CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
1  gal. apple cider
1  c. (red hots) cinnamon candy
1  stick cinnamon
1/4  tsp. powdered cloves
preparation
	Bring to a boil. Ready to serve.

CHRISTMAS CHEER DESSERT
ingredients
1/4  c. creme de menthe
1  pt. lime sherbet, softened
1  qt. vanilla ice cream, softened
1  pkg. Dream Whip, prepared per directions on pkg.
preparation
      Mix all together with mixer and refreeze.

MERRY CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  cup brown sugar
1  cup margarine
3  cups flour sifted with 1 tsp cinnamon and 1 tsp allspice
3  eggs, well beaten
1  cup milk
6  slices candied pineapple
2  cups candied cherries, red or green
2  cups chopped dates
7  cups broken pecans
preparation
      Cream sugar and margarine.  Add beaten eggs.  Add milk and flour alternately.  Add pineapple, cherries, dates and pecans. Mix all together.  (Can use hands.)
      Drop by teaspoonsful on greased cookie sheet and bake 18 to 20 minutes at 300.
      These freeze well in air-tight containers with waxed paper between layers.

CHRISTMAS PEPPER JELLY
ingredients
2  c. ground sweet red & green peppers
1/2  c. ground seeded jalapeno peppers
6  c. sugar
1 1/2  c. cider vinegar
6  oz. liquid pectin
  green food coloring optional
preparation
      Combine peppers and divide into 2 parts. In 1/2 of the peppers stir in 1 c. of sugar.  In a saucepan, combine the peppers and sugar mixture with vinegar and the remaining sugar; boil this for 10 minutes.  Add the other 1/2 of the peppers and pectin; boil for an additional 10 minutes.   Pour into jars and seal.  Serve over crackers with cream cheese.  Yield: 8 cups.

CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS
ingredients
1  bag 24 frozen dinner rolls
1  box (3 3/4 oz.) butterscotch pudding, not instant
1/2  c. butter
3/4  tsp. cinnamon
3/4  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Arrange rolls in greased fluted pan.  Sprinkle dry pudding mix over rolls.  Cook remaining ingredients over low heat until sugar is dissolved and mixture bubbles.  Pour over rolls.  Cover tightly with foil.  Let stand overnight on counter top.  Next morning, bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

TRADITIONAL CHRISTMAS BREAD
(Romanian)  
ingredients
  Sweet bread dough
10  oz. ground walnuts
1  cup milk
3/4  cup sugar
1/4  cup rum
  Vanilla
preparation
      Melt sugar in warm milk with vanilla in a saucepan.  When the sugar is melted, add the walnuts and keep stirring.  After a few minutes of boiling, and after filling has thickened, remove from heat and add rum.  When the filling is cold, roll a sheet of dough about 1/2 inch thick.  Uniformly spread the filling on top and roll like a jelly roll.  Grease a bread pan and place the roll inside. Let rise.  Bake in oven until done.  (Temperature and baking time was not provided.)

CHRISTMAS BEAN SALAD
(A Sweet and Sour Salad)  
ingredients
1  can French style green beans
1 small  can sweet peas
1/4  c. celery, chopped finely
1/2  c. bell pepper, chopped finely
1/2  c. onion, chopped finely (purple ones are pretty)
1/2 small  jar pimento
1  tsp. salt
1/4  c. vegetable oil
1  c. sugar
1/2  c. vinegar
preparation
      Mix green beans, peas, celery, bell pepper, onion, and pimento together in medium bowl.
      Mix salt, vegetable oil, sugar and vinegar together. Pour this over vegetables.
       Allow mixture to sit overnight, refrigerated, stirring 2 or 3 times.
      Drain off liquid before serving.

CHRISTMAS APPLESAUCE CAKE
ingredients
2  c. sugar
2  c. applesauce
1  c. nuts
1  tsp. salt
2  tsp. vanilla
2  tsp. allspice (optional)
1/2  c. shortening
2  c. raisins
2  tsp. soda
2  tsp. cinnamon
2  tsp. nutmeg (optional)
2 1/2  c. flour
preparation
      Mix all ingredients thoroughly and pour into well-greased tube pan. Bake 1 hour in 350° oven.
      No need for icing but a little plain powdered sugar icing can be used.

CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1 each of 4  oz. pkg. lemon and raspberry jello
2  c. water
1  can plain cranberry sauce mashed (not the whole berry kind)
10  oz. frozen raspberries thawed enough to separate them
7  oz. sprite
preparation
      Add jellos to water and bring to boil; dissolve stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in berries; add cranberry sauce and put in your serving  bowl.  Gently add Sprite; chill overnight and add topping.
Topping:
ingredients
1  c. pineapple juice
1/2  cup sugar
1  beaten egg
2  Tbsp. cornstarch
1  tsp. margarine
2  c. Cool Whip
preparation
      Combine all except Cool Whip and cook in double boiler until thick.  Chill 1 hour; fold in Cool Whip and spread on gelatin.

SPARKLING CHRISTMAS PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
2  pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
2  pkg. cherry Kool-Aid
1  (46 oz.) unsweetened pineapple juice
1  (46 oz.) unsweetened orange juice
2 or more  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      Combine first 5 ingredients in large container. Mix well until sugar and Kool-Aid dissolve completely. Add 2 bottles of ginger ale for each 4 cups concentrate in punch bowl. May freeze concentrate.

CHRISTMAS TREE SALAD
ingredients
1  box lime Jello
1  can crushed pineapple
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese (softened)
1  c. Cool Whip
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Dissolve Jello in 1 cup boiling water.  Let cool.  Add Philadelphia cream cheese, pineapple and Cool Whip.  Mix with beater.  Add nuts.  For tree effect pour salad mixture in coffee cup liners.  Gel.  Dip in hot water to loosen.  Turn upside down on leaf of lettuce.  Top with Cool Whip.  Place a Maraschino cherry on top of tree for effect, or pour into small square pan.

CHRISTMAS SOUFFLE
ingredients
5  egg whites, beaten stiff
1/2  c. sugar
  pinch of salt
1/2  c. seeded raisins, cut in pieces
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Beat egg whites and salt until stiff. Gradually add the sugar, beating constantly. Mix the raisins and nuts together and fold into the egg whites. Pour mixture into buttered baking dish and set dish in pan of hot water. Bake in a moderately slow oven (325°) about 30 minutes. Serve at once.

CHRISTMAS TORTILLA ROLL-UP
ingredients
1  pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1/3  c. chopped celery
1/4  c. green onion, minced fine
1/2  c. red pepper, chopped
1/4  c. green olives, chopped
  flour tortillas
preparation
      Mix ingredients together well. Refrigerate. Spread on tortilla; then roll tortilla up. Slice into 1-inch pieces.

CHRISTMAS COOKIES
ingredients
1  lb. red cherries
1  lb. green cherries
1  lb. assorted pineapple
2  c. coconut
4  c. pecans
1  tsp. vanilla
4  eggs, beaten
1  can condensed milk
1  box Duncan Hines yellow cake mix
preparation
	Cut up fruit and nuts until fine. Pour cake mix over all and mix gently. Add flavoring and milk to beaten eggs. Drop by spoonful onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes.

CHRISTMAS CUT OUT COOKIES
ingredients
1/2  C. butter
3/4  C. sugar
1  egg
1 1/2  tsp. vanilla
1 1/2  C. flour
1  tsp. baking powder
1/4  tsp. salt
preparation
      Cream butter, sugar, egg and vanilla.  Mix in remaining ingredients.
      Chill at least one hour.  Roll out thin for cutting out.
      Bake at 350 degrees until lightly brown.
      May choose to double this recipe.

CHRISTMAS DECORATIONS
(Confectioners Glue Recipe)  
ingredients
1  large egg white
1 3/4  c. confectioners sugar
preparation
      Blend in small mixer bowl.  Beat 2 minutes at high speed. Yield:  3/4 cup.
      Cut stockings out of cardboard.  Cover with red or silver foil; glue on Hershey's Kisses until covered.
      To make tree, cover Styrofoam cone with green or silver foil; glue on Hershey's Kisses.
      To make wreath, form circle with pipe cleaners 5 rows thick. Twist ends together; cover with foil.  Glue on Hershey's Kisses.

WHITE CHRISTMAS CHILI
ingredients
4  skinless boneless chicken breasts
5  c. water
1  large onion, chopped and divided
2  Tbsp. butter
2  celery ribs, chopped
3 (16-oz.)  cans great Northern beans, rinsed, drained, divided
3  cans (4.5-oz. each) chopped green chiles
1  c. chicken broth
1  tsp. ground cumin
1  bay leaf
1  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. ground red pepper
1  Tbsp. chopped fresh cilantro
preparation
      Place chicken, 5 cups water, and half of onion in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat, and cook 1 hour or until chicken is very tender.  Remove chicken, reserving cooking broth in Dutch oven. Cut chicken into bite-size pieces; set aside.
       Melt butter in a skillet; add celery and remaining onion, and sauté until tender.  Stir chicken, celery mixture, 2 cans of beans, and next 6 ingredients into broth in Dutch oven, and bring to a boil.  Reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at least 1 hour, stirring frequently, until thickened.  Process remaining 1 can beans in a blender until smooth, stopping to scrape down sides. Stir bean puree into chili.  Heat soup to simmering. Remove and discard bay leaf; stir in cilantro just before serving.

CHRISTMAS TOFFEE BARS
ingredients
2  sticks butter
1  egg yolk
1  c. chopped pecans or walnuts
1  c. brown sugar
2  c. flour
5  Hershey chocolate bars
preparation
      Mix and pour in pan. Bake 25 minutes at 350°. Cool and cut in small squares.
