Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

POTATO SOUP
ingredients
6  slices bacon, fried and drained
3  Tbsp. bacon grease
3/4  c. onion
3  c. potatoes, cut small
1 1/2  c. water
2  cans cream of mushroom soup
  salt to taste
2 soup  cans of milk
preparation
      Pour off all but 3 tablespoons of bacon grease.  Saut onions in grease and add potatoes, salt and water.  Cook until potatoes are done.  Add soup and milk.  Serve with crumbled bacon on top. Makes 8 servings.

TORTILLA SOUP
ingredients
4  chicken bouillon cubes
1  beef bouillon cube
5  c. boiling water
4  boneless chicken breasts, cut in 1/2-inch pieces
1  tsp. cumin
2  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1  green bell pepper, chopped
1  large onion, chopped
  garlic salt or powder to taste
1 (10 oz.)  can beef consomm
1 (10 oz.)  can Ro-Tel tomatoes, drained and chopped
1 (16 oz.)  can peeled tomatoes, drained and chopped
1 (15 oz.)  can tomato sauce
1  can chopped green chilies, drained (optional)
2  Tbsp. cornstarch
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Dissolve bouillon cubes in boiling water in large soup pot. Stir in chicken and cumin.  Simmer over low heat 2 hours.  Heat oil in saucepan.  Add green pepper, onion and garlic.  Sauté until tender.  Stir into soup pot.  Add consomm, tomatoes, tomato sauce and green chilies.  Mix well.  Blend cornstarch with 1 tablespoon soup liquid.  Stir into soup.  Simmer 1 to 2 hours or until heated through, stirring occasionally.  Add salt and pepper.  In individual serving bowl, top with tortilla chips, shredded Monterey Jack cheese, chopped onion or chopped avocado if you like.

DELI'S TACO SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. ground chuck
1  onion, chopped
1/2  c. celery, chopped
1/2  c. bell pepper, chopped
1  can whole kernel corn
1  can pinto beans
1  can tomatoes, diced
1  can evaporated milk
1 small  pkg. Velveeta
1  envelope taco seasoning
  TexJoy steak seasoning, to taste
preparation
      Brown meat with onion, celery, and bell pepper. Add taco seasoning when meat is done. Add cans of vegetables, milk and cheese and simmer until done. Add small amount of water if it is too thick.

CABBAGE PATCH SOUP
ingredients
1  c. chopped onion
2  cloves garlic
1  c. chopped green pepper
1  tsp. oregano
1 1/2 to 2  Tbsp. chili powder
2  lb. lean ground beef
1 (6 oz.)  can tomato paste
3  beef bouillon cubes
1 (15 oz.)  can kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1 (16 oz.)  can stewed tomatoes
1/2  head red cabbage, chopped
1/2  head white cabbage, chopped
  Cheddar cheese (optional)
preparation
      Sauté onion, garlic, green pepper, oregano, chili powder and beef together.  Drain fat, if any.  Then add 7 to 8 cups water, depending on desired thickness.  Add remaining ingredients, except cheese.  Bring mixture to a boil and simmer for 1 hour.  Can top with Cheddar cheese, grated.  Serve with cornbread.

CHESAPEAKE BAY CRAB SOUP
ingredients
1/4  c. butter
1/2  c. chopped onion
1/2  c. chopped green bell pepper
4  c. fish stock or bottled clam juice
1/4  c. long-grain rice
1  lb. lump crabmeat, free of shell and cartilage
1  large tomato, peeled and diced
1  tsp. chili powder
1  tsp. paprika
1/2  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/2  tsp. sugar
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Melt butter in a 2-quart pot and sauté onion and green pepper until onion is soft.  Add fish stock and rice.  Simmer, partially covered, 15 minutes.  Add crabmeat, tomato, chili powder, paprika and Worcestershire and simmer 20 minutes.  Remove from heat and stir in sugar, salt and pepper.  Makes 4 servings.

SPINACH SOUP
ingredients
4  Tbsp. margarine
1  c. diced raw potatoes
1/2  c. sliced onions
1  c. sliced fresh mushrooms
1  lb. fresh spinach, chopped finely
4  c. chicken broth (College Inn)
  salt and pepper to taste
1/4  tsp. ground cloves
1/2  c. oatmeal
preparation
      In skillet, melt margarine on low heat and add potatoes, onions and mushrooms.  Cover pan and cook 8 to 10 minutes, until soft and translucent.  Wash spinach; pick off tough stems and chop finely. Pour stock into large pan and add potatoes, onions, mushrooms and spinach.  Season with salt, pepper and cloves.  Add oatmeal. Simmer 20 minutes.

BAKED POTATO SOUP
ingredients
4  large baking potatoes
2/3  c. butter or margarine
2/3  c. all-purpose flour
6  c. milk
3/4  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
4  green onions, chopped and divided
12  slices bacon, cooked, crumbled and divided
1 1/4  c. (5 oz.) shredded Cheddar cheese, divided
1 (8 oz.)  carton sour cream
preparation
      Wash potatoes and prick several times with a fork; bake at 400° for 1 hour or until done.  Let cool.  Cut potatoes in half lengthwise; then scoop out pulp and set aside.  Discard skins. Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over low heat; add flour, stirring until smooth.  Cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Gradually add milk; cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thickened and bubbly.  Add potato pulp, salt, pepper, 2 tablespoons green onions, 1/2 cup bacon and 1 cup cheese.  Cook until thoroughly heated; stir in sour cream.  Add extra milk, if necessary, for desired thickness.  Serve with remaining onion, bacon and cheese.

WEDDING SOUP
ingredients
  meatballs, dime sized
1  egg
1  small onion, diced
1/2-1  c Italian bread crumbs
1/4  c parmesan cheese, grated
1  lb ground beef
3  tbsp parmesan cheese, grated
48 oz  can chicken broth
1/2  c acini de pepe pasta
1/2  c chopped frozen spinach
preparation
      Cook meatballs as you normally would.  Keep rolled small.  Warm broth.  Add chopped spinach and boil.  Add precooked meatballs. Reduce to slow simmer.  Add acini de pepe until they are fully cooked.  Add 3 tbsp grated cheese and serve.

CHUNKY ITALIAN SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  onion, chopped
2  cans Italian tomatoes
1  can tomato soup
4  c. water
1  clove garlic
2  tsp. salt
2  tsp. basil
2  tsp. oregano
1  Tbsp. chili powder
1  can kidney beans, drained
1  carrot, chopped
1  (8 oz.) rotini noodles, cooked
preparation
      Cook beef and onion; drain. Stir in tomatoes and next 7 ingredients. Bring to boil. Reduce heat; simmer, stirring occasionally, about 30 minutes. Add next 3 ingredients and simmer 15 minutes. Stir in pasta. Pour into soup bowls and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese for each serving.

TACO SOUP
ingredients
2  lb. ground beef
1  pkg. taco seasoning mix
1  pkg. Ranch dressing mix (dry)
1  jar picante sauce
1  can chilli beans
1 or 2  cans white Shoepeg corn (do not drain)
1  can Ro-Tel (do not drain)
1  qt. tomato juice or 2 cans diced tomatoes
preparation
      Serve with tortilla chips and grated cheese. Makes a large pot of soup.

FRESH GREEN BEAN SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. fresh string beans
2  medium-sized potatoes, diced
1  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. flour
2  Tbsp. fat
1/4  tsp. black pepper
1/4  tsp. paprika
1/4  c. cold water
1  pt. sour cream
preparation
      String and cut up beans.  Cook cut beans and diced potatoes in 5 cups of salted water for 15 minutes.  In a frying pan brown flour in the fat; add black pepper and paprika.  Add 1/4 cup cold water and stir until smooth.  Add sour cream.  Add this mixture to the cooked beans and potatoes.  Bring to a boil and simmer for a few minutes.

HAM AND BEAN SOUP OR HAM AND POTATO SOUP
ingredients
3/4 to 1  lb. Cook's ham slice
2  cans Swanson vegetable broth
1  can chicken broth
3  stalks celery
3  carrots
1  medium onion
1/4  tsp. fresh ground pepper
3  cans navy beans (not drained) or 3 to 4 potatoes, cubed (with or without skins)
1  stick butter (be sure to use real butter)
1/2  c. flour
3  c. milk (skim works, whole is richer or anything in between)
1/8  tsp. fresh ground pepper
preparation
      In large soup pot, add ham, cubed into 1/4 to 3/8-inch cubes, pepper, broth, celery, carrots, onion and beans (cubed potatoes if you are making potato soup), all cut into soup size chunks. Bring to a boil, then turn down to simmer while you thicken milk.
      In smaller but heavy pot, melt butter with pepper over medium+ heat. Add flour while whisking. It will get pasty. Slowly add milk while stirring with the whisk constantly. Keep stirring until it boils or just before; the mixture will be quite thick. Be careful not to scorch the milk. By now the vegetables should be cooked. Combine; stir and enjoy.
      Remember to scrape the gooey stuff from the milk pot with a spatula; that's the best part.  Start to finish, this recipe should only take 25 to 30 minutes.

SPLIT PEA SOUP
ingredients
2  c. green split peas
1  ham bone
2  qt. cold water
2  carrots, diced
1  onion, diced
1  celery stalk, diced
  savory
  cayenne pepper
preparation
      Soak peas overnight.  Put ham bone in a large kettle with cold water and simmer 1 1/2 hours, keeping the lid tightly closed.  Do not boil.  Add peas, carrots, onion, celery and seasonings and continue to simmer one more hour or until peas are very soft. Remove ham bone.  Rub soup through sieve and return to kettle. Season further to suit taste, adding salt only if necessary.

SCALLOP SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. scallops
1/2  stick butter
1  clove garlic
2  stalks celery
3  to 4 medium carrots
2  to 3 medium onions
2  cans chicken broth
  salt to taste
  white pepper to taste
1  tsp. thyme
1/2 to 3/4  c. half and half
  cornstarch
preparation
      Sauté scallops in butter with garlic.  While sautéing scallops, dice celery, carrots and onions.  Heat chicken broth.  Add seasonings, vegetables and scallops.  Bring to a boil.  Lower heat to simmer and cook for about 45 minutes (until vegetables are tender enough to be pierced with a fork).  Add half and half.  Cook approximately another 15 minutes.  Thicken with cornstarch to desired thickness.

CREAM OF BROCCOLI SOUP
ingredients
1  c. chopped white onions
3  Tbsp. butter
4  c. chicken broth
1/2  c. rice, uncooked
3/4  lb. broccoli (1 1/2 bunches)
1  c. lite cream*
preparation
      Cook onions in 3 tablespoons butter until wilted, 5 to 10 minutes.  Add broth, rice and broccoli and cover.  Simmer over low heat until tender, 10 to 20 minutes.  Puree soup; add cream and reheat.  May serve with grated Parmesan cheese on top or chopped dill and butter.
      *Evaporated milk or heavy cream may be used for a richer soup. The heavier the cream, the less you will taste the broccoli.

VELVET CORN SOUP
ingredients
1  c. finely chopped cooked chicken
1  c. (1 lb.) cream-style corn
1  egg white
1/2  tsp. salt
6  c. chicken broth
1/4  c. cornstarch
1/4  c. water
1  egg white, slightly beaten
1  Tbsp. finely chopped, cooked ham
preparation
      In a medium bowl stir together chicken, corn, 1 egg white and salt.  In large saucepan heat chicken broth to boiling.  Stir in chicken mixture.  Stir together cornstarch and water until smooth. Add to chicken broth.  Bring to boil over medium heat, stirring constantly, and boil 1 minute.  Slowly stir in slightly beaten egg white.  Sprinkle with ham.  Serve immediately.

MICROWAVE CREAM OF BROCCOLI SOUP
ingredients
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. chopped frozen broccoli or fresh broccoli
1/4  c. chopped onion
6  Tbsp. butter
6  Tbsp. flour
1/4  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
  dash of allspice
1 (13 3/4 oz.)  can chicken broth
2  c. milk
preparation
      In 2-quart glass casserole, place broccoli, onion and butter; cover. Microwave on High 8 minutes or until broccoli is thawed or tender. Stir in seasonings and flour. Gradually add broth and milk, stirring until smooth. Cover and microwave 10 to 12 minutes, stirring occasionally. Let stand a few minutes before serving. Serves 4 to 6.
      Variation: Adding cubed or shaved ham after cooking makes it even tastier.

TOMATO FLORENTINE SOUP
ingredients
3  Tbsp. basil
1/2  bunch fresh parsley, chopped
3/4  bunch cilantro, chopped
2  green onions, chopped fine
2  stalks celery, chopped fine
3  c. water
1 (48 oz.)  can tomato juice
3  Tbsp. chicken bouillon or base
1/2  can of water (tomato juice can)
  salt, pepper and Lawry's to taste
1  lb. cooked shell macaroni
preparation
      Simmer the first 6 ingredients over low heat until tender, about 45 minutes. Add the tomato juice, chicken bouillon or base and 1/2 can of water. Salt, pepper and Lawry's to taste. Add the macaroni. Heat until hot. May add hamburger to it.

CREAM OF SORREL SOUP
(Szczaw)  
ingredients
3  Tbsp. butter
1  large onion, sliced thin
1  c. celery, sliced thin
6  c. fresh sorrel leaves, washed and chopped
8  c. chicken broth
2 1/2  c. potatoes, diced
2  bay leaves
1  pt. heavy sour cream
preparation
      In soup pot, melt butter.  Sauté onions and celery over medium heat for 5 minutes.  Add sorrel and simmer three minutes. Add chicken broth, potatoes and bay leaves and simmer until potatoes are tender.  In separate pot or bowl, fork-blend sour cream with 3 to 4 tablespoons flour until very smooth, gradually adding a cup of broth at a time (3 to 4 cups).  Stir this mixture into soup and simmer several minutes without boiling.

HOT CHICKEN ENCHILADA SOUP
ingredients
1  dozen corn tortillas
1  onion, chopped
1  clove garlic, minced
2  Tbsp. oil
1 (4 oz.)  can green chilies, chopped
1 (14 1/2 oz.)  can beef broth
1 (10 oz.)  can chicken broth
1 (10 oz.)  can cream of chicken soup (undiluted)
1 (6 3/4 oz.)  can chunk style chicken (or use boiled chicken)
1 1/2  c. water
1  Tbsp. steak sauce
1/2  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  tsp. ground cumin
1  tsp. chili powder
1/8  tsp. pepper
3  c. cheddar cheese, grated
  paprika
preparation
      Cut 6 tortillas into 1/2 inch strips and set aside. Cut remaining 6 tortillas into triangles and fry in hot oil until crisp; (or you may use corn chips) set aside. Sauté onion and garlic in oil in dutch oven. Add next 11 ingredients; bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat; simmer for 1 hour. Add tortilla strips and cheese. Simmer, uncovered 10 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika. Serve with chips. Makes 8 cups.

STUFFED GREEN PEPPER SOUP
ingredients
2  lbs ground beef, browned and drained
28  oz tomato sauce
14.5 oz  can of diced tomatoes with chili peppers, undrained
14.5 oz  can of diced tomatoes, undrained
1  c uncooked rice
2  c green peppers chopped (about 2 peppers)
2  beef bouillon cubes
1/4  c brown sugar, firmly packed
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Place all ingredients in a slow cooker and cook overnight on the low setting.
       Makes 8-10 main course servings.

POTATO AND SHRIMP SOUP
ingredients
1  yellow onion, sliced
1/4  c. butter
1  bunch green onions, chopped
2  medium red potatoes, peeled and sliced
1  Tbsp. salt
2  qt. water
1  lb. shrimp
1/4  c. butter
1/2  c. cream
3  Tbsp. chives
preparation
      In heavy 4-quart pan sauté onion in 1/4 cup butter until limp; add green onions, potatoes, salt and water.  Bring to a boil and then simmer partially covered for 45 minutes or until potatoes are very tender.  Mash.  Add shrimp and cook 20 to 30 minutes until shrimp are done.  Cool.  Add 1/4 cup butter, cream and chives. Adjust seasoning.  Heat through, but do not boil or cream will curdle.

VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
2  large onions, chopped
3  medium potatoes, chopped
1  Tbsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  stick margarine
10  oz. pkg. frozen peas
10  oz. pkg. frozen carrots
10  oz. pkg. frozen corn
10  oz. pkg. frozen lima beans
64  oz. tomato juice or 15 oz. tomato sauce
1 large  can tomatoes
3 to 4  c. water
1/4  c. sugar (if desired)
preparation
      Saut ground beef in large Dutch oven until browned, stirring to separate. Drain off fat. Add remaining ingredients and simmer, covered, for 45 minutes or until all vegetables are very tender. Any leftover meat, vegetables or pasta may be added, if desired.
       (Do not use potatoes if freezing the soup.) Great served with cornbread!

LOW FAT BEAN SOUP
ingredients
2 (16-oz)  cans Navy beans, drained and rinsed
1  can reduced fat chicken broth
2  c. water
1 (6-oz)  package diced 97% fat-free ham
1  c. finely chopped onion
1  c. finely chopped celery
1  c. shredded carrots
2  c. diced, cooked potatoes
1/2  tsp. minced garlic
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  tsp. salt
preparation
      In large saucepan, cook potatoes until tender.  In another large saucepan, combine navy beans, chicken broth, water, ham, onion, celery, and carrots. Bring mixture to a boil. Stir in potatoes, garlic, pepper and salt.  Lower heat, cover and simmer for 30 minutes.
      Serves 6 (1-1/2 cup servings).

CHEESE SOUP
ingredients
1/2  c. finely chopped carrot
1/2  c. finely chopped onion
1/4  c. finely chopped celery
2  Tbsp. margarine
1/4  c. all-purpose flour
1  c. chicken broth
1/4  tsp. salt
2  c. light cream or milk
1 1/2  c. shredded American cheese (6 oz.)
preparation
      In covered saucepan, cook carrot, onion and celery in margarine over low heat until tender.  Stir in flour.  Add broth and salt. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly.  Stir in cream or milk and cheese until cheese melts and soup is heated through.  Do not boil.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.

DILL PICKLE SOUP
ingredients
4  large dill pickles, peeled and grated
3  Tbsp. butter or margarine
4  qt. chicken stock
1  c. sour cream
2  Tbsp. flour
preparation
      Sauté grated pickles in butter and flour until completely wilted.  Add the stock and simmer slowly for one-half hour.  In small bowl, stir together sour cream and 1 cup of broth.  Stir in to soup and simmer.  Serve hot.  However, if soup is not sour enough, add pickle juice to taste.  Serves 6.

EASY POTATO SOUP
ingredients
1  bag Ore-IDA O'Brien (or any hashbrown type potato)
3  cans fat free chicken broth
1  pkg. fat-free Pioneer white gravy mix
1/2  c. water
preparation
      Cook the potatoes in chicken broth until soft, about 20 minutes.  Mix gravy mix with water and add to potatoes, stirring constantly.  Cook until desired consistency.  You can add a little shredded cheese on top when you serve it and it is YUMMY.
      If you are using the Weight Watchers Plan, this counts as 1 point per cup.  Additional points must be added if you add cheese.

POTATO-LEEK SOUP
ingredients
2  medium potatoes
  bottoms of 3 large leeks
1/2  c. celery, chopped
1/2  c. carrots, grated
1/2  c. onion, chopped
1  pt. or more chicken broth
1 small  clove garlic
  salt and pepper to taste
  Accent
preparation
      Cook vegetables in enough water to keep from sticking until tender.  Add chicken broth and seasonings.  Add Accent while cooking.
      Serve hot with saltines or other crackers.

NEW ENGLAND CLAM CHOWDER SOUP
ingredients
3  large potatoes, diced
1  medium onion, diced
1  stalk celery, diced
1 1/2  c. water
1/2  stick butter
4  Tbsp. flour
2  c. milk
4  slices American or Swiss cheese
1 small  can chopped clams
preparation
      Cook potatoes, onion and celery in 1 1/2 cups water until tender.  Drain vegetables, saving 1 cup water.  In saucepan, melt 1/2 stick butter.  Add flour and stir until smooth.  Add 2 cups milk; stir until creamy.  Add 4 slices of cheese.  Stir until cheese is melted over medium heat.  Add vegetables to sauce; stir, then add clams.  Do not drain juice.  Pour clams and juice into sauce.  Add 1 cup water that you saved from vegetables, stirring constantly until mixture is blended to a smooth consistency. Serves 4.

CHICKEN AND VEGETABLE SOUP
ingredients
1  c. butter (2 sticks)
2  c. celery, diced
2  c. onion, diced
1/2  c. flour
8  c. chicken stock
1  Tbsp. garlic powder
1  Tbsp. dill weed
1  Tbsp. celery seed
  salt and pepper to taste
4  c. fresh or frozen vegetables (your choice)
10  boneless skinless chicken breasts, cooked and diced
preparation
      In a large skillet sauté butter, onions and celery until tender.  Add flour to mixture, turn heat to low, and cook for about 45 minutes, stirring constantly, until flour mixture is golden in color.  Add chicken stock and next 4 ingredients.  Turn heat to medium; add cooked chicken and vegetables and simmer until vegetables are tender.  Serve immediately.

CHEESY BROCCOLI-POTATO SOUP
ingredients
2  c. chicken broth
1/3  c. chopped onion
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen chopped broccoli
1 1/3  c. instant mashed potatoes (dry)
2  c. cut-up cooked chicken
2  c. shredded Swiss cheese (8 oz.)
2  c. milk
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
      Heat broth, onion and frozen broccoli to boiling in 3-quart saucepan.  Reduce heat.  Cover and simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Stir in potatoes until well blended.  Stir in remaining ingredients.  Heat over low heat about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until hot and cheese is melted.  Makes 6 servings, about 1 1/3 cup each.

MONTEREY JACK CHEESE SOUP
ingredients
1/2  c. finely chopped onion
1  large tomato, chopped, peeled and diced
2  large green chilies, seeded, veins removed and chopped
1/2  garlic clove, minced
1  c. chicken stock
1 1/2  c. medium white sauce
1 1/2  c. milk
1/4  tsp. salt
  dash of pepper
1 1/2  c. grated cheese
preparation
      Put onion, tomato, chilies and garlic in pot with chicken stock; cook until tender. Remove from heat; slowly stir in white sauce, then milk, stirring constantly. Add salt, pepper and cheese. Simmer slowly over low heat until cheese melts. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.

CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP
ingredients
1  can kernel corn
5  to 6 large potatoes
2  lb. chicken
1  box bow tie noodles
  salt and pepper
  rosemary, crushed
preparation
      Boil chicken until done.  Debone it and put in diced potatoes and corn.  Cook until potatoes are done.  Put in 2 tablespoons crushed rosemary, salt and pepper.  Put in bow tie noodles and cook until tender.

MEAT BALL SOUP
ingredients
1/2  lb. ground beef
  dash of salt and pepper
1  can Campbell's bean with bacon, minestrone, tomato or vegetable soup
1 soup  can water
preparation
      Season  beef  with salt and pepper;  shape into 18 meat balls. In  saucepan,  brown  meat  balls  (use  shortening if necessary);  cook  over  low  heat  5  minutes.  Pour off fat. Stir  in  soup  and  water.  Heat;  stir  now and then.  Makes about 3 1/2 cups.

HAMBURG-PEA SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. hamburg
4  potatoes
1  small onion
1  can peas or 1 can green beans
preparation
      Put 2-inches of water in pan.  Break up hamburg.  Put into water.  Chop onion very fine.  Dice potatoes.  When hamburg is done, add juice off peas.  Add potatoes and onion.  When done, add peas.

SOUTHWEST SOUP
ingredients
1  large onion, chopped
2  lb. ground meat
3 (No. 303)  cans Ranch Style beans
2  cans minestrone soup
1  can beef broth or 2 c. water and 2 bouillon cubes
1  can Ro-Tel tomatoes
preparation
      Sauté onions; brown meat and drain. Add all the other ingredients. Season to taste with salt, pepper and garlic. Simmer for 45 minutes.
      I usually put this in a crock-pot when I get up and it is ready when I come in. You may add mixed vegetables (Veg-All) and some pasta, noodles, macaroni, etc. Serve with grated cheese and corn bread. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

POTATO-LEEK SOUP
ingredients
2  Tbsp. margarine
1  c. leeks, chopped
2  stalks celery, chopped small
1 (14 1/2 oz.)  can chicken broth
2  cans water
4  medium potatoes, peeled and diced (about 4 c.)
1  Tbsp. chopped parsley
  salt and pepper to taste
1 (12 oz.)  can evaporated milk
2  Tbsp. flour
1/4  c. water
preparation
      Melt margarine. Sauté leeks and celery. Pour in chicken broth and water. Add potatoes and parsley. Simmer 1 hour. Add milk and simmer 15 minutes. Blend flour into 1/4 cup water and stir into soup. Simmer another 15 minutes, stirring frequently.
      Notice that I never put a high heat under this.  It takes longer to cook, but it does not stick on the bottom.

SLOW COOKER TACO SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  onion, chopped
2 (16 oz.)  cans chili beans, drained
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato sauce
2  c. water
2 (14.5 oz.)  cans peeled and diced tomatoes
1  pkg. taco seasoning mix
1  can chopped green chiles
1 (15 oz.)  can whole kernel corn, drained
1  Tbsp. chili powder
3/4  tsp. cayenne pepper (optional)
preparation
      Brown ground beef and drain. Combine all ingredients in a slow cooker and cook on low setting for 8 hours.

POTATO SOUP
ingredients
6  medium potatoes
3  c. water
3  c. milk
2  tsp. salt
1  tsp. black pepper
  Chives (optional)
1/2  stick butter
preparation
      Cut potatoes in small cubes.  Pour in water and cook until tender on low heat.  Put milk, salt, pepper, chives and butter in and bring to a slow boil.  Cook for approximately 3 minutes.  Good plain or garnished with grated cheese.

STRAWBERRY SOUP
ingredients
1  c. sour cream
  juice of 1/2 lemon
1  c. sugar
1  c. dry red or white wine
4  c. strawberries (fresh or frozen)
preparation
      Blend all ingredients well and serve cold.

PASTA SOUP
ingredients
1 (14 1/2 oz.)  can Del Monte pasta ready tomatoes
3  cans (14 1/2 oz.) low sodium chicken broth
1  onion
1  clove garlic
1  to 2 summer squash, sliced
4  to 5 carrots, sliced
1 (19 oz.)  can cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
1  tsp. dried Italian seasoning
4 to 5  Tbsp. fresh basil
1/8  tsp. red pepper flakes
1/2  c. pasta
preparation
      Sauté onion in a little oil.  Add carrots and squash.  Cook 5 minutes.  Add garlic and dried seasonings.  Add all cans; simmer 30 minutes.  Add pasta and fresh basil; cook 15 minutes.  Sprinkle with fresh Parmesan/Romano cheese.

HEARTY SPANISH SOUP
ingredients
2  lb. beef shanks
3  qt. water
2  cloves garlic
1  onion, sliced
8  peppercorns
3  carrots, sliced
3  zucchini, sliced
1/2  lb. green beans, cut up
  salt to taste
3  ears of corn (fresh or frozen), cut into 1-inch pieces
preparation
      Start the meat in cold water.  Make a rich broth by cooking it slowly with garlic, onion, pepper and salt.  When the meat is tender, strain off broth.  Add the vegetables (corn last) and cook slowly until done.  Add the meat, cut in cubes, to the soup.  If extra piquancy is desired, you may serve this with jalapeno sauce. Pick the corn up with fingers.

SHRIMP SOUP
ingredients
1  can Boston or New England clam chowder
2  cans shrimp soup
1  can cream of celery soup
1  can shrimp or 1/4 lb. fresh shrimp
1  can crab or 1/4 lb. fresh picked crab
1  can minced clams
2 soup  cans milk
1  to 2 dashes of Tabasco sauce
2  to 3 dashes of Worcestershire sauce
  pepper to taste
  sherry to taste
  chives or parsley (for garnish)
preparation
      Mix all ingredients and heat thoroughly.  Garnish with chives or parsley.  Serves a large group.

MOCK DUCK SOUP
ingredients
2 to 3  lb. pork spareribs
1  large onion
4  qt. water
5  Tbsp. vinegar
30  prunes (1 box)
1  tsp. marjoram
2  tsp. salt
  dash of pepper
1  c. sour cream
1  tsp. cinnamon (optional)
1/4  c. sugar
1/2  c. flour
preparation
      Cook spareribs covered with water until it boils.  Spill this water out; rinse ribs and start again the same way, adding the onion, prunes and rest of ingredients except flour and vinegar. Cook until meat is tender.  Strain soup.  Put broth aside.  Put all except meat through a sieve.  Put pulp back in broth.  Mix flour, sour cream and vinegar in blender, then add to broth (while cooking).  Cook to near boil.  Serve with noodles.

SWEET POTATO SOUP
ingredients
1  qt. peeled and chunked sweet potatoes
3  c. thickly sliced leeks or onions
3  carrots, cut in chunks
3  ribs celery, cut in large slices
2  qt. water
  sea salt and pepper to taste
1  Tbsp. margarine
1/4  c. milk
2  Tbsp. toasted sesame seed
1  Tbsp. caraway seed
2  tsp. chopped fresh tarragon or 1/2 tsp. dried tarragon
preparation
      Place potatoes, leeks or onions, carrots, celery and water in large kettle.  Add salt and pepper.  Bring to boil and simmer for 40 minutes.  With slotted spoon remove half of the carrots and celery and some of the firmer potato pieces and reserve.  Puree the remainder of soup until smooth.  Return to kettle and add reserved vegetables, margarine, milk, seed and tarragon.  Reheat and check seasonings.

SANTA FE SOUP
ingredients
1.5  lb. lean hamburger
1  diced onion
1 (16 oz.)  can Ranch Style beans
1 (16 oz.)  can corn
1 (16 oz.)  can stewed tomatoes, cut up in smaller pieces
1  can Ro-Tel (original hot, regular or mild, whatever your family likes; I use regular)
1  lb. Velveeta cheese
preparation
      You will need a crock-pot. (I cook in larger pan and then transfer to crock-pot; faster.)
      Cook hamburger and onions. Add all ingredients except cheese (do not drain vegetables; use juice). Heat meat and vegetables until ingredients are hot. Cut up cheese in smaller squares and add after the rest is hot. Stir frequently until melted.
       I serve with saltine crackers; could use corn chips or Doritos.

SENATE BEAN SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. dried navy beans
1/3  c. margarine
3  medium potatoes, cooked and mashed
1  c. chopped celery
1  c. chopped onion
2  cloves garlic, minced
3  tsp. salt or to taste
1/2  tsp. pepper
  chopped parsley
preparation
      Wash and drain beans.  Put in large kettle with 6 cups water. Bring to a boil and boil 2 minutes.  Remove from heat, cover and let stand for 1 hour.  Add 2 1/2 quarts water, bring to a boil, cover and simmer 2 hours or until beans are mushy.  Add margarine, potatoes, celery, onion, garlic and 3 teaspoons salt.  Cover and simmer about 1 hour, stirring occasionally.  Add more water if necessary to make a thick soup, then add pepper and more salt if necessary.  Sprinkle parsley over each serving of soup when ready to serve.  Yields 4 1/2 quarts.

BLUEBERRY SOUP
ingredients
5  c. fresh blueberries, plus additional berries for garnish
4  c. water
4  whole cloves
  2-inch piece cinnamon stick
2/3  c. honey
  juice of 1 lemon
3  Tbsp. creme de cassis (black currant liqueur)
1  Tbsp. blueberry vinegar
  plain yogurt (for garnish)
  grated fresh orange rind (for garnish)
preparation
      Rinse the blueberries and remove any stems, leaves or green berries.  Put the berries in a kettle and add the water, cloves and cinnamon stick.  Set over moderate heat and bring to a boil.  Stir in honey; reduce heat and simmer, partially covered, until berries are very tender, about 5 minutes.  Remove from heat and cool to room temperature.  Force the soup through a strainer or through the medium blade of a food mill.  Stir in lemon juice, creme de cassis and vinegar.  Cover and refrigerate for at least 6 hours.  Serve in chilled bowls, garnished with a few whole blueberries, a dollop of plain yogurt and a sprinkle of grated orange rind.  Serves 6.

BROCCOLI SOUP
ingredients
2  cans cream of chicken or celery soup
2  pkg. frozen broccoli, thawed
2  c. cooked diced potatoes
1  can evaporated milk
1  large onion, diced
2  c. milk
preparation
      Add all ingredients to large saucepan and cook over medium heat until creamy.

EASY BROCCOLI SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. Mexican Velveeta cheese
2  cans cream of mushroom soup
1  can cream of chicken soup
3  cans whole milk
1  stick butter or oleo
1  box frozen chopped broccoli
  medium onion, chopped
preparation
      Precook broccoli according to pkg. directions. Sauté onion in butter; add cheese and let melt. Add soups and milk (use soup can to measure milk). Keep stirring to prevent sticking. Add cooked broccoli. Serve with crackers.

LOADED BAKED POTATO SOUP
ingredients
9  c. cubed, peeled potatoes (use 1 bag frozen hash browns)
3  cans chicken broth
2  cans water
2/3  c. butter
1 1/2  c. chopped onions
2  Tbsp. chives
2  tsp. salt
1 1/2  tsp. pepper
1  can Oscar Mayer real bacon bits
1  c. flour
2  c. milk
1  lb. Velveeta cheese, cubed
1  (16 oz.) sour cream
preparation
      In stockpot, add first 9 ingredients.  Cook and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes.  Combine flour and milk. Stir until smooth.  Add to soup and bring to a boil, stirring often.  Remove pot from heat and add cheese.  Place lid on pot and let sit for 3 or 4 minutes.  Stir until cheese is melted completely.  Add sour cream and stir together until completely blended.

BLACK BEAN AND VEGETABLE SOUP
ingredients
1  large onion, coarsely chopped
1  Tbsp. Vegetable oil
1 (28 oz.)  can whole tomatoes (undrained), coarsely chopped   2/3 c. picante sauce
1 1/2  tsp. Ground cumin
1  tsp. Salt
1/2  tsp. Crushed basil leaves
1 (16 oz.)  can black beans, rinsed and drained
1  chopped green pepper
1  lg. Yellow squash or zucchini (or half & half) cut into 1/2-inch chunks (2 c.)
preparation
      In large saucepan or Dutch oven, cook onion in oil until tender.  Add tomatoes, picante sauce and seasonings.  Stir in beans, peppers, and squash; cover and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes.  Makes about 8 (1 cup) servings.
      Suggested toppings: Steamed rice, sour cream, chopped cilantro or parsley, shredded cheese.

LOADED BAKED POTATO SOUP
ingredients
3  lbs. red potatoes
1/4  c. margarine, melted
1/4  c. flour
8  c. Half and Half
16  oz. Velveeta, melted
  White pepper/taste
  Garlic powder/taste
1  tsp. tabasco
1/2  lb. bacon fried
1  c. shredded cheddar
1/2  c. chives, chopped
1/2  c. parsley, chopped
preparation
      Dice unpeeled red potatoes into 1/2-inch cubes.  Place in a large dutch oven, cover with water and bring to a boil.  Boil for 10 min. or until 3/4 cooked.  In a separate large dutch oven, combine melted margarine and flour, mixing until smooth.  Place over low heat and gradually add Half and Half, stirring constantly. Continue to stir until smooth and liquid begins to thicken.
      Add melted Velveeta.  Stir well.  Drain potatoes and add to cream mixture.  Stir in pepper, garlic powder, and tabasco.  Cover and cook over low heat for 30 min., stirring occasionally.
      Place soup into serving bowls and top with crumbled bacon, shredded cheese, chives and parsley.

TACO SOUP
ingredients
2  lb. ground beef
1  medium onion, chopped
1  can chopped green chilies (undrained)
1  can kidney beans
1  can pinto beans
1  can white hominy
3  cans stewed tomatoes
1  pkg. taco seasoning mix
1  pkg. Ranch-style dressing mix
1 1/2  c. water
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Brown meat and onions. Add all other ingredients and bring to a boil for 4 to 5 minutes. Reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes. Serve with Cheddar cheese, chopped green onions and crushed tortilla chips on top. Freezes well.

CHILI CHEESE SOUP
ingredients
1  box potatoes au gratin
8  c. water
1  can chili with beans
1  can Campbell's cream of cheddar cheese soup
1/4  c. margarine
2  c. milk
  Salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      This is the quickest, easiest soup to make and it is wonderful, thick and hearty.
      Bring water to a boil and add the potatoes from the au gratin box.  Cook until tender.   Add the package of cheese mix, stir well to blend - making sure all of the powder is dissolved.  Add the cheddar cheese soup, margarine, milk and the chili.  Stir well, let simmer for about 10 minutes.  Add salt and pepper to taste.
      Takes about 30 minutes to prepare, makes about 6 servings.

SWEDISH BEAN AND BACON SOUP
ingredients
6  strips bacon, cut up
1  c. chopped onion
7  c. chicken broth (from cubes)
1 (15 oz.)  can each small white Great Northern beans and navy beans
2  c. sliced carrots
1  tsp. dried marjoram
1/2  tsp. ground allspice
1  small bay leaf
1  large potato, cubed
4  c. shredded cabbage
preparation
      Cook bacon in a 5-quart pot over medium heat 5 minutes or until crisp.  Drain on paper towels.  Pour off all but 1 tablespoon fat.  Sauté onion in fat 4 minutes or until soft.  Add broth plus 1 extra cup water, the carrots, bacon, marjoram, allspice and bay leaf.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.  Cover and simmer 10 minutes.  Add remaining ingredients and boil gently 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender.  Discard bay leaf.  Top servings with sour cream.

CREAMY PUMPKIN SOUP
ingredients
3  strips bacon
1  c. chopped onion
2  cloves garlic, minced
2  c. cooked, mashed pumpkin
2  Tbsp. flour
1  can (12 oz.) evaporated milk, divided
3  c. chicken broth
1/2  tsp. curry powder
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/4  tsp. nutmeg
  sour cream (optional)
preparation
      Cook bacon until crisp; crumble and set aside.  In a saucepan, sauté onion and garlic in 1 tablespoon bacon drippings until tender.  In blender or food processor, puree pumpkin, flour, 1/3 cup milk and onion mixture; add to pan.  Add broth, spices, and remaining milk. Bring to boil over medium heat.  Boil for 2 minutes.  Top servings with dollop of sour cream and sprinkle with bacon.  Serve with rolls, fruit, and cheese.  Serves 6-8.

FRENCH ONION SOUP
ingredients
3  lb. onions, sliced thin
1  stick butter
8  cans consomme
1  Tbsp. black pepper
1  Tbsp. thyme
  dash of salt
2  cans water
1  loaf French bread
  Swiss cheese slices
  Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Brown onions in butter. Add consomme, pepper, thyme, salt and water. Simmer for 1 hour.
      Pinch tops and sides of bread and line each individual bowl with 5 to 6 pieces of the bread. Fill bowls with soup, then place a slice of Swiss cheese on each. Sprinkle with Parmesan and paprika just before baking. Bake at 400° until brown, usually at least 15 to 20 minutes.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

SOUTHERN CORN SOUP
ingredients
2  Tbsp. butter
2  Tbsp. flour
1  pt. milk
1  pt. bouillon or soup stock
1  can creamed corn (strain through a colander)
  salt and pepper to taste
  popcorn or croutons
preparation
      Melt butter and stir in flour.  Add milk, bouillon or soup stock and corn.  Season with salt and pepper.  Boil 5 minutes and serve in bouillon cups with popcorn floating on top.  Croutons can be used in place of popcorn.  Serves 4.

HOMEMADE VEGETABLE SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. stew beef (cover with water and cook 1 hour)
2  cans blended tomatoes
2  cans lima beans
1  can yellow corn
1  can cream-style yellow corn
1  can Campbell's tomato soup
3  diced potatoes
1  diced onion
preparation
      Cook stew beef 1 hour.  Add remaining ingredients with the exception of cream-style yellow corn. Cook 1 additional hour.  Add cream-style yellow corn and cook extra 15 minutes.  Stir almost constantly to keep cream-style corn from settling to the bottom and scorching.

SWEET AND SOUR CABBAGE SOUP
ingredients
2  or 3 soup bones
1  head cabbage, shredded
1 1/2  qt. water
1 (1 lb.)  can tomatoes
2  onions, sliced thin
1  apple, peeled and diced
1/4  c. seedless raisins
1/4  c. lemon juice
1/4  c. brown sugar
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Put the soup bones in a heavy saucepan.  Add the shredded cabbage and water.  Add the tomatoes, onions, apple and raisins. Add the lemon juice, brown sugar, salt and pepper.  Stir.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer for 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally.  Makes 6 to 8 servings.

BARLEY SOUP
ingredients
1  stick butter or margarine
4  stalks celery, diced
1  medium onion, sliced
1  c. barley
1/4  c. flour
12  c. chicken broth
1/4  tsp. thyme
1 1/2  c. sour cream or evaporated milk
preparation
      In large pan, melt butter or margarine.  Add celery, onion and barley; sauté for 5 minutes.  Turn down heat and quickly stir in flour.  Add chicken broth.  Bring to boil.  Lower heat; cover and simmer for 1 hour, until barley is tender.  Just before serving, add chopped parsley, thyme and sour cream or evaporated milk.

YELLOW ONION SOUP
ingredients
6  oz. onions, thinly sliced
2  Tbsp. butter
2 level  Tbsp. flour
5  c. beef stock
  salt to taste
  pepper to taste
  Mozzarella or Swiss cheese
preparation
      Sauté the onions in the butter for a moment.  Sprinkle them with the flour and as soon as they start to brown, stir in the stock.  Add salt and pepper to taste and cook for about 20 minutes.
      Put grated cheese in bottom of serving bowls and serve.

WILD RICE SOUP
ingredients
2  cans potato soup
2  c. shredded American deluxe cheese
9  slices bacon
1  medium onion
1  c. cooked wild rice
2  pt. half and half
preparation
      Combine soup and cheese; heat over low heat until cheese is melted. Cook bacon and onions together. Drain on paper towels. Break bacon into small pieces. Add to soup mixture. Add half and half; simmer over low heat for 1/2 hour.
      Note: Can also be made in a crock-pot.

FRENCH ONION SOUP
ingredients
2  lb. red onions, peeled and halved
3/4  c. butter or margarine
6  beef bouillon cubes
2  qt. water
1  c. dry white wine
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  tsp. salt
  dash of white pepper
  dash of black pepper
8  oz. chilled Swiss or Gruyere cheese
1/2  loaf French bread
preparation
      Slice onions.  Melt butter in a 4-quart Dutch oven.  Slowly cook onions in butter until lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Add bouillon cubes, water and wine to onions.  Cover and simmer 2 hours, stirring occasionally.  Add Worcestershire sauce, salt and white and black peppers to soup.  Stir.  Shred cheese.
      To serve soup, place a thin slice of French bread into the bottom of each individual ovenware serving bowl.  Ladle soup into bowls.  Top with layer of shredded cheese.  Place under broiler until cheese melts.  Serve at once.

FRENCH ONION SOUP
ingredients
2  lb. red onions, peeled and halved
3/4  c. butter or margarine
6  beef bouillon cubes
2  qt. water
1  c. chicken broth
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  tsp. salt
  dash of white pepper
  dash of black pepper
8  oz. chilled Swiss or Gruyere cheese
1/2  loaf French bread
preparation
      Slice onions.  Melt butter in a 4-quart Dutch oven.  Slowly cook onions in butter until lightly browned, about 20 minutes.  Add bouillon cubes, water and chicken broth to onions.  Cover and simmer 2 hours, stirring occasionally.  Add Worcestershire sauce, salt and white and black peppers to soup.  Stir.  Shred cheese.
      To  serve soup, place a thin slice of French bread into the bottom  of  each individual ovenware serving bowl.  Ladle soup into  bowls.  Top  with layer of shredded cheese.  Place under broiler until cheese melts.  Serve at once.

BROCCOLI AND CHEESE SOUP
ingredients
1  c. water
1  chicken bouillon cube
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen chopped broccoli, thawed
1  medium carrot, grated
4  Tbsp. margarine, melted
3  Tbsp. flour
2  c. milk
1  lb. Velveeta, cut up
1  can cream of chicken
1  Tbsp. minced onion flakes
1  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Heat water and bouillon cube to boiling. Add broccoli and carrot and cook according to directions on broccoli box. Remove from heat. Don't drain. In pan that you are going to make soup in, make white sauce by melting margarine and slowly stirring in flour. Continue stirring while slowly adding milk. Continue stirring until lumps are gone. Stir soup in bowl until smooth. Add to milk. Stir. Add cheese, onion, Worcestershire, salt and pepper. Cook on medium-low. Stir often until cheese is melted. Add broccoli and carrot mixture to this. Cook over low heat until thickens. Be careful or it will stick to pan. Serve with crackers or cornbread.

FRENCH MARKET SOUP MIX
ingredients
1  lb. dried navy beans
1  lb. dried pinto beans
1  lb. Great Northern beans
1  lb. dried split peas
1  lb. dried yellow split peas
1  lb. black-eyed peas
1  lb. dried lentils
1  lb. dried baby limas
1  lb. black beans
1  lb. dried red beans
1  lb. dried soybeans
1  lb. barley pearls
preparation
      Combine all beans.  Divide into 14 (2 cup) packages for gift giving.

FRENCH MARKET SOUP
ingredients
2  c. French Market Soup Mix
2  qt. water
1  ham hock
1 1/4  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1 (16 oz.)  can whole tomatoes, undrained and chopped
1  large onion, chopped
1  garlic clove, minced
1  chili pepper, chopped
1/4  c. lemon juice
preparation
      Sort and wash bean mix; place in Dutch oven.  Cover with water 2 inches above beans; soak overnight.  Drain beans; add 2 quarts water, ham hock, salt and pepper.  Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 1 1/2 hours until beans are tender.  Add remaining ingredients; simmer 30 minutes.  Stir occasionally. Remove ham hock, take meat from bone, chop and return to soup. Yields 2 1/2 quarts.

CREAM OF BROCCOLI SOUP
ingredients
1  large onion, chopped
1/4  c. margarine
1 (48 oz.)  can College Inn chicken broth
1  lb. noodles (medium size)
6  c. milk
2 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen chopped broccoli, thawed
1  lb. Velveeta cheese, cubed
  Pepper
  Garlic powder
preparation
      Sauté onion in margarine.  Add chicken broth and bring to boil.  Add noodles and cook for 5 minutes.  Add milk and broccoli and cheese, simmer for 8 minutes.  Add pepper and garlic powder to taste.

SLICED PANCAKE SOUP
(Frittatensuppe)  
ingredients
1/2  pt. milk
4  oz. flour
1  egg
  pinch of salt
1  oz. cooking fat
preparation
      Make a smooth paste of the cold milk and flour.  Stir in the egg and salt.  Heat enough fat in an omelette pan to cover the bottom of the pan; spoon into the pan enough batter to cover the bottom thinly and evenly.  Fry until crisp on both sides.  Add more fat before frying each pancake.  When cold, the pancakes are rolled up individually and cut into thin strips.  Add to hot beef broth.

LENTIL AND FRANKFURTER SOUP
ingredients
1  Tbsp. salad oil
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. frankfurters, cut into 1/2-inch slices
1  medium size red or green pepper, diced
1  large carrot, diced
1  large onion, diced
1  garlic clove, minced
2  medium size celery stalks, diced
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. dry lentils
1/4  tsp. pepper
2  chicken flavor bouillon cubes or envelopes
preparation
      About 2 hours before serving, in 5-quart Dutch oven over medium-high heat in hot salad oil, cook frankfurters until lightly browned on all sides, stirring frequently.  With slotted spoon, remove frankfurters to bowl; cover and refrigerate.  In drippings remaining in Dutch oven over medium heat, cook celery, red pepper, carrot, onion and garlic until tender, about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Meanwhile, rinse lentils in running cold water and discard any stones or shriveled lentils.  Add lentils, pepper, bouillon, 11 cups water and 1 teaspoon salt to vegetable mixture in Dutch oven.  Over high heat, heat to boiling.  Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 1 hour or until lentils are very tender and soup has thickened.  Return frankfurters to Dutch oven and cook until done.

SENATE BEAN SOUP
ingredients
3  c. dry navy beans
4 1/2  qt. water
1  ham bone
1 1/2  lb. smoked ground ham
3/4  tsp. celery salt
1 1/2  Tbsp. minced onion
1/3  tsp. dry mustard
  salt & pepper to taste
preparation
      Clean and soak beans overnight.  Drain.  Add water, ham bone, ground ham, celery salt, and onion.  Cook beans until very soft. Remove bone.  Press remaining meat from bone and add to soup.  Add mustard and onion.  Simmer until the desired tenderness to beans is reached.  Serves: 8 to 10.

MEXICAN TAMALE SOUP
ingredients
1  lb. hamburger
1  onion, chopped
1  bell pepper, chopped
1  can beef broth
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
  salt to taste
1 large  can tamales, drained
1  can stewed tomatoes
1 (10 oz.)  can cream-style corn
2  cans beans with jalapeno (if you like it hot)
1/2  tsp. cumin seed
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
preparation
   Brown meat, onion and pepper. To this, add beef broth, tomatoes, corn, beans and seasonings. Simmer 1/2 hour; just before serving, put in cornstarch. Also, just before serving, cut tamales in 1-inch pieces. Heat and serve.

CREAM OF ROASTED GARLIC SOUP
ingredients
2  large heads fresh garlic
  olive oil
1/4  c. butter
1/4  c. all-purpose flour
1  small sweet yellow onion, diced
1  bunch leeks, green part removed and diced
2  medium potatoes, baked, skins removed.
2  Tbsp. cognac (optional)
1  qt. chicken stock
  sourdough French bread cubes, several days old, sautéed in butter and garlic
1  qt. light cream
  salt and white pepper to taste
preparation
      Place garlic heads on cookie sheet, sprinkle with olive oil and bake in 350° oven about 1 hour.  Let cool.  Cut off end of each clove and squeeze out contents; set aside.  Sauté onion and leeks in the butter until tender and translucent. Stir flour into onion mixture until all butter is absorbed and continue to cook the mixture over low heat for 4-5 minutes, stirring constantly. Slowly add chicken stock, stirring with wire whisk until smooth, and bring mixture to a simmer. Process potatoes in a blender or food processor.  Add to soup, mixing thoroughly.  Finish the soup by adding the cognac and the cream, and seasoning to taste with salt and white pepper.  Heat thoroughly. Serve immediately garnished with croutons.  Yield:  2 quarts.

CRAWFISH SOUP
ingredients
2  lb. crawfish tails (or shrimp)
  Tony Chachere's Creole seasoning
1  large bell pepper, chopped
1  large onion, chopped
1  garlic clove
1  stick of oleo
4  cans cream of potato soup
2  can cream style corn
1 large  can plus 1 small can evaporated milk
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Wash crawfish; pat dry and sprinkle with Tony's seasoning. Sauté vegetables in 1 stick of oleo. Add crawfish and cook. Add soup and corn; cook about 10 minutes. Add milk, salt and pepper to taste; simmer 10 minutes. Serve over rice with crackers.
       Tip: Soup is better if made early so that seasonings can blend.

SPICY POTATO SOUP
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. ground beef
4  c. cubed peeled potatoes
1  small onion
3 (8 oz.)  cans tomato sauce
4  c. water
2  tsp. salt
1 1/2  tsp. pepper
1/2 to 1  tsp. hot pepper sauce
preparation
	In a Dutch oven or large pot, brown ground beef and onion; drain. Add potatoes and tomato sauce. Stir in water, salt, pepper and hot pepper sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour or until potatoes are tender and the soup has thickened.

CORN, CRAWFISH AND POTATO SOUP
ingredients
1  stick real butter (no substitutes)
1  small to medium white onion, chopped
1  bunch green onions, chopped
1  stick celery, finely chopped (optional)
3  cans Campbell's cream of potato soup
2  cans creamed corn
1 to 2  lb. crawfish, shrimp or crabmeat
1/2  pt. half and half
1  small cap full of crab boil
  pepper to taste
  Tony's to taste
preparation
	Saut butter and onions until tender. Add cream of potato soup and creamed corn; mix well. Cook for about 5 to 10 minutes over medium heat. Add crawfish, half and half and all spices, stirring until well blended. Cook 20 to 30 minutes over medium to low heat, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.

KIELBASA SOUP
ingredients
3  qts water
1-1/2  lbs beef kielbasa, cut in 1/4 inch slices
3  stalks celery, cut in small pieces
3  med onions, cut into 8 pieces each
4  med potatoes, peeled and cut into cubes
3  carrots, cut into small pieces
1/2  c barley
1/2  c lentils
1/2  c split peas
28 oz  can of whole or diced tomatoes
15 oz  can beef bouillon broth
2  beef bouillon cubes
1-1/2  tsp oregano
1-1/2  tsp salt
1/2  tsp fresh ground pepper
preparation
      Add all ingredients except potatoes to the boiling water. When water boils again, reduce to medium heat and simmer for 1-1/2 hours. When carrots are tender, add potatoes. Cook until potatoes are tender.
       Serve with a crusty bread and butter.

FRUIT PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
6  ripe bananas
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed and undiluted
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed and undiluted
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
  orange slices
3  c. water
2  c. sugar
2 (64 oz.)  bottles lemon-lime carbonated beverage, chilled
preparation
      Combine bananas and frozen fruit juices in blender; blend until smooth.  Combine banana mixture, pineapple juice, water and sugar in large mixing bowl; mix well.  Pour into plastic freezer containers or molds and freeze.  To serve, thaw until mushy and add carbonated beverage.  Garnish with orange slices.  Yields 6 quarts.

RUSSIAN TEA (NON-ALCOHOLIC DRINK)
ingredients
1  c. dry unsweetened instant tea
1 (10 cent)  pkg. lemonade mix
1  tsp. cloves
1 large  jar Tang (2 c.)
1  c. sugar
1  tsp. cinnamon
preparation
      Mix thoroughly and store in airtight container.  (Will keep indefinitely.)  Use 2 teaspoons Russian tea to 1 cup boiling water.  May be served hot or chilled.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4 small  boxes Jell-O (whatever flavor desired)
6  c. sugar
1  gal. water
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1/2  tsp. almond extract
preparation
      Heat first 3 ingredients until Jell-O and sugar are dissolved. Then add remaining ingredients.  Freeze in small portions.  When ready to use, scrape into a slush.  Add 4 or 5 quarts ginger ale or 7-Up.  Use flavor of Jell-O for color desired.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
4  c. water
5  well mashed bananas
1 tall  can pineapple juice
1 small  can frozen orange juice, mixed with required water
  juice of 2 lemons
preparation
      Heat sugar and water until dissolves, then add remaining ingredients.  Combine all and freeze.  Serve (melt until slushy). Add equal amount of 7-Up or ginger ale and slush.

AFRICAN SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
6  c. water
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (6 oz.)  can water
1 large  can unsweetened pineapple juice
5  mashed bananas
3  qt. ginger ale
preparation
	Boil sugar and 6 cups  of water in a large saucepan for 3 minutes; let cool.	Mash  bananas  in blender and combine in large container with fruit  juices and 6 ounces of water.  Add sugar mixture and blend  well.  Freeze  for at least 24 hours. Remove from freezer 1  hour  before  serving.  Mash to a pulp. Add ginger ale; mix and serve.  Serves 8 to 10 people.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  box jello (cherry or strawberry)
1/4  c. lemon juice
1 to 2  qt. ginger ale or 7-Up
1/2  c. sugar
1 tall  can pineapple juice
preparation
      Mix jello according to directions.  To this add sugar, lemon juice and pineapple juice.  Put into containers such as margarine tubs and freeze.  Put in the punch bowl.  Add ginger ale or 7-Up. We prefer strawberry over cherry jello.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  can crushed pineapple
6  bananas
6  c. water
2  c. sugar
1  large frozen lemonade
2  large frozen orange juice
4  large ginger ale
preparation
      Blend pineapple and bananas until smooth.  Add water, sugar, lemonade and orange juice.  Freeze.  Remove 30 minutes before serving.  Then add cold ginger ale.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  boxes Jell-O (any flavor)
1 1/2  c. sugar
2  c. boiling water
2 (12 oz.)  cans frozen lemonade
1 large  can pineapple juice
1  (2 liter) ginger ale
preparation
      Mix Jell-O with sugar; dissolve with water.   Add lemonade (with water added as directed on can).   Add pineapple juice. Freeze in Ziploc bags.   Thaw about 4 hours before serving.  Mix ginger ale with slushy mixture when ready to serve.

YUMMY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. Water
4  c. Sugar
5  Ripe bananas
1 x 16  oz. can Crushed pineapple
2  pkg. Cherry Koolaid, unsweetened
1 x 46  oz. can Pineapple juice
  7-Up or Sprite
preparation
      Bring the water and sugar to a full boil. Stir in the Koolaid. In a blender, mix together the bananas and pineapple to a smooth consistency. Add to first mixture, then add in pineapple juice. Freeze. To serve mix with 7-Up or Sprite. Makes 6-7 quarts.
      NOTE: You can also freeze the mixture in ice cube trays for individual servings. Just put a couple in each glass then add soda pop.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 1/2  c. sugar
6  c. cold water
2  pkg. fruit flavored jello
1 large  can pineapple juice
1  qt. orange juice
  juice of 5 lemons
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Boil sugar in water for 3 minutes.  Add jello and dissolve. Add juices and stir well.  Pour into milk cartons and freeze. Remove from freezer 2 hours before serving.  When ready to serve, add 1 quart of ginger ale to 1/2 gallon of punch.  Mix to slush.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
5  mashed bananas
3 1/2  c. sugar
6  c. water
1 small  can orange juice
46  oz. can pineapple juice
2  liter 7-Up
preparation
      Boil sugar and water.  Stir in orange juice, pineapple juice and bananas.  Freeze in milk cartons until ready to serve.  Tear open cartons.  Pour frozen mixture in punch bowl.  Add 2 liters (or more) 7-Up.

SPICED ORANGE TEA DRINK
ingredients
1 (17 oz.)  jar Tang
1  c. instant tea
1  tsp. cloves
1  tsp. cinnamon
preparation
      Combine all ingredients.  Makes nice gifts in decorated canisters.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  c. sugar
6 (6 oz.)  cans frozen Hawaiian Punch
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (46 oz.)  can orange juice
  Squirt soda
preparation
      Simmer sugar and 1 cup water until sugar is dissolved.  Add all the juices and freeze.  Take out 2 hours before serving.  Mix 1 quart sour or Squirt with 1 pint of the slush mixture.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. water
3 1/2  c. sugar
2 small  boxes Jell-O (flavor to be the color of punch you need)
2  c. boiling water
46  oz. pineapple juice
1 small  can lemonade (pink or yellow, whichever matches your punch color)
3  cans cold water
preparation
      Boil 2 cups boiling water and sugar for 3 minutes and set aside. Let cool. Mix Jell-O and water well until dissolved. Set aside and let cool. Mix pineapple juice, lemonade and 3 cans cold water well. After everything is cooled, mix all ingredients together and freeze. Let stand out 2 to 3 hours before using and then mix with Sprite.

FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  can frozen grape juice
1 large  can pineapple juice
1/4  c. lemon juice
1  pkg. frozen strawberries
5  bananas
4  c. sugar
3  large Sprite or ginger ale
preparation
      Put bananas, lemon juice and strawberries in blender. Blend until smooth. Add to thawed grape juice and pineapple juice in a large bowl. Heat sugar and 6 cups water until sugar dissolves (do not boil). Add to fruit mixture. Mix well and freeze.
       To Serve: Thaw slightly and pour Sprite or ginger ale over this. Don't use too much liquid. Punch should be thick and slushy. Make at least 3 or 4 days before serving. Can be refrozen. Will make 40 to 50 punch cups. Will keep in freezer 2 or 3 months.

ORANGE SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 (6 oz.)  boxes jello (orange)
2  c. sugar
2  c. boiling water
4  c. cold water
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
3  (1 qt.) 7-Up
preparation
      Dissolve jello and sugar in boiling water.  Add 4 cups cold water and 2 cans pineapple juice.
      Divide into three (1/2 gallon) cleaned and empty paper milk containers and freeze.  Remove from freezer 2 hours before serving.  Add 1 quart of 7-Up for each 1/2 gallon.  Stir until slushy and serve.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 (3 oz.) or 1 (6 oz.)  pkg. jello
2 1/2 to 3  c. sugar
2  qt. hot water
1/2  c. lemon or lime juice
1 (46 oz.)  can unsweetened pineapple juice
2  qt. cold ginger ale
2  qt. cold water
2  qt. 7-Up
preparation
	Dissolve jello and sugar  in  hot  water.  Add lemon or lime juice, pineapple juice  and  cold  water.  Mix  well  and freeze (divide equally in two containers).
	Before serving, thaw until  mixture is a slushy consistency. Add cold ginger  ale  and  7-Up  just  before serving. Yields 50 servings.
	By having the frozen  mixture in two containers you can mix one at a time.  (One  container of frozen mixture, 1 quart ginger ale and 1 quart 7-Up.) This will fill punch bowl.
	Note:  Thaw frozen mixture  at	least  two hours before serving.

CRANBERRY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 - 8  oz. cans jellied cranberry sauce
2 - 12  oz. cans frozen lemonade concentrate
1 - 12 oz  can cranberry-apple juice concentrate
4  c. water
1  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/2  tsp. ground allspice
12  c. lemon-lime soda, chilled
preparation
      In a bowl, combine the cranberry sauce, concentrates, water, cinnamon and allspice.  Cover and freeze for 8 hours or overnight. Remove from freezer 45 minutes before serving.  For each serving, combine 1/2 c. slush mixture with 1/2 c. lemon-lime soda.
      Makes 24 servings.

FRUIT TEA PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
1  c. cold water
2  c. strong tea
1  c. lemon juice
1 1/2  c. lemon juice
2  c. pineapple juice
1  gal. water
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Make a syrup of sugar and water in a large saucepan.  Add tea, fruit juice and water (enough to make 1 1/2 gallons).  Add ginger ale just before serving.  May freeze all ingredients, except ginger ale.  Serves 50.

CRAN-GRAPE-TEA PUNCH
ingredients
1 1/2  c. boiling water
2  family-size tea bags
10  whole cloves
2  cinnamon sticks
2  c. cranberry juice cocktail
1 1/2  c. unsweetened white grape juice
1/2  c. sugar
preparation
      Pour boiling water over tea bags and spices; cover and let stand for 5 minutes.  Remove tea bags, squeezing gently.  Remove and discard spices.  Add fruit juices and sugar; stir mixture until sugar dissolves.  Serve hot or cold.  Yield: 5 cups.

BREAKFAST SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3/4  c. sugar
1 1/4  c. water
3  c. pineapple juice
3  c. orange juice
3/4  c. lemon juice
1 large  bottle ginger ale, chilled
preparation
      Boil sugar and water.  Add pineapple, orange and lemon juices. Freeze in containers.  Set out about 1 hour before time to use. Place in punch bowl; pour chilled ginger ale over punch.  Small slices of lime and lemon can be frozen in mixture.  Accent with mint.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  pkg. Jell-O (any flavor desired)
2  c. hot water
3  c. sugar
1  pt. Realemon juice
1 large  can orange juice
9  c. water
2  Tbsp. vanilla
2  Tbsp. almond flavoring (if desired)
2 large  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in hot water.  Add remaining ingredients, mixing well.  Freeze until firm overnight or all day.  Serves 50.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  c. sugar
1  c. water
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (16 oz.)  can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed and undiluted
1 (48 oz.)  bottle cran-raspberry juice drink
1 (2 liter)  bottle ginger ale, chilled
preparation
      Combine sugar and water in a saucepan; cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until sugar dissolves.  Combine sugar mixture, pineapple juice and next 2 ingredients in a large container; freeze.  Remove from freezer 1 hour before serving.  Place in a punch bowl and break into chunks; add ginger ale.  Stir until slushy.  Yields 5 1/2 quarts.

COLD TEA PUNCH
ingredients
1  c. sugar
1 large  can frozen orange juice
8  regular tea bags
1 (6 oz.)  can lemonade
10  to 13 sprigs of mint (optional)
preparation
      Steep tea.  Mix other ingredients.  Put in gallon container and finish filling with cold water.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. jello (your choice of flavor or color)
2  c. hot water
1 small  can frozen lemonade
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 1/2  c. sugar
2  c. cold water
2  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve jello in hot water and add sugar. Stir in lemonade and cold water.  Add pineapple juice.  Pour into container and freeze.  Thaw 2 hours before needed.  Add ginger ale and mix in punch bowl.  Makes 4 quarts or 64 cups.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  oz. pkg. jello
2  c. sugar
66  oz. water (11 (6 oz.) cups)
1  oz. almond extract (I don't use)
1  (46 oz.) pineapple juice
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Bring sugar and 2 cups water to boil.  Add jello and allow to cool.  Add the rest of the water, almond extract and pineapple juice.  Mix well and freeze.  Remove from the freezer 4 hours before serving.  The mixture will become slushy.  Do not thaw too much.  Add ginger ale and serve.

FRIENDSHIP TEA OR SPICED TEA
ingredients
2  c. Tang
1 large  pkg. lemonade mix
2  tsp. cinnamon
3/4  c. instant tea
1  c. sugar
preparation
      Mix all together.  Use 2 teaspoons to a cup of boiling water.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 1/2  c. sugar
4  c. water
3  to 5 ripe bananas
2 small  cans frozen orange juice concentrate, mixed with water as called for on juice can
  juice from 2 lemons or 4 Tbsp. ReaLemon
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
2  c. water
preparation
      Heat sugar and water until dissolved.  Cool.  Blend bananas in blender.  Add dissolved sugar water, blended bananas, mixed orange juice, lemon juice or ReaLemon, pineapple juice and water.  Mix and freeze, stirring when about half frozen.  Take from freezer; let set out short while.  Then mix half and half with 7-Up in your blender.  Serve.

50TH ANNIVERSARY PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
5  lb. sugar
3 large  boxes lemon jello
4 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
2 large  cans frozen lemonade
1  bottle almond extract
3 or 4  bottles 7-Up or Sprite
preparation
      Freeze pineapple juice and set out about an hour before serving.  Add all the ingredients together to make mixture (should be slush).  Serves about 150.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
(For 75 Small Servings)  
ingredients
1  (12 oz.) orange juice concentrate (thaw)
2 (6 oz.)  cans frozen lemonade (thaw)
4  c. sugar (I use less sugar, very sweet)
8  c. water
5  bananas, mashed very fine
preparation
      Heat sugar and water until sugar melts.  Mix together all ingredients.  Freezes 8 hours.  Thaw 2 hours before serving.  Add 2 quarts of ginger ale.  (I have kept frozen longer.)

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  pkg. strawberry jello
1  pkg. cherry jello
1 1/2  c. sugar
1 large  can pineapple juice
1  can frozen limeade
1  can frozen lemonade
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve jello as directed on package.  Add frozen limeade diluted to make 1 quart.  Do the lemonade also the same way.  Put in freezer and freeze.  Just before serving add the ginger ale. May add ice cubes if you like.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  tea bags
2  c. sugar
12  oz. frozen lemonade
12  oz. frozen orange juice
2  c. bourbon (Optional)
8  c. water
preparation
      Steep tea bags in 2 cups boiling water. Boil sugar in 6 cups of water and cool. Combine tea, sugar water, lemonade, and orange juice. Add bourbon. Mix and freeze 24 hours or serve with ice.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
1 lg.  pkg. Strawberry Jell-O, or flavor of your choice
6  c. boiling water
2 lg.  cans pineapple juice
2-  2- liter sprite or ginger ale
preparation
      Mix together sugar, Jell-O and water, stir until dissolved, and add pineapple juice.  Pour into containers and freeze for at least 24 hr.  (Plastic milk jugs work well).  Take out of freezer at least 1 hr. before using.  Empty container into a large punch bowl; break mixture into chunks with a wooden spoon.  Add sprite or ginger ale; mix to a slushy consistency.  Makes a wonderful punch. Can add crushed pineapple or frozen strawberries when pouring in the pineapple juice.

STRAWBERRY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. strawberry jello
2  c. hot water
2  pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
2  c. sugar
1/2  c. lemon juice
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
4 1/2  qt. cold water
preparation
      Dissolve jello in hot water. Add Kool-Aid, sugar, lemon juice, pineapple juice and water. Freeze. Remove from freezer 2 or 3 hours before serving and flake with a fork until slushy.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice concentrate
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade concentrate
1 large  can pineapple juice (premade)
5  mashed, ripe bananas
2  c. water
1/2  c. sugar (omit, if desired)
2 liter  bottles 7-Up or any uncola
preparation
      Mix all but pop.  Freeze thoroughly in large Tupperware container.  Remove from freezer 1/2 hour before serving.  Scoop or scrape into punch bowl as much as desired.  Pour pop over and slightly mash with potato masher.  Serve thick or thin.  Add pop and scoop mixture as needed.  Keeps in freezer for a few months. Just use leftovers as desired.

SLUSH PUNCH
(Club Member: Amanda Speed)  
ingredients
1  large frozen lemonade (12 oz.)
3  cans water
2 large  bottles white grapefruit juice
2  c. sugar
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Use 1/2 water to melt lemonade. With other 1/2 water add to sugar in saucepan and heat to dissolve. Add to lemonade, then add juice. Put in large mouth container. Freeze to a slush. Add ginger ale when you start to serve.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  pkg. Jell-O (use color you want)
6  c. cold water
6  oz. frozen lemonade
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
2  c. hot water
1  c. sugar
12  oz. can orange juice (frozen)
1 small  bottle almond extract
preparation
      Mix in a large bucket.  Freeze until ready to use.  Thaw partly and add 2 or 3 bottles of ginger ale to serve.

PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
4  c. cranberry juice
7  c. water
2  c. sugar
12  oz. lemonade
6  oz. orange juice
  a little red food coloring
preparation
      Mix until sugar is dissolved.  Freeze.  When ready to serve, thaw to a slush.  Add 7-Up.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. water
3 1/2  c. sugar
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. gelatin
2/3  c. lemon juice
1 large  can pineapple juice
1 (6 oz.)  can orange juice
3  cans water
2  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Mix water and sugar.  Bring to a boil and simmer 3 minutes. Remove from heat and add gelatin until dissolved.   Mix remaining ingredients, except ginger ale.  Freeze for at least 24 hours. Two hours before serving, take out of freezer.  When ready to serve, break up with fork and add ginger ale.  Any gelatin can be used to change colors.

PARTY PUNCH (SLUSH)
ingredients
1 small  box jello of choice
1  c. hot water
3  c. cold water
1  can pineapple juice (46 oz.)
preparation
      Mix box of jello with hot water.  Add cold water and pineapple juice.  Freeze.  Take out 1 hour before party.  Add 1 liter ginger ale when thawed enough to stir.  Stir again 15 minutes before served.  Makes a slush.

CRANBERRY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 (8 oz.)  cans jellied cranberry sauce
2 (12 oz.)  cans lemonade concentrate
1 (12 oz.)  can cranberry-apple juice concentrate
4  c. water
1  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/2  tsp. ground allspice
12  c. lemon-lime soda, chilled
preparation
	In a bowl, combine the cranberry sauce, concentrate, water, cinnamon and allspice. Cover and freeze for 8 hours or overnight. Remove from the freezer 45 minutes before serving.
	For each serving, combine 1/2 cup slush mixture with 1/2 cup lemon-lime soda. Yield: 24 cup servings.

MOETTE PUNCH (NON-ALCOHOLIC DRINK)
(8 Servings)  
ingredients
1  c. pineapple juice
1  c. white grape juice
1  pt. club soda
  sugar to taste
1  qt. raspberry sherbet or ice
preparation
      Add soda to fruit juices; sweeten to taste.  Pour into punch bowl; add scoops of sherbet.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
8  c. water
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (46 oz.)  can orange juice
  juice of 2 lemons or 1/4 c. juice
5  crushed bananas
  ginger ale or Sprite
preparation
      Boil sugar and water for 3 minutes, or until sugar is dissolved.  Mix juice with sugar mixture.  Add bananas.  Freeze. When ready to use, chop up in a punch bowl.  Add ginger ale or Sprite.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 1/2  c. frozen orange concentrate
1 (48 oz.)  can unsweetened pineapple juice
3  c. water
3  blended bananas
1/4  c. lemon juice
1/2  c. sugar (optional)
preparation
      Combine all ingredients and freeze in containers.  Remove from freezer 1 hour before serving.  Mix with 2 liters of 7-Up or Sprite and serve.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  pkg. jello
2  c. hot water
3  c. cold water
2  c. sugar
2  cans pineapple juice
2 small  cans frozen lemonade
3  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve jello and sugar in boiling water.  Add cold water and juices.  Freeze in containers.  Add ginger ale when ready to use.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
  juice of 2 lemons
2  c. frozen orange juice, diluted
5  mashed bananas (use a fork, not a blender)
8  c. water
4  c. sugar
preparation
      Make a syrup using the water and sugar; bring to a rapid boil, then reduce heat and simmer 3 to 4 minutes.  Set aside to cool thoroughly.  When cooled, add other ingredients.  Mix well and freeze.  When ready to serve, add frozen mixture, after thawing to a slush, to equal amount of ginger ale, about 4 large bottles. Serves 50.

PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
1  pkg. strawberry jello
1  pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
1 large  can pineapple juice
1 1/2  c. sugar
1  c. boiling water
6 to 7  c. water
1 (10 oz.)  bottle chilled 7-Up
preparation
      Mix jello with 1 cup boiling water.  Add sugar and Kool-Aid. Add rest of water, then add pineapple juice to make 1 gallon. Place in freezer about 8 hours before serving time.  After 2 hours, start to stir mixture about every 45 minutes.  Add 7-Up when ready to serve.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
6  c. water
  1(46-oz.) can pineapple juice
1 (46-oz.)  can orange juice
5  bananas, mashed
1/2  c. lemon juice
2  (2liter) lemon-lime sodas (Sprite)
preparation
      Combine sugar and water in a saucepan, bring to a boil, stirring until sugar dissolves, cool.  Pour mixture into large bowl, add the next four ingredients and freeze until firm.  Remove from freezer several hours before serving (mixture should be slushy).  Pour into punch bowl and stir in chilled soda.  Yields approximately 2 1/2 gallons.

BOURBON SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  can orange juice concentrate
1 (12 oz.)  can lemonade concentrate
7  c. water
1  c. strong tea
1  c. sugar
2  c. bourbon
preparation
      Freeze 2 days and serve with 7-Up.

NADA'S KOOL-AID SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 1/2  pt. boiling water
2 1/2  pt. cold water
2 1/2  c. sugar
1  pkg. Kool-Aid (any flavor)
1/2  can (46 oz.) orange juice
1/2  can (46 oz.) pineapple juice
preparation
      Mix all the above and freeze; thaw to a slush and add 1 bottle of ginger ale before serving.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
6  c. water
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
2 (12 oz.)  cans frozen orange juice
1  (12 oz.) frozen lemonade
1  (2 liter) Sprite, chilled
5  bananas
preparation
      Dissolve sugar in water.  Add pineapple juice, orange juice and lemonade.  Mash bananas; blend in blender.  Freeze.  Add chilled Sprite to partially thawed punch.  Serves 50.

EDNA BROWN SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. sugar
4  c. water
4  pkg. (3 oz. size) strawberry Jell-O
6  oz. frozen lemonade
6  oz. frozen orange juice
46  oz. pineapple juice
1  qt. ginger ale, Sprite or 7-Up
1  oz. almond extract
preparation
      Bring sugar and water to a boil or until sugar is dissolved. While hot (not boiling), add Jell-O.  Cool.  Add juices, one at a time.  Mix well.  Add 1 gallon water and almond extract.  Makes 2 gallons.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
7  c. water
1  can pineapple juice (46 oz.)
1  can orange juice (46 oz.)
6  large bananas, mashed
1/2  c. lemon juice
2  (2 liters) 7-Up or Sprite
preparation
      Dissolve sugar in water and bring to  boil.  Set  aside and cool.  Add other ingredients except for  7-Up  or  Sprite. Freeze in 2 one gallon freezer bags.  Remove from freezer 1 to 2  hours before  serving and let it partially  thaw.  Put  in punch bowl and add 7-Up or Sprite.  Serves 50 people.

CRANBERRY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 (8 oz.)  cans jelled cranberry sauce
2 (12 oz.)  cans lemonade concentrate
1 (12 oz.)  can cranberry apple juice concentrate
4  c. water
1  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/2  tsp. ground allspice
12  c. lemon-lime soda, chilled
preparation
      In a bowl, combine the cranberry sauce concentrates, water, cinnamon and allspice. Cover and freeze for 8 hours or overnight. Remove from freezer 45 minutes before serving.
       For each serving, combine 1/2 cup slush mixture with 1/2 cup lemon-lime soda. Makes 24 (1 cup) servings.

BANANA PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
8  c. water
4  c. sugar
46  oz. pineapple juice
4  fresh lemons (juice)
2  small frozen orange juice
5  ripe bananas, mashed
preparation
      Boil water and syrup for 5 minutes.  Cool slightly.  Add pineapple, lemons, orange juice and bananas.  Mix, freeze overnight.  Take out and mash with a potato masher.  Pour 3 liters ginger ale over it.  Serve.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
  juice of 5 oranges
  juice of 2 lemons
2  qt. 7-up
6  c. water
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
5  bananas, mashed
preparation
      Mix sugar and water in a large pan and bring to a boil.  Boil for 3 minutes and cool.  Add juice of oranges, pineapple juice, and lemon juice.  Mix well.  Mix mashed bananas with other ingredients.  Freeze.  About 1 hour before serving, take out of freezer.  Add approximately 2 quarts of 7 up.  Will keep for months in the freezer.

PARTY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  (6 oz.) frozen lemonade
3  (6 oz.) frozen limeade
46  oz. pineapple juice
46  oz. water
2 1/2  bottles ginger ale (28 oz. bottles)
preparation
      Mix first 4 ingredients together and freeze in a wide mouth container.  Let thaw 6 hours before serving.  Use plastic wide mouth jugs.  Tint with food coloring.  Pour ginger ale over slush before serving (128 ounces equals 1 gallon).

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 - 3  oz. pkg. strawberry Jell-O
4  C. boiling water
2 1/2  C. sugar
10  C. cold water
46  oz. can strawberry Hi-C drink
1 1/2  C. lemon juice
7  - UP
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in the boiling water.  Add sugar and stir until dissolved.  Add the cold water, Hi-C and lemon juice.
      Freeze in large container.
      When ready to serve; put 2 scoops in a glass and fill with 7-UP.

DELICIOUS TEA/PUNCH
ingredients
1  gal. tea
1  bottle ginger ale
1  (6 oz.) frozen lemonade
preparation
      Mix all.  Serve.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (46 oz.)  can unsweetened pineapple juice
1  pkg. unsweetened orange Kool-Aid
2  pkg. unsweetened strawberry Kool-Aid
2  qt. water
3  c. sugar
1/3  c. ReaLemon
3  c. mashed bananas (use blender)
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Mix all ingredients in order listed, except ginger ale. Freeze.  Thaw approximately 5 hours before serving time.  Pour 1 quart ginger ale over punch mixture; stir well.  Serves 50.

CITRUS-TEA PUNCH
ingredients
1 1/2  c. water
1  tea bag
1 1/2  c. orange juice
1 1/2  c. pineapple juice
1/2  c. lemon juice
1  c. sugar
3  c. ginger ale, chilled
  orange and lemon slices (optional)
  lemon rind strips (optional)
  mint leaves (optional)
preparation
      Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan; add tea bag. Remove from heat, cover and let stand 5 minutes.  Remove tea bag. Add fruit juices and sugar, stirring until sugar dissolves. Chill.  Stir in ginger ale just before serving.   Add orange and lemon slices and lemon rind strips and mint, if desired.  Yield: 2 quarts.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  cups sugar
6  cups water
1 46  oz. can pineapple juice
1 46  oz. can orange juice
5  mashed bananas
1/2  cup lemon juice
5  quarts ginger ale
preparation
      Combine sugar and water in saucepan.  Bring to a boil.  Remove from heat and cool.  Pour mixture into a 5 quart freezer container. Stir in pineapple juice, orange juice, bananas and lemon juice. Freeze until firm.  Remove mixture from freezer several hours before serving.  Should be slushy.  Pour into punch bowl and stir in ginger ale.

CITRUS SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 1/2  c. sugar
3  c. water
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
3  c. cold water
4  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Bring sugar and 3 cups water to a boil, stirring until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Stir in frozen juices until melted. Stir in pineapple juice and 3 cups cold water. Pour into 2 (9 x 13) pans, cover and freeze at least overnight. Cut each pan of frozen punch into 24 squares. Place in freezer bags and store in freezer until ready to use. Makes 2 gallons.
      To Serve: Put squares into punch bowl and slowly pour in ginger ale. Mix to a slush.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 small  pkg. any flavor Jell-O (you may change flavors to obtain desired color)
9  c. boiling water
4  c. sugar
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
16  oz. bottle lemon juice
4  c. cold water
2  qt. (liters) ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water.  Add sugar, pineapple juice, lemon juice and cold water.  Mix well and freeze for 2 to 7 days. Remove punch from freezer approximately 8 hours before time to serve.  When ready to serve, mix partially frozen mixture with ginger ale.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. sugar
4  c. water
2 (32 oz.)  cans unsweetened pineapple juice
1  gal. cold water
1 (8 oz.)  jar ReaLemon juice
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice (undiluted)
1 1/2  oz. almond flavoring
2 large  pkg. lemon Jell-O
preparation
      Mix sugar  and  water;  bring  to  a  boil; add Jell-O, dissolve.  Add  other  ingredients.  Freeze.  Thaw  to a slush before serving.  Yields 2 gallons.
      To make  3  gallons,  add  2 cans of unsweetened orange juice.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  can pineapple juice
