1  large (46 oz.) strawberry Jell-O
1  pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
2  c. boiling water
2  c. sugar
6  c. cold water
2  liter ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve Kool-Aid, jello and sugar in boiling water.  Add cold water and pineapple juice.  Freeze 4 to 6 hours until it becomes slush.  Put in punch bowl and add ginger ale.  Serves 20.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
4  c. water
5  ripe bananas, mashed
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (46 oz.)  can orange juice
preparation
      Mix sugar and water  until  dissolved.  Add  juice  and mashed bananas.  Freeze in large  container (can make ahead of time). Thaw 2 to 3 hours before serving.  Mix up to 6 bottles of ginger ale.  Punch should be slushy.

FROZEN SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. water
2  c. sugar
3  ripe bananas
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1  can water
4  Tbsp. real lemon juice
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
6 (16 oz.)  bottles 7-Up
preparation
      Mix water and sugar. Boil for 5 minutes and cool. Mash bananas. Add remaining ingredients. Freeze in three 1/2-gallon cartons. Remove from freezer 2 hours before serving and cut through with knife to break up. Place one carton in punch bowl and pour 2 (16 ounce) bottles of 7-Up over it.

SLUSH FRUIT PUNCH
ingredients
6  oz. pkg. red jello
2  c. sugar
4  c. boiling water
46  oz. can unsweetened pineapple juice
12  oz. frozen lemonade
2 1/2  c. water
2  liter Sprite
preparation
      Mix jello and sugar; add boiling water and stir until jello is dissolved.  Add lemonade and water.  Place mixture in a container suitable for freezing.  When ready to serve, allow to thaw about 4 hours.  Add Sprite.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  boxes regular Jell-O (any flavor you want)
3  c. boiling water
3  c. sugar
1 large  can pineapple juice
1  small concentrate orange juice
1  small concentrate lemonade
preparation
      Combine Jell-O, water and sugar; stir until dissolved.  Add pineapple juice, orange juice and lemonade.  In 1 gallon jar, mix all ingredients.  Pour half into another gallon jar.  Fill with 1/2 gallon water.  Put in freezer 24 to 48 hours before serving.  Pour in 1 gallon punch bowl and add 1 quart ginger ale (1 quart ginger ale per gallon).

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
5  c. water
2  c. sugar
2 small  cans lemonade (frozen)
2 small  cans orange juice (frozen)
1 large  can pineapple juice
7  bananas
1  bottle 7-Up or up to 5 bottles if more is needed
preparation
      Mix water and sugar in large container until sugar dissolves (overnight if need be).  Add frozen lemonade and orange juice. Add pineapple juice.  Put bananas through blender.  Mix all these ingredients together and freeze.  Remove from freezer; mash with potato masher to slush up.  Add cold 7-Up (or Bubble-Up), 1 bottle, or up to 5 bottles if needed.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. any flavor gelatin
2  c. sugar
3  c. boiling water
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade concentrate
1  Tbsp. almond extract
5  c. cold water
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin and sugar in boiling water in bowl.  Combine gelatin mixture with pineapple juice, lemonade concentrate, almond extract and cold water in large freezer container.  Freeze for 3 to 4 days.  Let thaw for 6 hours before serving; stir.  Pour into punch bowl; ladle into punch cups. Yield: 20 servings.

STRAWBERRY-BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
6  c. water
2  pkg. frozen strawberries, thawed
1 large  can pineapple juice
  juice of 5 lemons or 1 large can frozen lemonade
  juice of 5 oranges or 1 large can frozen orange juice
5  ripe bananas, mashed
preparation
      Mix together and freeze in containers.  (This recipe serves 50.)  When serving this many, add 4 quarts of strawberry soda. The slush should be removed from the freezer 3 hours before adding the soda in order for it to slush and flavor the drink.  When serving a smaller number of people, use less of the slush and less of the soda.

STRAWBERRY TEA SLUSH
ingredients
2  c. boiling Water
4  Tea Bags, regular size
1 1/2  c. frozen Strawberries
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen Lemonade concentrate
1  c. Ice Cubes
1/4  c. Powdered Sugar
preparation
      Pour 2 cups boiling water over tea bags.  Cover and steep 5 min.  Remove tea bags.  Chill at least 1 hour.  Process chilled tea, frozen strawberries, and remaining ingredients in a blender until smooth and slushy.  Serve immediately.

FRUIT PUNCH DRINK
ingredients
1  c. ice
2  oz. orange juice
1  oz. apple juice
1  oz. diet 7-Up
preparation
      Blend in blender.  Each serving contains 55 calories.

ZOLA'S SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
6  c. water
2 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen strawberries
1 large  can frozen lemonade
1 large  can frozen orange juice
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
5  mashed bananas
2 (2 liter)  bottles strawberry soda pop
preparation
      Melt sugar in boiling water (to make syrup) and let cool.  In large bowl, combine syrup and all ingredients except soda pop. Mix well and freeze.  (Ziploc freezer bags work well.)  When ready to serve, place frozen mixture in punch bowl and pour strawberry soda pop over to break it up.  Will be ready to serve in 20 to 30 minutes.  Drowns 25, serves 30 to 50.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  pkg. strawberry Jell-O
1  pkg. cherry Jell-O
1 1/2  c. sugar
1 large  can pineapple juice
1  can frozen limeade
1  can frozen lemonade
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve gelatins as directed on package.  Mix frozen limeade and lemonade in 1 quart of water.  Add to gelatin mixture along with pineapple juice.  Freeze, stirring frequently.  Just before serving, add ginger ale and ice cubes, if needed.  Serves about 50.

JELLO SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. jello (strawberry, banana or orange)
1/2  c. sugar
1 large  can pineapple juice
1/4  c. lemon juice
2  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Mix jello and add sugar, juice and pineapple juice.  Freeze in ice cube trays.  When ready, add frozen cubes and "cold" ginger ale in punch bowl.  Mix or stir to slush.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
5  ripe bananas, liquefied
4  c. sugar
6  c. water
1  (46 oz.) unsweetened orange juice
1  (46 oz.) pineapple juice
preparation
      Mix all together and freeze until icy.  (Takes about 1 full day.)  Before serving, add 2 quarts (two 2 liter bottles) of 7-Up.

JELLO OPEN HOUSE PUNCH-SLUSH
ingredients
2  large Jell-O (orange)
4-1/2  c. sugar
5  c. water
1  bottle almond extract (1 oz.)
1  (12 oz.) frozen orange juice, undiluted
1  (6 oz.) frozen lemonade, undiluted
2 (46 oz.)  cans unsweetened pineapple juice
1  gal. water
  Canada Dry Ginger Ale
preparation
      Bring water and sugar to boil.  Turn off heat and add Jell-O and stir until dissolved.  Add extract, 1 gallon water, and all juices.  Blend together.  Put into 1/2 gallon containers and freeze.  Before serving, let thaw until you can cut it with a knife.  Cut in bowl until slush.  Add ginger ale to slush and serve.  Makes 3 gallons of frozen base.  Ginger ale not included. Yield:  approximately 75 servings.

BANANA SLUSH (FROZEN PUNCH)
ingredients
4  c. sugar
6  c. water
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice, undiluted
5  mashed bananas
4  qt. 7-Up or ginger ale
preparation
      Heat water and sugar until sugar is dissolved.  Add juices and mashed bananas.  Mix well.  Freeze at least overnight or until needed.  Remove from freezer 1 hour prior to serving.  Cut up in punch bowl and add 7-Up or ginger ale.  Serves approximately 50.

FRUIT PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
3  c. sugar
4 1/2  c. water
42  oz. pineapple juice
3  sliced bananas
1 (16 oz.)  can crushed pineapple
3 (21 oz.)  bottles ginger ale
  juice and pulp of 5 oranges
  juice and pulp of 2 lemons
preparation
      Boil water and sugar 5 minutes.  Set aside.  Combine in blender lemons, pineapple, oranges and bananas.  Leave chunky. Add to boiled sugar mixture.  Add bottled ginger ale and pineapple juice, freeze.  Remove from freezer 3 to 4 hours before ready to serve.  Keep pouring the remaining 2 bottles of ginger ale all over the punch while serving.

CITRUS SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
5  medium bananas
1 (6 oz.)  can lemonade concentrate, thawed
1 (12 oz.)  can orange juice concentrate, thawed
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice (unsweetened)
6  c. water
1 (32 oz.)  bottle lemon-lime soda
1 (32 oz.)  bottle club soda
preparation
      In blender, combine bananas, lemonade concentrate and orange concentrate; blend for 1 minute or until smooth.  (If blender is unavailable, combine ingredients in large mixing bowl and beat with electric mixer.)  Pour into large container (1 gallon size); add pineapple juice and water.  Freeze overnight.  (May be frozen up to 6 months.)

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 (12 oz.)  cans frozen lemonade
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
3  c. sugar
4  tea bags
6  c. hot water
14  c. water
2  c. bourbon or whiskey
preparation
      Steep tea bags in 6 cups hot water for 10 minutes.  Add remaining ingredients and freeze about 10 hours.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
6  c. water
1  qt. pineapple juice or 46 oz.
2 1/2  c. orange juice (3 small cans)
7  Tbsp. lemon juice (ReaLemon)
5  to 6 bananas, sliced (dip in lemon juice)
  red cherries
3  qt. 7-Up
preparation
      Mix sugar in water; boil until dissolved, then cool.  Add pineapple juice, orange juice, lemon juice, bananas and cherries. Freeze all this together until ready to use.  Add 7-Up and let thaw until slushy.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  oz. lime jello
3  oz. lemon jello
  juice from 1 lemon
1  c. sugar
1  large pineapple juice
  7-Up
preparation
      Dissolve jello with boiling water (1 1/2 to 2 cups).  Add all ingredients.  Freeze.  When ready to serve, thaw partially.  Take out of freezer at least 2 hours prior to serving.  Add 1 to 1 1/2 liter 7-Up.

PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  can orange juice concentrate
1 (6 oz.)  can lemonade concentrate
1  c. sugar
2  c. strong tea
7  c. water
preparation
      Mix and freeze.  Scrape with ice cream scoop.  Add to any clear beverage for a refreshing drink.

SLUSH PARTY PUNCH
ingredients
5  c. sugar
4  c. water
4 small  boxes jello (strawberry or your choice)
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1  gal. water
1  tsp. almond extract
  bananas (optional), blended in blender
preparation
      Bring sugar and water to boil; add jello and mix well.  Cool, then add frozen orange juice and large can of pineapple juice, water and extract.  Freeze.
      When ready to serve, take out of freezer about 3 hours before ready to use.  Pour into punch bowl and add bottle of ginger ale. Makes 2 gallons.  Serves 100.

LO-CAL PUNCH STRAWBERRY SLUSH
ingredients
1  c. slightly thawed frozen strawberries
1/2  c. pineapple juice
  Cool Whip
preparation
      In blender, puree strawberries with 1/4 cup pineapple juice. Add Cool Whip.

SLUSH AID PUNCH
ingredients
3 small  pkg. jello (any flavor)
9  c. boiling water
4  c. sugar
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
4  c. water
1  (7.5 oz.) frozen lemon juice
1 to 2  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve jello in water.  Add next four ingredients and mix well.  Freeze in plastic containers.  Take out of freezer at least an hour before serving so that it can thaw to a slush.  Add ginger ale.  Serves 50.  Also makes a great rum punch.

RED PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
1 1/2  c. water
1 1/2  c. sugar
1/4 to 1/2  c. cinnamon candies
6 lemons (juice) or 2  Tbsp. ReaLemon per lemon
8  oranges (juice)
1  qt. cranberry juice
1  qt. pineapple juice
2  qt. club soda
preparation
      Boil water, sugar and cinnamon candies for 5 minutes.  Stir to dissolve cinnamon candies.  Cool.  Add the juice from the oranges and lemons.  Mix cranberry and pineapple juices.  Freeze in two 1/2 gallon cartons.
      Thaw for 1 hour before serving.  Chop until mixture becomes slushy.  Add 2 quarts of club soda and serve.  Great punch for Christmas!

STRAWBERRY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  pkg. frozen strawberries
3 large (12 oz.)  cans frozen orange juice
3 (48 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
1/2 small  bottle vanilla extract
1/2 small  bottle almond extract
3 large  bottles ginger ale
3  c. sugar
2  pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
preparation
      Combine strawberries, orange juice and pineapple juice.  Add enough water to make 3 gallons.  Add remaining ingredients.  Mix well and combine all.  Put in freezer.  Serves approximately 100.

TEA BRANDY SLUSH
ingredients
8 to 9  c. boiling water
4  tea bags, steeped in water 5 to 10 minutes
2  c. sugar, dissolved in tea
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
2  c. brandy
preparation
      Mix all ingredients in ice cream bucket or large container. Store in freezer for 24 hours before serving.  Scoop out about 3/4 serving per glass, filling the remainder of the glass with white soda.  Garnish with a stem cherry.

FRUIT PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  can frozen fruit punch
4  oz. water
1  pt. strawberry Bullet
  7-Up
preparation
      Mix fruit punch, water and strawberry Bullet in large container and freeze.  When frozen, scoop into glass and mix half and half with 7-Up.

CRANBERRY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
5  c. cranberry juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade concentrate
4  c. 7-Up
2  c. ginger ale
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  Can be frozen.

FRUIT TEA PUNCH
ingredients
1/4  c. tea
10  c. boiling water
1  c. sugar
1  c. water
2  c. grapefruit juice
1  c. lemon juice
2  c. pineapple juice
preparation
      Pour boiling water over tea leaves and let stand.  Make a syrup by boiling the sugar and water until clear.  Add other ingredients.  Pour over ice and serve.  Grape juice may be used instead of the grapefruit juice.  Serves 25 people.

FRUIT TEA PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. boiling water
4  tea bags black tea
1/4  c. lemon juice
2  c. orange juice
1  Tbsp. honey
1  lemon
2  oranges
2  c. fresh strawberries
1  bottle soda water
preparation
      Pour boiling water over tea bags; steep 3 minutes.  Remove tea bags.  Blend in juices; sweeten with honey.  Wash, hull and cut in half the strawberries.  Add to tea.  Cover.  Refrigerate punch at least 6 hours to blend flavors.  Just before serving, add bottle of soda water.  Yield:  about 10 cups.

PUNCH (FROZEN SLUSH)
ingredients
1 large  box jello (determines color and flavor)
2  c. hot water
6  c. cold water
1  (12 oz.) frozen orange juice
1  (12 oz.) frozen lemonade
1  (64 oz.) pineapple juice
1  large (2 liter) pop (Vernors, 7-Up, Sprite, etc.)
preparation
      Stir hot water into jello until dissolved.  Add cold water, orange juice, lemonade, pineapple juice and pop.
      Mix and freeze ingredients in containers of 5 pounds.  Take out 4 hours before serving.  Crush into chunks.  Add pop.  Yields 30 servings in punch size cups.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4 (3 oz.)  boxes any flavor gelatin
4  c. boiling water
12  c. cold water
2 (46 oz. each)  cans pineapple juice
3  c. sugar
4  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      I use a dishpan to mix all the ingredients.  Add boiling water to gelatin and stir to dissolve. Add cold water and stir.  Add pineapple juice and sugar; stir.   Put in freezer Baggies and freeze.  You can make this punch up a week before you need it. Take out of freezer about 5 to 6 hours before serving. Add ginger ale to your taste.

SLUSH PUNCH

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  qt. water
6  to 8 mashed bananas
3 small  cans lemonade (frozen)
1 large  can pineapple juice
3  c. sugar
2 small  cans orange juice (frozen)
3  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Heat water and sugar until sugar dissolves, stirring constantly; cool.  Add all other ingredients in a large bowl; stir and freeze in containers.  When ready to serve, take out a container of punch and pour ginger ale on top a little at a time. Break up with a potato masher until slushy and serve in a punch bowl.

HOLIDAY PUNCH (SLUSH)
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  can cranberry juice cocktail (frozen)
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1  c. powdered sugar
3 (2 liter)  bottles Squirt
  fifth of gin
preparation
      Thaw juices.  Mix juices and powdered sugar together in a blender until mixed.  Pour in large container.  Add Squirt and gin.  Mix well.  Freeze for 24 hours.  Thaw for 1/2 hour before serving.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  pkg. Kool-Aid punch (any flavor)
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
30  oz. 7-Up or Sprite (can use more to taste)
3  large bananas, mashed
2  c. sugar
  juice of 1 lemon
2 1/2  qt. water
preparation
      Mix well and freeze.  Let slush before serving.  "Great hit."

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  bananas
  juice of 3 lemons
6  c. water
4  c. sugar
1  qt. pineapple juice
  juice of 5 oranges (1/2 to 1 c.)
4  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Chill all ingredients together thoroughly except ginger ale. Just before serving, add ginger ale that has been chilled.  Serves 50.
      Note:  This is better if frozen and allowed to thaw just enough to make a slush.  Cool and refreshing.  This is the recipe I used for Jill and Jackie's showers.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. hot water
4  c. sugar
1 large  can pineapple juice
2 (12 oz.)  cans frozen orange juice, thawed and undiluted
6  ripe bananas, blended in blender
3 (2 liter)  bottles ginger ale or lemon-lime soda
preparation
      Dissolve sugar in hot water.  Add pineapple juice, orange juice, lemonade and blended bananas.  Freeze mixture in 3 large containers.  Take out of freezer 2 hours before serving.  For each container of punch mixture, add 1 cold bottle ginger ale or lemon-lime soda.  Serve while slushy.  Serves 72.

"SLUSH" BOURBON PUNCH
ingredients
3  tea bags
2  c. water
2  c. sugar
12  oz. lemonade concentrate (frozen)
6  oz. frozen orange juice concentrate (frozen)
7  c. water
2  c. (1/2 liter) bourbon
preparation
      Boil the 2 cups of water and tea bags for 3 minutes; remove from heat and add remaining ingredients.  Stir together and freeze 12 to 24 hours.  Remove from freezer approximately 1 hour prior to serving.  Serve as slushy.  Enjoy!

GOLDEN TEA PUNCH
ingredients
16  family-size tea bags
1 1/2  qt. (6 c.) boiling water
1  c. sugar
1  c. water
2 (16 oz.)  cans frozen lemonade (undiluted)
1 (16 oz.)  can frozen orange juice (undiluted)
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
2 (33 oz.)  bottles ginger ale, chilled
preparation
      Brew tea for about 5 minutes, using tea bags and boiling water.  Remove tea bags and set aside.  To make sugar syrup, combine sugar and 1 cup water in small saucepan.  Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and set aside.
      In a large pot or bowl, combine tea, sugar syrup, lemonade, orange juice and pineapple juice.  Chill well.  Just before serving, add ginger ale and mix.  Serve over ice.  Serves 40.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. granulated sugar
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. flavored gelatin (can select desired flavor or color)
6  c. boiling water
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
4 (1 liter)  bottles ginger ale, chilled
preparation
      In a 6 quart container, combine sugar and gelatin powder.  Add boiling water.  Stir until dissolved.  Add pineapple juice; mix. Pour into plastic containers and freeze at least 24 hours.
      Approximately 1 hour before desired serving time, set containers out to thaw slightly.  Place mixture in punch bowl, breaking it into chunks.  Add ginger ale.  Mix to where is slushy. Makes approximately 70 (1/2 cup) servings.

PUNCH - SLUSH
ingredients
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. Jell-O (orange)
2  c. boiling water
4  c. cold water
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
2  c. sugar
3  qt. 7-Up
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water. Combine cold water, pineapple juice, sugar and Jell-O. Place in 5-quart pails. Cover and freeze for at least 48 hours.
       Two hours before serving, take out and thaw. When serving, add 7-Up.
      For red, use red Jell-O and cranberry juice.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 small  pkg. Kool-Aid
1 small  box Jell-O
2  c. sugar
preparation
	Dissolve all ingredients in hot  water;  add to 1 large unsweetened pineapple juice in a gallon container; finish with water.  Freeze to slush and serve with vanilla ice milk.

FROZEN SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 (6 oz.)  pkg. Jell-O (any flavor)
9  c. boiling water
4  c. water
4  c. sugar
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
1 (16 oz.)  bottle lemon juice
4  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      Mix Jell-O (flavor of Jell-O for color of punch) with boiling water in large container.  Cool.  Bring 4 cups of water and 4 cups of sugar to a boil in a saucepan.  Cool and add to Jell-O mixture. Pour in pineapple juice and lemon juice and stir well.  Pour into 2 gallon plastic milk containers and freeze.  Thaw for 4 hours. Cut top off plastic milk containers and pour into large punch bowl.  Slush and add 2 bottles of ginger ale to each gallon of punch.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. Jell-O (whatever flavor you want)
4  c. boiling water
2  c. sugar
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
preparation
      Mix all and freeze.  Take out of freezer 2 hours before serving at room temperature.  Add 2 quarts of ginger ale slowly just before serving.  Should be slushy.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
12  oz. pineapple juice
12  oz. frozen orange juice
4  pkg. cherry Kool-Aid
12  oz. frozen lemonade concentrate
2  qt. water
6  qt. 7-Up
preparation
      Mix the first 5 ingredients and freeze.  When ready to serve, put in punch bowl and add the 7-Up.  This recipe makes 75 servings.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  pkg. lime jello (use any flavor depending on color you wish)
4  c. cold water
2  liters 7-Up or ginger ale
1 1/2  c. sugar
2  c. boiling water
1  can pineapple juice
preparation
      Dissolve jello in 2 cups boiling water.  Add sugar, cold water and pineapple juice.  Freeze in gallon size Ziploc freezer bags. Thaw 1 hour before serving.  Add 7-Up and more pineapple juice, if desired.  Makes 30 (1/2 cup) servings.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  pkg. Jell-O
3 1/2  c. sugar
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (46 oz.)  can orange juice
  water
  ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in 4 cups boiling water.  Add sugar with 8 cups water and boil 3 minutes.  Add pineapple and orange juice. Freeze.  Thaw 2 1/2 hours before serving.  Add 2 quarts of ginger ale to each gallon.  (Add 2 packages of Kool-Aid, same flavor as Jell-O used, to make a richer and deeper color, if desired.)

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
12  oz. can orange juice
6  oz. can lemonade
46  oz. can pineapple juice
2  liters Sprite
4  c. water
preparation
      Mix,  serve  over  ice  or  freeze  to  make slush.  If frozen, add chilled Sprite when ready to serve.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  pkg. strawberry Jell-O
1  pkg. orange Kool-Aid
2  c. hot water
2  c. sugar
1 large  can unsweetened pineapple juice
2  qt. cold water
6  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in hot water, then add other ingredients, stirring as you add them.  Set in freezer for approximately 8 to 9 hours.  Stir hourly after the first 4 hours.  This recipe makes 1 gallon and 8 gallons serves 150 people.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
5  ripe bananas
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
2 (12 oz.)  cans frozen orange juice
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
6  c. water
  ginger ale
4  c. sugar
preparation
      Bring to boil water and sugar to make a simple syrup.  Cool. Mix all ingredients except ginger ale and freeze in 3 half gallon milk cartons.  When ready to serve, mix with ginger ale in punch bowl (1 milk carton of punch mixture to 2 or 3 tall bottles ginger ale).  Can be made ahead and used as needed.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  pkg. Jell-O (lemon or strawberry)
2  c. sugar
2  c. boiling water
1  c. pineapple juice
preparation
      Mix Jell-O and water.  Add sugar and stir well.  Add juice and enough water to equal one gallon.  Freeze to make slush. Shake occasionally to make a slush.

GALA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  medium grapefruit, peeled and cut into pieces
1 (67.6 oz.)  bottle lemon-lime carbonated beverage
1/4  c. sugar
1  pt. lime sherbet
1  pt. pineapple sherbet
preparation
      In a blender or food processor, place half of the cut up grapefruit. Cover and process until nearly smooth; strain into a large bowl. Repeat with remaining grapefruit. Add half of the carbonated beverage (about 4 cups) to the grapefruit juice. Stir in the sugar until dissolved. Pour into a 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan. Cover and freeze 4 to 5 hours or until nearly firm, stirring 3 times during the freezing time.
      To serve, spoon sherbet and grapefruit mixture into a punch bowl. Pour in remaining carbonated beverage. Serve immediately. Makes 16 (1-cup) servings.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice (thaw)
1 (48 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1  c. lemon juice
5  bananas, crushed
6  c. water
4  c. sugar
3  (2 liter) 7-Up
preparation
      Blend and freeze first 6 ingredients solid.  Remove from freezer 1 hour before using.  Chop up and pour 7-Up over.  Serve. Yield:  2 punch bowls full.

PARTY PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
6  c. water
3  c. sugar
46  oz. can pineapple juice
12  oz. can frozen orange juice
12  oz. can frozen lemonade
5  mashed bananas
preparation
      Mix together the water and sugar; boil 3 minutes.  Add the remaining ingredients; mix together and freeze (large plastic bags or plastic freezer container).
      To serve:  Add equal amounts of frozen mixture with 7-Up.  Can keep unused frozen mixture for weeks.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. sugar
4  c. water
2  qt. pineapple juice
2  pkg. Kool-Aid (whatever color)
1  can frozen lemonade
preparation
      Boil sugar and water together until clear.  Mix together in large container and freeze.  Stir occasionally.  Serves about 30 people.

GINGER TEA PUNCH
ingredients
8  single-serving-size tea bags
1  (1 to 2-inch) piece fresh ginger, thinly sliced
2 to 4  Tbsp. sugar
2 (12 oz.)  bottles or cans ginger ale, chilled
1  orange, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced (optional)
preparation
      Place tea bags and ginger in a tea pot. Add 4 1/2 cups boiling water. Cover; let steep 3 to 5 minutes or until desired strength. Remove tea bags. Stir in sugar. Cool at room temperature 2 hours. Cover and chill until ready to serve.
       To serve, pour tea mixture through a strainer into a 2-quart pitcher. Add ginger ale. Pour over ice in tall glasses.  If desired, garnish with orange. Makes 8 (8-ounce) servings.
       Make-Ahead Tip: Brew tea as directed. Cover and chill for up to 8 hours. Serve as directed.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  bananas, sliced
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice concentrate
2  c. sugar
1  large pineapple juice
2  qt. ginger ale
preparation
	Combine  bananas  and  a small amount of orange juice in blender  container.  Process  until  smooth.  Mix  with  6 cups water  and	remaining  ingredients except ginger ale in freezer container.	Store  in  freezer  until ready to use.  Thaw until slushy.  Add  ginger  ale  just  before serving time.  Yields 5 quarts.

PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
2  (3 oz.) pkgs. flavored gelatin (strawberry is good)
2  c. sugar
2  c. hot water
2  c. cold water
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
2  liter Sprite
1  pkg. Kool-aide  (same flavor as jello)
1  pkg. jello
1  c. sugar
2  c. hot water
2  c. cold water
preparation
      Mix until everything dissolves.  Pour into styrofoam cups, and place in freezer until frozen. Eat with a spoon.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
9  c. water
3 1/2  c. sugar
2 small  pkg. jello (flavor and color of choice)
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1  qt. fresh orange juice
5  lemons juiced (10 Tbsp.)
2  large ginger ale
preparation
      Boil water  and  sugar together for three minutes.  Add remaining  ingredients  except  ginger ale.  Freeze.  Remove 2 hours before  serving  and add 3 large ginger ales after punch has been slushed with potato masher.  Serves 36.

FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4 (46 oz.)  cans unsweetened pineapple juice
4  c. pina colada mixer
4  c. sugar
4  c. tropical punch
3  liters 7-Up or ginger ale
preparation
      In a large container, combine the first four ingredients. Stir until the sugar is dissolved.  Pour into containers and freeze.
      About 1 1/2 to 2 hours before party, remove from freezer and allow to thaw slightly.  Slush it with a knife.  Just before serving, add 7-Up or ginger ale.  (Amount of soda can vary according to preference.  Makes 2 1/2 gallons without 7-Up.)
      Note:  If you want an old rose color, add 2 cups of grape juice to recipe.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  pkg. Jello
1  c. hot water
2  c. sugar
2  qt. water
1 large  can pineapple juice
1  can lemon aid
preparation
      Mix together.  Freeze for three days.  When ready to serve, thaw 3 hours then add 2 liters of 7-UP or Sprite.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  c. sugar
11  c. water
1 large  pkg. jello (whatever flavor and color you like)
1 large  can unsweetened pineapple juice
1  large frozen orange juice, undiluted
1/2  c. lemon juice
preparation
      Boil sugar and water for 3 minutes.  Add jello and juices. Stir.  Pour into milk cartons and freeze.  Use 3 liters ginger ale per run of punch.  Makes 44 punch cups per run.  Thaw 2 hours or longer before adding ginger ale to serve.

CRANBERRY TEA PUNCH
ingredients
4  tea bags
2  c. boiling water
6  c. water
1  c. sugar
1  qt. (4 c.) cranberry juice cocktail, chilled
2  c. apple juice, chilled
6  oz. can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed
  orange slices (if desired)
  ice ring (if desired)
preparation
      Prepare tea by combining bags with 2 cups boiling water. Allow to steep 10 minutes; remove tea bags.  Cool to room temperature and refrigerate.
      Meanwhile, in medium saucepan, bring 6 cups water and sugar to boil, stirring constantly until sugar is dissolved.  Cool to room temperature; refrigerate.  Just before serving, combine chilled tea, sugar mixture, orange juice concentrate, cranberry juice and apple juice in large punch bowl.  Garnish with orange slices and ice ring.  Yield:  30 (1/2 cup) servings.  Calories per 1/2 cup serving:  70.

FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
6  c. water
5  bananas
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
2  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Heat sugar and water until sugar is dissolved; cool.  Blend bananas in blender.  Add a little of the pineapple juice.  Combine banana mixture, remaining pineapple juice, orange juice and lemonade; freeze in 1/2-gallon containers.   (I use Ziploc Baggies.)
      When ready to use, thaw slightly.  Put in punch bowl and add a little ginger ale.  Mash with a potato masher until slushy.  Add remaining ginger ale.
      Great to make ahead and have when needed.

FRUIT TEA PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
2  c. boiling water
8  tea bags
1  qt. boiling water
2  c. orange juice
3/4  c. lemon juice
1 1/2  c. pineapple juice
1 1/2  qt. cold water
preparation
      Mix sugar and boiling water until sugar dissolves.  Add tea bags to boiling water and steep 10 minutes.  Mix all ingredients together and chill.  Makes 1 gallon.

FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. water
2  c. sugar
1 (No. 2)  can pineapple juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
3  bananas, mashed
4  qt. 7-Up
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Boil water and sugar; cool.  Add next 4 ingredients; mix well. Freeze in a covered flat container.  When needed for serving, let set until slightly softened, 1 to 2 hours.  Scrape frozen mixture into punch bowl to form slush.  Add 7-Up and lemon juice; serve.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  pkg. unsweetened cherry Kool-Aid
2  qt. water
2  c. sugar
46  oz. can pineapple juice
4  liters ginger ale
preparation
      Mix well until sugar is dissolved.  Add pineapple juice and stir.  Pour into 2 clean 1/2 gallon cardboard milk containers. Close with paper clips and freeze solid.  One hour before serving, remove frozen slush from freezer and place in punch bowl.  Let sit until serving time.  With fork, chop and scrape until well broken up.  Add ginger ale.  Mix and serve.

HOLIDAY PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
2  c. strong tea (made with 3 tea bags)
2  c. sugar
7  c. water
2  c. vodka or gin
preparation
      Make strong tea with 3 tea bags.  Combine all other ingredients and mix.  Freeze in Tupperware.  Ready to serve in 24 hours.  To serve, fill glass 1/2 full with slush and 1/2 full with 7-Up or Sprite.

SLUSH PUNCH FOR LARGE PARTY
ingredients
2  c. sugar
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. gelatin
6  c. boiling water
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
4  (1 liter) ginger ale, chilled
preparation
      Use any flavor or color of gelatin in a 6-quart container. Combine sugar, gelatin and boiling water.  Stir until gelatin and sugar are dissolved. Add pineapple juice. Mix well and pour into plastic containers and freeze for 24 hours.
      Take out of freezer about an hour before serving. Empty into large punch bowl and break into chunks.  Add ginger ale.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 (3 oz.)  boxes lime jello
3  c. granulated sugar
2  qt. hot water
1 large  can pineapple juice
9 to 10  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  qt. cold water
4  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      Mix and dissolve jello, sugar and hot water.  Add pineapple juice, lemon and cold water.  Mix well.  Freeze in 3 portions in plastic containers.  Allow at least 2 days to freeze.  When ready to serve, take 1 portion of frozen mixture and put in punch bowl. Pour ginger ale over frozen mixture, then use an ice pick to make a slush mixture.  Repeat with another frozen mixture and ginger ale as needed.
      Suggestion:  Large 12-inch diameter Tupperware container will hold entire mixture for mixing.

GOLDEN TEA PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. water
2 rounded  Tbsp. instant tea
1/2  c. sugar
3  c. orange juice
1  c. lemon juice
1  c. pineapple juice
1/4  c. grenadine
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Stir instant tea into water until dissolved.  Add sugar and stir until dissolved.  Add juices.  Chill.  Pour punch into bowl and add ginger ale.  Add an ice mold to punch to chill.   Serves 18.

ICE TEA SLUSH
ingredients
2  tea bags
1  c. boiling water
1  c. sugar
3 1/2  c. water
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1/2  c. bourbon or whiskey
1/2 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
preparation
      Steep tea in boiling water 2 to 3 minutes; remove tea bags and discard.  Stir in sugar.  Add remaining ingredients and mix until sugar is dissolved.  Pour in container for freezer and freeze until firm.  Remove about 10 minutes before serving.  Spoon into glasses; garnish with lemon wedges.  Keep unused portion in freezer.  Makes 1 1/2 quarts.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  bananas
12  oz. orange juice, frozen
12  oz. lemonade, frozen
46  oz. pineapple juice
4  c. water
2  c. sugar
preparation
      Boil water and sugar.  Chill.  Put bananas in blender.  Blend with juices.  Before freezing, divide in half and freeze.  Before serving, thaw 2 hours.  Place in punch bowl and add 3 quarts of Wink before serving.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (48 oz.)  can pineapple juice
9  c. water
1  large ginger ale
1  c. sugar
preparation
      Mix and freeze all ingredients, except ginger ale, in plastic milk jugs.  Take out of freezer 4 hours before you serve, add ginger ale.  No ice is needed.

FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
24  oz. pineapple juice
24  oz. Hawaiian Punch
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
4  bananas
3  c. water
1 1/2  c. sugar
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Mash bananas, adding lemon juice.  Dissolve sugar in water. Add bananas and juices to sugar water.  Freeze.  Two hours before serving, remove from freezer.  To 2 quarts of frozen mixture, add 16 ounces ginger ale.  Stir until punch is slushy.  Serves 12.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 1/2  c. sugar
12  oz. can frozen orange juice
12  oz. can frozen lemonade
46  oz. can pineapple juice
2  bottles of Squirt (2 Liter)
preparation
	Mix 2 1/2 c. sugar and 3 c. water.  Add 1 can of orange juice and 1 can of lemonade.  Add 1 can pineapple juice.	Mix well.  Add 3 cups cold water.	Pour into (2) 9 X 13 pans and freeze.  Cut into 3 inch squares.  Put into freezer bags (one pan per freezer bag). Take one bag of cubes and add a 2 Liter bottle of pop.  (Makes 2 batches.)

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  (2 liter) large Sprite
4  c. sugar
7  c. water
1 small  can concentrated orange juice
1 small  can concentrated lemonade
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
4  c. crushed pineapple
6  large bananas, mashed
preparation
      Dissolve sugar in water in a large bowl.  Add other ingredients; freeze.  Remove from freezer approximately 2 hours before serving and mash into slush with a potato masher.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  pkg. lemonade Kool-Aid
1  box Jell-O (whatever flavor/color you desire)
2  c. sugar (add one and taste, 2 may be too sweet)
2  c. water
1  qt. unsweetened pineapple juice
preparation
      Mix all ingredients and freeze in Baggies.  Have 2 bottles of ginger ale real cold.  Set Baggies out to begin to soften.  Put in bowl and pour ginger ale over.  Mix and chop.  Makes a cool slushy punch.

GREEN TEA BANANA SLUSH
ingredients
1  c. water
1/4  c. sugar
3  Lipton green tea, tea bags
1  frozen banana, sliced
1  c. ice cubes (about 6-8)
preparation
      In saucepan, bring water and sugar to a boil; remove from heat. Add tea bags and brew for 1 1/2 minutes, dunking bags occasionally. Remove tea bags and chill. In a blender, process all ingredients at high speed until blended.  Pour into frosty glass. Garnish, if desired with whipped cream and mint twigs and serve.

ORANGE SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
6  c. water
4  bananas, mashed
1/2  c. lemon juice
2 (12 oz.)  cans frozen orange juice
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (2 liter)  bottle 7-Up
preparation
      Mix well all ingredients, except 7-Up and freeze until firm. Remove from freezer 2 hours before serving.  Break frozen mixture into large pieces and put in punch bowl.  Add 7-Up and stir until slushy.  Makes 6 1/2 quarts.

STRAWBERRY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
23  oz. orange juice
23  oz. pineapple juice
2 1/2  lb. frozen strawberries
  ginger ale or 7-Up
  red food coloring (optional)
preparation
      Let frozen strawberries thaw and mix strawberries, orange juice and pineapple juice together.  Re-freeze mixture.  About 1 hour before serving punch, remove frozen mixture from freezer and partially thaw.  Cut into "chunks." Beat mixture with wire whip until broken up and "slushy."  Add ginger ale or 7-Up until punch is desired consistency.  Serve immediately.  Makes 1 gallon.

YELLOW SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 1/2  c. sugar
19  c. lukewarm water
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice concentrate
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen limeade
1  tsp. almond extract
1 (1 liter)  bottle ginger ale, chilled
preparation
      Dissolve the sugar in the water in a large freezer container. Add pineapple juice, orange juice, limeade and almond extract and mix well.  Freeze, covered, until needed. Let stand until slushy. Combine with the ginger ale in a punch bowl and mix gently.  Makes 50 servings.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  can pineapple juice
3  bananas, diced
2  c. sugar
1 large  can crushed pineapple
3  c. water
1  (2 liter) 7-Up
preparation
      Boil water and sugar until sugar is dissolved.  When cooled, add pineapple juice, pineapple and bananas.  Put in freezer for 1 or 2 hours before you want to use.  Just before serving, add 2 liter 7-Up.  This should be thick like a slush.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  (3 oz.) jello, any flavor
4  c. boiling water
2  c. sugar
1  (12 oz.) frozen lemonade
1  (46 oz.) pineapple juice
1  2-liter 7-Up
preparation
      Dissolve jello in boiling water.  Add sugar, lemonade, and pineapple juice.  Freeze for at least 12 hours.  Add 7-Up before serving.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  pkg. Jell-O (any color)
1 1/3  c. sugar
3  c. water
1/4  c. lemon juice
1  tsp. almond extract
1 large  can pineapple juice
preparation
      Boil water and dissolve sugar and Jell-O.  Mix all ingredients in a gallon jug.  Fill with water and shake.  Freeze.  Let thaw 12 hours before serving.

FRUIT PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
6  ripe bananas
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (42 oz.)  can pineapple juice
2  c. sugar
3  c. water
preparation
      Puree the bananas in a food processor along with the thawed lemonade.  Then add the other ingredients and mix well.  This mixture is frozen and will fit in a gallon plastic milk jug. Before serving, partially thaw and add the following:  1 (64-ounce) ginger ale and 1 (64-ounce) lemon-lime soft drink. Yields 50 (1/2-cup) servings.  You can cut the amount of sugar in half.

APRICOT SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  small apricot Jell-O
9  c. water
3  c. sugar
preparation
      Boil 3 minutes.  Cool thoroughly and add 1 large can pineapple juice and 1 large frozen orange juice (undiluted).  Freeze in gallon jugs filling below the neck to allow for expansion.  Remove from freezer 2 to 3 hours before using.  Add 1 liter 7-Up to each recipe.  Makes 40 (15 ounce) servings.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
11  c. water
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
2 (20 oz.)  cans crushed pineapple
4  large ripe bananas, mashed
1 large  can pineapple juice
2  (2 liter) 7-Up or ginger ale
preparation
      Boil the sugar and water together a few minutes, then cool. Blend with next 4 ingredients and freeze.  To serve, take out of the freezer ahead of time for thawing.  Add pineapple juice to the slush and 7-Up or ginger ale.  Serve slightly thick.  Serves 35 to 40 people.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  qt. lemonade, mixed with sugar
2  c. water
1  small frozen lemonade and water called for
1  large pineapple juice
1/2 to 3/4  c. sugar (sweeten to taste)
2 liter  bottle Mountain Dew
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together.  Freeze.  Serve slushy.

FRUIT TEA PUNCH
ingredients
1  large frozen pineapple juice
1  large frozen orange juice
1  large frozen lemonade
1  gal. prepared tea
1 1/2  c. sugar
preparation
      Mix all together and serve over ice.
      For hot spice tea, add cinnamon and cloves to Fruit Tea Punch.

STRAWBERRY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
2  c. sugar
2  qt. water
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 or 2  boxes thawed frozen strawberries
1  can frozen pink lemonade
1  qt. 7-Up
preparation
      Boil and cool the first 3 ingredients. Add the pineapple juice, strawberries and pink lemonade.  Freeze in ice cream pail. Stir occasionally. Before serving, add the 7-Up.

NO. 3 TROPICAL TREAT PUNCH NON-ALCOHOLIC DRINK
ingredients
2  qt. pre-diluted orange juice
1  qt. pineapple-coconut juice (available at health food stores)
4  c. ice
preparation
      Combine all 3 ingredients.  Makes 1 gallon.

RED SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  pkg. cherry Kool-Aid
3  qt. water
4  c. sugar
1  qt. pineapple juice
1  qt. apple juice
preparation
      Mix Kool-Aid with water until dissolved.  Add sugar and both juices.  Stir well and pour into empty cartons.  Freeze 24 hours at least.  Thaw 2 hours and serve.  No ice necessary.  Should be slushy.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  c. sugar
1  qt. water
1 large  can pineapple juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1  (12 oz.) frozen orange juice
8  very ripe bananas
2 large  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      Bring to a boil 3 cups sugar and 1 quart water.  Stir until sugar is dissolved.  Cool.  Add 1 large can pineapple juice, 1 can frozen lemonade and 1 can frozen orange juice.   Add 8 very ripe bananas that have been mixed in osterizer.   Mix all ingredients well.  Freeze.
      To use, thaw partially and add 2 large bottles ginger ale. Enjoy!

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  c. water
1  pkg. Kool-Aid
46  oz. pineapple juice
3  oz. jello
3  c. sugar
1  qt. club soda
preparation
      Jello and Kool-Aid can be any flavor.  Bring water to a boil and dissolve jello. Add the Kool-Aid and the sugar.  Stir until dissolved.  Add pineapple juice to the mixture and freeze.  When ready to serve, let mixture stand at room temperature until mix can be chopped into chunks and is slushy.  Add club soda and serve.

CRUNCHY FROZEN PUNCH-SLUSH
ingredients
3 small  pkg. strawberry or apricot jello
9  c. boiling water
4  c. white sugar
1  (16 oz.) frozen lemonade concentrate
2 large  cans pineapple juice or frozen pineapple juice concentrate
2 large  bottles 7-Up or ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve jello and sugar in boiling water.  Bring to a boil. Set aside to cool.
      Add lemonade and pineapple juice next.  Mix well. Freeze in plastic containers. Cover with foil.  When ready to use, uncover and place container in hot water. When it is almost ready, add 7-Up and mix.  It should be slushy.  It's ready to serve.  Yields 40 cups.  If you add 1 quart pineapple sherbet, it will even taste better.

LIME SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime gelatin
3  c. pineapple juice
1  c. cold water
2  c. boiling water
1/3  c. lemon juice
1  (64 oz.) ginger ale, chilled
preparation
      Mix together first 5 ingredients.  Cover and freeze for 8 hours.  Take out 1 hour before using.  Add ginger ale.  Makes 1 gallon.

FRUIT-TEA PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. boiling water
4  tea bags black tea
1/4  c. lemon juice
2  c. orange juice
1  Tbsp. honey
1  lemon
2  oranges
2  c. fresh strawberries
1  bottle soda water
preparation
      Pour boiling water over tea bags; steep 3 minutes.  Remove tea bags.  Blend in juices; sweeten with honey.  Cut peel from lemon and oranges; section fruit.  Remove all membranes; add to tea. Wash and hull strawberries; cut in half.  Add to tea; cover. Refrigerate punch at least 6 hours to blend flavors.  Just before serving, add bottle of soda water.  Yields about 10 cups.

LIME SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1/2  c. sugar
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime flavored gelatin
2  c. boiling water
3  c. unsweetened pineapple juice
1/3  c. lemon juice
1  c. cold water
1 (64 oz.)  bottle ginger ale, chilled
preparation
      Dissolve sugar and gelatin in boiling water in large bowl. Stir in juices and cold water.  Cover and freeze 8 hours.  Remove 1 hour before serving.  Break into chunks and pour in ginger ale. Stir until slushy.  Yield: 1 gallon.

ORANGE SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
6  c. water
4  bananas, mashed
1/2  c. lemon juice
2 (12 oz.)  cans frozen juice concentrate, thawed (undiluted)
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (67.6 oz.)  bottle lemon-lime carbonated beverage, chilled
preparation
      Combine sugar and water in a Dutch oven; cook over high heat, stirring often, until sugar dissolves.  Let mixture cool.  Add bananas and next 3 ingredients to sugar mixture; stir well. Freeze until firm.
      Remove from freezer about 2 hours before serving.  Break frozen mixture into large pieces and place in punch bowl.  Pour in carbonated beverage; stir gently until slushy.  Yield: 6 1/2 quarts.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
6  c. water
2 (12 oz.)  cans frozen orange juice
2 (12 oz.)  cans frozen lemonade
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
2 (16 oz.)  cans pineapple chunks
3  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Bring water and sugar to a rapid boil, making a simple syrup. Add remaining ingredients except ginger ale and mix thoroughly. Freeze mixture.  When ready to use, stir in ginger ale.  Yield:  5 quarts of slush mix.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
3  c. water
2  c. orange juice
1/4  c. lemon juice
5  ripe bananas
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
preparation
      Combine the ingredients (bananas, lemon and orange juice) in blender.  The rest, put in a large container, then mix well.  Pour into Tupperware container or 1/2 gallon milk carton.  Freeze. When ready to serve, set out of freezer until thawed to slush (3 hours or so, depending on weather).  Add 4 quarts of ginger ale. Makes 50 servings.  Can be colored with food coloring to match color scheme.  Can be frozen in 4-pint container, if you choose.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. water
4  c. sugar
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (46 oz.)  can orange juice
  juice of 2 lemons
5  bananas, pureed
2 to 3 (32 oz.)  bottles tonic water
preparation
      Heat water and sugar until dissolved.  Add juices and bananas. Pour into ice cube trays, a shallow pan or empty milk carton; freeze.  Thaw 2 to 3 hours to form a slush.  Place in punch bowl. Add tonic water.  Yields about 27 cups.

RED PUNCH DRINK
ingredients
2  pkg. raspberry Kool-Aid
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1  qt. pineapple juice
preparation
      Mix Kool-Aid, orange juice and lemonade as directed on package.   Mix all with pineapple juice.   Pour over ice.

BANANA "SLUSH" PUNCH
ingredients
7  c. water
1  qt. ginger ale
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen pineapple juice
3 1/2  c. sugar
preparation
      Boil water and sugar.  Cool and add remaining ingredients, except ginger ale.  Freeze mixture in freezer bags for approximately 2 to 3 hours before serving. Remove from freezer and add ginger ale.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  cans Hawaiian Punch
1  can unsweetened pineapple juice
2  pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
2  c. sugar
1 (33.8 oz.)  bottle ginger ale
preparation
      Combine all ingredients, except ginger ale.  Mix well and freeze.  Before serving, remove from freezer and allow to partially thaw.  Stir in ginger ale.  Serve slushy.  No ice is needed.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  c. water
2  c. sugar
1/4  c. lemon juice
3  bananas, pureed
1 1/2  c. orange juice
46  oz. pineapple juice
3  qt. Sprite
preparation
      Get your favorite glass and a spoon.  Squirt as much chocolate syrup in your cup that you can get away with and add milk to fill your cup.  Stir well.  Drink this as fast as you can and ask to make more.  Don't ask to do this before dinner though because your mom will say "you can't have anything to drink because it will ruin your supper".

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  oz. pkg. wild strawberry Jell-O
2  c. sugar
2  c. boiling water
4 1/2  c. cold water
46  oz. can pineapple juice
1  c. ReaLemon juice
1  Tbsp. almond extract
2 liter  bottle 7-Up
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O and sugar in the boiling water.  Add the cold water, pineapple juice, lemon juice and almond extract.  Place punch into a plastic gallon ice cream bucket and freeze.  Thaw 4 to 6 hours and place into punch bowl.  Add the 7-Up and serve. Makes 1 1/2 gallons of delicious punch.

PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
4  c. water
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
20  oz. pineapple juice
3  mashed bananas (blender or potato masher)
4  qt. 7-Up
2  tsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Boil sugar in water until dissolved.  Cool and add the next 4 ingredients.  Mix well and freeze in 2 containers.  Thaw 2 hours before using.  In punch bowl, pour 7-Up and lemon juice over frozen mixture to serve.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. water
3  qt. ginger ale, Sprite or 7-Up
5  bananas, mashed
4  c. sugar
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade or 1/4 c. lemon juice
preparation
      Boil sugar and water until dissolved; cool.  Add fruit juices and bananas.  Blend well and freeze.  Let thaw about 2 hours before serving.  Just before serving, add the ginger ale in punch bowl and stir until slushy.

TEA STRAWBERRY SLUSH
ingredients
4  tea bags (caffeine free)
1 to 1 1/2  c. frozen strawberries
1/2 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade (Adams)
1  c. ice cubes
preparation
      Steep tea using 2 cups of water and chill.  In a blender, combine tea, strawberries and lemonade concentrate.  Process until smooth.  With blender running, gradually add about 1 cup ice cubes, processing until ice is melted.  Garnish with fresh fruit.  Serve immediately.  Serves 4.

FRUIT AND TEA PUNCH
ingredients
3  c. sugar
  juice of 10 lemons
  juice of 2 oranges
1 1/2  c. pineapple juice
4  qt. strong tea
preparation
      Combine sugar, lemon juice and orange juice in punch bowl. Mix until sugar is dissolved.  Stir in pineapple juice and tea. Serve over crushed ice in tall glasses.

LAMON'S BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  bananas, sliced
4  c. sugar
6  c. water
2 (12 oz.)  cans frozen orange juice, thawed
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade, thawed
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
6  qts. ginger ale
preparation
      Blend bananas in bowl or blender.  Combine bananas with sugar, water and juices.  Mix well.  Pour mixture into 3 one-half gallon containers.  Freeze.  Let thaw 1-2 hours before serving.  To serve, add 2 quarts ginger ale to one-half gallon container. Yield 24 servings.

FRUIT PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
6  ripe bananas
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade, thawed
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice, thawed
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
3  c. water
1  c. sugar
2  (64 oz.) lemon-lime, chilled or ginger ale or Sprite
preparation
      Combine bananas and fruit juices in blender until smooth. Mix other ingredients in blender, then mix all together.  Pour into plastic freezer container to freeze (day ahead).
      To serve, thaw until mushy.  Add carbonated beverage.  Makes 6 quarts.  One gallon serves approximately 25.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  to 6 bananas, liquified in blender
1  can frozen lemonade
1  can frozen orange juice
1  can pineapple juice
4  c. sugar
4  c. water
4  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Mix sugar, water and liquified bananas, lemonade and juices together.  Freeze in Ziploc bag, approximately 1 to 1 1/2 hours before serving time.  Remove from Ziploc bag and place in a large bowl.  Pour ginger ale over frozen chunk.  As this starts to thaw, it makes a real good slushy drink.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. sugar
4  c. water
2 large  pkg. strawberry jello
1 small  pkg. lemon jello
1  large frozen orange juice
2 small  cans frozen lemonade
2 large  cans pineapple juice
2  oz. almond extract
1  gal. water
preparation
      Mix sugar and water in a large pot.  Boil until syrupy. Remove from heat and stir in jello until dissolved.  Add frozen juices, pineapple juice, almond extract and water.  Mix well. Pour into jugs or empty drink bottles and freeze.  Thaw 2 hours before serving.

TROPICAL PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
8  pkg. Tropical Punch Kool-Aid
12  c. sugar
2 large  cans crushed pineapple
preparation
      Mix ingredients and add enough water for large Tupperware container.  Freeze and keep stirred.

STRAWBERRY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  can pineapple juice
1  pkg. orange Kool-Aid
2  pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
2  qt. water
3  c. sugar
1/3  ??? lemon juice
24  oz. Sprite
3  bananas, mashed
preparation
      Mix bananas, lemon juice and some pineapple juice in blender. Mix with rest of ingredients.  Freeze at least 2 to 3 days.  Let thaw for 5 to 7 hours until slushy.  Makes 20 servings.
      Can add additional Sprite to help make slushy.  Can vary Kool-Aid for color or flavor.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
5 (3 oz.)  pkg. jello
5  c. sugar
84  oz. unsweetened pineapple juice
1  pt. lemon juice (real lemon or equivalent)
18  oz. grapefruit juice
4  qt. cold water
preparation
      May use any flavor gelatin.  Dissolve jello in 5 cups boiling water.  Add all other ingredients.  Freeze.  Keeps well.  Set out of freezer 3 to 4 hours before serving (sometimes you have to chop with wooden spoon).  Add 6 quarts 7-Up and 2 quarts ginger ale when serving.  No need for ice or ice rings.  Stays cold.  Makes at least 150 punch cups.

FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  bananas
12  oz. frozen orange juice, thawed
2  c. water
2 (2 liter)  bottles Sprite
6  oz. frozen lemonade, thawed
46  oz. pineapple juice (unsweetened)
3  c. sugar
preparation
      In a blender mix bananas, orange juice and lemonade.  In a gallon container mix water, sugar and pineapple juice.  Stir in banana mixture.  Freeze mixture.  About 3 hours before serving, take out of freezer to thaw.  Add Sprite immediately before serving.  Serves 25 to 30 people.

CARDINAL PUNCH (NON-ALCOHOLIC DRINK)
(44 Servings)  
ingredients
1  qt. cranberry juice
1  pt. orange juice
2 lemons, squeezed or 2  oz. lemon juice
4  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Combine juices with ice and chill.  Pour into punch bowl over block of ice; add ginger ale.  Garnish glasses with mint sprig. (May add orange sherbet scoops.)

TEA DRINK
ingredients
3  tea bags
1 1/2  c. sugar
8  Tbsp. lemon juice extract
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Soak tea bags overnight.  Add sugar, lemon juice extract and ginger ale.  Add enough water to make a gallon (about 2 quarts plus 1 cup water).

WATERMELON SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3/4  c. sugar
1/2  c. water
2  c. seedless watermelon
1/4  tsp. salt or less
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  Tbsp. lime juice
2  drops red food coloring
  7-Up
preparation
      Boil sugar and water until clear and sugar is dissolved; set aside.  In blender, blend watermelon, salt, lemon juice, food coloring and lime juice.  Add sugar syrup.  Freeze at least 24 hours.  Break into chunks and place in glasses.  Pour 7-Up over chunks, blending in slush.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 (12 oz.)  cans frozen orange juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
5  bananas
1 small  can crushed pineapple
4  c. sugar
6  c. hot water
4 (67.2 oz.)  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      In a blender, dissolve 4 cups sugar in 6 cups hot water (add food coloring, if desired).  Add juices directly from the cans; add cut up bananas and pineapple.  Freeze.  To serve, put the frozen mixture into a punch bowl.  Pour ginger ale over it and mix slowly so mixture becomes slushy.  Yield:  60 servings.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  or 5 oranges, juiced
3  lemons, juiced
1 large  can pineapple juice
5  large bananas, mashed
1  pkg. Kool-Aid (whatever color)
4  c. sugar
3  c. water
preparation
      Freeze.  Stir several times during freezing.
      For punch, add ginger ale to slush in a punch bowl.  Serves 25 to 30.

PARTY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  large (6 oz.) strawberry jello
2  c. hot water
4  c. sugar
1  pt. ReaLemon juice
2  Tbsp. almond extract
9  c. water
1 large (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 large  can frozen orange juice
4 to 6  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Mix jello, hot water and sugar together until jello is dissolved.  Add all other ingredients except ginger ale.  Put in containers and freeze.  I use butter tubs or freezer bags.  Take out of freezer 3 hours before serving.  Place in punch bowl and pour ginger ale over.  Mix together.  This will be slushy.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. hot water
4  c. sugar
1 large  can pineapple juice
2 (12 oz.)  cans frozen orange juice, thawed and undiluted
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade, thawed and undiluted
6  ripe bananas, blended in blender
3 (2-liter)  bottles ginger ale or lemon-lime soda
preparation
      Dissolve sugar in hot water.  Add pineapple juice, orange juice, lemonade and blended bananas.  Freeze mixture in 3 large containers.  Take out of freezer 2 hours before serving.  For each container of punch mixture, add 1 cold bottle ginger ale or lemon-lime soda, serve while slushy.

JELLO SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 small  pkg. strawberry jello
1/2  c. sugar
1  qt. ginger ale
1  small frozen lemonade
2  small frozen orange juice
1  Tbsp. almond extract
preparation
      Prepare all juices and jello as directed on packages (do not cool the jello).  Combine these in large container.  Add remaining ingredients, mixing well.  Freeze overnight.  Thaw about 3 1/2 hours before serving.  Makes a slush.  Makes about 2 gallons.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  qt. ginger ale
2 large  cans unsweetened pineapple juice
2  cans water
2  c. sugar
1  bottle almond flavoring extract
  food coloring (if desired)
preparation
      Freeze for 16 to 20 hours. If using soon, stir every few hours or freeze and when ready to use, thaw out overnight.  Keep stirred to give it the slush texture.  Will keep frozen for several months.

FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  large Jell-O (cherry or lime)
1 1/2  c. sugar
2  c. boiling water
1 (6 oz.)  can lemonade
4 1/3  cans water
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice plus 1 1/2 cans water
2 liter  bottles 7-Up
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O and sugar in boiling water.  Add lemonade, water, pineapple juice plus water.  Freeze solid.  Remove 3 hours before serving.  Crush as you can.  Add 2 liter bottles 7-Up.

BEST EVER SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
46  oz. pineapple juice
46  oz. orange juice
1  c. sugar
1  c. water
30  oz. frozen Hawaiian Punch concentrate or 1 qt. liquid concentrate
2  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Mix all ingredients in an empty ice cream pail.  Mix well and freeze.  Take out of freezer 4 to 5 hours ahead to thaw a little. Chop with a knife to make slush.  Put into punch bowl and add ginger ale just before serving; will be slushy.  Makes 50 (5 ounce) servings.  (You can make this several days ahead of time and keep frozen until ready to use.  Take out a few hours ahead of time.)

CHRISTMAS PUNCH OR HOT RUSSIAN TEA
ingredients
2  small tea bags
2  cinnamon sticks
15  whole cloves
1 large  box cherry Jell-O or 2 small
1 1/2  c. sugar (may use only 1 c.)
1 large  can pineapple juice
4 lemons or 4  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Simmer tea, cinnamon and cloves in 4 cups water for 30 minutes.  Dissolve Jell-O in 2 cups boiling water.  Pour Jell-O mixture into large container.  Then add 6 cups cold water.  Now add sugar and pineapple juice.  Squeeze and strain lemons and add to Jell-O mixture.  Strain tea mixture and combine with Jell-O mixture.  Makes more than one gallon.  Serve cold for punch and hot for tea.

GAY'S PINEAPPLE BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
4  c. water
2 large  cans crushed pineapple
3  to 4 bananas
1  can orange juice
1 (3-liter)  bottle ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve sugar in water to make a light syrup.  Mix syrup with next three ingredients and pour into small containers to freeze solid.  Approximately 1 hour before serving, remove containers from freezer and place in punch bowl.  Pour ginger ale over frozen ingredients.  As mixture thaws, rake a fork over ice mixture to make slushy.

FRUIT TEA PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
1  c. water
2  c. strong tea
1  c. lemon juice
2 1/2  c. orange juice
2  c. pineapple juice
2  c. frozen strawberries
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Make a syrup of 2 cups of sugar and 1 cup of water.  Add tea, fruit juices and enough water to make 1 1/2 gallons.  Stir in strawberries and ginger ale just before serving.  Makes about 50 servings.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 (46 oz.)  cans unsweetened pineapple juice
3 (6 oz.)  cans thawed orange juice
4  pkg. unsweetened Kool-Aid
4  c. sugar
5  qt. water
preparation
      Mix together and freeze.  (This makes the largest Tupperware cake taker full.)  Remove from freezer 5 hours before serving. Chop up with fork and add two 2-liter bottles of ginger ale.
      You can change the color of punch by changing the Kool-Aid. Example:  For red punch, use 2 cherry and 2 strawberry.  For yellow punch, use 4 lemonade.  For purple punch, use 4 grape.  For pink punch, use 3 pink lemonade and 1 cherry.  For green punch, use 4 lime.  Punch can be frozen if ginger ale is not added.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  pkg. any flavor Jell-O (flavor determines color)
1 1/2  c. sugar
5  c. pineapple juice
1 small  can frozen lemonade
1 small  can frozen limeade
1  qt. ginger ale (added when ready to serve)
preparation
	Dissolve  Jell-O  in water as directed on package.  Add sugar while hot.	Add other juices.  Mix well.  Freeze.  When ready to use,  remove  from	freezer  at least 2 hours before serving. Break  up  and  stir  until slushy.  Add ginger ale. Makes approximately 50 cups.

AGGIE SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (46 oz.)  can unsweetened pineapple juice
1 (48 oz.)  bottle Ocean Spray cranberry juice cocktail
1  c. sugar
2 (1 liter)  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      Mix juices with sugar and freeze.  Two hours before the punch is to be served, remove from freezer and let thaw.  Right before serving, scoop thawed juice into punch bowl and pour ginger ale into the bowl.  The ginger ale will cause the frozen juice to melt even quicker.  Stir thoroughly and break up large chunks of ice. Punch will be mushy.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  pkg. cherry Kool-Aid
1  pkg. orange Kool-Aid
3  c. sugar
1 1/2  qt. water
1  tall pineapple juice
  juice of 3 lemons
3  mashed bananas
3  qt. 7-Up
preparation
      Freeze overnight.  Take out 2 hours ahead and beat occasionally.

FROZEN P.T.A.  SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 1/2  c. sugar
6  c. water
5  to 6 bananas
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
3 juice  cans water
1/2  c. lemon juice
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
2 to 3  qt. 7-Up, Squirt or lemon juice
preparation
      Boil sugar and water 5 minutes.  Cool.  Mash bananas in blender and add rest of the ingredients except 7-Up.  Freeze. Remove from freezer 2 hours before serving.  Add 7-Up and serve slushy.  You may have to break up frozen chunks.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (46 oz.)  can unsweetened pineapple juice
1 (12 oz.)  can unsweetened apple juice plus 3 cans water
1  Tbsp. almond flavoring
1  (2 liter) 7-Up
preparation
      Combine all ingredients and place in freezer.  Stir after 8 to 12 hours.  Stir occasionally.  When ready to serve, add one 2 liter bottle diet 7-Up.

SLUSH PUNCH
(Serves 50)  
ingredients
6  c. water
2  pkg. lemon jello
3 1/2  c. sugar
1  (46 oz.) pineapple juice
  juice of 5 lemons
4  c. water
3  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      Boil sugar and water together.  Add lemon jello, stir until dissolved.  Add cold water.  When cool, add pineapple juice and juice of 5 lemons.  Pour in 3 half-gallon milk cartons and freeze.
      Before serving, thaw about 3 hours at room temperature until crunchy.  Add ginger ale just before serving, 1 large bottle ginger ale per carton of punch.  Do not add ice.  May use cherry or strawberry jello for pink punch.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. boiling water
1 large  pkg. Jell-O
1  c. sugar
8  c. water
1 large  can pineapple juice
preparation
	Combine.  Add  water to make a gallon.	Freeze.  Remove from freezer 6 hours before serving.  Serves 15 to 20.

FRUIT PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
6  ripe bananas, pureed
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (42 oz.)  can pineapple juice
2  c. sugar
3  c. water
1 (64 oz.)  bottle ginger ale
1 (64 oz.)  bottle lemon-lime soft drink
preparation
      Puree the bananas in a food processor, along with the thawed lemonade.  Then add the orange juice, pineapple juice, sugar and water; mix well.  This mixture is frozen and will fit in a gallon plastic milk jug.  Before serving, partially thaw and add the ginger ale and lemon-lime soft drink.  Yields 50 (1/2 cup) servings.  You can reduce amount of sugar.

FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  can pineapple juice
12  oz. can frozen orange juice
12  oz. can frozen lemonade
3  mashed bananas
4  c. water
1  lemon-lime soda pop
preparation
      Mix thoroughly and freeze.  When ready to serve, stir to mash. Add soda pop.  Yields 25 servings.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4  cups sugar
6  cups hot water
5  ripe bananas
1 46  oz. can pineapple juice
1 46  oz. can orange juice
  juice of 2 lemons
1  tsp. vanilla
2  qts. ginger ale
preparation
      Mix sugar in hot water, let cool.  Add juices.  Blend in bananas and lemon juice.  Freeze in (2) 1 gal. ziploc baggies. Remove from freezer 3 - 4 hours before use.  Mix 1 bag to 1 qt. ginger ale.  Serves 50.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. hot water
1 large  pkg. Jell-O
1 1/2  c. sugar
1 large  can pineapple juice
1 (2 liter)  bottle ginger ale
preparation
      Mix Jell-O and sugar in hot water until dissolved; add pineapple juice.  Stir constantly.  Add water to make 1 gallon. Freeze overnight.  Take out of freezer and clip with pick or knife.  Add ginger ale.

SLUSH OF A PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  can pineapple juice
2 large  cans frozen orange juice (12 oz.)
2 large  cans frozen lemonade (12 oz.)
2  pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
preparation
      Sweeten to own taste.  Freeze until slushy.  When ready to serve, pour ginger ale over and mix.  You can add food coloring to darken color.

SLUSH PUNCH
(Serves 100 People, 8 Ounce Cups)  
ingredients
3 (6 oz.)  pkg. Jell-O (any color)
6  c. sugar
6  qt. hot water
3  c. plus 4 Tbsp. lemon juice
2  (46 oz.) pineapple juice
4  qt. cold water
4  qt. 7-Up, Sprite, sparkle water or ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O and sugar in hot water.  Add lemon juice, pineapple juice and cold water.  Then freeze overnight or 6 to 12 hours.  Remove, shake and add 7-Up or one of the other. Delicious. Great for weddings or showers, just any time.  Freeze in punch bowl.

PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. jello
2  c. sugar
6  c. water
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
3 large  bottles ginger ale (cold)
preparation
      Heat 3 cups water to boil.  Dissolve jello and sugar.  Add 3 cups cold water; add juice.  Freeze.  One hour before serving, use potato masher and mash to soften.  Add ginger ale.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 (46 oz.)  cans unsweetened pineapple juice
3 (6 oz.)  cans frozen orange juice, thawed
2  pkg. cherry powdered drink mix
2  pkg. strawberry powdered drink mix
4  c. sugar
5  qt. water
preparation
      Mix together and freeze.  Take out of freezer 5 hours before serving.  Chip up with fork and add 2 bottles of ginger ale.

BANANA PUNCH (SLUSH)
ingredients
2  c. sugar
9  c. water
3  mashed bananas
1/4  c. ReaLemon juice
1 large  can pineapple juice
1 large  can frozen orange juice
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Mix sugar with 3 cups water and boil for ten minutes.  Let cool.  In another container, put bananas, lemon juice, pineapple juice and orange juice.  Mix well.  Add to cooled syrup and freeze. Take from freezer one hour before using.  Use a wooden spoon to break frozen mix apart and stir into a slush.  Do not let mix thaw completely.  Add 6 cups of water and ginger ale; stir and enjoy.

ALMOND TEA PUNCH
ingredients
4  tea bags
2  c. boiling water
1 1/2  c. sugar
1/3  c. lemon juice
1  tsp. vanilla and almond extract
2  qt. water
preparation
	Boil water and steep tea 5 minutes. Add sugar, lemon juice, vanilla and almond extract to tea. Add the water and stir well. Freeze. Remove from freezer in time to allow it to become slushy at serving time.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
5  bananas
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice concentrate
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
2 1/2  c. sugar
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
  water
4  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Mash bananas thoroughly and add the slightly thawed orange juice and lemonade.  Sprinkle sugar over mixture.  Add the pineapple juice, stirring well to dissolve the sugar.  Put mixture into a gallon milk container and fill with water; do not fill to the top of container.  Allow space for expansion during freezing. Freeze to a slush.  At serving time, cut off top of milk container to remove slush.  Place mixture in a 2-gallon punch bowl and add the ginger ale.
      This punch base can be frozen and kept indefinitely (well almost).  Before serving, allow several hours for the mixture to reach the slush stage.  This is a great punch and one of our favorites.  Makes 64 (4-ounce) servings.

GINGER TEA PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. brewed tea
  juice of 2 oranges
  juice of 1 lemon
1/4  c. sugar
1 (16 oz.)  bottle ginger ale or mint ginger ale
preparation
      Brew 2 cups of regular tea.  Cool slightly.  Add fruit juices and sugar.  Add ginger ale just before serving.  Serve over ice.

PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
1  frozen lemonade (12 oz.)
1  frozen orange juice (6 oz.)
2  c. strong tea (3 tea bags to 2 c. water)
7  c. water
1  c. whiskey or bourbon
preparation
      Stir and put in large container.  Freeze at least 10 hours. Take out of freezer 2 hours before serving.

YELLOW SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  pkg. lemonade Kool-Aid (unsweetened)
2  c. sugar
4  qt. water
1  large pineapple juice
3  Tbsp. almond extract
4  Tbsp. lemon jello
4  ripe bananas, blended (optional)
1 (2 liter)  bottle 7-Up or Sprite
preparation
      Boil 1 cup of the measured water to dissolved jello.  Add all the remaining ingredients except 7-Up and dissolve well.   Freeze in 3 (1/2 gallon) milk or juice boxes.  Thaw to a slush and add 7-Up just before serving.  (Takes about 5 hours to thaw.)  To make red punch, substitute strawberry Kool-Aid and jello.  To make green punch, substitute lime jello and Kool-Aid.  Makes 2 gallons.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  pkg. Kool-Aid
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
2  tsp. almond extract
2 1/2  c. sugar
1  qt. water
2  tsp. vanilla extract
preparation
      (Use the color Kool-Aid you wish your punch to be. You may add food coloring, if needed.)
      Freeze ahead and stir occasionally.   When ready to serve, add a bottle of chilled ginger ale. (Take out of freezer and let sit for 30 minutes to an hour to thaw slightly.) Serves 25.

STRAWBERRY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
4  c. water
2 (6 oz. each)  boxes strawberry gelatin
64  oz. fruit punch
46  oz. Hawaiian Punch
46  oz. pineapple juice
2 (2 liter each)  bottles 7-Up or Sprite
preparation
      Combine the sugar and water in a medium size saucepan.  Bring to a boil.  Remove from heat and stir in the gelatin, stirring until completely dissolved.  Add remaining ingredients (except 7-Up or Sprite) and stir to mix well.  Pour into two 1-gallon plastic containers and freeze.  Remove from freezer 1 to 2 hours before you plan to serve it so that it will begin to thaw.  Break up the punch a little before pouring it into the punch bowl.  Pour in the 7-Up or Sprite and gently slush the mixture using a dull knife.  You will probably want to divide this punch into portions when serving, especially if you don't have a large punch bowl.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 1/2  c. sugar
3  c. water
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. jello (flavor may vary)
1  oz. almond extract
1 (46 oz.)  can unsweetened pineapple juice
16 1/2  c. water
preparation
      Bring to a boil the sugar and water.  Add jello and stir well. Add extract, pineapple juice and water.  Mix well.  Freeze at least overnight.  Thaw 4 to 6 hours before serving.  Serves 40. Makes 2 gallons.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  pkg. Kool-Aid (any flavor)
1  c. sugar
1  can unsweetened pineapple juice
  ginger ale
preparation
      Prepare in an empty gallon milk jug.  Mix Kool-Aid, sugar and a small amount of water, then add pineapple juice.  Fill rest of jug with water and freeze.  Set out to thaw to where it is slushy, then pour cold ginger ale over it and serve.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 (46 oz.)  cans unsweetened pineapple juice
3  (6 oz.) frozen orange juice
4  pkg. unsweetened Kool-Aid
4  c. sugar
5  qt. water
2  qt. ginger ale
2  liter 7-Up
preparation
      Mix together and freeze.  Take out 5 hours before serving. Chop up with a fork. Add ginger ale and 7-Up.
You change color by:
preparation
      Red:  Use 2 cherry and 2 strawberry Kool-Aid.
      Yellow:  Use 1 yellow and 4 lemonade.
      Purple:  Use 4 grape.
      Pink:  Use 3 pink lemonade and 1 cherry.
      Green:  Use 4 lime.
      Serves 35 to 40 people.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  pkg. raspberry jello
9  c. water, boil and let cool
4  c. sugar
4  c. water, boil and let cool
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
1 (16 oz.)  can lemonade concentrate
preparation
      Freeze in gallon bags. Add 3 bottles (1 liter) ginger ale to frozen gallons at least one hour before serving.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. sugar
1  qt. Hi-C orange
6  pkg. unsweetened strawberry Kool-Aid
8  qt. water
1  qt. pineapple juice
preparation
      Mix ingredients and pour into large containers and freeze. Remove from freezer and thaw to slush stage.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
8  c. pineapple juice (1 large can)
8  c. sugar
1  qt. plus 1 c. orange juice, mixed (one 12 oz. can frozen)
6 (28 oz.)  bottles 7-Up
3  qt. warm water
1  c. lemon juice
10  mashed ripe bananas
preparation
      Mix all ingredients well, except 7-Up.  Freeze and store until day needed.  Thaw to slush stage (about 4 hours).  Pour into punch bowl and add 7-Up and serve.  Serves 30 to 35.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  qt. water
3  c. sugar
6  to 8 mashed bananas
2 small  cans frozen orange juice concentrate
3 small  cans frozen lemonade concentrate
1 large  can pineapple juice
3  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Heat water and sugar until sugar dissolves, stirring constantly.  Cool.  Add all other ingredients in a large bowl; stir.  Freeze in containers.
      When ready to serve, take out a container of punch and pour ginger ale on top, a little at a time, and break up with a potato masher until slushy.  Serve in punch bowl.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 small  boxes jello (color you prefer)
6  c. boiling water
3  c. sugar
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
2 small  cans frozen lemonade
2 small  cans frozen orange juice
1  bottle ginger ale
preparation
      Freeze first 6 ingredients in 5 gallon bags.  When ready to serve, add ginger ale, one bottle to each gallon of frozen juice.

CRAN-GRAPE-TEA PUNCH
ingredients
1 1/2  c. boiling water
2  family size tea bags
10  whole cloves
2 (3-inch)  sticks cinnamon
2  c. cranberry juice cocktail
1 1/2  c. unsweetened white grape juice
1/2  c. sugar
preparation
      Pour boiling water over tea bags and spices; cover and let stand 5 minutes.  Remove tea bags, squeezing gently; remove and discard spices.  Add fruit juices and sugar.  Stir mixture until sugar dissolves.  Serve hot or cold.  Yields 5 cups.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
2  c. water
1 small  pkg. cherry jello
1  oz. almond flavor extract
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
preparation
      Boil sugar, water and cherry jello.  Then add almond flavor and pineapple juice.  Place in large container and freeze.  Serve slightly thawed.  Great for parties!

SUNSHINE PUNCH (SLUSH)
ingredients
3  c. water
1  c. sugar
2  ripe bananas, cut up
2 (12 oz.)  cans unsweetened pineapple juice
1 (6 oz.)  can orange juice concentrate, thawed
1 (6 oz.)  can lemonade concentrate, thawed
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
28  oz. carbonated water or club soda
preparation
      In saucepan, bring water and sugar to a boil.  Stir until sugar is dissolved.  Boil gently 3 minutes.  Remove from heat and let cool.
      In blender, blend until smooth, bananas and 1 can unsweetened pineapple juice.  Stir in 1 can unsweetened pineapple juice, orange juice, lemon concentrate and lemon juice.  Turn into container and freeze for up to 2 months.
      To Serve:  Bring to room temperature, about 30 minutes.  Pour into punch bowl and slowly add carbonated water or club soda. Decorate with strawberries or other fruits.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. water
2 1/2  c. sugar
2 small  boxes wild strawberry Jell-O
4  c. cold water
1  large orange juice
1  large pineapple juice
6  Tbsp. lemon juice
  ginger ale
preparation
      Pour 6 cups of water into saucepan along with the sugar.  Boil for 3 minutes.  Mix in Jell-O, then combine this with all the remaining ingredients, except the ginger ale.  Mix well and freeze in gallon jugs.  Remove from freezer about 4 hours before serving time (punch should be slushy).  Add 1 large ginger ale per 1 gallon punch.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 small  boxes Jell-O (any flavor)
2  Tbsp. almond extract
2  bottles ginger ale or Sprite
1  can frozen lemonade
2 small  cans frozen orange juice
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
4  c. sugar
preparation
      Boil together 9 cups water and 4 cups sugar; add Jell-O to hot mixture. When thoroughly mixed, add 4 cups cold water, then add all ingredients, except ginger ale or Sprite! Freeze overnight or longer; remove 1 hour before serving. Stir with a fork and let the punch thaw to slush. Add ginger ale or Sprite.

PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
6  c. water
5  bananas
2 small  cans frozen lemonade concentrate
2 small  cans frozen orange juice concentrate
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
6  qt. ginger ale
preparation
