      Bring sugar and water to a boil; let boil for 5 minutes. Cool.  Put bananas in blender and cover with some of the juices. Process until bananas are smooth.  To the cooled sugar water, add the bananas and all juices.  Mix well.  Pour into 6 equal containers and freeze.  Before serving, remove from freezer. Partially thaw.  Add 1 quart of ginger ale to each frozen portion and stir until slushy.  Six portions serve fifty people.

HOT PUNCH DRINK
ingredients
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1  qt. cranberry juice in jar
3  c. water
1  c. brown sugar
1/2  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. whole cloves
1  Tbsp. whole allspice
6  cinnamon sticks
preparation
      Place spices in cheesecloth. Combine remaining ingredients in crock-pot. Put on No. 5 setting for 2 hours, then turn down to No. 2 setting. Keep warm for serving. Makes 24 (4 ounce) servings.

PARTY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  qt. boiling water
4 to 5  c. sugar
1/4  c. citric acid
1 (46 oz.)  can unsweetened pineapple juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen pink lemonade
1 (10 oz.)  can frozen strawberry daiquiri mix
4  qt. water
8 (10 oz.)  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      Combine 2 quarts boiling water, sugar and citric acid, stirring until sugar and acid dissolves.  Combine pineapple juice (thawed), undiluted strawberry daiquiri mix and pink lemonade and 4 quarts of water.  Add to sugar mixture in large plastic container. Divide evenly into four 1-gallon size heavy-duty zip-top bags. Freeze.
      Remove each bag from freezer 30 minutes before serving.  Place in punch bowl and break into chunks, add 2 bottles (10 ounces each) ginger ale.  Serve.

STRAWBERRY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  large frozen orange juice concentrate
1  large frozen lemonade concentrate
1 46 oz  can pineapple juice
1  Pre-sweetened pkg strawberry kool-aid
2  c water
3  1/2 c sugar
  ginger ale
preparation
      Prepare orange juice, lemonade, and kool-aid according to package directions.  In large pot, combine all 3 with pineapple juice.  Heat 2 c water and 3 1/2 c sugar until boiling and sugar has melted.  Add to juice mixture.  Allow to cool and  then freeze. Makes 2 gallons.  Before serving in punch bowl, pour about 2 c ginger ale over slush.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 large  pkg. Jell-O
4  c. sugar
1 large  can pineapple juice
16  oz. ReaLemon juice
  almond flavoring
  water
  ginger ale
  Sprite
preparation
      Dissolve desired color and flavor Jell-O in 2 cups boiling water.  Add sugar, pineapple juice, 12 cups water, lemon juice and flavoring (to taste).  Place in container(s) and freeze to slushie state.  When serving, add equal parts of punch, ginger ale and Sprite.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 1/2  c. sugar
6  c. water
2  pkg. jello
1  qt. orange juice
1  can pineapple juice
2/3  c. lemon juice
2 (28 oz.)  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      Boil water and sugar; simmer 3 minutes.  Add jello and juices. Freeze.  Remove from freezer; add ginger ale.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 small or 1 large  pkg. Jell-O
3  c. hot water
1  c. sugar
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
2  qt. ginger ale, 7-Up or Sprite
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in hot water.  Add sugar and pineapple juice. Freeze.  Remove from freezer in time for it to thaw just to slush stage.  Add cold ginger ale before serving.

RAMSEY FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  c. hot water
2  c. sugar
1  (43 oz.) pineapple juice
1 3/4  c. ready to drink orange juice
1/4  c. lemon juice
3  ripe bananas, mashed
preparation
      Combine all ingredients thoroughly. Mix with preferred carbonated drink (Ginger Ale is best choice). Makes 3 gallons. Use for holiday punch and top with frozen jello mold ring of fruit afloat in punch.

GOLDEN PUNCH DRINK
ingredients
2 (6 oz.)  cans frozen orange juice
2 (6 oz.)  cans frozen lemonade
2 (6 oz.)  cans frozen pineapple juice
3  qt. water
2  qt. ginger ale
1  c. sugar
preparation
      Mix all together and serve over ice.  Serves 30 large glasses.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1  (46 oz.) pineapple juice
1 1/2  c. brandy (if desired)
12  oz. frozen lemonade
12  oz. frozen orange juice
1  qt. 7-Up or ginger ale
preparation
      Mix all the ingredients together.  Be sure it is completely mixed.  Pour into wide mouth gallon jar or pitcher and freeze for at least 24 hours.  Use scoop and put in glasses and pour more 7-Up or ginger ale over and stir slowly.  This is a very refreshing drink for a hot day.  Makes 1 gallon.
      P.S.  When I had a party, I had made some punch the first of the week and froze it.  I used several bottles of the plastic 16-ounce drink bottles to freeze it in.  (I left enough room at the top to cut off.)  I opened the frozen punch and put it in a punch bowl then I had a gallon of cold (not frozen) that I poured over it.  It was very slushy and extra good and I didn't have to use any ice.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 large  cans pineapple juice
1 (8 oz.)  bottle lemon juice
1 large  pkg. cherry Jell-O
3 1/2  c. sugar
14  c. water
preparation
      Bring 4 cups water to a boil and stir in the sugar and Jell-O until all is dissolved.  Divide mixture between 2 one gallon jugs. Divide the 8 ounces of lemon juice in half and pour into jugs. Add 1 can pineapple juice to each gallon.  Add the remaining 10 cups of water, 5 into each jug.  Freeze.  Take out of freezer 4 to 5 hours before serving.  Shake and stir well.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4 1/2  c. water
1  c. sugar
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen limeade or lemonade
1 1/2  c. vodka or gin
preparation
      Bring water and sugar to a boil; cool to tepid.  Add juices and vodka or gin; mix together.  Put in a plastic covered container and freeze.  When serving, put a couple scoops into a glass and cover with ginger ale, half and half or some other mix.

PUNCH SLUSH FOR A BUNCH
ingredients
3  c. water
2  c. sugar
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice, diluted as suggested
3  bananas, pureed in blender
1/4  c. lemon juice
preparation
      Bring water and sugar to boil.  Cool slightly.  Add remaining ingredients.  Mix together and freeze.  Set out one hour before using.  Pour 3 quarts ginger ale over slush.  Do not add ice. Punch should have an icy slush floating on top.  Delicious!
      This punch receives raves from all who taste it.  Our school librarian introduced it to me.

SLUSH PUNCH FOR A CROWD
ingredients
2  c. sugar
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. flavored gelatin (any one)
6  c. boiling water
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
4  bottles (1 liter each) ginger ale, chilled
preparation
      In 6-quart container, combine sugar and gelatin powder.  Add boiling water; stir until dissolved.  Add pineapple juice; mix well.  Pour into plastic containers and freeze at least 24 hours. About an hour before serving time, put out containers to thaw. Empty containers into large punch bowl; break mixture into chunks with wooden spoon.  Add ginger ale; mix to a slushy consistency.

STRAWBERRY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  c. boiling water
2 small  pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
1 small  pkg. strawberry jello
1  qt. ginger ale
2  c. sugar
1  qt. crushed sweet strawberries
1 large  can pineapple juice
preparation
      Dissolve Kool-Aid, jello, and sugar in boiling water.  Add strawberries and pineapple juice.  Cool and freeze in Ziploc bags. About 1/2 hour before serving set out.  At serving time, add ginger ale and chop to mix.  You may use NutraSweet jello and Kool-Aid and leave off sugar for low sugar recipe.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. any-flavor jello
2  c. boiling water
2  c. cold water
2 (48 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
2  c. sugar
1  (2-liter) ginger ale or 7-Up
preparation
      Dissolve jello in boiling water; stir in cold water.  Add juice and sugar.  Stir until all sugar is dissolved.  Pour into ice cream pail and freeze.  Remove from freezer 2 hours before serving.
      Use 1/2 pail per punch bowl.  Add soda to fill rest of bowl. If too sweet, add water.  Makes 2 punch bowls full.  No need to make ice rings as punch will be slushy and will stay cold.

FRUIT PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  can orange juice concentrate
6  bananas
3  c. water
2  (64 oz.) lemon-lime drinks
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (6 oz.)  can lemonade concentrate
2  c. sugar
preparation
      Blend bananas and juice concentrates in blender until smooth. Combine remaining ingredients, except lemon-lime.  Mix well in a large bowl.  Put into containers to freeze (may be placed in 2 containers).  Thaw slightly before serving.  Pour lemon-lime soda over fruit mix.  Should be slushy.  Garnish with orange slices.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 large  can pineapple juice
3  c. sugar
5  c. water
2 small  cans frozen orange juice
1 small  can frozen lemonade
5  very ripe bananas
2 to 3 (2 liter)  bottles 7-Up or ginger ale
preparation
      Heat pineapple juice, sugar and water until sugar is dissolved.  In a blender or with a potato masher, blend frozen orange juice and lemonade and bananas.  Combine the 2 mixtures and freeze in a large bowl or decorative ice ring.  Thaw 1 to 1 1/2 hours (or less if you like).  Place in a large punch bowl and add 7-Up or ginger ale as you like.  Makes 24 to 30 servings.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. strawberry gelatin
1  c. sugar
2  c. boiling water
1 large  can pineapple juice
16  oz. lemon-lime soda
preparation
      Mix gelatin, sugar and boiling water together until dissolved. Add pineapple juice, then enough water to make 1 gallon.  Freeze overnight.  Just before serving, put in punch bowl and add lemon-lime soda.  Stir until slushy.

PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
6  c. water
5  bananas
2 small  cans frozen lemonade
2 small  cans orange juice
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
6  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Put bananas in blender.  Bring sugar and water to boil and boil for 5 minutes.  Cool.  Add to juices and bananas.  Put into 6 (1 quart) containers.  Freeze.
      Before serving time, take from freezer and let thaw for a short time.  Add 1 quart ginger ale to each portion and stir until slushy.  Serves 50 to 60.

BANANA PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
6  c. water
2  c. sugar
46  oz. can of pineapple juice
12  oz. can of frozen orange juice
12  oz. can of frozen lemonade
2 (12 oz.)  cans of water
5  mashed bananas
2 liter  bottle of ginger ale
preparation
      Boil sugar and 6 cups of water and cool. Add orange juice, lemonade, pineapple juice, water and bananas. Freeze. Take out frozen mixture 3-4 hours before serving to make it slushy. Add ginger ale before serving.

SLUSH PUNCH
(Serves 50 People, 8 Ounce Cups)  
ingredients
3 (3 oz.)  pkg. Jell-O (any color)
3  c. sugar
3  qt. hot water
1 1/2  c. plus 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
1  (46 oz.) pineapple juice
2  qt. cold water
2  qt. 7-Up, Sprite, sparkle water or ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O and sugar in hot water.  Add lemon juice, pineapple juice and cold water.  Then freeze overnight or 6 to 12 hours.  Remove, shake and add 7-Up or one of the others. Delicious.  Great for weddings or showers, just any time.  Freeze in punch bowl.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 small  pkg. Jell-O (any color)
9  c. boiling water
4  c. sugar
4  c. warm water
1 (16 oz.)  bottle ReaLemon juice
2 (40 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
2 (2 liter)  bottles 7-Up or Sprite
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in bowl with boiling water.  Mix warm water and sugar together.  Bring to a boil.  Add dissolved Jell-O to the sugar and water mixture.  Let cool.  Add lemon and pineapple juice to jello mixture.  Mix well.  Put in 2 large containers.  Freeze. When ready to use, remove from freezer 4 to 5 hours ahead of time so it may thaw.  When it gets slushy, pour 7-Up over it and enjoy. Makes 2 large punch bowls.

ALMOND TEA PUNCH
ingredients
1  can frozen lemonade
1  pt. sugar (2 c.)
1  qt. water (4 c.)
1  c. strong tea (1 tea bag)
1  tsp. vanilla extract
1  tsp. almond extract
1  bottle ginger ale (1 qt.)
  coloring to suit occasion
preparation
      Make a simple syrup of sugar and water.  Mix all ingredients together. Chill.  Add chilled ginger ale just before serving. Makes 1 gallon.
      Praising God in less than good situations is the shortest route to answered prayer.     Proverbs 14:26

FROZEN PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
1  large frozen orange juice
1  large frozen lemonade
1  can unsweetened pineapple juice
1  c. sugar, dissolved in warm water
preparation
	Mix and  freeze  items.  Add ginger ale, Sprite or 7-Up to partially thawed mixture when ready to serve.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
1  c. sugar
1  qt. water
1 large  can pineapple juice
6  bananas
preparation
      Mix Kool-Aid, sugar, water and pineapple juice.  Puree bananas in blender and add to Kool-Aid mixture.  Freeze in large container for 2 days or until ready to use.  Thaw for 3 to 4 hours; stir to slush.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  c. sugar
3  c. cold water
1 large  can pineapple juice
1/2  oz. almond extract
1  pkg. Kool-Aid or Jell-O
3  c. hot water
1 small  can frozen lemonade
1 to 2  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve sugar in 2 cups hot water.  Dissolve Kool-Aid or Jell-O in 1 cup hot water.  Add remaining ingredients, except ginger ale.  Freeze.  Thaw to a slush before serving and add ginger ale.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
12  oz. frozen orange juice, diluted as directed
12  oz. frozen pineapple juice, diluted as directed
5  bananas
1  c. lemon juice
6  c. water
4  c. sugar
  grapefruit soda
preparation
      In a blender, mix 5 bananas and lemon juice.  Add orange juice and pineapple juice.  Last add water and sugar.  Freeze in a plastic container.  Add grapefruit soda when ready to serve.

TEA BAG SLUSH
ingredients
4  tea bags
2  c. sugar
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1/5  gin
preparation
      Boil tea bags in 2 cups water and cool.  Boil sugar in 7 cups water and cool.  Mix all together and freeze.  Makes 1 gallon. Serve in glass with 1/2 slush mixture and 1/2 Team or 7-Up.

PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
2  pkg. Kool-Aid *
3 small  pkg. Jell-O *
8  c. boiling water
6  c. sugar
16  oz. bottle ReaLemon
1 large  can pineapple juice
1  gal. cold water
preparation
      *Choose Kool-Aid and Jell-O color according to color theme.
      Blend first 3 ingredients together.  Add remaining ingredients.  Freeze until solid or partially slushy.  When thawed to adequate slush property, add 4 liters 7-Up to serve.  Makes 3 gallons.

BANANA SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  c. water
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
1 (48 oz.)  can pineapple juice
4  c. sugar
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
5  ripe bananas, mashed
preparation
      Bring water and sugar to a boil; cool.  Combine with remaining ingredients.  Divide into quart freezer containers and freeze overnight or a month.
      Remove from freezer 3 hours before serving time.  Add 1 quart of ginger ale for each quart of punch.  Punch is best served slushy, not liquid.  Perfect for weddings or golden anniversaries.

AFTERNOON TEA PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. (1 qt.) boiling water
6  tea bags
1  Tbsp. dried mint
1/2 to 2/3  c. sugar
1  small frozen orange juice
1  small frozen lemonade
preparation
      Pour boiling water over tea bags and mint and let steep for 10 minutes, strain.  Stir in sugar until it melts, add frozen juice and water to taste.  Serve with fresh sprig of mint.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 1/2  c. sugar
6  c. water
2 - 3  oz. pkg. mixed fruit flavored gelatin
1 - 46  oz. can pineapple juice
1  quart orange juice
2/3  c. lemon juice
2 - 28  oz. bottles ginger-ale, chilled
preparation
      Combine sugar and water in large saucepan.  Bring to boil. Simmer three minutes.  Stir in jello and juices.  Ladle into wide topped freezer containers.  Leave 1 inch head space.  Cover tightly and freeze.
      To serve - Partially thaw juice blocks at room temperature about 5 hours.  Place in punch bowl.  Stir with fork to break up ice chunks.  Add ginger-ale.  Serves 25.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 small  pkg. jello (flavor determines color of punch)
9  c. water
4  c. sugar
8  c. water
16  oz. lemon juice
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
6  large ginger ale or 7-Up
preparation
      Dissolve jello in boiling water.  Cool.  Combine sugar and water.  Bring to quick boil to dissolve sugar.  Remove from fire and cool.  Combine dissolved jello and sugar water.  Add lemon juice and pineapple juice; put into container and freeze.  Best made 2 days before using.  Remove from container into punch bowl; add ginger ale and break up frozen punch.  Take from freezer 2 to 3 hours before serving.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 large  pkg. jello
4  c. sugar
2  c. ReaLemon juice
4  c. boiling water
9  c. cold water
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
preparation
      Mix and freeze.  Take out 3 to 4 hours ahead.  When soft, stir in 2 large ginger ale.

ORANGE SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  c. sugar
4  mashed bananas
2 (12 oz.)  cans frozen orange juice, thawed and undiluted
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (67.6 oz.)  bottle lemon-lime carbonated beverage, chilled
6  c. water
1/2  c. lemon juice
preparation
      Combine sugar and water in Dutch oven; cook over high heat until sugar is dissolved.  Let cool.  Add bananas, lemon juice, orange juice and pineapple juice.  Freeze until firm.  Remove from freezer 2 hours before serving.  Break frozen mixture into large pieces; put in punch bowl.  Pour soda over and stir gently.  Makes 6 1/2 quarts.

REFRESHING PUNCH SLUSH
ingredients
8 small  pkg. Jell-O (any flavor)
16  c. boiling water
6  c. sugar
8  c. cold water
3 (12 oz.)  cans frozen lemonade
4 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
4  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O and sugar in boiling water.  Add cold water and juices.  Place in clean milk cartons or plastic soft drink bottles, leaving room for expansion when frozen.   Place in freezer for at least 8 hours.
      To serve, cut away the container from the block of punch.  Add ginger ale and break up to form slushy mixture.  Add ginger ale or frozen punch as necessary to replenish punch bowl.  Serves 100. Lemon, lime or strawberry Jell-O works well in this recipe. Choose a flavor to compliment the color scheme of your event.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2  pkg Kool-Aid
1 lg.  can unsweetened pineapple juice
preparation
      Mix Kool-Aid (any flavor) according to package directions. Stir in juice and place in freezer.  Stir 1 time each hour for 6 hours.  Delicious!

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice
3  pkg. raspberry Kool-Aid
2  c. sugar
4  c. water
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Combine all ingredients except ginger ale.  Freeze to slush. Add ginger ale just before serving.  Yields 15 to 18 servings.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. jello (any flavor)
1 large  can pineapple juice
5  c. water
1  c. sugar
1  qt. 7-Up
preparation
      Prepare jello as package directs.  Add pineapple juice, water and sugar.  Pour into container and place in freezer overnight. When ready to use, put slush into punch bowl.  Add 7-Up or ginger ale.  Stir slightly before serving.  Yields 150 ounces.

STRAWBERRY SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
4 (3 oz.)  pkg. strawberry gelatin
4  c. boiling water
4  c. sugar (I used about 3 c.)
4  c. cold water
2  c. lemon juice
2 (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
2  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in 4 cups boiling water.  Combine sugar and 4 cups cold water.  Bring to a boil until sugar dissolves.  Add to gelatin and cool.  When cool, add lemon and pineapple juices.  Mix well.  Pour into containers suitable for freezing.  Freeze.  Take out several hours before time to use.  (Should be slushy.)  Add ginger ale before serving.
      I adjust the amount of ginger ale according to the amount in the freezer container that is being used.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
6  pkg. strawberry, unsweetened Kool-Aid
2 large  cans unsweetened pineapple juice
2 large  cans warm water
6  c. sugar
preparation
      Mix and freeze.  When ready to serve, add one 2-liter bottle ginger ale.  Mix until slush.

FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
2 1/2  qt. water
3 (6 oz.)  cans frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed and undiluted
2 (46 oz.)  cans unsweetened pineapple juice
2 (14 oz.)  envelopes cherry or lemon-lime flavored unsweetened drink mix
8 (10 oz.)  bottles ginger ale
preparation
      Combine all ingredients except ginger ale.  Stir until drink mix dissolves.  Divide mixture evenly into 4 gallon size, heavy-duty zip-top plastic bags; freeze.  Remove each bag 1 hour before serving.  Place in punch bowl and break into chunks.  Add 2 bottles ginger ale into each bag of mixture.  Stir until slushy. Yield:  2 1/2 gallons or 2 1/2 quarts per bag of mixture.

LEMON-LIME SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3  pkg. lime jello
4  c. sugar
7  c. water and 6 c. water
1 (16 oz.)  bottle ReaLemon juice
2 large (46 oz.)  cans pineapple juice
preparation
      Mix the lime jello and sugar and dissolve with 7 cups of water, then add 6 more cups of water.  After mixing well, add the ReaLemon juice and pineapple juice.  Pour mixture into several containers to freeze solid.  To serve, thaw to slush by adding 2 or 3 bottles of ginger ale.

SLUSH PUNCH
ingredients
3 small  pkg. strawberry Jell-O
2  c. sugar
46  oz. boiling water
46  oz. pineapple juice
46  oz. cold water
2 (2 liter)  bottles 7-Up or ginger ale
preparation
      Mix Jell-O, sugar and boiling water.  Add juices and cold water.  Put into small containers.  Freeze.  Unthaw a bit and put in with pop in punch bowl.

PEACHY DESSERT SAUCE
ingredients
1  tsp. cornstarch
1/4  c. water
2  Tbsp. apricot jam or preserves
1/2  tsp. lemon juice
1 1/2  tsp. sugar
3/4  c. sliced fresh or canned peaches
  vanilla ice cream
preparation
      In small saucepan, mix cornstarch and water.  Add the jam, lemon juice and sugar.  Bring to a boil.  Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes; reduce heat.  Add peaches and heat through.  Serve warm over ice cream.  Yield:  3/4 cup.

FRUIT AND CHEESE DESSERT
ingredients
2  sticks butter, softened
2  c. flour
2  Tbsp. sugar
8  oz. Cool Whip
2 (21 oz.)  cans favorite pie filling
8  oz. cream cheese
3/4  c. powdered sugar
preparation
      Mix and press onto sided cookie sheet the butter, flour and sugar. Bake 20 minutes at 350°.  Cool.
      Beat cream cheese and powdered sugar. Fold in Cool Whip. Spread on cooled crust. Top with pie filling. Refrigerate.

CHOCOLATE LAYER DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. flour
1  stick butter
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1  large tub Cool Whip
1  c. powdered sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
1 large  box chocolate pudding
preparation
      Melt butter in 8 x 13 casserole dish.  Add flour and mix to form a crust on the bottom of dish.  Bake at 400° for 10 minutes until light brown.  Cool.  Mix together cream cheese, 1/2 of Cool Whip and powdered sugar.  Spread on top of crust.  Prepare pudding according to package directions and layer on top of cream cheese mixture.  Top pudding layer with rest of Cool Whip.  Refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight.

FOUR LAYER DESSERT
ingredients
1  stick margarine
1  c. chopped nuts
1  c. flour
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  c. confectioner sugar
1  c. Cool Whip for layer, more to top whole dessert
1  box vanilla instant pudding
1  box chocolate instant pudding
  Enough milk to make puddings
preparation
      Melt 1 stick margarine, mix with nuts and flour.  Put evenly in pan and bake.  Let cool.
      Layer 1:  Mix cream cheese, confectioner sugar, Cool Whip together and spread on top of cooled crust.
      Layer 2:  Vanilla instant pudding as directed on package.
      Layer 3:  Chocolate instant pudding as directed on package.
      Layer 4:  Top with more cool whip.

HEATH BAR DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. Ritz crackers (crushed)
1  stick margarine
1  tsp. sugar
2 small  boxes French vanilla instant pudding
2  c. milk
1  qt. vanilla ice cream
preparation
      Spread on top of crumbs mixture.  Refrigerate 1/2 hour.  Top with 8 ounce Cool Whip.  Sprinkle frozen Heath bars on top.

REFRIGERATOR DESSERT
ingredients
2  sleeves graham crackers
1  pkg. vanilla pudding (Not Instant)
1  pkg. chocolate pudding (Not Instant)
  Cool Whip
preparation
      Prepare puddings according to package directions.  Line graham crackers on bottom and sides of square pan.  Pour vanilla pudding on graham crackers and smooth out, put another layer of graham crackers and top this with the chocolate pudding then top with Cool Whip.  Keep refrigerated.  Enjoy!

APPLE ENCHILADA DESSERT
ingredients
1 (21 oz.)  can apple pie filling
6  (8-inch) flour tortillas
1  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/3  c. margarine
1/2  c. white sugar
1/2  c. packed brown sugar
1/2  c. water
preparation
	Preheat oven 350°. Spoon fruit evenly onto all tortillas, sprinkle with cinnamon. Roll up tortillas and place seam side down on lightly greased baking pan. Bring margarine, sugars, and water to boil in a medium saucepan. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring constantly for about 3 minutes. Pour sauce evenly over tortillas, sprinkle with extra cinnamon on top if desired. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.

CREAM PUFF DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. water
1/2  c. margarine
1  c. flour
5  eggs
1 large  box instant vanilla pudding
1/2  tsp. almond flavoring
8  oz. cream cheese
8  oz. Cool Whip
preparation
      Bring water and margarine to boil and then add flour. Add eggs, one at a time. Spread on a greased jelly roll pan. Bake at 425° for 20 minutes. Push down lightly with fingers. Cool. Prepare vanilla pudding. Add almond flavoring and cream cheese. Spread on cool crust. Top with Cool Whip. Drizzle with chocolate syrup. Cool and serve.

DESSERT - ORANGE STUFF
ingredients
2 small  pkg. tapioca
2 small  pkg. instant vanilla pudding
2 small  pkg. orange Jell-O
4  c. water
4 small  cans Mandarin oranges
16  oz. Cool Whip
preparation
      Boil the 4 cups water. Add tapioca, instant pudding mix and orange Jell-O. Let cool. Add Cool Whip together with mixer, then add Mandarin oranges (drained) to mixture. Refrigerate.

BLUEBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1/4  cup butter
1 1/2  cup sugar
20  graham crackers
3  eggs
1  package (8 oz) Philadelphia cream cheese
1  tsp. vanilla
1  qt. Blueberries
3  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  Tbsp. corn starch
  whipping cream
preparation
      Combine butter, 1/2 cup sugar with 20 graham crackers. Press into 9x13 pyrex pan. Beat eggs with cream cheese. Add 1/2 cup sugar and vanilla. Spread over graham crackers. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes then cool. Mix Blueberries, lemon juice, 1/2 cup sugar, and corn starch. Thicken as for pie. Pour over crust. Let stand 5 hours in refrigerator. Top with whipping cream.
      Note: Can use 2 Tbsp. of cornstarch for frozen Blueberries.

ICE CREAM SANDWICH DESSERT
ingredients
19  ice cream sandwiches
1  carton (12 oz.) frozen whipped topping, thawed
1  jar (11 3/4 oz.) hot fudge ice cream topping
1  c. salted peanuts
preparation
      Cut one ice cream sandwich in half.  Place one whole and one half sandwich along a short side of an ungreased 13 x 9 x 2 pan. Arrange 8 sandwiches in opposite direction in the pan.  Spread with half of the whipped topping.  Spoon fudge topping by teaspoonfuls onto whipped topping.  Sprinkle with 1/2 c. peanuts.  Repeat layers with remaining ice cream sandwiches, whipped topping and peanuts (pan will be full).  Cover and freeze for up to 2 months.  Remove from the freezer 20 minutes before serving, cut in squares.  Makes 12 - 15 servings.

ORANGE DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. cottage cheese (24 oz.)
1  pkg. Cool Whip (8 oz.)
1  can Mandarin oranges, drained (11 oz.)
1  can pineapple chunks, drained (1 lb. 4 oz.)
1 large size  pkg. orange jello (dry)
preparation
      Drain Mandarin oranges and pineapple well.  Save juice for another use.  Mix all ingredients together and chill.  Very good!

RHUBARB DESSERT #1
ingredients
1 1/2  c. flour
3/4  c. margarine
1  c. oatmeal
1  c. brown sugar
3  c. rhubarb
1 1/2  c. sugar
5  Tbsp. flour
1  pkg. (3 oz.) dry strawberry Jell-O
preparation
      Mix 1 1/2 cup flour, margarine, oatmeal and brown sugar.  Pat 1/2 of this in 9 x 13 pan.  Cook rhubarb, sugar and 5 Tbsp. flour. Put this over the above ingredients.  Put strawberry Jell-O powder over next.  Then put rest of crumbs on top.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.

GREEN DESSERT
ingredients
1 20  oz. can crushed pineapple
1/2  c. sugar
1  small lime jello
2  sticks celery, chopped
1/2  c. nuts
1  pouch dream whip
8  oz. pkg. cream cheese
preparation
      Mix pineapple and sugar.  Bring to hard boil.  Add jello. Cool for 20 minutes.  Whip dream whip.  Add dream whip, celery, nuts and cream cheese to jello mixture.  Cool.

FROZEN DESSERT
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
10  oz. pkg. frozen strawberries, thawed
1 large  can crushed pineapple, drained
2  bananas, sliced
3/4  c. sugar
1  large Cool Whip
1  c. chopped pecans (optional)
preparation
      Mix  cream  cheese,  sugar  and Cool Whip.  Add rest of ingredients.  Freeze.  Thaw about 15 minutes before serving.

ZUCCHINI DESSERT
ingredients
4  c flour
1-1/2  c sugar
3  sticks margarine, softened
2  tbsp water
preparation
      Mix crust until crumbly. Press half of mixture into 9x13 pan. Bake at 350° for 5-10 minutes.  Let cool.  Spread zucchini filling mixture (recipe to follow) over crust. Crumble other half over top.  Bake at 350° for 50 minutes.
Zucchini Filling:
ingredients
8  c zucchini (peeled and seeded), sliced or diced
2/3  c lemon juice
1  c sugar
2  tsp cinnamon
preparation
      Mix ingredients together and cook over medium heat about 50 minutes.  Let cool.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

BANANA SPLIT DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. graham cracker crumbs
2  Tbsp. sugar
1  stick butter or margarine
16  oz. cream cheese
1 (16 oz.)  box powdered sugar
1 (15 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
5  bananas, sliced
1/2  c. chopped pecans
  chocolate syrup
  maraschino cherries
preparation
      Combine crumbs, sugar and butter or margarine; press into 9 x 13-inch pan. Beat cream cheese until soft and fluffy. Add powdered sugar.  Spread over crust. Layer crushed pineapple and sliced bananas. Top with Cool Whip. Sprinkle with chopped nuts. Refrigerate 24 hours. Dribble chocolate syrup over dessert and top with cherries.
       To serve, cut into squares. Serves approximately 10 to 12.
      Cal-540.6, CHO-74.5, Pro-5.2, Fat-26.6.

RASPBERRY ICEBOX DESSERT
ingredients
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. raspberry gelatin
2  c. boiling water
3  c. raspberries (fresh or frozen)
2  c. graham cracker crumbs (about 32 squares)
1/4  c. brown sugar, packed
1/2  c. margarine, melted
1 1/2  c. cold milk
1 (3.4 oz.)  pkg. instant vanilla pudding mix
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
preparation
	In a bowl, combine gelatin and water.  Stir until gelatin is dissolved.	Fold in raspberries.  Refrigerate for 1 hour or until syrupy.  In a small bowl, combine the cracker crumbs, brown sugar and butter.  Press into a greased 9 x 13-inch dish.  In a mixing bowl, beat the milk and pudding mix on low speed for 2 minutes.  In another bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth.  Gradually add the pudding mixture.  Layer over crust.  Spoon gelatin mixture over the top.  Chill until set.  Refrigerate leftovers.
	 For shortcut, use a ready made 9-inch graham cracker shell.

PUNCH BOWL DESSERT
ingredients
1  chocolate cake mix.
1  chocolate instant pudding, (4 serving)
2  c. milk
1  large cool whip
2  large butterfinger candy bars
preparation
      Bake cake and cool. Crumble 1/2 of cake in punch bowl. Mix pudding with milk. Pour 1/2 of pudding over 1/2 of cake. add 1/2 of cool whip. Repeat layers and top with 2 large butterfinger candy bars that have been crushed.

BUTTERFINGER DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. crushed soda crackers
2  c. crushed graham crackers
1/2  c. melted butter or oleo
2  pkg. instant vanilla pudding
2  c. milk
1  qt. vanilla ice cream, softened
8  oz. Cool Whip
2  Butterfinger candy bars
preparation
      Mix the first 3 ingredients together and press into 9 x 13 pan, saving 1/2 cup for topping.
      Mix the pudding with the milk. Add the ice cream; spread over crumb mixture. Top with the Cool Whip. Crush the candy bars and mix with reserved crumbs. Put over Cool Whip. Refrigerate. (Also good as a frozen dessert.)
      Variation: Use 1 quart butter brickle ice cream and crushed Heath candy bars.

PUMPKIN DESSERT
ingredients
2 (15 oz.)  cans solid packed pumpkin
1 (12 oz.)  can evaporated milk
1 (18 1/4 oz.)  box yellow cake mix
1  c. sugar
3  eggs
2  tsp. vanilla
1 1/2  c. chopped pecans
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1  c. margarine, melted
1  c. confectioners sugar
1  (12 oz.) Cool Whip, thawed
preparation
      Line a 13 x 9 baking pan with waxed paper and spray with Pam. Set aside.
      In a mixing bowl, combine pumpkin, milk and sugar. Beat in eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Pour into prepared pan. Sprinkle with dry cake mix and drizzle with melted butter. Sprinkle with pecans. Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until golden brown. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Invert onto large platter. Carefully remove waxed paper.
       In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla until smooth. Fold in Cool Whip. Spread on top of dessert. Keep refrigerated.

DIRT DESSERT
ingredients
8  oz. cream cheese, softened
3  c. milk
2  small pkgs. vanilla instant pudding
12  oz. Cool Whip
5  bananas, sliced
1 (20 oz.)  pkg. Doublestuff Oreo cookies
preparation
      Crumble Oreo cookies in blender or processor.  Soften cream cheese and beat.  Add 3 cups milk.  Add pudding and beat again. Fold in Cool Whip.  Layer pudding, bananas, and dirt (Oreos) in an 8 1/2 inch plastic flower pot (without a hole in the bottom). Repeat layers 3 times.  End with dirt (Oreos) on top.  Chill in refrigerator or harden in FREEZER!  A layer of ice cream may be added if desired.
      Served with garden trowel and a stem (bunch) of colorful artificial silk flowers in the middle of it.  Use the trowel as the serving dipper.  This dessert is also nicely done in a trifle dish.

BROWNIE DESSERT
ingredients
1  box brownie mix
7  large Heath bars, crushed (crushes best when bars are frozen)
1  large Cool Whip
preparation
      Bake brownies as directed on box.  When cooled, break up brownie mix and layer portion in bottom of bowl (should have 2 or 3 layers).  Spread with layer of Cool Whip.  Sprinkle with layer of crushed Heath bars.  Do this at least twice, ending with Cool Whip and crushed Heath bars.

BANANA DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. flour
1/2  c. butter, softened
8  oz. softened cream cheese
1  c. powdered sugar
16  oz. Cool Whip, thawed
4  bananas
6  oz. vanilla instant pudding mix
3  c. milk
preparation
      Heat oven to 375°. In medium bowl, combine flour and butter. Spread on bottom of 9 x 13 pan. Bake 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool.
      In small bowl, beat cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth. Fold in half of Cool Whip. Spread over crust. Slice bananas and arrange cream cheese mixture.
       In medium bowl, prepare pudding as desired, using 3 cups of milk. Pour over bananas. Spread remaining Cool Whip over pudding. Refrigerate. Makes 16 servings.

FROSTY STRAWBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. flour
1/4  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. nuts, chopped
1/2  c. butter
2  egg whites
2/3  c. sugar
10  oz. frozen strawberries, partially thawed
2  Tbsp. ReaLemon juice
1  c. whipped cream
preparation
      Mix the first 4 ingredients and spread in 9 x 13 pan evenly. Bake for 20 minutes. Stir occasionally while baking. Remove half for the top; leave the rest in the bottom of the pan.
       Whip the egg whites. Add the sugar, strawberries and lemon juice. Mix and beat for 10 minutes until stiff peaks. Fold in the whipped cream and spread over the crumbs in 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle the remaining crumb mixture on top of the strawberry mixture. SERVE FROZEN!!!

RUTH'S STRAWBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1  box frozen strawberries, thawed
2  tsp. lemon juice
3/4  c. sugar
3  egg whites
1  pkg. Keebler sandy pecan cookies
1  large container Cool Whip
preparation
      Put together thawed strawberries, lemon juice, sugar and egg whites in mixing bowl and beat with electric mixer for 20 minutes, no longer than that.  While this is being done, crush one package of Keebler sandy pecan cookies.  Reserve some to sprinkle on top of dessert.  Put remaining in 9 x 13-inch pan. When mixture has been mixed for 20 minutes, fold in thoroughly one large container of Cool Whip.  Spread over crushed cookies in pan and sprinkle reserved crushed cookies on top.  Place in freezer.  This can be made a week ahead and is just fine.

MANDARIN ORANGE DESSERT
ingredients
4 serving  pkg. vanilla instant pudding
2  c. buttermilk
12  oz. bowl Cool Whip
2  cans Mandarin oranges, drained
1  pkg. Fudge Stripe cookies, broken into small pieces
preparation
      Mix pudding and buttermilk. Add oranges and cookies. Stir in Cool Whip. Refrigerate.

ICE CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
1  stick margarine
2 1/2  c. Rice Krispies
3/4  c. brown sugar
1  c. nuts
preparation
      Melt margarine in small saucepan.  Pour melted margarine over Rice Krispies, brown sugar and nuts in 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 300° for 1/2 hour, stirring occasionally.  Let cool.  Save 2/3 cup for topping.
      Pour softened ice cream over mixture.  Sprinkle Rice Krispies mixture over the top.  Freeze.

STRAWBERRY PRETZEL DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. crushed pretzels
3/4  c. butter, melted
2  Tbsp. sugar
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1  c. sugar
1  (12 oz.) container Cool Whip
1 (8 serving size)  pkg. Jell-O strawberry flavor gelatin
2  c. boiling water
1 (24 oz.)  pkg. frozen sliced strawberries with sugar
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°. Stir together pretzels, melted butter and 2 tablespoons sugar. Press into bottom of 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool completely.
      In large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and 1 cup sugar with electric mixer on medium speed until fluffy. Fold in dessert topping. Spread cream cheese mixture over cooled crust.
      In bowl, dissolve gelatin in the boiling water. Stir in frozen strawberries. Chill until gelatin mixture is slightly thickened. Spoon gelatin mixture over cream cheese layer. Chill at least 4 hours. Serves 16 to 20.

CHOCOLATE AMBROSIA DESSERT
ingredients
2 (1 oz.)  sq. unsweetened chocolate
1/3  c. milk
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, cubed
1  tsp. vanilla
2  c. powdered sugar
1 1/2  c. orange sections
1/4  c. coconut
6  slices of pound cake, 1/2 inch thick
preparation
      Melt chocolate with milk over low heat, stirring until smooth. Add cream cheese; stir until melted. Stir in vanilla. Gradually add sugar, mixing until well blended. Combine oranges and coconut; toss lightly. For each serving, cover one cake slice with 1/4 c. orange mixture; top with 2 Tbsp. sauce. To reheat, spoon sauce into saucepan; stir over low heat until thoroughly heated. Makes 6 servings.

COUNTRY APPLE DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. yellow cake mix
1/3  c. butter, softened
1  egg
20  oz. can apple pie filling
1/2  c. brown sugar, packed
1/2  c. chopped walnuts
1  tsp. cinnamon
1  egg
1  c. dairy sour cream
preparation
      Heat oven to 350°. In large bowl, combine cake mix, butter and 1 egg at low speed until crumbly. Press into 9 x 13-inch pan. Spread with pie filling. Combine brown sugar, nuts and cinnamon. Sprinkle over apples.
       In small bowl, blend sour cream, egg and vanilla. Pour over sugar mixture. Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes or until sides are golden brown. Serve warm or cool. Refrigerate any leftovers.

SUGAR-FREE DESSERT
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. raspberry Jell-O (sugar-free)
1  c. hot water
  applesauce (sugar-free)
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in hot water.  Add 1 cup of sugar-free applesauce.  Enjoy.

DESSERT DELIGHT
ingredients
1  cup flour
1  stick oleo
2  Tbsp. sugar
1/2  cup nuts, chopped fine
8  ounce cream cheese
1  cup powdered sugar
1  large container of cool whip
2  boxes instant pudding, any flavor
3  cups milk
preparation
      Melt oleo, add flour, sugar, and nuts.  Press into the bottom of a 9 by 13 inch pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.  Cool. In a mixing bowl, combine cream cheese, powdered sugar, and 1/2 the container of cool whip.  Spread this on the cooled crust.
      Mix pudding and milk, and spread on cream cheese mixture.  Top with remaining cool whip.

QUICK BANANA DESSERT
(Lo-Fat, Lo-Cal)  
ingredients
1 1/2  c. cold fat-free milk
1 (3.4 oz.)  pkg. instant vanilla pudding (sugar-free)
1 (8 oz.)  carton whipped topping (reduced fat)
18  cinnamon graham cracker squares
2  large firm bananas, sliced
preparation
      In a bowl, whisk or beat milk and pudding mix for 2 minutes, until soft set. Fold in half of the whipped topping. Place 9 graham cracker squares in an ungreased baking dish. Top with half of the pudding mixture, then half of the sliced bananas. Then put another layer of crackers, pudding mixture and sliced bananas. Top with remaining whipped topping. Let set, covered, in the refrigerator for at least an hour before serving.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

PISTACHIO DESSERT
ingredients
60  Ritz crackers, crushed
1/2  c. butter, melted
2  pkg. (3 oz. each) pistachio pudding
1 1/2  c. cold milk
1  qt. vanilla ice cream
  whipped topping
1  c. toasted coconut
preparation
  Mix crackers and butter together in bottom of 9 x 13 pan and bake at 350° for 15 minutes.  Combine pudding mix, milk and ice cream. Pour over the warm cracker mixture.  Add a layer of whipped topping and sprinkle with toasted coconut.  Chill and serve.

FROZEN CHOCOLATE DESSERT
ingredients
24  oreo cookies
1  stick margarine, melted
1/2  gal. vanilla ice cream, softened
1  container (8 oz.) Cool Whip
1  Baker's German sweet chocolate bar
2/3  c. sugar
2/3  c. evaporated milk
1/8  tsp. salt
1  stick margarine
preparation
      Crush cookies in blender or food processor.  Reserve some cookie crumbs for garnish.  Put remaining crumbs in 9 x 13 pan and drizzle with melted margarine.  Let set in freezer.  Cover with softened ice cream.  Freeze.
      Bring to boil the chocolate bar, sugar, evaporated milk, salt, and margarine.  Boil for 4-5 minutes stirring constantly.  Cool. Spread on ice cream.  Let set in freezer.  Top with cool whip. Sprinkle with a few more cookie crumbs.  Freeze.
      Before serving, let dessert set out for a few minutes so it is easier to cut.

PINEAPPLE VANILLA DESSERT
ingredients
2  cups graham cracker crumbs
1/4  c. sugar
1/2  c. butter, melted
1- 8  oz. Package of cream cheese
1/2  c. sugar
1  c. Cool Whip (take out of 16 oz. container used below)
5.25  oz. pkg. of vanilla instant pudding
2 1/2  c. half and half
1 regular size  can of crusted pineapple (drained well)
1 16  oz. cool whip
preparation
      Spread on top of pudding.  Garnish with almonds and maraschino cherries.

FRUIT DESSERT SQUARES
ingredients
1 (18 oz.)  pkg. refrigerated sugar cookie dough
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/3  c. sugar
  assorted fruits (strawberries, blueberries, kiwi slices, seedless grapes, mandarin oranges, banana slices, etc.)
1/2  c. apricot or peach preserves or orange marmalade
2  Tbsp. water
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°. Cut cookie dough into 1/8-inch thick slices. Arrange cookie slices, slightly overlapping, into 14 x 10-inch rectangle on lightly greased foil-lined baking sheet. Press slices together lightly with fingers to form crust. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely. Carefully remove foil.
      In medium bowl, combine cream cheese and sugar; mix until blended. Spread onto cookie crust. Arrange fruit on cream cheese mixture.
      In small bowl, combine preserves and water; brush over fruit. Refrigerate until chilled, 2 to 3 hours. Cut into squares. Yield: 10 to 12 servings.

OREO DIRT DESSERT
ingredients
1 large  pkg. instant vanilla pudding mix
3  c. milk
1  pkg. Oreo cookies
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  (8 oz.) container Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix together and chill, milk and pudding mix. Separate the filling of the cookies. Crush the cookies and set aside. Mix together chilled pudding, cookie middles, cream cheese and Cool Whip. Starting with cookie crumbs, layer in a 9 x 13 pan. Chill and serve.

BUTTERFINGER DESSERT
ingredients
4  egg yolks
2  c. powdered sugar
1/2  c. melted butter
1 large  carton Cool Whip
6  Butterfinger candy bars
  angel food cake
preparation
      Beat together egg yolks, powdered sugar and melted butter. Add Cool Whip. Crush the candy bars; save 1/2 for the top. Break angel food cake into pieces and line bottom of a 9 x 13-inch cake pan. Pour mixture on top of cake; sprinkle with remaining candy.

YUMMY DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. self-rising flour
1  c. chopped pecans
1  c. powdered sugar
1  pkg. instant chocolate pudding
1  stick butter
1 large  pkg. cream cheese
1  large Cool Whip
1  pkg. vanilla instant pudding
preparation
      Mix flour and butter with pastry cutter. Add nuts. Pat into bottom of a 9 x 13 baking dish. Bake in 350° oven 20 minutes. "Cool."
      Cream the cream cheese and sugar. Add 1 cup of whipped topping. Spread over the crust.
      Mix together vanilla and chocolate pudding. Add package direction amount of milk. Mix until smooth. Pour over second layer. Top with remaining topping. Let set, covered, in the refrigerator at least 4 hours.

CAROLYN'S STRAWBERRY CRUNCH DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. flour
1/4  c. packed brown sugar
1/2  c. chopped nuts or more
1  tsp. cinnamon
1/2  c. melted butter
1  c. sugar
2  egg whites (at room temperature)
1 (10 oz.)  box frozen strawberries, thawed (I use 16 oz.)
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
8  oz. dish Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix the first 4 dry ingredients; stir into melted butter until well blended.  Bake on large cookie sheet set at 350° for 20 minutes.  Stir OFTEN.  Mixture should be crumbly.  Cool.  Can be made ahead and stored in a tightly covered jar until needed.
      In a large mixing bowl, beat the egg whites until foaming. Gradually add sugar, beating until very thick.  Add strawberries and lemon juice.  Beat until very light and fluffy. Add Cool Whip. In a 9 x 13-inch baking dish, place one half of the crumb mixture, then the strawberry mixture and then the other half of the crumbs; scatter evenly over the top.  Freeze 8 hours or more. It keeps very well.  Have FUN!!!

BLUEBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1 large  can crushed pineapple, with juice
3  c. fresh blueberries
3/4  c. sugar
1  box yellow cake mix, dry
1/4  lb. melted margarine or butter, drizzle on
1  c. chopped pecans
1/4  c. sugar
preparation
      Grease 9 X 13 pan.  Layer as listed.  After all layers have finished, bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees for 35 to 40 minutes.

FLUFFY PECAN DESSERT
ingredients
3  egg whites
1  c. sugar
1  tsp. baking powder
  dash of salt
1  tsp. vanilla
1  c. chopped pecans
1  c. crushed Corn Chex
  whipped cream
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°. Beat whites until soft peaks form. Add sugar, baking powder and salt. Beat until sugar is dissolved and meringue is stiff. Stir in vanilla, pecans and cereal crumbs. Spread filling evenly on greased 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with additional chopped pecans.

TREASURE CHEST DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. Rice Krispies, slightly crushed
1/2  c. coconut
1  qt. vanilla ice cream, softened
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1/2  c. brown sugar
1/3  c. melted butter
preparation
      Mix together Rice Krispies, nuts and coconut and brown in oven. Stir in sugar and butter. Put half in 9 x 9-inch square pan. Spoon ice cream and put remaining crumbs on top.

FROSTED MANDARIN DESSERT
ingredients
1 (11 oz.)  can Mandarin oranges
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. orange Jell-O
2  c. boiling water
1  pt. orange sherbet
preparation
      Drain oranges, reserving syrup.  Add water to syrup to make 1 cup.  Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water.  Add measured liquid.  Add sherbet by spoonfuls, stirring until melted.  Chill until slightly thickened.  Stir in oranges.  Chill until set, about 1 hour.  Makes about 5 cups (8 servings).

ORANGE DESSERT
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. orange Jell-O
1  c. boiling water
1  pt. orange sherbet
1 (11 oz.)  can mandarin oranges, drained
1  c. heavy cream, whipped or Cool Whip
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water; add sherbet and mix well until sherbet dissolves. Place in fridge until partially set (about 10 minutes). Fold in oranges and whipped cream. Chill.

CHERRY DESSERT
ingredients
2 1/2  c. coconut
1  c. flour
1  c. sugar
1 1/2  c. soda cracker crumbs
1/2  lb. butter
2  cans cherry pie filling
preparation
      Mix first 4 ingredients.  Melt butter; pour over mixture and mix well.  Reserve some crumbs for topping.  Press into bottom and sides of jelly roll pan.  Cover with cherry pie filling.  Sprinkle with crumbs.  Bake at 350° for 1/2 hour, then at 300° for 15 minutes.  Serves about 20.

BROKEN GLASS DESSERT
ingredients
24  crushed graham crackers
1/2  c. sugar
1/2  c. melted margarine
1  pkg. (3 oz.) lemon gelatin
1  pkg. (3 oz.) lime gelatin
1  pkg. (3 oz.) strawberry gelatin
1  envelop unflavored gelatin
1/4  c. cold water
1  c. pineapple juice
1  Tbsp. sugar
2  c. whipping cream, whipped
preparation
  Mix together graham crackers, sugar and margarine to make crust. Reserve half of crust mixture and place remainder in bottom of 9 x 13 pan.  Dissolve each package of gelatin (lemon, lime and strawberry) separately in 1 1/2 cups boiling water.  Chill each until firm, then cut into squares.  Dissolve unflavored gelatin in cold water.  Heat pineapple juice and sugar together; cool and add to unflavored gelatin.  Add the whipped cream.  Add cut up gelatin squares and mix.  Pour gelatin mixture into pan on top of graham cracker crust and top with remaining graham cracker crust mixture. Chill until serving time.

CATHY'S CHOCOLATE DELIGHT DESSERT
ingredients
1  stick butter
1  c. chopped walnuts
1 large  pkg. cream cheese
2 small  pkg. instant chocolate pudding
1  c. flour
3  c. milk
2  large containers Cool Whip
1  c. powdered sugar
preparation
      Mix butter, flour and 1/2 cup of the walnuts. Press into the bottom of the pan and bake at 350° for 15 minutes or until light brown. Mix Cool Whip, cream cheese and powdered sugar until blended. Spread on top of cooled crust. Mix chocolate pudding mix with milk. Spread on top of Cool Whip/cream cheese layer. Spread another container of Cool Whip on top. Sprinkle remainder of walnuts and flakes of Hershey bar on top.

GOLOSH DESSERT
ingredients
1  can crushed pineapple bits (20 oz.)
1  can cherry or strawberry pie filling (20 oz.)
1  c. nuts
3  bananas (cut into pieces)
1  can condensed milk (14 oz.)
1  container whipping cream
preparation
      Stir together all ingredients and mix well.

CHERRY DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. graham cracker crumbs
6  Tbsp. sugar
1  stick margarine
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese
2  c. powdered sugar
2  c. Cool Whip
2  cans cherry pie filling
preparation
      Combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar and melted butter. Spread in 13 x 9 oblong pan and bake in 350° oven for 8 minutes. Cream Philadelphia cream cheese and add powdered sugar.  Add Cool Whip and spread over cooled graham cracker crust.  Spread cherry filling over cream cheese mixture.

BROWNIE TRIFLE DESSERT
ingredients
1  box brownie mix with walnuts
1 (12 oz.)  carton Cool Whip
1 small  pkg. chocolate instant pudding
  red maraschino cherries, optional
preparation
      Mix a box of brownie mix with walnuts and bake according to directions on box.  Cool.  Break into small pieces.  Mix pudding according to directions on the box.  Use a glass trifle bowl and layer chocolate pudding, brownies and Cool Whip.  Repeat one time. sprinkle brownie crumbs on top.  May garnish each layer with maraschino cherries, if desired.

PEACH DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
2  c. self-rising flour
1  c. (2 sticks) margarine, melted
1  c. pecans, chopped
preparation
      Mix together all ingredients and press into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
      Bake at 375° for 15 to 20 minutes.  Cool for 30 minutes.
Filling:
ingredients
4  c. peaches
8  oz. cream cheese
2 1/2  c. powdered sugar
8  oz. (1 small tub) Cool Whip
preparation
      Peel and chop peaches; then set aside.
      Mix together cream cheese, powdered sugar and Cool Whip. Spread mixture on cooled crust.  Top with peaches and put in refrigerator.
Topping:
ingredients
1 1/3  c. sugar
5 1/2  Tbsp. flour
4  Tbsp. jello, peach
1 1/3  c. water
preparation
      In a saucepan, mix together sugar, flour and jello.  Add water and cook over medium heat until thick.  Let cool completely and pour over peaches.

FROZEN STRAWBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
16  oz. Cool Whip
1  can Eagle Brand milk
16  oz. frozen sliced strawberries, thawed (with juice)
20  oz. can crushed pineapple (do not drain)
1  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Mix Cool Whip and Eagle milk until blended. Add strawberries, pineapple and nuts. Pour into a 13 x 9-inch pan. Freeze. Cut into squares.

APPLE STREUSEL DESSERT
ingredients
1  package of spice cake mix
3  eggs
1  can apple pie filling
1/3  cup packed brown sugar
1  Tbsp flour
1  tsp cinnamon
1  cup chopped nuts
preparation
      Lightly grease and flour a 9 X 13 pan. In a large bowl, combine first 3 ingredients; beat until moistened. Continue to beat on medium speed for 4 minutes. Pour into prepared pan. Mix last 4 ingredients together; sprinkle over cake batter. Bake at 350° for 35 minutes. Cool slightly before cutting.

ICE CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
72  Ritz crackers, crumbled
1/2  c. walnuts
1  Tbsp. sugar
preparation
	Mix and pat into a cake pan.
First Filling:
ingredients
1/2  gal. vanilla ice cream
1  box vanilla instant pudding
1/2  gal. chocolate ice cream
1  box chocolate instant pudding
preparation
	Mix and pour on top of First Filling. Sprinkle additional crushed cracker crumbs on top. Freeze.

4 LAYER DESSERT
ingredients
1  stick margarine
1  c. flour
1/2  c. pecans chopped
8  oz. cream cheese
1  c. powdered sugar
1  c. Cool Whip
1 large  pkg. chocolate instant pudding
3  c. milk
  Cool Whip
  Hershey bar, grated (or sprinkle with chocolate chips)
preparation
      Make a fourth layer with Cool Whip. Top with grated Hershey's candy bar. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.

DESSERT PIZZA
ingredients
1  pkg. refrigerated sugar cookie dough
4  oz. cream cheese, softened
2  Tbsp. sugar
1  Tbsp. milk
8  oz. Cool Whip
  Toppings:  chocolate chips, strawberries, grapes, nuts
preparation
      Heat oven to 350 degrees. Press cookie dough into 12 inch pizza pan. Beat cream cheese, milk and sugar with wire whisk. Stir in whipped topping. Spread on cookie crust. Garnish with toppings.

MILE HIGH DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
1/2  c. margarine
1  c. flour
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Work together like pie crust and spread into 9 x 13 pan.  Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes.  Cool, crumble with a spoon and take out 1/2 cup for topping.  Spread remainder evenly over bottom of pan.
Filling:
ingredients
1  pkg. (10 oz.) frozen strawberries, partially thawed
2  egg whites
1  c. sugar
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  c. whipped whipping cream
preparation
      Put strawberries, egg whites, sugar and lemon juice in a large mixing bowl and beat at high speed about 10 or 15 minutes, or until it holds its shape.  Fold whipped cream into berry mixture.  Spread over crumbs.  Sprinkle remaining crumbs over top. Freeze.

PRETZEL DESSERT
ingredients
2-2/3  c. crushed pretzels
3  tbsp. sugar
1  c. sugar
1 large  pkg. strawberry jello
10  oz. frozen strawberries
2  sticks melted margarine
8  oz. cream cheese
4  oz. cool whip
2-1/2  c. boiling water
preparation
      Mix butter, 3 tbsp. sugar and pretzels into a 9 x 13 inch pan; bake 10 minutes at 350°F. Let cool. Mix cream cheese and remaining sugar and cool whip  together, spread over cooled pretzel bottom. Mix jello and water; add the strawberries and let partially gel, then pour over cream cheese. Refrigerate. Serve after jello is set.

COCONUT DESSERT
ingredients
1  cube margarine
1  c. flour
1/2  c. chopped pecans
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1/2  box powdered sugar
1  c. Cool Whip
2  pkg. instant pudding (coconut cream)
2 1/2  c. milk
1/2  c. cream of coconut
preparation
      Mix together margarine, flour and pecans and press into a 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes. Cool.
      Mix together cream cheese, powdered sugar and 1 cup Cool Whip. Pour on top of crust. Sprinkle with coconut and pecans.
      Mix pudding, milk and cream of coconut. Spread on mixture. Spread remaining Cool Whip (extra large) on top and sprinkle with coconut and pecans. Refrigerate several hours before serving.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

LEMON DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
1  c. plain four
1  stick margarine
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Mix together and bake in 350° oven until light brown.  Cool.
First Filling:
ingredients
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1  c. powdered sugar
1  c. Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix together and spread on top of crust.
Second Filling:
ingredients
3 1/2  c. milk
2  boxes Jell-o lemon instant pudding
preparation
      Mix together and put on top of  first filling.
Topping:
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  carton Cool Whip
  nuts
preparation
      Top with cool whip and sprinkle with nuts.  Put in refrigerator or can put in freezer for awhile.

RHUBARB DESSERT
ingredients
4  c. chopped fresh or frozen rhubarb
1  c. sugar
1/4  c. strawberry gelatin powder
1  pkg. white cake mix
1  c. hot water
1/2  c. flaked coconut
1/3  c. slivered almonds
6  Tbsp. melted butter or margarine
preparation
      In a greased 13 x 9 baking pan, arrange rhubarb. In a mixing bowl, combine sugar and gelatin; sprinkle over rhubarb. Then sprinkle the dry cake mix over the gelatin mixture. Pour hot water over cake mix, but do not stir. Top with coconut and almonds; drizzle with butter. Bake in 350° oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

LOW FAT DESSERT
ingredients
1  (fat free) angel food cake
1 large  box sugar free vanilla instant pudding
  Skim milk for pudding
1  can strawberry or cherry pie filling, lite
1  can crushed pineapple, drained
1  lg. container cool whip, lite
2  or 3 bananas
  Lemon juice (optional)
preparation
      Crumble cake in bite size pieces.  Mix pudding and milk according to package directions.  Layer cake, pudding, pineapple, bananas, pie filling and cool whip. This will make two layers.
      This is real nice in a trifle dish.  The bananas will not turn brown as fast if you will dip the slices in lemon juice before putting in recipe.

PEACHES AND CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
3  c. frozen sliced peaches, thawed
4  Tbsp. sugar
1  c. light sour cream
1/4  tsp. ground cinnamon
1 1/2  c. Cool Whip
1  c. granola cereal
preparation
      Dice peaches, reserving several slices for garnish. Mix peaches and 2 tablespoons of the sugar in large serving bowl. Mix sour cream, remaining 2 tablespoons sugar and cinnamon in another large bowl. Gently stir in whipped topping. Sprinkle 3/4 cup of the granola over peaches. Top with whipped topping mixture. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup granola. Garnish with additional whipped topping, reserved peach slices and cinnamon sticks. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

TWINKIE DESSERT
ingredients
1  box Twinkies
2  pkg. (10 oz.) frozen strawberries, thawed
2  or 3 large bananas
1 large.  pkg. vanilla pudding mix
1  (12 oz.) Cool Whip
preparation
      Arrange Twinkies in a pyrex dish. Pour strawberries (with juice) over Twinkies. Slice bananas and make a layer over the strawberries.
       Mix pudding according to pkg. directions; pour over bananas. Top with Cool Whip. Chill and serve.

GRAHAM CRACKER CRUMB DESSERT
ingredients
1  box graham cracker crumbs
1 large  box Dream Whip (2 pkg. box)
2  (10 oz.) frozen strawberries
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1  c. sugar
1  c. sweet milk
1  stick melted butter
preparation
      Cook strawberries with 3 tablespoons flour until thick. Cool. Whip the Dream Whip with sugar and sweet milk until stiff. Add the softened cream cheese. Take the graham cracker crumbs and butter and mix together. In the bottom of a large cake pan, layer the crumbs, cheese and strawberries. Then refrigerate until set.

ANGELS DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. strawberry jello
1  c. hot water
1 - 10  oz. pkg. frozen strawberries
1  c. Cool Whip
2  c. mini marshmallows
1  angel cake, cut up
preparation
      Combine all together and put in well greased angel cake pan or bundt pan and chill. Serve with Cool Whip.

LEMON SUPREME CAKE DESSERT
Cake:
ingredients
1  Duncan Hines Lemon Supreme Cake Mix
2  beaten eggs
1 (15 oz.)  can mandarin oranges and liquid
preparation
      Drain mandarin oranges, save liquid.  Mix cake mix, beaten eggs and mandarin liquid.  Fold in orange pieces.  Pour into 9 x 13 greased and floured pan.  Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.  Cool.
Topping:
ingredients
1  box vanilla instant pudding
1  carton (8 oz.) Cool Whip
1  can (13 oz.) crushed pineapple and juice
preparation
      Mix and put on cooled cake for frosting.  Refrigerate 24 hours.

PUMPKIN DESSERT
ingredients
1  box yellow cake mix, set aside 1 cup
1/2  cup melted margarine
1  egg
1 large  can of pumpkin
3  eggs
1/2  cup brown sugar
2/3  cup milk
1/4  cup white sugar
3  tsp cinnamon
1/2  tsp ground cloves
1/4  cup of sugar
1/4  cup soft margarine
1/3  cup nuts
preparation
      1 box yellow cake mix, set aside 1 cup. Add; 1/2 cup melted margarine, 1 egg. Mix and spread in 9 X 13 pan, ungreased.
      Mix together:  1 large can of pumpkin, 3 eggs, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 2/3 cup milk, 1/4 cup white sugar, 3 tsp cinnamon and 1/2 tsp ground cloves.
      Pour over crust.  Take cup of cake mix, add 1/4 cup of sugar and 1/4 cup soft margarine, 1/2 cup nuts.  Mix to crumbs.  Sprinkle on top.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour.  Serve with Cool Whip.

ANGEL FOOD DESSERT
ingredients
1  box angel food cake mix
1- 3  oz. pkg. strawberry jello
1  c. hot water
  1-12 oz. bag frozen strawberries
1  c. cool whip
preparation
      Bake the angel food cake according to the directions on the box.  Let cool.
      Dissolve jello in hot water and add frozen strawberries. Place in refrigerator until partially thickened.  Fold in cool whip and let stand in refrigerator until it will spread between layers.
       Slice angel food cake in 3 layers.  Place one layer at a time in pan and fill with filling between each layer.  Put back in refrigerator until it is firm. Take cake out of pan and place on cake plate. Use left over filling for top of cake.

CHOCOLATE CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
3/4  c. cold butter or margarine
1  ppkg. chocolate cake mix
1  egg, lightly beaten
1  ppkg. cream cheese (8 oz.), softened
1  c. confectioners sugar
4  c. whipped topping, divided
3  c. cold milk
2  ppkg. instant chocolate pudding mix
2  Tbsp. chocolate curls
preparation
      In a bowl, cut butter into cake mix until crumbly.  Add egg and mix with electric mixer.  Press into a greased 13 x 9 x 2 in. baking dish.  Bake at 350°F for 15 - 18 min. or until set.  Cool completely.  Beat cream cheese and confectioners sugar until smooth.  Fold in 1 c. of whipped topping.  Carefully spread over the crust, refrigerate.  Whisk milk and pudding for 2 min.; let stand until slightly thickened.  Spread over cream cheese layer. Top with remaining whipped topping.  Refrigerate 2 hours before eating.  (12 servings.)

FRESH STRAWBERRY DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
1/2  c. butter or margarine
1  c. flour
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Mix; press into 8 x 12-inch pan. Bake 12 minutes at 350°. Cool.
Filling:
ingredients
1  c. Cool Whip
2  Tbsp. milk
8  oz. pkg. cream cheese
1  c. powdered sugar
preparation
      Mix thoroughly and spread on cooled crust. Chill.
Topping:
ingredients
1  c. sugar
1  c. water
3  Tbsp. cornstarch
3  oz. pkg. strawberry Jell-O
1  qt. fresh strawberries
2  Tbsp. white Karo
preparation
      Boil water, sugar and cornstarch. Remove from heat and add Jell-O. Stir in berries and spread on top of cream cheese mixture. Chill.
       Frozen strawberries may be used but use less sugar and add  1 package of Knox unflavored gelatine.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

STRAWBERRY ANGEL FOOD DESSERT
ingredients
1  large bag frozen strawberries (in syrup)
1  envelope unflavored gelatin
2  c. heavy cream
1/4  c. sugar
1  angel food cake
preparation
      Bake cake and set aside. Put strawberry syrup in top of double boiler. Add gelatin and stir until it is dissolved. Add strawberries; stir. Then chill until thickened. Whip cream until stiff; add sugar. Fold cream into thickened strawberry mixture and then frost cake and chill several hours before serving.

QUICK MIX PUMPKIN DESSERT
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  can pumpkin
1/2  c. milk
1 (3 1/2 oz.)  pkg. instant vanilla pudding
1  tsp. cinnamon
1/4  tsp. nutmeg
1/4  tsp. cloves
1  (9 oz.) container Cool Whip
3  c. miniature marshmallows
  nuts
preparation
      Beat together the first six ingredients slowly until blended. Chill 5 minutes, then fold in Cool Whip and miniature marshmallows.  Pour into 9 x 13-inch dish and top with nuts. Chill overnight or for several hours.

PUMPKIN DESSERT
ingredients
1  box yellow cake mix, set aside 1 cup
1/2  cup melted margarine
1  egg
1 large  can pumpkin
3  eggs
1/2  cup brown sugar
2/3  cup milk
1/4  cup white sugar
3  tsp cinnamon
1/2  tsp ground cloves
preparation
      1 box yellow cake mix, set aside 1 cup. Add: 1/2 cup melted margarine, 1 egg. Mix and spread in 9 X 13 pan, ungreased.
      Mix together: 1 large can pumpkin, 3 eggs, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 2/3 cup milk, 1/4 cup white sugar, 3 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tsp ground cloves. Pour over crust. Take cup of cake mix, add 1/4 cup sugar and 1/4 cup soft margarine, 1/2 cup nuts. Mix to crumbs. Sprinkle on top. Bake at 350° for 1 hour. Serve with cool whip.

FROZEN PEANUT BUTTER DESSERT
ingredients
8  oz. cream cheese, softened
2  c. powdered sugar
2/3  c. peanut butter
1  c. milk
2  (9 oz.) bowls Cool Whip
1/2  c. chopped peanuts
preparation
      Whip  cheese  until soft and fluffy.  Beat in sugar and peanut butter.  Slowly  add  milk,  blending  thoroughly into mixture. Fold  in  Cool  Whip,  and  pour into graham cracker crust. Sprinkle  with chopped peanuts.  Freeze until firm and serve.

COOL CRANBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
  12-16 oz Cool Whip
8  oz cream cheese
3  tbsp mayonnaise
1/4  c sugar
1 large  can crushed pineapples (drained)
1  can whole cranberries
preparation
      Cream together mayonnaise, cream cheese and sugar.  Add pineapples and cranberries.  Add Cool Whip and mix well. Freeze.
      Let stand 1-2 hours before serving.

PUMPKIN PIE DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
1/2  c. margarine, softened
1/2  c. brown sugar, firmly packed
1/2  c. quick cooking oats
1  c. flour
preparation
      Mix and press into greased 9 x 13 inch baking pan.  Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.
Filling:
ingredients
1 large  can pumpkin
1 (3 oz.)  can evaporated milk
3  eggs
1  c. sugar (half white/half brown) maybe more
1  tsp. pumpkin pie spice
1  tsp. cinnamon
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
      Mix together and pour over crust, return to oven for 30 minutes.
Topping:
ingredients
1/2  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. chopped walnuts or pecans
2  Tbsp. butter
preparation
      (I usually double this...haha!!)  Mix all ingredients together and crumble over the pumpkin mixture.  Add extra walnuts. return to oven for additional 15 - 20 minutes or until pumpkin is done.  Cut into squares and serve with whipped cream if desired.

CHERRY CREAM CHEESE DESSERT
ingredients
3/4  c. graham cracker crumbs
2  Tbsp. sugar
2  Tbsp. butter or margarine, melted
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1 (14 oz.)  can sweetened condensed milk
1/3  c. lemon juice
1  tsp. vanilla extract
1 (21 oz.)  can cherry pie filling or apple or strawberry
preparation
      In bowl, combine cracker crumbs, sugar and butter. Divide among 8 dessert dishes, about 4 rounded teaspoonfuls in each. In a small mixing bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Gradually add milk until blended. Beat in lemon juice and vanilla. Spoon 1/4 cup into each dish. Top with pie filling, about 1/4 cup each. May use apple or strawberry pie filling. Top with whipped cream if desired. Makes 8 servings.

CHOCOLATE CLAIR DESSERT
ingredients
3 (3.5 oz.)  boxes French vanilla instant pudding
4 1/2  c. skim milk
1  box low-fat graham crackers
1  (12 oz.) container whipped topping
preparation
      Using a whisk, mix pudding with milk.  Fold in whipped topping. Place layer of graham crackers on bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan.  Top with half of pudding mix.  Repeat layers: graham crackers, remaining pudding, graham crackers.  Top with Chocolate Sauce.
Chocolate Sauce:
ingredients
2  c. sugar
1/2  c. cocoa
1/2  c. milk
1/2  c. butter
  dash of salt
preparation
      Combine all ingredients in a saucepan.  Boil 1 minute.  Cool slightly.  Pour over top layer of graham crackers while still warm. Refrigerate several hours or overnight.  Yields 12 servings.

FRUIT COCKTAIL DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. sugar (granulated)
1  c. flour
1  tsp. soda
1/2  tsp. salt
1  egg
1 (1 lb.)  can fruit cocktail
1  tsp. vanilla
1/2  c. brown sugar, packed
1  c. nuts, chopped
preparation
      Mix together sugar, flour, soda and salt and add egg, slightly beaten, one can fruit cocktail, undrained, vanilla and 1/2 of the nuts.  Pour into buttered pan, 9 x 9-inch or round 9-inch pie pan. Mix remaining nuts into brown sugar and sprinkle over top.  Bake at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes.  Serve with whipped cream; good warm. Serves 8.

LEMON DESSERT
ingredients
1 1/2  c. flour
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1 1/2  sticks margarine
8  oz. cream cheese
1  c. powdered sugar
2 small  cartons Cool Whip
3  c. milk
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. instant Jell-O lemon pudding
preparation
	For crust, mix flour, margarine and nuts together and put into 13 x 9-inch pan. Bake in 350° oven for 30 minutes. Cool. For filling, mix together cream cheese, powdered sugar and 1 small carton of Cool Whip. Spread on crust. Stir milk into instant lemon Jell-O pudding, mix and pour over cream cheese mixture. Put 1 small carton (4 oz.) Cool Whip on top. Chill for several hours.

LAYERED PUMPKIN DESSERT
First Layer:
ingredients
1 1/2  sticks of oleo or butter
1 1/2  c. flour
3/4  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Cut margarine into flour.  Mix well, add nuts, and spread on bottom of  9 x 13 pan.  Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes.
Middle Layer:
ingredients
8  oz. cream cheese
2  c. powdered sugar
1  c. Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix cheese and sugar.  Then fold in Cool Whip.  Spread on cooled crust.
Top Layer:
ingredients
2  (3.4 oz.) packages of instant vanilla pudding
1  c. pumpkin
1  tsp. cinnamon
1/2  tsp. ginger
1/4  tsp. cloves
2  c. milk
preparation
      Mix well all ingredients except milk.  Add milk.  Spread on other layers.  Refrigerate.  Top with Cool Whip and few nuts.  Can be frozen.

OREO DESSERT
(This Dessert Is Made Of 4 Layers)  
Layer 1:
ingredients
1 1/4  lb. Oreos, crushed (set aside small handful)
1  stick margarine, melted
preparation
      Press into 9 x 13 pan.
Layer 2:
ingredients
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese (room temperature)
1  c. powdered sugar
1  (8 oz.) Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix and pour on crust.
Layer 3:
ingredients
1 large  box chocolate pudding
preparation
      Mix by directions on box and pour into pan.
Layer 4:
ingredients
1  (8 oz.) Cool Whip
preparation
      Sprinkle on remaining Oreos.

TWINKIE DESSERT
ingredients
1  box of Twinkies
2  pkgs. instant butterscotch pudding
3  C. milk
8  oz. Cool Whip
2  Heath candy bars
preparation
      Cut Twinkies in half lengthwise and layer cream side up in the bottom of a 9 x 13-inch pan.
      Mix pudding and milk together and pour over Twinkies.  Top with Cool Whip.  Crush the Heath bars and sprinkle on top.

BLUEBERRY-PINEAPPLE DESSERT
ingredients
1/2  c. grated pecans (optional)
1  can blueberry pie filling
1 large  can crushed pineapple
1  Duncan Hines cake mix (yellow)
1 1/2  sticks margarine
preparation
      Spray 9 x 13-inch cake pan. Pour in blueberry pie filling and pineapple with the juice. Pour the cake mix on top of fruit (dry mix). Melt margarine and pour butter on top of dry cake mix. Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until golden brown.

LEMON PUDDING DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. cold butter or margarine
2  c. all-purpose flour
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1  c. xxxx sugar
1 (8 oz.)  carton frozen whipped topping, thawed and divided
3  c. cold milk
2 (3.4 oz.)  pkg. instant lemon pudding mix
preparation
      In a bowl, cut butter into the flour until crumbly. Press into an ungreased 9 x 13 x 2-inch baking pan. Bake at 350° for 18 to 22 minutes or until set. Cool on a wire rack. In mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Fold in 1 cup whipped topping. Spread over pie crust. In a mixing bowl, beat milk and pudding mix on low speed for 2 minutes. Carefully spread over the cream cheese layer. Top with the remaining whipped topping. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Yield: 12 to 16 servings.

"STATE DESSERT" APPLE KUCHEN
ingredients
1/2  c. butter or margarine
1/2  c. flaked coconut
1/2  c. sugar
1  tsp. cinnamon
1 (20 oz.)  can pie sliced apples, drained or 6 medium apples, peeled and sliced
1  pkg. yellow cake mix
2  egg yolks
1  c. sour cream
preparation
      Cut butter into dry cake mix until crumbly. Mix in coconut. Pat lightly into ungreased 9 x 13 pan. Bake 10 minutes at 350°. Arrange apples on warm crust.
      Mix cinnamon and sugar; sprinkle on apples. Blend sour cream and egg yolks. Drizzle over apples. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes until edges are light brown.
      I microwaved the apples on half power for 5 minutes beforehand.

PUMPKIN DESSERT
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  can pumpkin
1  can Milnot
1  c. sugar
1  tsp. pumpkin pie spice
4  eggs
1  yellow cake mix
1  c. chopped pecans
1  stick butter or margarine
  whipped cream
preparation
      Mix the pumpkin, Milnot, sugar, pumpkin pie spice (I use 1 teaspoon vanilla also) and eggs together and pour into an 11 x 13 pan. Sprinkle with the yellow cake mix over the pumpkin mixture. Add pecans. Melt butter or margarine and distribute evenly over top. Bake in 350° oven for about 1 hour. Serve with whipped cream.

CHERRY MERINGUE DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
1 1/4  c. sifted all purpose flour
1/2  tsp. double acting baking powder
1/4  tsp. salt
1/3  c. shortening
1/3  c. sugar
2  unbeaten egg yolks
1  Tbsp. milk
1/2  c. pecans, chopped
preparation
      Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. Blend shortening with sugar, creaming well. Blend in egg yolks and milk; beat well. Add the dry ingredients all at once; stir until mixture forms a dough.  Press into bottom of well-greased 9-inch round layer pan.  Chop pecans; reserve 2 Tbsp. for Meringue. Sprinkle remainder over dough. Bake at 375° for 12 to 15 minutes.  Cool. Heat pie filling and add almond extract. Cool. Transfer the cookie circle to baking sheet. Beat egg whites until soft mounds form. Add 1/4 c. sugar gradually, beating well after each addition. Beat until meringue stands in stiff straight peaks.  Drop meringue by tablespoonfuls around edge on top of circle. Sprinkle with reserved pecans.  Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes. Fill center with cherry filling.
Cherry Filling:
ingredients
1  can sour pie cherries
2  Tbsp. cornstarch
1/2  c. sugar
1/4  tsp. almond extract
preparation
      Drain cherries, reserving 3/4 c. juice. Blend cornstarch with sugar in saucepan. Blend in the reserved cherry juice, stir until sugar dissolves. Cook, stirring constantly, until thick and clear. Add almond extract and the cherries.

TOFFEE DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. Graham Crackers, crushed (30 crackers)
1/2  c. Oleo, melted
1  c. Soda Crackers, crushed (25 crackers)
2 sm.  pkg. Vanilla Instant Pudding
2  c. Milk
1  qt. Vanilla Ice Milk
1 (4 1/2 oz).  carton Cool Whip
2  Butterfinger candy bars, frozen and crushed
preparation
      Combine cracker crumbs and oleo.  Mix well.  Place 2/3 crumb mixture in 9x13 pan.
      Prepare pudding with milk and add ice milk.  Blend until smooth.  Pour over crumbs. Refrigerator until firm. Spread Cool Whip over pudding mixture.  Add candy bars to remaining crumb mixture and sprinkle over top.  May refrigerator several hours. DO NOT FREEZE!

RHUBARB DESSERT
ingredients
3/4  c. butter
2  Tbsp. sugar
2  c. flour
5  c. rhubarb
1  c. milk
1/4  tsp. salt
6  egg yolks
2  c. sugar
4  Tbsp. flour
2  Tbsp. cornstarch
preparation
      Make crumbs of top 3 ingredients.  Put in 11 x 5 x 1 in. pan. Bake for 10 min.  Mix the rest together, cook and pour on crust. Bake for 25 min.  Beat 6 egg whites.  While beating, add 1-2 Tbsp. sugar and 1 tsp. vanilla, beat till stiff.  Pour on cake and bake till golden.  Very good!

CHERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1/2  c. granulated sugar
1/2  c. brown sugar
1  c. quick oats
1 1/2  c. flour
2  cans cherry pie filling
preparation
      Combine all ingredients, except cherries; mix thoroughly. Place in large, buttered pan, reserving one-fourth mixture for topping.  Add cherries.  Cover with topping.  Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.

NO-BAKE STRAWBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1  (10 1/2 oz.) loaf angel food cake, cut into 1-inch cubes
2 (.3 oz.)  pkg. sugar-free strawberry gelatin
2  c. boiling water
1 (20 oz.)  pkg. frozen, unsweetened, whole strawberries, thawed
2  c. cold 1% milk
1 (1 oz.)  pkg. sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix
1  (8 oz.) frozen reduced fat whipped topping, thawed
preparation
      Arrange cake cubes in a single layer in a 13 x 9-inch dish. In a bowl, dissolve gelatin in boiling water; stir in strawberries. Pour over cake and gently press cake down. Refrigerate until set, about 1 hour. In a bowl, whisk milk and pudding mix for 2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Spoon over gelatin layer. Spread with whipped topping. Refrigerate until serving. Yields 20 servings.

WALNUT APPLE DESSERT
ingredients
8  c. sliced, peeled tart apples (about 6 medium)
2 1/4  c. packed brown sugar, divided
2  tsp. ground cinnamon
1  c. butter or margarine, softened
2  eggs
2  c. all-purpose flour
1  c. finely chopped walnuts, divided
  vanilla ice cream (optional)
preparation
      Place apples in a greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup brown sugar and cinnamon.  In a mixing bowl, cream butter and remaining brown sugar.  Add eggs.  Stir in flour and 1/2 cup walnuts.  Spread over apples.  Sprinkle with remaining walnuts.  Bake at 350° for 45 to 55 minutes or until the apples are tender.  Serve warm with ice cream if desired.  Yield:  12 to 16 servings.
