Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

OREO DESSERT
ingredients
8  oz. cream cheese
8  oz. Cool Whip
1  lb. Oreo cookies
3  c. milk
1  stick butter or margarine
1  c. powdered sugar
2 small  pkg. vanilla pudding
preparation
      You will need 3 bowls.
      Mix milk with pudding. Crumble Oreos and set aside.
       Cream butter and cream cheese together, then add powdered sugar. Mix well and set aside.
       Mix pudding and Cool Whip together. Mix all ingredients together except the Oreo cookies.
       In a 13 x 9 dish, layer 1/2 of the Oreos, cream cheese mixture and the other 1/2 of the cookies in that order. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

PUMPKIN DESSERT
Cheese Cake:
ingredients
24  graham crackers, crushed
1/2  c. margarine
1/2  c. sugar
2  eggs
3/4  c. sugar
8  oz. cream cheese, softened
preparation
      Mix crackers, margarine and 1/2 c. sugar together and press into 9 X 13 pan. Beat eggs, 3/4 cup sugar, and cream cheese together and pour over graham cracker crust. Bake 20 minutes at 350°. Cool.
Filling:
ingredients
2  C. pumpkin
1/2  c. sugar
1/2  c. milk
3  egg yolks
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. cinnamon
1  env.  Knox gelatine
1/4  c. water
3  egg whites
1/4  c. sugar
1  c. Cool Whip
preparation
      Combine pumpkin, 1/2 cup sugar, milk, egg yolks, salt and cinnamon in a saucepan.  Cook until thick, stirring constantly. Dissolve Knox gelatine in water and add to pumpkin mixture.  Cool. Beat egg whites and remaining sugar.  Fold into cool pumpkin mixture.  Fold in Cool Whip.  Add pumpkin mixture to rest of dessert in pan.  Refrigerate and cut into squares.  Top with Cool Whip.

CREAMSICLE DESSERT
ingredients
1  angel food cake mix
  2-3 oz packages of orange jello
2  cups hot water
1  pt. orange sherbet
1  pt heavy cream, whipped
1  can mandarin oranges, optional
preparation
      Break cake into small pieces. Fill buttered 9 X 13 pan with cake pieces. Dissolve jello in hot water, add sherbet and stir. Allow to thicken slightly. Fold in whipped cream. Pour over cake pieces and refrigerate. Top with additional whipped cream and mandarin oranges slices if desired.

LEMON DESSERT
ingredients
1  stick butter or margarine
1  c. flour
1/2  c. pecans, chopped fine
1  (12 oz.) Cool Whip
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
  scant 3/4 c. sugar
2  pkg. instant lemon pudding
3  c. milk
1 1/2  c. sweetened whipped cream
preparation
      First Layer:  Mix together butter, flour and chopped pecans. Place in 9 x 13 pan. Bake 20 minutes at 350° and cool.
      Second Layer:  Mix together Cool Whip, cream cheese and sugar; spread over cooled crust. Chill 1 hour.
      Third Layer:  Beat the pudding and milk in mixer until quite thick; spread over second layer.  Refrigerate overnight. Top with sweetened whipped cream when served.

CREAM PUFF DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. water
1/2  c. margarine
1  c. flour
4  eggs
preparation
      Bring water and margarine to rolling boil. Remove from heat and add flour, stirring vigorously, until it forms a ball. Add eggs, one at a time, beating vigorously until smooth. Spread on a 15 x 11-inch jelly roll pan (greased on bottom only). Bake 30 minutes at 400°. Cool.
Filling:
ingredients
8  oz. softened cream cheese
1/2  c. milk
3  c. milk
2  boxes instant vanilla pudding
preparation
      Beat cream cheese and 1/2 cup milk. Add instant pudding and 3 cups milk; beat well. Pour over cream puff crust. Add layer of Cool Whip. Drizzle chocolate syrup on top and refrigerate.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

EASY STRAWBERRY-RHUBARB DESSERT
ingredients
4  c. rhubarb, cut up
1  c. sugar
1  pkg. strawberry Jell-O
1  pkg. dry white cake mix
1  c. water
1/3  c. melted butter
preparation
      In a 9 x 13 pan, layer all the ingredients. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes to an hour.

CRESCENT ROLL DESSERT
ingredients
2  cans crescent rolls
1  (8 oz.) pkg cream cheese
1  c. 10x powdered sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
1  tsp. cinnamon
1  c. brown sugar
1  stick butter, melted
preparation
      Put 1 can of rolls in bottom of 9 x 13 inch dish or pan.  Mix cream cheese, powdered sugar and vanilla.  Pour over rolls.  Put other can of rolls on top of this.  Sprinkle cinnamon on top of rolls.  Then sprinkle brown sugar on top of cinnamon.  Melt butter and drizzle on top of sugar.  Bake 30 minutes at 325°.

CHOCOLATE PIE DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. graham crackers
1  stick butter, melted
1/3  c. sugar
2 large  pkg. cooked chocolate pudding
3  Hershey candy bars
1 (8 oz.)  carton Cool Whip
preparation
      Crush graham crackers and mix well with melted butter and sugar; press mixture into a 9 x 13-inch pan. Cook chocolate pudding as directed. When pudding comes to a full boil, add 2 candy bars to mixture. Stir until melted; pour into pan. Cool. When completely cooled, put Cool Whip on top of pudding mixture. Put grated candy bar on top.

LEMON PUDDING DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. margarine
2  c. flour
1  pkg. (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
1  c. powdered sugar
1  carton (8 oz.) Cool Whip, thawed, divided
3  c. cold milk
2  packages (3.4 oz. each) instant lemon pudding
preparation
      In bowl, cut margarine into the flour until crumbly.  Press into ungreased 9 x 13 pan.  Bake at 350° for 18 to 22 minutes. Cool.  In mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar till smooth. Fold in 1 cup Cool Whip.  Spread over crust.  In small mixer bowl, beat pudding and milk on low speed 2 minutes.  Carefully spread over the cream cheese layer.  Top with remaining whipped topping. Refrigerate at least 1 hour.  Yield 12 to 16 servings.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

PUMPKIN PIE DESSERT
ingredients
2 1/4  c. crushed butter flavored crackers (about 50 crackers)
1/2  c. sugar
3/4  c. butter or margarine, melted
2  c. cold milk
2  pkg. (3.4 oz.) instant pudding mix
1 (15 oz.)  can solid packed pumpkin
1  tsp. pumpkin spice
1/2  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/4  tsp. ginger
1/4  tsp. nutmeg
  whipping cream
  chopped pecans
preparation
      In a bowl, combine the cracker crumbs, sugar and butter. Press into a greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch dish.  Set aside.  In a bowl, whisk milk and pudding; mix for 2 minutes.  Stir in pumpkin and spices.  Spread over the crust.  Refrigerate for 3 hours or until set.  Garnish with whipped topping and nuts.  Yields 12 to 15 servings.

PISTACHIO PUDDING DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
1  c. flour
2  Tbsp. sugar
1  stick margarine
1/4  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Mix and pat in greased 9 x 13 pan.  Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.
Filling:
ingredients
1  pkg. (8 oz.) cream cheese
2/3  c. powdered sugar
1/2  large container of Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix and pour over cooled crust.
Topping:
ingredients
2  boxes instant Pistachio pudding
2 1/2  c. milk
preparation
      Beat 1 minute.  Pour over cream cheese.  Top with rest of Cool Whip.  Sprinkle a few nuts on top (optional).

OREO ICE CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. Oreos, crushed
1  jar hot fudge or caramel ice cream topping
1/2  gal. square vanilla or chocolate ice cream
1  (8 oz.) container whipped topping
preparation
      Take 3/4 package of Oreos and spread in the bottom of 9 x 13 pan. Slice ice cream. Lay on top of Oreos. Slightly warm sauce and pour over ice cream. Spread whipped topping over sauce. Top with remaining crushed Oreos. Freeze 3 to 4 hours or overnight.

STRAWBERRY-PRETZEL DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. coarsely crushed pretzels
3/4  c. melted butter or margarine
2  tsp. sugar
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1  c. sugar
1 (16 oz.)  carton Cool Whip
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. strawberry Jello
2  c. boiling water
2 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen strawberries including juice
preparation
      Mix pretzels, melted butter and 2 teaspoons sugar.  Pat into 9 x 13-inch baking dish.  Bake at 400° for exactly 8 minutes.  Set aside.  Beat sugar into cream cheese and stir in Cool Whip. Spread on cooled pretzel mix.  Dissolve strawberry Jello in boiling water.  Add strawberries and mix.  Let stand until beginning to gel.  Pour over cream mixture and refrigerate.

STRAWBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
2  cans sweetened condensed milk
4  Tbsp. lemon juice or 8 Tbsp. lime juice
16  oz. Cool Whip
2  qt. berries (may be whole, sliced, or crushed)
preparation
      Stir  first  2 ingredients well.  Add Cool Whip and mix well, then fold in berries.  (May  use  blueberries,  peaches, blackberries, etc.) Pour into 9 x 13-inch pan.  Chill.
      Note:  You  can  1/2  the recipe and put in a baked pie shell.

FANTASTIC DESSERT
1st Part:
ingredients
1  stick oleo
1  c. flour
1/2  c. pecans, chopped
1/4  c. powdered sugar
preparation
      Mix together. Press into long 9 x 13 baking pan and bake at 350° until brown.
2nd Part:
ingredients
8  oz. cream cheese
1  c. Cool Whip
1  c. powdered sugar
preparation
      Mix well and spread on cooled first layer.
3rd Part:
ingredients
1  pkg. chocolate instant pudding mix (can use sugar-free)
1 3/4  c. milk
preparation
      Beat until thick, about 4 minutes and spread on top of second layer. Top with a thin coat of Cool Whip and sprinkle with chopped pecans.

LAYERED CREAM CHEESE STRAWBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1 1/4  c. crushed round buttery crackers
1/4  c. butter, melted
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
2  Tbsp. sugar
2  Tbsp. milk
1  c. halved strawberries
1  envelope Dream Whip whipped topping mix or Cool Whip
1  pkg. Jell-O brand vanilla instant pudding
1 1/2  c. cold milk
preparation
      Combine crackers and butter and press into bottom of 8-inch square pan. Bake at 375° for 8 minutes. Cool. Beat cream cheese with sugar and 2 tablespoons milk in bowl until smooth. Spread evenly in crumb-lined pan. Arrange strawberries on cream cheese mixture. Prepare whipped topping mix. Prepare pudding mix with 1 1/2 cups milk. Fold in 1/2 cup of whipped topping. Spoon over strawberries and chill until set, about 2 hours. Garnish with remaining whipped topping and additional strawberries. Cut into squares.

PEGGY'S FROZEN OREO CHOCOLATE DESSERT
ingredients
20  Oreo cookies, crushed
1/2  stick Margarine, melted
1/2 of 1/2  gallon Vanilla Ice Cream
2  sq. semi-sweet Chocolate
1  c. Sugar
1 (6 oz.)  can Pet Milk
2  tbsp. Oleo
preparation
      Mix cookies and margarine and press down in bottom of 13 x 9 inch pan.  Spoon ice cream over crust and place in freezer.  Mix remaining ingredients in saucepan over medium heat until melted. Cool and pour over ice cream.  Freeze.  Add cool whip and pecans, if desired.  Let sit out about 5 minutes before serving.

FAVORITE PUDDING DESSERT
ingredients
1  stick margarine
1  c. flour
1/2  c. chopped nuts
8  oz. cream cheese
1  c. powdered sugar
1  c. non dairy whipped topping
3  boxes instant chocolate pudding
3  c. milk
  whipped topping
preparation
      Heat oven to 350°.  In a small bowl, mix margarine, flour and nuts together and spread in 9 X 13 pan.  Bake about 15 minutes. Cool completely.  In medium bowl, mix cream cheese and powdered sugar together.  Fold in whipped topping.  Spread onto cooled crust.  Prepare pudding with milk and spread onto creamed cheese mixture.  Top all with whipped topping.  Chill until serving.

EASY STRAWBERRY SALAD/DESSERT
ingredients
1 1/2  c. miniature marshmallows
2 (10 oz.)  pkg. strawberry Jell-O
2  c. boiling water
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen strawberries with juice
1 small  can crushed pineapple
1  (8 oz.) container Cool Whip
1  c. pecans, chopped
preparation
      Add marshmallows and Jell-O to boiling water, then add frozen strawberries and pineapple.  Refrigerate to thicken, then add Cool Whip and pecans.  Refrigerate until time to serve.

JELLO DESSERT
ingredients
1  Package Jello
1  Can Pie Filling
  Whipped Cream
preparation
      Follow pkg directions to make jello.  Add a can of pie filling & chill. Use any combination of jello & filling; top with whipped cream & serve.

STRAWBERRY JELLO DESSERT
ingredients
2  angel food cakes
2 small  pkg. strawberry Jello
  Cool Whip
2 small  pkg. frozen strawberries
3  c. water
preparation
      Mix Jello and 3 cups water with strained juice.  Heat up and let jell, soft.  Add Cool Whip and drained strawberries.  Spray a large 9 X 13 baking dish with Pam.  Pinch angel cakes into bite size pieces.  Pour Jello mix over it.  Top with whole fresh strawberries.  Let chill.

STRAWBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1  (10 1/2 oz.) loaf angel food cake, cubed
1 (1 oz.)  pkg. sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix
1  c. cold skim milk
2  c. sugar-free, low-fat vanilla ice cream, softened
1 (.3 oz.)  pkg. sugar-free strawberry-flavored gelatin
1  c. boiling water
1  c. cold water
1  (20 oz.) bag frozen, unsweetened strawberries, partially thawed and sliced
preparation
      Place cake in the bottom of a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. In a mixing bowl, beat pudding mix and milk on low 1 1/2  minutes. Add ice cream; beat on low 1 minute. Pour over cake; chill. Dissolve gelatin in boiling water; add cold water and strawberries. Mix until partially set. Spoon over pudding layer. Cover and chill overnight.

PISTACHIO DESSERT
ingredients
3  c. crushed Ritz crackers
1  stick oleo
2  boxes instant pistachio pudding
1  c. milk
1  qt. vanilla ice cream, softened
1  large container Cool Whip
4  Heath bars, crushed (crushes best when bars are frozen)
preparation
      Mix crackers and oleo to form crust layer.  Blend together pudding, milk and ice cream.  Spread evenly over Ritz crust; frost with Cool Whip and sprinkle crushed Heath bars on top.

FRUIT DESSERT
(Low Fat)  
ingredients
1  (16 oz.) plain yogurt
1  can crushed pineapple in juice
1  pkg. vanilla pudding, dry
1  carton Cool Whip
1  c. pecans, chopped, optional
preparation
      Mix all ingredients and refrigerate.

MEETING DESSERT
ingredients
3  egg yolks
1  c. sugar
1  c. milk
1  tsp. vanilla
1  envelope plain gelatin
  pinch of salt
1/4  c. cold water
1/2  pt. whipping cream
3  beaten egg whites
1  small angel food cake
  another 1/2 pt. whipping cream
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in cold water and set aside.  Combine egg yolks, sugar, salt and milk.  Cook in double boiler until mixture coats the spoon. Stir in gelatin.  Cool.  Fold in 1/2 pint whipping cream.  Butter a 9 x 13 pan.  Crumble or slice cake and line pan with half.  Spread half of custard on top.  Cover with remaining half of cake and custard.  Whip other 1/2 pint of cream; spread over filling.  Garnish with cherries or shaved chocolate. Refrigerate.  Keeps well.  Serves 12.

BANANA SPLIT DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. crushed graham crackers
1/2  c. melted butter
2  Tbsp. sugar
2  eggs
1  c. butter or margarine
2  c. powdered sugar
4  bananas, thinly sliced
1/2  c. chopped nuts
2  c. crushed pineapple, drained
  whipped topping
preparation
      Combine graham cracker crumbs, 1/2 c. melted butter and sugar.  Press into 9 X 13 inch utility dish.  Beat eggs, 1 c. butter and powdered sugar with mixer for 15 minutes.  Spread bottom layer.  Cover with bananas, nuts, and pineapple.  Top with whipped topping.  Refrigerate.  Serves 20.

O U DESSERT
ingredients
2  pkg. instant vanilla pudding
1  large angel food cake
1  can strawberry pie filling
1  tub Cool Whip
preparation
      Prepare pudding mix as directed on the package. Then take your angel food cake and tear it into small pieces. Put it in your pudding mix until it is a thick consistency. Put mixture in a 9 x 13 baking dish. Then layer with strawberry pie filling and add Cool Whip on top. Cover dish and refrigerate.

PUMPKIN DESSERT
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  can evaporated milk
3  eggs
1  c. sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
1  tsp. cinnamon
2  c. pumpkin (16 oz. can)
1  box yellow cake mix
1 1/2  c. pecans, chopped
1 1/2  sticks butter, melted
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°. Grease and flour a 13 x 9 x 2 inch pan. Beat sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, milk, and eggs together. Blend in pumpkin. Pour into pan. Sprinkle cake mix on top; sprinkle nuts then drizzle margarine over. Bake about 45 minutes. If pecans begin to brown too fast, reduce heat or cover with a sheet of foil.
Topping:
ingredients
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
1/2  c. powdered sugar
1  (12 oz.) container Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix softened cream cheese and powdered sugar till smooth. Gradually fold in Cool Whip. Spread on cooled pumpkin dessert. Refrigerate until ready to serve. About 15 servings.
       Tip: This recipe can be doubled and poured into a 12 x 18 x 2 inch pan for 30 servings.

CHOCOLATE CHIP DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. Chocolate Chip Cookies
1  large bowl of Cool Whip
preparation
      Dip each cookie in sweet milk and layer cookies in pan.  Put cool whip between layers.  Can add nuts on top.

BANANA CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
4  medium firm bananas, sliced
1/2  c. lemon juice
1 1/2  c. graham cracker crumbs
1/4  c. sugar
1/2  c. butter, melted
1  c. (8 oz.) sour cream
1 (3.4 oz.)  pkg. instant vanilla pudding
1 (12 oz.)  carton whipped topping, thawed
1/3  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Toss bananas with lemon juice; drain well and set aside.  In a bowl combine the graham cracker crumbs, sugar and butter.  Press into greased 9-inch spring-form pan.  In a small mixing bowl, beat the sour cream and pudding.  Mix on low speed for 2 minutes.  Fold in bananas and whipped topping.  Pour into prepared crust.  Chill for up to 6 hours.  Sprinkle with pecans.  Serves 8 to 10.

CRESCENT ROLL DESSERT
ingredients
2  pkgs. Pillsbury Crescent rolls
2  pkgs. cream cheese, softened
1  c. sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
1  egg, separated
1  c. powered sugar
preparation
      Layer bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan with 1 pkg. rolls.  Mix together cream cheese, sugar, vanilla and egg yolk.  Pour over rolls.  Layer with 1 pkg. rolls.  Brush with egg white.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until light brown.  Mix powered sugar with a little milk to make glaze, and drizzle on top.

BLUEBERRY CRUNCH DESSERT
ingredients
1  (15 oz.) crushed pineapple (undrained)
3  c. blueberries
1/4  c. sugar
3/4  c. sugar
1  box yellow cake mix
1  stick margarine, melted
1 1/2  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Pour undrained pineapple in bottom of 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Spread blueberries over pineapple. Sprinkle 3/4 cup of sugar over this mixture. Sprinkle the box of dry cake mix on top of the sugar. Next, drizzle the melted margarine over the cake mix. Then sprinkle the pecans over this. Finally sprinkle the 1/4 cup sugar over this. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes. Then stick with fork all over and bake for another 15 minutes longer.

RHUBARB DESSERT #2
First Layer:
ingredients
1/2  c. butter
1  Tbsp. sugar
1  c. flour
preparation
      Mix. Pat in 8 inch square pan.  Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.
Filling:
ingredients
2 1/2  c. rhubarb, diced
3  beaten egg yolks
1  c. sugar
3  Tbsp. flour
1/2  c. sour or sweet cream
  pinch of salt
preparation
      Mix.  Pour over crust.  Bake 45 minutes at 350°.  (If doubling recipe for 9 x 13 pan, add 10 minutes baking time.)
Meringue Topping:
ingredients
3  egg whites
1/4  cup water
1/4  tsp. baking powder
1/4  c. sugar
preparation
      Beat egg whites with water till foamy.  Add baking powder. Beat until stiff.  Add sugar.  Beat till dissolved.  Add meringue topping over other layers.  Brown.

LAYERED FRUIT DESSERT
ingredients
12  (2 1/2-inch) graham cracker squares
1  c. sliced banana
2  c. sliced fresh strawberries
1 (4 serving)  pkg. Jell-O sugar-free, instant, vanilla pudding mix
2/3  c. nonfat Carnation dry milk powder
1 (8 oz.)  can crushed pineapple (packed in fruit juice; undrained)
3/4  c. water
3/4  c. Cool Whip
1  tsp. coconut extract
2  Tbsp. flaked coconut
preparation
      Arrange crackers in bottom of a 9 x 9-inch cake pan.  Evenly layer banana and strawberries over crackers.  In large bowl, combine dry pudding mix, dry milk, undrained pineapple and water. Mix well using wire whisk.  Evenly spoon pudding mixture over fruit.  Refrigerate for at least 20 minutes.  Cut into 6 servings.
      In a small bowl, combine Cool Whip and coconut extract.  When serving, top each piece with a full tablespoon of topping mixture and garnish with 1 teaspoon coconut.  Mix 1 teaspoon lemon juice with banana.

DUMP-IT DESSERT CAKE
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  can crushed pineapple
1  can cherry pie filling
1  box yellow cake mix
1 1/2  sticks margarine
1/2 to 3/4  c. flaked coconut
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.  In lightly greased 9 x 12 inch baking pan, spread pineapple and top with pie filling.  Sprinkle dry cake mix over this.  Slice margarine into 12 slices and dot over top. Cover all with coconut.  bake for 1 hour or until golden.  Serve with ice cream or whipped cream if desired.

MAKE-AHEAD LEMON DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. angel food cake mix
2  envelopes unflavored gelatin
1/4  c. cold water
1  c. boiling water
1 (12 oz.)  can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed
  sugar substitute equal to 1 c. sugar
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/4  tsp. grated lemon peel
1/8  tsp. salt
3  (8 oz.) whipped topping
1/2  c. flaked coconut, toasted
  maraschino cherries and lemon slices (for garnish)
preparation
      Prepare and bake cake according to package directions. Cut cooled cake into 1 1/2-inch cubes. In a bowl, sprinkle gelatin over cold water; let stand for 1 minute. Add boiling water and stir until gelatin is dissolved. Add orange juice concentrate, sugar substitute, lemon juice, lemon peel and salt; mix well. Refrigerate for 20 to 25 minutes, until partially set. Fold in 2 cartons of whipped topping.
      In a large bowl, gently combine cake cubes and whipped topping mixture. Then press into a lightly buttered large bowl; refrigerate, covered, for at least 24 hours.
       Just before serving, turn out on a large platter or plate and frost with the remaining whipped topping. Garnish with maraschino cherries and lemon slices if desired.

LAYERED BANANA SPLIT DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
1 1/2  c. flour
3/4  c. (1 1/2 sticks) margarine, melted
3  Tbsp. sugar
1/2  c. pecans, chopped
preparation
      In a bowl, mix together flour, melted margarine, sugar and pecans.  Press into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
      Bake at 300° for 15 minutes.  Cool to room temperature (about 30 minutes).
Filling:
ingredients
3  to 4 bananas, sliced
8  oz. cream cheese, softened
2  c. powdered sugar
16  oz. (2 small tubs) whipped topping
8  oz. (1 can) pineapple, crushed
2  Tbsp. vanilla extract
  cherries (for garnish)
  nuts, chopped (for garnish)
  chocolate, grated (for garnish)
preparation
      Arrange sliced bananas over crust.
      In a bowl, combine together cream cheese, 1 cup powdered sugar (remainder to be used later) and 8 ounces (1 small tub) whipped topping (2nd tub will be used later).  Mix until smooth.  Spread over bananas.  Spread pineapple over top.
      In a bowl, combine together the rest of the powdered sugar (1 cup), whipped topping (2nd small tub) and vanilla.  Mix well. Spread on top of pineapple.
      Chill until serving time.  Garnish with cherries, nuts and grated chocolate.

BLUEBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. graham cracker crumbs
1/2  c. confectioners sugar
1/2  c. nuts
1  stick oleo, melted
8  oz. cream cheese
1  c. granulated sugar
2  whole eggs
3  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Mix together graham cracker crumbs, confectioners sugar, nuts and oleo.  Press into bottom of 9 x 13 pan.  Beat rest of ingredients until smooth; place in 9 x 13 pan and bake for 20 minutes at 350°.  Remove from oven and cool.  Spread 1 can blueberry pie filling over baked mixture, then spread whipped cream with sugar added, on top of pie filling.  Chill for 2 hours; cut into squares and serve.  Very rich!

GLORIA'S CHOCOLATE-VANILLA DESSERT
ingredients
1  box graham crackers
1 small  box vanilla instant pudding mix
1 small  box French vanilla instant pudding mix
9  oz. Cool Whip
1  carton chocolate icing
3 1/2  c. milk
preparation
      Mix pudding mixes with  3  1/2 cups milk.  Stir in Cool Whip. Butter 9 x  13-inch  dish.  Layer 1 package of crackers in bottom of dish.  Add  one-half of pudding mixture.  Layer 1 package of crackers  and  rest of pudding.  Layer last package of crackers. Remove  foil  seal  from icing and microwave for approximately one minute.  Pour  over  top  layer of crackers. Chill.

A VERY SPECIAL JELL-O DESSERT
Jell-O Bottom:
ingredients
2 small  pkg. of orange Jell-O, (or your choice of flavor)
2  c. boiling water
2  c. cold water
1 large  can crushed pineapple (drain and save juice)
2  large bananas, chopped
1  c. miniature marshmallows
preparation
      Mix Jell-O and boiling water, stir until dissolved, add cold water and stir thoroughly. Add rest of ingredients and refrigerate until set.
Topping:
ingredients
1/2  c. sugar
2  Tbsp. flour
1/2  c. pineapple juice
1  egg (slightly beaten)
2  Tbsp. butter
1/2  c. (3 oz. pkg.) cream cheese
1  box Dream Whip (or small tub Cool Whip)
preparation
      Put first five ingredients in saucepan and cook until very thick. Remove from heat. Add cream cheese (3 ounce package can be used), and stir until dissolved. Cool mixture. Add one box of whipped Dream Whip, (or one small tub Cool Whip). Spread like frosting over top of set Jell-O mixture.

JELLO DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. Jell-O (lime or orange)
1  c. boiling water
4  ice cubes
1  c. vanilla ice cream
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O and boiling water until dissolved.  Add ice cubes; let melt.  Then add by spooning in the vanilla ice cream. Let set in refrigerator.

PISTACHIO DESSERT
ingredients
1  large Cool Whip
50  Ritz crackers
1  stick margarine
4  pkg. instant pistachio pudding
3  c. milk
1/2  gal. soft vanilla ice cream
1  Heath candy bar or Bits
preparation
      In 9 X 13 pan, melt margarine. Crush Ritz crackers. Place on top of melted margarine. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes. Cool. Mix pudding and milk well until thick. Blend in ice cream. Pour over top of cooled crust. Top with Cool Whip and sprinkle with grated Heath bar. Store in freezer.

BLUEBERRY DESSERT
Crust and Filling:
ingredients
1 1/4  c. graham cracker crumbs
1/4  c. butter
1/4  c. sugar
8  oz. cream cheese
1/2  c. white sugar
3  egg yolks
1  tsp. vanilla
3  egg whites
preparation
      Mix graham cracker crumbs, butter and 1/4 cup sugar.  Spread and press in 9 x 13 pan.  Cream together:  cream cheese and 1/2 c. white sugar.  Mix in egg yolks and vanilla.  Beat egg whites and fold in.  Spread on crust.  Bake at 375° for 15 minutes.
Topping:
ingredients
2  cans (or 4 c. fresh) blueberries
1 1/2  c. juice
1/2  c. sugar
2  Tbsp. cornstarch
1 1/2  tsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Bring to a boil, thicken a little, then add 1 Tbsp. butter. Cool and pour on cooled crust.  Refrigerate.

ICE CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. packed brown sugar
1/2  c. butter
1 3/4  c. graham cracker crumbs (22 squares)
1/2  gal. vanilla ice cream or flavor of your choice, softened
preparation
      In saucepan, combine brown sugar and butter; cook and stir until sugar is melted.  Remove from heat; stir in cracker crumbs. Place half of the crumb mixture in a greased 11 x 7 x 2 dish. Carefully spread ice cream over crumbs (pan will be full). Sprinkle with remaining crumbs; gently press down.  Cover and freeze until firm.  Remove from freezer 10 minutes before cutting. May be frozen for up to 2 months.

ICE CREAM SANDWICH DESSERT
ingredients
18  to 24 ice cream sandwiches
1  jar chocolate fudge ice cream topping
1  c. salted peanuts
1 (12 oz.)  carton whipped topping
preparation
      Put a layer of ice cream sandwiches in 9 x 13 pan (ungreased).  Spread 1/2 carton of whipped topping over bars. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup peanuts.  Drizzle with 3/4 jar of topping. Put another layer of ice cream bars.  Spread remainder of whipped topping.  Sprinkle with remainder of peanuts.  Drizzle with rest of chocolate topping.  Freeze, will keep in freezer for several months.
      When serving, take out of freezer approximately 20 minutes before serving so it is easier to cut.

FOUR LAYER DESSERT
First Layer:
ingredients
1 1/2  c. flour
1 1/2  c. chopped pecans
3/4  c. melted margarine
preparation
      Bake in 9 x 13 pan at 375° for 15 minutes.
2nd Layer:
ingredients
1 1/2  c. Cool Whip
1 1/2  c. powdered sugar
12  oz. cream cheese
preparation
      Beat until fluffy.  Pour on first layer.
3rd Layer:
ingredients
3 small  boxes instant pudding (any flavor)
4 1/2  c. cold milk
preparation
      Mix well and pour on second layer.
      4th Layer: Spread remaining Cool Whip on top and chill.

COOL WHIP PINEAPPLE DESSERT
(Low Fat)  
ingredients
1  (12 oz.) container of Fat Free Cool Whip
1 small  box vanilla fat free/sugar free pudding
2 medium  cans of pineapple tidbits, drained
1  (8 oz.) container pina colada yogurt
preparation
      Just mix all of this up together in a bowl and keep refrigerated.  It's very simple, easy and good.   If you want the fat, use regular pudding and Cool whip.

PEACHES AND CREAM DESSERT
Base:
ingredients
1 1/2  c. flour
1  tsp. baking powder
1  tsp. salt
6  Tbsp. butter, softened
2  eggs
1  c. milk
2 small  boxes instant vanilla pudding
preparation
      Combine all ingredients and beat 2 minutes with mixer. Pour into a greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Drain 1 large can sliced peaches. Keep the juice. Place peaches over the batter.
Topping:
ingredients
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  c. sugar
6  Tbsp. peach juice
preparation
      Mix together well. Spoon topping over batter and peaches. Sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar before baking for 30 minutes at 350°.
      This is the most awesome dessert served warm with Cool Whip or vanilla ice cream.

LAYERED PUDDING DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. crushed vanilla wafers, divided
1  pkg. (3 oz.) cook and serve vanilla pudding mix
2  medium ripe bananas, divided
1  pkg. (3 oz.) strawberry gelatin
1  c. whipped topping
preparation
      Spread half of the crushed wafers in the bottom of a greased 9 inch square pan.  Prepare pudding mix according to package directions; spoon hot pudding over crumbs.  Slice one banana; place over pudding.  Top with remaining crumbs.  Chill for 1 hour. Meanwhile, prepare gelatin according to package directions; chill for 30 minutes or until partially set.  Pour over crumbs.  Slice the remaining banana and place over gelatin.  Spread whipped topping over all.  Chill for 2 hours.  Yield: 9 servings.

BLUEBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. flour
2  sticks butter
1/4  c. sugar
8  oz. cream cheese
1/2  c. powdered sugar
1 8  oz. Cool Whip
  pie crust
  blueberry pie filling
preparation
      Spray 9 X 13 pan with Pam.  Mix flour, butter, and sugar and pat into pan.  Bake at 325 degrees until golden brown.  Cream together cream cheese and powdered sugar, and add 1 tub of Cool Whip.  Whip until well blended.  Spread over cooled crust.  Spread blueberry pie filling over top.  Chill well.

LEMON DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
1  egg
1/2  c. margarine
1  lemon cake mix
preparation
      Cream egg and margarine. Add cake mix.  Pat in 9 x 13-inch greased baking dish.
Filling:
ingredients
8  oz. pkg. cream cheese
2  eggs
1  tsp. vanilla
1  box powdered sugar
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  Pour over crust.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes. Cool and cut in squares.

SUGAR-FREE FRUIT DESSERT
ingredients
16  oz. can sugar-free fruit cocktail
15 1/2  oz. can pineapple tidbits (in own juice)
3  small bananas
1 small  box sugar-free vanilla instant pudding and pie filling
preparation
      Mix undrained fruit cocktail, pineapple and sliced bananas together.  Stir in instant pudding until well blended.  Store in refrigerator.

FROSTY CHERRY DESSERT
ingredients
2 (8 oz.)  cans crushed pineapple (undrained)
1 (21 oz.)  can cherry pie filling
1 (14 oz.)  can sweetened condensed milk
1 (8 oz.)  carton frozen whipped topping, thawed
  green maraschino cherries and additional whipped topping (optional)
preparation
      In a bowl, combine pineapple, pie filling and milk; fold in the whipped topping. Spread into a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish that has been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Cover and freeze until firm. Garnish with cherries and whipped topping, if desired. Yield: 12 to 16 servings.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

CHOCOLATE CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
1  package brownie mix
2  2/3 powdered sugar
1/2  cup + 6 Tbsp. butter, softened
1 or 2  Tbsp. water
1  cup semi-sweet chocolate chips
preparation
      Prepare brownie mix as directed on package. Let brownies cool completely. Beat the powdered sugar, butter and water until smooth. Spread evenly on top of cooled brownie. Cover and refrigerate until set. Place chocolate chips and remaining 6 tablespoons butter in microwave-safe bowl and microwave on high for approx. one minute or until mixture is smooth when stirred. Pour over the chilled dessert. Cover and refrigerate at least one hour before serving. Cover and refrigerate any leftover dessert.

PEACH DESSERT
ingredients
1 large  can peaches
1  pkg. yellow cake mix
1  c. brown sugar
1  stick butter, melted
preparation
      Place peaches in large dish. Put dry cake mix on top of peaches. Sprinkle brown sugar on top of cake mix. Pour melted butter evenly on top of brown sugar. Bake at 325° for 50 to 60 minutes or until brown.

RHUBARB DESSERT
ingredients
3  C. rhubarb
1  C. sugar
3  Tbsp flour
preparation
      Place rhubarb in bottom of 8 x 8-inch pan.  Sprinkle flour and sugar over mixture.
      Make the following like a crumb mixture:  1 C. brown sugar, 1 C. quick cook oatmeal, 1 C. butter or margarine, 1 1/2 C. flour. Sprinkle over rhubarb.
      Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes.

APPLE NUT DESSERT
ingredients
1  beaten egg
3/4  c sugar
1  tsp vanilla
1/2  c sifted all-purpose flour
1  tsp. baking powder
1/4  tsp. salt
1  chopped unpared apple
1/2  chopped nuts
preparation
      Beat egg. Add sugar and vanilla. Separately mix flour, baking powder and salt. Add flour mixture to egg mixture. Stir in apples and nuts. Bake in a greased 7 X 9 inch pan at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes. Quick, easy, delightful.

WALNUT APPLE DESSERT
ingredients
8  c. tart apples, sliced and peeled (about 6 medium apples)
2 1/4  c. brown sugar, packed and divided
2  tsp. ground cinnamon
1  c. butter or margarine, softened
2  eggs
2  c. all-purpose flour
1  c. walnuts, finely chopped and divided
  vanilla ice cream (optional)
preparation
	Place apples in a greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup brown sugar and cinnamon. In a mixing bowl, cream butter and remaining brown sugar. Add eggs. Stir in flour and 1/2 cup walnuts. Spread over apples. Sprinkle with remaining walnuts. Bake at 350° for 45 to 55 minutes or until the apples are tender. Serve warm with ice cream, if desired. Yield: 12 to 16 servings.

ORANGE-RICE JELLO FLUFF SALAD OR DESSERT
ingredients
1 1/2  c. lite cottage cheese
8  oz. Cool Whip
3 1/2  oz. orange Jell-O
1  (15 1/2 oz.) pineapple tidbits, drained
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  Tbsp. pineapple juice
preparation
      Mix all together and refrigerate.  Serve with chicken. Serves 9 to 12.

BANANA SPLIT DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
1  c. butter
2 1/2  c. flour
1/2  c. brown sugar
preparation
      Mix.  Put in two 9 x 13 pans.  Bake at 375° for 15 minutes. Stir occasionally, press in pans, cool.
Topping:
ingredients
5  bananas
1/2 or 3/4  gal. Neapolitan ice cream
1  c. chopped nuts
1  c. chocolate chips
1/2  c. butter
1 1/2  c. evaporated milk
2  c. powdered sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
  whipping cream or 3 packages Dream Whip
preparation
      Slice bananas on crust.  Slice ice cream (1/2 inch thick slices, or more) on bananas.  Sprinkle with nuts; freeze.
      Melt chocolate chips and butter in evaporated milk.  Stir in powdered sugar and cook until thick and smooth, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add vanilla.  Cool mixture and pour over ice cream; freeze.
      Whip cream and pour over the chocolate mixture.  Store in freezer.  Remove 10 minutes before serving.  This keeps several weeks.  Approximately 25 servings.

RHUBARB MERINGUE DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
2  c. all-purpose flour
2  Tbsp. sugar
1  c. cold butter or margarine
preparation
      In a bowl, combine the flour and sugar; cut in butter until crumbly.  Press into a greased 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.  Cool on a wire rack.
Filling:
ingredients
2  c. sugar
1/3  c. all-purpose flour
1  tsp. salt
6  egg yolks, beaten
1  c. whipping cream
5  c. sliced fresh or frozen rhubarb, thawed
preparation
      In a bowl, combine the sugar, flour and salt.  Stir in egg yolks and cream.  Add rhubarb.  Pour over crust.  Bake at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes or until set.
Meringue:
ingredients
6  egg whites
1/2  tsp. cream of tartar
3/4  c. sugar
1  tsp. vanilla extract
preparation
      In a mixing bowl, beat egg whites and cream of tartar on medium speed until soft peaks form.  Gradually beat in sugar, a tablespoon at a time, until stiff peaks form.  Beat in vanilla. Spread over hot filling.  Bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.  Cool on a wire rack.  Refrigerate for 1-2 hours before serving.  Refrigerate leftovers.  Yield: 12-15 servings.

ANGEL FOOD CAKE DESSERT
ingredients
1  angel food cake, cubed
2 small  boxes instant vanilla pudding
1  (3 oz.) cream cheese, softened
3  c. milk
1  large Cool Whip
1 large  can crushed pineapples
preparation
      Mix pudding, milk, cream cheese and Cool Whip.  Place cake in 9 x 13 glass dish. Pour pudding mixture over cake.  Pour pineapples over the top.  Do not mix.  Chill.

ORANGE DESSERT
ingredients
1 large  can crushed pineapple and juice
2/3  c. sugar
1 large  box orange flavored jello
2  c. water
1  c. pecans, chopped
1  c. Velveeta cheese, shredded
1  carton Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix pineapple with juice and sugar. Bring to a boil. Add dry jello and water; stir well and let gel. Add cheese, pecans, and Cool Whip. Chill and serve.

STRAWBERRY REFRIGERATOR DESSERT
ingredients
  yellow cake
3  qt. sliced strawberries
1 large  pkg. instant vanilla pudding
preparation
      Bake a yellow cake in 9 x 13-inch pan.  Cool.  Slice in half. Add  sugar  to  strawberries.  Make  instant pudding as directed on package.
      First Layer:  Bottom half of cake.
      Second Layer:  One-half strawberries.
      Third Layer:  All of pudding.
      Fourth Layer:  Top half of cake.
      Fifth Layer:  Remaining berries.
      Make  layers  in this order.  Cover.  Refrigerate until serving time.  May top with whipped cream.

STRAWBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1  qt. sliced strawberries
1  bag glaze
8  oz. cream cheese
1  bowl Cool Whip
1  angel food cake
3/4  c. milk
preparation
	You will need a 9 x 13 pan.
	Mix cream cheese and sugar until soft and fluffy. Mix Cool Whip and milk separately, then add to cream cheese mixture. Refrigerate until it hardens. Tear cake up in 9 x 13 pan, then pour Cool Whip mixture on the cake, then mix the strawberries and glaze and put on top.

BERRY DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
1 1/2  c. flour
3/4  c. margarine
1/2  c. nuts
preparation
      Mix and put in 9 x 13 pan, pat.  Bake at 325° for 15 minutes. Cool.
Topping:
ingredients
8  oz. Philadelphia cream cheese
1  c. powdered sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
6  oz. Cool Whip
1  can cherry or blueberry pie filling
2  Tbsp. melted butter
1/2  tsp. almond extract
preparation
      Soften cream cheese.  Add powdered sugar, vanilla and Cool Whip.  Spread on crust.  Spread pie filling on cream cheese mixture.  Put over melted butter and almond extract.  Refrigerate.

CHOCOLATE DESSERT
ingredients
1 1/2  sticks margarine
1  1/2 cups flour
8  oz. cream cheese
1  cup powdered sugar
1  12  oz. container cool whip divided in half
2  packages instant chocolate pudding
3  cups milk
preparation
      Put the flour and softened margarine in the bottom a pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.  Let cool.
      Combine the cream cheese, powdered sugar and 1/2 the cool whip. Mix and place in pan.
      Mix the pudding and milk until thick.  Add to the pan.  Top with the remaining cool whip.

SPRING GREEN DESSERT
ingredients
1  cup flour
1/2  cup oleo (1 stick)
1/2  cup ground pecans
2  (3 oz.) pkgs. cream cheese
3  cups milk
1  cup powdered sugar
2  cups prepared whipped topping mix
2  (3 oz.) pkgs instant pistachio pudding (or any other flavor you like)
preparation
      First layer:  Mix flour, oleo and pecans together.  Pat into a 9 x 13 inch pan and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes -- Do not brown and cool.
      Second layer: Cream powdered sugar and cream cheese together and fold in 1 cup of whipped topping.  Spread over cooled crust.
      Third layer: Beat together pudding mix and milk for 2 to 3 minutes.  Spread over the second layer.  Refrigerate 2 - 3 hours or overnight.  Before serving, spread the other cup of whipped topping over all.

CHEESECAKE DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
2/3  c. butter, melted
2/3  c. brown sugar, firmly packed
2  c. flour
preparation
      Mix in bowl. Save 1/2 cup. Put the rest in 9 x 13 cake pan. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.
Filling:
ingredients
16  oz. cream cheese, softened
1/2  c. sugar
2  eggs
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  c. red cherries
1  c. green cherries
preparation
      In blender, blend cream cheese, sugar, eggs and lemon juice. Blend well (I use a mixer). Fold in cherries. Put mixture in pan evenly. Sprinkle 1/2 cup leftover crust on top. Bake at 350° for 18 to 20 minutes or until firm.

LIME JELLO DESSERT SALAD
ingredients
  graham cracker crust pie shell
1  c. boiling water
1/2  c. sugar
  lime Jell-O (small box)
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1/2  c. sugar
1  c. Pet milk
preparation
      Mix together Jell-O into boiling water with 1/2 cup sugar added.  Beat in cream cheese, 1/2 cup sugar and Pet milk.  Pour into graham cracker crust.

ICE CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
20  vanilla ice cream sandwiches with chocolate outside
1/3  c. Kahlua liqueur (or any coffee liqueur)
6  Heath Bars chopped (or 1 pkg. already chopped)
  whipped topping
  caramel sauce
preparation
	Line bottom of 8 1/2 x 11-inch casserole dish with ice cream sandwiches. (Should take about 9 1/2 sandwiches.) Sprinkle 1/3 of the Heath Bar pieces on top of the sandwiches. Add a second layer of ice cream sandwiches. Poke holes in the sandwiches with a fork. Drizzle the Kahlua over the sandwiches. Sprinkle more of the Heath Bar pieces, saving a few for the top. Spread whipped topping on top and garnish with the remaining Heath Bar pieces. Keep frozen until serving. It is easiest to serve when frozen overnight. Serve on a dessert plate and drizzle with caramel sauce.

STRAWBERRIES N CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. (about 10 oz.) pound cake cut into 1/2 inch slices
1/4  c. orange juice (divided)
1  can (14 oz.) sweetened condensed milk
1/4  c. fresh lemon juice (I use bottled)
1  tsp. grated lemon peel
1  carton (12 oz.) Cool Whip, thawed
2  pints strawberries, hulled and sliced or 2 pkg. (10 oz. each) frozen strawberries, thawed and drained
preparation
      Place cake slices in bottom of pan (cutting to fit). Reserve remaining for second layer. Brush top of cake slices with half of orange juice. Combine sweetened condensed milk, lemon juice and lemon peel. Stir until thickened. Stir in whipped topping. Spread half of lemon mixture over cake. Top with half of strawberries. Repeat layers with remaining ingredients. Cover and refrigerate.

PEANUT BUTTER APPLE DESSERT
ingredients
1 1/2  c. graham cracker crumbs (about 24 squares)
1/2  c. brown sugar, packed
1/2  c. plus 1/3 c. peanut butter, divided
1/4  c. butter or margarine, melted
1  pkg. (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
3/4  c. sugar
1  carton (16 oz.) frozen whipped topping, thawed
2  cans (21 oz. each) apple pie filling
3/4  c. powdered sugar
1  tsp. cinnamon
preparation
      In a bowl, combine crumbs, brown sugar, 1/2 cup peanut butter, and butter; spoon half into a 3 qt. bowl.  In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth; fold in whipped topping.  Spread half over crumb mixture in the bowl.  Top with one can of pie filling.  Combine powdered sugar, cinnamon, and remaining peanut butter until crumbly; sprinkle half over pie filling.  Repeat layers.  Refrigerate until time to serve.
      Yield: about 20 servings in a glass bowl or 9 x 13-inch pan.

BUSTER BAR DESSERT
ingredients
1  lb. pkg. Oreo cookies, crushed
1/2  c. melted margarine
1 1/2  c. peanuts
2  c. powdered sugar
1 1/2  c. evaporated milk
2/3  c. chocolate chips
1/2  c. margarine
1  tsp. vanilla
1/2  gal. vanilla ice cream, softened
preparation
      For the topping, mix powdered sugar, evaporated milk, chocolate chips and margarine; bring to a boil. Boil for 8 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add vanilla.
      Mix crushed Oreos and melted margarine. Spread in a 9 x 13 pan. Place in refrigerator to set. Then spread peanuts over crust. Spread ice cream over crust and peanuts. Cover with cooled topping mix and freeze.

PINEAPPLE DESSERT
ingredients
1 (1 lb. 4 1/2 oz.)  can pineapple chunks
1  pkg. lemon gelatin
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
preparation
      Make and chill a graham cracker crust. Drain pineapple chunks. Reserve the syrup. Chill the pineapple. Add water to pineapple syrup to make 1 cup. Bring to a boil, then stir into lemon gelatin until completely dissolved. Gradually blend half of hot gelatin into cream cheese warmed to room temperature. When smooth, pour into chilled crust. Chill until set. Arrange pineapple on top and spoon remainder of gelatin over all. Chill.

FRESH STRAWBERRY DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
1/2  c. butter or margarine
1  c. flour
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Mix; press into 8 x 12-inch pan. Bake 12 minutes at 350°. Cool.
Filling:
ingredients
1  c. Cool Whip
2  Tbsp. milk
8  oz. pkg. cream cheese
1  c. powdered sugar
preparation
      Mix thoroughly and spread on cooled crust. Chill. Add fresh strawberries on top.

FROZEN PEACH DESSERT
ingredients
3  Tbsp. butter or margarine
1 1/2  c. finely crushed vanilla wafers
1 (21 oz.)  can peach pie filling
1  can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
1  c. (8 oz.) plain yogurt
1  tsp. almond extract
preparation
      In small saucepan, melt butter. Stir in crumbs, reserving 1/4 cup for garnish. Pat remaining crumbs on bottom of buttered 13 x 9-inch baking pan. Set aside.
       In medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Mix well. Spread into prepared pan and garnish with reserved crumbs. Freeze 4 hours or until set.

ORANGE DESSERT
ingredients
1  family size orange Jello
2  c. hot water
1 small  can frozen orange juice
2  c. drained Mandarin oranges
1  c. crushed pineapple with juice
1  box instant lemon pudding mix
1  c. milk
1  c. Cool Whip
preparation
      Add Jello to hot water and stir until dissolved.  Add orange juice, oranges and pineapple.  Mix thoroughly and pour into 9 x 12-dish.  Chill until congealed.
      Combine pudding mix and milk and whisk until thickened.  Fold in Cool Whip.  Spread pudding mixture on top of congealed mixture.

RITZ CRACKER DESSERT
ingredients
67  Ritz crackers, crumbled
1  stick margarine, melted
1/2  c. nuts, chopped
2  pkg. instant butter pecan pudding
1 1/2  c. milk
1  qt. softened vanilla ice cream
1  large Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix crumbled crackers, margarine and chopped nuts; reserve 1/2 cup.  Spread in 9 x 13-inch pan.  Mix pudding and milk; stir in ice cream.  Fold in Cool Whip.  Pour into 9 x 13-inch pan.  Sprinkle with 1/2 cup reserved topping.  Freeze.

OREO DESSERT
ingredients
1  lb. Oreos, crushed
1 large  pkg. vanilla instant pudding
1  stick oleo, melted
8  oz. cream cheese
1  (9 oz.) Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix  1/2 Oreos and margarine.  Press into bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan.  Mix pudding as directed on box, then mix it with cream  cheese  and spread over crumbs.  Top with Cool Whip and sprinkle remaining crumbs on top and chill.

JELLO DESSERT II
ingredients
1  angel food cake, crumbled
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen strawberries
1 large  box strawberry Jell-O
1 (3 oz.)  box strawberry Jell-O
1  qt. vanilla ice cream
preparation
	Mix both boxes of Jell-O with 3 cups boiling water. Add frozen strawberries and ice cream. Stir until dissolved. Pour over crumbled cake. Chill. Top with Cool Whip.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

CAKE, JELLO AND PUDDING DESSERT
ingredients
1  large cherry Jello
1  loaf Angel Food cake
1 small  box vanilla instant pudding
2  or 3 ripe bananas
1  Cool Whip
preparation
      Slice cake and place on bottom of 9x13 pan.  Prepare Jello and pour over cake.  Chill until set.  Slice bananas over cake and Jello.  Prepare pudding.  Spread over bananas.  Let set 5-10 minutes in refrigerator. Spread Cool Whip over pudding. Refrigerate.
       Variation:  Use strawberry Jello and strawberries or other fruit combinations.

SOUR CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. Jell-O (any flavor)
1  Tbsp. water
1/8  tsp. salt
1 1/2  c. boiling water
1  c. light cream
1/2  tsp. vanilla
1/2  c. sour cream
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O, sugar and salt in boiling water.  Stir in cream and vanilla (mixture will look curdled, but will become smooth).  Stir in sour cream.  Chill until slightly thickened. Beat until smooth.  Pour into 3 or 4-cup ring mold.  Chill until firm.  Unmold.  Serve with fruit if desired.  Makes 6 servings.

RITZ CRACKER DESSERT
ingredients
1  lb. chopped dates
1  can Eagle Brand milk
1  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Cook on medium heat until mushy.  Add pecans and spread on Ritz crackers.
Icing:
ingredients
1  stick butter
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese (softened)
1  lb. confectioners sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      Mix icing ingredients and spread on top of mixture on crackers.  Store in tight container in refrigerator.

FROZEN SALAD OR DESSERT
ingredients
2  cans of whole cranberry sauce
1 large  can crushed pineapple, juice and all
1  - 8 oz container of Cool Whip
  1-8 oz package of cream cheese
1/2  cup chopped pecans.
preparation
      Mix well and put into foil muffin cups and freeze. Makes approx. 30 cups.

STRAWBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1  angel food cake
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. strawberry Jell-O
2  c. boiling water
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. frozen strawberries
1 (8 oz.)  carton Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix Jell-O with boiling water until dissolved. Add frozen berries. Cool until slightly thickened. Tear cake into pieces. Put in bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan. Mix Cool Whip and strawberry mixture. Fold in slightly. Pour over cake. Refrigerate until set. Yield: 12 to 15 servings.

TRIPLE CHOCOLATE DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. chocolate cake mix
1 small  pkg. instant chocolate pudding mix
1 16  oz. pkg. sour cream
4  eggs
1  c. water
3/4  c. oil
1  c. chocolate chips
preparation
      In a mixing bowl, combine the first six ingredients.  Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes.  Stir in chocolate chips.  Pour into a 5 quart slow cooker that has been sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Cover and cook on low for 6-7 hours or until a toothpick inserted near center comes out with moist crumbs.  Serve in bowls with ice cream.  Or may cook on high for 3-4 hours.

STRAWBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. pretzels
3/4  c. butter
2  Tbsp. sugar
8  oz. cream cheese
1  c. sugar
1  medium Cool Whip
6  oz. strawberry Jell-O
2  c. boiling water
20  oz. unsweetened berries
preparation
      Crush pretzels (not too fine).  Press into 9 x 13 pan.  Bake at 400° for 8 minutes.  Let cool.  Mix together cream cheese, sugar and Cool Whip.  Put on pretzel mixture.  Mix Jell-O with water.  Stir in berries.  Let stand 10 minutes and pour on top of the cream cheese mixture.

GRAHAM CRACKER DESSERT
ingredients
72  graham cracker sections
1  stick butter
1  stick margarine
1/2  c. sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
  ground nuts
preparation
      Line 2 cookie sheets with foil. Line graham crackers on foil: 48 sections on 1 sheet and 24 on the second. Melt butter and margarine; melt sugar and vanilla. Cook until syrupy. Spread on crackers, then sprinkle ground nuts on top. Bake in 350° oven approximately 10 minutes; remove as soon as baked.

WIKIWIKI WALK AWAY DESSERT
ingredients
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. instant vanilla pudding
1  can milk
1 (8 1/2 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained (3/4 c.)
preparation
      Soften cream cheese and use mixer; gradually blend in 1/4 cup milk.  Add remaining milk and pineapple; beat 1 minute.  Chill; just before serving, spoon into ice cream cones.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

BANANA SPLIT DESSERT
First Layer (Crust):
ingredients
2  c. graham cracker crumbs
1  stick butter, melted
2  Tbsp. sugar
preparation
      Combine and press in 9 x 13 cake pan. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes. "Cool." Reserve 1/4 cup and set aside.
Second Layer:
ingredients
4  bananas, cut up
1  can crushed pineapple, drained
preparation
      Cover crust with the bananas and crushed pineapple.
Third Layer:
ingredients
2  sticks butter, melted
2  eggs
2  c. powdered sugar
preparation
      Whip the butter and eggs until lemon light color. Add the powdered sugar and whip about 15 minutes. Pour over fruit layer.
Fourth Layer:
ingredients
1 large  carton Cool Whip
preparation
      Spread over creamed layer. Sprinkle 1/4 cup reserved graham crackers.
      Top each square with 1/2 maraschino cherry. Each square should resemble a small banana split. "Enjoy, calorie free."

CHOCOLATE DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. self-rising flour
1  stick margarine
1/2  c. chopped pecans
8  oz. cream cheese
1  c. confectioners sugar
1  c. Cool Whip
2  pkg. instant pudding (4 oz. each; chocolate)
3  c. cold milk
preparation
      Mix self-rising flour, margarine and pecans and pat it out in a 13 x 9-inch pan. Bake at 350° for 15 minutes and let it cool.
      For filling, combine cream cheese, confectioners sugar and fold in Cool Whip, using a mixer. Mix 2 packages of instant chocolate pudding with cold milk; mix with mixer and refrigerate for 2 hours until it gets cold. Add the rest of Cool Whip on top. Refrigerate until you serve.

FROZEN LEMON DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. graham cracker crumbs
1/4  c. margarine, melted
2  c. Carnation milk, chilled
1  c. sugar
3/4  c. lemon juice
preparation
      Combine graham cracker crumbs and melted margarine.  Press into the bottom of a 9 x 13-inch pan.  Beat milk until fluffy. Add sugar and lemon juice.  Mix well.  Pour over graham cracker crust and freeze.

OREO DESSERT
ingredients
1  bag Oreo cookies
1  stick margarine
2 (3.4 oz.)  pkg. instant vanilla pudding mix
3  c. milk
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  (8 oz.) Cool Whip
preparation
      Crush cookies (all but 4 or so) and place across bottom of 9 x 13  pan.  Melt margarine and pour over cookie layer.  Combine pudding, milk, 1/2 of Cool Whip, and melted cream cheese.  Spread mixture over cookie layer.  Top layer is remaining Cool Whip and crumbs of saved cookies.  Cover and Refrigerate.

FROZEN DESSERT
ingredients
  graham crackers
1 large  pkg. instant vanilla pudding
3  c. milk
1  pt. sliced frozen strawberries
1 large  can crushed pineapple, drained
2  1/2 bananas, well ripened
1 (8 oz.)  carton Cool Whip
preparation
      Layer crackers in a clear glass bowl. Mix pudding with 3 cups milk. Layer pineapple, bananas and strawberries over crackers. Pour pudding mix over fruit. Cover with Cool Whip. Make ahead to serve later. Serves 8.

ICE CREAM SANDWICH DESSERT
ingredients
24  ice cream sandwiches
2  (8 oz.) containers whipped topping
1  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      In the  bottom  of  a  9  x 13-inch casserole, place 12 sandwiches.  Spread  on  one  container  of  whipped  topping. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup chopped nuts.  Repeat layers.  Freeze.

ICE CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
2  tubes Ritz crackers
1 1/2  stick oleo, melted
3  boxes Instant coconut cream pudding
2  c. milk
1/2  gallon vanilla ice cream
preparation
      Mix together cracker and oleo.  Reserve 3/4 c. Lightly grease 9x13 glass dish.  Pat mixture into dish and chill while making the rest of the dish.  Mix together pudding and milk. When mixed, beat in softened ice cream.
      Variation:  Strawberry ice cream with vanilla pudding or create your own.

LEMON DESSERT
ingredients
1  stick soft margarine
1  c. flour
8  oz. cream cheese
1  c. confectioners sugar
1  c. Cool Whip
2  pkg. instant lemon pudding mix
3  c. milk
preparation
      Mix together flour and sugar and press in 9 x 9-inch pan. Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.  Cool.  Cream together cream cheese and confectioners sugar.  Fold in Cool Whip and spread mixture over crust.  Mix lemon pudding mix and milk until thick.  Spread mixture over cheese mixture.  Top with remaining Cool Whip and grated walnuts.  Chill.

PEACH DESSERT
ingredients
1  box yellow cake mix
2  cans sliced peaches (with juice)
1  c. melted butter
  chopped pecans (optional)
preparation
      Pour sliced peaches in bottom of glass casserole dish. Cut them into smaller pieces (bite size). Sprinkle dry cake mix over peaches. Pour melted butter over cake mix. You can add chopped pecans to top of dessert. Bake at 350° until golden brown.
      Great with ice cream.

DESSERT
ingredients
1  box yellow cake mix
1  egg
1/2  c. margarine
1  box powdered sugar
2  eggs
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1  can coconut (optional)
  pecans
preparation
      Mix first 3 ingredients together and add 1/2 cup chopped pecans.  Press into 9 x 13-inch pan.  Mix together for 5 minutes using mixer the remaining ingredients.  Pour over cake mixture in pan.  Bake for 40 minutes at 350°.  Cut in squares.

ZUCCHINI DESSERT SQUARES
Crust:
ingredients
4  c. all-purpose flour
2  c. sugar
1/2  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/2  tsp. salt
1 1/2  c. cold butter or margarine
preparation
      In a bowl, combine flour, sugar, salt and cinnamon.  Cut in butter until crumbly, reserve 3 cups.  Pat remaining crumb mixture into the bottom of a greased 9 x 13 inch baking pan.  Bake at 375° for 12 minutes.
Filling:
ingredients
8 - 10  c. cubed, seeded, peeled zucchini (4 - 5 lb.)
2/3  c. lemon juice
1  c. sugar
1  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/2  tsp. ground nutmeg
preparation
      Meanwhile, for filling, place zucchini and lemon juice in a saucepan, bring to a boil.  Reduce heat, cover and cook for 6 - 8 minutes or until zucchini is crisp-tender.  Stir in sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg, cover and simmer for 5 minutes.  (Mixture will be thin.)  Spoon over crust, sprinkle with the reserved crumb mixture. Bake at 375° for 40 - 45 minutes or until golden.  Yields 16 - 20 servings.

PISTACHIO DESSERT
(Can Be Frozen; Allow 3  Hours For Thawing)  
ingredients
68  Ritz crackers
1 1/2  sticks oleo
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened before mixing with sugar and Cool Whip
2/3  c. powdered sugar
1/2 large  carton Cool Whip (21 oz. size)
2  pkg. instant pistachio pudding (make as directed on pkg.)
preparation
      Melt the oleo in pan and add crushed cracker crumbs. Set aside 3/4 cup for top of dessert. Pat remainder in a 9 x 13 pan and bake 10 minutes at 350°. (Put in freezer until real firm to make it easier to spread the next layer.)
      Combine the cream cheese, powdered sugar and Cool Whip. Then spread on cracker layer. Chill real well before next layer.
      Spread the pistachio pudding on top of cheese layer. Top with remaining Cool Whip and sprinkle with cracker crumbs.
      Note: Lemon pudding may be used instead of pistachio pudding. Serves 20.

CHOCOLATE DESSERT WRAPS
ingredients
1/2  c. creamy peanut butter
4  flour tortillas (8-inch)
1  c. miniature marshmallows
1/2  c. miniature semi-sweet chocolate chips
  vanilla ice cream
preparation
      Spread 2 tablespoons of peanut butter on each tortilla. Sprinkle 1/4 cup marshmallows and 2 tablespoons chocolate chips on half of each tortilla. Roll up, beginning with the topping side. Wrap each tortilla in heavy-duty foil; seal tightly. Grill, covered, over low heat for 5 to 10 minutes or until heated through. Unwrap tortillas and place on dessert plates. Serve with ice cream, if desired. YIELD: 4 servings.

BANANA SPLIT DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. graham cracker crumbs
3  sticks margarine
2  c. powdered sugar
2  eggs
4  large bananas
1 large  can crushed pineapple, drained
  Cool Whip, thawed
2  Tbsp. pecans, chopped
8  cherries. halved
preparation
      Let margarine stand at room temperature until softened. Mix 1 stick of margarine with the graham cracker crumbs to form a crust; press into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Place remaining 2 sticks of margarine, powdered sugar, and eggs into a mixing bowl and beat with mixer for 3 minutes; spread over the crust.
      Layer the bananas, pineapple, and Cool Whip on top of the filling. Dot with cherries and sprinkle with nuts. Refrigerate overnight before serving.

BLUEBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1  box Jiffy white cake mix
2  cans blueberry pie filling
1 lg and 1 small  box vanilla pudding
8  oz cream cheese
8  oz cool whip
preparation
      Bake cake according to directions in 13 x 9 pan.  Cool.  Mix pudding according to directions.  Beat in cream cheese.  Spread pie filling over cake, add pudding mixture then top with cool whip.

APPLE PUMPKIN DESSERT
ingredients
1 (21 oz.)  can apple pie filling
1 (16 oz.)  can pumpkin
1 (14 oz.)  can sweetened condensed milk
2  eggs
1  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/2  tsp. ground nutmeg
1/2  tsp. salt
1  c. gingersnap crumbs (about 18 cookies)
2  Tbsp. melted butter
preparation
      Heat oven to 400°. Spoon apple filling into 8 to 10 custard cups.
      In large mixer bowl, beat pumpkin, sweetened condensed milk, eggs, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt. Spoon over apple filling. Combine crumbs and butter. Sprinkle over pumpkin mixture. Place cups on 15 x 10-inch baking pan. Bake 10 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350°. Bake 15 minutes or until set. Cool. Garnish with whipped topping. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

BANANA PINEAPPLE DESSERT
ingredients
1 1/2  c. graham cracker crumbs
1/4  c. sugar
1/3  c. butter or oleo
3  bananas, sliced
1  pkg. cream cheese
1  (8 oz.) Cool Whip
3 1/2  c. cold milk
2 small  pkg. instant vanilla pudding
1 (20 oz.)  can drained pineapple
preparation
      Make crust with graham cracker crumbs, sugar and oleo.  Press into bottom of baking pan.  Arrange banana slices on crust.  Beat cream cheese in large bowl until smooth.  Gradually beat in milk. Add pudding mix.  Beat until well blended.  Spread evenly over bananas.  Spoon pineapple evenly over pudding mixture.  Spread Cool Whip over pineapple.  Refrigerate about 3 hours.

JELLO DESSERT I
White Layer:
ingredients
2  c. boiled milk
1  c. sugar
1  pt. sour cream
1  tsp. vanilla
2  pkg. Knox gelatine
1/2  c. cold water
preparation
	Mix well the first 4 ingredients. In a separate bowl, mix Knox gelatine and water until well dissolved. Add to other ingredients. Refrigerate.
Jell-O:
ingredients
1 small  box lime
1 small  box lemon
1 small  box orange
1 small  box cherry
1  c. hot water
1/4  c. cold water
preparation
	To each box of Jell-O, mix hot water and cold water. Pour into a 7 x 12 x 2-inch dish. Put in the refrigerator and let jell. Top with White Layer. Mix next Jell-O and repeat, alternating Jell-O  and White Layer.
	 I start 2 days in advance of when I need the dessert. Use colors depending on occasion.

STRAWBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  box strawberry Jello
1  (8 oz.) Cool Whip
1  pt. frozen strawberries
1  store-bought Angel Food cake (1 whole one like Kroger's)
preparation
      Pour 2 cups boiling water over Jello.  Add 1/2 cup cold water and 1/2 cup juice from strawberries.  Mix and let gel set till soft.  After set, beat with electric mixer till very fluffy, about 3 minutes.  Add strawberries and beat some more.  Fold in Cool Whip.   Using a loaf pan, layer, starting with Jello mix, then cake, and repeat ending up with Jello mix.  Chill overnight or 24 hours.  Enough Jello may be put in bottom of pan chilled stiffly for a nicer look when serving (about 3/4 c.).  You may add 1/2 c. chopped maraschino cherries on top.

STRAWBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
  Angel food cake
1  box Dream Whip
8  oz. sour cream, softened
  Strawberries
  Salada
preparation
      I Layer:  Break angel food cake in small pieces.
      II Layer:  Cream cheese, 1/2 c. sugar, Dream whip (prepare per package directions).  Fold dream whip into whipped cream cheese and sugar.
      III Layer:  Prepare salada as directed.  Cool.  Fold into strawberries.  Add 1/2 c. sugar to berries if fresh.  May substitute strawberry pie filling for salada.

PEANUT BUTTER ROCKY ROAD DESSERT
ingredients
5 peanut butter  cup candies cut in eighths
1 1/4  cup chocolate graham cracker crumbs (about 8 crackers)
4  Tbsp butter melted
2  1/2 cups milk
1  pkg butterscotch pudding
1  pkg vanilla pudding
1/4  cup peanut butter
8  ounce container cool whip, thawed
1/2  cup miniature marshmallows
1/4  cup peanuts
2  Tbsp. chocolate syrup
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Refrigerate candies to make cutting easier.  Mix butter and graham cracker crumbs well.  Press into bottom of a 9 inch square pan.  Bake 8 minutes.  Cool completely.
      Mix puddings, milk, and peanut butter until it begins to thicken.  Fold in whipped topping.  Spread evenly over crust.
      Cut peanut butter candies into eighths.  Sprinkle candies, marshmallows, and peanuts over pudding mixture.  Drizzle with chocolate syrup.  Cover with aluminum foil and freeze 6 hours or overnight.  Cut into squares.

PINK DESSERT
ingredients
1  large cottage cheese
1 1/2  pkg. strawberry jello (dry)
1 large  can fruit cocktail, drained
1  carton Cool Whip
1 small  can crushed pineapple, drained
2  c. small marshmallows (optional)
preparation
      Mix all together with cottage cheese and jello. Add Cool Whip. Mix well. Let stand overnight in refrigerator.

LEMON CHEESECAKE DESSERT
ingredients
1-1/2  cups graham cracker crumbs
1/3  cup finely chopped pecans
1/3  cup sugar
1/3  cup butter or margarine, melted
2  pkg (8 oz) cream cheese, softened
1  can (14 oz) sweetened condensed milk
2  eggs
1/2  cup lemon juice
preparation
      In a bowl combine the cracker crumbs, pecans and sugar, add butter, mix well (set aside 1/2 cup).  Press the remaining crumb mixture into greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish.  Bake at 325 degrees for 8 minutes.  Meanwhile, in a small bowl beat the cream cheese until smooth.  Add the milk, eggs and lemon juice, beat until smooth.  Spoon over crust.  Sprinkle with the reserved crumb mixture.  Bake for 30 minutes or until center is almost set.  Cool on a wire rack.  Store in refrigerator.  16 to 20 servings.

CHERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1 1/2 or 2  cans cherry pie filling
1/2  pkg. white cake mix
1/2  c. coconut
1/2  c. nuts
1/2  c. melted butter
preparation
  Place cherry pie filling mix in a buttered 9 x 12 pan.  Mix cake mix, coconut and chopped nuts and spread evenly over cherries. Drizzle butter over dry cake mix.  Bake in 350° oven for 45 minutes or until nicely browned.

CREAM PUFF DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. water
1  stick butter
1  c. flour
1/4  tsp salt
4  eggs
1 8  oz. pkg. cream cheese, softened
2  pkg. of instant pudding-any flavor
  cool whip
  Optional:  chocolate syrup or caramel syrup
preparation
      Bring to boil water and butter until butter melts.  All at once, add flour and salt.  Stir until dough comes away from sides of pan.  Let cool 5 minutes.  Beat eggs in one at a time.  Spread in 1 inch deep cookie sheet type pan.  Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes.  Pierce with fork all over.  Let cool before putting topping on.  For topping, make pudding according to package directions, then beat in cream cheese.  Spread over crust.  Top with cool whip.  Put on topping of choice if desired (chocolate or caramel syrup, etc.).

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

PUMPKIN PIE DESSERT
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  can pumpkin
4  eggs
1  can evaporated milk
1 1/2  c. sugar
1  tsp. salt
2  tsp. pumpkin pie spice
1  yellow cake mix (dry)
2  sticks butter, melted
1  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Combine first 6 ingredients. Place in 9 x 13 baking dish. Sprinkle with dry cake mix. Pour melted butter on top. Top with nuts. Bake 1 hour at 350°.

ICE CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
2-1/2  c. Kelloggs Crispix cereal, crushed
1  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. margarine, melted
3/4-1  c. coconut, shredded
1/2  gal. vanilla ice cream, softened
preparation
      Mix first four ingredients.  Press half of the mixture into a 9 x 13 greased pan.  Spoon 1/2 gal. softened ice cream onto mixture in pan.  Press second half of mixture on top of ice cream. Freeze until ready to serve or until ice cream is frozen.
      Variation:  Add 1/3 c. caramel on top of the first layer of ice cream.

STRAWBERRY DESSERT
(Frozen)  
ingredients
1  c. flour
1/4  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1/2  c. melted butter
2  egg whites
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  c. sugar
1  c. whipping cream
1  pkg. frozen fresh strawberries
preparation
      Stir together first 4 ingredients in a large casserole dish. Save 1/2 cup of this mixture to sprinkle over the top later.  Set aside.  Put the rest in the oven and bake 15 to 20 minutes at 350°.  Stir often and smooth out to form a crust on the bottom of dish.  Mix egg whites, lemon juice, sugar and strawberries.  Beat until fluffy.  Set aside while you beat the whipping cream.  Add 3 tablespoons sugar, one tablespoon at a time and a pinch of salt. Combine fluffy mix and whipping cream mix.  Pour over crust, then sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup you saved from the bottom of the casserole.  Freeze.  This is cut into squares to serve.  It is best to let it sit about 10 minutes before serving.

CHOCOLATE ECLAIR DESSERT
ingredients
2 small  boxes instant vanilla pudding mix
3  c. milk
1  (8 oz.) Cool Whip
  box of graham crackers
  can of milk chocolate frosting (ready to spread)
preparation
      Mix instant pudding and milk. Beat 3 minutes. Fold in Cool Whip; stir well. Line 9 x 13 inch pan with graham crackers; cover with pudding mixture. Continue layering graham crackers and pudding mixture. Cover top of dessert with a layer of graham crackers. Add melted chocolate frosting to top.
