Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

STRAWBERRY GRAHAM DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. graham cracker crumbs
2  Tbsp. butter or margarine, melted
1  pkg. (3 oz.) strawberry Jell-O
1  c. boiling water
1  pkg. (16 oz.) frozen, sweetened sliced strawberries, thawed
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
4  oz. cream cheese, softened
1/2  c. powdered sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
  dash of salt
1  c. whipping cream, whipped (or use Cool Whip)
  fresh strawberries, optional
preparation
      In small bowl, combine cracker crumbs and butter; set aside 1 Tbsp. for topping.  Press remaining crumb mixture into 8 inch square pan.  Bake at 325° for 10 to 14 minutes, until golden brown.  Cool.
      In bowl, dissolve gelatin in boiling water; stir in strawberries and lemon juice.  Refrigerate until partially set, about 1 1/2 hours.
      In small mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla and salt until smooth.  Fold in whipped cream.  Spread half over cooled crust.  Pour gelatin mixture over filling. Refrigerate until firm.  Top with remaining cream mixture. Sprinkle with reserved crumb mixture.  Refrigerate overnight. Garnish with fresh strawberries, if desired.  9 servings.

BANANA SPLIT DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. graham cracker crumbs
2  eggs
1  tsp. vanilla
1 (16 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained (reserve juice)
1  (9 oz.) Cool Whip
  chopped nuts
  maraschino cherries
  chocolate syrup
1 2/3  c. margarine
2  c. powdered sugar
3  bananas
preparation
      Melt 2/3 cup margarine.  Stir in graham cracker crumbs and press in 9 x 13 baking dish.  Beat remaining margarine with eggs, powdered sugar and vanilla.  Spread over crumb mixture.  Slice bananas; dip in pineapple juice and arrange on egg mixture.  Place pineapple on top of bananas and top with Cool Whip.  Drizzle with chocolate syrup; sprinkle chopped nuts and maraschino cherries over top.  Chill for 8 hours.

TWINKIE DESSERT
ingredients
1  box (10 pieces) twinkies
2  bananas
1 large  pkg. instant vanilla pudding and pie filling mix (6 servings)
1  small container frozen whipped topping, thawed
preparation
      Layer the twinkies in a 9 inch square pan. (They just fit so do not eat any.) Peel and slice bananas, arrange slices on top of twinkies. Prepare vanilla pudding, spread over bananas. Spread whipped topping over bananas and pudding. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.

LEMON DESSERT
ingredients
3  eggs
2  lemons
1  can condensed milk
1  box vanilla wafers
1  pt. heavy whipping cream
preparation
      Beat 3 egg yolks.  Add rind of 1 lemon and the juice of 2 lemons.  Add can of condensed milk and stir until thick.  Crush 1/2 box of wafers and put on bottom of 8 x 8-inch pan.  Pour mixture over crumbs, then spread the whipped cream over mixture.  Add the remaining crushed wafers and refrigerate for several hours before serving.

ICE CREAM DESSERT
ingredients
1/2  gal. ice cream, softened
1  stick margarine or butter
3 or 4  oz. almonds, sliced
1  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. chopped nuts
2 1/2  c. Rice Chex, crushed (measure before crushing)
preparation
      Mix all ingredients, except ice cream.  Press 1/2 of mixture into bottom of 9 x 13 pan.  Spread with ice cream.  Sprinkle remaining mixture over the ice cream.  Freeze for 4 to 6 hours. Serves 12.

4 LAYER BUTTERSCOTCH DESSERT
ingredients
1/4  c. brown sugar
1  c. flour
1  stick margarine
1  c. chopped pecans
3 1/2  c. milk
2  boxes instant butterscotch pudding
1  c. Cool Whip
8  oz. cream cheese
1  c. powdered sugar
preparation
	Melt margarine and add brown sugar, flour and pecans. Press ingredients into 9 x 13 glass baking dish. Bake at 325° for 20 minutes. Let cool.
	 Mix with mixer the milk and pudding.
	Mix Cool Whip, cream cheese and powdered sugar in a separate bowl. Spread this mixture over the baked portion, then pour pudding over second layer.
	Fourth Layer: Spread remaining Cool Whip on top and garnish with pecans.

PEANUT BUTTER DESSERT
ingredients
2 1/4  c. crushed peanut butter cookies (don't use low-fat)
1/4  c. sugar
1/4  c. butter or margarine, melted
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1  c. confectioners sugar
1 (8 oz.)  carton frozen whipped topping, thawed and divided
2 1/2  c. cold milk
2 (3.9 oz.)  pkg. instant chocolate pudding mix
  additional peanut butter cookies, crushed
preparation
      In a bowl, combine the crushed cookies, sugar and butter; press into ungreased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish, bottom only. Bake at 350° for 6 to 8 minutes or until golden brown. Cool.
      In a mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese and confectioners sugar; fold in 1 cup whipped topping.  Spread over cooled crust. In another mixing bowl, beat milk and pudding mix on low speed for 2 minutes or until thickened.  Spread over cream cheese layer.  Top with remaining whipped topping; sprinkle with cookie pieces. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

LEMON DELIGHT DESSERT
ingredients
1  large angel food cake (10-inch size)
1/2  c. lemon juice
1  can sweetened condensed milk
1  pt. whipping cream
  shredded coconut
preparation
      Break cake into bite-sized pieces. Mix lemon juice with sweetened condensed milk and stir until well mixed. Whip cream; put the 2 together. Put 1/2 of the cake in a 9 x 13 pan, then half the mixture. Top with the other 1/2 of the cake pieces and the rest of the mixture. Sprinkle top with coconut. Refrigerate overnight.

CHERRY OR BERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. butter
1 1/4  c. sugar
4  eggs
1  tsp. almond extract
2  c. flour
2  tsp. baking powder
1  can cherry pie filling
  powdered sugar to dust top
preparation
      In large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs. Beat until light. Add almond extract. Stir in flour and baking powder. Mix until smooth. Butter 9 X 13 pan. Turn batter into pan. Spoon filling into the cake in 16 spots evenly. Bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes. Dust with powdered sugar.
      Other berry pie filling may be substituted.

SNAPPY PUMPKIN DESSERT
Crust:
ingredients
2 1/2  c. finely crushed gingersnaps, about 40 cookies
1/2  c. butter or margarine, melted
preparation
      Combine gingersnap crumbs and butter.  Press into an ungreased 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking pan.  Bake at 325° for 10 minutes.  Cool.
Filling:
ingredients
1  pkg. (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
1/2  c. powdered sugar
2  Tbsp. milk
preparation
      In a mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese, powdered sugar and milk until fluffy. Spread over the crust.
Topping:
ingredients
3  c. cold milk
2  pkg. (3.4 oz. each) instant vanilla pudding mix
1  can (15 oz.) solid-pack pumpkin
2 1/2  tsp. pumpkin pie spice
2  c. whipped topping
  additional whipped topping, optional
preparation
      Beat milk and pudding mix for 1 minute.  Add pumpkin and pie spice; beat until well blended.  Fold in whipped topping.  Spread over the cream cheese layer.  Refrigerate for at least 3 hours. Cut into squares; garnish with whipped topping if desired.  Yield: 12-15 servings.

CHOCOLATE CLAIR DESSERT
ingredients
2 (4 oz.)  pkg. French vanilla instant pudding mix
3  c. plus 3 Tbsp. milk, divided
8  oz. whipped topping
1 (12 oz.)  pkg. graham crackers
6  Tbsp. butter
2 (1 oz.)  sq. semi-sweet chocolate
1 3/4  c. confectioners sugar
preparation
      Combine pudding mix and 3 cups milk in large bowl. Prepare pudding using package directions. Add whipped topping, beating with electric mixer set at medium speed until blended. Arrange a layer of graham crackers in bottom of a 13 x 9-inch dish. Spread half of pudding mixture. Add a second layer of graham crackers. Spread remaining pudding mixture. Top with another layer of graham crackers. Combine butter and chocolate in small saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring frequently, until chocolate melts. Stir in remaining milk. Place confectioners sugar in medium bowl. Add chocolate. Beat at medium speed until icing is a spreadable consistency. Spread over layers. Chill, covered, for 8 hours. Cut into squares and serve.

STRAWBERRY PRETZEL DESSERT
ingredients
2  c. crushed pretzels
3/4  c. low fat margarine or butter, melted
1  c. plus 3 Tbsp. Splenda or sugar
1 - 8  oz. pkg. low fat or regular cream cheese, softened
1 - 20  oz. can unsweetened crushed pineapple
2  pkg. sugar-free or regular strawberry jell-O
2 - 10  oz. pkg. sliced unsweetened or sweetened sliced strawberries
preparation
      Combine pretzels, margarine, and sugar.  Spray a 9 x 13 baking dish with non-stick spray and press pretzel mixture into the bottom.  Bake at 400° for 18-20 minutes.  Cool.
      In a small bowl, beat cream cheese, and remaining 1 c. of sugar until smooth.  Fold in cool whip and spread over cooled crust. Refrigerate.  Drain pineapple, reserving juice; set pineapple aside.  Add water to juice to make 1 c. Put in small saucepan and bring to boil.  Pour into large bowl and stir in jell-O.  Drain berries, reserving juice.  Add water to juice to make 1 1/2 c. and stir this into jell-O mixture.  Refrigerate until partially set. Stir in all fruits and spoon over cream cheese layer.  Cover and chill 3-4 hours.  Makes 18 servings.

STRAWBERRY CREAM DESSERT
(Prep: 15 Minutes Plus Refrigerating)  
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. ladyfingers, split
1 (8-serving size)  pkg. or 2 (4 serving size) pkg. Jell-O
 Brand strawberry flavor, sugar-free, low-calorie gelatin
1  pt. (2 c.) strawberries
1 3/4  c. boiling water
2  c. ice cubes
1  (8 oz.) tub Cool Whip
 lite whipped topping, thawed
preparation
      Trim 3/4-inch from ends of ladyfingers; place ends on bottom of 9-inch spring-form pan. Stand remaining ladyfingers around side of pan with cut sides facing in. Reserve 2 strawberries for garnish; mash remaining strawberries.
      Stir boiling water into gelatin in large bowl at least 2 minutes until completely dissolved. Add ice cubes; stir until melted. Add whipped topping and mashed strawberries; stir gently with wire whisk until well blended. Refrigerate 10 minutes or until mixture is very thick and will mound. Spoon into pan. Refrigerate 3 hours or until firm. Remove side of pan. Garnish with reserved strawberries. Makes 12 servings.

PINEAPPLE DESSERT
ingredients
2  cans 20 oz. pineapple chunk (drained)
2/3  c. sugar
3  Tbsp. flour
1  c. mild cheddar cheese
24  Ritz Crackers
1  stick margarine
preparation
      Arrange drained pineapple in baking dish.  Mix sugar and flour together and sprinkle over pineapple.  Then, sprinkle cheddar cheese over this.  Melt margarine and then break up Ritz Crackers in small pieces and mix in with margarine.  Cover top with rest of mixture.  Bake at 325 degrees for 30 minutes or until brown on top.

SUMMER SURPRISE DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. fresh seedless grapes, halved
1  c. fresh whole blueberries
1  c. fresh strawberries, halved
1  c. firmly packed brown sugar
preparation
      In shallow 9 x 12-inch glass dish, combine all fruit and mix well.  Sprinkle brown sugar over fruit.  Top with sour cream. Cover with plastic wrap; refrigerate 3 to 4 hours or overnight. The sour cream will seep through the brown sugar to the fruit.  To serve, gently stir the fruit; spoon into sherbet glasses.
      Tip: Any combination of fruits may be used - fresh plums, kiwi, raspberries, pitted Bing cherries, etc. However, fresh peaches, fresh grapes and fresh blueberries are a necessity. Frozen or canned fruits are not recommended.

EASY DESSERT
ingredients
1  stick margarine
1  can crushed pineapple
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1  box Jiffy yellow cake mix
2  cans fruit pie filling
preparation
      Drain pineapple and place on bottom of square casserole pan. Add fruit filling. Cover with yellow cake mix and nuts. Cut small pieces of margarine and place on top of cake mix. Bake at 325° for 30 minutes.

APPLE DESSERT
ingredients
1  can apple pie filling
2  tsp. cinnamon
3  c. flour
1  c. sugar
1 1/2  c. milk
1/2  c. margarine
3  tsp. baking powder
1  tsp. salt
3  eggs
1/4  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. chopped nuts
2  Tbsp. melted margarine
preparation
      Mix cinnamon in pie filling.  Cream sugar and margarine.  Add eggs; mix well.  Add flour, milk, baking powder and salt.  Mix well.  Pour into greased 9 x 13-inch baking pan 1/2 of batter. Spoon 1/2 apple pie filling over batter.  Repeat with remaining batter and pie filling.  Sprinkle brown sugar and nuts on top. Drizzle with melted butter.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.  Cool for 20 minutes.
Glaze:
ingredients
3/4  c. 10x sugar
1  Tbsp. margarine
3/4  tsp. vanilla
2 to 3  tsp. water
preparation
      Mix. Glaze cooled cake.

BLUEBERRY ANGEL DESSERT
ingredients
1- 8  oz. pkg cream cheese (softened)
1  c. powdered sugar
1- 8  oz. carton Cool Whip
1-  (14-16 oz.) Angel food cake cut into 1 inch cubes
2  cans blueberry pie filling
preparation
      In a large bowl beat cream cheese and powdered sugar.  Fold in Cool Whip an cake cubes.  Spread evenly into an ungreased 9x13 inch dish.  Top with pie filling and refrigerate at least 2 hours before cutting.

STRAWBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1  1/2 sliced bananas
1  qt. washed and drained strawberries
2  pkg. strawberry glaze
1/4  c. 7-up
1  large angel food cake
1  large bowl cool whip
preparation
      Mix together strawberries, bananas, strawberry glaze and 7-up. Pinch angel food cake into small pieces.  Stir cake into fruit mixture and top with cool whip.  Garnish with strawberry slices. Chill and serve.

HOLIDAY DESSERT PIZZA
ingredients
1 (20 oz.)  pkg. refrigerated cookie dough
8  oz. light cream cheese, softened
1/3  c. sugar
1  tsp. grated orange peel
1  tsp. vanilla extract
1 (11 oz.)  can Mandarin orange segments, drained
1 (8 oz.)  can crushed pineapple in juice, drained
4  kiwi fruit, peeled and sliced
1/4  c. apricot jam, melted
preparation
      Press dough onto 14-inch pizza pan.  Bake in 350° oven 15 to 20 minutes until browned and puffed.  Cool completely.  Beat cream cheese, sugar, orange peel and vanilla until blended.  Spread over cooled cookie.  Arrange fruit over cream cheese.  Brush with jam. Serves 12.

HEATH BAR DESSERT
ingredients
1  box vanilla wafers
1  stick butter, melted
2 small  boxes instant vanilla pudding
1  qt. French vanilla or butter pecan ice cream, softened
2  c. milk
4  Heath bars, crushed
1  large container Cool Whip
preparation
	Crush vanilla wafers with rolling pin or food processor. Mix with melted butter. Press into a 9 x 13-inch pan, reserving some for garnish. Mix the instant pudding with milk, then add the softened ice cream and blend together. Pour over crust mixture. Top with Cool Whip. Sprinkle Heath bars on top along with remaining crust mix. Refrigerate 2 hours. (Ice cream should be soft but not completely melted.)

PUMPKIN PECAN DESSERT
Cake:
ingredients
  2-15 oz. cans solid pack pumpkin
  1-12 oz. can evaporated milk
1  c. sugar
3  eggs
1  tsp. Griffin's Vanilla
1  pkg. yellow cake mix
1  c. melted butter
1-1/2  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Line a 13x9x2 baking pan with wax paper and coat paper with non-stick spray, set aside.
      In large mixing bowl, combine pumpkin, milk, and sugar.  Beat eggs and vanilla.  Pour into pan.  Sprinkle with dry cake mix. Drizzle with melted butter.  Sprinkle on pecans.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until golden brown.
      Cool completely and then turn upside down on platter. Carefully remove wax paper.
Frosting:
ingredients
  1-8 oz. pkg. cream cheese, soften
  1-12 oz. carton Cool Whip (thaw)
1  tsp. Griffin's Vanilla
1-1/2  c. powdered sugar
preparation
      In large mixing bowl beat cream cheese, powdered sugar and vanilla until smooth.  Fold in whipped topping.  Frost dessert. Keep refrigerated.  Serves 16.

ICE CREAM DESSERT
(Lemon-Lime Delight)  
ingredients
1-1/2  cups of crushed Ritz crackers
1  stick margarine
1/4  cup sugar
1  quart of lime sherbet
1  quart of vanilla ice cream
3/4  cup sugar
4  Tbsp lemon juice
6  Tbsp butter or margarine
2  egg yolks
  whipped cream
preparation
      Mix crackers margarine and sugar and press into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan.  Set aside.  Let Sherbet and ice cream soften and mix together.  Spread over the crust and freeze.  Mix sugar, lemon juice and butter together and cook on low heat until dissolved. Add a little of the hot mixture to 2 egg yolks.  Mix well and pour back into saucepan with other hot mixture.  Bring to a boil and cook one minute.  Cool thoroughly and spread over ice cream.  Serve with dollop of whipped cream and lime slice.

TIRAMISU TOFFEE DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. (10.75 oz.) frozen pound cake, thawed and cut into 9 slices
3/4  c. strong coffee
1  c. sugar
1/2  c. chocolate flavored syrup
1  pkg. (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
2  c. whipping (heavy) cream
2  bars (1.4 oz. each) chocolate-covered toffee candy, chopped
preparation
      Arrange cake slices on bottom of rectangular baking dish, 11 x 7 x 1 1/2 inches, cutting cake slices if necessary to cover bottom of dish. Drizzle coffee over cake. Beat sugar, chocolate syrup and cream cheese until smooth. Add whipping cream. Beat on medium speed until light and fluffy. Spread over cake. Sprinkle with candy. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour, but no longer than 24 hours to set dessert and blend flavors.

EASY DESSERT
ingredients
1 21  oz. can cherry pie filling
1 15 1/4  oz. can crushed pineapple
1  box yellow cake mix
1  c. chopped pecans
1  c. butter or margarine
preparation
      Spread pie filling and pineapple in the bottom of a greased 9 x 13 pan. Cover fruit evenly with cake mix.  Sprinkle pecans evenly on top.  Top evenly with pats of butter or margarine.  Bake in preheated 350° oven for 1 hour.  Serves 8 - 10.  Top with whipped cream or Cool Whip.

LITE LEMONY DESSERT
ingredients
1  can lemon pie filling
1  (8 oz.) lemon non-fat yogurt
1  (8 oz.) cool whip lite
1  angel food cake
preparation
      Stir pie filling, yogurt and Cool Whip until mixed well. Break cake into bite-size pieces.  Layer filling, cake, filling, etc. into container.  Garnish with lemon slices if desired.  Can also be used as frosting.  Slice cake into 3 or 4 layers and frost between each layer with filling/yogurt/Cool Whip mixture.

CHERRY CHIFFON DESSERT
ingredients
1 (21 oz.)  can Thank You cherry or light cherry pie filling
1 (14 oz.)  can sweetened condensed milk or 1 c. (8 oz. carton) frozen whipped topping, thawed
1 (15 oz.)  can crushed or chunk pineapple, drained
1  c. miniature marshmallows
preparation
      Combine ingredients in large bowl, folding together until blended.  Spoon into decorative serving bowl.  Chill.  Makes 12 to 14 servings.  Preparation time: 5 minutes.  Chill time: 30 minutes.
      Try this recipe with Thank You peach or strawberry, too.  For a lighter dessert, use light whipped topping.  Use pineapple packed in juice.

PEACHY DESSERT
ingredients
1  box mixed fruit Jello
1  c. hot Water
1 small  can sliced peaches, drained
1 small  can Mandarin Oranges, drained
8  oz. carton Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix jello and hot water.  Add fruit.  Let set 1 hour in refrigerator.  Mix in cool whip. Refrigerate.

FLUFFY LIME DESSERT
ingredients
1/4  c. butter or margarine
1  c. graham cracker crust crumbs
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime flavored gelatin
1  c. boiling water
1 (14 oz.)  can Eagle Brand milk
1 (8 oz.)  can crushed pineapple
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
4  c. miniature marshmallows
1  c. whipped cream
preparation
      In small saucepan, melt butter and stir in graham cracker crumbs.  Pat firmly in 11 x 7 pan; chill.  In large bowl, dissolve gelatin in boiling water.  Stir in sweetened milk, pineapple and lemon juice.  Fold in marshmallows and Cool Whip.  Pour in prepared pan. Chill for two hours.

BANANA SPLIT DESSERT
ingredients
2  or 3 bananas
1  c. chopped nuts (optional)
  graham cracker crumbs
2  c. powdered sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
1/2  gal. Neapolitan ice cream
1  c. chocolate chips
1/2  c. oleo
1 1/2  c. evaporated milk (12 oz.)
1  pt. Cool Whip
preparation
      Cover bottom of 11 x 15-inch pan with graham cracker crumbs. Reserve 1 cup of crumbs. Slice bananas and layer over crumbs. Slice frozen ice cream in 1/2-inch slices and lay over bananas. Sprinkle nuts over ice cream and until firm. You can save some nuts to sprinkle on top also.
      Melt chocolate chips and oleo; add powdered sugar and evaporated milk. Cook until thick and smooth, constantly stirring. Remove from heat and add vanilla. Cool chocolate mixture and then pour over ice cream. Freeze again. Spread Cool Whip over chocolate and top with reserved crumbs. Store in freezer. Remove about 10 minutes before serving.

BANANA CHEESECAKE DESSERT
ingredients
2 (21.4 oz.)  pkg. strawberry no-bake cheesecake mix
3/4  c. butter, melted
1/4  c. sugar
3  c. cold milk
1 (8 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, well drained
3  medium firm bananas, sliced
1/2  c. chocolate ice cream topping, warmed and divided
1/2  c. caramel ice cream topping, warmed and divided
1 (8 oz.)  carton frozen whipped topping, thawed
1/3  c. chopped pecans
  maraschino cherries with stems
preparation
      Set aside filling and strawberry topping packets from cheesecake mixes. Place the contents of the crust mix packets in a large bowl; add butter and sugar. Press into an ungreased 13 x 9 x 2-inch dish.
      In a large mixing bowl, combine the milk and contents of filling packets. Beat at low speed until well blended. Beat on high for 3 minutes or until slightly thickened. Spread over the crust. Refrigerate for 1 hour.
      Spread contents of strawberry topping packets over cheesecake. Top with pineapple and bananas. Drizzle with 1/4 cup of chocolate and 1/4 cup of caramel toppings. Spread with whipped topping (dish will be full). Refrigerate for 2 hours or until set.
       Before serving, drizzle with remaining chocolate and caramel toppings. Top with pecans and cherries. Yields 16 to 20 servings.

PUMPKIN THING DESSERT
(Good for Thanksgiving)  
ingredients
1  box yellow cake mix, reserve 1 c.
1/2  c. butter or margarine
1  egg, beaten
1 large  can pumpkin
3  eggs, beaten
1/2  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. white sugar
2/3  c. evaporated milk
1 1/2  tsp. cinnamon
1/2  c. chopped walnuts
1/4  c. butter or margarine
preparation
  Grease 9 x 13 baking pan; preheat oven to 350°.  Mix 1/2 cup butter and 1 beaten egg with the cake mix.  Spread and press into the prepared cake pan.  Beat pumpkin, 3 eggs, both sugars, cinnamon and milk.  Pour over cake mix in pan.  Mix reserved 1 cup cake mix, nuts and 1/4 cup butter until mixture is crumbly.  Sprinkle over top of pumpkin mixture.  Bake 50 to 60 minutes or until it tests done.

CHOCOLATE DESSERT
ingredients
1  c. flour
1  c. chopped nuts
1  stick butter
1  c. powdered sugar
1  c. Cool Whip
1  (8 oz.) pkg cream cheese
1  pkg. instant vanilla pudding
1  pkg. instant chocolate pudding
3  c. milk
  shaved chocolate
preparation
      Blend together flour, nuts and butter.  Press in bottom of 9 x 13 inch pan.  Bake 20 minutes at 350°.  Mix powdered sugar, Cool Whip and cream cheese and spread on top of cooled crust.  Mix together the chocolate and vanilla pudding with the milk and spread over the cream cheese mixture.  Top with Cool Whip and shaved chocolate.

OREO DESSERT
ingredients
1 large  pkg. Oreo cookies
16  oz. cool whip
8  oz. cream cheese
1 large.  pkg. instant chocolate pudding
1  stick melted butter
1  c. sugar
preparation
      Mix cool whip, cream cheese, and sugar together.  Make pudding by directions on box.  Crush cookies and mix with butter.  Put layer of cookie mixture on bottom, then layer of pudding.  Then layer of cool whip mixture, top with cookies and refrigerate.

PINEAPPLE DESSERT
ingredients
2  cans pineapple chunks, drained well
3/4  c. sugar
5  Tbsp. flour
1 1/2  c. sharp Cheddar cheese
1  sleeve Ritz crackers, coarsely crumbled
1  stick butter, melted
preparation
	Preheat oven to 350°. In a buttered 9 x 13 baking dish, place the drained pineapple chunks.
	 In a separate bowl, combine the sugar and flour and spread over the pineapple. Sprinkle the cheese over the flour mixture. With your hands, you can crumble the Ritz crackers and sprinkle over the cheese mixture. Melt the butter and drizzle evenly over the cracker. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until dessert is bubbling.

KAHLUA DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. chocolate cake mix
2 small  boxes instant chocolate pudding (3.9 oz.)
1  c. Kahlua
1 (16 oz.)  carton Cool Whip
6  Heath bars
preparation
      Mix and bake cake mix according to package instructions. When cooled, break into pieces into large bowl. Prepare pudding according to directions. Add Kahlua. Pour over cake. Top with Cool Whip and then the Heath bar, crushed.

EASY CHERRY DESSERT
ingredients
1  can cherry pie filling
1  container cool whip
1  can pineapple, drained
1  can sweetened, condensed milk
1  cup pecans, chopped
1  cup miniature marshmallows
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together.  Place in a 9 by 13 container. This dessert can be frozen.

PISTACHIO PINEAPPLE DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. family size pistachio pudding
1 (16 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
1  pkg. Dream Whip, made up
1/2  c. nuts
preparation
      Mix all and chill before serving.

FRUIT FILLED LAYERED ANGEL DESSERT
ingredients
1  pkg. white angel food cake mix
1 (3 1/2 oz.)  pkg. vanilla instant pudding mix
2  c. skim milk
1  (8 oz.) container Cool Whip, thawed
1  pt. strawberries, cut into 1/2 or 1/4's
1  kiwi fruit, peeled
preparation
      Bake and cool cake as directed on box.  Trim brown crust from cake.  Tear cake into about 1-inch pieces.  Prepare pudding as directed on box, using skim milk.  Fold in 2 cups whipped topping.
      Place 1/3 of cake pieces in 3-quart glass serving bowl. Top with 1/3 of the pudding mixture, 1/2 of the strawberries, 1/3 of the cake pieces and 1/3 of the pudding mixture. Slice kiwi fruit; cut into halves. Place slices against side of bowl. Top with remaining cake pieces, pudding and strawberries. Refrigerate at least 4 hours. Garnish with whipped topping.

CREAM CHEESE DESSERT
ingredients
2  pkg. crescent rolls
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  c. sugar
1  egg
1/2  c. sugar
1 1/2  tsp. cinnamon
1/2  c. chopped pecans or walnuts
preparation
      Press 1 package crescent rolls over bottom of a greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Be sure all seams are closed (can put the roll between 2 pieces of wax paper and roll to size). Beat cream cheese, sugar and egg. Pour over unbaked crust. Press or roll out second package of rolls as before, being sure all seams are closed, then flip onto cheese mixture. Pinch edges together. Mix together the 1/2 cup sugar, cinnamon and nuts. Brush crust with slightly beaten egg white so it will hold the cinnamon mixture in place. Sprinkle cinnamon mixture on top. Bake in preheated 350° oven for 30 minutes.

CHOCOLATE DESSERT
ingredients
1/2  c. melted margarine
2  tsp. sugar
1/2  c. ground nuts
1  c. flour
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  c. powdered sugar
1  (16 oz.) container Cool Whip
3  c. milk
2  pkg. instant chocolate pudding
preparation
      Mix together melted margarine, sugar, nuts and flour. Spread in a 9 x 13-inch pan and bake in preheated 375° oven for 10 to 15 minutes. Let cool and press down.
      Beat together cream cheese, powdered sugar and only 1 cup Cool Whip and spread on top of cooled crust.
       In medium bowl, beat together milk and instant chocolate pudding and pour on top of cream cheese layer. Spread on remaining Cool Whip. Sprinkle with chopped nuts. Refrigerate.

CRISP BAKED FISH FILETS
ingredients
1  lb. fish filets
2  Tbsp. oil
1/3  c. cornflake crumbs
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Preheat oven to 500°. Wash and dry filets and cut into serving pieces. Dip in oil and coat with cornflake crumbs. Arrange in single layer in a lightly oiled shallow baking dish so that the pieces do not touch each other. Season. Bake 10 minutes without turning or basting. Serves 4.

TUNA FISH SALAD PLATE
ingredients
2  cans solid albacore tuna (packed in water)
2  stalks chopped celery
1/2  Granny Smith apple (unpeeled)
1  tsp. finely minced onion
2 small sweet pickles, chopped or 2  tsp. pickle relish
1/2  c. green grapes, washed and cut in quarters
1/4  c. sliced almonds
  Miracle Whip (sparingly)
preparation
      Drain off all water from tuna.  Separate and mash tuna with a fork.  Mix all ingredients.  Add small amount of Miracle Whip at a time, just enough to hold mixture together.  Chill in refrigerator. Place chilled lettuce leaves on plates.  Add tuna salad (a nice size serving) in middle of lettuce.  Arrange sliced fresh orange, pear halves, tomato wedges, sliced avocado and few ripe olives to garnish.  Serve with crisp crackers.

GRILLED FISH AND SHRIMP
ingredients
4  fish fillets
1  lb. large shrimp, cleaned
1/2  c. butter
  juice of 2 lemons
1 or 2  cloves garlic, pressed
  Greek seasoning
1  bell pepper
1/2  c. onion, chopped
1  tomato, chopped
preparation
      Melt butter; add lemon juice and garlic and simmer 1 minute. Season fish and shrimp lightly with Greek seasoning.  Place fish and shrimp in a large sheet of heavy foil with top loosely opened. Baste heavily with lemon butter and garlic sauce.  Add chopped tomato, onion and green pepper.  Place on an outdoor grill and cook about 5 minutes.  This may be baked in oven with foil closed.
      Scallops may be substituted for shrimp.

FISH STOCK
ingredients
2  c. white wine
2  c. water or chicken broth
2  lbs. fish heads, bones or shells
1  onion
3  springs parsley
1  bay leaf
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  tsp. fresh tarragon, minced
1  tsp. lemon peel, grated
6  peppercorns, lightly crushed
2  whole cloves
1/2  c. mushroom stems (or 1 Tbsp. concentrate)
1  tsp. salt
1  Tbsp. butter
preparation
      Combine all ingredients in a soup kettle, cover and slowly bring to boil skimming as needed. Lower heat and simmer 1 hour. Strain, cool and refrigerate. Stock has a 4-day shelf life, so it's best to freeze unless using immediately.
      Note: See Soup Stock Basics for storage information.

HERBED FISH AND VEGETABLES
ingredients
2  sheets (12x18 inches each) heavy duty aluminum foil
2  fish fillets (4 to 6 oz. each), thawed
2  tbsp. sliced green onions
1  pkg. (16 oz.) frozen broccoli, carrots and cauliflower
1/2  tsp. dried thyme
1/2  tsp. dried marjoram
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  tbsp. butter or margarine, cut in pieces
  Lemon juice
preparation
      Preheat oven to 450 degrees or grill to medium-high.  Spray foil with nonstick cooking spray.  Center one fish fillet on each sheet of foil.  Top with green onions; place frozen vegetables around fish.  Sprinkle fish with thyme, marjoram, salt and pepper. Top with margarine.  Bring up foil sides.  Double fold top and ends to seal packet, leaving room for heat circulation inside. Repeat to make two jackets. Bake 18-20 minutes on a cookie sheet in oven or grill 10-12 minutes in covered grill.  Drizzle with lemon juice.  Makes 2 servings.

MEDITERRANEAN FISH FILLET CASSEROLE
ingredients
6  Gorton's Crunchy Golden Fish Fillets, Garlic & Herb or Lemon
3  cups cooked rice
  1-16 oz can cut green beans, drained
1  medium onion, chopped
2  medium tomatoes, chopped
1  teaspoon salt
1/2  teaspoon dried basil leaves
1/2  teaspoon dried oregano leaves
1/3  cup pitted ripe olives
1/3  cup crumbled feta or grated parmesan cheese
preparation
      Place uncooked Gorton's Fillets in the bottom of an ungreased baking dish.  Mix all ingredients except cheese and spoon evenly over fillets.  Cover & cook in the oven at 375 for 25 minutes. Top with cheese.  Makes 6 servings.

FISH KABOBS
ingredients
2  lb. boneless halibut or swordfish, cut in cubes
2  tsp. Worcestershire
4  strips bacon
1 1/2  c. chili sauce
2  bell peppers (1 red, 1 green), cut into 1-inch squares
1  tsp. salt
  few dashes hot pepper sauce
preparation
      In a shallow pan, arrange the fish cubes in one layer.  Combine the chili sauce, Worcestershire, hot pepper sauce and salt.  Pour over fish and let stand for 1 to 2 hours.  Drain the fish, reserving the marinade.  Cut each piece of bacon into fourths.  On each of 8 skewers, string a fish cube, a piece of bacon, then a square of pepper.  Repeat, ending with a fish cube.  Grill 4 to 5 inches from heat for 10 to 12 minutes, basting a few times with reserved marinade.

CAJUN RUBBED FISH NUGGETS
ingredients
1  tsp garlic powder
4  tsp paprika
1  tsp dry mustard
1  tsp crushed peppercorns
1/4  tsp cayenne pepper
1/4  tsp finely crushed fennel seeds
preparation
      Brush BBQ grill with oil.  Turn to medium high.  Place Cajun Rub and 1 pound of fish nuggets in a paper bag.  Shake until pieces are well coated.  Thread onto pre-soaked skewers.  Cook on hot grill for 3 - 5 minutes each side.  Serve with lemon wedges, as an appetizer for 4 or as a main dish for 2.

BOUILLON POACHED FISH
ingredients
1  Tbsp. instant chicken bouillon or 1 c. chicken broth
1  c. water
1/2  c. thinly sliced carrots
1/2  c. chopped celery
1/2  c. chopped green pepper
1/2  c. chopped onion
1  lb. fresh or frozen, fish fillets (orange roughy or Tilapia really good!)
preparation
      In large skillet, or electric skillet, dissolve bouillon with water over medium heat.  Add vegetables, cover and simmer 10 minutes.  Add fish; cover and simmer 10 to 15 minutes.  4 servings.  Only 1 1/2 Weight Watcher Points per 4 oz. serving.

BROILED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
2  lb. fish fillets (1/4 to 1/2-inch thick), cut into serving sized pieces
1/4  c. margarine or butter, melted
preparation
      Arrange fish fillets, skin side up, on broiler pan.  Brush both sides of fish with margarine.  Broil 4 to 6 inches from heat for 5 to 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork.  Turn once and baste with margarine.  If desired, season with salt and pepper to taste.

FISH AND CHIPS
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. fresh fish fillets (sole, flounder, haddock or cod)
2  eggs, separated
1/2  c. beer
1/4  c. milk
1  c. all-purpose flour
1/2  tsp. seasoned salt
1/4  tsp. seasoned pepper
preparation
      Cut fillets into pieces, about 3 x 1 1/2-inches.  Place on paper towels to dry.  Beat egg yolks until thick and light. Blend in beer, milk, flour and seasonings.  Mix until smooth. Beat egg whites stiff but not dry; fold in.  Pat fillets dry.  Dip into batter, a few pieces at a time; lift out and drain slightly with fork or slotted spoon.  Fry in deep fat heated to 375° for 2 to 3 minutes until golden brown and puffed.  Drain on absorbent paper.  Serve with French fried potatoes.

HONEY FRIED FISH
ingredients
2  Eggs
1  Tbsp. Honey
1  c. finely crushed Ritz Crackers (about 22)
1/3  c. Flour
1/4  tsp. Salt
1/4  tsp. Pepper
1  lb. Fish Filet
  Vegetable Oil for Frying
  additional Honey
  Lemon Wedges
preparation
      In a bowl, beat Egg and Honey.  In another bowl combine the next 5 ingredients.  Dip Fillets into Egg and Honey mixture then coat with Cracker mixture.  In a large skillet, heat Oil.  Fry Fillets over medium heat for 3 - 4 minutes or until Fillet flakes easily with fork.  Drizzle with Honey and Lemon if desired. Yields:  4 servings.

TOM'S HERB-BAKED FISH (OR CHICKEN) AND RICE
ingredients
1 1/2  c. hot chicken bouillon
1/4  tsp. Italian seasonings
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen broccoli, thawed
1  can Durkee French fried onions
1  lb. fish fillets or boneless chicken breasts
1/2  c. uncooked regular rice
1/4  tsp. garlic
1  Tbsp. Parmesan cheese
  paprika
1/2  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°.  In an 8 x 12 dish, combine bouillon, rice and seasonings.  Bake, covered, for 10 minutes.  Top with broccoli, 1/2 can onions and Parmesan cheese.  Place fillets in dish; sprinkle with paprika.  Bake, covered, for 20 to 25 minutes. If using chicken, bake for about 40 to 45 minutes.  Stir rice. Top with Cheddar cheese and rest of onion.  Bake, uncovered, 3 minutes.  Serves 3 to 4.

TUNA FISH SPECIAL
ingredients
1 6-oz.  can tuna, drained and flaked
1  c. frozen peas, thawed
1/2  c. chopped celery
1/4  c. sliced green onions
1/3  c. mayonnaise
1  tsp. lemon juice
1/2  tsp. soy sauce
1/8  tsp. curry powder
  Dash garlic powder
2  Tbsp. slivered almonds, toasted
1  c. chow mein noodles
  Lettuce leaves, optional
preparation
      In a bowl, combine tuna, peas, celery and onions.  In another bowl, combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, soy sauce, curry powder and garlic powder; stir into tuna mixture.  Stir in almonds; top with noodles.  Serve on lettuce if desired.  Serves 2.

SMOKED FISH & CHEESE DIP
ingredients
1 1/2  c. flaked smoked fish
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  clove garlic, minced
2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
3  Tbsp. minced onions
  Salt to taste (skip if fish is really salty)
  strips of pimento (optional)
preparation
	Blend all ingredients & chill for several hours.  Garnish with pimento if desired.

FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
5  -6 medium potatoes, pared and cubed
3/4 - 1  lb. white fish (haddock or cod)
1  medium onion, chopped
2  stalks celery, chopped
1  bay leaf
1  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. olive oil
1/2  tsp. pepper
12  oz. evaporated milk
  paprika
2  Tbsp. butter
5 - 6  c. boiling water
preparation
      Sauté onion and celery in olive oil until tender.  Add potatoes and cover with boiling water.  Add bay leaf, salt and pepper.  Cook ten minutes. Then add cubed fish.  When all is cooked, add evaporated milk and heat through.  Add butter and sprinkle paprika on top.  Serve with crackers and salad.

BAKED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
1  lb. fresh  fish fillets
1 (10 1/2 oz.)  can condensed cream of celery soup
1/2  c. shredded cheddar cheese
preparation
      Arrange fillets in one layer in greased shallow pan.  Pour undiluted soup evenly over fillets. Sprinkle with cheese.  Bake about 15 minutes at 350°.  Serves 4.

FISH AND VEGETABLE PACKETS
ingredients
4  lean fish fillets (about 4 oz. each)
1  pkg. (16 oz.) frozen broccoli, cauliflower and carrots, thawed
1  Tbsp. chopped fresh or 1 tsp. dried dill weed
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/4  c. chicken broth
preparation
      Heat oven to 450°. Place each fish fillet on a 12 inch square of aluminum foil. Top each fish fillet with one fourth of the vegetables. Sprinkle with dill weed, salt and pepper. Drizzle 1 Tbsp. chicken broth over each mound of vegetables. Fold up sides of foil to make a tent; fold top edges over to seal. Fold in sides, making a packet; fold to seal. Place packets on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake about 20 minutes or until vegetables are crisp tender and fish flakes easily with fork.  This has 7 grams carbohydrates.

FRIED FISH BATTER
ingredients
2  c. cornmeal
4  tsp. salt
1  tsp. seasoned salt
1  tsp. black pepper
1  tsp. red pepper
preparation
      Mix ingredients together. Dredge fish in cornmeal mixture and fry at 350° until golden brown.

STEWED FISH
ingredients
1  lb. fish (whiting or trout)
  salt and pepper
1/2  c. water
  grated onion
preparation
      Place fish in pan. Add 1/2 cup of water, salt, pepper and grated onion. Cover the pan with a top and let stew for 30 minutes.

FISH CAKES
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. Stove Top stuffing mix
1/3  c. mayonnaise
2 (6 oz.)  cans crabmeat, drained and flaked (may use canned tuna)
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  c. Mozzarella cheese, shredded
1/2  c. chopped green onion
3/4  c. water
preparation
      Mix together all ingredients in a bowl. Cover and refrigerate 10 minutes.
      Heat large nonstick skillet sprayed with cooking spray on medium heat. Shape 1/3 handful of stuffing mixture into patties. Add to skillet in batches. Cook 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown on both sides, turning over occasionally.

NANCY'S FISH FANTASTIC
ingredients
2  lbs. fish fillets, frozen or fresh
  Juice of 1 lemon
  Salt and pepper to taste
1/2  onion, thinly sliced in rings
1/2  c. mushrooms, sliced
3/4  c. grated cheddar cheese
1  can (10-1/2 oz.) cream of mushroom soup
1  Tbsp. parsley, fresh or dried
preparation
      Spread fish fillets in a buttered baking dish.  Sprinkle with lemon juice, salt and pepper.  Layer with onions, then mushrooms, then cheese and finally concentrated mushroom soup.  Sprinkle with parsley.  Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.
      Yield:  6 servings.
       Variations:  Sole, haddock, perch or bass, sturgeon.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

CONGEALED TUNA FISH SALAD
ingredients
1  can tuna
1  c. celery, chopped
1 small  bottle stuffed olives, chopped
1 small  can pimento, chopped
1  pkg. lemon jello
1/2  envelope Knox gelatine
1/4  c. water
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  c. hot water
1  c. mayonnaise
preparation
	Dissolve Knox gelatine in 1/4 cup hot water; add lemon jello to the 2 cups of hot water and mix both gelatins together in serving dish. When almost set, add tuna, celery, lemon juice, olives, pimento and mayonnaise. Chill until firm. Serve on lettuce. Serves 8.

FISH AU GRATIN
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. frozen cod, haddock or flounder fillets
4  Tbsp. butter or margarine
1  green onion, thinly sliced
1/3  c. all-purpose flour
1/4  tsp. pepper
1 1/2  c. milk
1 (4 oz.)  pkg. shredded sharp Cheddar cheese (1 c.)
preparation
      ABOUT 45 MINUTES BEFORE SERVING: Remove frozen fish fillets from freezer; let stand at room temperature 15 minutes to thaw slightly.
      Preheat oven to 450°. With sharp knife, cut frozen fish crosswise into 4 pieces. Place fish in greased 10 x 6-inch baking dish; bake 25 minutes.
      Meanwhile, in 2-quart saucepan over medium heat, melt butter or margarine; add green onion and cook until tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in flour and pepper until blended. Gradually stir in milk; cook over medium heat until thickened, stirring. (Sauce will be thick.) Remove from heat. Reserve 2 tablespoons shredded cheese; stir remaining cheese into sauce until blended. Spoon cheese sauce over fish. Sprinkle with reserved cheese. Bake 3 to 4 minutes longer or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork and cheese is melted. Makes 4 main dish servings.

FRIED FISH
ingredients
  Fish, your choice
  salt
  flour, 1/3 c. or as needed
  cornmeal, 1/3 c. or as needed
  lemon juice, 2 or 3 Tbsp.
  cooking oil
preparation
      Allow for 2 or 3 pieces of fish for each person.  Rinse fish in lemon water.  Drain and sprinkle with salt.  Roll in flour and cornmeal mixture.  Heat oil to about 350°.  Fry in iron skillet with at least 1 inch of cooking oil on medium high temperature. Cook about 3 minutes each side or until golden brown and flaky. Serve with lemon slices, cole slaw, French fries, and hush puppies.

FISH STEW
ingredients
2  Tbsp. oil
1  large onion, chopped
1  can tomato soup (undiluted)
1 large  can chopped tomatoes
  Worcestershire sauce to taste
1  lb. ocean perch, cut up
  crushed red pepper to taste
preparation
      Pour oil in pan and sauté onion. Add tomato soup, chopped tomatoes and Worcestershire sauce. Simmer for a few minutes. Add fish pieces and crushed pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes.
       To Serve: Place a slice of loaf bread on a plate and pour a serving of stew over it.

BAKED HERBED FISH
ingredients
1  lb. fish fillets (such as cod, flounder or trout)
1 1/2  Tbsp. margarine, melted
1 1/2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  tsp. parsley flakes
1/2  tsp. basil leaves
1/2  tsp. paprika
1/4  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. garlic powder
preparation
      Place fish in a greased baking pan. Combine remaining ingredients and spoon evenly over fish. Bake in preheated 350° oven 10 to 15 minutes until fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork; do not overcook. Makes 4 servings.
      Alternate Microwave Cooking Instructions: Place fish in a shallow microwave baking dish and prepare as directed. Cover with wax paper. Cook in microwave oven on full power about 4 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Tips:
preparation
      Serve with easy scalloped potatoes, green peas and a combination salad.
      Use other seasonings on fish as desired: oregano, dill, ground red pepper, onion powder.

NO FRYING FISH
ingredients
  fish filets (as many as you need)
  milk
  hot sauce (5 good shakes; depends on how much fish)
  spray butter (for top of filets)
  lemon juice
  Tony's
  Italian seasoned breadcrumbs
preparation
	Preheat oven to 400°. Mix milk and hot sauce together and stir well. Soak fish filets about 20 minutes or so; drain well and roll in breadcrumbs. Line pan with foil and place fish in single layer in pan. Spray butter on top of breadcrumbs and then drizzle lemon juice (not much, just drop by drop). Bake until golden brown or bake for 30 minutes, then put in broiler to brown.
