BAKED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
  Fish fillets (Perch, Walleye, etc.)
  Egg
  Instant Mashed Potatoes
  Oil (for frying)
preparation
  Dip fillets in beaten egg.
  Roll in dry mashed potato mix.
  Fry in oil until lightly brown.

HERBED BAKED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
1  pound fish fillets
1/2  cup whole wheat flour
1/2  teaspoon garlic powder
1/2  teaspoon oregano
1  teaspoon freshly grated ginger
1  egg white
1/2  cup plain low or nonfat yogurt (This keeps the fish from becoming dry)
preparation
  Combine flour and herbs. Dip fish in egg white, then in flour mixture. Place fish in single layer in baking pan. Spoon yogurt over fish. Bake in preheated 400° oven about 15 minutes.

RED FISH COURT BOUILLON
ingredients
3  Tbsp. cooking oil
1  large onion, chopped fine
2  stalks celery, chopped fine (optional)
1/2  can (15 oz.) whole peeled tomatoes, cut up
1  can tomato sauce (8 oz.)
1  can tomato paste (6 oz.)
1  medium bell pepper, chopped fine or 1/2 large
1/2  tsp. garlic, minced
1/2 to 1  tsp. parsley, maybe a little more
4  onion tops, chopped fine
1/2  tsp. cayenne pepper
  Louisiana hot sauce (about 1 tsp. or more)
1/2  can Ro-Tel (mild is better)
1  tsp. lemon juice
  red fish, cut into 1 1/2-inches
3  c. hot water
1  tsp. sugar to every can tomato sauce
  salt to taste
preparation
	In oil, saut onions and celery about 10 minutes.  Stir in the next 12 ingredients.  Cook loosely covered for about 3 hours, stirring frequently.  Add water in small amounts as needed; simmer and arrange fish steaks in single layer.  Add sugar and salt and continue cooking, covered for 15 to 20 minutes to cook fish. Remove lid and simmer for 15 minutes more.	Serve over hot rice with garlic bread.

GRILLED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
2  fillets orange roughy or other fish
  Lawrys seasoned salt
1  zucchini
1  yellow squash
1  red or orange pepper (not the hot kind)
  lemon juice
  margarine
preparation
	Rinse fillets in cold water, pat dry with paper towel.	Place in center of square of foil, sprinkle both sides with seasoned salt. Wash zucchini and squash, no need to peel.  Cut into 2 to 3 inch sticks.  Slice red pepper to 1/4 inch thickness.  Place vegetables on foil with fish, dribble lemon juice over all.  Put about a tsp. of margarine on top and seal foil with double fold on top and ends.  Pierce foil on top with 2 small holes to vent. Place on hot grill for about 15 minutes, no need to turn.  Cooking time varies according to the thickness of fish and heat of the grill, also whether or not grill has a lid.  Fish can be baked in oven at 400° for 15 minutes.

FISH AND CHEESE CHOWDER
ingredients
1  lb. fish fillets
2  Tbsp. butter
6  Tbsp. chopped onion
1  c. chopped carrot
6  Tbsp. chopped celery
1/4  c. flour
1/2  tsp. salt
  dash of paprika
2  cans chicken broth (10 oz. size, undiluted)
3  c. milk (whole or skim)
1  c. grated cheese
preparation
      Cut fish into 1-inch cubes. Cook onion, carrot and celery in butter until onion is transparent. Blend in flour, salt and paprika. Cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Gradually add broth and milk. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened. Add fish; simmer until fish flakes easily (5 minutes). Add cheese and stir until melted. Yield:  2 1/2 quarts.

BATTER FOR ONION RINGS OR FISH
ingredients
2  eggs
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  c. flour
3/4  c. milk
1 heaping  tsp. baking powder
preparation
      Combine all ingredients and beat with whisk.  Dip onion rings, haddock pieces, shrimp or scallops and deep fry or pan fry in at least two inches of oil.  For superb onion rings, use sweet Vidalia onions.  Once fried place on paper towels to drain excess oil.

CHARCOAL GRILLED WHITE FISH
ingredients
2 1/2 or 3  lb. white fish (trout, snapper or mackerel may be used)
1/4  c. olive oil
1/2  c. fresh lemon juice
3/4  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  Tbsp. oregano
1/2  tsp. Accent
preparation
      Make 4 or 5 shallow slits on each side of fish.  Brush fish generously with a mixture of oil, lemon juice, salt, pepper, oregano and Accent.  Cook over coals until golden brown, brushing with mixture.  Turn fish gently to cook both sides.  When fish is done, put on serving platter and pour remaining mixture over fish. Serves 3 to 4.

FAMILY FISH LOAF
ingredients
20  oz. cooked flaked fish (halibut is great)
2  eggs, beaten
1  c. tomato sauce
2  tsp. onion flakes, soaked in water
1/2  c. bread crumbs
preparation
      Combine all ingredients. Shape into loaf and bake at 350° for 20 minutes. Cover with a low-fat tartar sauce for the last 5 minutes. Serve with vegetables from your garden.

BAKED FISH
ingredients
1/4  c. (1/2 stick) butter
1/4  c. water
1/4  c. dry white wine
3  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1 1/2  tsp. dried basil
1 1/3  c. uncooked instant white rice
1  small red onion, thinly sliced
1  red pepper
1  c. frozen peas
4  sole fillets (flounder, dolphin or your favorite mild white fish)
1/4  tsp. lemon pepper seasoning
1  plum tomato, thinly sliced
  lemon wedges (optional)
preparation
      Heat oven to 450°. Heat butter, water, wine, lemon juice, 1/4 teaspoon salt, pepper and basil in small saucepan until butter melts. Lay out 4 squares of heavy-duty foil. Spread 1/3 cup rice in center of each square. Top with onion, red pepper and peas. Sprinkle with remaining salt. Top with fillets; tuck any rice under. Sprinkle with lemon pepper. Top with tomato. Curl foil up slightly. Divide butter mixture among packets. Seal packets completely. Place on baking sheet. Bake in heated 450° oven 20 to 25 minutes. Open packets carefully, as steam may escape. Serve with lemon wedges if desired. Delicious!!!!!!

DELICIOUS FISH
ingredients
3/4  c. Parmesan cheese
1/2  c. butter, softened
3  Tbsp. green onions, chopped
3  Tbsp. mayonnaise
2  tsp. chives
6  fish fillets (scrod, orange roughy or grouper)
3  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Mix first 5 ingredients together in a small bowl and set aside. Place fish in a single layer in a lightly greased pan. Pour lemon juice over and sprinkle with pepper. Broil 6 to 10 minutes or until fish flakes with a fork. Remove from oven. Spread with cheese mixture. Return to broiler for an additional 2 to 3 minutes or until cheese is lightly browned and bubbly. Serves 6.

FISH FILET PARMESAN
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. fillets
1/2  tsp. salt
  pepper to taste
3/4  c. sour cream
1/2  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1  Tbsp. chives
1/4  c. fine dry bread crumbs
  paprika
  watercress (optional)
preparation
      Wash and pat fillet dry with paper towels.  Arrange in greased baking pan. Sprinkle salt and pepper over fish.  Mix sour cream with cheese, chives and crumbs.  Spread over fish.  Dust with paprika.  Bake at 450° for 10 minutes per inch of thickness. Garnish with watercress.  One-half-inch thick- cook 5 minutes. One-inch thick - cook 10 minutes.  One and one-half-inch thick - cook 15 minutes.  Measure thickness by measuring thickest point of fillet.

FISH PATTIES
ingredients
3  lb. fish fillets (perch, bass or any fresh fish)
3  eggs
1/3  c. milk
1  c. Bisquick
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/4  c. chopped peppers
1/2  c. chopped onions
preparation
      Cut fish into 1/4 to 1/2-inch cubes.  Beat eggs with a fork and add milk and Bisquick until well blended.  Mix in rest of ingredients; put in fish last.  Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Drop by large spoonfuls in hot oiled skillet.  Brown over medium heat until golden brown.  Turn once.  Remove and drain on paper towels.  Cool 1 minute and serve.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

LEMON DIJON BAKED FISH
ingredients
2  orange roughy fillets
1  Tbsp. butter
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce (Atkins brand)
1  Tbsp. dijon mustard
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/3  c. premium, multi-grain crackers, crushed
preparation
      Cut fillets in half and arrange in lightly greased pan.  Mix mustard, butter, lemon juice and Worcestershire sauce.  Spread mixture over fillet halves.  Sprinkle cracker crumbs on fillet halves.  Bake at 425° for 15 to 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.  Serves 2.

BAKED FISH WITH LEMON-PEPPER CRUST
ingredients
1  c. fresh or dried bread crumbs
1/4  c. parsley, chopped
1  tsp. lemon pepper, ground
1/2  tsp. salt
24  oz. firm white fish fillets, fresh or frozen, thawed
2  Tbsp. butter, melted
2  lemons, juiced
preparation
      Preheat oven to 450°.  In a bowl, combine bread crumbs, parsley, pepper and salt.  Set aside.  Dip fish into melted butter and coat both sides with crumb mixture.  Place on a baking sheet and bake until cooked through, yet flaky to the fork, about 10 minutes.  Sprinkle lemon juice and serve.

OVEN-FRIED FISH (DIABETIC)
ingredients
1/2  cup crushed corn flakes
1/2  tsp. celery salt
1/8  tsp. paprika
  Dash of pepper
1  lb. fish fillets
1/8  tsp. onion powder
1  Tbsp. plus 1 tsp. skim milk
preparation
      Combine corn flakes, celery salt, onion powder, paprika, and pepper.  Dip fish in milk; roll in corn flake mixture.  Place fish in nonstick baking pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes until brown.  Yield   6 - 2 oz. servings.  Each serving may be exchanged for 1/2 bread - 2 low-fat meat.

FISH STEW
ingredients
3 -4  slices fat back
5  medium fish
1  large onion, chopped
1 -14  oz. ketchup
1/2  tsp. red pepper
1/3  tsp. black pepper
1  tsp. sugar
2  cups water
  salt to taste
preparation
      Fry fat back to obtain drippings.  Cook onion until soft in hot grease.  Mix water, ketchup, sugar and pepper in a sauce pan. Add onion and bring mixture to a boil for about 10 minutes.  Add fish and simmer for 20 minutes.  Serve over rice.

FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
1  lb. red snapper
6  c. water
1  medium onion chopped
4  medium potatoes cut into pieces
3  to 4 medium carrots sliced into pieces
1/2  can diced tomatoes
1  Tbsp. Tonys Herb and Spice
1  stick butter
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
	In a large pot add water and bring to boil; then add fish, salt and pepper to taste.  Cook fish until done about 10 minutes. Remove fish and debone. Add vegetables (except tomatoes) and Tonys Herb Spice to stock, cook until tender.  Add tomatoes, butter and fish bring to boil.  Then serve.

FRIED FISH
ingredients
2  c. cornmeal
2 to 3  lb. fillets of fish
2 to 4  Tbsp. lemon pepper
1/2  onion, diced
4  Tbsp. salt
1  Tbsp. black pepper
1/2  c. lemon juice
preparation
      Dip fish fillets into lemon juice. Roll into batter (cornmeal, lemon pepper, onion, pepper and salt). Deep-fry in peanut oil. Wait until fish floats, then wait one minute more before removing.

EASY BAKED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. whitefish fillets
1  Tbsp. lime juice
1  Tbsp. mayonnaise
1/8  tsp. onion powder
1/8  tsp. pepper
1/2  c. bread crumbs
1 1/2  Tbsp. butter, melted
2  Tbsp. fresh parsley, chopped
preparation
      Heat oven to 425°. Place fish in a greased 11 x 7-inch baking dish. In a small bowl, combine lime juice, mayonnaise, onion powder and pepper. Spread over fish. Sprinkle with bread crumbs; drizzle with butter. Bake about 20 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley.

BLACKENED FISH
ingredients
4  fresh or frozen catfish, cod, pollock, pompano or haddock fillets (1 lb.)
1/4  tsp. onion powder
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
1/2  tsp. ground red pepper
1/2  tsp. dried basil, crushed
1/4  tsp. ground white pepper
1/4  tsp. dried thyme, crushed
1/4  tsp. black pepper
1/8  tsp. ground sage
1/4  c. margarine or butter, melted
preparation
      Thaw fish if frozen.  In a small mixing bowl combine onion powder, garlic salt, red pepper, basil, white pepper, thyme, black pepper and sage.  Brush both sides of fish with melted margarine; coat with seasoning.  If using a charcoal grill, remove grill rack and place an unoiled 12-inch cast-iron skillet directly on hot coals.  If using a gas grill, turn to high and place skillet on the grill rack.  Preheat the skillet 5 minutes or until a drop of water sizzles.  Add coated fillets to skillet.  Carefully drizzle about 2 teaspoons of melted margarine over the fish.  Grill fish 2 1/2 to 3 minutes or until blackened.  Turn fish and drizzle with 2 teaspoons of melted margarine.  Grill 2 1/2 to 3 minutes more.  Transfer to serving plates.  Drizzle with any remaining melted margarine. Makes 4 servings.

PAN-FRIED FISH
ingredients
6  to 8 large pieces trout
  fish fry
  butter and olive oil for frying
  lemon wedges
  red pepper, black pepper, and salt to taste
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  tsp. hot sauce
1/4  cup mustard
preparation
      Season fish with salt and peppers, hot sauce and Worcestershire sauce.  Add mustard; mix well.  Heat a black iron skillet and melt butter and olive oil together.  Roll fish in fish fry and fry. Serve with lemon wedges.

FISH SAUCE
ingredients
1  dozen clams with juice
1  lb. cleaned shrimp
1  lb. scallops
1  lb. squid
2  pieces cod or scrod
5  cloves garlic, chopped
1 1/2  c. tomato paste
2 large  cans Del Monte - cut, diced tomatoes
  handful fresh parsley
1  lb. linguine
preparation
      In pan, sauté garlic and parsley in a little olive oil over medium heat.  Put in tomatoes and tomato paste and cook for about 1 hour.  Start to cook linguine about 15 minutes before the hour is up.  Do not put fish into sauce until linguine is nearly cooked.  Then put fish into sauce and cook about 10 -15 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste.  Drain pasta (do not rinse)  and put in serving bowl.  Pour fish sauce over it and serve.

FISH ITALIANO
ingredients
3  Tbsp. margarine, melted
1  onion, thinly sliced
1 1/2  lb. fish filets
1/2  c. mayonnaise
  Oregano
  Chopped parsley
1/4  c. Parmesan cheese
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  tsp. Worcestershire Sauce
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. paprika
preparation
      Pour butter into bottom of 9 x 13-inch baking dish.  Arrange onion evenly on bottom of dish.  Place fish filets in a single layer atop the onion.  Combine mayonnaise, cheese, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, paprika and salt.  Spread evenly on top of fish.  Sprinkle, to taste, with oregano and parsley.  Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

BLACKENED FISH
ingredients
4  fresh or frozen catfish, cod, pollock, pompano or haddock fillets (1 lb.)
1/2  tsp. onion powder
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
1/2  tsp. ground red pepper
1/2  tsp. dried basil, crushed
1/4  tsp. ground white pepper
1/4  tsp. dried thyme, crushed
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/8  tsp. ground sage
1/4  c. margarine or butter, melted
preparation
      Thaw fish, if frozen. In a small mixing bowl, combine remaining ingredients except margarine or butter. Brush both sides of fish with some of the melted margarine or butter; coat both sides with seasonings.
      If using a charcoal grill, remove grill rack and place an unoiled 12-inch cast-iron skillet directly on hot coals.
      If using a gas grill, turn to high and place skillet on the grill rack.
      Preheat the skillet 5 minutes or until a drop of water sizzles. Add coated fillets to skillet. Carefully drizzle about 2 teaspoons of the melted margarine over the fish. Grill fish 2 1/2 to 3 minutes or until blackened. Turn fish and drizzle with 2 teaspoons of the melted margarine. Grill 2 1/2 to 3 minutes more or until blackened and fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Transfer to serving plates. Drizzle with any remaining melted margarine. Makes 4 servings.

MARINATED FISH
ingredients
1  lb. fish of your choice
1/2  tsp. shredded lemon/lime peel
1/4  c. lemon/lime juice
1  Tbsp. olive oil
1  Tbsp. Fish/Chicken worcestershire sauce
2  Tbsp. cooking sherry or wine
1/2  tsp. christopher garlic
1/2  tsp. crushed thyme or rosemary
preparation
      Combine juices, oil, sauces and herbs together. Pour over fish and allow to marinate. Bake as desired.

BATTERED HERB FISH
ingredients
1/2  c. butter
2/3  c. Ritz crackers
1/2  c. Parmesan cheese
1/2  tsp. basil
1/2  tsp. oregano
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1  lb. fish
preparation
      Melt butter in pan.  Mix remaining ingredients.  Roll fish in melted butter, then crumb mixture.  Place in pan and bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.

BROILED FISH WITH PACIFICA SAUCE
ingredients
2  lb. fish fillets or steaks, fresh or frozen (haddock, cod, cod steaks)
1/2  c. lemon juice
3  Tbsp. butter
2  Tbsp. grated onion
2  Tbsp. brown sugar
1  tsp. dry mustard
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
  paprika
  baby carrots
  asparagus spears
preparation
      Arrange the fish in a single layer in heat- proof platter or shallow baking pan. In small saucepan combine lemon juice, butter, onion, brown, sugar, dry mustard, salt and pepper. Heat, stirring, till blended. Pour sauce over fish. Preheat broiler. Broil fish slowly, about 4 inches from the flame, basting 2 or 3 times with sauce till fish is browned and will flake when tested with fork. Sprinkle with paprika after final basting. Arrange cooked baby carrots and asparagus spears around edge of platter and serve. Makes 6 servings.

FISH BATTER
ingredients
2  eggs
1  Tbsp. onion salt
1  Tbsp. garlic powder
1  Tbsp. paprika
1  Tbsp. flour
1  can 7-Up (room temperature)
preparation
      Beat eggs and spices together; add enough flour to make a stiff dough. Add 7-Up until dough is thin. Dip fish in flour and then in batter and fry.

SPENCER'S BEER BATTER FISH FRY
ingredients
1/2  c. flour
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. baking powder
1  egg
  beer (enough for thin pancake recipe)
preparation
      Very good as a condiment with chicken, turkey, ham and pork. Some like it even on a sandwich.
       Mix together 2 parts whole cranberry sauce with 1 part horseradish. Example: 2/3 cup cranberry sauce and 1/3 cup horseradish. Stir together. Refrigerate 4 hours or longer to allow flavors to blend.

OVEN FRIED FISH
ingredients
2  fish filets
1/4  c. milk
2  tsp. salt
1  c. bread crumbs
1/2  tsp. paprika
2  Tbsp. melted butter
preparation
      Mix milk and salt.  Dip fish in salted milk.  Mix together bread crumbs and paprika.  Roll fish in bread crumbs.  Place fish side by side in oiled, shallow baking dish.  Drizzle melted butter over fish.  Bake at 525° for 15 to 20 minutes or until fish is golden and flakes easily with fork.  Watch closely.

MARINADE FOR FISH
ingredients
1/2  c. orange juice
1/4  c. vega table oil
1/4  c. soy sauce
1/4  c. Ketchup
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  cloves garlic minced
2  Tbsp. parsley minced
1 1/2  tsp. fresh or 1/2 tsp. dried oregano
  Black pepper
preparation
      Combine all ingredients.  This can be used to perk up swordfish or any fish.  Serves 5-6.

BROCCOLI FISH AU GRATIN
ingredients
1  lb. fresh broccoli, cut into spears and cooked
1  lb. firm white fish
1  can cream of broccoli soup
1/3  c. of milk
1/2  c. shredded cheddar cheese
2  toasted sun dried tomato bagels
2  Tbsp. melted butter
  salt, pepper, cayenne to taste
preparation
      Place broccoli in a 2 pt. shallow baking dish.  Place fish on top.  Blend soup and milk and pour over the fish.  Put cheese over soup mixture.  Mix butter, seasoning, and crumble bagels together and place on top.  Bake at 450 for 30 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

OVEN FRIED FISH
ingredients
2  lb. fresh or frozen cod or tilapia fish
2  Tbsp. canola oil
1/2  c. seasoned, fine, dry bread crumbs
1/3  c. yellow cornmeal
1  tsp. seasoning salt
2  Tbsp. Parmesan cheese
1  slightly beaten egg white
preparation
      Coat baking pan with canola oil.  Set aside.  Thaw fish if frozen.  Rinse and dry with paper towels.  Cut into 4-inch pieces.
      Preheat oven to 425°.  Heat baking sheet.  Stir together bread crumbs, cornmeal, salt and Parmesan cheese. Mix well.  Dip each fillet in egg white, then the crumb mixture.  Place fish on preheated baking sheet.  Bake, uncovered, 6 to 8 minutes (depending on thickness of fish) or until fish flakes easily.

TUNA FISH SALAD FOR A CROWD
ingredients
5  eggs, boiled and chopped
1  apple, chopped
1/4  c. chopped sweet pickles
  salt and pepper
4  cans tuna fish
1/2  onion, chopped
4  Tbsp. mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. pickle juice
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together in large bowl. Salt and pepper to taste. This will serve a large crowd.

FISH AU GRATIN
ingredients
1  lb. fish fillets
4  Tbsp. mayonnaise
1  green onion
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  Tbsp. melted butter
preparation
      Broil fillets 8 to 12 minutes.  Combine remaining ingredients and spread over fish.  Broil until puffy and golden, 1 to 3 minutes more.  Or, can put on when you put the fish under the broiler.

FISH WITH PECAN BUTTER SAUCE
ingredients
  fish (trout, redfish or other firm fleshed fish)
  Tony Chachere's Creole seasoning
  flour
  oil
  butter
preparation
	In a large frying pan, place equal amounts of oil and butter enough to cover the bottom of the pan.  Season the fish in the Creole seasoning.
	In a Baggie, add flour and additional seasoning and dredge each fillet with the mixture.  Remove off excess and place fillet in hot oil (350°).  Cook about 2 to 3 minutes per side.  Drain on paper towels.  Place hot fillets on serving plate.  Top each fillet with 1 to 2 tablespoons of Pecan Butter Sauce and 1 tablespoon of chopped pecans.
Pecan Butter Sauce:
ingredients
1  stick butter
1/2  c. pecans (dry roasted)
2  Tbsp. onion, chopped
1  tsp. lemon or lime juice
1/2  tsp. Tabasco sauce
1  clove garlic, chopped
preparation
	Put all ingredients into a food processor and puree until well mixed, creamy and smooth. Serve with hot fish fillets.
	 Pecan Butter Sauce can be stored in airtight container in refrigerator for 3 to 4 weeks.

OVEN-FRIED FISH
ingredients
2  lb. fish fillets
1/4  c. milk
2  tsp. salt
1  c. crushed corn flakes
preparation
      Heat oven to 500 degrees. Grease baking sheet. Combine milk and salt in a small pan or bowl and stir. Dip fish in milk and roll in crushed corn flakes. Place on baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.

FRIED FISH
ingredients
1  c. corn meal
1  tsp. salt
1/2  c. flour, all purpose
1/2  tsp. onion powder
preparation
      Combine corn meal, salt, flour, and onion powder.  Dredge fish in mixture, coating both sides.  Deep fry in hot oil for 3 to 5 minutes, or until brown.  Drain.

MARINATED FISH FILETS
ingredients
2  Tbsp. soy sauce
2  Tbsp. corn oil
2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  tsp. garlic powder
1  tsp. paprika
1  tsp. chili powder
  Fish filets
preparation
      Combine all ingredients (except for fish filets) and marinate fish filets in the mixture for 1/2 hour or more.  Broil 12 to 15 minutes.  Serve with tartar sauce.

FISH FILLETS
ingredients
2  lb. frozen cod or halibut fillets
1  c. chicken broth
1/4  c. olive oil
1/4  c. lemon juice
1  bay leaf
1  clove garlic, minced
1  Tbsp. grated onion
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. thyme
4  to 6 onion slices
4  to 6 tomato slices
1/4  c. corn flakes, crumbled
2  Tbsp. grated parmesan cheese
3  Tbsp. butter
preparation
      Cut fish into 4 to 6 portions, and put into shallow buttered casserole dish. Mix the next 6 ingredients and pour over fish. Let stand until fish is thawed. When ready to bake, top each piece of fish with 1 onion slice and 1 tomato slice. Sprinkle over top, a mixture of corn flake crumbs and parmesan cheese. Dot with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes, or until top is a golden brown. Serve with sauce from pan.

TARTAR SAUCE (FISH)
ingredients
1/2  c. mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. sweet pickle relish
  Dash of Worcestershire sauce with hot-pepper seasoning Lemon juice to taste
preparation
      Mix above together.

TUNA FISH CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  (12 oz) bag of noodles
2  cans of tuna
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1/2  c. milk
1  tbsp. of mayo
preparation
      Cook noodles and drain tuna.  Add soup to milk, and then add mayo.  Add all ingredients to noodles and cook at 350 degrees until done.

OVEN-FRIED FISH
ingredients
1 1/2 to 2  lb. catfish fillets
1  c. corn meal
2  Tbsp. dry mustard
4  Tbsp. water
  season to taste
preparation
      Mix mustard and water.  Line shallow pan with foil.  Spray with Pam.  Cut fish into 1-inch pieces and dip in mustard mixture.  Roll in corn meal.  Place in pan slightly apart.  Spray fish with Pam. Bake at 400° for 20 minutes.  Then turn on broil for 5 minutes or until slightly brown.

GENE'S BUTTER HERB BAKED FISH
ingredients
1/2  c. butter or margarine
1/2  tsp. each - basil leaves, oregano, and salt
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1/4  c. parmesan cheese grated
1  lb. fish fillets
preparation
	Preheat oven to 350°.  In a 13 by 9 inch pan, melt butter. Mix all the above ingredients together except fish.  Dip fish in butter and then crumb mixture.  Bake near center of oven for 25 to 30 minutes until tender or fish flakes with fork.  Any fish fillet will work; especially good with Wisconsin Walleye or Bluegill.

SPANISH CORN WITH FISH STICKS
ingredients
1/4  c. chopped onion
1/4  c. chopped green pepper
1/4  c. chopped red pepper
1/4  c. all-purpose flour
1 1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
2  tsp. sugar
2 (14 1/2 oz.)  cans stewed tomatoes
2 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen corn, thawed
2 (12 oz.)  pkg. frozen fish sticks
preparation
      In a skillet, saut the onion and peppers in butter until tender.  Stir in the flour, salt, pepper and sugar until blended. Add tomatoes and bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes, stirring until thickened.  Stir in corn.
      Transfer to two greased 11 1/2 x 7 x 2-inch baking dishes. Cover and bake at 350° for 25 minutes, uncovered; arrange fish sticks on top.  Bake 15 minutes longer or until fish sticks are heated through.  Yield: 8 to 10 servings.

FISH MARINADE
ingredients
1/4  c. dry white wine
1/4  c. sherry
1/4  c. rice vinegar or white wine vinegar
2  Tbsp. white wine worcestershire
1  Tbsp. soy sauce
1  tsp. grated ginger root
1  Tbsp. honey
2  Tbsp. parsley
1  Tbsp. dill
preparation
	Combine the ingredients in glass bowl and add fish, coating well.  Cover the fish and refrigerate for 1 hour or longer.  Grill.

BAKED FISH AND GRAVY
(Catfish or Trout)  
ingredients
1  large fish
1 large  can milk
1  can cream of mushroom soup
4  boiled eggs, chopped
preparation
      Mix. Pour over fish in pan.  Let simmer about 15 minutes.  For more gravy, double recipe.  Serve over cooked rice.  Very good.

BROILED FISH WITH TANGY SWEET & SOUR SAUCE
ingredients
1/2  c. water
1/2  c. honey
1/4  c. lemon juice or rice vinegar
1/4  c. dry white wine
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
1  tsp. garlic salt
1/2  tsp. grated lemon peel
1  Tbsp. chopped fresh cilantro
2  lb. red snapper or cod fillets
preparation
      Combine all ingredients except cilantro & fish in a small saucepan; cook & stir over medium heat until mixture boils & thickens. Simmer 2 minutes. Add cilantro; mix well. Remove sauce from heat & keep warm. Place fish on lightly oiled baking sheet. Broil 4-6 inches from heat source 10 minutes per inch of thickness or until fish turns opaque & flakes easily when tested with a fork. Spread sauce over fish to serve.

NEW ENGLAND FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
1  medium onion, chopped
2  large potatoes, cubed
2  cans chicken broth
1  lb. cod filets (or other white fish), cut in small pieces
2  c. milk
1 (12 oz.)  can evaporated milk
  paprika
preparation
	In large pot, cook onion, and potatoes in chicken broth until potatoes are medium tender (but not cooked).  Add fish and simmer additional 10 minutes. Stir in the two milks and continue to simmer for approximately 15 to 20 minutes until fish is flaky (not mushy).  Garnish chowder in serving bowl with paprika.  Can serve with biscuits or crackers.

SMOKED FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
1  lb. butter
1  large onion
1  rib celery
3  qt. clam juice
3  baking potatoes, cubed
  bay leaf
  thyme
  parsley
1 1/2  lb. smoked whitefish
1/2 to 3/4  c. flour
  heavy cream
preparation
      Saut onions and celery with butter. Add flour to thicken (about 5 minutes).  Add clam juice; simmer.  Add cubed potatoes and remaining spices and whitefish.  Salt to taste.  Before serving, add 1 quart heavy cream for every gallon of soup prepared.

RESTAURANT STYLE FISH N CHIPS
ingredients
3/4 to 1  lb. fresh Alaskan cod
1  pkg. tempura flour (Sun Luck brand; Oriental section)
1  pkg. Panko batter (Sun Luck brand; Oriental section)
2 to 3  Tbsp. milk, mixed with 1 egg
1  bottle Crisco vegetable oil
preparation
      Use deep fryer.
      Put Crisco oil in deep fryer and turn up to about 375°.
      In three bowls, put flour in one bowl, egg-milk mixture in second bowl and Panko in third bowl.
      Cut fish into small 1-inch cubes, careful not to cut too small or you will be deep-frying for ever!
      With fork, take each piece of fish and cover first in flour (tap off excess), second roll in egg mixture and third cover in Panko. Do a few this way and then drop into hot oil. Take out when golden brown. Put in a colander lined with paper towels and cover with tinfoil to keep warm.

SMOKED FISH AND EGGS
ingredients
1  lb. smoked fish
3  Tbsp. butter or oleo
3  Tbsp. flour
3/4  tsp. salt
2  c. milk
3  hard-boiled eggs, cut up
3  Tbsp. thinly sliced green onions
  buttered, toasted English muffins
  paprika
preparation
      Bone, skin and flake fish. Melt butter or oleo in saucepan. Blend in flour and salt. Add milk. Cook, stirring until smooth and thickened. Fold in eggs, fish and onions. Serve on buttered muffins or hot biscuits. Sprinkle with paprika.

FISH CAKES
ingredients
2 6  oz. cans salmon (drained, skin & bones discard)
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  c shredded mozzarella
1/2  c chopped green onion
1  box stuffing mix
1/3  c mayonnaise
3/4  c water
preparation
      Mix together stuffing mix, water, mayonnaise, fish, lemon juice, cheese, and vegetables. Cover and refrigerate for 10 minutes. Heat nonstick skillet sprayed with cooking spray on medium heat. Shape 1/3 cupfuls of the stuffing mixture into pattie, add to skillet, cook 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown on both sides.

OVEN-FRIED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
1  lb. flounder or sole fillets
1  Tbsp. reduced-calorie mayonnaise
6  Tbsp. fine dry breadcrumbs
2  Tbsp. minced fresh parsley
1/2  tsp. paprika
  vegetable cooking spray
  lemon wedges
preparation
      Coat fillets with mayonnaise. Combine breadcrumbs, parsley and paprika. Dredge coated fillets in breadcrumb mixture. Arrange fillets on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 450° for 12 minutes or until fillets flake easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges. Yield: 4 servings.

CHINESE FISH FILLETS
ingredients
4  (8-oz.) catfish fillets
1 1/2  c. chicken broth (low-sodium)
4  tsp. Thick N Thin (not starch thickener)
4  tsp. dark sesame oil
3  cloves garlic, pushed through a press
4  tsp. grated, peeled fresh ginger
2  Tbsp. unseasoned rice wine vinegar
2  Tbsp. soy sauce (low-sodium)
1  pkt. sugar substitute
2  green onions, thinly sliced (garnish)
preparation
      Heat broiler. For sauce: Mix broth and thickener in a small bowl, stir until thickener dissolves. Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir-fry garlic and ginger for 30 seconds. Add rice wine vinegar, soy sauce, sugar substitute and broth mixture. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly,1 minute. Remove from heat.
       Fish fillets: Brush fillets with sauce. Broil for 3 minutes per side. Transfer to plates. Top with remaining sauce. Garnish with onions. Serves 4.

MARINATED FISH
ingredients
2 to 3  tsp. lemon juice
1 or more  tsp. cumin
1  lb. or more cooked fish
1  onion, chopped
1  can green chiles
  tomatoes, chopped (optional)
preparation
      Mix to taste.  Chill before serving.

GOLDEN FISH PUFFS
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. frozen piked fillets, thawed
  salt and pepper
1  egg white
1/4  tsp. dill seed
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  c. mayonnaise
1/4  tsp. orange juice
preparation
      Heat oven to 425°. Place fillets in greased baking dish, 11 1/2 x 7 1/2 x 1 1/2-inches. Season with salt and pepper. Beat egg white and 1/8 teaspoon salt until stiff, but not dry. Fold in remaining ingredients; spoon onto fish. Bake, uncovered, 12 to 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork and topping is puffed and brown.

BARBECUED FISH
ingredients
4  lb. red snapper or bass
1  stick margarine
3  Tbsp. grated onion
1  Tbsp. grated green bell pepper
2  Tbsp. minced parsley
2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  tsp. Louisiana Red Hot sauce
2  lemons, sliced
  Tony Chachere's Creole Seasoning
preparation
      Melt margarine in a saucepan. Add all other ingredients except fish; stir well. Place fish on a sheet of heavy foil and pour sauce over fish. Seal foil making sure there is no leakage. Place on a grill; turn every 20 minutes, being careful not to tear foil. Cook for 1 1/2 hours. Remove from foil (reserving the sauce) and place on grill for 10 minutes. Turn and cook another 10 minutes basting with sauce. Serves 6.

ON-THE-GRILL FISH STEAKS
ingredients
2  lb. fresh fish steaks, 3/4-inch thick
1/2  c. melted margarine or butter
1/4  c. lemon juice
1  dash hot pepper sauce
  paprika
preparation
      Place serving size portions of fish on well-greased grill. Spray grill well before putting on fish.  Baste fish with sauce and sprinkle with paprika.  Cook about 5 inches from hot coals for 8 minutes.  Baste with sauce, then turn and cook for 7 to 10 minutes longer or until fish flakes or turns shiny white.  Serves 4.

MY FAVORITE TUNA FISH SANDWICH
ingredients
1  can tuna fish, drained (your choice of brand)
  Miracle Whip
  kosher dill pickles
2  slices bread (your choice)
preparation
      Put tuna in a medium mixing bowl.  Add enough Miracle Whip to make it look creamy or to your taste.  Cut up pickles and put them in (I like lots of pickles).  Stir it all up and put it on the bread or eat with crackers.

FRAN'S MACARONI AND TUNA FISH CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  cup uncooked macaroni
1  Tbsp salad mustard
1/4  cup milk
1  1/2 Tbsp chopped pimento
1  Tbsp chopped onion
1  can mushroom
3  oz cream cheese
1  can tuna fish
preparation
      Cook macaroni. Mix together other ingredients together, top with 1/2 cup bread crumbs and 2 tbsp butter. Bake at 375° for 30 minutes. Serves 4.

CORNBREAD-COATED FISH
ingredients
1  lb. fresh or frozen fish fillets
2  Tbsp. buttermilk or plain low-fat yogurt
1  Tbsp. margarine
1/2  c. corn bread stuffing mix, crushed
1/8  tsp. salt
  dash to 1/8 tsp. ground red pepper
preparation
      Thaw fish if frozen.  Turn under any thin edges of fish.  In a 12 x 7 1/2 x 2-inch baking dish (use an 8 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish for low-wattage ovens), arrange thicker portions of fish fillets toward outer edges of the dish.  Brush fish with buttermilk or yogurt.  In a small mixing bowl, cook margarine on 100% power (High) about 30 seconds or until melted.  Stir in stuffing mix, salt and red pepper.  Spoon stuffing mixture over fish fillets.  Cook fish, uncovered, on High for 4 to 7 minutes (7 to 9 minutes for low-wattage ovens) or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.  Give the dish a half-turn after 3 minutes.  Serves 4.
      Time - Preparation Time: 7 minutes.  Cooking Time: 4 1/2 minutes.

BAKED FISH WITH PARMESAN-SOUR CREAM SAUCE
ingredients
1  1/2 pounds Orange Roughy, Tilapia, Flounder, or any white fish fillets
1  (8-ounce) container sour cream (fat free works well)
1/4  cup shredded Parmesan cheese
1/2  teaspoon paprika
1/2  teaspoon salt
1/4  teaspoon pepper
2  tablespoons Italian-seasoned breadcrumbs
2  tablespoons butter or margarine, melted
preparation
      Place fillets in a single layer in a lightly greased 13x9-inch pan.  Stir together sour cream and next 4 ingredients; spread mixture evenly over fillets.  Sprinkle with breadcrumbs, and drizzle with butter.  Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until fish flakes with a fork.  Yield:  4-6 servings.

LEMON DILL FISH
ingredients
1/2  c. mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/2  tsp. grated lemon peel
1  tsp. dried dill weed
1  lb. boneless skinless fish fillets (cod, orange roughy, flounder, or catfish)
preparation
      Stir mayonnaise, lemon juice and peel, and dill until well blended.  Place fish fillets on greased rack of broiler pan. Brush with half of the sauce.  Broil 5 to 8 minutes; turn and brush with remaining sauce.  Continue broiling 5 to 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork.  Makes 4 servings.

LEMON DIJON BAKED FISH
ingredients
2  (6 oz.) orange roughy fillets
1  Tbsp. Dijon mustard
1  Tbsp. butter, melted
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/3  c. crushed buttery-flavored crackers
preparation
      Preheat oven to 425°.  Cut fillets in half. Arrange in lightly greased pan. Mix together mustard, butter, lemon juice and Worcestershire sauce. Spread mixture over fillets.  Crush crackers finely and sprinkle on fish. Bake 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork.

FISH BALLS
ingredients
1  can salmon
2  c. cooked rice
2  eggs, beaten
1/2  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. paprika
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  Tbsp. minced onion
2  Tbsp. chopped parsley
  crushed cornflake crumbs
preparation
      Drain liquid from fish.  Remove bones.  Flake fish.  Add rice, beaten eggs, salt, paprika, lemon juice, onion and parsley.  Stir with fork until well blended.  Form into bite size balls.  Roll in cornflake crumbs.  Deep-fry in oil at 375° until browned, about 3 minutes.  Drain on paper towels.  Serve warm, plain or with tartar sauce.  For a family main dish, make into patties and pan-fry.

FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. fish (Bass or haddock make a good chowder)
2  lg. onions diced
5  sticks celery diced
1/2  green pepper diced
2  sticks butter
3  lg potatoes
  salt
  pepper
  poultry seasoning
  pinch of garlic powder
1  can evaporated milk
preparation
      Cover fish with water lightly salted. Boil about 15 minutes. Remove fish from water, let cool, then flake fish. Take water fish was boiled in and strain through cheesecloth or fine strainer. Save the water, (you should have about 1 quart of water.) Add vegetables to water and add another quart of water. Cook 20 minutes. Add salt, pepper, poultry seasoning, and garlic powder, and fish. Cook until potatoes are done.
       Add 1 can evaporated milk.

GRILLED LEMON DILL FISH
ingredients
1/2  c. Kraft Light Mayonnaise
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  tsp. dill weed
1/2  tsp. grated lemon peel
1  lb. firm-textured fish filets (such as cod, catfish or salmon)
preparation
      Mix mayonnaise, lemon juice, dill and lemon peel.  Place fish on greased grill over medium coals.  Brush with 1/2 of the mayonnaise mixture.  Grill 5 minutes, turn.  Brush with remaining mayonnaise mixture.  Grill an additional 5 to 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork.
      Kitchen Tip:  For more flavor, increase lemon juice to 2 tablespoons.

GRILLED FISH
ingredients
2  lb. fish
1/2  c. salad oil
1/3  c. freshly squeezed lemon juice
1/4  c. chopped onion
2  Tbsp. capers and juice (optional)
2  Tbsp. catsup
1  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. sugar
2  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
4  bay leaves, crushed
1/4  tsp. pepper
2  cloves garlic, finely chopped
  paprika
preparation
      Marinate fish for 30 minutes in mixed ingredients.  Cook on grill about 8 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork.  Baste fish while grilling and sprinkle with paprika.  Baste shrimp or scallops only, don't marinate.

SOLE FISH
ingredients
8  fillets, Sole, Cod or other white fish
1/2  lb. raw, shelled, deveined shrimp
1/2  lb. sliced mushrooms
1/4  tsp. paprika
1  tsp. lemon juice
1/2  c. snipped parsley
  white sauce, (recipe below)
preparation
      Wash fish, dry thoroughly. Cut foil 14 inch square. Place one fish fillet in center of each. Arrange shrimp and mushrooms over fillet. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, paprika, and lemon juice. Top each with 1/4 cup white sauce. Sprinkle with parsley. Fold to seal. Bake at 400° for 35 minutes. Serve in foil. Makes 8 servings.
White Sauce:
ingredients
4  Tbsp. butter or margarine
1/4  c. all-purpose flour
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. seasoned salt
1/4  tsp. paprika
1  tsp. worcestershire sauce
2  c. milk
preparation
      Melt butter and blend in flour, salt, seasoned salt, paprika, and worcestershire sauce. Add milk all at once and cook, stirring constantly until thick and bubbly.

FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
1/2  c. margarine
1  small onion, diced
1  lb. pollock
3  c. water
1/2  c. salt pork, diced
3  c. half & half
4  med potatoes, peeled & diced
  salt & pepper to taste
3  fish bouillon cubes
preparation
      Sauté onion and salt pork in margarine until onions are translucent; add potatoes, pollock, water, bouillon cubes, salt and pepper to onion mixture and simmer until potatoes are tender; stir in half & half; heat thoroughly.
      Note:  A sprinkle of paprika on the top makes this attractive when serving.  You may substitute haddock or your favorite catch of the day if you prefer.

BAKED PARMESAN FISH
ingredients
2  Tbsp. dry bread crumbs
1  Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese
1  Tbsp. paprika
1  tsp. dried basil
1  pound fish fillets
1  Tbsp. melted butter
preparation
      Combine first 4 ingredients.  Melt butter; then dip fish in melted butter and then in seasonings.  Bake at 500° for 10 minutes.

LEMON FISH ROLL-UPS
ingredients
1 1/2  c. cooked rice
1  8  oz. pkg shredded sharp cheddar cheese
1   10  oz. pkg. frozen chopped broccoli, thawed and drained
8  fish fillets
  paprika, to taste
preparation
      In a medium bowl combine rice, cheese, broccoli and lemon mixture.  Divide mixture among 8 fish fillets.  Roll up and place seam side down in 9 x 13 pan.  Top with remaining sauce and paprika.  Bake at 375° for 25-30 minutes or until fish flakes with fork.
Lemon Mixture:
ingredients
1 1/3  c. butter, melted
1/3  c. lemon juice
2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Melt butter and mix together with other ingredients well.

LEMON BROILED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
3  lb. Fish Fillets
6  Tbsp. Butter or Margarine
1  tsp. Salt
1/2  tsp. Pepper
1  Tbsp. Worcestershire Sauce
2  Tbsp. Lemon Juice
  Paprika
1/2  Cup White Wine
preparation
      Place fish in greased broiler pan.  Melt butter or margarine; mix with salt, pepper, worcestershire sauce and lemon juice. Brush fillets with this mixture.  Sprinkle with paprika.  Broil 3 inches from source of heat for about 5 minutes or until golden brown.  Turn, brush again with sauce and sprinkle with paprika. Broil 7 minutes longer until fish flakes easily when tested with fork.

TUNA FISH SALAD
ingredients
2 - 6  oz. cans tuna fish
2  - hard boiled eggs
1/2 -  cup Miracle Whip or mayonnaise
2 -  Tbsp. sweet pickle relish
1  - chopped dill pickle
preparation
      Put the tuna, Miracle Whip, sweet and dill pickle into a large bowl. Chop up one of the boiled eggs and put in with the tuna mix.   Add salt, pepper, and onion powder or salt and garlic powder to your taste.  Mix all of these ingredients together.  Add a little dill pickle juice for added flavor.  Place the mixture into a serving bowl and flatten down the top. Slice the 2nd egg and place on top of the tuna.  Sprinkle a dash of paprika over the top for looks.  Serve with Ritz Crackers.

FISH STEW
ingredients
1  large onion, chopped
1/2  c. celery, chopped with leaves
1  large garlic clove
2  Tbsp. butter
2 (1 lb.)  cans chopped tomatoes
1/2  c. dry white wine
1/2  c. minced parsley
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. rosemary
1/4  tsp. pepper and thyme
1  lb. fish (any whitefish, cod is very good)
preparation
      Sauté onion, celery and garlic in butter. Add all other ingredients, except fish, and simmer for 30 minutes.  Add fish in chunks and cook gently for 7 to 10 minutes.

FISH SOUP
ingredients
1/4  c. butter
1  c. chopped onion
1  c. chopped green bell pepper
2 4  oz. cans mushrooms
1  pt. plus 2 oz. tomato juice
1  c. water
2  chicken boullion cubes
1/4  tsp. oregano
1 5  oz. can lobster
2  cups cooked shrimp
1  can crab meat
preparation
      Melt butter.  Sauté onion, green pepper and mushrooms.  Stir in tomato juice, water, bouillon cubes and oregano.  Cover and simmer 15 minutes.  Add lobster, crab and shrimp.  (Serves 6-8.)

FABULOUS FISH IN A BOAT
ingredients
  fresh fish
  sliced tomatoes, peppers, onions
  mango chutney
  curry
  salt and pepper
  chicken broth or chicken bouillon cube dissolved in water
  butter (if desired)
  foil
preparation
	One piece of foil per serving.	Lay fresh fish on foil and shape into "boat".	Add 2-3 Tbsp. chutney on top of fish. Sprinkle with curry powder to taste.  Layer with fresh veggies. Sprinkle with  salt and pepper and about 2 Tbsp. chicken broth.   Dot with butter, if desired.  Bake at 400° for 20 minutes or place on hot grill for 20-25 minutes.  Serve with rice.

RUFFANN TUNA FISH SALAD
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  can oil tuna fish
3  hard-boiled eggs, chopped
1  rib celery, chopped
1/4  c. Miracle Whip or mayo salad dressing
preparation
      Mix with salt and pepper mixture to taste and maybe onion and garlic powder added to a somewhat lumpy mixture.  Serves two.

OVEN FRIED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
1  lb. flounder or other fish fillets
2  Tbsp. low-fat mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. water
5  Tbsp. fine dry bread crumbs
1  tsp. parsley flakes
1  tsp. paprika
preparation
      Cut fillets into serving size pieces.  Coat fish with mixture of water and mayonnaise.  Combine bread crumbs, parsley flakes and paprika in a shallow dish.  Press fish fillets into crumb mixture to coat both sides.  Place on nonstick baking sheet.  Bake in a preheated 450° oven for 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.  Serves 4.

PAN TOASTED FISH
ingredients
1  lb. fish fillet
1/2  c. skim milk
1  egg white
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/2  c. oat bran
1/2  tsp. paprika
1/8  tsp. black pepper
1  Tbsp. vegetable oil
preparation
      Place fish in shallow baking dish and cover with milk. Refrigerate 1 hour.  Drain and pat dry.  Combine egg white and lemon juice in a separate shallow dish and set aside.  Combine oat bran, paprika and black pepper.  Dip fillets in egg mixture then oat mixture.  Saut in oil in nonstick skillet 3 minutes on each side or until evenly browned.  Serves 4.

SCALLOP/FISH BAKE
ingredients
1-1/2  lb. Sea Scallops
2  lb. Cod (any white fish can be used)
  dry Bread Crumbs (plain or seasoned)
1  stick Margarine, sliced in 1/4 inches
  fresh Lemon, cut into wedges (optional)
preparation
      Spray a baking dish with Pam-type spray.  Line the bottom of the baking dish with Scallops.  Shake Bread Crumbs over scallops until lightly covered.  Top with half the Margarine slices.  Place the Cod on top of the margarine.  Repeat the procedure with Bread Crumbs and Margarine.  Place in a 400 degree oven for 40 - 45 minutes or until the Cod flakes easily when touched with a fork. Serve immediately with a baked potato and salad.  Lemon wedge, optional.

TUNA FISH PIE
ingredients
1/2  c. sliced green peppers
3  Tbsp. oleo
1 lg.  can tuna (drained)
2  slices of onion, chopped
6  Tbsp. flour
3  c. milk
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  pkg. refrigerated dinner rolls
preparation
      Melt butter, add pepper and onions, cook until soft.  Add flour and stir until smooth.  Add milk slowly, stirring constantly until thick and smooth.  Boil 2 minutes, add remaining ingredients, pour into large baking dish, cover with rolls.  Bake 30 minutes at 350°.

EASY AND DELICIOUS FISH
ingredients
  fish fillets (1/2 lb. per person)
  lemon juice
  salt and pepper
  mayonnaise
  Parmesan cheese
  paprika
preparation
	Preheat oven to 450°. Wash fish and pat dry. Line a baking dish with foil. Place fish skin side down in baking dish. Squeeze lemon juice over fish; sprinkle generously with salt and pepper. Spread mayonnaise evenly over fish, including the edges. Sprinkle lightly with Parmesan cheese and paprika. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until done. Run under broiler for 1 minute or until lightly browned and puffed.

CREOLE FISH
ingredients
2  lb. thick fish fillets
2  Tbsp. margarine
3/4  c. celery, diced
3/4  c. diced carrots
1/4  c. black olives
1/2  c. green pepper, diced
1  red onion, chopped
1 (16 oz.)  can tomatoes
3/4  c. tomato sauce
preparation
      Pour 2 tablespoons margarine in bottom of baking pan.  Combine celery, carrots, olives, green pepper, onions, tomatoes and tomato sauce.  Spread half of mixture in bottom of pan.  Place fish on top.  Cover with remaining mixture.  Dot with margarine.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes in a 350° oven.  Calories:  280.

TUNA FISH CASSEROLE
ingredients
1 (9 1/4 oz.)  can tuna in water
1  can cream of celery soup
1  c. green peas
1/4  c. chopped onions
1/2  c. sharp Cheddar cheese, shredded
2  c. macaroni
2/3  c. milk
1/2  c. sharp Cheddar cheese, shredded
2  tsp. butter (stick)
  bread crumbs (for topping)
preparation
      Cook macaroni and drain. Add macaroni, celery soup, tuna fish, peas, onions and 1/2 cup of shredded cheese in a 2-quart casserole dish along with milk. On top, add remaining 1/2 cup cheese then slice butter on top of cheese then sprinkle bread crumbs on last. Bake at 400° for 30 minutes.

FISH STEW
ingredients
1/2  lb. bacon
7  small white potatoes, peeled and sliced 1/4-inch thick
6  (3 oz.) fillets whitefish
3  large onions, peeled and thinly sliced
  salt and pepper to taste
2 (10.75 oz.)  cans Manhattan style clam chowder
1 (28 oz.)  can crushed tomatoes
1  doz. eggs
preparation
      Line the bottom of a large pot with bacon. Place a layer of potatoes over the bacon; then a layer of fish, in bite-size pieces; then a layer of onion slices, without separating the rings; and finally salt and pepper. Repeat layers, not including bacon, and finish with a final potato layer. Top with the chowder and crushed tomatoes. Can add 1 small can of tomato paste if you like a little more tomato flavor. Pour in enough water so that all is covered. Cover and simmer over medium heat until potatoes are tender, about 1 hour; bring heat back to a boil. Crack eggs into pot. Cook until eggs are done. Serve with crackers and hot sauce.

BAKED FISH STEAKS
ingredients
4  (3 oz.) fish steaks
3  tsp. oil
1  onion, sliced thin
1  potato, sliced thin
1/2  carrot, sliced thin
  dash of salt and pepper
1/2  tsp. parsley, snipped
preparation
      Preheat oven to 450°.  Remove skin from fish, cut meat from bones.  Cut 4 (10 x 12-inch) pieces of heavy-duty foil, use oil to grease center of each piece of foil.  Place a steak on each piece of foil.  Top each steak with slices of onion, potato and carrot. Salt and pepper.  Using drugstore wrap, fold each piece separately. Put on cookie sheet and bake until fish flakes and is tender, approximately 20 minutes.  Garnish with parsley.

FISH HOUSE SLAW
ingredients
1  large cabbage
1 small  jar pimento, diced
1  c. dill pickle cubes
1  can diced tomatoes
1  large bell pepper
1/2  c. sugar
3/4  c. vinegar
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
	Combine together. Dissolve well. Pour over cabbage mixture. Let set awhile before using. It will keep several weeks in refrigerator.

PICKLED FISH
ingredients
30  fish
3  Tbsp salt
2  Tbsp pickling spices
  vinegar enough to cover
preparation
      Cut fish into small pieces. Cover with cold water and add three Tbsp of salt. Let soak for  two hours. Drain fish well and place side by side in a pan. Add spices and vinegar enough  to cover.  Bake at 350° until tender.

FISH SOUP WITH STUFFED PASTA
ingredients
1  large onion, chopped
1  stalk celery, chopped
2  cloves garlic, pressed
3  Tbsp. oil
  pinch of dried red pepper
  salt to taste
1/4  tsp. sage
2  cans chicken broth
1 large (24 oz.)  can tomatoes with basil
1 1/2  lb. red snapper, cut in 1-inch pieces
1  pkg. cheese ravioli (7 oz.)
1/2  lb. small shrimp
1  c. white wine or water
1/2  c. fresh parsley
preparation
      Brown onion, celery and garlic in oil.  Add next 5 ingredients. Cook covered 1/2 hour.  (This part can be made ahead and refrigerated.)  Bring to a boil.  Add fish and cook 5 minutes. Cook ravioli.  Add to soup with shrimp, wine and parsley.  Serve hot.

FISH KABOBS
ingredients
2  Tbsp. extra virgin olive oil
2  Tbsp. fresh lime juice
1  Tbsp. Dijon mustard
1  lb. fresh halibut, scrod, salmon or tuna steak, cut inch thick
1/2  large red onion, cut lengthwise into quarters
1/2  yellow bell pepper, cored, seeded and cut into 4 wedges
1/2  red bell pepper, cored, seeded and cut into 4 wedges
4  cherry tomatoes
preparation
      Combine the oil, juice and mustard in an 8 x 8 inch glass baking dish. Stir to blend. Cut the fish into sixteen 1 inch cubes. Add in one layer to the marinade. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 5-10 minutes. Turn the fish cubes to coat evenly and chill 5 minutes longer. Preheat the broiler. Drain the fish cubes, reserving the marinade. Separate the onion layers slightly. Thread the fish and vegetables onto four skewers, alternating fish cubes with onions, peppers and tomatoes. Brush kabobs lightly with the reserved marinade. Place the skewers on a broiler pan and broil 4 inches from heat source, about 3 minutes. Turn the kabobs and brush again with the marinade. Broil for 3-4 minutes longer or until the fish is no longer translucent and the vegetables are crisp tender. This has 6 grams carbohydrates.

FISH CASSEROLE
ingredients
1   lb. cape or sea scallops cut up
1 to 1 1/4  lb. haddock filets cut into small pieces
2  cans of cream of shrimp soup undiluted
  Salt and pepper to taste
  Buttered bread crumbs
preparation
      Combine all ingredients except bread crumbs.  Place in baking dish and top with bread crumbs.  Bake at 350° for 40 minutes. Serves 4-6.
      Yummy.

MICROWAVED FISH
ingredients
4  (5 to 7 oz.) fish fillets or steaks
2  Tbsp. melted butter
1  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. lemon or lime juice or white wine
1/2  tsp. tarragon or other herb
preparation
      Arrange fish on a microwave-proof platter with the thicker parts to the outside of the dish. Combine other ingredients and brush mixture over fish. Cover fish with plastic wrap or wax paper and microwave on the High setting for 5 minutes. Check for doneness. Continue microwaving and checking at 1 minute intervals until fish is flaky and no longer translucent in the center. Garnish with 2 teaspoons lemon or lime peel and parsley. Yield: 4 servings.

UNFRIED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
  vegetable oil cooking spray
1/4  c. cornmeal
1  tsp. dried thyme
1  tsp. dried basil
2  tsp. Old Bay seasoning
4  fish fillets (catfish, flounder or sole)
preparation
      Spray baking sheet to coat.  Combine cornmeal, thyme, basil and Old Bay seasoning on large platter.  Dip each fillet into until coated on both sides.  Place on baking sheet and spray lightly with cooking spray.  Bake at 400° for 20 minutes; reduce heat to 350° and bake another 5 minutes until golden and fish flakes easily.

SWEET & SOUR FISH
ingredients
  about 1/3 c. cornstarch
2  lb. turbot or halibut fillets, cut into 1/2 inch squares
  about 6 Tbsp. salad oil
1  clove garlic, minced or pressed
1  onion, cut into 1-inch cubes
1  med green bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1/2 inch thick strips
1  med tomato, cut into 1-inch cubes
  fresh cilantro or Italian parsley (optional)
preparation
      Prepare sweet & sour sauce and set aside.
      Place cornstarch in a bag, add fish pieces, and shake to coat completely; shake off excess.  Place a wok over medium-high heat; when wok is hot, add 2 Tbsp. of the oil.  When oil is hot, add some of the fish; stir fry until fish is browned on all sides and flakes when prodded (about 2 minutes).  Remove from wok and keep warm. Repeat to cook remaining fish, adding about 2 Tbsp. more oil. Increase heat to high and pour 2 Tbsp. more oil into wok.  When oil is hot, add garlic, onion, and bell pepper; stir fry for 2 minutes. Stir sweet & sour sauce; pour into wok and stir in tomato.  Bring to a boil, stirring.  Return fish and any accumulated juices to wok; stir to combine.  Garnish with cilantro, if desired.  Makes 4 servings.
      Sweet & Sour Sauce:  Stir together 1 Tbsp. cornstarch and 1/4 c. sugar.  Stir in 2 Tbsp. each soy sauce and catsup, 1/4 c. distilled white vinegar, and 1/2 c. regular strength chicken broth.

BAKED CATFISH OR ANY KIND OF FISH
ingredients
1  Cup Breadcrumbs or Frosted Flakes
1  tsp. Paprika
1/4  tsp. Basil
1/2  tsp. Pepper
3/4  Cup Parmesan Cheese
1/4  Cup Parsley
1/2  tsp. Oregano
1  tsp. Salt
3/4  Cup Melted Butter or Oleo
preparation
      Mix all except butter.  Roll fish in butter then into crumb mixture.  Bake at 350 until brown.

FISH IN TOMATO SAUCE
ingredients
2  lb. fish fillet
2  c. tomatoes
1/2  tsp. salt
1  bay leaf
1  Tbsp. onion, minced
1/2  tsp. peppercorns
1  Tbsp. oil or butter
preparation
      Place fish fillet in heated skillet with oil; add onions. Saut about 2 minutes. Add remaining ingredients; let simmer until done.
      Note:  You can cool all ingredients separate and then pour over cooked fish.  Serves 3 or 4.

PUFFY FISH PATTIES
ingredients
1  pt. canned fish, drained or 1 lg. can salmon
1/2  c. crushed cracker crumbs
2  eggs
2  tbsp. white vinegar
1/2  onion, chopped (optional)
1/2  tsp. seasoning salt
  flour to dredge patties
preparation
      Heat oil in frying pan. Mix all ingredients together except flour. Scoop by spoonful. Press into patties and dredge in flour. Fry in skillet to golden brown. Drain on paper towel. Serves 6.

FISH CASSEROLE
ingredients
2  cups prepared Stove Top Stuffing
1  lb. ocean perch fillets
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1/2  can milk
  Swiss cheese
preparation
      Layer dressing in 9 x 9 inch baking dish.  Cover with fish. Mix soup and milk and pour over fish.  Sprinkle with Swiss cheese. Bake, covered, at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

SALSA FISH
ingredients
1  lb. Captain's Cut Cod   or    1 lb. Thick Haddock
1  jar Ortega Thick & Chunky Salsa Sauce (1 lb 8 oz jar)
preparation
      Rinse and pat dry Fish.  Place fish in a glass casserole dish. Pour 1/2 to 3/4 of the Salsa Sauce covering the Fish.  Cover and bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until fish is done.

BAKED BREADED FISH
ingredients
1  loaf bread (chopped)
1/2  c oil
  add thyme
  add parsley
  oleo
  fish
preparation
      Grease pan with oleo.  Put fish in bottom, sprinkle mixture on top.  Bake at 350 degrees for half an hour.

BAKED MILK FISH
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. cod fillets
1 1/2  c. 1% milk
1  onion, chopped
1  tsp. lemon pepper
1  tsp. dried parsley
  salt to taste (optional)
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Prepare an 8 x 8 baking dish with cooking spray. Rinse cod fillets and pat dry. Place fish in a single layer in the baking dish. Mix together the milk, onion, lemon pepper and parsley (add salt, if using). Pour over the cod fillets. Drizzle lemon juice over top. Bake in preheated 350° oven for 15 minutes or until fish is firm and can be flaked with a fork.
       May replace the cod with your favorite whitefish.

PORTUGUESE FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
1/2  c. salt pork cubes (small)
1  c. chopped onions
3  c. diced potatoes
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/2  tsp. saffron
1  Tbsp. vinegar
2  lb. lean fish (haddock, flounder, whiting), cut into chunks
preparation
      In a deep kettle, fry out pork cubes slowly, turning occasionally, until crisp bits remain. Remove these to use later. In the hot fat, fry onions slowly until soft and golden. Add 6 cups cold water, potatoes, seasonings and vinegar. Boil until potatoes are half done. Add fish chunks. Continue cooking gently until fish is tender. Add the browned bits of pork.

FISH PUDDING
ingredients
1 2/3  lb. pollock, red snapper or cod, cooked and picked
2  Tbsp. grated onion
2  Tbsp. plus 2 tsp. lemon juice
1/3  stick butter, melted
3  Tbsp. cracker crumbs
1  tsp. salt
1 1/3  c. milk
  light dash of Tabasco
1/4  tsp. baking soda
1/4  c. chopped parsley
4  eggs, well beaten
1  Tbsp. dry sherry
  cracker crumbs (to cover)
  butter pats
preparation
	Mix in a 2-quart casserole; cover with cracker crumbs and dot with butter. Bake until set. Serve with potatoes and slaw.

CREOLE FISH FRY
ingredients
1  lb. whitefish fillets (cod, flounder, scrod)
2  Tbsp. hot Dijon-style mustard
1  c. cornmeal
1  c. milk
1  Tbsp. Creole spices
  oil (for deep-frying)
preparation
      Mix milk and mustard. In a separate bowl, mix Creole spices and cornmeal. Dip the fish in the milk-mustard mixture and then cornmeal. Heat a skillet with oil. Fry fish until flaky.

OVEN FRIED FISH
ingredients
1  pound flounder or fish of your choice
2  Tablespoon non-fat yogurt, plain
2  teaspoons vegetable oil
1 1/2  teaspoon fresh lemon juice
1/4  teaspoon paprika
1/2  teaspoon Morton Lite salt
1/8  teaspoon black pepper
2  slices of toasted whole wheat bread, crumbled
preparation
      Wash and drain fish. Combine yogurt, oil, lemon juice and seasoning in a shallow dish. Sprinkle bread crumbs on wax paper. Dip fish in yogurt mixture and then press in crumbs. Coat both sides. Place fish on slightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 475 in oven for 10 minutes or until done.

TUNA FISH CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  c. frozen or 1 can peas
2  cans tuna fish
1  small onion, chopped fine
6  oz. egg noodles, cooked
1  can cream of mushroom
1  can cream of chicken
3/4  c. mayo
2 soup  cans of water
8  oz. shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
      Cook noodles. Mix soups, mayo, cheese and water. Spray or grease a 9 x 13 pan. Pour less than 1/2 of the soup mixture in the bottom. Next, layer noodles, 1 can of tuna and peas  and repeat with remaining ingredients. Pour remaining soup mixture on top, covering the noodles. Croutons, crushed crackers or dry fine bread crumbs can be put on top, if desired. Cook at 425° for 20 minutes or until bubbling in the middle and enjoy!

BAKED WHITE FISH
ingredients
1  lb. haddock or any other white fish
1  can cream of shrimp soup
1/4  lb. your favorite grated cheese
2  Tbsp. chopped pimento
preparation
      Place fish in a greased baking dish.  Spread undiluted soup over fish.  Sprinkle pimento over soup and top with cheese.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes (depending on thickness of fish).

CHEESY OVEN FRIED FISH
ingredients
1  lb. fresh white fish fillets (cod, whiting, sole)
1  egg
2  Tbsp. olive oil or salad oil
5  Tbsp. grated parmesan cheese
6  Tbsp. Italian seasoned bread crumbs
  Paprika
  salt and pepper
preparation
      Preheat oven to 450°.  Cut fish in serving size pieces. Spray a nonstick cookie pan with cooking spray.
      Whisk egg and oil together.  Sprinkle cheese on a plate. Sprinkle bread crumbs on another plate.
      Dip each fillet lightly in the egg-oil mixture, then in the cheese, then in the crumbs, coating both sides lightly and evenly. Sprinkle with paprika.
      Arrange in a single layer on the cookie tin.  Salt and pepper to taste. Bake in preheated oven for  8 to 10 minutes turning after 6 minutes.

OVEN-FRIED FISH
ingredients
3/4  c. corn flake crumbs
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1/2  tsp. ground red pepper
1/4  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. black pepper
1 1/2  lb. fish fillets
2  eggs, lightly beaten
preparation
      Preheat the oven to 500°. Combine first 5 ingredients in a shallow dish. Stir well. Dip fish in eggs and dredge in crumb mixture. Place fish on a baking sheet coated with vegetable cooking spray. Bake at 500° for 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Makes 4 servings.

BATTER FOR FISH
ingredients
3/4  c. flour
2  tsp. baking powder
1  tsp. salt
1  egg, separated
1/2  c. lukewarm water
1  Tbsp. salad oil
preparation
      Beat egg white until stiff.  Mix other ingredients well and fold in egg white.  Dry fish.  Dip in batter and deep-fry 4 to 6 minutes.  Drain.  Will coat 2 pounds fish.

BEST POP FISH STEW
ingredients
3  to 4 catfish or different fish
  large can fresh tomatoes
1  large onion, diced
  bacon, fried lightly
2 (16 oz.)  cans Veg-All
1/2  ketchup
6  shakes hot sauce
1/2 to 1  c. fresh okra
preparation
      Fry bacon lightly.
       In one large pot or kettle, add all ingredients. Cook medium-low 2 hours.  Enjoy with cornbread camping.

FILET OF FISH IN ALMOND BUTTER
(A Microwave Entree)  
ingredients
1/3  c. slivered almonds
1/3  c. butter
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  lb. fish filets*
2  Tbsp. white wine
1/2  tsp. dill seed
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
      *I like to use tilapia or orange roughy.
      In 8 x 8 baking dish, combine almonds and butter. Cook lightly covered 5 minutes or until golden brown. Stir in lemon juice, wine, dill seed and salt. Arrange filets in butter mixture, spooning sauce over filets. Cook covered with wax paper for 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Let stand at room temperature for 2 minutes before serving. Garnish with lemon slices.

FISH A LA CREME
ingredients
1  lb. fish fillet (snapper, grouper or haddock)
1/4  c. lemon juice
1/2  c. butter, melted
1/2  c. shrimp soup
1/2  c. sour cream
preparation
      Marinate fish in lemon juice for 10 minutes. Mix butter, soup and sour cream. Pour over fish. Broil 10 minutes. Bake in 350° oven until it starts to bubble or turn brown. Serves 2.

MRS. MURPHY'S FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
4  slices bacon
  bacon fat
1  medium onion, minced
2  to 3 potatoes, peeled and diced small
1  lb. fish fillets
  salt and pepper
2  c. whole milk
1  tsp. butter
preparation
      Fry 4 slices bacon in large frypan until crisp.  Remove bacon and add onion and potatoes and fry for a short time. Add water to cover potatoes and lay fish on top of potatoes. Cook until fish turns white and solid (15 minutes).
      Remove fish, skin and flake.  When ready to serve, add fish, milk and butter.  DO NOT BOIL.  Add salt and pepper.  Serve.

ARTHUR TREACHERS' FISH COATING
ingredients
  fish fillets
1  c. buttermilk
  slice of lemon
2  c. pancake mix
2  c. club soda
24  oz. oil (to cook with)
preparation
      Put fish fillets in buttermilk and a slice of lemon. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Remove fish from the buttermilk and discard lemon. Combine pancake mix and club soda to consistency of buttermilk. Heat oil in skillet until hot. Dip fish in batter; let excess drop off. Fry fish 4 minutes on each side. Drain on paper towels and keep warm until eating!

TUNA FISH CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1  pkg. egg noodles
1  can tuna
  shredded Cheddar cheese (optional)
preparation
      Cook cream of mushroom soup as directed.  Cook egg noodles until done.  Spread tuna fish over bottom of medium casserole dish; add noodles, then cream of mushroom soup.  Mix all together. Bake in oven for 15 minutes at 325°.  Sprinkle shredded Cheddar cheese and cook an additional 3 to 5 minutes.

FISH STIR-FRY
ingredients
  fish fillet or nuggets
1  tsp. olive oil
1/2  stick butter
1/4  tsp. red pepper
3  Tbsp. soy sauce
2  cloves garlic, crushed
1/2  onion, chopped
1/2  bell pepper
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      In large skillet, combine oil and butter. Add bell pepper, onion, garlic, crushed red pepper, fish and lemon juice.  Cook on medium to low heat until fish is tender.  Then add soy sauce. Serves 6.

BEER BATTER FISH
ingredients
6  whole small fish
4  Tbsp. butter
1  c. Bisquick
1/2  tsp. salt
1  egg
1/2  c. beer (any brand)
preparation
      Melt butter in a heavy skillet or electric frypan. Combine biscuit mix, salt, egg and beer; mix until smooth. Dip fish into batter, letting excess drip into bowl.
       Fry at moderate heat until golden brown on both sides.

BAKED FISH WITH LEMON AND BLACK PEPPER
ingredients
1  lb. fish fillets (your choice)
1/2  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. turmeric
1/2  tsp. cumin powder
1/2  tsp. fresh ground black pepper
1  clove garlic, minced
1  tsp. vegetable oil
1 1/2  tsp. lemon juice, fresh squeezed
preparation
      Place fish fillets into a medium sized bowl and sprinkle with salt, turmeric, cumin, black pepper and garlic, tossing to coat well.  Cover and marinate for 50 to 60 minutes in the refrigerator.
      Preheat oven to 400°.  Coat the bottom of an 8 x 8-inch baking dish with the vegetable oil.  Place the fish in a single layer inside the baking dish and pour the marinade on top.  Bake, uncovered, for 20 to 25 minutes.  The fish should be firm to the touch.  Fish is done when it easily flakes with a fork.  Sprinkle with lemon juice 5 minutes before serving.

FISH FLORENTINE
ingredients
1  pkg. frozen chopped spinach, thawed
  Salt, pepper to taste
6  small flounder fillet of sole
1  tbsp. butter
1/4  lb. mushrooms or 1 can sliced
1  small onion, chopped
3  tbsp. butter
1  c. milk
2  tbsp. flour
1/4  c. white wine, opt.
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      In bottom of buttered casserole, put thawed spinach, salt and pepper.  Top with fish fillets.   Sauté in 1 tbsp. butter the mushrooms and the onion.  Put this over fish.  Make a white sauce of butter, milk, flour and white wine.  When thick, add the Parmesan cheese.  Pour over fish and bake at 375° for 20-25 mins.

FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
2 1/2  lb. haddock or chowder fish
2  c. water
1/4  lb. butter (more 1/2 lb.)
1 3/4  c. thinly sliced onions
2  Tbsp. flour
2 1/2  c. cubed potatoes
2  c. celery, chopped coarsely
1  bay leaf, quartered
2 1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. Accent
1/4  tsp. pepper
4  c. milk
1  c. medium cream (I use heavy)
1  c. sour cream (I use 1 small or large container)
preparation
      Simmer fish with water for 5 minutes or until fish can be flaked. Remove fish. Boil fish broth 10 minutes or until reduced to about 1 2/3 cups. Remove skin, unless you buy skinless haddock and cool fish. Saut onions in 5 tablespoons butter for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in flour. Gradually add fish broth. Add potatoes, celery, seasonings and about 2/3 cup of fish. Simmer 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Scald milk. Remove from heat. Add cream and sour cream. (Bring the cream and sour cream to room temperature or they'll curdle.) Beat with a wire whip until creams are well combined. Reheat slowly; don't boil. Add potatoes and fish mixture to the milk mixture. Heat 5 minutes. Remove loose bay leaves. Top with butter. Best heated next day. Makes 3 quarts.

WILD RICE FISH CAKES
ingredients
1  lb. Red Snapper skinless
2  c. water
1/2  c. cooked wild rice
1/2  c. mayonnaise
1/2  c. bread crumbs
1 1/2  tsp. Old Bay Seasoning
1  large egg beaten
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1/2  tsp. dry mustard
2  tbsp. cornmeal
3  tbsp. butter
preparation
	Bring fish and water to a boil in a 12 inch nonstick skillet. Reduce heat and simmer fillets 8 to 10 minutes until cooked through.  If fillets are thick turn halfway through cooking. Drain on paper towels, cool.  Flake fish into small pieces with fork. Combine rice,  mayonnaise,	bread crumbs, Old Bay Seasoning, egg, salt, pepper, and dry mustard in bowl.  Stir in fish and refrigerate one hour or overnight.	Line jelly roll pan with waxed paper.  Sprinkle with one tbsp. cornmeal.  Shape fish into 8 1/2 inch patties,  place on pan and sprinkle tops with one tbsp. cornmeal.	Melt 2 tbsp. butter in large nonstick skillet over medium heat, cook 3 minutes.   Add 1 tbsp. butter, turn cakes and cook 3 more minutes.   Makes 4 servings.

FISH
ingredients
2  large fish filets
  tony's creole seasoning
1  small onion sliced
1  stick butter
preparation
      Season fish with tony's. Melt butter in frying pan. Add fish, then onions. Fry 5 minutes on each side until done.

LEMON BUTTER BAKED FISH
ingredients
1  lb. catfish fillets
1/2 to 1  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
1/2  c. (1/4 lb.) butter
1/2  c. chopped parsley
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/2  tsp. paprika
preparation
      In a 12 x 8 x 2-inch dish, arrange fillets with thickest, meaty areas to outside edge of dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. In 1-quart casserole dish, place butter. Microwave on High for 1 to 2 minutes until melted. Blend in parsley and lemon juice; pour over fish. Sprinkle paprika over fillets. Preheat oven to 350°. Place casserole dish in oven. Cook 45 to 60 minutes or until fillets are fluffy. Serves 2 to 3 people.

FISH AND PASTA
ingredients
  Olive oil
1  onion - cut into small pieces
1  green pepper - cut into small pieces
1  lb plum tomatoes (about 8) skinned and cut up
1  bay leaf
  garlic powder
  paprika
  sweet basil
  creole seasoning
1/2  can black olives - chopped into small pieces
10 mushrooms -  cup up
8  ounces white wine
1  1/2 lbs fish filets - cut into bite size pieces
  Parmesan cheese
8  ounces flat noodles - cooked
preparation
      In a large flat sauce pan put olive oil.  Add the cut up onion and green pepper, cook until soft.  Add the cut up tomatoes. Add bay leaf, garlic powder, paprika, sweet basil and creole seasoning stir and let cook for about 10 minutes.  Add the chopped up black olives, the cut up mushrooms and white wine.  Stir in well to mix and then let it cook down for about 15 minutes.  Add the Fish pieces and parmesan cheese, let the fish and cheese sit on top.  Cook until the fish is done, about 10 - 15 minutes. Serve over a bed of cooked flat noodles.  Serves 3 - 4 people.

SMOKED FISH SPREAD  #1
ingredients
2  1/2  lb smoked salmon
6  oz. chilli sauce
16  oz. sandwich spread
1  tsp. worcestershire sauce
preparation
      Skin the smoked fish and remove it from the bones. Break fish into small pieces and put it in a large bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Serve on crackers or bread. Makes about 3 quarts.

FISH IN CUCUMBER SAUCE
ingredients
2  lb. fish (white fish fillets)
4  Tbsp. butter (divided)
1  medium cucumber, unpeeled and chopped
1  medium tomato, chopped
1/3  c. sour cream
1/2  tsp. dill week
1/2  tsp. salt
1  can mushroom soup
preparation
      Combine cucumber, dill and 2 tablespoons of butter.  Sauté until tender.  Stir in soup, sour cream and tomato.
      Place 2 tablespoons of butter and salt in baking dish and melt. Arrange fish in dish and cover with sauce.  Bake until fish is tender.  Serve over rice.  Makes 6-8 servings.

FISH STICKS AND CHEESE SANDWICH MELTS
ingredients
  fish sticks
  butter
  bread
  american cheese slices
preparation
      Prepare fish sticks according to box directions.  Spread tops of bread with butter.  Place 4 cooked fish sticks on bread, slice of cheese.  Then in a skillet over medium heat, place buttered side of bread down in pan.  Heat until golden brown and cheese is melted.

FISH CAKES
ingredients
1  pkg. (6 oz.) Stove Top Stuffing Mix (any flavor)
1/3  c. mayonnaise
2  cans (6 oz. each) salmon, drained, skin and bones discarded
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  c. shredded mozzarella cheese
1/2  c. chopped green onions
preparation
      Mix together stuffing mix with 3/4 c. water, mayonnaise, fish and 1/2 c. vegetables. Cover and refrigerate 10 minutes. Heat large nonstick skillet sprayed with cooking spray on medium heat. Shape 1/3 cupfuls of the stuffing mixture into patties; add to skillet in batches. Cook 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown on both sides, turning over carefully. Makes 6 servings, 2 fish cakes each.

FETA TOMATO BASIL FISH
ingredients
1/3  c. chopped onion
1  garlic clove, minced
2  tsp. oil
1  can Italian diced tomatoes, drained
1 1/2  tsp. fresh basil, minced
1  lb. white fish
4  oz. crumbled feta cheese
preparation
      In a saucepan, sauté onion and garlic in oil. Add tomatoes and basil. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Broil fish 4-6 inches from heat for 5 minutes. Top each piece of fish with tomato mixture and cheese. Broil 5-6 minutes or until fish flakes easily.

GRILLED FISH RUB
ingredients
3  Tbsp. salt (kosher if available)
3  Tbsp. sugar
1  tbsp. brown sugar
2  tsp. black pepper
2  tsp. celery seed
1  tsp. paprika
2  tsp. garlic powder
1  tsp. cayenne pepper
1  tsp. onion powder
1/2  tsp fennel seed
1/2  tsp. chili powder
preparation
      Rub fish with a little mayonnaise; then sprinkle rub on--rub it in well with back of wooden spoon.  Rub oil on grill and grill approximately 10-15 minutes depending on thickness of fish filets. Especially good on salmon!

BAKED FISH
ingredients
6  fish fillets
1/2  c. Miracle Whip
1/4  c. butter
  salt and pepper
1  c. bread crumbs or cracker crumbs
preparation
      Mix.  Put on both sides fish.  Bake at 350° about 30 minutes or until fish are golden brown.

CITRUS FISH NUGGETS
ingredients
  fish fillets (bass, crappie, bluegill)
  fresh squeezed orange juice
  flour
  citrus pepper
preparation
      Marinate fillets in orange juice for 30 minutes.  Mix citrus pepper with flour to taste.  Roll fillets in flour.  If flour runs out, make more!  Deep fry in oil.
      NOTE:  You can substitute lemon juice for orange juice.

BAKED FISH
ingredients
  fish fillets, cut into small pieces
1  egg, beaten
  Ritz cracker crumbs
  butter
  sliced almonds
preparation
      Roll fish in beaten egg and then in Ritz cracker crumbs. Place in shallow baking pan and bake at 350° to 400° for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and brush with melted butter. Sprinkle almonds over fish. Bake 10 minutes more.

FISH STEW
ingredients
  fat back
2  large onions, diced
2 small  cans tomato paste
1 large  can V-8 juice
  salt and pepper to taste
2  cans water, may add more
1  tsp. lemon juice
  dash of Worcestershire sauce
  dash of sugar
  fish
preparation
      Fry fat back. Fry onions in fat back grease. Combine rest of ingredients and cook about 6 to 10 minutes.

STUFFED FISH
ingredients
3  whole fish
2  Tbsp. ginger root, peeled and chopped
2  Tbsp. fresh chives, minced
1  c. oil (optional)
  salt to taste
  pepper to taste
preparation
      Rub the cavities of fish with oil, then stuff with ginger and chives.  Bake or steam fish until done.  To serve hot, remove ginger and chives, then fillet.  To serve chilled, refrigerate before removing ginger and chives. Yields 4 servings.

FRIED FISH
ingredients
2  c. flour
2  c. yellow cornmeal
2  Tbsp. seasoning salt
2  Tbsp. white pepper
2  Tbsp. Cajun seasoning
2  Tbsp. garlic powder
1  Tbsp. paprika
2  eggs
2  Tbsp. water
2  lb. cod, whiting or catfish fillets, rinsed and patted dry
  vegetable or canola oil for frying
  cubed dear meat
  diced tomatoes
  corn
  mixed vegetables
  potatoes
  onion or onion flakes
  salt and pepper
preparation
      Brown cubed dear meat.  Mix with all other ingredients in crock pot.  (Vegetables can be canned or fresh.)  Cook on high for 1 hour then turn down and cook until vegetables are done. Salt and pepper to your taste.

BAKED FISH FILLETS IN MUSHROOMS CHEESE SAUCE
ingredients
1  lb. frozen fish fillets
1  c. (10 1/2 oz.) cream of mushroom soup
1/8  tsp. pepper
  salt
1  c. grated sharp Cheddar cheese
  paprika
preparation
      Cut fish in serving pieces and arrange in serving baking dish. Sprinkle with salt. Mix rest of ingredients except paprika. Spread on fish. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake in moderate oven (375°) for about 25 minutes. Serves 3.

PUFFED BAKED FISH
ingredients
1  lb. (more or less) white fish
1/4  c. mayonnaise
1/4  c. shredded cheese (American or cheddar)
1  egg white (beaten until stiff)
preparation
      Heat oven to 400°.  Arrange fish in buttered baking dish.  Mix mayonnaise, cheese and egg white.  Spread over fish and bake 15-20 minutes.  Easy.

OVEN-FRIED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
1  lb. fish fillets or small whole fish
1  c. dry bread crumbs
1/4  c. French dressing (2 parts vegetable oil to 1 part vinegar or lemon or lime juice)
preparation
      Preheat oven to 500° (very hot).  If frozen fish is used, thaw it enough to separate pieces.  Dip fish into well-seasoned French dressing, then into bread crumbs.  Arrange on an oiled baking pan or on an ovenproof platter.  Pour any remaining French dressing over fish.  Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.  Makes 4 servings, 4 oz. each.

BAKED FISH
ingredients
2  fish fillets (flounder)
2  tsp. olive oil
2  tsp. crushed fresh garlic
1  Tbsp. chopped parsley
1  Tbsp. chopped basil or any herb you like
  salt
  pepper
preparation
      Rinse fish and dry with paper towel. Brush fish with olive oil. Salt and pepper both sides of the fish and place on a baking dish. Rub the top of the fish with the fresh garlic and sprinkle the fish with herbs. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes. Serve with your favorite side dishes. (I like to slice a lime and squeeze on my fish.) Makes 2 servings.
      Cal-193, CHO-1g, Pro-31g, Fat-6g.
