CORNFLAKE FISH
ingredients
  Fish fillets (catfish or other white fish)
  Tabasco sauce
  Cornflake crumbs
  Olive oil
preparation
      Wash filets and cut into serving pieces.  Heat frying pan and grease lightly with olive oil.
      Prepare each fish piece by sprinkling with Tabasco sauce, then rolling in cornflake crumbs.  Fry in olive oil on each side until flesh flakes with a fork.

SHELLRONI AND TUNA FISH SALAD
ingredients
1  box shellroni
1  can tuna
1  lb. green grapes
1  c. celery, diced
  juice of 1 lemon
1  pt. jar mayonnaise
  salt
preparation
      Cook shellroni until tender, then chill by running cold water over it. Flake tuna. Blend all ingredients with mayonnaise.

TATER CRISP FRIED FISH
ingredients
2  lbs fresh or frozen perch--thawed
2  eggs
1  c mashed potato flakes
1/4  c grated parmesan cheese
2  tsp oregano leaves
1/2  c canola oil
  salt
  pepper
preparation
      Rinse fish fillets under cold water and pat dry.  In shallow dish, beat eggs.  In another dish, combine potato flakes, parmesan cheese and oregano.  Dip fillets in eggs and coat with potato flakes mixture.  In large skillet, heat oil over medium heat for 1-2 minutes. Fry fish in skillet until crust is golden brown and fish flakes easily with fork (about 3-5 minutes) on each side. If fish sticks to pan, add more oil.

VICKI'S FISH BRINE
ingredients
1  gal. water
2  c. brown sugar
3/4  c. salt
1/4 small  bottle Liquid Smoke
1/2  jar pickling spices
preparation
      Mix above ingredients in large pot. Boil for 20 minutes, stirring often. Chill in refrigerator.
      Soak 10 pounds of fish (fillets) in brine for 8 hours, stirring up often. Smoke fillets until firm, not hard.

LUSCIOUS BROILED FISH
ingredients
16  oz. fresh or frozen sole (thawed)
3/4  cup mayonnaise
1/2  cup fresh grated Parmesan cheese
  Salt to taste
  Pepper to taste
1  medium onion, finely chopped
preparation
	Place fish in a shallow broiler pan.  Mix the mayo, cheese, salt and pepper together.  Spread on fish; sprinkle onion on top. cover the pan with aluminum foil (do not let foil touch fish). Place under a preheated broiler for about 7 minutes.  Remove the foil and continue to broil until onion is golden brown, about 5 minutes.  Serve immediately.
	 Serves 6.

FISH A LA BURGENDLAND
ingredients
2  lb. filleted pike, whitefish, sole, scrod or haddock
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/4  c. milk
1/2  c. flour
  butter
4  chopped anchovies
1  c. sour cream
1  large red pepper, in thin julienne strips
1  large green pepper, in thin julienne strips
preparation
      Cut fish in pieces.  Salt and sprinkle with lemon juice and then let stand for 10 minutes.  Then dip in milk, then in flour. Sauté both sides in butter until golden brown.  Remove to shallow casserole.  Blend anchovies into fish butter.  Pour over fish. Pour sour cream over and bake 5 minutes in preheated moderate oven (375°).  Lightly saut peppers in butter.  Arrange over fish.

TUNA-FISH CASSEROLE
ingredients
6  oz. (approximate) egg noodles
1  can cream of celery soup
1  can milk (same size as soup)
1  can tuna
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Cook noodles until tender; blanch in hot water.  Mix in the tuna and the milk with the celery soup.  Add salt and pepper to taste.  Pour into baking dish, dot top with butter and bake in oven at 350° for 30 minutes.
      Optional:  Crumb potato chips over top before adding butter. Cereal flakes can also be used.

HOT FISH SHOP TARTAR SAUCE
ingredients
1/2  quart miracle whip
1  small onion
1  large dill pickle
1/8  bottle capers
  parsley flakes
preparation
      Chop onion and pickle very small. Mix all ingredients together. Chill.

TARRAGON MUSTARD SAUCE (FOR FISH)
ingredients
2  Tbsp. tarragon or cider vinegar
2  Tbsp. Dijon mustard
1  tsp. dried tarragon (or 1 Tbsp. fresh)
1/4  cup plus 2 Tbsp. plain yogurt
1/4  cup mayonnaise
1  Tbsp. fresh cilantro (optional)
preparation
      Mix ingredients until well blended.  Put spoonful of sauce on top of cooked fish.

FISH BOATS
ingredients
2  lb. frozen or fresh sole or flounder fillets
1/4  lb. margarine
1/4  c. lemon juice
1/4  c. A.1. sauce
  paprika
preparation
      Thaw fish fillets, if frozen.  Melt margarine.  Mix with A.1. sauce and lemon juice.  Cut fish into serving pieces.  Place each serving in center of a piece of Reynolds Wrap.  Cup foil and pour sauce over fish.  Loosely seal edges of each "fish boat."  Bake in 350° oven for about 20 minutes.  Unwrap fish boats, sprinkle with paprika and serve in foil.  (Place boats on cookie sheet.)

TATER TOPPED FISH
ingredients
1  pkg. Frozen broccoli, carrots, cauliflower vegetable blend
1  lb. Orange roughy fillets (about 4)
1  Can condensed cream of celery soup
1  pkg. (8 oz.) shredded Sharp cheese, divided
1/4  Cup Milk
1/8  tsp. Ground black pepper
3  Cup Frozen tater tots
  Fresh parsley, snipped
preparation
      Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place veggies in large microwave safe cooker, microwave on to package directions. Drain and pat dry with paper towel. Place veggies in bottom of baking pan, top with fish, in large bowl, combine soup, 1 c. of the cheese, milk, black pepper and mix well. Spoon over fish and spread. Top with taters and bake for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with rest of cheese. Bake for another 5 minutes until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with parsley.

OUR OWN FISH STICKS
ingredients
2  eggs
3  Tbsp. sour cream
1 1/2  c. Italian-flavored bread crumbs
1 1/2  lb. frozen white-fleshed fish fillets, cut in 1 x 4 strips
1/4  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/2  c. vegetable oil
preparation
      In a small bowl, combine the eggs and sour cream. Mix well. Place the bread crumbs in a shallow dish. Season the fish with the salt and pepper. Dip each fish strip into the egg mixture, then the bread crumbs, coating completely.
       Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the fish strips and cook for 6 to 8 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork, turning to brown all sides. Serve immediately as is or with tartar sauce.

BASQUE FISH SOUP
ingredients
1  large onion chopped (1 c.)
1/2  c. chopped celery with leaves
1 large  clove garlic, crushed
2  Tbsp. butter
2  cans (16 oz.) tomatoes cut up
1/2  c. dry white wine
1/2  c. minced parsley
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. each pepper and thyme
1  pkg. (1 lb.) frozen fish fillets, thawed or partially thawed and cut in 1 inch chunks
preparation
      Sauté onion, celery, garlic and butter in large pan until tender.  Stir in tomatoes, wine, parsley, salt, pepper and thyme. Cover and simmer 30 minutes.  At this point refrigerate or freeze if desired, or add fish and simmer 7 to 10 minutes until fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.

BEER BATTER FOR FISH
ingredients
2  c. flour
1/2  tsp. baking powder
  salt and pepper
1  c. water
1  c. beer
1  tsp. baking soda
1  egg
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  Dry fish.  Dip in batter.  Fry fish in hot oil.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

FISH SALAD
ingredients
1/2  lb. small shrimp, cooked
1/2  lb. small scallops, cooked
1/2  lb. crab meat (or imitation pollack)
1  can sardines (in olive oil), drain off oil
2  Tbsp. mayonnaise (fat-free)
1/2  tsp. dill weed
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  tsp. garlic powder
1/2  tsp. salt
2  stalks celery
1  small onion
1  small green pepper
1/2  c. roasted red peppers
preparation
      Put all seafood into a bowl.  Chop celery, onions, green pepper and roasted red peppers finely.  Put into same bowl; mix thoroughly with fish and all spices.  Add mayonnaise.  If 2 tablespoons is not enough, add until you have consistency you want.  Serve over crisp romaine lettuce.

NIBBLIN FISH
ingredients
2  1/2 cups round toasted oat cereal
1  1/2 cups pretzel sticks
1  cup small fished shaped crackers
1  cup peanuts or mixed nut
preparation
      Combine all ingredients in a large plastic bag and shake to mix.  Serve.

BOILED FISH
ingredients
  Water
2  Large Potatoes
1/2  Cup Salt
preparation
      Use a two-gallon pot.  Fill 3/4 full of water.  Add two large potatoes and about 1/2 cup salt.  Bring water to boil.  Add a fatty fish such as trout.  Cook until done (fork easily penetrates flesh).  Season and serve.  Larger fish are best prepared by this method.  Allow 2 lb. fish for every 2 potatoes.

BAKED FISH, SPANISH STYLE
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. fish (steaks or filets)
1 1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. paprika
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  green pepper, cut into rings
1  tomato, sliced
1  small onion, sliced
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  Tbsp. olive or vegetable oil
1  clove garlic, finely chopped
  lemon wedges
preparation
      From sunny Spain, a colorful, low calorie fish dish, garnished with a traditional Spanish medley of green peppers, tomatoes, onions and subtle seasonings.
      If fish pieces are large, cut into serving pieces.  Arrange fish in ungreased square baking dish, 8 x 8 x 2-inches; sprinkle with salt, paprika and pepper.  Top with green pepper rings and tomato and onion slices.  Mix lemon juice, oil and garlic; pour over fish.  Cover and cook in 375° oven for 15 minutes.  Uncover and cook until fish flakes easily with fork, 10 to 15 minutes. Garnish with lemon wedges.  Serves 6.

FISH BAKED IN WINE
ingredients
2  lbs. fish fillets
  salt + pepper
1  lg onion sliced
1  c white table wine (Sauterne or Chablis)
3  tbsp butter or margarine
2 fresh tomatoes sliced or 1  can tomato sauce
1/2  green pepper sliced
1  tsp Worcestershire sauce
preparation
      Any white fish, sole, halibut, sea bass, catfish, or salmon may be used.
      Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper. Cover with sliced onion.
      Pour wine over all and let stand 30 minutes.
       Melt butter in lg shallow baking pan.
       Remove fish and onion from wine and place in pan. Cover with tomatoes, green pepper, and sprinkle with salt.
      Bake in 375 degree oven about 35 minutes or until fish is tender basting frequently with a mixture of the wine in which the fish was soaked and the worcestershire sauce.
      Serves 6.

FISH BATTER
ingredients
1  c. self-rising flour
1  egg yolk
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. oil
3/4  c. warm water
1  beaten egg white
preparation
      Combine flour, egg yolk, salt, oil and warm water. Fold in beaten egg white. Dip fish in batter and fry in hot oil.

FISH FRY
ingredients
1  cup self-rising cornmeal
1  cup self-rising flour
  Dash of cajun seasoning
6  oz. beer
1  egg
  Fish fillets
preparation
	Mix cornmeal, flour and seasoning.  Set aside.	In a separate bowl blend beer and egg.  Beat until frothy.  Dip fish in wet ingredients and then dredge in dry.  Let sit for 10 minutes.  Deep fry until golden brown.  Serve with Hush Puppies.

FISH CAKES
ingredients
1  can mackerel, drained
3  small potatoes, cooked and mashed
1  small onion, chopped
1  egg
  salt and pepper
preparation
      Mix all ingredients and shape into patties.  Coat with flour. Fry in shortening until brown on both sides.  Makes 12 cakes.

BAKED FISH AND CREAM
ingredients
1/2  c. flaked cooked fish
1/4  c. light cream
  butter
  salt
  freshly ground black pepper
preparation
      Place fish and cream in shallow individual baking dish. Dot with butter. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake in a hot oven (400°) for 10 minutes. Serves 1.

ORIENTAL FISH AND VEGETABLE STIR-FRY
ingredients
1  envelope Lipton Vegetable Recipe Secrets soup mix
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
1/4 to 1/2  tsp. ground ginger
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1 1/4  c. water
2  Tbsp. soy sauce
2  Tbsp. peanut or vegetable oil
1/4  c. sliced green onions
2  c. broccoli florets
1  lb. halibut, cod or firm white fish fillets, cut in 1-inch chunks
preparation
      In small bowl, thoroughly blend Vegetable Recipe soup mix, cornstarch, ginger and garlic powder. Stir in water and soy sauce; set aside. In large skillet, heat oil and cook green onions and broccoli 1 minute or until broccoli is crisp-tender. Add soup mixture and fish.  Cook, stirring frequently, 3 minutes or until fish is tender. Makes 4 servings.
      Microwave Directions:  Decrease oil to 1 tablespoon.  In small bowl, thoroughly blend Vegetable Recipe soup mix mixture as directed; set aside.  In 1 1/2-quart shallow oval casserole, combine green onions with oil and microwave at High (full power) 1 minute.  Add fish and broccoli.  Cover with plastic wrap, venting one corner, and microwave 3 minutes, stirring once.  Remove fish and broccoli; set aside.  Add soup mixture to casserole and microwave 3 minutes or until thickened, stirring once.  Stir in fish and broccoli.

BATTER FOR SHRIMP OR FISH
ingredients
1  c. flour
1  tsp. baking powder
1/4  tsp. salt
2  eggs
2/3  c. milk
  vegetable oil
preparation
      Wash, drain and dry shrimp or fish with paper towels.
       To prepare batter, mix flour, baking and salt. Beat eggs until fluffy; add milk and 1 teaspoon oil. Add the flour to the egg-milk mixture, stirring only enough to dampen it. Dip in meat. Fry in oil heated to 350° until golden.

FISH STEW
ingredients
2  tsp. olive oil
1  clove garlic minced
1  small onion chopped
1/2  c. white wine or vegetable juice cocktail
1 28  oz. can plum tomatoes drained and roughly chopped
1  bay leaf
1/2  tsp. red pepper flakes
1/4  tsp. salt
3/4  lb. firm fleshed fish, such as cod or monkfish, cut into 1 inch cubes
1/2  lb. medium shrimp peeled and deveined
preparation
      In a large nonstick pot, heat the oil over medium heat.  Add the garlic and onion.  Sauté gently for 2 minutes.  Add the wine and cook for 2 minutes longer.
      Add the tomatoes, bay leaf, red pepper flakes and salt.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
      Add the fish cubes and cook for 2 minutes.  Add the shrimp and cook for 3 minutes longer.  Remove the bay leaf and serve.  Add small package (12 oz.) of macaroni if desired.  (Cook separate.) Makes 4 servings.

THAI SPICED BAKED FISH
ingredients
1  pkg. red pepper Thai spice mix
  fish filets, boneless
preparation
      Prepare Thai spice mix according to package directions.  Pour over fish; bake about 20 minutes.  Simple; spicy; superb!

FISH CAKES
ingredients
1/2  c. flaked, cooked fish
1/2  tsp. minced onion
1/2  tsp. lemon juice
1/8  tsp. salt
  dash of pepper
1  egg, slightly beaten
1/2  c. cold mashed potatoes
1  Tbsp. flour
2  Tbsp. fat or oil
preparation
      Combine fish, onion, lemon juice, seasonings, egg and potatoes.  Mix thoroughly.  Form into cakes.  Coat cakes with flour and sauté in hot fat/oil until brown on both sides.

POACHED FISH
ingredients
2  lb fish fillets, sliced or chunks
1  large onion, chopped
  1-15 oz can stewed tomatoes
2  Tbsp vegetable oil
2  stalks celery, diced
6  large button mushrooms, sliced
1  bunch green onions, sliced
1 large  can pineapple chunks, reserve juice
1/2  tsp black pepper
1/2  tsp garlic powder
1/2  tsp celery salt
  Salt to taste
1/2  green pepper, diced
1/4  tsp cayenne pepper OR dash of tabasco sauce
2  carrots thinly  sliced
preparation
      Use large frying pan or deep pot.  Put oil in bottom.  Put in onions, celery and mushrooms.  Sauté until onions are transparent. Add drained pineapple chunks; stir until lightly browned.
      Add spices, tomatoes, green pepper and pineapple juice.  Lay pieces of fish on top.  Simmer for 10-20 minutes.  Gently baste or stir vegetables over fish as it cooks.  Juices may be slightly thickened with 2 Tbsp cornstarch dissolved in 1/4 C cold water. Pour sauce over fish to serve.

MEDITERRANEAN FISH SOUP
ingredients
1  onion, chopped
1/2  green bell pepper, chopped
2  cloves garlic, minced
1 (14.5 oz.)  can stewed tomatoes (may use Italian-style or garlic stewed tomatoes)
2 (14 oz.)  cans chicken broth
2 1/2  oz. fresh mushrooms, sliced
1/4  c. sliced black olives
1/2  c. orange juice
1/2  c. dry white wine
2  bay leaves
1  tsp. dried basil
1/4  tsp. fennel seed, crushed
1/8  tsp. black pepper
1 to 2  lb. fish (assorted; tilapia, mahi mahi, etc.)*
preparation
      *Can substitute some shrimp, medium size, peeled and deveined if desired.
      Place onion, bell pepper, garlic, tomatoes, chicken broth, mushrooms, olives, orange juice, wine, bay leaves, dried basil, fennel seeds and pepper into a pot. Cover and bring to a boil, then simmer 20 to 30 minutes.  Add fish and cook for 15 minutes. Stir in shrimp and cook until opaque. Remove and discard bay leaves. Serve with fresh bread.
       Serving Size: 1 cup. Cal-256, Carbs-15, Protein-23, Fat-9.

BAKED FISH
ingredients
1  c. dried bread crumbs
1/2  c. chopped fresh parsley
1  garlic clove, minced
1/4  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1  tsp. lemon zest
1  lb. whitefish fillets
  lemon wedges (garnish)
  parsley sprigs (garnish)
preparation
	Preheat oven to 325°. Combine bread crumbs, parsley, garlic, salt, pepper, Parmesan cheese and lemon zest. Rinse fillets gently and pat dry. Rub fillets with oil; dip in bread crumbs, coating each side. Bake 15 to 20 minutes, uncovered, until done. Garnish with parsley and lemon wedges.

SPICY SAUTÉED FISH
ingredients
1/4  c. olive oil
2  lb. tilapia, red snapper or orange roughy fillets
1/2  c. chopped fresh parsley
1/2  tsp. dried crushed red pepper
4  c. cherry tomatoes, halved
1  c. kalamata olives
6  garlic cloves, minced
preparation
      Heat olive oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper. Add half of fish to skillet and saut until just opaque in center, about 3 minute per side. Transfer fish to platter. Repeat with remaining fish. Add parsley and crushed red pepper to same skillet; saut 1 minute. Add tomatoes, olive and garlic; saut until tomatoes are soft and juicy, about 2 minutes. Season sauce with salt and pepper; spoon over fish.

EASY BAKED FISH
ingredients
1 (11 oz.)  pkg. frozen fish portions
1/4  tsp. lemon pepper
1/4  tsp. dried basil
1  small tomato, sliced
2  Tbsp. green onions, sliced
2  Tbsp. Parmesan cheese, grated
preparation
      In a baking dish, arrange fish portions.  Sprinkle with lemon pepper and basil.  Bake at 375° for 15 minutes.  Place tomato slice on each portion.  Sprinkle with green onions and cheese.  Bake another 10 minutes.

LITTLE FISH BIRTHDAY COOKIES
Cookies:
ingredients
1  c. 2 sticks of unsalted butter, softened
3/4  c. sugar
1  large egg
1  Tbsp. corn syrup
2  tsp. vanilla extract
3 1/2  c. all purpose flour
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
      Heat oven to 350°.  In large bowl, with electric mixer on high, beat together butter and sugar until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes.  Add egg, corn syrup, and vanilla, and beat 1 minute. Reduce mixer speed to low and beat in flour and salt until combined.  Divide dough in half.  Shape each half into a disk.
      Between two sheets of wax paper, roll one disk to 1/4 inch thickness.  Remove top sheet of wax paper, invert dough onto baking sheet, and remove wax paper.
      On heavy paper make a fish shape.  Use as a template.  Cut out fish-shaped cookies 1 inch apart.  Repeat with remaining dough.
      Bake cookies until gold, about 15 minutes.  Cool 1 minute. Transfer to wire rack and let cool completely.
Royal Icing:
ingredients
1 box, 1  lb. confectioners' sugar
2  Tbsp. powdered egg white
9  Tbsp. water, divided
1/2  tsp. cream of tartar
  blue, green, orange and red food coloring
  Hersheys' candy coated sprinkles
preparation
      In bowl, with electric mixer on low, beat together all ingredients until combined, reserving 3 Tablespoons water to thin icing to the consistency of heavy cream.  Divide icing among four bowls, and tint each bowl with food coloring.  Using fingertip, spread icing over cookies.  Place colored candy on some fish for eyes.  Let cookies dry completely.  To make colored circles, dig bottle cap into icing bowls and randomly dot tops of dried cookies. Makes 3 dozen.

BROILED FISH
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. fish fillets or steaks
3  Tbsp. melted butter or margarine
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. dried dill weed or other herb
preparation
      Place top oven rack 4 to 5-inches from heat source.
       Preheat oven on the "broil" setting. Arrange fish on a well-oiled baking dish. Combine butter and seasonings. Baste fish. Broil fish, basting occasionally and turning once, for 10 minutes per inch of thickness or until fish is flaky and no longer translucent in the center. Yield: 4 servings.

SCALLOP AND FISH NEWBURG
ingredients
1/2  c. bread cubes
1/2  c. butter
3  Tbsp. flour
1  c. water
1/2  c. evaporated milk
1  bouillon cube
1/2  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
1  Tbsp. grated onion
2  Tbsp. sliced, stuffed olives
1  pkg. frozen fish fillets, cut in pieces
1  pkg. frozen scallops
  dash of paprika
preparation
      Brown bread cubes in 1/4 cup butter; set aside.  Make white sauce; mix together 1/4 cup butter, flour, milk and water.  Mix well.  Season with bouillon cube, salt, pepper and onion.  Arrange fish pieces and scallops in sea shells.  Pour white sauce over fish pieces and scallops.  Decorate each serving with olives and bread cubes.  Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.  Serves 4.

OVEN-FRIED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
4  Tbsp. unsalted butter (1/2 stick), can substitute olive oil
2/3  C. crushed crackers (Ritz) OR cornflake crumbs
1/4  C. grated Parmesan cheese (about 1 oz.)
1/2  tsp. dried basil
1/2  tsp. dried oregano
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1  lb. sole, scrod, perch or other mild-tasting fish fillets
  lemon wedges
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Melt the butter in a 9 x 13 pan in the oven.  While it melts, combine everything else except the fish, in a pie plate.  Dip the fish around in the melted butter, dip each piece of fish in the crumb mixture and return it to the baking pan.  Bake the fillets for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the fish flakes with a fork.  Serve with lemon wedges.  Yield:  4 servings.

FISH/VEGGIE CASSEROLE
ingredients
10  oz. whole potatoes can
1/3  c. water mixed with 2 Tbsp. Italian salad dressing
  frozen bag broccoli/cauliflower/carrot mix, thawed
1/2  c. bread crumbs
1  c. Cheddar shredded cheese
1/2  tsp. dill weed
1  can Durkee onions
1  pkg. fish loins (any variety), thawed if frozen
preparation
      Place potatoes in bottom of 9 x 13-inch baking dish.  Mix water/dressing and pour over potatoes.  Add mixed vegetables.  Mix bread crumbs, cheese, dill weed and Durkee onions together.  Spread 1/2 mixture over veggies.  Place fish loins on top of veggies and sprinkle remaining crumb mixture over fish.  Bake at 375° for 20 to 25 minutes uncovered.  Enjoy!!

HERBED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
1/2  c. cornmeal
1/2  tsp. salt (optional)
1/2  tsp. dill weed
1/2  tsp. paprika
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  lb. cod or halibut
1  egg, beaten
2  Tbsp. milk
2  Tbsp. butter or oleo, melted
preparation
      Heat oven to 350°.  Combine cornmeal and seasonings.  Dip fish in egg and milk mixed and coat with cornmeal.  Place on cookie sheet (15 x 10-inch).  Drizzle butter over fish.  Bake for 15 to 20 minutes (or until golden brown).  Garnish with parsley and lemon wedges, if desired.

CAT FISH STEW
ingredients
1/2  lb fat back
4  lbs onions
3  c campbell tomato soup
1/2  bottle catsup
  salt & pepper to taste
3  1/2 lbs dressed cat fish
preparation
      Fry fat back and remove from grease, cut up onions and sauté in grease until clear, add soup and catsup, salat and pepper and simmer about 1 hour, stirring often as it sticks easily. Continue cooking till fish are fork tender.  Serve over rice.  Very good when camping or on a cold day.

BOSTON-STYLE FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
3  slices bacon
1/2  c. chopped celery
1/2  c. chopped onion
1  clove garlic
1/4  c. flour
4  c. flour
2  tbsp. chicken flavor bouillon or 6 bouillon cubes
1 1/2  c. diced potatoes
1  lb. white fish fillets, fresh or f rozen, thawed and cut into bite-size pieces
2  c. light cream
2  tbsp. chopped pimiento
preparation
      In large Dutch oven, cook bacon till crisp; remove and crumble.  In drippings, cook celery, onion and garlic until tender.  Stir in flour.  Gradually add water and bouillon, stirring until smooth and well blended.  Bring to a boil.  Add potatoes; reduce heat and cook 10 mins.  Stir in fish; cook 15 mins. longer.  Add cream and pimiento;  heat through.  Garnish with bacon.  Refrigerate leftovers.

BAHAMIAN STEW FISH
ingredients
2-1/2  lb. grouper or other fish
1/3  cup oil
3/4  cup flour
1  small onion, chopped
1/4  tsp. thyme
2  Tbsp. tomato paste
3  Tbsp. tomato sauce
6  cups water
  salt and pepper
preparation
	Heat oil in skillet; blend in flour and brown well, stirring constantly to avoid burning.  Add onion, thyme, tomato paste and sauce; mix well.  Heat 6 cups water to boiling; add flour mixture and simmer for about 15 minutes stirring occasionally.  Add fish, salt and pepper; cook for 20-30 minutes or until fish is tender.

SPICY FISH DIP
ingredients
1  c. mayonnaise
3/4  c. Italian salad dressing
1/2  c. sour cream
3  Tbsp. Dijon mustard
1  lb. fish fillets, broiled and flaked
preparation
      Combine mayonnaise, salad dressing, sour cream and mustard. Mix thoroughly. Fold in flaked fish. Chill overnight to blend flavors. Serve with chips, crackers or toasted party breads.

FISH STEW
ingredients
2  lb. fish fillet, cubed
1  medium onion, chopped
1  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1  can tomatoes, diced
2  potatoes, chopped
1  can corn
  salt and pepper
preparation
      Cook onions in oil; stir in tomatoes, seasoning and potatoes. Bring to a boil; simmer 15 minutes.  Add fish and corn; return to boil.  Cook until fish flakes.  Good with cornbread.

FISH BATTER FOR PERCH
ingredients
1/2  c. water
1/2  c. milk
1  c. self-rising flour
1  Tbsp. vinegar
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
	Combine all ingredients. Have grease hot and deep-fry perch (or any fish) until golden brown.

FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
1/2  chopped onion
2  sprigs parsley
1  stalk celery, chopped
1  bay leaf
  pinch of thyme
1  c. Milk
1/2  C. water
1  small potato, chopped
1/2  Can corn, drained
1/4  lb. cut up fish fillet (white fish tastes best)
preparation
      Sauté first 5 ingredients in a little butter.  Add milk, water, potato and corn; simmer 5 minutes.  Add fish and simmer 5 more minutes till fish is flaky and potato is cooked.

MY MOTHER'S FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
1  1/2 quarts water
8  large potatoes, peeled and cut up
1  onion chopped
1 1/2  lb. skinless haddock (or other white fish)
1 large  can evaporated milk
1/2  stick butter
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. pepper
1  tsp. parsley
preparation
      Cook potatoes and onion in water just covering them, in large pot until almost done. Add fish pieces pieces on top of potatoes, cover and cook another 5 minutes on low heat. Remove from heat; stir in evaporated milk, butter and seasonings. Do not drain water. Serve with salad and corn bread.

CRISPY LEMON FISH
ingredients
  Any Fish
  Beaten Eggs
  Salt
  Pepper
  Commercial Potato Flakes
  Butter
  Lemon Juice
preparation
      Clean, wash and ry fish thoroughly with towel.  Dip in beaten eggs.  Salt and pepper fish and roll in commercial potato flakes.
      Fry in butter and sprinkle both sides with a few drops of lemon juice.  Be careful not to add too much lemon.  The fish will flake when done.
      Small trout are especially good with this recipe, but any fish or fish fillet will do.

FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
2  lb. fish (haddock is good)
4  medium potatoes, peeled and sliced
3  medium onions, sliced
1  stick of butter or oleo
1  tsp. celery leaves, chopped
2 1/2  tsp. salt
4  whole cloves
1/4  tsp. dill weed or seed
1/4  tsp. white pepper (or black)
1  bay leaf
1  clove of garlic
2  c. boiling water
1/2  c. vermouth (optional)
1  pt. half and half cream
preparation
      Sauté onion in butter.  Place all ingredients except half and half in a large kettle.  Cook slowly until potatoes are done and fish flakes.   Add 1 pint of scalded half and half (light cream) to finished chowder.  Let sit for 15 minutes or more for flavors to absorb into the cream.
      This is the best fish chowder.

SHRIMP AND FISH CREOLE
ingredients
1/2  lb. shrimp, peeled
1  lb. fish fillets, cut in small pieces
1 1/2  c. chopped onion
2  cloves garlic, minced
1/2  c. chopped green pepper
1  Tbsp. unsalted margarine
4  ripe tomatoes, peeled and coarsely chopped
2  Tbsp. chopped parsley
2  tsp. paprika
1/2  tsp. sugar
1/8  tsp. cayenne pepper
1  bay leaf
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
1  Tbsp. water
1  c. uncooked rice
preparation
      Sauté onions, green pepper and garlic in margarine until tender. Add tomatoes, parsley, paprika, sugar, cayenne and bay leaf. Cover and simmer 30 minutes. Add fish to sauce, then add shrimp. Cook about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally until shrimp turns pink and fish flakes easily with fork. Blend together cornstarch and water. Add to creole and cook, stirring until slightly thickened.
      Meanwhile cook rice according to directions, omitting salt. Serve with creole.

TUNA FISH SPAGHETTI SAUCE
ingredients
1 medium  can flaked tuna fish (preferably Italian tuna)
2+  cloves garlic, chopped
1+  Tbsp. chopped parsley
1+  Tbsp. olive oil
1/4  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
1 large  can tomatoes
1 small  can tomato puree
1/3  tsp. oregano
1/2  tsp. chopped basil
preparation
      Brown tuna fish, garlic and parsley in oil over gentle fire for 10 minutes.  Add salt, pepper, tomatoes and tomato puree and simmer 1 hour.  Add oregano and basil and cook 5 minutes.  Serve over spaghetti or fine noodles.  Makes enough for 1 pound of spaghetti.

PIQUANT FISH
ingredients
2  - 3  pieces of orange Roughy
preparation
      Place fish in cold water and lemon juice for a few minutes. Place fish in a baking dish.  Pour sauce (recipe to follow) over fish coating very well.  Bake at 500° for 10  minutes or until flaky.
Sauce:
ingredients
2  tsp margarine, melted
1  1/2 tsp apple cider vinegar
1  1/2 tsp lemon juice, fresh if possible
1  1/2 tsp worcestershire sauce
1/2  tsp yellow prepared mustard
  white pepper to taste
preparation
      Mix ingredients together well.  Pour over fish.

BAKED FILLET OF FISH
ingredients
1  tsp. garlic powder
1  tsp. onion powder
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. black pepper
4  fish fillets
1  stick butter or margarine
  dash of soy sauce
3  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
preparation
      Combine seasonings and sprinkle on both sides of fish. Make a sauce with the melted butter, soy sauce and Worcestershire sauce. Baste fish with sauce mixture. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes. Halfway through, turn over and baste again with sauce mixture.

STEVE'S DEEP FRIED FISH
(Quebec Style)  
ingredients
1  Tbsp. vinegar
1/2  c. milk
1  c. all-purpose flour
1  Tbsp. baking powder
1/2  c. water or more (keep thinner than thick)
1/2  tsp. salt
  fish fillets
preparation
      Combine ingredients, except fillets and mix well.  Keep fillets cut 1 1/2 to 3 1/2-inches thick and batter cold so fish won't soak up too much oil.  Use peanut oil at 350° to 375°; a candy thermometer works well to maintain temperature.  Too many fillets deep fried together will cause fish to stick together and temperature will drop below 350° resulting in soggy fish.  Keep fish in oil until golden brown and place on wire rack over paper towel lined plate for crispness.  Use leftover batter and dribble in hot oil to make delicious crunchies that everyone will love. When done, strain oil through cheesecloth so you can use it several times.  Place potato slice in hot oil to remove all flavors.  This recipe works great with walleye, Northern pike or crappie.
      Have fun catching and deep frying!!!  What a great way to spend time with your children!

MARINADE FOR FISH OR CHICKEN
ingredients
1/2  c. soy sauce or light soy sauce
2  Tbsp. olive oil
1  Tbsp. honey
1  Tbsp. brown sugar
1  Tbsp. lime zest
1/4  c. red wine
1  Tbsp. minced fresh ginger
2  garlic cloves, minced
preparation
      Place all ingredients in a Ziploc bag. Shake to mix. Marinate fish or chicken for 30 minutes and drain well. If broiling or grilling, baste with marinade.

FISH ETOUFFEE
ingredients
1  pkg. Cajun King etouffee seasoning mix
1  cup water
3/4  cup butter, divided
1  lb. crabmeat
1  lb. fish fillets
  Cajun seasoning
preparation
      Rehydrate etouffee mix in 1 cup water.  Slowly add rehydrated mixture to 1/2 cup melted butter, stirring until well blended. Add crabmeat and simmer 10 minutes.
      Pan sauté or broil fish fillets in 3  tablespoons butter.  Add Cajun seasoning to taste.  For finished entree, etouffee  can be served on top of fish.

STRIPED BASS OR BLUE FISH FILETS
ingredients
2  whole filets, about 8 ounces each
1  lb ripe plum tomatoes, chopped coarsely
4  cloves garlic, sliced (about 1 tsp)
1/2  tsp crushed oregano
1  tsp crushed dried basil
1  tsp grated parmesan cheese
1  tsp crushed red hot pepper
1  TBSP olive oil
  salt to taste
preparation
      Arrange the two fillets on a lightly oiled baking pan.  Spread the chopped tomatoes evenly over the fillets.  Scatter the garlic slices over the tomatoes.  Sprinkle on the oregano, basil, parmesan cheese and hot pepper.  Dribble on the olive oil and season with salt.  Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 20 - 30 minutes or until the flesh of the fish flakes easily and the tomato topping is bubbly.  Serve hot.
      Serves 6 to 8.

BAKED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
1  lb. fillets of fish*
1  medium onion, chopped
15  button mushrooms, sliced
1/2  c. white wine
2  sprigs dill weed or chopped dill
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
      Sauté onion in butter or olive oil. Lightly sauté sliced mushrooms. Grease a cookie sheet (one with sides) and place fish fillets on sheet. Pour onion and mushroom mixture over fillets. Pour wine on fillets and then sprinkle on the dill weed.
      Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes or longer until done. Can broil if you like your fish dryer.
      *You can use any kind of fish fillets.

GOLDEN FISH FILETS
ingredients
3  Eggs
3/4  c. Flour
3/4  c. Corn Meal
1  tsp. Garlic Powder
1/2  tsp. Salt
1/2  tsp. Pepper
1  lb. Fish Filet (white fish preferred - haddock, sole, cod, etc.)
  Oil for frying
preparation
      In a bowl beat Eggs.  In another bowl combine next five ingredients.  Dip fillets in egg, then coat with cornmeal mixture. Heat Oil in skillet.  Fry Fish over medium heat for about 3 - 4 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easy with a fork.  Yield 4 servings.

HERBED FISH AND TOMATO STEW
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. cod fillets
  salt and coarsely ground pepper to taste
6  to 8 green onions, thinly sliced
2  Tbsp. butter or margarine
1  clove garlic, minced or pressed
1  bay leaf, crumbled
1/2  tsp. dry thyme leaves
1/2  c. fish broth or dry white wine
1 (1 lb.)  can tomatoes
1/2  lemon, thinly sliced
preparation
      Wipe fish with a damp cloth.  Cut into serving pieces. Sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper.  In a deep frying pan or Dutch oven, cook onions in butter over medium heat until soft and bright green.  Add garlic, bay leaf, thyme, broth or wine and tomatoes with liquid.  Break tomatoes up with a fork.  Bring mixture to boiling.  Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, until thick, stirring occasionally, 10 to 15 minutes.  Add lemon slices and fish.  Cover.  Simmer over low heat until fish is opaque and flakes when tested with a fork, 8 to 10 minutes.  Taste.  Add salt, if needed.  Serve fish in shallow bowls with tomato sauce spooned over.
      Note:  You can substitute fillets of sole, flounder or perch for cod.  Serves 4.

FISH ITALANO
ingredients
12  oz. Orange Roughy fish, or other light favored fish
1/2  c. Ragu sauce
1/4  c. chopped onions
2  tbsp. chopped green pepper
4  oz. Mozzarella cheese, shredded
preparation
      Top fish with sauce, onion, green pepper and last Mozzarella cheese.  Bake at 400 for 15 to 20 minutes.  Serves 3 or 4.
      *
      (God) wants all men to be saved and to come to a knowledge of the truth.  1 Tim. 2:4

FISH CURRY
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. catfish filet (2-inch pieces)
1  medium tomato, chopped
1  medium onion, chopped
2  cloves garlic, chopped
2  Tbsp. olive oil
1  Tbsp. sour cream
5  Tbsp. tomato sauce
  salt
2  tsp. curry powder
1/2  tsp. black pepper
preparation
      In an open saucepan, heat oil and add onions for 1 minute and add garlic. On medium heat, stir until tender. Add tomato and stir for 3 minutes. Add spices and tomato sauce. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in sour cream and on low heat, cook for 3 minutes. Add fish; stir gently for 5 minutes. Cover and cook for an additional 15 minutes. Serve over white rice.

SIOUX FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
1  c. chopped onion
4  c. cubed potatoes
1  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
5  c. raw fish (3/4-inch cubes)
1  qt. boiling water
2  c. milk
1  c. half and half
  parsley or chives
preparation
      Add potatoes, onions, salt and pepper to water. Cook about 10 minutes until vegetables are soft, but not completely cooked. Add fish and cook 10 minutes. Add milk and light cream. Stir and heat 15 minutes longer. DO NOT BOIL. Serve with parsley or chives.

FISH BAKE
ingredients
1  lb. haddock fillets
1/2  lb. scallops
1  can frozen shrimp soup
1/3  c. milk
preparation
      Cook haddock and scallops.  Heat 1/3 cup milk and add the shrimp soup.  Pour over fish and bake 350° oven as casserole.

CHEESE FISH BAKE
ingredients
1  lb. fish fillets, fresh or thawed frozen
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1/4  c. shredded cheese
  dash of black pepper
  dash of paprika
preparation
      Arrange fish fillets in a single layer in a greased 10 x 6 x 2 inch shallow baking dish.  Stir cream of mushroom soup and pour over fish.  Season with pepper, and then sprinkle with shredded cheese and paprika for extra color and flavor.  Bake at 375° for about 45 minutes or until lightly brown.  Makes 4 servings.

FISH CHOWDER
ingredients
4  cubed potatoes
4  c. chopped onions
1  c. chopped green pepper
1  c. chopped celery
4  c. cubed fish (no bones)
1  can evaporated milk (12 oz.)
4  oz. butter
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Combine vegetables.  Cover with water.  Add salt and pepper. Boil until done.  Add fish; boil about 10 minutes.  Reduce heat below boil.  Add milk and butter, stir while adding.  Bring back to boil.  Remove from heat.  Serve hot.  Add 1 teaspoon butter to bowl when serving.

FISH HERB MIX
ingredients
1  Tbsp. fennel seed
1  Tbsp. dried savory
1  Tbsp. dried marjoram
1  Tbsp. dried thyme
1  Tbsp. rubbed sage
preparation
      Combine all ingredients. Store in an airtight container. Use to sprinkle over fish or chicken and cook as desired.

TUNA FISH AND NOODLES
ingredients
1 8-oz.  pkg. noodles
1 small  can tuna
3  Tbsp. mayonnaise
2  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1  can milk
1  small onion
preparation
      Cook noodles and drain. In a 9 x 13 inch pan, mix mayonnaise, tuna, onion and salt and pepper (to taste). In a saucepan, mix soup and milk until creamy. Add cheese and cook over low heat until cheese is melted. Add noodles and soup mixture to tuna mix and mix well. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

EASY FISH, CHICKEN OR STEAK MARINADE
ingredients
2  Tbsp. fresh lemon or orange juice
1/4  c. olive oil
2  Tbsp. sesame oil
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. ground pepper
1/2  tsp. ground ginger
1  clove garlic, chopped
2  tsp. soy sauce
2  lb. fresh fish, chicken or steak
preparation
      Combine all ingredients except meat in small bowl. Mix well. Pour over meat and marinate 4-24 hours in refrigerator. Grill meat according to liking, approximately 10 minutes for each inch of thickness.

MARINADE FOR FISH
ingredients
1 1/2  c. olive oil
  fresh chopped garlic for taste
  juice of 2 limes
1/2  c. soy sauce
  sliced onions
  colored peppers
  tuna or orange roughy or mahi mahi filets
preparation
      Marinate the fish filets in the combined ingredients and grill fish, onions and peppers.

ANN'S SMOKED AMBERJACK FISH SPREAD
ingredients
1  lb. smoked amberjack fish
2  Tbsp. sour cream
1/3  c. mayonnaise
1  Tbsp. prepared horseradish
1  Tbsp. onion, chopped
1  tsp. lemon juice
1  tsp. Crystal hot sauce
1/8  tsp. garlic powder
  salt and pepper
preparation
      Skin amberjack and flake in bowl.  Add next 7 ingredients and mix well.  Salt and pepper to taste.  Chill for 6 hours.  Serve with crackers and capers.

FISH CASSEROLE
ingredients
4  c. narrow noodles
3  qt. boiling water
2  Tbsp. salt
1  c. flaked fish (7 oz.)
1 1/4  c. mushroom soup (10 oz.)
4  Tbsp. water
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  c. bread crumbs
2  Tbsp. melted butter
preparation
      Cook noodles in boiling, salted water until tender. Drain. Add fish, mushroom soup, liquid and salt. Blend and pour into casserole dish. Sprinkle top with bread crumbs moistened with butter. Bake in preheated 400° oven for 25 minutes. Serve hot.

FISH BATTER
ingredients
1  c. flour
1 1/2  tsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. salt
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  Tbsp. melted shortening
2/3  c. water
preparation
      Mix ingredients and dip fish in and place in hot oil to fry.

COD FISH APPETIZER
ingredients
  dry cod fish (boneless)
  vinegar
  olive oil
8  green olives or to taste, chopped
1  onion, chopped
1  green pepper, chopped
1  tomato, chopped
  black pepper
preparation
      To make dressing, 1 part vinegar and 3 parts olive oil.
      Soak cod overnight.  Change water.  Tear apart into shreds. Mix onion, pepper and tomato together.
      Make oil and vinegar dressing with black pepper.  No need for salt.

CRUNCHY TOPPED FISH WITH POTATO STICKS
ingredients
4  (4 oz.) fresh or frozen catfish or other fish fillets, cut 1/2 to 3/4-inch thick
  nonstick spray coating
2  medium baking potatoes (12 oz. total), cut into 3 x 1/2 x 1/2-inch sticks
2  tsp. cooking oil or margarine, melted
  garlic salt
3/4  c. herb seasoned stuffing mix, crushed
2  Tbsp. margarine, melted
preparation
      Thaw fish if frozen.  Rinse fish and pat dry with paper towels; set aside.  Line a large baking sheet with foil.  Spray foil with nonstick spray coating.  Arrange potato sticks in a single layer over half of the baking sheet.  Brush potatoes with oil or the 2 teaspoons melted margarine.  Sprinkle with garlic salt.  Bake in a 450° oven for 10 minutes.
      Meanwhile, stir together stuffing mix and the 2 tablespoons melted margarine.  Place fish on baking sheet next to potatoes. Sprinkle stuffing mix over fish.  Return pan to oven and bake 9 to 12 minutes more or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork and potatoes are tender.  Makes 4 servings.
      Time - Preparation Time: 15 minutes.  Cooking Time: 19 minutes.

FISH COURTBOUILLON
ingredients
2  lb. boneless catfish
2  onions
2  bell peppers
1  can Franco-American mushroom gravy
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1  can Dawn steak sauce
1  can Rotel tomatoes
1  can tomato sauce with bits
1  cup V-8 juice
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Sauté onions and bell peppers until tender.  Add all canned ingredients.  After about 5 minutes add fish and cook until tender.

Fish Tacos
(- A San Diego favorite!  Yield:  10 Tacos)  
ingredients
1  lb. Cod
1  cup Flour
1/2  cup Beer
1  Egg
  Salt and pepper to taste
  Green or Red Cabbage
3  ripe Tomatoes
  Shredded Jack cheese
  Salsa, your favorite kind
  Oil
  Corn tacos
preparation
      1. Cut cod into 1/2 x 3-inch strips.
      2. In a bowl, add flour, salt and pepper.  Add egg and beer. You want it the consistency of pancake batter.
      3. In a large fry pan, fill with about 1 inch of oil.  Heat to 350°.
      4. Dip cod strips into batter.  Coat thoroughly.  Slowly add them to oil and cook until golden brown, approximately 3 minutes per side.
      5. Shred cabbage very fine, like cole slaw.  Dice tomatoes.
      6. Warm tortillas in a dry, cast iron skillet or on the burners.  (Be careful if you do it this way.)
      7. Assemble tacos.

BAKED FISH AND VEGETABLES
ingredients
2 to 3  lb. fish fillets
1/4  stick margarine
  salt and pepper
  TexJoy steak seasoning (or Tony Chachere's Creole Seasoning)
  potatoes, as desired
  carrots, as desired
1  onion, sliced
1  bell pepper, sliced
  garlic powder, to taste
preparation
      Place fish in iron skillet with margarine. Season fish lightly with TexJoy steak seasoning); sprinkle parsley flakes over fish. Peel and slice potatoes and carrots (use amount desired) around and over fish. Place sliced onion and bell pepper over all and sprinkle with more parsley flakes. Cover and bake at 400° until potatoes and carrots are done. Mighty good!

RANCH BAKED FISH
ingredients
1  stick butter
  8-10 fish filets
1  pkg. dry ranch dressing
1  c. mayonnaise
1  c. milk
  8-10 cheese slices
1 1/2 to 2  c. potato chips, crushed
preparation
      Melt butter in a 13X9-inch baking dish. Place fish filets on top of butter in dish. Mix dry ranch dressing, mayonnaise and milk. Pour over fish, top with sliced cheese. Crumble crushed chips over cheese. Bake in 350 oven for 40 minutes or until done.
      Also works well on chicken.

FISH AND FRIES
ingredients
1 1/2 to 2  lb. fish fillets
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. frozen French fries
1 (10 oz.)  can cream soup
2/3  c. milk
1/4  c. mayonnaise
1  tsp. parsley
preparation
      Place thawed fish in single layer in greased dish. Cover with frozen crinkle-cut French fries. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over the fish and fries. Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 50 minutes.

FISH SOUP
ingredients
2  lb. fish meat, chopped
1  medium onion, sliced
2  large potatoes, sliced
2  large tomatoes, sliced
1/4  c. olive oil
2  garlic cloves, minced
2  bay leaves
1/4  c. finely chopped parsley
preparation
      Over medium heat, cook potatoes, onion, garlic and bay leaves in a saucepan for 5 minutes until onions are translucent.  Add remaining ingredients, except fish.  Boil until vegetables are tender.  Add fish and heat until cooked through.  Add salt and pepper to taste.

FRITO FRIED FISH
ingredients
2  c. Fritos
3/4  c. flour
1  tsp. seasoned salt
1/2  tsp. lemon pepper
3  eggs
preparation
	Crush Fritos in plastic bag.  Remove Fritos chips to bowl.  In bag, mix flour, salt and pepper.  Beat eggs in second bowl.  Drop fish in bag and shake.  Dip fish in beaten eggs.  Roll in crushed Fritos chips.  Fry in hot oil.

BAKED FISH
ingredients
4 to 5  lb. bass or other fish
1/2  c. white bread crumbs and 1/2 c. cornbread, crumbled together
1/2  c. tomato sauce
1/2  c. water
1/2  c. chopped celery
1/2  c. chopped onion
1/2  c. chopped bell pepper
  dash of sage (optional)
1  large onion, sliced
  paprika
preparation
      Slice  1  large onion and lay in greased pan.  Salt and pepper fish  and  lay on top of onion.  Pour tomato sauce and water mixture over fish.  Sprinkle paprika on fish.  Mix bread crumbs, cornbread,  chopped  celery,  onion  and bell pepper. Place dressing around fish.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until done.

SAUCE FOR FISH
ingredients
1  can mushroom soup
1 1/2  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/4  tsp. mustard
  dash of black pepper
3 to 4  drops hot sauce
2  Tbsp. milk
2  shallots, chopped
1  tsp. chopped parsley
2  Tbsp. white wine vinegar
6  to 8 shrimp
preparation
      Mix together all ingredients and pour over a pound of fresh or frozen fish.  Bake at 375° about 1/2 hour.  Serves 2 or 3.

CRISPY OVEN FISH
ingredients
2 1/2  c. finely crushed potato chips
2  Tbsp. chopped parsley
1/4  c. lemon juice (from concentrate)
1  lb. fish fillets
1/2  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1/2  c. mayonnaise or salad dressing
preparation
      Preheat oven to 400°.  Combine chips, cheese and parsley.  In small bowl, combine mayonnaise and 2 tablespoons lemon juice.  Dip fish in remaining 2 tablespoons of lemon juice, then mayonnaise mixture, then chip mixture.  Arrange in greased baking dish. Bake 5 to 10 minutes or until fish flakes with fork.  Refrigerate leftovers. Makes 4 servings.

ITALIAN SAUCED FISH
ingredients
2  lb. fresh fish (orange ruffy)
2  Tbsp. chopped onion
1- 8  oz. can spaghetti sauce with mushrooms
1  c. shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Arrange fillets in single layer on well greased 15 1/2 x 10 1/2 x 1 inch baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt. Mix spaghetti sauce and onion, pour over fillets. Bake uncovered at 350° till fish flakes easily with a fork, about 25-30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese; return to oven till cheese melts, about 3 minutes.

MICROWAVE BAKE FISH ON CELERY LEAVES
ingredients
  Celery leaves
4  Tbsp. Lemon juice
4  thick fish fillets
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. white pepper
  paprika to taste
1  1/2 cups mayonnaise
1/2  cup sweet relish
3  green onions
1  Tbsp. chopped parsley
preparation
	Cover bottom of shallow pan with celery leaves.  Sprinkle lemon juice over fish.  Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and paprika.	Let stand 20 minutes.  Place fish on celery leaves.  Combine mayonnaise, relish, onions and parsley.  Blend well.  Spread over fish.  Microwave on high 6-8 minutes or until fish is flakey. Serves 4.

FISH BATTER RECIPE
ingredients
1  c. self-rising flour
1  tsp. oil
1  tsp. salt
1  egg yolk
3/4  c. warm water
preparation
      Beat egg yolk and fold into other ingredients.  Fry in deep-fat.
      Good to make onion rings, too.

SMOKED FISH SPREAD #2
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. white fish or herring
8  oz. French dressing
2  oz. steak sauce
3  oz. water to moisten
preparation
      Skin the fish and remove it from the bones. Break the fish into small pieces and put it in a large bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Serve on crackers or bread.  Makes about 3 quarts.

LOW CARB FISH OR CHICKEN
ingredients
1  lb. fish fillets or chicken breast
2 1/2  Tbsp. mayonnaise
1  tsp. Dijon mustard
1  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  Tbsp. minced onion
1  oz. grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Spray baking dish with Pam.  Combine all ingredients except cheese and spread over fish or chicken.  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and bake until fish is flaky or chicken is moist but not pink.

GRILLED FISH
(Red Fish, Red Snapper, or Trout)  
ingredients
6  to 8 thick pieces fish with skin and scales left on one side
6  oz. Italian dressing
1/2  cup chopped onion
1/2  cup chopped green onion
1  Tbsp. chopped garlic
  juice of 1 lemon
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/2  lb. butter
preparation
      Season fish with salt and pepper; pour Italian dressing over fish.  Let marinate 3 to 4 hours.
      Melt butter; sauté seasonings a little.  Add 1 cup water.  Add lemon juice and Worcestershire sauce; simmer about 1 hour.  Place fish, scale side down, on hot barbecue grill.  Baste with butter sauce while cooking.  Fish should cook  30 to 45 minutes (fish is done when it separates easily from skin).  Serve topped with additional sauce and lemon wedge.

SUNDAY NIGHT FISH
ingredients
1  can chicken mushroom soup
1  can water
2  celery ribs, chopped
1  large onion, chopped
  Louisiana hot sauce
4  fish filets
preparation
      Salt fish to taste.  Place in baking dish.  Combine soup, water, celery, onion and as much hot sauce as you like.  Pour over fish.  Bake at 300° just until fish is flaky.  Do not overcook. Serve over hot rice.

PASTA WITH WHITE BEANS AND TUNA FISH
ingredients
3/4  lb. pasta shells
1  Tbsp. plus 1 tsp. olive oil
1  can cannellini beans (undrained) or white Northern
1  can water pack tuna, drained
1 1/2  c. vegetable stock
1/2  large red onion, chopped fine
1/2  tsp. dried oregano
  salt and pepper to taste
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
	Cook pasta according to directions. Drain and coat with 1 teaspoon olive oil to keep from sticking; set aside. In large skillet, combine beans, tuna, vegetable stock, 1 tablespoon olive oil, oregano and pasta. Simmer 5 to 7 minutes to allow mixture to thicken. Add salt and pepper. Turn off heat and let sit 20 to 25 minutes. Place in individual serving bowls. Top with Parmesan cheese. Serve warm with tossed salad or serve cold as a salad. Serves 4.

BLACKENED RED FISH
ingredients
  Red Fish fillets
1  Tbsp. paprika
2  Tbsp. salt
1  tsp. onion powder
1 1/2  tsp. garlic powder
1  tsp. cayenne pepper
1/2  tsp. white pepper
1/2  tsp. black pepper
1/2  tsp. thyme
1/2  tsp. oregano
1  Tbsp. parsley
  melted butter
preparation
      Mix spice ingredients. Dip each fish fillet in melted butter and sprinkle with spice mixture; drop in very hot cast iron skillet. A tablespoon of butter may be added to hot skillet just before seasoned fish fillets are added to prevent sticking. Cook 3 to 4 minutes per side.

TUNA FISH SPREAD
ingredients
2  cans tuna fish (packed in water), drained
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
1  pkg. onion soup mix
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together. May need to add 1 to 2 tablespoons mayonnaise. Great on crackers!

PLAKI (GREEK FISH)
ingredients
2  lb. haddock
2  lb. onions, chopped
5  cloves garlic, minced
  lemon juice
  salt and pepper to taste
  raisins
  olive oil
  crushed tomatoes
  mint
  parsley
  water
preparation
      Sauté onions and garlic in small amount olive oil.  Clean fish and rub with lemon juice and salt.  Add to pot.  Pour crushed tomatoes over and small amount of water.  Sprinkle generously with mint flakes, parsley and raisins.  Bring to boil; cover and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes or until tender.

BAKED PARMESAN FISH
ingredients
1/3  c. grated Parmesan cheese
2  Tbsp. all-purpose flour
1/2  tsp. paprika
1/4  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
1  egg
2  Tbsp. milk
4  (4 oz.) catfish or orange roughy fillets
preparation
      In a shallow bowl, combine the cheese, flour, paprika, salt and pepper.  I put mine in a Ziploc to mix.  In a bowl, beat egg and milk.  Dip fillets in egg mixture, then coat with cheese mixture. Arrange in a greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish.  Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes or until flaky.
       Number of Servings: 4 servings.

BAKED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
15  lb. fish fillets
1  lb. fat, melted
1  Tbsp. salt
1  tsp. pepper (white)
1/2  c. lemon juice
14  oz. flour
2  oz. butter or margarine, melted
3/4  c. milk
preparation
      Cut fish into 50 portions. Mix fat, salt, pepper and lemon juice. Dip each portion into seasoned fat. Dredge fish with flour. Place close together in a single layer in a greased baking pan. Mix butter or margarine and milk and pour over fillets. Bake at 400° for 25 minutes.

PICKLED FISH
ingredients
3  c. of fish, chunked
1 heaping  Tbsp. pickling spices
1  large onion, sliced
1 1/4  c. white vinegar
1/2  c. sugar
2  Tbsp. salt
preparation
      Mix fish, spices and onion together in a container with a lid.  Mix remaining ingredients and add.  Refrigerate for at least 7 days, stirring or shaking once or twice daily.

FRIED FISH
ingredients
2  lb. skinned fish fillets
1  c. self-rising flour
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Cut fish fillets into serving-size pieces. Combine flour, salt and pepper. Coat fish with flour mixture. Place fish in a frying pan containing about 1/8-inch hot (but not smoking) oil. Fry at moderate temperature for 4 to 5 minutes or until brown. Turn carefully and fry additional 4 to 5 minutes or until fish is brown and flaky and no longer translucent in the center. Drain on paper towels. Yield: 6 servings.

DANNY'S FISH FRY
ingredients
2  c. corn meal
1  tsp. flour
3/4  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1/4  tsp. seafood seasoning or cajun seasoning
preparation
      Blend in a blender to make a powder. Coat fish and fry in hot oil. M-mmmm!

DRESSING FOR BAKED FISH
ingredients
3  lb. fish fillets or whole fish
2  c. dry bread crumbs
1/3  c. onion
1/3  c. sour cream
1/4  c. chopped dill pickle
1/2  tsp. paprika
1/4  c. salad oil
1/2  tsp. salt
  pepper
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together and put a layer of it between fish fillets or stuff whole fish. Brush with oil; wrap in foil and bake at 350° for 45 to 60 minutes.
      Very good cold, too, or warmed up next day.

BARBECUED FISH
ingredients
1  red snapper (3 to 4 lb.)
2  tsp. chopped onion
1  tsp. fat
2  tsp. brown sugar
2  tsp. vinegar
1/4  c. lemon juice
1/2  tsp. salt
3  tsp. Worcestershire
1  c. catsup
1/2  c. water
  salt and pepper
preparation
      Clean fish and place in greased shallow pan.  Brown onion in fat.  Add brown sugar, vinegar, lemon juice, salt, Worcestershire sauce, catsup and water.  Simmer 5 minutes.  Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper and pour sauce over it. Bake at 425° for 10 minutes.  Reduce heat to 350° and continue baking 35 to 45 minutes longer.

TUNA FISH SALAD
ingredients
1  c. tuna fish
1  hard boiled egg
2  c. cooked shell macaroni
1/2  c. celery
1  tbsp. chopped pickles
1/4  c. mayonnaise
1 6  oz. pkg. strawberry Jello
2  c. boiling water
2  10  oz. pkg. frozen strawberries (not thawed)
preparation
      Dissolve jello in water.  Add frozen strawberries.  Let stand until firm.

TUNA FISH SALAD
ingredients
2  cans tuna fish, drained
1  small onion (optional)
1/2  c. celery
3  Tbsp. sweet relish
2  boiled eggs, chopped
2/3  c. mayonnaise
  small amount of pimento
preparation
      Mix well and serve.

OVEN-FRIED FISH
ingredients
3  Tbsp. margarine or butter
1/4  c. all-purpose flour
1/2  tsp. onion salt
1  egg, slightly beaten
1  Tbsp. water
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/2  to 3/4 crushed corn flakes, crackers or bread crumbs
1  lb. fish fillets (1/2-inch thick)
preparation
      Heat oven to 350°.  Melt margarine in 13 x 9-inch (3-quart) glass baking dish in oven.  In shallow pan, combine flour and onion salt.  In medium bowl, combine egg, water and lemon juice. Place corn flakes in another medium bowl.  Coat fish fillets with flour mixture; dip in egg mixture.  Coat with corn flakes.  Place fish in baking dish; turn to coat with melted margarine.  Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. Mozzarella cheese, cubed
1  pkg. riotti noodles, cooked
2  small cans, sliced olives
1  jar artichoke hearts, quartered
1 small  bottle Italian dressing
  Parmesan cheese
1  red onion, sliced thin
1  yellow bell pepper, sliced thin
1  red bell pepper, sliced thin
1/4  lb. salami, cubed
preparation
	Combine all ingredients. Mix well. Keep refrigerated.

PASTA PRIMAVERA
ingredients
16  oz. pkg. spaghetti or linguine
1/2 small  bunch broccoli, cut into 1-inch pieces (about 2 c.)
2  Tbsp. olive or salad oil
1 (12 oz.)  pkg. mushrooms, cut in half
1  small onion, minced
1  small carrot, cut into matchstick-thin strips
1  small red pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 (12 oz.)  can evaporated skim milk
2  tsp. chicken flavor instant bouillon
1 1/4  tsp. cornstarch
1/2  tsp. salt
1  medium sized tomato
2  Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese
2  Tbsp. minced parsley
preparation
      In saucepot, prepare spaghetti as label directs; drain. Return spaghetti to saucepot; keep warm.
      Meanwhile, in 2-quart saucepan over high heat, in 1-inch boiling water, heat broccoli pieces to boiling. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally until broccoli is tender-crisp. Drain.
       While broccoli is cooking, in 12-inch skillet over high heat in hot olive or salad oil, cook mushrooms, onion and carrot, stirring frequently until vegetables are golden and tender-crisp. Add red pepper strips and cook, stirring until vegetables are tender.
      In 2-cup measuring cup with fork, mix evaporated skim milk, chicken bouillon, cornstarch and salt. Into vegetable mixture in skillet, stir evaporated milk mixture. Over high heat, heat to boiling and boil 1 minute. Add diced tomato, Parmesan cheese, parsley, broccoli and spaghetti, tossing to coat well; heat through. Makes 6 main dish servings.
      Cal-355, Carb-33, Protein-10, Fat-4g.

SPARE RIB PASTA
ingredients
2  lb. Penne pasta or mostaccioli
3  large onions, chopped
6  lb. spare ribs
  white wine
2  lb. salscicia or other sausage
5 large  cans chopped tomatoes with basil, oregano and garlic
  olive oil
1  bunch fresh basil, chopped
preparation
      Cut spare ribs into individual ribs. Cut salscicia into small 3 inch chunks. Sauté rubs and salscicia in olive oil and drain. Add fresh oil and sauté 3 large chopped onions. Add white wine (about 1/2 bottle) and simmer for 1 minute. Add ribs and salscicia, 5 cans chopped tomatoes with garlic, basil and oregano and 1 bunch fresh basil, (destemmed and chopped). Cover and simmer for about 2 - 2 1/2 hours. Cook pasta and drain. Remove meat from sauce. Mix sauce with cooked pasta. Serve meat and pasta separately. Pass Parmesan cheese.

PASTA SALAD
ingredients
  Bermuda onion
  tomato
  green pepper
  olives
  cheese
2  boxes pasta
1 large  bottle Zesty Italian dressing
preparation
      Mix dressing with onion, tomato, green pepper, olives and cheese. Cook pasta and add. Let set in refrigerator overnight.

PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1/2  pkg. twirl pasta
preparation
      Boil pasta according to package directions. Rinse and chill.
Dressing:
ingredients
1/3  c. white vinegar
1/3  c. vegetable oil
2  Tbsp. chopped fresh parsley or 1 Tbsp. dried
2  Tbsp. fresh chopped basil leaves or 1 tsp. dried
1  clove garlic, minced
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Whisk all ingredients together and chill.  Pour over pasta mixed with fresh, chopped salad ingredients such as:  bell peppers, onions, tomatoes, mushrooms, cucumbers, yellow squash, pimentos and ripe or green olives.

SUMMER PASTA SALAD
ingredients
2  c. ditalini or other small pasta shapes
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. frozen mixed vegetables, thawed and drained
1/4  c. chopped onion
2/3  c. mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  tsp. sugar
1  tsp. dried dill weed
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      In medium saucepot of boiling water, cook pasta to desired doneness; drain and cool. (Rinse with cold water to cool quickly.) In a large bowl, combine cooled pasta, mixed vegetables and onion. Mix well. In small bowl, combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, sugar, dill weed, salt and pepper. Blend well. Pour mayonnaise mixture over pasta-vegetable mixture. Toss lightly. Chill before serving.
      Note: If desired, garnish with paprika and serve over lettuce. To make a main course, add 1 cup cooked chicken or beef or some diced cheese.

FRESH VEGETABLES IN GARLIC SAUCE WITH PASTA
ingredients
3  medium carrots
2  small zucchini
1/4  c. butter or margarine
1  large onion, chopped
4  cloves garlic, minced
1/2  c. chicken broth
1/2  c. heavy cream
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. dried tarragon leaves, crushed
1/4  tsp. pepper
2  c. hot, cooked, drained pasta (fettuccini, ziti or shells)
preparation
      Cut carrots and zucchini lengthwise into thin slices with vegetable peeler. Bring 1 inch water to a boil in medium saucepan. Add carrots and zucchini. Cook until crisp tender. Remove from saucepan and drain; set aside. Melt butter in same saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic; cook until tender. Gradually stir in broth, cream and seasonings; simmer 5 minutes or until sauce in slightly thickened. Add vegetables; heat thoroughly, stirring occasionally. Add vegetables and sauce to hot cooked pasta; toss lightly.

CHEESY PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. small shells
1  jar green olives
1  jar black olives
1/4  lb. hard salami
1/4  lb. pepperoni
1/4  lb. white brick Mozzarella
3  onions
3  stalks celery
2  small green peppers
3  tomatoes
1  tsp. pepper
1  tsp. sugar
1  Tbsp. oregano
1/2  c. vinegar
3/4  c. oil
1  tsp. salt
preparation
      Cook shells until done and drain.  Chop fine the olives, salami, pepperoni, cheese, onions, celery, green peppers and tomatoes.  Combine with shells.  Mix together pepper, sugar, oregano, vinegar, oil and salt.  Pour over shell mixture.

PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. box angel hair pasta, cooked, drained and cooled
2  to 3 small tomatoes, chopped
1  green pepper, chopped
1  small onion, chopped
1  to 2 cucumbers
1 small  jar Kroger salad seasonings
1  pkg. Good Seasons Italian dressing
preparation
      Mix the dressing according to directions on package. Mix all ingredients together and keep in the refrigerator overnight.

ROAST BEEF WITH PENNE PASTA
ingredients
1  lb. deli roast beef, thinly sliced
1 (12 oz.)  pkg. penne pasta
2  Tbsp. olive oil
1 small  clove garlic, minced
1  each yellow, green and red pepper (Cored, seeded and thinly sliced)
1  small red onion, chopped
1  c. black olives, halved or whole
1  tsp. red pepper, (optional)
1/2  c. citrus salad dressing or dressing to taste
preparation
      Cook pasta according to package directions.  Cut roast beef into strips.  Sauté garlic, peppers and onions in olive oil until tender.  Combine roast beef strips with all ingredients and toss. Serve warm or cold.

MEXICALI PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. fettuccine
10  cherry tomatoes, halved
2  avocados, diced
1  can (1 c.) whole pitted ripe olives
3  green onions, chopped
1/4  lb. fresh mushrooms, halved
2  fresh green chili peppers (Anaheim or Poblano)
1/2  lb. sharp Cheddar cheese, cubed
  vinaigrette dressing
preparation
      Cook fettuccine; drain and set aside.  Add remaining ingredients.  Bell pepper may be substituted for chili peppers. Toss with fettuccine and vinaigrette dressing.

ARTICHOKE-AND-PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1 (14 oz.)  can artichoke hearts, drained and divided
1  Tbsp. olive oil
1  Tbsp. water
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/2  tsp. dried basil
1/4  tsp. dried oregano
1/4  tsp. black pepper
1  garlic clove, minced
3  c. cooked radiatore (about 5 oz. uncooked, short, coiled pasta)
2  c. thinly sliced spinach
1  c. chopped, seeded tomato
1/4  c. (1 oz.) crumbled Feta cheese
preparation
      Combine 2 artichoke hearts, olive oil and the next 6 ingredients (olive oil through garlic) in a blender or food processor and process until mixture is smooth.
       Chop the remaining artichoke hearts.  Combine the chopped artichokes, pasta, spinach and chopped tomato in a large bowl. Pour pureed artichoke mixture  over pasta mixture and toss well to coat.  Cover and chill 2 hours.  Sprinkle with Feta cheese. Yield: 6 servings.

CHICKEN AND BASIL PASTA SALAD
ingredients
4  oz. packaged dried corkscrew macaroni (about 1 c.)
8  oz. skinless boneless chicken breast
  nonstick coating spray
1/8  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
4  plum tomatoes, halved lengthwise and sliced
1  small zucchini and/or yellow summer squash, halved lengthwise and sliced
1/4  c. sliced green onions
2/3  c. reduced-fat or fat-free clear Italian salad dressing
1/4  c. snipped fresh basil
preparation
      Cook macaroni according to package directions, except omit any oil and use 1/4 teaspoon salt. Drain pasta. Rinse with cold water; drain. Meanwhile, rinse chicken and pat dry with paper towels. Cut chicken into 1-inch pieces. Spray an unheated large skillet with nonstick coating. Preheat over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Remove chicken from heat. In a large mixing bowl, toss together cooked macaroni, chicken, tomatoes, zucchini or summer squash and green onions. Drizzle with salad dressing. Sprinkle with basil. Toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours or up to 6 hours. Toss salad before serving. Makes 6 servings.

PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1 large  box linguini, cooked
  cherry tomatoes, quartered
  cucumber, peeled and diced
12  oz. bottle zesty Italian dressing
1/2  bottle salad seasoning (McCormick Salad Supreme, 2.75 oz. bottle))
preparation
      Run cold water over linguini to cool.  Add tomatoes and cucumbers.  Add seasoning and bottle of dressing.  Refrigerate 24 hours before serving.

ITALIAN PASTA BAKE
(Makes 6 Servings)  
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
8  oz. broken spaghetti or 3 c. penne pasta, cooked and drained
1 (26 to 28 oz.)  jar spaghetti sauce
3/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese, divided
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. shredded Mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Brown meat in large skillet; drain. Stir in pasta, sauce and 1/2 cup of the Parmesan cheese. Spoon into 13 x 9 baking dish. Top with Mozzarella cheese and remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Bake at 375° for 20 minutes. Preparation time: 10 minutes.

SUMMER PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1/3  c. oil
3  Tbsp. vinegar, preferably red wine
1  tsp. each:  salt, oregano and basil
4  c. large pasta twists (spirals), cooked and drained
1 (16 oz.)  can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
1  c. cherry tomatoes, halved
4  oz. Mozzarella, cut in thin strips (about 1 c.)
2  oz. sliced salami, cut in thin strips (about 1/2 c.)
1/2  c. pitted ripe olives
preparation
      In large salad bowl or deep serving dish, mix well oil, vinegar, salt, oregano and basil.  Add pasta, chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, Mozzarella, salami and olives; toss to combine.  Cover; chill several hours or overnight.  Toss; let stand at room temperature 30 minutes before serving.  Makes 4 servings.  Can be made up to a day ahead.

PERFECT PASTA SALAD
ingredients
6  oz. bow tie or rotini pasta (uncooked)
2  c. small broccoli florets
1  c. thin diagonally sliced carrots
3  oz. sliced Genoa salami, cut into thin strips
1/2  c. olive oil
1/4  c. red wine or balsamic vinegar
1  clove garlic, minced
1  tsp. crushed basil
1  tsp. each salt and pepper
2  c. cherry tomato halves or chopped plum tomatoes
2  c. (8 oz.) Italian blend shredded cheese
preparation
      Cook pasta; rinse in cold water. In a large bowl, combine pasta, vegetables and salami. Combine oil, vinegar, salt and pepper and add to the pasta mixture. Toss well. Cover and chill at least 2 hours.
       If you are chilling overnight, do not add tomatoes at this point, but add the next day. Just before serving, add cheese and toss well.

SKILLET PASTA AND VEGETABLES
ingredients
4  oz. uncooked bow tie pasta
1/4  c. butter or margarine
1  tsp. minced fresh garlic
1  medium zucchini, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
1  small eggplant, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
1  medium red onion, cut into eighths
1  tsp. basil leaves
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  1/2 (6 oz.) shredded Mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Cook pasta according to package directions; drain.  In 10-inch skillet, melt butter until sizzling.  Stir in garlic. Stir in remaining ingredients except pasta and cheese.  Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are crisp tender (4 to 6 minutes).  Stir in pasta.  Continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until heated through (2 to 3 minutes). Stir in cheese and serve immediately.
      Four ounces of your favorite uncooked pasta can be substituted for the bowtie pasta.  Serves 4.

HAM, BROCCOLI AND PASTA CASSEROLE
ingredients
2  c. chopped, cooked ham
1  (10 oz.) frozen broccoli, chopped
1 1/2  c. cubed processed cheese spread (Velveeta)
2  Tbsp. chopped pimiento
  pepper
1/4  c. margarine
1/4  c. all-purpose flour
1/4  c. onion, grated
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. dry mustard
1/8  tsp. white pepper
3  c. milk
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. elbow macaroni
preparation
      Prepare broccoli and macaroni according to package directions. Set aside.  Melt margarine over low heat.  Add flour and onion, stirring well.  Add milk gradually, stirring until mixture is thickened.  Add cheese spread, pimiento, mustard, salt and pepper. Stir well until cheese melts.  Remove from heat and fold in ham, broccoli and macaroni.
      Pour mixture into 2 1/2 to 3-quart casserole.  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.  Yield: 8 servings.

EASY CONFETTI-PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. shell macaroni (uncooked)
3  c. fresh broccoli flowerets
1 (6 oz.)  can small pitted ripe olives, drained
1  sweet red pepper, cut into thin strips
1  c. small cherry tomatoes
2  small yellow squash, sliced
2  carrots, scraped and sliced
1/4  c. thinly sliced green onions
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1 (8 oz.)  bottle Caesar salad dressing (Paul Newman)
preparation
      Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Rinse with cold water. Drain again. Layer half each of pasta and next 8 ingredients in large (2 1/2-quart) bowl. Drizzle with half of salad dressing. Repeat layering with remaining ingredients. Cover and chill at least 8 hours. Toss gently before serving, if desired. Yields 10 to 12 servings. Actually up to 20. Serves 20. Must do ahead.
