BAKED BRIE WITH STRAWBERRIES AND KIWI FRUIT
ingredients
1  (8 oz.) round Brie cheese
1  c. sliced strawberries
1  kiwi fruit, peeled and sliced
  fresh mint sprigs (optional)
preparation
      Place Brie on ovenproof platter.  Arrange fruit over top. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes, or until cheese is bubbly.  Serve immediately with gingersnaps or English crackers.  Garnish with mint sprigs.  Makes 16 servings.

RAW CRANBERRY/ORANGE/APPLE RELISH
ingredients
1  lb. cranberries
3  oranges (4 if small)
3  apples (4 if small)
1  c. sugar or to taste
preparation
      Wash cranberries and remove any stems.  Wash and seed oranges (do not peel) and cut into chunks suitable for grinder.  Wash and core apples and cut into chunks (do not peel).  Grind the fruits together; mix well and add sugar.  Like stew, it improves with age and will keep well in refrigerator for about a week.  Freezes indefinitely and good with meat or fowl.

LIME PEAR SALAD
ingredients
1 large  box lime Jell-O
1  large cream cheese
1  pt. heavy cream
1 large  can pears, drain and reserve juice
1  c. chopped walnuts
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in 2 cups boiling water.  Add pear juice and water to 2 cups.  Let Jell-O partially set.  Meanwhile, let cream cheese soften.  In blender or electric mixer, blend cheese and cream.  Add partially set Jell-O, blending well.  Fold in cut up pears and chopped nuts.  Pour into a large flat dish.  Chill overnight.  Cut into squares to serve.
      Substitute maraschino cherries for nuts.

GRAPEFRUIT PINEAPPLE SHAKE
ingredients
2  c. Ocean Spray grapefruit juice, chilled
1 (8 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, packed in its own juice
1 1/2  c. vanilla ice cream
preparation
      In a blender container, process grapefruit juice, pineapple and ice cream until smooth and frothy.  Makes 6 to 8 servings.

ORANGE KIWI SALSA
ingredients
3  oranges, divided
3  kiwi fruit, peeled and diced
1/3  c. raisins
1/4  c. chopped red onion
1 to 2  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  tsp. chopped fresh mint
  salt to taste
preparation
      Peel and section 2 oranges; halve orange sections.  Squeeze juice from remaining orange into medium sized bowl; add orange sections and remaining ingredients.  Cover and refrigerate overnight or up to 2 days.  Serve with grilled chicken, duck, pork, lamb or fish.

APRICOT-LIME SALAD
ingredients
2  pkg. lime gelatin
1 3/4  c. hot water
1/4  c. cold water
1  Tbsp. gelatin
2  c. ginger ale
1 small  bottle maraschino cherries
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1  can apricot halves
preparation
      Dissolve lime gelatin in hot water. Soak 1 tablespoon gelatin in cold water and add to hot mixture; cool. Add ginger ale.  Pour into 9-inch ring mold. Chill until partially set.  Fill center of apricot halves with cream cheese balls rolled in nuts. Arrange filled apricots in partially set gelatin alternating with cherries.  Chill until firm.  Serve with dressing.

GINGERED ORANGE AND KIWI FRUIT FLUFF
ingredients
1  c. heavy or whipping cream
1  Tbsp. confectioners sugar
1  Tbsp. minced preserved ginger
3  large kiwi fruit
1 (11 oz.)  can mandarin oranges
  drain
preparation
      About 30 minutes before serving, in small bowl with mixer at medium speed, beat heavy or whipping cream and sugar until stiff peaks form.  Fold in ginger, peel and slice kiwi fruit.  Arrange kiwi fruit and orange in 6 dessert dishes.  Top with cream.

FIG-STRAWBERRY PRESERVES
ingredients
4  c. figs, mashed
2  c. sugar
3 small  pkg. strawberry jello
preparation
      Cook  all  ingredients  together  25 minutes.  Place in hot, sterilized jars and seal.

PEAR RELISH OR PEAR PINEAPPLE HONEY
ingredients
4  c. good pears, peeled and sliced thin
4  c. sugar
1 (16 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
preparation
      Combine in pan.  Mix and simmer 30 to 40 minutes or until thickened.  Pour into hot jars and seal.  Yields 3 to 4 pints.

CHERRY OR BLACKBERRY DESSERT
ingredients
2 1/2  c. graham cracker crumbs
1/2  c. sugar
1  stick oleo
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1/2  c. sugar plus 2 Tbsp. sugar
2  eggs
1  can blueberry pie filling
2  pkg. Dream Whip
preparation
      Mix thoroughly graham cracker crumbs, sugar and oleo.  Mix cream cheese with sugar and eggs.  Put graham cracker mix in loaf pan and spread with mixture.  Bake 15 minutes at about 350°. Cool.
      Spread pie filling over and cool thoroughly in refrigerator. Spread with Dream Whip and refrigerate.

LIME JELLO-PEAR SALAD
ingredients
1 large  pkg. lime jello
1  can pears, cut up
8  oz. cream cheese, softened
  Cool Whip
preparation
      Prepare   jello  as  package  directions;  chill  until wiggley.  Make  paste  of  pear  juice  and cream cheese.  Add pears and  paste  to  chilled  jello.  Put into mold and chill until firm.  Serve with Cool Whip.

STRAWBERRY KIWI SMOOTHIES
ingredients
5  kiwi fruits, ripe, soft to touch
2  c. frozen strawberries, unsweetened
1  c. Tropicana Twister, Lite, Tropical Strawberry
1/2  c. yogurt, plain, non fat
2/3  c. Splenda Granular
1  tsp. vanilla extract, pure
preparation
      Peel kiwi, cut in quarters and freeze for 20 minutes or until frozen. Add all ingredients to blender. Blender will be full. Mix on low speed for 1-15 seconds. Remove lid and stir with wooden spoon. Mix on medium speed for 15-20 seconds, remove lid and stir again. Mix on high speed for 20-25 seconds, or until smooth. Pour into glasses. Serve immediately.

CHERRY, APPLE OR PEACH COBBLER
ingredients
1  lb. cooked peaches
1  c. sugar
1  c. flour
1  c. milk
1  stick butter
  peaches
preparation
      Melt stick of butter in baking pan.  Mix, using wire whip, the sugar, flour and milk until blended smooth without lumps.  Pour flour mixture on top of melted butter in pan.  Pour peaches on top of flour mixture in pan.  Do not stir.   Put pan in oven; bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

RASPBERRY LIME CHICKEN
ingredients
2  whole chicken breasts
2  Tbsp. margarine
2  cloves garlic, crushed or minced
2  Tbsp. brown sugar
1  Tbsp. soy sauce
1 1/2  Tbsp. raspberry vinegar
  juice of 2 limes (3 to 4 Tbsp.)
preparation
      Halve the breasts; bone and skin.  Flatten with hand.  Melt butter in heavy pan over low heat.  Add chicken; cover tightly. Cook slowly until it is no longer pink inside (approximately 5 to 7 minutes), turning once.  Do not brown.  Remove chicken and reserve.
      To juice left in pan, add garlic.  Cook, while stirring, for 1 minute.  Do not brown.  Add brown sugar and stir until mixture bubbles.  Stir in soy sauce, raspberry vinegar and lime juice. Remove from heat and add chicken.  Let chicken remain in sauce for 30 minutes, turning once.  (Flavor is enhanced if stored, tightly covered, overnight in refrigerator.)
      Return to low heat in same covered pan.  Bring to desired temperature.  Serve with rice and green salad.

STRAWBERRY-KIWI SUGAR-FREE PIE
ingredients
3  c. skim milk
1 large or 2 small  boxes sugar-free instant vanilla pudding
1  small tub Crystal Lite (strawberry-kiwi)
1  (8 oz.) regular Cool Whip (Lite Cool Whip doesn't work)
2  graham cracker pie shells
preparation
	Pour milk, pudding and Crystal Lite into large bowl; beat with mixer 2 minutes. Add Cool Whip and beat until blended. Pour into pie crust. Makes 2 pies.

PINEAPPLE AND GRAPEFRUIT SALAD
ingredients
1  can grapefruit
1  c. boiling water
1  c. sugar
  juice of 1 lemon
2  envelopes plain gelatin
1  c. cold water
1  c. crushed pineapple, drained
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.  Add cold water and sugar. Cut in grapefruit and pour in juice.  Add pineapple and lemon juice.  Chill.

BLUEBERRY OR BLACKBERRY COBBLER
ingredients
1  c. flour
1  tsp. baking powder
1/4  tsp. salt
1/2  c. sugar
3  Tbsp. butter or margarine
1/2  c. milk
2  c. fruit
1  c. sugar
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
2/3  c. boiling water
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°.  Blend flour, baking powder, salt and 1/2 cup sugar.  Cut in butter or margarine.  Add milk and beat until smooth.  Cover bottom of 9 x 9-inch pan with fruit.  Pour batter over fruit.  Mix 1 cup sugar and cornstarch and sprinkle evenly over batter.  Pour boiling water over all.  Bake 45 minutes.

APRICOT AND PEAR PIE
ingredients
1  (15 oz.) refrigerated Pillsbury pie crust
4  c. thinly sliced ripe pears
12  dried apricots, cut into matchstick pieces
2  c. water
1  c. sugar
1/4  tsp. cinnamon
3  Tbsp. Minute tapioca
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  Tbsp. sugar
preparation
      Prepare pie crust according to package directions for two crust pie, using a 9-inch pan.  Heat oven to 425°.
      In a large saucepan, combine apricots, pears and 2 cups of water.  Cover and cook for 15 minutes; drain, reserve liquid and cool.  To 1 cup reserved liquid, add sugar, fruit, cinnamon, tapioca and lemon juice.  Pour into a 9-inch pie crust lined pan.
      To make top crust, cut a 7-inch circle of remaining crust. Brush with milk, create a design, sprinkle with sugar, arrange crust over filling and flute edges of the bottom crust.  Bake at 425° for 10 minutes, then for 50 minutes at 325°.  If the edge gets too brown, cover with a strip of foil.

BLACKBERRY OR CHERRY COBBLER
ingredients
1  c. flour
1  c. sugar
1/2  c. milk
3  Tbsp. cornstarch
3/4  c. sugar
1  c. boiling water
2 1/2  c. berries or cherries
preparation
      Mix batter of flour, 1 cup sugar, milk and cornstarch.  Put 3/4 cup sugar on top of first mixture (use more sugar for cherries).  Add boiling water over all, then berries or cherries. Bake at 375° for 45 minutes.

KIWI STRAWBERRY TART
ingredients
1/2  c. soft butter
1/2  c. plus 2 tbsp. sugar
1  egg yolk
2  tsp. vanilla
1/2  tsp. almond extract
1 1/2  c. flour
3/4  c. sliced, toasted almonds
8  oz. cream cheese
1/4  c. apricot jam
2  kiwi fruit, peeled, sliced
1  pt. strawberries, hulled, sliced, reserve 1 whole berry
preparation
      Finely chop almonds and blend with butter, 1/2 c. sugar, 1 tsp. vanilla, 1/2 tsp. almond extract and 1 1/2 c. flour.  Can be done in food processor.  Press mixture in tart pan, prick shell and bake 10 minutes at 375°.
      Beat cream cheese, 2 tbsp. sugar, 1 tsp. vanilla; spread on cooled tart shell still in pan.  Chill.
      Arrange fruit slices in attractive pattern on top with whole berry in middle.
      Whisk jam with 1 tbsp. water and boil for 1 minute.  Brush fruit with glaze.  Chill and serve within 3-5 hours.

BLACKBERRY OR PEACH WINE CAKE
ingredients
1  box white cake mix
4  eggs
1  c. oil
1  c. blackberry or peach wine
6  oz. or 2 (3 oz.) boxes blackberry or peach Jell-O
preparation
      Combine all ingredients and bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
Glaze:
ingredients
2 1/2  c. powdered sugar
1/2  c. wine
preparation
      Prepare glaze while cake is cooking.  Let cool in pan for 10 to 15 minutes, then while still in pan, spoon glaze over cake, letting glaze soak in side and middle.  Save a few spoons of glaze to dribble over cake after turning out onto plate.

LIME PEAR JELLO SALAD
ingredients
1 large  can pears
1  (3 oz.) lime jello
3  oz. cream cheese, softened
3/4  c. Cool Whip
preparation
	Drain juice from pears. Boil juice and pour over lime jello. Stir until dissolved. Mash pears and mix with cream cheese and jello mixture. Fold in Cool Whip. Refrigerate.

CRANBERRY-ORANGE PINEAPPLE RELISH
ingredients
2  whole oranges, quartered with skins
1  bag cranberries (12 to 14 oz.)
2  c. sugar
1  can crushed pineapple (with juice)
preparation
      Grind oranges with cranberries.  Save juice.  Add sugar and pineapple with juice.  Add sugar and mix well.  Put in jars in refrigerator.

BLUEBERRY OR BLACKBERRY COBBLER
ingredients
1  qt. blueberries or blackberries
3/4  c. sugar
1/4  c. flour
1/4  tsp. salt
1 1/2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1 1/2  Tbsp. butter
1  Pillsbury Ready pie crust (from dairy case)
preparation
      Mix berries, sugar, flour, salt and lemon juice. Pour into greased 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan. Dot with butter. Place in preheated oven for about 15 minutes or until mixture is hot and bubbling. Have pie crust at room temperature and cut into strips for cobbler pie. Place strips on berries and cook until brown, approximately 15 minutes.

PEAR OR CHERRY/PINEAPPLE COBBLER
Fruit Preparation (Pears):
ingredients
1  c. sugar
1 to 2  tsp. cinnamon
1  tsp. nutmeg
4  Tbsp. Fruit-Fresh
4 to 8  Tbsp. cornstarch
4 to 5  c. water
12  pears, cored, peeled and cut in small slices (some ripe, some not so ripe)
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Dissolve the first 5 ingredients in a large pan of boiling water (2 cups).  Add pears and 1 more cup of water.  Bring mixture to a low boil until pears are soft and tender.  Stir as needed.  Add rest of water, if needed.  When pears are soft and tender, turn heat to low.  Check occasionally while preparing the dough.  For best results the pears should be much like lumpy applesauce.  Just before putting fruit into dough lined baking pan, bring fruit to rolling boil.
Fruit Preparation (Cherry/Pineapple):
ingredients
2 (21 oz.)  cans cherry pie filling
1 (20 oz.)  can pineapple tidbits
2  tsp. cinnamon
1  tsp. nutmeg
4 to 8  Tbsp. cornstarch (as needed)
1 (21 oz.)  can water
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Put all ingredients in a large pan. Bring to a boil. Simmer fruit mixture until dough is ready.  Check occasionally while preparing dough.  Just before putting fruit into dough lined baking pan, bring fruit to rolling boil.
Dough Preparation:
ingredients
1  c. all-purpose white flour
1  c. finely ground wheat flour or white flour
4  tsp. baking powder
1  tsp. salt
1  stick real butter (at room temperature; very soft but not melted)
2  medium eggs (at room temperature)
1/2  c. honey (if the eggs are large 1/3 c.)
  solid Crisco (grease pan)
1/2  pt. cream
1/2  c. sugar
preparation
      Put first 4 ingredients in a sifter (do not sift yet).  Put honey in a medium mixing bowl. Blend the butter into honey with a fork. Stir in eggs with a fork.  You might want to check the fruit mixture. Sift 1/3 of the flour mixture in medium mixing bowl. Stir in thoroughly. Sift in the second 1/3 and stir in thoroughly. Sift in the last 1/3 and stir in thoroughly. Dough will be very moist.
      Making The Cobbler:  Prepare the 9 x 9-inch deep dish baking pan or a very deep 5 or 6-inch cake pan.  Lightly grease. Sprinkle in a light covering of flour, making sure the bottom and sides have flour on them.  Line the pan with thin layer of dough (bottom and sides). Sprinkle 1 to 2 tablespoons of sugar in the bottom of the pan.  Pour 2 to 3 tablespoons of cream on bottom of pan.  Put pan on  a cookie sheet (to keep oven clean).  Pour in boiling fruit mixture. Cover mixture with thin layer of dough. Sprinkle 1 to 2 tablespoons of sugar over top layer of dough.  Pour 2 to 3 tablespoons of cream over top layer of dough.  Pour 1/8 to 1/4 cup of water over top layer.  Make 4 to 6 breathing holes. Cook for 40 minutes (or until golden brown) at 350°.  Serve in desired quantities with cream or ice cream.  Makes 9 servings.
      This was entered in the State Fair of Texas. It is more of a guide.  I never do it exactly the same each time. The more I practice with it, the better it gets.
      The recipe is an adaptation of ideas from my wife (Helen Todd), my mother (Martha Todd), my mother-in-law (Ermine Heckman) and my Grandma Todd and was created by me.

PEAR, RASPBERRY AND RHUBARB CRISP
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  pkg. frozen raspberries
4  c. rhubarb
6  ripe pears, peeled and cored
3/4  c. honey
1/2  c. flour
2  tsp. cinnamon
1  c. quick rolled oats
1 1/2  c. flour
1/2  c. brown sugar
1/2  tsp. salt
6  Tbsp. margarine
2  Tbsp. raspberry jelly
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°.  In a large bowl, stir raspberries, rhubarb, pears, honey, flour and cinnamon.  Pour into greased 13 x 9-inch baking dish.
      To mix topping:  In medium bowl, stir together oats, flour, brown sugar, cinnamon and salt.  Combine margarine and jelly; heat or microwave until melted.  Stir into flour mixture until crumbly. Sprinkle over fruit.  Bake for 40 to 50 minutes, until fruit is done.

GLAZED ORANGES WITH KIWI
ingredients
3  large seedless oranges
1/4  c. sugar
2  tsp. cornstarch
1/2  c. water
1 kiwi fruit, cut up, or 1/2  c. raspberries or blueberries
preparation
      Cut thin slivers of peel from one orange with a vegetable parer or sharp knife, being careful not to cut into white membrane.  Cover peel with boiling water; let stand 5 minutes. Drain.
      Mix sugar and cornstarch in a 2-cup measure; stir in water and orange peel.  Microwave, uncovered, on High (100%), stirring every minute with a fork, until thickened, 2 to 3 minutes.  Let cool 5 minutes.
      Pare oranges, cutting deep enough to remove all white membrane.  Cut into slices.  Pour syrup over slices; cover and refrigerate about 1 hour.  Just before serving, fold in kiwi fruit.

ORANGE ROUGHY FISH WITH KIWI FRUIT
ingredients
4  fish fillets
  salt
  garlic powder
  black pepper
  oregano
  kiwi fruit, peeled and sliced
  juice of 1/2 one lime
  Macadamia nuts, chopped
1/4  c. melted margarine
preparation
      Place fish in glass dish which has been sprayed with Pam. Sprinkle with salt, garlic, pepper and oregano to taste.  Add kiwi slices.  Slowly squeeze and dribble lime over fish.  Add nuts. Dribble margarine over all.  Cover with tin foil to keep from drying out fish.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes until flaky.

LIME PEAR SALAD
ingredients
1 large  box lime gelatin
2  c. boiling water
1 large  can pears
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  (12 oz.) container whipped topping
preparation
      Dissolve the gelatin in the boiling water.  Drain the pears and reserve the juice.  Heat the juice to a boil and add the cream cheese to dissolve.  Set aside to cool.  Mash the pears with a fork.  Cool the gelatin until it begins to gel, then beat for a few minutes.  Add the pear juice and cream cheese mixture.  Add the crushed pears and beat again for a few minutes.  Fold in the whipped topping.  Refrigerate in an oblong glass baking dish.  Top with coconut or red cherries, if desired.

CRANBERRY, PEARS AND APPLES
ingredients
1  c. sugar
1  c. water
12  oz. fresh cranberries
2  Granny Smith apples, sliced
2  pears, sliced
preparation
      Boil sugar and water for 3 minutes; add cranberries and boil for 2 more minutes.  Add apples and pears to mixture and boil another 8 minutes.  Delicious!  Put in a pretty bowl.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

LIME AND PEAR SALAD
ingredients
1 large  pkg. lime jello
2  c. hot water
  large cream cheese
preparation
      Let jello and hot water firm up a little (not completely). Blend softened cream cheese with jello.  Add 1 small and 1 large can of pears.  Cut the halves in about 3 pieces.  Refrigerate until firm.

EASY COBBLER - PEACH, CHERRY, APPLE
ingredients
1  stick butter
1  c. sugar
1  c. flour
1 1/2  tsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  c. milk
2  cans fruit or 2 qt. fruit
1/2  c. sugar
preparation
      Melt butter and pour in the bottom of a 9 x 11-inch baking pan.  Make batter of 1 cup sugar, flour, powder powder, salt and milk.  Mix and pour batter over melted butter.  Spoon in fruit with juice.  Sprinkle 1/2 cup sugar over the batter.  Do not stir. Bake 45 minutes to 1 hour at 350°.

MICROWAVE PINEAPPLE KIWI FRUIT JAM
ingredients
4  kiwi fruit, peeled and sliced 1/8 inch thick
3  c. sugar
1/4  c. lime juice
8  oz. can crushed pineapple, undrained
3  oz. pkg. liquid fruit pectin
3  drops green food color
preparation
      In 2-quart microwave-safe bowl, combine kiwi fruit, sugar, lime juice and pineapple.  Microwave on High for 11 1/2 to 16 minutes or until mixture comes to full rolling boil, stirring every 2 minutes. Stir in liquid pectin.  Microwave on High for 2 to 3 minutes or until mixture comes to full rolling boil; continue to boil for 1 minute.  Skim foam, stir in food color.  Spoon into 5 clean, hot 8-ounce jars; screw lids on firmly.  Cool several hours.  Store in refrigerator up to 3 weeks or in freezer up to 3 months.  Makes 4 1/2 cups.

CHERRY FIG BARS
ingredients
2/3  c. all-purpose flour
1/4  c. sugar
1/4  c. chopped pecans
1  tsp. cinnamon
1/2  tsp. baking powder
1  c. fig preserves
  dash of salt
2  eggs, lightly beaten
  vegetable cooking spray
preparation
      Combine first 7 ingredients in a bowl; stir well.  Add eggs; stir until dry ingredients are moistened (batter will be slightly thick).  Spread into a 9-inch square baking pan coated well with cooking spray.  Bake at 350° for 25 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean.  Cool in pan for 10 minutes; cut into bars about 2 inches across.  Bake about 12 to 15 minutes or until browned.  (The cookies won't be crisp unless they are browned.)  Yields 44 cookies.  Calories:  144 for 2 cookies. Food exchange:  1 bread and 1 1/2 fat.

STRAWBERRY KIWI PIZZA
ingredients
1 1/2  c. self-rising flour
2  c. pecan chips
1 1/2  sticks melted butter
2  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1  box powdered sugar
1  large Cool Whip
  sliced strawberries
  strawberry glaze
  sliced kiwi
preparation
      Mix flour, pecan chips and butter and put in pizza pan.  Cook on 350° for 10 to 15 minutes.  Mix together cream cheese, powdered sugar and Cool Whip (save about 1 cup Cool Whip) until smooth and put on top of cooled cake.  Add sliced strawberries to cover pizza.  Cover with strawberry glaze.  Decorate with kiwi.  Dot top of pizza with leftover Cool Whip.

BLACKBERRY OR RASPBERRY JAM
ingredients
5  c. crushed berries
7  c. sugar
1  box Sure-Jell
preparation
      Crush berries one layer at a time.  Measure fruit packed solidly in cup; if slightly short add water.  Put into 6 to 8-quart pan.  Measure sugar and set aside.
      Stir Sure-Jell into fruit (pan must not be more than 1/3 full to allow a full boil).  Bring to a full boil over high, stirring constantly.  At once, stir in sugar.  Stir and bring to a full rolling boil (a boil that cannot be stirred down).  Then boil hard 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Skim off foam with large metal spoon.  Immediately ladle into jars.  Wipe rims of jars with damp cloth.  After cooled, cover with wax.  Use 1/2 teaspoon butter and 1/4 cup sugar with Sure-Jell to produce less foam on top.

RASPBERRY-PEAR PIE
(Makes 8 Servings)  
ingredients
3/4  c. sugar
1/3  c. all-purpose flour
1  Tbsp. finely shredded orange peel
1  tsp. ground cinnamon
4  medium pears, peeled, cored and sliced (5 c.)
2  c. raspberries
  double crust pastry
1  Tbsp. margarine or butter, cut up
  Glazed Nut Topping
preparation
      In a mixing bowl, combine sugar, flour, orange peel and cinnamon. Add pears and raspberries; toss to coat. Set aside.
      For pie shell, prepare double-crust pastry. Roll out half of pastry to a 12-inch circle and line a 9-inch pie plate. Fill pastry-lined pie plate with pear mixture. Dot filling with margarine or butter. Trim bottom pastry to 1/2-inch beyond the pie plate. Roll out remaining pastry to 12-inch circle.  Cut into 1/2-inch wide strips. Weave strips on top of filling to make a lattice. Trim strips even with edge of bottom pastry.  Fold under pastry and flute edge. Cover edge of pie with foil. Bake in a 375° oven for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for 25 to 30 minutes more or until crust is golden. Spoon Glazed Nut Topping over warm pie.  Cool on wire rack. Serve with sweetened whipped cream.
Glazed Nut Topping:
ingredients
2  Tbsp. margarine or butter
1/2  c. chopped walnuts
3  Tbsp. brown sugar
1  Tbsp. milk
preparation
      In a small saucepan, combine margarine or butter and walnuts. Cook and stir over medium heat until walnuts are lightly browned. Stir in brown sugar. Heat and stir 1 minute.  Carefully stir in milk.

LIME PEAR JELLO SALAD
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime Jell-O
1/2  pt. whipping cream
1 (13 oz.)  can pears
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
2  Tbsp. mayonnaise
preparation
      Drain pears and heat juice.  Mash pears.  Add Jell-O to heated juice.  Dissolve thoroughly.  Add mashed pears to Jell-O mixture. Chill until slightly set.  Whip cream cheese and mayonnaise.  Add to Jell-O mixture.  Whip the whipping cream.  Fold into Jell-O mixture.  Put in mold.  Refrigerate until set.

STRAWBERRY FIG JAM
ingredients
3  c. figs
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. or 1 (6 oz.) pkg. strawberry jello
2  c. sugar
preparation
      Mash figs and bring to boil.  Cook for 10 minutes then add strawberry jello and sugar.  Cook for 10 minutes, then pour in jars and seal.

STRAWBERRY FIG JAM
ingredients
2  c. sugar
3  c. mashed figs
2  boxes strawberry jello
preparation
      Cover figs with jello and sugar.  Let stand 45 minutes.  Cook slowly 5 minutes.  Raise heat, but don't bring to a boil.  Cook 15 minutes or until thickens.  Put in hot jars and seal.

FIG (STRAWBERRY) PRESERVES
ingredients
8  c. fruit
2 small  boxes jello
5  c. sugar
preparation
      Use potato masher to mash fruit to a fine pulp.  Add sugar and jello.  Cook over low heat until mixture comes to a boil.  Let boil 15 to 20 minutes and put into jars and seal.

APRICOT-LIME SALAD
ingredients
2  pkg. lime-flavored gelatin
1 1/2  c. hot water
1/2  c. cold water
2  c. ginger ale
1 medium size  can apricot halves
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1 small  bottle maraschino cherries
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in hot water.  Stir in cold water and ginger ale.  Pour into 9-inch ring mold.  Chill until partially set. Fill centers of apricot halves with cream cheese balls, rolled in nuts.
      Place, cheese side down, on top of partially set gelatin, alternating with maraschino cherries.  Chill until firm.  Unmold. Can be served with favorite dressing.  Makes 8 servings.

FIG-LEMON CONSERVE
ingredients
4  c. quartered fully ripe figs
4  c. sugar
1  (3 oz.) lemon gelatin dessert
preparation
      Mix figs and sugar in a heavy saucepan.  Cook on low for 15 minutes.  Add gelatin; mix well.  Seal in hot jars.

FRESH RASPBERRY, STRAWBERRY OR PEACH PIE
ingredients
1  c. sugar
1 1/4  c. water
3  Tbsp. cornstarch
3  Tbsp. water
5 to 6  c. fresh fruit
1  pie crust
preparation
      Bake and cool pie crust.  Boil sugar and 1 1/4 cups water until the sugar is dissolved.  Mix cornstarch with 3 tablespoons water and add to sugar mixture.  Cook until thick.  I add a little crushed fruit to give it color.  Cool mixture a little, then carefully stir in fruit.  Pour into pie shell and refrigerate until ready to serve.  Superb!

PRESERVED PLUMS OR PLUM SAUCE
ingredients
3  qt. not fully ripe plums
1  lb. sugar
1  c. vinegar
1/2  tsp. cinnamon
1/2  tsp. cloves
1/2  tsp. allspice
preparation
      Boil plums 15 minutes. Drain off juice. Add all other ingredients and boil 30 minutes.  Pour into Mason jars while still very hot so jars will seal.

STRAWBERRY AND KIWI SALAD
ingredients
2  c. strawberries, halved
2  medium kiwi fruit, pared and sliced
1/4  c. lime juice
2  tsp. fructose
preparation
      Arrange kiwi slices in overlapping circles in a shallow dish. Place 1/2 of strawberries, cut side out, around edge of dish to form a border.  Arrange remaining strawberries in a flower-petal pattern in center of plate.  Combine lime juice and fructose and pour over fruit, cover and chill until served.  Makes 4 servings; 74 calories and 0 fat.

ORANGE-FIG DROPS
ingredients
1/2  c. butter, softened
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1/4  c. packed brown sugar
1/3  c. orange marmalade
1 1/4  c. all-purpose flour
1 1/2  tsp. baking powder
1  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/2  c. dried figs, chopped
  Orange Frosting
preparation
      Cream butter, cheese  and  sugar  until light.  Beat in marmalade.  Stir together  dry  ingredients  and  1/4 teaspoon salt;  stir into creamed  mixture.  Fold  in  figs.  Drop by 1 1/2 tablespoonfuls on an ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake at 350° until browned, 12 to  15  minutes.  Cool.  Frost  with  Orange Frosting. Makes 2 dozen.
Orange Frosting:
ingredients
1  c. sifted powdered sugar
1/4  c. orange marmalade
1  Tbsp. softened butter
preparation
      Blend ingredients; beat well.

STRAWBERRY, RASPBERRY OR PINEAPPLE SQUARES
ingredients
1  c. flour
1/4  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. Grape-Nuts
1  stick margarine, melted
2  egg whites (unbeaten)
2/3  c. granulated sugar
1  pkg. frozen berries or 8 1/2 oz. can crushed pineapple
2  Tbsp. fresh lemon juice
1  large Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix flour, brown sugar, Grape-Nuts and margarine.  Spread on cookie sheet.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes, stirring often into crumbs.  Drain some of juice from fruit.  Combine egg whites, sugar and lemon juice with fruit in large mixing bowl and beat on high speed until soft peaks (maybe 10 minutes).  Fold in large Cool Whip.  Spread 1/2 crumbs in 9 x 13-inch pan.  Cover with filling and then rest of crumbs.  Cover with foil and freeze.  Can be made several days in advance.

PEAR LIME JELLO
ingredients
1 small  pkg. lime Jell-O
1  can pear halves
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1 (8 oz.)  carton whipped topping
preparation
      Drain pears, saving the juice. Add water to pear juice to make 1 cup.  Bring to a boil. Add lime Jell-O and mix for 2 minutes.
      With mixer, add 2 tablespoons of whipped topping to cream cheese and mix well.  Slowly add lime Jell-O to cream cheese, using mixer.  Add the rest of the whipped topping to lime mixture, using mixer.  Mash pears and fold into lime mixture.  Pour into a bowl and chill.

APRICOT OR LIME JELLO SALAD MOLD
ingredients
1 large jello or 2 small  pkg. apricot or lime jello
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1 1/2  c. boiling water
1 small  can drained crushed pineapple
preparation
      Mix dry jello with cream cheese.  Add 1 1/2 cups boiling water and stir until all lumps are gone.  Add pineapple and stir.  Mold and refrigerate.

BANANA-STRAWBERRY-ORANGE POPS
ingredients
1  soft banana
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen strawberries
1  c. orange juice
  artificial sweetener or sugar (optional to taste)
preparation
      You will also need 4 or 5 small paper cups and 4 or 5 popsicle sticks.
      First, wash your hands.  Have an adult help you crush the banana and strawberries in a blender; add the orange juice and mix again for about 20 seconds.  Pour the juices into the cups; put a stick in it and put in the freezer overnight.  Pull the paper cup off and enjoy a yummy frozen fruit treat.

CRANBERRY-ORANGE-APRICOT BREAD
ingredients
2  c. all-purpose flour
1  c. uncooked Quaker Oats (quick or old fashioned)
1  c. sugar
2  tsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. baking soda
3/4  tsp. salt
2  eggs
1/2  c. Crisco oil
1/2  c. orange juice
1/3  c. water
1  Tbsp. grated orange peel
3/4  c. chopped cranberries
1/2  c. finely chopped apricots
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Heat oven to 350°.  Grease and flour bottom only of 9 x 5-inch loaf pan.  Combine first six ingredients, mixing well; set aside. Beat eggs and oil with wire whisk to blend thoroughly.  Mix in orange juice, water and orange peel.  Add dry ingredients, mixing just until moistened.  Stir in remaining ingredients.  Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes.   Cool 15 minutes.  Remove from pan and cool completely.

BANANA/PINEAPPLE/ORANGE PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. sugar
6  c. water
1 (46 to 48 oz.)  can pineapple juice, frozen
1 (46 to 48 oz.)  can orange juice, frozen
5  bananas, mashed
1/2  c. lemon juice
5  qt. ginger ale
1  qt. Orange Crush (optional)
  slices of lemons and oranges
preparation
      You will need a 5 to 6-quart freezer container.
      Combine sugar and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil slowly.  Stir constantly until sugar dissolves.  Pour sugar and water mixture into a 5 to 6-quart freezer container.  Add frozen juices, bananas and lemon juice, stirring thoroughly.  Freeze until firm.  Remove mixture from freezer several hours before serving to partially thaw.  Pour into a punch bowl and stir in ginger ale, Orange Crush (optional) and orange and lemon slices.  Makes 2 1/2 gallons.

LEMON-LIME JELLO, CHEESE AND PINEAPPLE SALAD
ingredients
1 small (3 oz.)  pkg. lemon Jell-O
1 small (3 oz.)  pkg. lime Jell-O
8  oz. cream cheese
1 small  carton Ricotta cheese
20  oz. can crushed pineapple
preparation
      Mix lemon and lime Jell-O with 1 1/2 cups boiling water until dissolved.  Add 2 more cups cold water.  Allow to cool until it starts to set.  Add the softened cream cheese, mixed with 1/4 cup of water and the Ricotta cheese, mixed with 1/4 cup of water. Stir vigorously or use a mixer.  Then stir in the crushed pineapple.  Allow to set in the refrigerator.

CRANBERRY FIG BARS
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  pkg. cranberries
1  c. snipped dried figs
6  Tbsp. honey
1  tsp. vanilla extract
2  c. all-purpose flour
2  c. oatmeal
1 1/2  c. light brown sugar
1/2  tsp. baking soda
1/2  tsp. cinnamon
1/4  tsp. salt
1  c. butter, melted
  Lemon Glaze
preparation
      In saucepan, combine cranberries, figs and honey.  Cook, covered, over low heat for 15 minutes or until cranberries pop. Stir often.  Stir in vanilla.
      In large mixing bowl, stir together flour, oatmeal, brown sugar, soda, cinnamon and salt.  Blend in butter.  Put half of oat mixture on bottom of a 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 8 minutes.  Remove and spread fruit filling over baked layer. Sprinkle remaining oat mixture over top and pat gently.  Bake 20 minutes longer, until golden.  Cool.
Lemon Glaze:
ingredients
1 1/2  c. sifted powdered sugar
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Combine sifted powdered sugar with lemon juice, adding juice until of spreading consistency.  Drizzle over top and cut into bars.  Makes 36.

GRAPEFRUIT PINEAPPLE SALAD
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  c. sugar
2  envelopes unflavored gelatin
1/4  c. water
3/4  c. boiling water
1 medium size  can crushed pineapple
2  c. grapefruit sections and juice, cut into bite-size pieces
1/2  c. walnuts or pecans, chopped
preparation
      Cream together cream cheese and sugar.  Dissolve gelatin in 1/4 cup water.  Add boiling water.  Stir until dissolved.  Add to mixture.  Combine well.  Add crushed pineapple, grapefruit sections and juice and walnuts or pecans.  Chill until firm.
      Note:  It might be good if your pineapple is real tart to sprinkle about 1/4 cup sugar and let set before adding to other ingredients.

PEAR LIME SALAD
ingredients
1  cup pear juice, boiling
1  pkg. lime jello
1  pkg. (8 oz.) cream cheese
2  Tbsp. milk
2  1/2 cups mashed pears
1  cup whipping cream
preparation
      Mix pear juice and jello.  Mix milk with cream cheese.  Let jello cool, then mix pears - when like egg whites.  Mix in whipping cream.

STRAWBERRY FIG JAM
ingredients
3  c. mashed figs
3  c. sugar
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. strawberry jello
preparation
      Combine mashed figs, sugar and jello and mix thoroughly.  Let stand 30 minutes.  Slowly bring to a boil and boil slowly for 10 to 15 minutes.  Pour into jars and process in water bath for 10 minutes.  Can be mixed and stored in refrigerator overnight.
      Note:  Raspberry or cherry jello can be used.

KIWI LIME COOLER
ingredients
2  kiwi fruit, peeled and halved
1/2  c. white grape juice
2  (4 oz.) lime frozen fruit bars, cut into chunks
2  tsp. lime juice
  strawberries for garnish
preparation
      Puree all ingredients, except strawberries, in blender until thick and frothy.  Pour into glasses and top with sliced strawberries.  Serves 2.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

TANGERINE CRANBERRY RELISH
ingredients
5  tangerines
1 (12 oz.)  pkg. cranberries (about 3 c.)
3/4  c. sugar
preparation
      Squeeze the juice of 2 tangerines to measure 1/2 cup.  Peel remaining 3 tangerines, separate segments.  Cut each segment in half, removing seeds.  In a 3-quart saucepan bring cranberries, sugar and tangerine juice to a boil over high heat, stirring frequently.  Reduce heat to low.  Simmer, uncovered, until all cranberries pop.  Spoon cranberry mixture into bowl and stir in tangerine segments.   Cover and refrigerate at least 3 hours. Makes 4 cups.

PEAR LIME MOLD SALAD
(Doubled)  
ingredients
2  cans sliced pears, drained (reserving syrup)
1 large  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1  large tub whipped cream
2  pkg. lime jello
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in pear syrup and bring to boil.  Chill until slightly thickened.  Mash pears; whip with mixer.  Beat in cream cheese until smooth and add to slightly thickened gelatin.  Fold in whipped cream.  You may want to reserve some for topping.  Chill until set.

CRANBERRY ORANGE WITH CHERRY GELATIN
ingredients
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. cherry flavor gelatin
2 1/2  c. boiling water
1  c. crushed pineapple (juice and all)
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen Indian Trail cranberry orange sauce, thawed
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.  Stir in Indian Trail cranberry orange sauce and pineapple.  Pour into mold.

FIG PRESERVES WITH STRAWBERRIES
ingredients
3  c. figs, mashed (raw)
2  c. sugar
2  boxes strawberry jello
preparation
      Cook 3 to 5 minutes.

LIME PEAR SALAD
ingredients
1  can pears (1 lb. size)
1  pkg. lime jello (small)
1  pkg. cream cheese (3 oz.)
1/2  pt. whipping cream
1 to 2  tsp. sugar (added to jello)
  maraschino cherries and nut meats (optional)
preparation
      Heat 1 cup pear juice to boiling.  Add jello and sugar and dissolve.  Add cream cheese and mix well.  Add one cup mashed pears.  Let stand until slightly thick, but not firm.  Use beater through jello to whip it up.  Add whipped cream.  Mix chopped cherries and nuts if desired.  This can be molded or set in plain bowl.
      Note:  Pear juice is the only liquid used to dissolve jello.

BLACKBERRY APRICOT
Filling:
ingredients
2  c. frozen blackberries, partially thawed and partially drained
2  c. apricots
2 1/2  Tbsp. cornstarch
1  c. sugar
4  Tbsp. butter
  9-inch pie shell
preparation
      Combine  fruit.  Mix  dry  ingredients,  add  to fruit. Pour into  unbaked  9-inch  pie  shell.  Top with second crust after dotting with butter.  Bake for one hour at 400°.
      Hint:  May substitute peaches for apricots.

LEMON, BANANA, PINEAPPLE SALAD
ingredients
2  packages lemon Jello
4  c boiling water
1-1/2  c miniature marshmallows
1  can crushed pineapple, drained (save juice)
4  bananas
2  tbsp flour
1  c sugar
2  tbsp margarine
2  eggs, beaten
8  oz Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix lemon Jello and boiling water.  Add marshmallows to mixture and stir until melted.  Add drained pineapple and sliced bananas to lemon mixture.  Let set in refrigerator in 9 x 13 glass dish.  Put pineapple juice, sugar, flour, margarine and eggs in saucepan. Cook until bubbly and thickened.  Let cool.  Add Cool Whip.  Fold into cooked mixture.  Spoon and spread on top of lemon mixture and refrigerate until well set (several hours).

CANDY ORANGE/GRAPEFRUIT PEEL
ingredients
  peel from 3 oranges
  peel from 3 to 4 grapefruits*
2  c. sugar
1  Tbsp. light corn syrup
1  tsp. ground ginger
1/8  tsp. salt
1 1/2  c. water
1  pkg. Knox unflavored gelatine
1/2  c. sugar (to be used later)
preparation
	*I have used just orange or just grapefruit.  Four to 5 grapefruits can be used.
	I  cut	my  grapefruit in half, and when eaten, I clean the membrane out of rind; if the white is thick, I scrape some of this.  Cut	in strips about 1/2-inch thick; place in large saucepan  with  water to cover.  Heat to boiling;  reduce heat and simmer  15  minutes.  Drain;  repeat with fresh water and drain 2  more times.  After the third cooking, return rind to pan.  Add 2 cups of the sugar, corn syrup, ginger, salt and 1 cup  of the water.  Cook slowly for 40 minutes, stirring often from  bottom of pan, or until most of syrup is absorbed.  Have the	gelatin softened in the remaining 1/2 cup water.  Stir it until dissolved,	then cool.  Lift out strips, one at a time; roll  in remaining 1/2 cup sugar sprinkled on a sheet of waxed paper.  Coat generously.  Place in a single layer on a cookie sheet  to  dry slightly.  If stored in a tightly covered container, peel will keep for weeks.

Fig Strawberry Jam
ingredients
5  c. figs, peeled and mashed
5  c. sugar
4 (3 oz.)  boxes strawberry Jell-O
preparation
      Mix all ingredients and bring to a boil for 3 minutes.  Place in jars.  Seal and let set one or two days before freezing.

PEARS WITH SPICY LIME, CHILE AND PEANUT CHUTNEY
ingredients
3  Bosc pears
5  tsp. fresh lime juice plus zest from 1 lime
1/4  tsp. crushed red pepper
1  clove garlic, minced
1  tsp. soy sauce
2  Tbsp. brown sugar
1/4 to 1/2  c. dry-roasted peanuts, finely ground
12  sprigs fresh mint
preparation
      Cut each pear lengthwise into quarters.  Using a melon baller, create a well in the center of each quarter.  In a small bowl, prepare chutney by mixing together the next seven ingredients. Spoon chutney into hollowed out section of pear quarters.  Add a sprig of mint for garnish.  Place on serving tray.

PEAR LIME GELATIN
ingredients
1 (29 oz.)  can pear halves in juice
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime gelatin
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, cubed
1  c. whipped topping
preparation
      Drain pears, reserving juice; set pears aside.  Measure the juice; add water if needed to equal 1 1/2 cups.  Pour into a saucepan; bring to a boil.  Add gelatin; stir until dissolved. Gradually add cream cheese, whisking until smooth.  Cover and refrigerate until cool.  Mash reserved pears; fold into gelatin mixture.  Fold in whipped topping.  Pour into a 6-cup serving bowl. Refrigerate until set.  Yield:  6 servings.
      Note:  One can prepare this salad with sugar-free gelatin successfully.

PLUM OR PEACH CUSTARD DESSERT
ingredients
1/2  c. margarine
1  c. sugar
1 1/4  c. sifted flour
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. cinnamon
1/4  tsp. baking powder
1 (1 lb. 14 oz.)  can purple plums, drained and pitted or peach halves, drained
1  egg
1  c. cream for whipping
preparation
      Cream the margarine and sugar.  Sift flour, salt, cinnamon and baking powder.  Blend into creamed mixture until crumbly.  Measure out about 1/3 of mixture and press remaining mixture evenly into bottom and about 1 inch up sides of ungreased 9-inch pie pan. Arrange plums or peaches in shell.  Sprinkle with saved mixture. Bake at 400° for 15 minutes.
      Beat egg slightly.  Stir in cream (do not whip cream).  Pour over and bake 30 minutes longer or until custard is set.

PEAR AND LIME JELLO SALAD
ingredients
2 small  pkg. lime Jell-O
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1 large  can pears
2  c. juice from pears
1  small Cool Whip plus 1 c.
preparation
      Soften cream cheese.  Put pears and cream cheese in blender; liquefy.  Bring juice to a boil.  Dissolve Jell-O and cool.  Pour into cream cheese mixture, then fold into Cool Whip.

STRAWBERRY  JELLO FIGS
ingredients
8  c. peeled and sliced figs
6  c. sugar
4  small or 2 large strawberry Jell-O
1  pkg. Sure-Jell
preparation
      Mix the first 3 ingredients together and let set 1 hour or more. Cook slowly and boil 20 minutes. Add the Sure-Jell and cook 2 minutes longer.  Put in sterile jars and seal.  Tastes and looks like strawberry preserves.

MANGO LIME MOUSSE WITH RASPBERRY SAUCE
ingredients
2  ripe mangoes
1  envelope gelatin
1/4  c. lime juice
1/2  c. whipping cream (heavy)
1  pkg. frozen raspberries
1/2  c. sugar
1/4  c. Chambord
preparation
      Sprinkle gelatin over lime juice in a small saucepan and allow to stand for 10 minutes.  Peel mangoes and cut fruit off seed.  In a bowl, mash mangoes together with cream until smooth.  Over low heat, melt gelatin in lime juice.  Add to mango mixture.  Stir and place in bowl in refrigerator.  (You can freeze.)  On day you are going to serve, place thawed package of raspberries in blender with 1/2 cup of sugar and 1/4 cup of Chambord.  Blend, then put mixture through sieve to eliminate seed.  Pour over mousse when ready to serve.

CHERRY, STRAWBERRY OR BLUEBERRY CHEESE CAKE
ingredients
1  large Cool Whip
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  box xxx powdered sugar
1  c. nuts
2  sticks butter
2  c. self-rising flour
1  can pie filling
preparation
      Melt butter in an oblong pan.  Mix flour and nuts together; add butter and press into pan.  Bake at 350° until light brown. Cool.
      Whip first 3 ingredients; pour over cool crust.  Spread filling on top and store in refrigerator.

FIG-STRAWBERRY PRESERVES
ingredients
3  c. mashed figs
3  c. sugar
2 small  boxes strawberry jello or 1 large family box
preparation
      Cook mashed figs and sugar 20 or 25 minutes.  When ready, add 2 small boxes jello, cook until dissolved.  Pour into jars; seal.

BLACKBERRY RASPBERRY JELLY
ingredients
8  c. blackberry juice
5  lb. sugar
2  boxes Sure-Jell
3 small  boxes black-raspberry Jell-O
preparation
      Pour juice in pan.  Add Sure-Jell.  Stir over high heat until juice boils.  Add sugar and Jell-O.  Bring to a hard rolling boil and boil for 2 minutes.  Pour into jars.  Cool before serving.

FIG-STRAWBERRIES
ingredients
3  c. mashed strawberries
3  c. sugar
2  boxes strawberry Jell-O
preparation
      Mix all ingredients well; let set for 30 minutes.  Simmer for 5 minutes, cooking slowly.   Pour into jars and seal.

CRANBERRY TANGERINE SMOOTHIE
ingredients
4  oz Ocean Spray - Cran Tangerine Cranberry Tangerine
1/2  banana cut into slices
3  medium strawberries
1/2  c crushed ice
1  strawberry for garnish
preparation
      Mix altogether in a blender. Serve.

CRANBERRY-TANGERINE CONSERVE
ingredients
3  or 4 tangerines
2  c. water
1 (12 oz.)  pkg. cranberries
1 (1 3/4 oz.)  pkg. powdered fruit pectin
6 1/2  c. sugar
1  c. chopped walnuts
preparation
      Remove peel from tangerines; scrape off excess white membrane. Cut and peel into very thin strips.  Reserve 3/4 cup strips.
      In 6-quart kettle, combine peels and water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
      Meanwhile, chop the fruit from the tangerines (you need 1 1/3 cups of fruit).  Add juices from the fruit and the cranberries. Put all three into the hot peel mixture.  Return it to boiling; boil hard for 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Add walnuts.  Remove from heat and skim foam.
      Ladle into hot, clean half-pint jars, leaving 1/4-inch headroom.  Wipe rims; adjust lids.  Process in boiling water bath for 15 minutes.  Yields 8 1/2 pints.
      Makes a lovely gift from the kitchen.

TOPPING FOR APPLE, BLUEBERRY OR CHERRY PIE
ingredients
3  c. rolled oats
3  c. brown sugar
3  c. flour
2  c. margarine
1 1/2  c. nuts
1 1/2  tsp. baking powder
1 1/2  tsp. salt
3  tsp. cinnamon
preparation
      Mix all together and use as needed.

PEACH, STRAWBERRY OR BLACKBERRY COBBLER
ingredients
1/2  c. margarine
2  c. sugar
4  c. fresh or frozen fruit
1  c. self-rising flour
1  c. milk
preparation
      Melt butter in a 9 x 13 x 2-inch pan.  Combine flour, 1 cup sugar and milk.  Spoon evenly over margarine.  Do not stir. Combine fruit with remaining cup of sugar (may need more sugar if fruit is tart).  Bring to a boil.  Ladle over butter.  Do not stir.  Bake at 375° for 30 to 45 minutes or until brown.

CRANBERRY TANGERINE SMOOTHIE
ingredients
4  oz. Ocean Spray Cran-Tangerine Juice Drink, chilled
1/2  banana, cut into slices
3  medium strawberries, hulls removed, cut into halves
1/2  c. crushed ice
1  strawberry for garnish
preparation
      Put all ingredients, except garnish, in a blender.  Blend for a few seconds on high speed or until ingredients are thoroughly combined.  Pour into a large glass and garnish with strawberry.

PEACH OR FIG FRUIT PRESERVES
ingredients
1  gal. fruit
1  pt. water
1  c. Karo syrup
6  c. sugar
preparation
      To keep celery crisp, stand it in a jar of cold salted water and refrigerate.
      Let raw potatoes stand in cold water for 30 minutes before frying for crispier French fries.
      For a juicier hamburger, add 1/2 cup cold water per pound of meat before grilling.

BLUEBERRY/APPLE/PEACH CRISP
ingredients
1  c. flour
3/4  c. sugar
1  tsp. baking powder
3/4  tsp. salt
1  egg, unbeaten
5  c. fresh fruit
2  Tbsp. brown sugar
1/4 to 1/2  c. melted butter
1  tsp. combined cinnamon and sugar
preparation
      Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and egg with a fork until crumbly for topping.  This will look too dry. Fear not.
      Fruit goes into a 2-quart casserole.  Sprinkle brown sugar over the fruit. Add topping. Dribble melted butter over top. Sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar.  Bake at 375° for about 30 minutes.

STRAWBERRY, CRANBERRY, PINEAPPLE SALAD
ingredients
1  can crushed pineapple
3  c. water
3  boxes strawberry jello
1 large  can jellied cranberry sauce
1 (1 lb.)  box frozen strawberries
preparation
      Drain the pineapple well.  Put the juice with water to make 3 cups.  Boil and pour over the jello and mix.  Add cranberry sauce; mix.  Add pineapple and box of strawberries.  Stir now and then until everything is thawed and mixed.  Let set.

LIME AND PEAR SALAD
ingredients
1  box lime jello, according to directions on box
1 small  pkg. cream cheese
1/4  tsp. ground ginger
1 small  can sliced pears, drained
preparation
      Mix  cream  cheese  with hot jello mixture; add ginger. When partially  congealed,  add  small  can of drained sliced pears. Fruit  juice  may  be  substituted  for  cold water in jello.

GRAPEFRUIT AND PINEAPPLE SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. lime jello
1 (16 oz.)  can grapefruit
1 (8 oz.)  can crushed pineapple
1  c. boiling water
preparation
	Drain  fruit  and  reserve liquid.  Dissolve jello in 1 cup boiling water.  Add 1 cup grapefruit and pineapple juice. Stir well.  Add fruit and  refrigerate  in  5  x 8-inch pan or glass dish until jello  sets.  Serve  on	lettuce  leaf  with favorite dressing.  Makes 8 servings.
	Variation:  Add  12  ounce  carton  cottage  cheese  to mixture before it sets.

MANDARIN ORANGE OR ORANGE PINEAPPLE CAKE
ingredients
1  box Duncan Hines yellow butter cake mix
4  eggs
1/2  c. Crisco oil
1 (11 oz.)  can mandarin orange slices with juice
9  oz. container Cool Whip
1 (5 1/2 oz.)  can crushed pineapple with juice
1 large  pkg. instant vanilla pudding
preparation
      Mix cake mix, eggs, Crisco and orange slices and bake in 3 (9-inch) round layer cake pans at 350° for approximately 20 to 30 minutes.  Mix Cool Whip, crushed pineapple and juice and package of pudding together and spread between cooled layers, on top and sides.  Keep cake in refrigerator.

PEACH, APPLE OR APRICOT COBBLER
ingredients
1  cube butter
1  c. sugar
1 1/2  tsp. baking powder
1  c. flour
1/4  tsp. salt
3/4  c. milk
preparation
      Melt butter in large baking dish.  Mix sifted dry ingredients with milk.  Pour the batter carefully over the butter.  Pour fruit over top of batter.  Sprinkle with 1/2 cup sugar.  Bake at 400° for 45 minutes.

FIG - STRAWBERRY PRESERVES
ingredients
3  c. figs, mashed
3  c. sugar
2  pkg. strawberry Jell-O or wild strawberry
preparation
      Wash figs and cut off any dark spots.  Mash and mix other ingredients together.  Cook 3 or 4 minutes at a hard boil.  Put in jars and cover with wax.  When cooled, store in refrigerator.

STRAWBERRY KIWI TART
ingredients
1 1/4  c. Bisquick baking mix
1/4  c. sugar
1/4  c. margarine, softened
1/4  c. apricot or apple jam
1  c. strawberries, sliced
1 kiwi fruit, pared and sliced or 1/2  c. seedless green grapes, halved
1/4  c. strawberry jam
preparation
      You can use any fresh fruit, not frozen.
      Mix baking mix and sugar.  Cut in margarine until mixture resembles coarse cornmeal.  Press mixture in bottom of a lightly sprayed with Pam spring-form pan (9 x 3-inch) or shape into 9-inch round on cookie sheet.  Bake until light brown, 9 to 12 minutes.  I bake for 8 minutes in my oven.  Cool 30 minutes.  Remove side of pan.  Do not take out of pan.  Heat 1/4 cup jam to boiling. Immediately pour and spread over crust.  Arrange fruit on top. Heat other 1/4 cup of jam to boiling.  Brush or spoon over fruit. Refrigerate at least 1 hour but no longer than 8 hours.  Cut into wedges.  Serve with whipped cream, if desired.  Serves 6.
      Bake at 400°.

CRANBERRY, ORANGE AND APRICOT BREAD
ingredients
2  c. all-purpose flour
1  c. Quaker oats (uncooked)
1  c. sugar
2  tsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. baking soda
3/4  tsp. salt (optional)
2  eggs
1/2  c. Crisco oil
1/2  c. orange juice
1/3  c. water
1  Tbsp. grated orange peel
1/2  c. finely chopped apricots
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1/2  c. chopped cranberries
preparation
      Heat oven to 350°.  Grease and flour bottom only of 9 x 5-inch loaf pan.  Combine first six ingredients, mixing well; set aside. Beat eggs and oil with fork or wire whisk to blend thoroughly; mix in orange juice, water and orange peel.  Add to dry ingredients, mixing just until moistened.   Stir in remaining ingredients. Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.  Cool 10 minutes; remove from pan.  Cool completely.  Makes 16 servings.

JUSTIN'S CHERRY, PINEAPPLE, BANANA PIE
ingredients
1 (20 oz.)  can cherries
1 (20 oz.)  can pineapple tidbits
1/4  tsp. salt
2 1/4  c. sugar
1/2  c. flour
  red food coloring
6  bananas, sliced
1  c. pecans
3  baked 8-inch pie shells
preparation
      Drain cherries and pineapple, reserving juices.  Add enough water to the reserved juices to equal 2 cups.  Combine juices with cherries, pineapple, salt, sugar, flour and coloring in saucepan. Cook until thick, stirring constantly.  Cool.  Fold in bananas and pecans.  Pour into pie shells.  Garnish with whipped cream.

LIME-APRICOT SALAD
ingredients
1 medium  can crushed pineapple with juice
6  oz. apricot  or lime Jell-O
2  c. buttermilk
1  small Cool Whip
1  c. pecans, chopped
preparation
      In a saucepan, bring pineapple to a boil. Add remaining ingredients. Congeal and serve.

FIG STRAWBERRY PRESERVES
ingredients
3  c. mashed figs
3  c. sugar
2 (3 oz.)  boxes or 1 (6 oz.) box strawberry gelatin
preparation
      Cook mashed figs and sugar for 10 to 15 minutes.  Add gelatin and boil until it dissolves.  Pour into hot sterilized pint jars and seal.

WHITE CHOCOLATE MOUSSE WITH KIWI AND STRAWBERRY SLICES
ingredients
1/2  c. sugar
4  egg whites
2  c. whipping cream
1/4  c. water
1  lb. white chocolate (chips or chopped bar)
  kiwi fruit and strawberries
1/4  c. minced pistachio nuts
preparation
      Combine sugar and water in small, heavy saucepan.  Bring to boil, stirring just until dissolved.  Boil gently until it reaches 225° on candy thermometer.  Remove from heat.  Set aside while beating egg whites.  Beat egg whites until soft peaks form.  With mixer at low speed, add sugar syrup in slow, steady stream.  Beat 30 seconds, or until fluffy.  Melt chocolate at 50% power in microwave.  Add to mixture and continue beating.  Set aside.  Whip the cream until stiff.  Fold into chocolate mixture.  Pour into serving dishes.  Chill.  Before serving, decorate top with sliced kiwi and strawberries.  Sprinkle with nuts, if desired.

PEACH PLUM FRUIT PIE
ingredients
2 1/2  c. sliced, peeled peaches
2 1/2  c. sliced, peeled plums
3/4  c. sugar
3  Tbsp. cornstarch
1/4 to 1/2  tsp. cinnamon
1/4  tsp. nutmeg
2  Tbsp. margarine
  milk
  sugar
  vanilla ice cream (if desired)
  unbaked double pie crust
preparation
      Heat oven to 425°.  Prepare pie crust.
      In large bowl, combine  peaches,  plums, 3/4 cup sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon and nutmeg;  mix lightly.  Spoon into pie crust lined pan.  Dot  with margarine.  Top with second crust. Cut four  4  inch slashes in center of crust forming a crisscross design.  Peel  back  center points and press lightly in crust  to hold and form eight petals.  Brush crust with milk; sprinkle  with sugar.  Bake  at  425° for 50 to 60 minutes or until  golden brown.  Serve with vanilla ice cream or garnish as desired.  Makes 8 servings.

LEMON-LIME PINEAPPLE MOLD
ingredients
1 (3 1/2 oz.)  pkg. lemon Jell-O
1 (3 1/2 oz.)  pkg. lime Jell-O
1 1/2  c. boiling water
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1/2  pt. whipping cream
1 small  can crushed pineapple, undrained
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in water.  Mix cream cheese into hot gelatin mixture.  (Use a blender if desired.)  Refrigerate until slightly congealed.  Beat heavy cream with pineapple until smooth.  It will not be stiff.  Stir cream mixture into gelatin mixture, mixing well.  Pour immediately into a lightly oiled mold.  Refrigerate until firm.

LIME JELLO WITH APRICOTS SALAD
ingredients
2  boxes lime jello
1 (8 oz.)  bottle 7-Up
1  can whole apricots, unpeeled
1  pkg. (8 oz.) Philadelphia cream cheese, softened
1/2  c. chopped pecans
2  c. boiling water
1/2  c. cold water
preparation
      Dissolve jello in boiling water.  Add 7-Up and cold water. Stuff apricots with cream cheese and pecans.  Place in jello mold and pour jello over stuffed apricots.  Place in refrigerator and let set.

STRAWBERRY-KIWI-TEA-SPRITE PUNCH
ingredients
3  liter Sprite
2  tea bags
  chipped ice
preparation
      Put tea in bags in Sprite bottle.  Return lid and set some place out of the way for 2 days.  Do not shake Sprite.
      When ready to use, open carefully because it foams and pour carefully over chipped ice.
      One 3 liter Sprite makes nice punch bowl.

STRAWBERRY FIG JAM
ingredients
3  c. mashed figs
3  c. sugar
2 small or 1 large  pkg. strawberry Jell-O
preparation
      Combine and cook 7 minutes after it comes to a rolling boil. Pour into sterilized jars and seal.

RASPBERRY OR BLACKBERRY LIQUEUR
ingredients
1  lb. raspberries or blackberries
1  lb. granulated sugar
1  fifth vodka
preparation
      Mix all the ingredients in a 1-gallon, wide mouthed jar. Store in a cool, dark place.  Stir or shake every few days for about 3 weeks.  Strain through several layers of cheesecloth, reserving the liquid, but discarding the pulp and seeds. Refrigerated, the liqueur will keep indefinitely.  Makes 5 cups.

FIG STRAWBERRY PRESERVE
ingredients
1  pkg. (6 oz.) strawberry or wild strawberry gelatin (Jell-O)
3  c. mashed figs
3  c. sugar
preparation
	Thoroughly mix	figs,  Jell-O  and  sugar  in saucepan. Bring to boil  and  boil 3 minutes, stirring constantly.	Pour quickly into glasses or jars.  Cover with paraffin.

FIG-STRAWBERRY JAM
ingredients
3  c. mashed figs
3  c. sugar
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. strawberry jello
preparation
      Put figs, sugar and jello in pot.  Bring to a boil.  Stir until it boils.  Then simmer 20 minutes or more.  Stir once in a while, as it boils.  Pour into jars and seal with wax.

LIME PEAR CONGEALED SALAD
ingredients
1 large  can pears
1/4  c. lemon juice
1 (16 oz.)  carton Cool Whip
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime jello
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
preparation
      Heat juice from pears and dissolve jello in the juice.  Add this to the cream cheese and blend until smooth.  Let it begin to gel and then add lemon juice, chopped pears and Cool Whip. Congeal.

KIWI RASPBERRY FINALE
ingredients
4  egg whites, room temperature
1  tsp. vanilla
1 (11 oz.)  can mandarins, drained
1  c. sugar
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
1  tsp. white wine vinegar
1/8  tsp. salt
4  kiwi, peeled and sliced
1 1/2  c. whipping cream
  Raspberry Sauce
preparation
      Preheat oven to 400°.  In a large bowl, beat egg whites and salt until mixture holds soft peaks.  Stir together sugar and cornstarch.  Beat egg whites, gradually adding sugar mixture until mixture holds stiff peaks.  Beat in vinegar and vanilla.
      Lightly moisten a greased baking sheet.  Pile egg white mixture onto damp baking sheet, shape into a 7-inch circle.  Place in oven preheated to 350°, immediately reduce oven temperature to 250°, bake until meringue is lightly browned and dry to the touch (about 1 1/2 hours).  Let cool, lift off baking sheet with a large spatula and transfer to a serving plate.
      To serve, beat cream until stiff and swirl over meringue. Garnish with drained mandarins and sliced kiwi fruit.  Pass Raspberry Sauce to spoon over individual servings.  Serves 6.
Raspberry Sauce:
ingredients
2  c. raspberries, slightly crushed
1/2  c. sugar
2  tsp. lemon juice
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
1/2  c. water
1/4  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      In a saucepan, add all ingredients and cook over medium heat, stirring until sauce boils and thickens.  Cool, cover and refrigerate overnight.

LIME PEAR DELIGHT
ingredients
1 small  pkg. lime jello
1  c. hot pear juice
1  c. sieved pears
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. softened cream cheese
1  c. heavy cream, whipped
preparation
      Dissolve lime jello in hot pear juice.  Add sieved pears (put through a sieve) to the softened cream cheese; blend until smooth.

GRAPEFRUIT AND ORANGE COCKTAIL SALAD
ingredients
2  grapefruit
2  oranges
2  Tbsp. fine granulated sugar
  mint, chopped
1/8  c. light rum
preparation
      Halve grapefruit and remove segments.  Save shells.  Cut orange into segments and combine with grapefruit segments.  Add sugar and rum.  Place mixture into clean grapefruit shells. Garnish with chopped mint and refrigerate until serving.

RASPBERRY FIG PRESERVES
ingredients
3  c. mashed figs
3  c. sugar
2 (3 oz.)  boxes raspberry jello
preparation
	Combine all ingredients in pan.  Bring to a boil and boil for 7 minutes.  Put into sterilized jars and seal.
	You can use strawberry jello for strawberry fig preserves.

PEAR-BANANA-LIME MOLD
ingredients
3/4  c. evaporated milk
1 (16 oz.)  can pear slices or halves
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime-flavored gelatin
2  ripe, medium bananas
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
  lettuce
preparation
      Pour milk into freezer tray.  Freeze until edges are icy. Drain pers, reserving syrup.  Add water to make 1 cup; bring to boil.  Dissolve gelatin in boiling liquid.  Chill until  partially set.  Gradually add milk to gelatin, whipping until double.  Dice pears.  Slice bananas; sprinkle with lemon juice.  Fold fruits into gelatin.  Pour the mixture into a 6 1/2-cup ring mold.  Chill mixture until firm.  Unmold on lettuce.  Serves 8.

LIME JELLO MOLD WITH PEARS
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  can pear halves
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime Jell-O gelatin
1/4  tsp. salt
1  c. boiling water
1/4  c. cold water
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1/2  c. pear syrup
preparation
      Drain pears, reserving 1/2 cup.  Dice pears and set aside. Dissolve gelatin and salt in boiling water; add cold water, pear syrup and lemon juice.  Measure 1 1/4 cups into an 8 x 4-inch loaf pan (I use metal mold sprayed with Pam).   Chill until set, but not firm.  Gelatin should be sticky to the touch.
      Meanwhile, soften cream cheese.  Beat in gelatin.  Fold in pears.  Spoon over set gelatin.  Chill overnight or until firm.

PEAR HONEY OR PEAR BUTTER
ingredients
4  c. peeled, crushed fruit
3  c. sugar
1/4  tsp. salt
  peel of 1 lemon, ground
1/4  tsp. cinnamon (optional)
1/4  tsp. cloves (optional)
preparation
      Combine all ingredients and cook in heavy pan, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes.  Put through a food mill.
      Fill hot jars with hot pear butter.  Run a thin blade around inside of jar to remove air bubbles.  Process for 10 minutes in a hot water bath.
      Note:  Orange may be substituted for lemon to make orange pear honey.

HAZELNUT, PEAR AND APRICOT PIE
Filling
ingredients
1  c. Hazelnuts
1/2  c. Sugar
2  tsp. All-Purpose Flour
1/4  c. Margarine, cut into pieces
2  Eggs
2  tsp. Vanilla Powder or Pure Vanilla Extract
1  Large, Firm, Ripe Pear (Bartlett or Comice)
2  Tbsp. Lemon Juice
1/4  c. Apricot Jam
preparation
      Prepare a pastry for a single 9-inch pie.  Place the hazelnuts in a 8 or 9-inch wide pan.  Bake in a 350° oven until nuts are lightly browned under the skins (15 to 20 minutes).  Pour into a towel, rub lightly with towel to remove as much of the brown skins as possible.  Lift the nuts from the towel; discard the skins.
      In a food processor or blender, whirl the nuts with sugar and flour until finely ground.  Add butter, eggs and vanilla and whirl until thoroughly blended.
      Fit the pastry over the bottom of a plain or fluted tart pan with a removeable bottom; fold any excess pastry down to make flush with the pan rim.  Pour the nut mixture into the pastry and spread it smooth.
      Core the pear and cut into 1/4-inch wedges.  Sprinkle with lemon juice.  Arrange the pear slices, overlapping, on nut filling. Bake in a 350° oven until filling is richly browned, about 40 minutes.
      In a 3 to 4 cup pan over low heat, stir the apricot jam until warm (or microwave-safe bowl on full power in a microwave oven; stir every 10 seconds).  Spoon the jam onto the warm pie, then gently spread to pastry.  Serve warm or at room temperature.  If making ahead, cover airtight and chill up to 1 day.  Serves 8 to 10.
      Per serving: 300 calories (57% from fat); 4.2g protein, 19g fat (5.2g saturated); 30g carbohydrate; 172 mg sodium; 55mg cholesterol.

PEACH BLACKBERRY CRISP
ingredients
4  c. sliced, peeled peaches or frozen peaches
1  c. fresh or frozen blueberries
1/4  c. sugar
1/2  c. packed brown sugar
1/2  c. quick oatmeal
1/4  c. flour
1  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/4  c. margarine
1/4  c. chopped walnuts
1  tsp. finely shredded lemon peel
preparation
      In mixing bowl, combine brown sugar, oats, flour, lemon peel and cinnamon; cut in margarine until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Stir in walnuts.  Sprinkle crumb mixture over filling. Bake at 375° for 30 to 35 minutes.  If using frozen fruit, bake 40 minutes.  Serve warm.  Serves 4 to 6.
      If using frozen fruit, do not drain; combine fruit and sugar and set aside.  Bake in a 10 x 6-inch baking dish.

BANANA-KIWI FOOL
ingredients
1  c. sliced, quartered kiwi
1 1/2  tsp. cornstarch
3  oz. cream cheese
1  tsp. vanilla
1  c. sliced bananas
1/4  c. sugar
1  tsp. lemon juice
1/4  c. powdered sugar
1  c. whipping cream
preparation
      Put first five ingredients in pot over medium heat; stir to thicken and boil 1 minute.  Put in glass dish, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate.  Beat cheese, sugar and vanilla until fluffy; add cream and beat until stiff.  Fold fruit mixture into cheese mixture.  Chill some more.

APRICOT-FILLED PEAR CAKE
ingredients
1  (16 oz.) canned pears
1  box white cake mix
3  eggs
1 (10 oz.)  jar apricot jam
1  tub thawed whipped topping
preparation
      Drain pears.  Save 1/2 cup juice.  Blend pears in blender until smooth.  In large bowl, combine cake mix, pureed pears, 1/2 cup pear juice and eggs at slow speed until smooth and moistened. Beat 2 minutes on high.  Pour batter in a lightly greased and floured 13 x 9-inch pan.  Grease a piece of wax paper and fit in bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes. Cool in pan 10 minutes, remove from pan and cool completely. Slice cake in half, spread apricot jam over cut half.  Replace top cake layer.  Spread with topping.  Chill well.

CRANBERRY-APPLE-PEAR SAUCE
ingredients
2  pkg. fresh cranberries (12 or 16 oz. bags)
3  apples, pared, cored and diced
2  pears, pared, cored and diced
2  c. golden raisins
2  c. sugar
1  c. fresh orange juice (2 medium oranges)
2  Tbsp. grated orange peel
2  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/4  tsp. nutmeg
1/2  c. Cointreau liqueur or similar orange liqueur
preparation
      Heat all ingredients except liqueur in large pan to boiling, stirring frequently, to prevent burning.  Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, stirring frequently until mixture thickens, about 45 minutes.  Take off heat; stir in Cointreau.  Refrigerate, covered, at least 4 hours.  Better overnight or longer.  Serve chilled with turkey.

ORANGE-APPLE-CRANBERRY RELISH
ingredients
1  (12 oz.) bag fresh cranberries
1  c. Mandarin orange segments
1  c. Granny Smith apples, chopped and seeded (with skin on)
1  c. chopped pecans
1/2  c. raisins
1/2  tsp. cinnamon
1/2  tsp. nutmeg
1/2  tsp. vanilla
1/4  c. orange juice
2  c. sugar
preparation
      Boil (low to medium) together until cranberries burst, then simmer 5 minutes.
      If you love cranberries, double this recipe!
      Remember to bring apples and cranberries up to room temperature before cooking. This allows the cooking of the relish to gel faster.

STRAWBERRY-KIWI JAM
ingredients
1 1/2  qt. strawberries
3  kiwi fruit
1  Tbsp. minced crystallized ginger
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  pkg. Ball 100% natural fruit jell pectin
5  c. sugar
preparation
      *BLKLIN

      *BLKLIN
      *BLKLIN

FIG-STRAWBERRY PRESERVES
ingredients
3  c. peeled and mashed figs
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. strawberry flavored gelatin
3  c. sugar
preparation
      Thoroughly mix figs, gelatin and sugar in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over low heat and continue boiling for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Pour quickly into glasses. Cover at once with 1/8-inch hot paraffin or seal with new lids.  Makes 6 medium glasses.

RASPBERRY/BLACKBERRY COBBLER
ingredients
1 1/2  qt. raspberries or blackberries
1  c. sugar
1  white or vanilla cake mix (dry)
1  stick butter
1  egg
preparation
      Mix berries and sugar, sweeten to taste.  Pour into greased 9 x 13 baking dish.  Melt butter.  Mix egg, batter, and dry cake mix (mixture will be stiff).  Spoon over berries.  Bake at 350° for 45-50 minutes.

CHOCOLATE-LACED KIWI FRUIT WITH ORANGE SAUCE
ingredients
1/2  c. nonfat plain yogurt
1  Tbsp. partially thawed frozen unsweetened orange juice concentrate
4  large kiwi fruit, pared and cut into 1/4-inch slices
2  Tbsp. semi-sweet chocolate chips
1  tsp. shortening
preparation
      Mix yogurt and orange juice concentrate; spoon 2 tablespoons onto each of 4 dessert plates.  Arrange 1 sliced kiwi fruit over yogurt mixture on each plate.  Heat chocolate chips and shortening over low heat, stirring constantly, until chocolate is melted. Carefully drizzle chocolate in thin lines over kiwi fruit.  Makes 4 servings.

PEAR SALAD WITH RASPBERRY CREAM
ingredients
3/4  c. sour cream
1/4  c. seedless raspberry preserves
3  Tbsp. red wine vinegar
1/8  tsp. dijon mustard
4  ripe pears
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  head Bibb lettuce, torn
1  small head romaine lettuce, torn
1/2  c. freshly shredded Parmesan cheese
4  to 6 bacon slices, cooked and crumbled
1/2  c. fresh raspberries
preparation
      Whisk together first 4 ingredients.  Set dressing aside. Peel pears, if desired; quarter and core pears.  Brush with lemon juice.  Arrange Bibb and romaine lettuces on 4 plates.  Arrange pear quarters over lettuce.  Drizzle with dressing; sprinkle salad with Parmesan cheese, crumbled bacon and raspberries.

STRAWBERRY FIG JAM
ingredients
6  c. figs, peeled
6  c. sugar
4  boxes strawberry jello
preparation
      Combine figs, sugar and jello.  Cook until thick and transparent (about 35 to 40 minutes).  Makes 4 pints.  Wash jars in hot, soapy water.  Rinse well.  Place jars and lids in pot of boiling water.  Boil at least 10 minutes.  Remove jars from hot water.  Place on clean dishcloth.  Fill jars with jam.  Place lids on jars and seal tightly.

LIME-PEAR JELLO SALAD
ingredients
1 small  pkg. lime Jell-O
1 small  pkg. lemon Jell-O
2  c. pear juice and water
1 (29 oz.)  can pears
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
  Cool Whip
preparation
      Dissolve Jell-O in hot juice and water.  Blend in blender the pears, cream cheese and hot Jell-O.  Cool and add 1/2 large carton Cool Whip.  Makes 13 x 9-inch pan.

ORANGE CRANBERRY STRAWBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1 large  pkg. strawberry jello
2  c. boiling water
1 (1 lb.)  pkg. frozen sliced strawberries
1  (1 oz. size) frozen orange cranberry relish or sauce
2 (8 oz.)  cans crushed pineapple
preparation
      Dissolve jello in boiling water.  Add frozen strawberries and frozen orange cranberry relish.  Stir until melted.  Add crushed pineapple; stir.  Put into 9 x 13-inch pan.  Refrigerate.

"STRAWBERRY" FIG JELLY
ingredients
3  lb. mashed figs
1 1/2  c. sugar
1 (6 oz.)  box strawberry jello
preparation
      Bring to a boil and let bubble for 10 minutes.  Fill sterilized jars and seal.

PEAR LIME SALAD
ingredients
1 large  can or 2 small (No. 303) cans pears
2 (3 oz.)  boxes lime Jell-O
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
8 to 9  oz. Cool Whip
preparation
      Drain pear juice from can of pears.  Add water to make 2 cups liquid.  Heat to boiling and pour over lime Jell-O and cream cheese.  Stir to dissolve.  Cool until firm.  Mix and blend crushed pears, Cool Whip and Jell-O mixture.  Can use electric mixer.  Chill until firm.

STRAWBERRY KIWI PUNCH
ingredients
1  bottle Sprite
5  kiwi strawberry tea bags
preparation
      Add tea bags to Sprite; put bags right into bottle. Refrigerate 2 hours.

LEMON, PINEAPPLE, MANDARIN ORANGE MOLD
ingredients
9  oz. lemon jello
2 (20 oz.)  cans crushed pineapple
3  c. cold water
2 (11 oz.)  cans drained Mandarin oranges
2 large  cartons Cool Whip
1  c. chopped walnuts (optional)
preparation
      Mix lemon jello and crushed pineapple and the juice in a cooking pot.  Mix thoroughly and cook on medium heat until it bubbles.  Add 3 cups cold water and mix well.  Refrigerate until it starts to jell.  Fold in the drained oranges and 1 cup chopped walnuts, if desired.  Fold in Cool Whip very well, so it reaches evenly around the edges.   Turn into 10 to 12 cup mold or use a Bundt pan.  Refrigerate overnight before unmolding.

APRICOT-RASPBERRY TORTE
ingredients
1  yellow lite cake mix
1 1/3  c. apricot nectar
3  egg whites
1  c. raspberry jam
1 small  box instant vanilla pudding
1/2  c. skim milk
2  Tbsp. apricot nectar
1  (8 oz.) Cool Whip Lite
3  Tbsp. toasted coconut
preparation
      Combine cake mix, nectar and egg whites.  Beat 2 minutes at high speed.  Pour into 2 (8-inch) pans, sprayed with Pam.  Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes until done.  Cool 15 minutes.  Turn out onto wire racks.  Cool.  Slice each cake in half horizontally to make 4 layers.  Spread jam between layers.
      Combine pudding mix, milk and nectar.  Add Cool Whip.  Fold together.  Beat on low for 2 minutes.  Frost top and sides of cake.  Sprinkle coconut on top.  Refrigerate 3 hours.

STRAWBERRY FIG JAM
ingredients
3  c. sugar
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. strawberry Jell-O
3  c. figs, mashed (use potato masher)
preparation
      Mix ingredients together and cook 15 minutes over low heat until it boils, then cook 15 minutes more.  Seal in jars and top with paraffin.

GRAPEFRUIT AND CRANBERRY RELISH
ingredients
  raw relish
1  c. sugar
2  c. fresh cranberries
1  grapefruit, sectioned
preparation
      Put cranberries through food chopper.  Add sugar and mix well. Dice grapefruit sections.  Stir in cranberry mixture.  Chill. Makes 3 1/3 cups.

CRANBERRY ORANGE WITH CHERRY GELATIN
ingredients
2 (3 oz)  pkg. cherry flavored gelatin
2 1/2  c. boiling water
1 (10 oz)  pkg. frozen Indian Trail cranberry with orange, thawed
1  c. crushed pineapple, with juice
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.  Stir in cranberry with orange and pineapple.  Pour into mold.  Chill.

FIGS AND RASPBERRY PRESERVES
ingredients
3  c. cut up or mashed figs
3  c. sugar
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. raspberry Jell-O
preparation
      Cook in large pot 24 to 30 minutes after they begin to boil, stirring constantly.  Wash your lids and jars in hot water.  Have them ready to pour preserves into.
      Note:  May also use 6 ounce package of strawberry Jell-O for Fig and Strawberry Preserves.

CORNISH HENS WITH PEAR OR APRICOT PRESERVES
ingredients
4  Cornish hens
1  c. seedless green grapes
4  tsp. sugar
1  c. melted butter
4  Tbsp. pear or apricot preserves
4  tsp. seasoning salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1/2  c. Sauterne
1/2  c. water
preparation
      Fill each hen with 1/4 cup grapes which have been tossed lightly into sugar.  Brush each hen generously with hot mixture of melted butter, preserves, salt and pepper.
      Place hens, breast side up, on rack in shallow roasting pan. Add Sauterne and water to pan.  Roast at 400° for 45 to 60 minutes, basting often.  Serve with wild rice.

CRANBERRY-ORANGE PINEAPPLE PUNCH
ingredients
4  c. cranberry juice
2  c. orange-pineapple juice
  Sprite or 7-Up
preparation
      Mix cranberry juice and the orange-pineapple juice together. Add Sprite or 7-Up to taste just before serving.
      You can also freeze and use as a slush punch.

PEACH PLUM PIE
ingredients
3  Tbsp. cooking tapioca
3/4  c. sugar
1/4  tsp. salt or salt substitute
2  c. sliced fresh peaches
2  c. sliced red plums
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
  pastry for 2 crust 9-inch pie
1  Tbsp. margarine
preparation
      Combine tapioca, sugar, peaches, plums and lemon juice.  Let stand 15 minutes.  Roll half of pastry and line 9-inch pie pan. Use rest for top crust or lattice top.  Dot with butter, then put topping on.  Bake at 425° for 55 minutes or until done.

BLACKBERRY OR RASPBERRY JAM CAKE
ingredients
2/3  c. butter
1 1/2  c. sugar
3  eggs
1  c. raspberry or blackberry jam
3  c. flour
2  tsp. baking powder
1  tsp. baking soda
1/3  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. ground cloves
1  tsp. ground cinnamon
1  c. sour milk
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
	Cream together 2/3 cup of butter and 1 1/2 cup sugar. Separate 3 egg yolks, reserving the whites.  Slightly beat the yolks and mix with 1 cup of jam; whip into creamed mixture.  Sift together flour, baking powder, soda, salt, ground cloves and cinnamon.  Add dry ingredients alternately with 1 cup sour milk. Beat the 3 egg whites and fold into the batter.  Add vanilla. Bake in 3 lined layer cake pans in 350° oven for 25 minutes or until done.  Test with a toothpick.  Cool and frost with cream cheese frosting or a vanilla frosting.
	From a collection of recipes belonging to my mother, Florence Redman.  She frequently made this cake.

ORANGE-GRAPEFRUIT SALAD
ingredients
2  Tbsp. sugar
1/4  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. malt vinegar
2  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1/8  tsp. almond extract
6  c. torn salad greens
3  medium oranges, peeled, seeded and sectioned
1/2  c. thinly sliced celery
2  Tbsp. sliced green onions
preparation
      Combine first 5 ingredients in a jar.  Cover tightly and shake vigorously.  Set aside.  Just before serving, combine salad greens and remaining ingredients.  Drizzle with dressing and toss gently.

APPLE, PEACH OR PEAR CRISP
(So Easy, So Good)  
ingredients
3  c. cut-up fruit
1  stick butter or margarine
1/2  c. self-rising flour
3/4  c. oatmeal
3/4  c. brown or white sugar
1  tsp. cinnamon
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Mix fruit with enough sugar to sweeten slightly.  Place in 2-quart baking dish.  In a pan, melt margarine.  Remove from heat. Add flour, oatmeal, sugar and cinnamon.  Stir until crumbly. Sprinkle over fruit.  Top with nuts.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes at 350°.  Serve with ice cream or cheese if desired.
      In memory or my mother.
