PLUM OR PEACH KUCHEN
ingredients
1 1/2  c. sifted flour
1  tsp. baking powder
1/4  tsp. salt
1/2  c. shortening
1  egg yolk
2  Tbsp. milk
4  c. sliced peaches or halved plums (enough to cover top of cake)
1/2  c. sugar or honey
1 1/2  Tbsp. flour
2  Tbsp. butter
1/4  tsp. salt
preparation
      Bake in a 375° oven for 45 minutes.  Serve hot with cream.

FIG-STRAWBERRY PRESERVES
ingredients
4  c. figs, mashed
4  c. sugar
  strawberry jello (6 oz.)
preparation
      Mix figs and sugar together.  On medium heat, bring figs and sugar to a boil and add jello.  Boil 15 minutes longer.   Seal in jars according to directions.

COUSCOUS SALAD WITH ORANGES AND FIGS

STRAWBERRY-KIWI PUDDING
ingredients
3 1/2  oz. instant vanilla pudding
1  can Eagle Brand condensed milk
1 1/2  c. milk
1  box vanilla wafers
3 to 6  c. strawberries and kiwi or any other fruit desired
  large Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix first 3 ingredients together and put in refrigerator for 5 minutes.  Add 1 1/2 cups Cool Whip to pudding mix.  Layer vanilla wafers, pudding and fruit twice and finish with rest of Cool Whip.
      This recipe looks pretty doubled and prepared in a torte bowl!

LIME PEAR JELLO SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. lime jello
1  c. boiling water
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  can pears, mashed, drain, retain juice
1  c. chopped pecans
1  pkg. Dream Whip or 1 c. whipping cream
preparation
      Put jello in boiling water. Add cream cheese and dissolve. Add juice of pears; mix. Place in refrigerator and let partially congeal.  Remove and beat.  Add mashed pears, nuts and Dream Whip. Blender may be used.

FIG STRAWBERRY PRESERVES
ingredients
3  c. mashed figs (about 20 medium figs)
2  pkg. (3 oz.) strawberry jello
3  c. sugar
preparation
      Thoroughly mix figs, jello and sugar in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat and continue boiling for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Pour quickly into prepared jars and seal.  Makes 6 jars.

KIWI LIME COOLER
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen limeade concentrate, thawed
2 (12 oz.)  cans carbonated beverage
1  kiwi, peeled and thinly sliced
preparation
      In large pitcher, place limeade concentrate.  Slowly add carbonated beverage.  Add kiwi.  Serve over ice.  Serves 4.

FIG-STRAWBERRY JELLY PRESERVES
ingredients
3  c. mashed figs
3  c. sugar
2  boxes strawberry jello (small)
1  tsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Bring to a rolling boil for 5 minutes.  Pour into jelly jars and seal.  Yields 6 to 6 1/2 pints.

PEACH OR BLACKBERRY COBBLER
ingredients
2  c. sliced peaches
1 1/2  c. sugar
1  stick margarine
3/4  c. flour
2  tsp. baking powder
  pinch of salt
3/4  c. milk
preparation
	Blackberries may be used instead of peaches.
	Mix fruit  with  3/4  cup sugar.  Put margarine in deep baking dish and  melt  in	a 350° oven.  Stir up batter of 3/4 cup sugar, flour,  baking  powder,  salt and milk.  Pour over melted margarine.	Do  not  stir.	Pour fruit on top.  Bake at 350° for one  hour  or  until  crust is golden brown.  Batter rises to top during baking.

KIWI-STRAWBERRY SPINACH SALAD
ingredients
12  cups torn fresh spinach
2  pints fresh strawberries, halved
4  kiwi, peeled and cut in 1/4 inch slices
1/3  cup sugar
1/4  cup canola oil
1/4  cup raspberry vinegar
1/4  tsp paprika
1/4  tsp Worcestershire sauce
2  green onions, chopped
2  Tbsp sesame seeds, toasted
1  Tbsp poppy seeds
preparation
      In a large salad bowl, combine spinach, strawberries and kiwi. In a blender combine the sugar, oil, vinegar, paprika and Worcestershire sauce. Process for 30 seconds. Add onion and seeds. Pour over salad and toss to coat. Yield 12 servings.

STRAWBERRY BANANA PINEAPPLE JELLO SALAD
ingredients
1  large strawberry jello
3  crushed bananas
1  small crushed pineapple, undrained
1  large frozen strawberries
  Dream Whip
2  c. boiling water
preparation
      Thaw strawberries.  Dissolve jello in boiling water.  Add mashed bananas, pineapple (with juice) and strawberries.  Pour into jello mold.  Let set.
      Alternate method:  Pour into pan.  Set.  Top with Dream Whip.

QUICK PLUM OR APRICOT BREAD
ingredients
2  c. flour
1 1/2  c. sugar
1  tsp. cinnamon
3  eggs
1  tsp. vanilla
1  tsp. soda
1/2  tsp. salt
1  c. salad oil
1  c. chopped nuts
1  c. baby food (apricot, peach, plum, etc.)
preparation
      Bake for 1 hour at 350° in two loaf pans.

CRANBERRY-RASPBERRY-PINEAPPLE PUNCH
ingredients
1 (48 oz.)  can pineapple juice, chilled
1  (8.5 oz.) container cranberry-raspberry juice concentrate*
1 liter seltzer or 1  bottle champagne, chilled
preparation
      Combine all ingredients in a 3-quart pitcher or punch bowl. Serve over ice.  Makes 11 cups.
      *You can find the concentrate in the bottle juice section of the grocery store.  It comes in a box.

PEACH-BLACKBERRY COBBLER
ingredients
2  Pillsbury pie crusts (dairy case)
2  qt. blackberries (frozen or fresh)
1  can sliced peaches with juice
1  c. sugar (1/2 more or less to taste)
1/4  c. flour
  dots of margarine
preparation
      Thaw 4 crusts. Cut and fit 2 pie crusts into the bottom of a 9 x 13 baking pan.
      Mix berries with peaches.  Put into pan.  Mix flour and sugar. Sprinkle evenly over fruit.  May add a dash of cinnamon or nutmeg. Dot top with a few pats of margarine.  Cut strips from other 2 pie crusts and weave across the top of the cobbler.  Bake at 350° for about 1 hour or until bubbly and browned.

STRAWBERRY-KIWI SALAD WITH BASIL
ingredients
1/4  c. half and half
1  Tbsp. sugar
3  peeled strawberries (about 1 pt.)
2  Tbsp. white balsamic vinegar
1/4  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. finely chopped fresh basil
preparation
      Combine first 4 ingredients in a bowl.  Add kiwi fruit and strawberries.  Toss well.  Cover and chill for 1 hour.  Stir in basil just before serving.  Yields 4 servings.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

APRICOT PEAR TART
ingredients
1 1/3  c. graham cracker crumbs
2  Tbsp. sugar
1/4  c. butter or margarine, melted
1  pkg. apricot Jell-O
1  c. boiling water
1 3/4  c. whipped topping
1/2  tsp. ground ginger
16  oz. can pear halves
  mint leaves
  cinnamon stick, cut into 3/4-inch pieces
preparation
      Mix graham cracker crumbs, sugar and butter in a small bowl. Press crumb mixture onto bottom of 9-inch spring-form pan. Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water, measure 3/4 cup Jell-O; set aside.  Chill remaining Jell-O until slightly thickened.  Fold in whipped topping and ginger.  Spoon over crust.  Chill measured gelatin until slightly thickened.  Slice pears lengthwise, cutting almost through stem ends.  Arrange on whipped topping mixture, fanning each pear slightly.  Place mint leaf and cinnamon stick at stem of each.  Carefully spoon remaining Jell-O over pears. Chill 3 hours.  Run hot knife around edges of pan before removing.

STRAWBERRY FIG JAM
ingredients
5  c. figs, mashed
3  c. sugar
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. strawberry Jell-O
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  Bring to boil; cover.  Cook on medium-high for 5 to 10 minutes, stirring constantly.  Spoon into jars and seal.

LEMON, PEARS AND PINEAPPLE CONGEALED SALAD
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  box lemon Jell-O
1  c. Bartlett pears, drain well, dice and save juice
1  c. sour cream or mayonnaise
1  c. buttermilk
1  c. grated mild Cheddar cheese
1  (8 oz.) Cool Whip, thawed
preparation
      Combine 3/4 cup of the pear juice and 1/4 cup of water.  Bring to a boil.  Add Jell-O and stir well. Cool to touch.  Blend buttermilk with Cool Whip.  Add mayonnaise (or sour cream) and blend well.  Fold in the fruit and grated cheese.  Add cooled Jell-O and blend well.  Congeal in 3-quart Pyrex dish. Cut into 18 pieces.

STRAWBERRY KIWI MOCK MARGARITA
ingredients
1-1/2  cups cold water
1  cup cold orange juice
2  Tbsp. lime juice
1  tub CRYSTAL LIGHT TROPICAL PASSIONS Strawberry Kiwi Flavor Low Calorie Soft Drink Mix
1  qt. (4 cups) ice cubes
preparation
      PLACE water, orange juice, lime juice and drink mix in blender container; cover. Blend until drink mix is dissolved.  ADD ice; cover. Blend on high speed until smooth.

GRAPEFRUIT ORANGE MOLD
ingredients
2  envelopes lemon flavored artificially sweetened gelatin
1/4  tsp. salt
1  c. boiling water
3/4  c. cold water
3/4  c. fresh diced grapefruit sections
3/4  c. fresh orange sections, drained
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin and salt in boiling water.  Add water to gelatin mixture.  Chill until very thick.  Fold in grapefruit and orange sections.  Pour into six individual molds.  Chill until firm.  Yield:  6 servings.  Carbohydrate 5 g, protein 0 g, fat 0 g, calories 20.  One serving = 1/2 fruit exchange.

LEMON-LIME PINEAPPLE PUNCH
ingredients
2  pkg. lemon-lime Kool-Aid
2  c. sugar
2  qt. water
1 (36 oz.)  can pineapple juice (if unsweetened, use 1 more c. sugar)
1 (32 oz.)  bottle ginger ale
preparation
      Mix ingredients.  Yield is little over a gallon.  Freeze punch in ice trays for ice.

PINK GRAPEFRUIT AND PINEAPPLE PUNCH
ingredients
1  tub Crystal Light pink grapefruit flavor sugar-free drink mix
1  tub Crystal Light lemonade flavor sugar-free drink mix
8  c. cold water
1 (46 oz.)  can unsweetened pineapple juice
2  bottles (1 liter each) diet ginger ale
preparation
      Place drink mixes in large punch bowl.  Add water and pineapple juice; stir to dissolve.  Refrigerate.  Just before serving, add ginger ale.  Serve over ice.  Serves 29.

FIG AND STRAWBERRY JAM
ingredients
3  c. mashed figs
3 3/4  c. sugar
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. strawberry Jell-O
preparation
      Mix well and boil 3 minutes.  Put in hot jars and seal.

DELICIOUS STRAWBERRY, BANANA, PINEAPPLE JELLO DESSERT
ingredients
1 large  box Strawberry Jello Mix
1  oz. Frozen Strawberries, thawed
1 large  can Pineapple, crushed and drained
3  Medium Bananas
1  C. Walnuts
1  pt. Sour Cream
1  C. Boiling Water
preparation
      Dissolve Jello with boiling water. Add strawberries, bananas, pineapple, and nuts. Pour 1\2 mixture into glass 9x9 dish. Refrigerate until Jello sets. About an hour or so. Spread sour cream over jello mixture. Top with rest of Jello mixture. Refrigerate until reset.

STRAWBERRY-ORANGE-BANANA SMOOTHIE
ingredients
1  banana
1  c. orange juice
1  c. milk
1/2  c. ice
1/2  c. frozen strawberries
1  c. vanilla ice cream
preparation
      Mix in a blender until very smooth and enjoy. Makes 2 servings.

BLACKBERRY COBBLER (OR PEACH)
ingredients
1  c. flour
1  c. sugar
1  egg
1  c. milk
1  stick butter
  blackberries or peaches
preparation
      Stir all ingredients together and bake at 375° in greased pan 30-40 minutes.  Makes its own crust.

ORANGE-GRAPEFRUIT SALAD
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. orange gelatin
1 1/2  c. boiling water
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen orange juice, thawed
1  c. cold water
1 (11 oz.)  can mandarin oranges
1  lb. can grapefruit sections, drained and cut in pieces
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.  Add orange juice concentrate and cold water.  Drain oranges, reserving syrup.  Add syrup to gelatin mixture.  Chill until partially set.  Fold in oranges and grapefruit.  Pour into 6 1/2-cup ring mold.  Chill until set.  Unmold.  Serve with mayonnaise.

PEAR-LIME SALAD
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  can pear halves, undrained
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime gelatin
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1 (8 oz.)  carton lemon yogurt
preparation
      Drain pears, reserving juice.  Bring juice to a boil, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Add gelatin, stirring until dissolved.  Let cool slightly.  Coarsely chop pear halves. Combine cream cheese and yogurt; beat at medium speed of electric mixer until smooth.  Add gelatin and beat well.  Stir in pears.  Pour into an oiled 4-cup mold or Pyrex dish.  Chill.

AUNT SUE'S STRAWBERRY FIG SURPRISE *
ingredients
6  c. figs, peeled and chopped
12  oz. strawberry Jell-O
6  c. sugar
preparation
      Pour sugar over figs and refrigerate overnight.  Bring to boil and simmer for 20 minutes.  Slowly pour in Jell-O while stirring. Simmer for 10 minutes.  Pour in jars, seal.

PINEAPPLE LEMON-LIME GELATIN SALAD
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime jello
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lemon jello
1  c. boiling water
1/2  c. cold water
1 (No. 2)  can crushed pineapple (do not drain)
1  c. Farmer's cottage cheese
1  c. mayonnaise
1 large  can evaporated milk
1/2  c. chopped pecans
1/2  c. celery, chopped fine
preparation
      Dissolve jellos in  boiling  water.  Add cold water and can of pineapple.  Add  remaining  ingredients and chill until firm. Serves 16 to 20.
      Half recipe  fits  in Tupperware salad container.  Very filling salad.

BLUEBERRY/BLACKBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1  large blackberry Jell-O
1 small  can crushed pineapple
1  c. pecans
1  can blueberries in heavy syrup, drained
2  c. hot water
1  c. cold water
preparation
      Mix Jell-O and 2 cups hot water; dissolve.  Add 1 cup cold water and the rest of the ingredients.
Topping:
ingredients
1  (8 oz.) sour cream
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1/2  c. sugar
preparation
      Mix all together; spread on top.

LEMON-PINEAPPLE BANANA DESSERT
ingredients
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. lemon sugar-free Jell-O
1 small  can crushed pineapple, drained
  bananas
1 small  pkg. sugar-free lemon pudding
  Cool Whip
  chopped pecans
preparation
      Mix lemon Jell-O according to package directions.  When set, mix lemon pudding.  Slice bananas (crosswise).  Place over Jell-O mixture.  Immediately cover with pudding mixture.  Cover with Cool Whip and chopped pecans.  Refrigerate.

FIG - STRAWBERRY PRESERVES
ingredients
3  c. mashed figs
2 small  boxes strawberry flavored Jell-O
3  c. sugar
preparation
      Thoroughly mix figs, Jell-O and sugar in large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat.  Boil 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Pour quickly into jars and seal.
      Note:  You can substitute any flavor Jell-O.

GRAPEFRUIT-PINEAPPLE PUNCH
ingredients
1 (46 oz.)  can grapefruit pineapple juice
1/4  c. red hot cinnamon candies
1/3  c. sugar
1  qt. ginger ale, chilled
preparation
      Heat 1 cup juice with sugar and candy.  Combine with remaining juice and chill thoroughly.  Just before serving, add chilled ginger ale.  Serves 30.

PEAR 'N RASPBERRY SHORTCAKE
ingredients
2  c. all-purpose flour
2  tsp. baking powder
1/2  c. plus 3 Tbsp. butter
1  egg, lightly beaten
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen raspberries in light syrup
2  pears, cored and thinly sliced
  fresh raspberries (for garnish)
1/4  c. plus 2 Tbsp. sugar
1/4  tsp. salt
2/3  c. milk
1  tsp. vanilla extract
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
1/4  c. orange flavored liqueur
preparation
      Preheat oven to 425°.  Grease an 8-inch round cake pan. Combine flour, 1/4 cup sugar, baking powder and salt in a medium bowl.  Cut in 1/2 cup butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Stir in milk, egg and vanilla until well blended.  Spread mixture in pan; bake for 15 minutes.  Cool.  In saucepan over medium heat, combine raspberries, cornstarch and liqueur.  Cook until thickened, about 5 minutes.  Cool slightly; strain to remove seeds.  Melt remaining butter and sugar over medium heat.  Add pears; cook 3 to 5 minutes.  Arrange pear slices over top of cake; drizzle with half of the raspberry sauce.  Garnish with fresh raspberries; serve with remaining sauce on side.  This is too wonderful!!!  Makes 6 to 8 servings.

PEAR-LIME GELATIN SALAD
ingredients
1 (29 oz.)  can pear halves in juice
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime gelatin
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, cubed
1  c. whipped topping
preparation
      Drain pears, reserving juice.  Set pears aside.  Measure the juice; add water if needed to equal 1 1/2 cups.  Pour into saucepan and bring to a boil.  Add gelatin; stir until dissolved. Gradually add cream cheese, whisking until smooth.  Cover and refrigerate until cool.  Mash reserved pears; fold into gelatin mixture.  Fold in whipped topping.  Pour into a 6-cup serving bowl.  Refrigerate until set.  Yield: 6 servings.

MONA NEWBERN'S STRAWBERRY FIG PRESERVES
ingredients
5  c. mashed figs
5  c. sugar
1 large  pkg. strawberry jello
1  pkg. Sure-Jell
preparation
      Mix and cook figs and sugar.  After this starts to boil, cook for 20 minutes.  Add strawberry jello and Sure-Jell.  Let come to a boil and cook for 1 minute.  Put into scalded jars and seal.

MOCK STRAWBERRY JAM FROM FIGS
ingredients
6  c. mashed figs
3  c. sugar
2 small  pkg. strawberry jello
preparation
	Cut stems off figs.  Wash and crush with potato masher. Place all ingredients in	large  pot.  Cook  over  medium heat until  it starts to bubble.	Reduce	heat  and  cook  for  45 minutes, stirring frequently.  Put in jars and seal.

CRANBERRY-CHERRY-PINEAPPLE SALAD
ingredients
1  can whole cranberry sauce
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. cherry jello
1  can crushed pineapple
  nuts (optional)
preparation
      Heat cranberry sauce until hot.  Add cherry jello; stir until jello is dissolved.  Add crushed pineapple, juice and all.  Stir; put into mold and chill.

KIWI ORANGE ROUGHY
ingredients
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/4  tsp. dried whole oregano
4  orange roughy fillets (1 1/2 lb.)
2  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1/4  c. margarine, melted
1/4  c. fresh lime juice
1 (3 1/2 oz.)  jar Macadamia nuts, chopped
2  kiwi fruit, peeled and sliced
preparation
      Combine  salt,  garlic  powder,  pepper   and  oregano; sprinkle  over  fillets.  Place fillets in a 12 x 8  x  2-inch baking dish coated with vegetable oil.  Drizzle  fillets  with melted  butter and lime juice.  This can be prepared  to  this point  up  to  12  hours  ahead and kept in  the  refrigerator covered with plastic wrap.  Cover with foil and bake  at  350° for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested  with a fork. Transfer  fillets to a serving platter;  garnish  with Macadamia nuts and kiwi fruit slices.  Serves 4.

GERMAN APPLE CAKE (OR PLUM OR PEACH)
ingredients
1/2  c. unsalted melted butter
1  c. sugar
2  eggs
1  c. flour
1  tsp. baking powder
1  tsp. vanilla
1/2  c. sugar
1 1/2  tsp. cinnamon
4  to 5 large sliced apples
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Grease an 8 x 8-inch square baking dish. Combine the butter, 1 cup sugar and eggs in bowl and beat thoroughly. Add flour, baking powder and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Spread evenly in baking dish. Combine 1/2 cup sugar with the cinnamon.  Add to the apples, coating well. Arrange slices on top of batter in overlapping rows, pressing lightly in batter. Bake 1 hour.  Cool and cut into squares.

FRUIT PIE FILLING FOR STRAWBERRIES, BLUEBERRIES OR RASPBERRIES
ingredients
1  baked graham cracker crust
1  c. water
1  tsp. vanilla
3/4  c. white sugar
1/2  c. oleo
3  Tbsp. flour (heaping)
3/4  qt. berries
preparation
      Cook oleo and flour until smooth. Add water, vanilla and sugar. Cook until thickened; add berries. Pour into pie crust.

CRANBERRY TANGERINE RELISH
(Try it on a turkey sandwich!)  
ingredients
3  lb. cranberries
2  c dried tart cherries
2  tangerines, zest and fruit
1  qt water
1  c orange juice
2  c sugar
preparation
      Bring orange juice and water to a boil.  Add sugar, stirring until dissolved.  Add zest and cut up orange flesh.  Add cranberries to boiling mix.  Bring to a boil again and listen for popping.  When they are considerably softer, approx 3-5 minutes, remove from heat.  In a bowl large enough to hold everything, put the dried cherries.  With a strainer and the back of a soup ladle or wooden spoon, strain the liquid over the cherries and force the berries through the strainer with the ladle.  Occasionally scrape the underside of the strainer to allow more flow.  Keep forcing the berries through until almost completely strained.  Discard the remaining husks.  Refrigerate overnight.  The mixture will jell considerably as it cools.

PEACH-PLUM JAM
ingredients
2  lb. ripe peaches
1 1/2  lb. fully ripe Italian prune plums
1 3/4  oz. pkg. powdered fruit pectin
5 1/2  c. sugar
preparation
      Peel and pit peaches; chop very fine.  Pit plums; chop very fine.  Mix fruits; measure 4 1/2 cups into large saucepan.  Place saucepan of fruit over high heat.  Add pectin.  Stir until mixture comes to a hard boil.  At once, stir in sugar.  Bring to a full, rolling boil and boil hard 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Skim and stir for 5 minutes.  Ladle quickly into hot scalded glasses.  Seal at once.  Makes ten 6-ounce glasses.

PEAR AND LIME JELLO
ingredients
1 large  can pears
1  pkg. lime Jell-O
1 (2 oz.)  pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese
  juice of 1/2 lemon
1/2  tsp. ginger
1  c. boiling water
preparation
	Make Jell-O using  juice  of  pears  and  lemon, adding water to make up	second	cup.  Save  2  tablespoons  juice to soften cheese.  When Jell-O is softly set, beat in cheese and pears and let set.

FIG STRAWBERRY JAM
ingredients
4  c. figs
2 small  pkg. strawberry jello
3  c. sugar
preparation
      Pour sugar over figs.  Let set for 20 minutes.  Add jello and cook for 12 more minutes.  Pour into hot jars and seal.   Makes 4 1/2 pints.

LEMON KIWI FRUIT PIE
ingredients
1  pastry shell, baked
1 (14 oz.)  can Eagle Brand milk (not evaporated milk)
1 (6 oz.)  can frozen lemonade or limeade concentrate, thawed
  yellow food coloring (optional)
1  (8 oz.) container frozen nondairy whipped topping, thawed (3 1/2 c.)
2  kiwi fruit, peeled and sliced
preparation
      In a  large  bowl  combine  sweetened  condensed  milk, lemonade concentrate  and food coloring (optional);  mix well. Fold in whipped  topping.  Pour  into  prepared  pastry shell. Chill 4 hours or until set.  Garnish with kiwi fruit.

STRAWBERRY KIWI JAM
ingredients
3  c. crushed strawberries
3  kiwi, peeled and diced
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  Tbsp. minced crystallized ginger
5  c. sugar
1  pkg. powdered pectin
preparation
      Rinse and pat dry strawberries.  Place in medium bowl; crush with a potato masher.  Combine strawberries, kiwi, lemon juice, ginger and pectin in a large saucepot.  Bring to a rolling boil, stirring frequently.  Add sugar; return to a rolling boil, stirring constantly.  Boil hard for 1 minute if using Sure-Jell pectin or 4 minutes if using MCP pectin.  Remove from heat; skim foam, if necessary, or place 1 teaspoon of butter to cut foaming down.  Pour into hot jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace.  Adjust caps.  Process 10 minutes in simmering water bath.  Makes 6 half-pint jars.

CHERRY, BANANA, PINEAPPLE WHIP
ingredients
1  can cherry pie filling
1  can crushed pineapple
1  can Eagle Brand milk
1  banana, mashed
1  large Cool Whip
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Mix together and freeze.

GRAPEFRUIT AND APPLE MIST
ingredients
2  c. grapefruit juice
1 1/2  c. apple juice
1/4  c. lime juice
2  Tbsp. sugar
1 (12 oz.)  bottle ginger ale
preparation
      Stir juices and sugar until sugar dissolves.  Gradually stir in ginger ale.  Serve with crushed ice.  Makes approximately 5 cups.

STRAWBERRY-KIWI CAKE
ingredients
1  yellow cake mix
1 small  pkg. vanilla instant pudding (.9 oz.)
2  c. half and half
2  c. sliced almonds
1  tsp. vanilla
1  large tub Cool Whip
  strawberries, sliced
  kiwi fruit or pineapple, sliced and drained
preparation
      Prepare cake mix as directed.
      Filling:  Prepare pudding as directed using half and half instead of milk.  Add 1 cup sliced almonds and vanilla.  Chill. Slice cake into 4 layers.  Spread pudding mixture between layers and cover with strawberries and pineapple or kiwi.  Frost cake with Cool Whip and garnish with strawberries, kiwi or pineapple and remainder of almonds.  Refrigerate until serving.

PEARS WITH FIGS
ingredients
  pears
  figs
  sugar
preparation
	Use 3  parts  pears  to  1 part figs.  Slice pears very thin. Use 1/3  cup sugar to a pint of pears.  Cover pears and sugar mix with  water and boil approximately 20 minutes.  Add figs and continue  to cook 5 minutes after mixture comes back to a boil. Seal  in pint jars.  (Should make as many pints as you have pears.)

HOT CRANBERRY APPLE ORANGE COMPOTE
ingredients
2  c. sugar
1 1/2  c. water
1  lb. whole raw cranberries
4  apples, peeled and sliced (a tart, cooking apple)
2  oranges, peeled and sliced
1/2  c. nuts (optional)
preparation
      Bring water and sugar to a boil. Add fruit and boil for 5 minutes or until berries pop. Add nuts. Serve for breakfast, hot or serve cold. Serves 8 to 10.

LIME-PEAR HONEY
ingredients
3  lb. pears (about 12 medium)
1 (8 1/2 oz.)  can crushed pineapple (1 c.)
1  lime (juice and grated peel)
5  c. sugar
preparation
      Peel and core pears and put through food chopper.  Mix all ingredients and cook approximately 20 minutes, stirring frequently.  Pour into jars; seal.  Makes 3 pints.

APPLE, PINEAPPLE, ORANGE SALAD
ingredients
1  (20 oz.) unsweetened pineapple chunks
1/4  c. reduced fat margarine
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
2  Tbsp. water
  artificial sweetener equivalent to 2 Tbsp. sugar
3  c. chopped unpeeled red apples
2  c. green grapes
1  can mandarin orange slices
preparation
      Drain pineapple juice into a saucepan. Add margarine and lemon juice; cook over medium heat until margarine is melted. Mix cornstarch and water until smooth. Add to juice mixture. Bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes. Reduce heat. Add sweetener and cool to room temperature. Pour over the fruit. Toss to coat. Chill at least 1 hour or overnight.

ORANGE-GRAPEFRUIT NOG
ingredients
1  C orange juice
1  C grapefruit juice
1/2  C orange sherbet
1  1/2 C milk
preparation
      Combine all ingredients in electric blender container. Cover and blend until smooth. Chill or serve over ice. Makes about 4 cups.

GRAPEFRUIT PINEAPPLE SLUSH
ingredients
2 1/2  c. pink grapefruit juice
2 1/2  c. unsweetened pineapple juice
1/2  c. cranberry juice cocktail
1/3  c. tequila (optional)
preparation
      Mix juices and tequila.  Pour all but one cup into ice cube trays (preferably metal) fitted with dividers.  Freeze for several hours or up to 2 days.  Refrigerate remaining one cup mixture.
      To Serve:  Process frozen juice cubes in food processor or blender (you may need to do this in batches), using on/off turns, adding some refrigerated mixture to each batch.  Process until smooth but still frozen.

PINEAPPLE, STRAWBERRY AND CHERRY CONSERVE
ingredients
1  qt. strawberries
1  qt. sour cherries or 2 c. canned pie cherries
2  c. pineapple tidbits
1  orange
  sugar
preparation
      Prepare berries and cherries; drain pineapple.  Slice orange very thin.  Combine fruits; weigh and add equal weight of sugar. Cook slowly until mixture thickens when a little is tested on a cold plate.  Pour into hot glasses and cover with paraffin.  This is delicious served with cream cheese and crackers.

PEAR LIME MOLD
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  can sliced pears, drained (save syrup)
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime jello
1  c. whipping cream, whipped
preparation
      Add enough water to the syrup to make 1 cup.  Bring to a boil. Stir into gelatin until dissolved.  Chill until slightly thickened.  Mash pears; beat in cream cheese until smooth and add to thickened gelatin.  Mix well.  Fold in 1 1/2 cups of whipped cream; chill.

CANTALOUPE AND RASPBERRIES WITH LIME JUICE
ingredients
1  ripe cantaloupe
1/2  lime
1/2  pt. fresh raspberries
1 to 2  tsp. sugar
preparation
      Peel cantaloupe, cut in half and remove seeds.  Cut melon into thin wedges and arrange on platter.  Juice the lime and drizzle over melon.  Toss raspberries with sugar in separate bowl.  Spoon evenly over melon.  Serve at room temperature.  Yield:  4 servings.

CRANBERRY-RASPBERRY PINEAPPLE PUNCH
ingredients
1 (48 oz.)  can pineapple juice, chilled
1  (8.5 oz.) container cranberry raspberry juice concentrate
1 liter seltzer water or 1  bottle champagne, chilled
preparation
      Combine all ingredients in 3-quart pitcher or punch bowl. Serve over ice.  Makes 11 cups.  Time: 5 minutes.

KIWI, STAR AND STRAWBERRY FRUIT BOWL
* * * * *  
ingredients
3  kiwi, sliced
3  star fruit, sliced
2  qt. fresh strawberries, washed and drained well
preparation
      Luncheons may be as fancy or as simple as you prefer.  For a ladies luncheon, use plenty of flowers, your prettiest china and linen.  Sugared white grapes interspersed with sugared violets and leaves make a pretty centerpiece.  Just beat the egg whites until foamy.  Dip grapes, violets and leaves in the whites and place on waxed paper.  Sprinkle lightly with finely granulated sugar.
      An aperitif of sherry, or a sweet vermouth on the rocks would be in order.  If this is a masculine type lunch, beer and wine may be offered.  For the beverage with the meal, iced tea, coffee, wine or champagne.

STRAWBERRY FIG JAM
ingredients
3  c. Figs, mashed
6  oz. strawberry Jello - with sugar
3  c. Sugar
preparation
      Put all ingredients in large pan.  Bring to boil. Stir constantly.  Boil at least 2-3 minutes to dissolve sugar.  Put into freezer boxes and freeze, or put into jelly jars and process 10 minutes in boiling water to seal jars.

PEAR-LIME SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. lime jello
1  c. hot pear juice
2 small  pkg. cream cheese
1  c. whipped cream
2  Tbsp. salad dressing
1  can pears, mashed
preparation
      Combine ingredients.  Beat well.  Pour into mold.  Let set in refrigerator.

APRICOT-GRAPEFRUIT SALAD
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  can apricot nectar
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. apricot Jell-O
1  envelope Knox unflavored gelatine
1 (8 oz.)  can crushed pineapple
2  or 3 oranges, peeled and sectioned
2  grapefruit, peeled and sectioned
preparation
      Bring 1 cup nectar to boil; add Jell-O and dissolve.  Dissolve gelatine in 1/2 cup of the remaining nectar, then add to Jell-O mix.  Cool until thickened.  Pour into square glass dish.  Add pineapple and juice.  Remove membranes from sectioned citrus fruit and cut into bite size pieces.  Add to mixture.  Chill until firm, stirring occasionally.  Using the fresh citrus fruit gives this salad a delicious flavor.

PEACH, STRAWBERRY OR BLUEBERRY PIE
(Diabetic, Low-Fat Recipe)  
ingredients
1  c. water
2  Tbsp. cornstarch
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. sugar-free jello
4  c. fruit
preparation
      Bring to a boil, water; add cornstarch, then add jello.  Stir until cool.  Add fruit.  Put into baked pie shell.  Cool and add Cool Whip topping.  You can also use graham cracker shell.  Use light Cool Whip.

BLACKBERRY PEACH COBBLER
ingredients
1 1/2  c. flour
1/2  c. sugar
2  tsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  c. milk
2  tsp. oil
1  egg
4  c. blackberries
3  medium peaches, sliced thin
  whipped topping
preparation
      Sift together dry ingredients.  Beat together liquids.  In a medium bowl add dry ingredients.  Pour in liquid mixture; stir just until moist.  Pour into greased 11 x 13-inch pan.   Top with spoonfuls of batter.  Topping will expand and spread while baking. Bake at 375° for 20 to 25 minutes.  Serve warm.  Top with favorite cold topping if desired.  Serves 8 to 10.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

FIG PRESERVES WITH LEMON
ingredients
2  lb. whole, fresh, ripe figs
  enough cold water to cover figs plus 1 inch
1  c. sugar
1  large lemon
preparation
      Wash figs and remove stems; do not peel.  Place in saucepan; add water.  Sprinkle sugar on top and bring to a simmer.  Stir to distribute and help sugar to melt.  Wash lemon; slice into very thin cross-sections.  Discard seeds.   Cut slices in half and blanch in boiling water 1 minute; drain and add to figs.  Cook until figs are tender, stirring frequently.  When syrup thickens and darkens, remove from heat.  Allow to cool.  Store in jars and refrigerate.

PEACH-PLUM JAM
ingredients
5  c. plums
4  c. peaches
8  c. sugar
1  lemon, sliced thin
preparation
      Boil rapidly until thick.  Stir, as will burn.  Pour into jars and seal.  It is go good!!

BLUEBERRY OR PEACH OR CHERRY DELIGHT
ingredients
1 1/2  sticks oleo
1 1/2  c. flour
1/4  c. sugar
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1  lb. box powdered sugar
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1  (9 oz.) Cool Whip
1  can blueberry, peach or cherry pie filling
preparation
      Crust:  Mix with mixer the oleo, flour, 1/4 cup granulated sugar and nuts.  Pour into greased 9 x 13-inch baking dish.   Bake until golden brown at 350°.  Cool completely.
      Filling:  Cream cheese with mixer.  Add powdered sugar, then fold in Cool Whip.  Spread over cooled crust.
      Topping:  Top with a can of your favorite flavor of pie filling.  May garnish with fresh fruit or nuts.

VIRGIN STRAWBERRY KIWI MARGARITA
ingredients
1 1/2  c. cold water
1  c. cold orange juice
2  Tbsp. lime juice
1  tub Crystal Light Strawberry Kiwi Low Calorie Soft Drink Mix
4  c. ice cubes
preparation
      Place water, orange juice, lime juice and soft drink mix in a blender.  Cover and blend until drink mix is dissolved.  Add ice cubes.  Cover and blend on high speed until smooth.  Makes 6 servings.

SPICED PEARS, PEACHES AND APPLES
ingredients
5  c. sugar
2  c. water
1  c. vinegar
  12-inch stick cinnamon, broken
2  tsp. whole cloves
  fruit (pears, peaches or crab apples to fill one jar)
preparation
      Combine sugar, water, vinegar, cinnamon and whole cloves. Heat to boiling.  Into syrup, drop enough fruit to fill one jar. Cook covered just until tender.  Pack in hot sterilized jar; add hot syrup to 1/2-inch from top.  Seal.  Makes enough syrup for 6 pints.

PEACH-ORANGE-PINEAPPLE PRESERVES
ingredients
3  c. prepared peach pulp
1  orange, ground (juice and rind)
1  c. crushed pineapple
1 small  can maraschino cherries and juice
4  c. sugar
preparation
      Combine ingredients in saucepan and cook for about 30 minutes. Seal in sterilized jars.

CRANBERRY-ORANGE-APPLE RELISH
ingredients
1  lb. whole cranberries, coarsely chopped (preferably fresh) or frozen
2  c. peeled apples, chopped coarsely
1  c. orange marmalade
1  c. sugar
2  c. chopped walnuts (English walnuts are best)
1/4  c. lemon juice
preparation
      Combine all ingredients in a bowl and refrigerate until time to serve.  Will keep a long time in refrigerator.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

PEAR RASPBERRY JAM
ingredients
2  lb. pears, peeled and cored
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen red raspberries, thawed
6  c. sugar
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  Tbsp. orange peel
1/2 (6 oz.)  pkg. (1 foil pouch) liquid pectin
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together except pectin.   Chop or mash fruit to get 4 cups puree.  Bring to rolling boil.  Add pectin and boil hard for 1 minute more.  Skim foam.
      Put in hot sterilized jars, leaving 1/4-inch headroom.  Wipe rims, cover and process 15 minutes in the boiling water bath method, which is to immerse jars, with lids secure but not tight, into already boiling water for 15 minutes.  Jars must be covered by the water.  Remove and let cool slowly.  Listen for the pop.
      Yields 6 to 7 1/2 pints.

RASPBERRY OR APRICOT DREAMS
ingredients
1  c. flour, sifted
1  tsp. baking powder
  pinch of salt
1/2  c. butter
1  egg, beaten
1  Tbsp. milk
1 (12 oz.)  jar raspberry or apricot preserves
1  c. sugar
1 1/2  c. coconut
1  egg, beaten
1/8  lb. butter
preparation
      Sift flour, baking powder and salt.  Add butter, egg and milk. Beat until smooth.  Roll or pat into 9 x 13 x 2-inch pan.  Spread thin layer of jam.  Spread sugar, coconut and egg mixture over jam.  Bake at 325° for 25 to 30 minutes.

STRAWBERRY KIWI TRIFLE
ingredients
1 (3.5 oz.)  pkg. vanilla instant pudding
1 3/4  c. skim milk
1 1/2  c. nonfat vanilla yogurt
1  angel food cake, torn into cubes
1  qt. strawberries, sliced
3  peeled kiwi, sliced
preparation
      Prepare pudding according to package using 1 3/4 cups skim milk.  Let thicken.  Add yogurt and stir.  In a glass bowl, layer 1/3 of cake, 1/3 of pudding and 1/3 of fruit.  Repeat two more times.  Refrigerate.
      This can be made using 2 cups prepared lemon pie filling in place of vanilla pudding.

APRICOT FIG LOAF
ingredients
1 3/4  c. sifted flour
1  tsp. baking powder
1/4  tsp. soda
1/4  tsp. salt
1/2  c. chopped dried figs
1/2  c. chopped dried apricots
1/4  c. flaked coconut
3  beaten eggs
1  c. sugar
3/4  c. melted butter
1/2  c. plain yogurt
1  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      Sift first 4 ingredients together.  Add next 3 ingredients and mix well.  Combine remaining ingredients in bowl.  Add dry ingredients, stirring just enough to moisten.  Pour into 3 small greased and floured loaf pans.  Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes. Remove from oven and cool in pans, 15 minutes.  Remove from pans and continue cooling.
Glaze:
ingredients
2  c. sifted confectioners sugar
1/3  c. plain yogurt
preparation
      Combine and glaze.

LIME PEAR JELLO SALAD
ingredients
1 large  can pears, mashed up
2  pkg. lime jello
8  oz. cream cheese
2  c. whipping cream, whipped adding small amount (1/4 c.) sugar
preparation
      Drain pears; add enough water to juice to make 2 cups.  Bring to boil and add jello and cream cheese.  Chill until partially set and whip.  Add whipped cream and pears.  Mix well and set.

PEAR-LIME JELLO MOLD
ingredients
1  pkg. sugar-free lime Jell-O
3  oz. pkg. low-fat cream cheese
2  Tbsp. skim milk
15  oz. can pears in own juice
1  medium banana, sliced
preparation
      Prepare Jell-O according to package directions.  Beat cream cheese with milk.  Slowly add to Jell-O and beat until fluffy. Chill until partially set.  Add fruit and pour into mold.  Serves 6.

LIME PEAR SALAD
ingredients
1 large  pkg. lime Jell-O
1 large  can pears
1 large (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  pkg. Dream Whip
preparation
      Set cream cheese out to soften.  Drain pears and mash.  Add enough water to pear juice to make 2 cups.  Bring liquid to a boil.
      In large bowl empty Jell-O.  Add hot liquid, mix well and set aside to gel a little.  Whip Dream Whip according to directions. Add cream cheese, mashed pears and Dream Whip to Jell-O and whip altogether.  Makes a large 9 x 13-inch pan.  When set, cut in squares.  You can sprinkle chopped nuts on squares and a cherry if desired.

PEAR LIME MOLD
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  can pears, drained (reserving syrup)
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime jello
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/2  pt. (1 c.) whipped cream, whipped
preparation
      Add enough water to syrup to measure 1 cup.  Bring to a boil. Stir into gelatin until dissolved.  Chill until slightly thickened.  Mash pears, beat in cream cheese until smooth.  Add to gelatin.  Mix well.  Fold in 1 1/2 cups whipped cream.  Chill until set.

PINEAPPLE GRAPEFRUIT SWIRLS
ingredients
1 1/4  c. fresh pink grapefruit juice
  sugar to taste (if desired)
1 1/4  c. canned unsweetened pineapple juice
3  oz. tequila
preparation
      In a metal tray, stir together 1 cup of the grapefruit juice and the sugar until the sugar is dissolved; fit the tray with the divider and freeze the mixture until it is frozen solid.  In another metal ice tray fitted with the divider, pour 1 cup of the pineapple juice and freeze it until it is frozen solid.  (The fruit mixtures may be prepared up to this point 1 day in advance.) In a blender, blend the frozen grapefruit juice mixture with 1 1/2 ounces of tequila and the remaining 1/4 cup grapefruit juice, scraping down the sides occasionally, until the mixture is smooth but still frozen and divide the mixture between 2 stemmed glasses. In the cleaned blender, blend the frozen pineapple juice with the remaining 1 1/2 ounces tequila and the remaining 1/4 cup pineapple juice, scraping down the sides occasionally, until the mixture is smooth but still frozen.  Pour over grapefruit mixture.  Makes 2 drinks.

KIWI FRUIT BLUEBERRY SALAD
ingredients
4  Boston lettuce leaves
4  kiwi fruit, peeled and quartered
1/2  c. blueberries
2  Tbsp. reduced calorie mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. unsweetened orange juice
1/2  tsp. sugar
1/2  tsp. poppy seed
4  fresh strawberries, halved
preparation
      Place lettuce on 4 individual plates.  Arrange kiwi fruit on lettuce and top evenly with blueberries.  Combine mayonnaise and next 3 ingredients.  Stir well.  Drizzle over salads and top with strawberries.  Serve immediately.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

CRANBERRY APPLE ORANGE SALAD
ingredients
2  cans whole cranberries with sugar
1  whole apple
1  whole orange
1/2  lemon
1/2 to 1  c. raisins
3/4  c. walnuts
preparation
      Empty cranberries into large mixing bowl.  Chop remaining ingredients coarsely in food processor or blender.  Add to berries and marinate overnight or several days.

FIG-STRAWBERRY PRESERVES
(Tastes Like Strawberry Preserves)  
ingredients
3  c. mashed figs
3  c. sugar
2 small  boxes strawberry jello
preparation
      Mash figs thoroughly.  Mix jello, sugar and figs.  Stir until the sugar dissolves.  Heat.  Boil for 3 minutes, stirring constantly.  Place in hot sterilized jars and seal.

STRAWBERRY AND FIG JELLY
ingredients
3  c. fresh figs, cut in half
3  c. sugar
2 small  pkg. strawberry Jell-O
preparation
	Put all ingredients into a pan and bring to boil. Cook for 4 minutes. Put in small canning jars. Great gift to give at the holidays. Good on toast, biscuits or with cream cheese.

FIG STRAWBERRY JAM
ingredients
3 1/2  c. figs, peeled
3  c. sugar
2  pkg. strawberry jello
preparation
      Cover figs with water.  Cook until tender.  Drain and mash. Add sugar and jello.  Stir and boil 3 minutes.  Pour into sterilized jars and seal.

CRANBERRY-ORANGE AND APRICOT BREAD
ingredients
2  c. all-purpose flour
1  c. Quaker oats (quick; uncooked)
1  c. sugar
2  tsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. baking soda
3/4  tsp. salt
2  eggs
1/2  c. Crisco oil
1/2  c. orange juice
1/3  c. water
1  Tbsp. grated orange peel
3/4  c. chopped cranberries
1/2  c. finely chopped apricots
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
	Heat oven to 350°. Grease and flour bottoms only of 9 x 5 loaf pan. Combine first 6 ingredients, mixing well; set aside. Beat eggs and oil with whisk to blend thoroughly. Mix in orange juice, water and orange peel. Add to dry ingredients, mixing until just moistened. Stir in remaining ingredients. Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely. Yield: 16 servings.

LEMON-LIME PINEAPPLE PUNCH
ingredients
2  pkg. lemon-lime Kool-Aid
3  c. sugar
2  qt. water
1 (32 oz.)  bottle ginger ale
1 (46 oz.)  can pineapple juice (unsweetened)
preparation
      In large pitcher, mix Kool-Aid, sugar and water. Refrigerate all ingredients. When ready to serve, place Kool-Aid mixture in punch bowl. Slowly add ginger ale and well shaken pineapple juice. Stir gently. Serve.

PINEAPPLE GRAPEFRUIT SALAD
ingredients
4  large grapefruits, sectioned
2  envelopes gelatin
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1 small  pkg. lemon gelatin
2 (No. 2 1/2)  cans pineapple chunks, drain (reserve juice)
1/4  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. sugar
preparation
      Soak gelatin in lemon juice.  Place drained pineapple juice on heat and bring to a boil.  Pour over lemon gelatin and plain gelatin.  Cool.  Add pineapple chunks, grapefruit sections and salt.  Pour into pans or molds and let set in refrigerator several hours.  Yields 12 to 18 servings.

STRAWBERRY AND FIG JAM
ingredients
3  c. figs, mashed fine
3  c. sugar
2  pkg. strawberry Jell-O
preparation
      Mash figs fine; measure 3 cups.  Add sugar and Jell-O.  Stir good.  Put on stove and bring to a boil.   Boil 10 minutes.  Do not put any water in it.  Put in sterilized jars and seal.

GRAPEFRUIT APPLE SALAD
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  can undrained pineapple chunks
1  (3 oz.) lemon flavored gelatin
1  c. boiling water
3/4  c. water
1  c. grapefruit sections
1  small unpeeled apple, chopped and cored
1/2  c. chopped green pepper
  lettuce leaves
preparation
      Drain  pineapple,  reserving  1/4  cup juice.  Dissolve gelatin  in  1  cup  boiling water in large bowl.  Add 3/4 cup water  and reserved pineapple juice.  Chill until thick.  Fold grapefruit,  apple  and  green  peppers  into gelatin mixture. Pour in lightly oiled 4 cup mold.  Cover and chill until firm. Unmold  onto  lettuce  leaves  and garnish with mayonnaise, if desired.  Yield:  6 to 8 servings.

FROTHY LIME-PEAR JELLO MOLD
ingredients
1  (3 oz.) lime jello
1  c. boiling water
1/2  c. cold water
1/2  c. orange juice
1 (17 oz.)  can pear halves
1  (3 oz.) lemon jello
1  c. boiling water
3/4  c. cold water
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
preparation
      Dissolve lime jello in boiling water.  Add cold water and orange juice.  Arrange pears in lightly oiled ring mold or rectangular Pyrex dish; cover with lime gelatin.  Chill until almost set.
      Dissolve lemon jello in boiling water; add cold water and lemon juice.  Gradually add to softened cream cheese, mixing until well blended.  Pour over lime layer.  Chill until firm.  Unmold. Enjoy!

GRAPEFRUIT BANANA ENERGIZER
ingredients
1  large grapefruit
1  large banana
1  tsp. fructose
preparation
      Peel grapefruit; remove seeds and cut in chunks.  Peel banana and slice.  Place grapefruit and banana with fructose in blender. Blend until smooth.

KIWI LIME PIE
ingredients
3/4  c. sugar
1/2  c. all-purpose flour
1 3/4  c. milk
3  beaten eggs
2  tsp. shredded lime peel
1/4  c. lime juice
1 (8 oz.)  carton lemon yogurt
  few drops green food coloring
  pastry for double crust pie
1/4  c. apple jelly
  whipped cream
2  kiwi fruits, peeled and sliced
1  or 2 limes, sliced
preparation
      In a saucepan, combine sugar, flour and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Stir in milk.  Stir over medium heat until bubbly.  Reduce heat; cook and stir 2 minutes more.  Remove from heat.  Stir 1 cup of hot mixture into eggs.  Return to saucepan; cook and stir until thickened.  Cook and stir 2 minutes more.  Do not boil.  Remove from heat.  Stir in margarine, lime peel and juice.  Fold in yogurt.  Tint with food coloring.  Cover surface with plastic wrap; cool.
      Brush the pastry shell with some jelly.  Place about 1 cup of custard in shell.  Cover with 8-inch pastry.  Brush with jelly. Spread with 1 1/4 cups of custard.  Top with 8 3/4-inch pastry. Top with remaining jelly and custard.  Cover; chill pie overnight.
      To serve pie, garnish with whipped cream, kiwi fruit slices and lime slices.  Makes 8 servings.

CRANBERRY ORANGE WITH CHERRY GELATIN
ingredients
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. cherry flavor gelatin
2 1/2  c. boiling water
1  c. crushed pineapple, undrained
1 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen Indian Trail cranberry orange sauce
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.  Stir in cranberry orange sauce and pineapple.  Pour into mold.  Let set.
      Note:  Not necessary to thaw cranberry orange sauce since it will melt in the hot water with the gelatin.

CRANBERRY-FIG MUFFINS
ingredients
3/4  c. water
1/2  c. oat bran
1/2  c. low-fat milk
1/3  c. canola oil or vegetable oil
2  large egg whites
1/3  c. sugar
1 1/4  c. all-purpose flour
1  Tbsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. salt
1  c. Blue Ribbon Mission or Calimyrna figs, chopped
1  c. cranberries
preparation
      Preheat oven to 400°.  Adjust oven rack to above oven center. In a small saucepan, heat water to a rolling boil.   Stir in oat bran and remove from heat.  Continue stirring until smooth and free of lumps.  Set aside to cool for 5 minutes.  Stir milk and oil into oat mixture.  Beat egg whites with sugar just until foamy.  Stir in oat mixture.  Combine flour with baking powder and salt.  Stir into egg white mixture with figs and cranberries. Spoon batter into 12 (2 3/4-inch) muffin tins lined with paper baking cups.  Bake 20 minutes or until lightly brown.  Cool 10 minutes before serving.  Makes 12 muffins.

PEACH-PLUM COBBLER
ingredients
1  c. sugar
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
1  c. boiling water
3  c. peaches and plums with juice
1/2  stick cinnamon
1/4  tsp. nutmeg
1  Tbsp. sugar
2  tsp. almond flavoring
1  c. flour
3  Tbsp. sugar, mixed with 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
1 1/2  tsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. salt
3  Tbsp. shortening (cold)
1/2  c. milk
1  egg
preparation
      Mix sugar and cornstarch in saucepan; gradually stir in boiling water.  Boil for 1 minute, then add fruit, stirring constantly.  To mixture, add cinnamon, nutmeg, 1 tablespoon of sugar and almond.  In a bowl, sift together the flour, sugar-nutmeg mix, baking powder and salt.  Cut in shortening until pea size particles are formed.  Beat milk and egg and add to dough mixture; stir and blend well.  Pour into greased baking dish. Now, add fruit mixture to baking dish.  Drop spoonfuls of dough atop fruit.  Place in 400° oven and bake for 30 minutes.
      If fruit is very juicy, pour off some and use as a sauce.

LIME PEAR SALAD
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. lime jello
1 large  can pears, drained (reserve 1 c. juice)
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
1  (8 oz.) Cool Whip
preparation
      Heat pear juice and mix with the lime jello; let thicken slightly.  Cream the softened cream cheese and mash the pears. Add both to jello mixture and mix in Cool Whip.  Beat together until blended.

PEAR-LIME SALAD
ingredients
1 large  pkg. lime jello
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1 large  can pears
1/2  pt. whipping cream, whipped
preparation
      Dissolve jello as usual, except use liquid from pears in place of the water.  Add cream cheese to hot liquid and beat with beaters.  Mash pears and fold in the whipped cream.  Refrigerate after placing in mold.

LIME PEAR SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. lime jello
1  c. boiling water
1/2  c. orange juice
1/2  c. cold water
  pineapple chunks
1  pkg. lemon jello
1  c. warm water
1  pkg. cream cheese
preparation
	Line a mold  with  pear halves.  Dissolve lime jello in boiling water.  Add orange	juice  and  cold water.  Pour over pear halves.  Add  pineapple  pieces  with	pears, if desired. Set until firm.
	Whip lemon  jello, water and cream cheese (soft).  Pour over fruit mixture.  Chill.  Turn  out on lettuce leaves.  May add fresh strawberries on last layer.  Whip cream topping.

CHERRY (OR CRANBERRY) APRICOT MUFFINS
ingredients
1 1/2  c. flour
1  c. whole wheat flour
1  Tbsp. baking powder
1/4  tsp. salt
1  egg
1  c. milk
1/2  c. sugar
1/2  c. brown sugar
1/3  c. vegetable oil
1  Tbsp. grated orange peel
3/4  c. chopped fresh cranberries or fresh or dried cherries
1/2  c. chopped dried apricots
1/2  c. chopped walnuts
preparation
      In large bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt.  In medium bowl, place egg, milk, sugars, oil and orange peel.  Beat well 1 minute.  Add to flour mixture and beat about 15 seconds to combine.  Do not overmix.
      By hand, stir in fruits and nuts.  Grease muffin tins and fill 2/3 full (may sprinkle with cinnamon sugar mixture).  Bake at 400° for 18 to 20 minutes.  Serve with softened cream cheese.  Yield: 18 muffins.

FIG JAM USING STRAWBERRY JELLO
ingredients
1 1/2  c. mashed fresh figs (quite ripe)
1 1/2  c. sugar
1  pkg. strawberry Jell-O (3 oz. size)
preparation
	Mash the figs well (can use a potato masher).  Cook all three ingredients 20 minutes or until flakes from spoon.	Pour in small quantities in containers.

APRICOT-GLAZED PEARS
ingredients
1  can pear halves
1/3  c. apricot preserves
1/3  c. orange juice
preparation
      Use an 8 x 8 x 2-inch or 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan.  Place pears, cut side down.  Pour mixture of preserves (or jam) and juice over. Cover.  Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.  Garnish with ground nutmeg.  Great warm or cold.

PEACH OR FIG COBBLER
ingredients
3  c. fruit
1  c. sugar
1  c. flour
1  egg
1  Tbsp. lemon juice (fresh) for figs or 1 1/2 tsp. almond extract for peaches
1  Tbsp. melted butter or oleo
preparation
      Put fruit in 6 x 10-inch baking dish.  Add lemon juice or extract; mix well.  Mix sugar and flour.  Beat egg slightly and add to sugar-flour mixture to make crumbles.
      Spread crumbles over fruit and dribble melted butter over top. Bake in 375° oven for 35 to 40 minutes.

PINEAPPLE GRAPEFRUIT PUNCH
ingredients
2 large  cans pineapple-grapefruit juice
1  c. simple syrup
1  bottle ginger ale
preparation
      Mix all ingredients and serve from punch bowl with a lemonade ice ring.
      Note:  Substitute one bottle of champagne for ginger ale, and you have a champagne punch.
      When entertaining with wine, it is always appropriate to serve something non-alcoholic.   This is one of Eufaula's favorites.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
ingredients
2  pkg. crescent rolls
1/4  c. sour cream
1/4  c. mayonnaise
1  pkg. Ranch dressing mix (Hidden Valley)
8  oz. cream cheese, softened
1  pkg. grated Mozzarella cheese
1  pkg. grated Cheddar cheese or American
1/2 to 3/4  c. grated carrots (raw)
1/2 to 3/4  c. broccoli, finely chopped (raw)
1/2 to 3/4  c. cauliflower, finely chopped (raw)
preparation
      Spray a large sheet pan with Pam. Place crescent rolls whole on sheet pan. Form a crust. Press the seams together to close any cracks. Bake at 350° until lightly brown; let cool. Mix together sour cream, mayonnaise, Ranch dressing mix and cream cheese and spread over the crust. Sprinkle over spread the remaining ingredients. Chill in the refrigerator for several hours before cutting into serving pieces.

PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. ground chuck
1  jar pizza sauce
1  pkg. sliced pepperoni
8  oz. pkg. Mozzarella cheese
1 (16 oz.)  box corkscrew macaroni
preparation
      Fry the ground chuck until brown. Add cooked macaroni, pizza sauce and ground chuck together in a large flat casserole dish. Spread Mozzarella cheese over top. Place sliced pepperoni on top of cheese. Bake in oven at 325° for 25 minutes.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
1  pkg. sugar cookie dough
8  oz. cream cheese
1  c. sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
1  pkg. strawberry glaze
  grapes
  strawberries
  bananas
  kiwi
  pineapple (fresh)
  peaches (fresh)
preparation
	Spread cookie dough in a 9 x 13-inch pan and bake according to directions on package. Then set aside to cool. Mix cream cheese, sugar and vanilla. Spread mixture over cooled cookie crust. Next, spread strawberry glaze over the cream cheese mixture. Slice fruit separately and arrange in layers over strawberry glaze. Refrigerate 1 hour before serving.

VEGGIE PIZZA APPETIZERS
ingredients
2  cans (8 count) Crescent Rolls
16  oz. Soft Cream Cheese
1  envelope Hidden Valley Ranch Salad Dressing Mix
1  cup Mayonnaise
  Broccoli
  Red Pepper
  Cucumber
  Baby Carrots
preparation
      Spray a 15 inch jelly roll pan with non-stick cooking spray, pull out the dough sealing the edges.  Bake according to pkg directions, leave in the pan to cool.
      Chop all the veggies very small and toss them together in a large bowl.  Mix cream cheese, mayonnaise and Salad dressing mix together, spread over the cooled crust. Top with veggies, pressing down into the cream cheese.  Cut into 1 inch squares.
      You can replace the above veggies with what ever kind of veggies you like.

MACARONI PIZZA STYLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1/2  c. chopped onion
8  oz. small elbow macaroni, cooked and drained
1  (15 oz.) Hunt's tomato sauce with tomato bits
1/4  c. water
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
1/2  tsp. basil
1/4  tsp. oregano
2  c. mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Brown beef and onion.  Mix seasonings in water.  Mix browned beef, cooked macaroni, seasonings and tomato sauce.  Pour 1/2 mixture in Pyrex dish; add 1/2 of cheese.  Pour remaining meat mixture and top with cheese.  Makes two 8 x 8 or one 8 x 12 inch pyrex dishes.  Freezes well for another meal.

QUICK PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1 (14 oz.)  jar pizza sauce
2  c. (8 oz.) Mozzarella cheese
3/4  c. biscuit mix
1 1/2  c. milk
2  eggs
preparation
      Brown ground beef  and drain.  Spoon into 8-inch baking dish. Top with  pizza sauce and cheese.  Combine biscuit mix, milk and eggs.  Beat  until  smooth  and  pour over casserole. Bake at 400° for 30 to 35 minutes.

PEPPERONI HEART SHAPED PIZZA
ingredients
2  c. Bisquick baking mix
1/2  c. cold water
1/2  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1  tsp. dried oregano leaves, slightly crushed
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
8  oz. tomato sauce
3 1/2  oz. pkg. pepperoni
1 (2.2 oz.)  can sliced olives
1 (2 1/2 oz.)  jar sliced mushrooms
1 1/2  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese (6 oz.)
preparation
      Heat oven to 425°.  Mix baking mix and water until soft dough forms; beat vigorously for 20 strokes.  Pat dough with hands floured with baking mix into 12-inch heart shape on lightly greased cookie sheet, carefully forming a 1/2-inch rim.  Sprinkle evenly with Parmesan cheese.  Stir oregano and garlic powder into tomato sauce; spoon over Parmesan cheese.  Carefully spread to cover; sprinkle with remaining ingredients.  Bake until crust is golden brown, about 20 minutes.

PIZZA CUPS
ingredients
2  Tbsp. margarine
1/3  c. mushrooms, chopped
1/4  c. green pepper, chopped
1/4  c. onion, chopped
6  oz. tomato paste
1/4  c. water
1/2  tsp. dried oregano leaves
1 1/2  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
7 1/2  oz. can refrigerated buttermilk biscuits
preparation
      Melt margarine. Add mushrooms, peppers and onions to skillet. Stir until veggies are tender. Add tomato paste, water and oregano; blend. Cover for 5 minutes. Simmer over low heat. Add 1 cup cheese. Mix well. Grease 10 muffin cups. Separate dough into 10 biscuits. Press biscuits onto bottom and sides of muffin cups. Fill with vegetable mixture. Bake at 375° for 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with remaining cheese.

PEPPERONI PIZZA SPREAD
ingredients
2  c. (8 oz.) shredded Cheddar cheese
2  c. (8 oz.) shredded Mozzarella cheese
1  c. real mayonnaise
1  c. chopped pepperoni
1 (4 oz.)  can drained mushrooms, drained and chopped
1/2  c. chopped onion
1/2  c. green pepper
1 (6 oz.)  can ripe olives
1  c. chopped stuffed green olives
  crackers, breadsticks and/or French bread
preparation
      In large bowl, combine the first 9 ingredients.  Transfer to an 11 x 7 x 2 baking dish.  Bake uncovered at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.  Serve with crackers, breadsticks or French bread.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
ingredients
2  pkg. Pillsbury crescent rolls
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1 to 2  pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix
1  pkg. finely shredded mild cheddar cheese
1  pkg. finely shredded Monterey Jack and colby cheese
  raw vegetables (broccoli, cauliflower, carrots, radishes), cut up fine
  small amount of mayonnaise to spread
preparation
      Place unrolled crescents on large cookie sheet.  Bake at 375° for 11 to 13 minutes.  Cool completely.  Mix cream cheese, dressing and mayonnaise to make a creamy spread.  Spread on rolls. Crumble veggies over cream cheese mixture.  Top with shredded cheese.  Serve.

PIZZA BREAD
ingredients
1/2  lb. bacon
24  (3 cans) buttermilk biscuits (refrigerated)
1/2  c. (1 stick) butter, melted
8  oz. (1 pkg.) pepperoni (cooked to get excess grease out)
16  oz. cheese, Cheddar OR mozzarella
1  small onion, diced fine
1  small green pepper, diced fine
preparation
      Cook bacon then crumble into pieces and set aside.
      Cut biscuits into quarters.  Dip each piece into melted butter and layer 1/3 of the pieces into a greased bundt pan.  Sprinkle half of each of the following ingredients over biscuits in the bundt pan:  bacon, pepperoni, onion, cheese and green pepper.
      Put another 1/3 of the prepared biscuits on top of the ingredients in the pan.  Cover with the rest of the bacon, pepperoni, onion, cheese and green pepper.
      Put the last 1/3 of the prepared biscuits on top of the ingredients in the pan.
      Bake at 350° for 40 minutes or until golden brown.

BREAKFAST PIZZA
ingredients
1  pkg. crescent rolls
1  lb. sausage
1 small  pkg. hash browns, thawed
1  c. shredded cheese
5  eggs
1/4  c. milk
1/2  tsp. salt
1/3  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Roll  out  crescent  rolls  onto  pizza pan.  Brown and drain sausage.  Add on top of crust, then thawed hash browns. Beat eggs, milk, salt and pepper.  Pour over sausage.  Sprinkle with cheese.  Bake at 350° until browned, approximately 20 to 30 minutes.

SPAGHETTI PIZZA
ingredients
2  eggs
1  c. milk
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. spaghetti, cooked and drained
1  lb. ground beef, cooked and drained
1 (28 oz.)  jar spaghetti sauce
1 (3 1/2 oz.)  pkg. sliced pepperoni (optional)
1 (4 oz.)  can mushroom pieces, drained
1/4  c. chopped onion
  garlic salt to taste
2  c. (8 oz.) shredded Mozzarella cheese
1  c. (4 oz.) shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
      In a large bowl, beat the eggs and milk. Add spaghetti. Toss to coat. Transfer to a greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Top with beef, spaghetti sauce, pepperoni, mushrooms and onion. Sprinkle with garlic salt. Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with cheeses. Bake 10 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Let stand 15 minutes before cutting. Yield: 8 servings.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
ingredients
1  can crescent rolls
1  head cauliflower
  sliced olives
2 to 3  tsp. mayonnaise
1  pkg. Ranch dressing mix
1  bunch broccoli
1  c. grated cheese
1/2  c. sour cream
1  pkg. cream cheese
preparation
      Line cookie sheet with rolls, making an edge like a pizza. Make sure to spray pan.  Bake 8 to 10 minutes.  Set aside to cool. Mix cream cheese, sour cream and mayonnaise with Ranch dressing until soft enough to spread.  Spread cream cheese mixture into cooled crust.  Layer vegetables on top with grated cheese and olives.

PIZZA POTATOES
ingredients
1  pkg. scalloped potatoes
1 (16 oz.)  can tomatoes or pizza sauce
1 1/2  c. water
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. sliced pepperoni
1  pkg. Mozzarella cheese, shredded
preparation
      Empty potato slices and packet of seasoned sauce mix into ungreased 2 quart casserole dish.  Heat tomatoes, and water to boiling, stir into potatoes.  Arrange pepperoni on top and sprinkle with cheese.  Bake at 400° for 30 to 35 minutes uncovered.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
1  box yellow cake mix
1/4  c. water
1/4  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. soft butter
2  eggs
1/2  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Mix ingredients and spread into 2 greased pizza pans.  Bake at 350° for 15-20 minutes.
Filling:
ingredients
1  (8 oz.) Cool Whip
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1/2  c. powdered sugar
preparation
      Whip together.  Spread over crust.  Arrange fruits of your choice (ex. strawberries, kiwi, oranges and pineapples).
Topping:
ingredients
1/4  c. sugar
1  c. pineapple juice
1 1/2  Tbsp. cornstarch
preparation
      Combine ingredients.  Cook until thick; stirring constantly. Let cool.  Pour over fruit.  Chill before serving.

PIZZA
Crust:
ingredients
2  c. biscuit mix
2  Tbsp. French's mustard
1/2  c. milk
preparation
      Measure mix into a bowl.  Stir mustard into milk and blend into mix.  Knead 1 minutes on board dusted with biscuit mix.  Roll to fit 12 inch pizza pan.  Prick surface with a fork.  Bake in hot oven, 425°, for 5-7 minutes or until set.  Remove from oven. Reduce heat to 375°.
Filling:
ingredients
2 (8 oz.)  cans tomato sauce
1  Tbsp. sugar
1  Tbsp. French's minced onion
2  Tbsp. French's mustard
1/4  tsp. French's oregano
1  lb. sausage, well cooked and drained
1  c. grated sharp cheddar cheese
2  Tbsp. grated parmesan cheese
preparation
      Combine tomato sauce, sugar, onion, mustard and oregano. Bring to a boil and simmer 10 minutes. Pour into partially baked crust. Sprinkle with half of cheddar, then sausage, then remaining cheddar. Top with parmesan. Return to oven. Bake 12-15 minutes or until cheese melts and crust is deep golden brown.  Yield: 6 servings.
      Friendly warning:  Because French's mustard has a special flavor, texture and color all its own, don't expect best results from this recipe with any other mustard.

SAUSAGE AND PEPPERONI PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. Bob Evans Italian roll sausage
1 (12 oz.)  pkg. wide noodles, cooked
2 (14 oz.)  jars pizza sauce
2  c. Cheddar cheese, shredded
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. pepperoni slices
preparation
	Preheat oven to 350°. Crumble sausage into medium skillet. Cook over medium heat until brown, stirring occasionally. Remove sausage and drain on paper towels. In a large, lightly greased casserole dish, layer 1/2 of cooked noodles, 1/2 of sausage and 1/2 of remaining ingredients. Repeat with second layer of noodles and sausage. Layer remaining cheese and pepperoni, reserving several pieces of pepperoni slices to garnish top. Bake 35 to 40 minutes. Refrigerate leftovers.

PIZZA CUPS
ingredients
3/4  lb ground beef
6  oz tomato paste
1  tbsp minced onion
1  tsp Italian seasoning
1/2  tsp salt
10 oz  can refrigerated biscuits
1/2  c mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Brown and drain beef.  Stir in tomato paste, onion, and seasoning (mixture will be thick).  Cook over low heat for 5 minutes, stirring frequently.  Place biscuits in a greased muffin pan, pressing down to cover the bottom and sides.  Spoon about 1/4 cup of meat mixture into biscuit lined cups. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 400° for 12 minutes or until golden brown.
      Makes 12 cups.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
ingredients
1  pkg. crescent rolls
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
8  oz. salad dressing
  dill dip to taste
  vegetables, cut up to desired size (any kind of vegetables you like)
  shredded cheese
preparation
      Pat out rolls to cover baking sheet. Bake to directions on package. Mix cream cheese, salad dressing and dill dip. Spread onto cool crescent rolls. Place vegetables on top of cream cheese mixture. Place shredded cheese on top.

PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. hamburger
  small onion
  jar Ragu pizza sauce
1/2  c. water
1 (10 count)  can large biscuits
1  bag Mozzarella cheese
1  pkg. pepperoni
preparation
      Brown hamburger and onion.  Drain grease.  Add Ragu sauce and water.  Simmer for 30 minutes.  Cut biscuits into 4 pieces each. Place in greased 9 x 13 baking dish.  Pour sauce over this.  Top with Mozzarella cheese and pepperoni.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes at 350°.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
ingredients
2  pkg. crescent dinner rolls
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese (at room temperature)
1  c. green peppers, finely chopped
1  c. carrots, finely chopped
1  pkg. dry Ranch dressing mix
1  c. mayonnaise
1  c. broccoli, finely chopped
1  c. cauliflower, finely chopped
8  oz. shredded cheese
preparation
      Flatten dinner rolls out on cookie sheet.  Put creases together. Bake according to directions until brown. Cool for 20 minutes.
       Beat cream cheese, then add mayonnaise and dry Ranch dressing mix. Mix all together well. Spread this mixture over the top of the crust.  Top with chopped veggies. Sprinkle with cheese on top. Cut in small finger-sized squares. Cover and keep in refrigerator until serving time.  Makes enough to share.
      Hint:  Use low-fat ingredients for a lower fat count.

PIZZA
ingredients
1  (1 lb.) loaf frozen bread dough, thawed
2  tsp. vegetable oil
1  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
1 (15 oz.)  can tomato sauce
1  Tbsp. chopped onion
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. dried oregano leaves
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
2  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
4  oz. sliced pepperoni
  green pepper strips (eyebrows, nose, mouth)
  olive slices (eyes)
preparation
      Heat oven to 425°.  Divide thawed dough in half; roll and stretch each half into 10 to 12-inch circle on round pizza pan. Turn up edges 1/2 inch and pinch.  Brush circles with oil. Sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese.  Mix tomato sauce, onion, salt, oregano and garlic powder.  Pour on circles.  Top with Cheddar cheese.  Decorate with overlapping pepperoni slices, green pepper strips and olive slices for face.  Bake until crust is brown, 20 to 25 minutes.  Makes 2 pizzas.

PIZZA SOUP
ingredients
2  lb. ground beef
1  green pepper, diced
1  red pepper, diced
1/2  lb. pepperoni, sliced
2  cloves garlic, minced
2  Tbsp. dried oregano
1  piece cooked Italian sausage, sliced
1/2  c. fresh basil, chopped
  salt and pepper to taste
1  medium onion, diced
2 (16 oz.)  cans diced tomatoes with juice
1  qt. water
2 (16 oz.)  cans pizza sauce
1/2  tsp. crushed red pepper (optional)
  shredded Mozzarella (for garnish)
preparation
      In a medium saucepot, add beef and all ingredients, except the pizza sauce, tomatoes and the water. Saut until the beef is done; add the pizza sauce, tomatoes and the water. Let simmer for 1/2 hour. Garnish with cheese.

PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground meat
2  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
2  eggs
3/4  c. biscuit mix
1 (14 oz.)  jar pizza sauce
1 1/4  c. milk
preparation
	Cook meat until brown, stirring as you go; drain well and pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan. Top with pizza sauce and cheese. Combine biscuit mix, milk and eggs. Beat until smooth and pour over the top evenly. Bake at 400° for 30 to 35 minutes.

PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  medium onion, chopped
1  jar pizza sauce
1  (8 oz.) spiral pasta, cooked and drained
2  c. mozzarella cheese
4  oz. pepperoni
preparation
      Brown beef and cook onion until done and drain. Stir in pizza sauce and pasta. Transfer to 13 x 9 inch pan. Sprinkle with cheese and place pepperoni on top. Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
  4x confectioners sugar
1  qt. fresh strawberries
  strawberry glaze
  crushed pineapple
3  bananas
8  oz. cream cheese
  sugar cookie roll
  Pam
  lemon juice
preparation
      Press  sugar  cookie  roll on sheet (sprayed with Pam). Cook at  350°  for  15  minutes  and cool.  Combine 1 1/2 cups confectioners sugar with 8 ounces cream cheese; mix and spread on cooled cookie.
      Slice  3 bananas (coat with 2 tablespoons lemon juice). Stir until  coated good.  Put on cream cheese mixture.  Slice strawberries,  then  glaze.  Drain pineapple and top.  Fix day before and refrigerate.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
1  roll of sugar cookie dough
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  c. sugar
1  pkg. strawberry glaze
  assorted fresh fruits (sliced) or fruit cocktail
preparation
      Thaw cookie dough and press out with floured fingers on cookie sheet or pizza pan.  Bake at 350 degrees until golden brown.  Cool.  Mix sugar with softened cream cheese.  Spread mixture to edges of cookie pizza.  Drizzle with thin layer of strawberry glaze.  Add fruit and chill for 30 minutes.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
  Pillsbury cookie dough (in tube)
8  oz. Philadelphia cream cheese
  cup powdered sugar
1/4  tsp. vanilla
  pineapple tidbits (drained)
  mandarin oranges (drained)
  kiwi
  coconut
  strawberries
preparation
      Crust:  Spread cookie dough on a round pizza pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until golden brown.  Let cool.
      Icing:  Mix together in a bowl, cream cheese, powdered sugar and vanilla.  Spread evenly on cooled cookie crust.
      Cut strawberries and kiwi, put on top of icing.  Also top with drained pineapple tidbits, mandarin oranges, and sprinkle with coconut.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
Crust:
ingredients
2  cans crescent rolls
8  oz. cream cheese
8  oz. sour cream
8  oz. shredded cheese
preparation
      Spread rolls on cookie sheet and bake until golden brown. cool  Mix cream cheese and sour cream together.  Spread on cool crust.
Vegetables:
ingredients
  cauliflower
  broccoli
  cherry tomatoes
  onions
  carrots
  peppers
preparation
      Chop and dice the desired amount of vegetables and arrange on top.  Add Shredded cheese top of vegetables.  Do not bake.

PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef, fry and drain grease
1/3  c. chopped onion
1  tsp. oregano
1/2  tsp. salt
1  can tomato soup
1/2  can water
2  c. wide cooked noodles
1  c. Mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Add the onions, oregano, salt, soup and water to meat. Layer the noodles, meat mixture and cheese. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

QUICK SNACK TIME PIZZA
ingredients
1  can biscuits
  pizza sauce
  pepperoni
  sausage, cooked and drained
  shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Heat oven to 350 degrees. Remove biscuits from can and flatten. Place onto, (vegetable sprayed), cookie sheet. Top each biscuit with 1 tablespoon pizza sauce. Place pepperoni and sausage on top of sauce. Top each with cheese. Bake 8--10 minutes or until biscuits are done and cheese melted.

PIZZA POTATOES CASSEROLE
ingredients
5  oz. (1 box) scalloped potatoes
16  oz. (1 can) tomatoes, whole
1 1/2  c. water
1/4  tsp. oregano
8  oz. (1 pkg.) pepperoni, sliced
4  oz. (1 pkg.) mozzarella cheese, shredded
preparation
      Empty potato slices (and seasoned sauce packet) into an ungreased 2-quart casserole dish.  Heat tomatoes, water and oregano to a boil.  Stir into potatoes.  Arrange pepperoni on top and sprinkle with cheese.
      Bake uncovered at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.

PIZZA GRILLED CHEESE
ingredients
1  Tbsp. butter, softened
2  slices bread
1  slice cheese
2  Tbsp. pizza sauce
6  slices pepperoni (optional)
preparation
      Butter one side of each slice of bread. Place one slice in a skillet, butter side down. Top with cheese, pepperoni, sauce and second slice of bread, butter side up. Cook over medium heat until golden brown, turning once.

PIZZA-BURGERS
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  can pizza sauce
1  pkg. Mozzarella cheese, sliced
preparation
      Brown meat and drain. Add pizza sauce. Patty out burgers and grill. When done, top with Mozzarella cheese and melt. Serve on hamburger with toppings of choice.

PIZZA POCKETS
ingredients
1  tube crescent rolls
1  jar pizza sauce
1  pkg. sliced pepperoni
1  c. shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°. Unroll crescent rolls. do not separate into triangles. Take each rectangle piece of dough and roll slightly between 2 pieces of waxed paper. Put a teaspoon or two of pizza sauce in middle of rectangle. Top with pepperoni and cheese. Fold edges over and seal along cracks. Bake for 15 minutes. One tube makes 4 pizza pockets.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
ingredients
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
2/3  c. mayonnaise
1  pkg. original Ranch dressing
2  cans crescent rolls
  raw vegetables
preparation
      Mix cream  cheese,  mayonnaise  and Ranch dressing; let stand several hours or overnight.  Pinch together the crescent rolls on a pizza pan.  Bake at 375° for 10 to 13 minutes.  Let cool; spread cream cheese mixture on top.
      Garnish with raw vegetables, olives, peppers, broccoli, etc. At Christmas use red bell pepper and broccoli.

CHINESE VEGETABLE PIZZA
ingredients
2  yellow squash
2  zucchini
1  green bell pepper
1  red bell pepper
1  large onion
8  cloves of garlic
5  Tbsp. soy sauce
1/2  tsp. black pepper
4  pieces flat bread, round 6 inch size
1/2  cup parmesan cheese
  6-8 oz. sliced mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Wash all veggies.  Cut squash, zucchini, and peppers into thin slices.  Quarter garlic.  Cut onion into thin stringy slices.  Mix all veggies well, add 5 Tbsp. soy sauce, garlic and black pepper, mix again.  Place veggies in lightly sprayed grilling basket.  Cook on BBQ grill for 15 minutes or until veggies get tender.  Heat oven to 375F.  Place bread on baking sheet, place veggies on top of bread in equal amounts.  Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and dust with parmesan cheese.  Bake for 10-12 minutes or until cheese has melted.  Can be served with Jalapeno Soy Dip.

PIZZA BREAD
ingredients
3  loaves frozen bread (Bridgeford)
1  lb. Owens hot sausage
3  bunches green onions
2  pkg. sliced pepperoni
  salad olives (small jar)
2  lb. grated Cheddar cheese
  Tabasco
preparation
      Put frozen loaves in refrigerator overnight.  Cut each loaf in half and roll out.  Brown sausage and drain.  Chop green onions, olives and pepperoni.  On each 1/2 loaf rolled out, layer sausage, onions, olives, pepperoni and cheese.  Sprinkle a few drops of Tabasco, if desired.  Roll up and seal edges.  Bake at 350° for about 35 minutes or until brown.  At this point, you may eat it or freeze it.  If frozen, remove from freezer (do not thaw) and bake at 350° for about 25 minutes or until hot all the way through. Makes 6 loaves.

BREAKFAST PIZZA
ingredients
2  cans crescent rolls
1  lb. sausage
4  eggs
1  c. grated cheese
preparation
      Place rolls in pizza pan to form shape of pizza pan. Brown sausage and crumble sausage over crust. Beat eggs, salt and pepper. Pour over sausage. Put cheese over this. Bake at 350° until crust is brown and eggs are done.

HOMEMADE PIZZA CRUST
ingredients
2  c. self-rising flour
3  Tbsp. oil
  milk
  salt
1  tsp. red chilli powder
1  Tbsp. sugar
2  Tbsp. plain yogurt
2  tsp. dry yeast
preparation
      Mix all the ingredient and make a dough.  Cover and let stand for 15 min.  Preheat the oven on 300°.  Grease pizza pan with cooking spray.  Roll out the dough to make the crust.  Bake for about 10 mins or until it's light brown.  Flip it and let it bake the uncooked side.   When done spread pizza sauce and your fav. toppings and bake for 10 min.  And Enjoy!!!!!!!!

CHOCOLATE PIZZA
ingredients
1 (12 oz.)  pkg. semi-sweet chocolate chips
1  lb. white almond bark, divided
2  c. miniature marshmallows
1  c. crisp rice cereal
1  c. peanuts
1 (6 oz.)  jar red maraschino cherries, drained and cut in halves
3  Tbsp. green maraschino cherries, drained and cut in fourths
1/3  c. shredded coconut
1  tsp. oil
preparation
      Melt chocolate chips with 14 ounces of almond bark in large saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in marshmallows, cereal and peanuts. Pour onto greased 12-inch pizza pan. Top with cherries. Sprinkle with coconut. Melt remaining 2 ounces almond bark with oil over low heat, stirring until smooth. Drizzle over coconut. Chill until firm, then store at room temperature.

PIZZA BURGERS
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1/4  c. chopped onions
1  c. pizza sauce
1/2  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
8  buns
preparation
      Cook ground beef in large skillet until meat is brown.  Add onions and cook for 1 more minute.  Add pizza sauce and cheese to cooked hamburger.  Cook 2 minutes or until hot.
