Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

SAUSAGE AND EGG BREAKFAST PIZZA
ingredients
1  pkg. (12- to 16-oz.) ground pork sausage
1  can (8.5-oz.) refrigerated crescent rolls
1  c. frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
1  c. (4-oz.) shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
3  eggs, lightly beaten
3  Tbsp. milk
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
3  Tbsp. each diced red and yellow bell pepper (optional)
1/4  c. thinly sliced green onions (optional)
2  Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°.  In large skillet, cook sausage over medium-high heat, stirring frequently until no longer pink. Separate crescent rolls into 8 triangles.  Place in ungreased 12-inch rimmed pizza pan with points toward the center.  Press together, seal perforations and form a circle 1-inch larger in diameter than pan bottom.  Turn edges under to make a slight rim. Sprinkle cooked sausage over crust.  Top with potatoes.  Add peppers and/or green onions if desired.  Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese.  Stir eggs, milk, salt, and pepper in small bowl; pour evenly over pizza.  Sprinkle with Parmesan.  Bake 20 minutes or until eggs are set and crust is golden.  Serve immediately.

PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  box curly noodles (egg noodles)
1  lb. hamburger, browned and drained
1  onion, diced
1  jar spaghetti sauce
1  pkg. pepperoni, sliced
1  pkg. shredded Mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Brown hamburger and onion. Drain grease. In a separate pot, boil curly noodles until tender and drain. Mix together the noodles, hamburger and onions and add spaghetti sauce. Mix well. Pour into a baking dish and top with pepperoni and Mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350° until cheese is melted. Serve with bread and a salad.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
1 (20 oz.)  pkg. refrigerated sugar cookie dough
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese, softened
1/3  c. sugar
1  (8 oz.) tub Cool Whip (strawberry flavor), whipped and thawed
1  pt. sliced strawberries
preparation
      Shape and pat out cookie dough in pizza pan.  Bake 15 minutes at 350°.  Cool.  Mix cream cheese and sugar with flavored Cool Whip.  Top with sliced strawberries.

RYE BREAD PIZZA
ingredients
1  lb. seasoned sausage
1  lb. hamburger
1  lb. Velveeta cheese
1/2  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  tsp. garlic salt
1  tsp. oregano
1/2  c. chopped green peppers
1/2  c. chopped onions
1 small  can tomato sauce
1 small  can mushrooms, chopped
preparation
      Brown sausage and hamburger; drain off grease.  Add cheese, Worcestershire sauce, garlic salt and oregano.  Mix well.  Add remaining ingredients.  Mix well and cool.
      Spread mixture on slices of rye bread (1 loaf).  I use the small party rye.  Place on cookie sheet and freeze.  After frozen, lay in bread bag, just like bread slices.  Take out any number of slices and heat in oven.

PIZZA HOT DISH
ingredients
1  lb. hamburger or sausage or half and half
1  lb. cooked spiral noodles (half cooked)
4  oz. pepperoni
  small can drained mushrooms
1/2  green pepper, chopped
1  onion, chopped
1/2  c. sliced green olives
1/2  c. sliced black olives
  salt and pepper to taste
1  can pizza sauce
1/2 to 1  can Hunt's 4 cheese spaghetti sauce
16  oz. shredded Mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Brown meat with onion, green pepper and seasons. Drain off grease. Mix in pepperoni, olives, mushrooms and sauce. Heat until hot. Add to 9 x 13 greased pan with noodles; stir. Top with Mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle with parsley (optional). Bake until cheese is browned at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
1  sugar cookie dough
2  (8 oz.) Philly cream cheese
1/2  c. sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
  grapes (red and green)
  strawberries
  bananas
  kiwi
preparation
      Press cookie dough firmly into the bottom of a pizza pan that has been sprayed with Pam. Bake at 350° for approximately 10 to 13 minutes (or until brown).
      Mix cream cheese, sugar and vanilla together. Spread on top of baked dough.
      Slice fruit and arrange in a fashion that is pleasing to the eye. (Example: First green grapes, second, strawberries, third, kiwi, fourth, banana and fifth the red grapes.) You can use any of your favorite fruits.
      If you choose to, you can spread orange marmalade over the fruit which will help prevent the bananas from turning brown as well as adding an extra flavor to your "pizza."

PIZZA PASTA
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. mostaccioli or penne pasta, cooked
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. pepperoni
1  c. sliced mushrooms
1 (8 oz.)  jar pizza sauce
1 (14 oz.)  can diced tomatoes
1  Tbsp. Italian seasoning
2  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Mix pepperoni, mushrooms, sauce, tomatoes and seasoning. Layer pasta, sauce mixture and cheese in 13 x 9 pan.  Bake at 450° for 20 minutes.

BREAKFAST PIZZA
ingredients
1  lb. sausage
1  tube crescent rolls
1  c. frozen loose packed hash browns, thawed
1  c. shredded cheese
5  eggs
1/4  c. milk
1/2  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
2  Tbsp. Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Brown sausage and drain. Separate rolls into 8 pieces; place in ungreased 12-inch pizza pan with points in the center. Press over bottom and up sides to form a crust; seal perforations. Spoon sausage over dough. Sprinkle with potatoes. Top with cheese. In a bowl, beat together eggs, milk, salt and pepper; pour into crust. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese. Bake at 375° for 25 to 30 minutes. Serves 6 to 8.

SHRIMP PIZZA
ingredients
12  oz. cream cheese, softened
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
  dash of Tabasco
1  small onion, grated
2  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
  dash of garlic salt
1  bottle chili sauce
2  cans small shrimp, drained
preparation
      With a mixer, combine cream cheese, lemon juice, Tabasco, onion, Worcestershire sauce and garlic salt.  Spread this mixture with a spatula on a platter or large round plate (like a crust). Pour chili sauce over cream cheese "crust" and spread evenly. Sprinkle the shrimp on top, forming the 3rd layer of your pizza. Serve with crackers - we love Sociables crackers.  Can be made the night before.

PIZZA COOKIES
ingredients
1 1/2  tsp. flour
1/2  tsp. baking soda
1/3   c. margarine
1  egg
1  tsp. vanilla
1/2  tsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. salt
1  c. brown sugar
1  Tbsp. hot water
preparation
      Combine flour, baking soda, salt, and baking powder.  Stir in melted margarine and brown sugar.  Add egg, vanilla, and hot water. Press into pan.  Top with chocolate chips, M&Ms, pecans, coconut, and marshmallows.  Marshmallows go on last.
      Bake at 350°F for 18 min.  It's good for a holiday, eat it like chocolate bars.

MULTI GRAIN PIZZA
ingredients
1  cup whole wheat flour
1  cup oat flour (1/4 cup rolled oats blend until fine)
1/4  cup corn meal
1  tsp. baking powder
2/3  cup milk
1/4  cup oil
5  slices bacon (cooked, drained, and crumbled)
1/2  pound ground beef (browned and drained)
1 1/2  cup mozzarella cheese
2  Tbsp. parmesan cheese
  pizza sauce, peppers, onions, olives, as desired
preparation
      Preheat oven to 425 degrees.  Grease a 14-inch pizza pan.  Mix together first 6 ingredients.  Press onto pan and bake 12 to 15 minutes.  Top with remaining ingredients and bake 10 to 15 minutes longer.

FAST EASY MOMS PIZZA
ingredients
  english muffins
  pizza sauce
  meat (any kind)
  mozz. cheese
preparation
      Cut english muffins in half, put tbsp. pizza sauce on each add cheese on each and meat, put on bakers pan and put under broiler for 5-10 minutes and watch very closely they could burn if not watched, easy supper or snack for the kids they will be a big hit.

POTATO PIZZA
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1/4  c. chopped onion
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
4  c. thinly sliced potatoes
1  can cheddar cheese soup
1/2  c. milk
8  oz. tomato sauce
1/2  tsp. oregano
  grated mozzarella cheese
  parmesan cheese
preparation
      Brown hamburger. Add onion, salt, and pepper, set aside. Mix potatoes, cheese soup, and milk in a baking dish. Top with hamburger mixture. Mix tomato sauce and oregano and put on top of hamburger mixture. Bake, covered at 350° for 1 hour. Remove cover and top with cheeses and return to oven to melt cheeses.

PEPPERONI PIZZA BITES
ingredients
1  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
1/2  c. chopped pepperoni
1/2  c. pizza sauce
2  pkgs. (10 each) refrigerated biscuits
1  Tbsp. milk
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Combine mozzarella cheese, pepperoni and pizza sauce in bowl. Set aside.  Flatten biscuits to 3-inch circles.  Place about 1 rounded tablespoon filling in the center of each biscuit.  Bring edges together and pinch closed with fork.  Brush with milk. Sprinkle Parmesan over biscuits.   Bake in oven at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.  Serve warm.  Makes 20.

BRUNCH PIZZA SQUARES
ingredients
1  lb. sausage or ham
1  tube of crescent rolls
4  eggs
2  Tbsp. milk
1/8  tsp. pepper
3/4  c. shredded cheese
preparation
      Unroll crescent roll dough into a greased pan (13 x 9 x 2 in.). Press dough 1/2 in up the sides.  Sprinkle with meat.  In a bowl, mix the other ingredients and pour over meat.  Bake, uncovered at 400°F for 15 min. or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted.  About 8 servings.

CHERRY PIZZA CAKE
ingredients
2  c. pie filling, cherry or other flavor
1  box white cake mix
1 1/2  sticks butter/margarine, melted
1  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Butter 13 x 9 inch cake pan and pour pie filling in bottom. Sift cake mix over filling. Melt butter and pour over mix and sprinkle with nuts. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

UPSIDE DOWN PIZZA
ingredients
2  lb. ground beef
2  Tbsp oil
3  Tbsp dry onion or 1/2 of fresh thinly chopped onion
1  pkg. spaghetti mix (or prepare your own with mixing together 1/2 tsp of each oregano, salt, pepper, garlic)
1  carton (1 lb) sour cream
1  can crescent rolls or biscuit dough
2  cups grated Mozzarella cheese
1 (16 oz)  can tomato sauce
2  Tbsp melted butter
2  Tbsp Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Brown beef with dry onion in 2 Tbsp oil.  When nicely browned, drain of excess oil.  Put meat in skillet, add spaghetti mix and tomato sauce and simmer for about 3 to 4 minutes.  Put meat on the bottom of 13x9 inch glass baking dish.  Spread on top of meat sour cream and mozzarella cheese.  Top with can of crescent rolls or biscuit dough.  Lay the rolls crosswise on the pan mixture, brush rolls with melted butter and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Bake at 375°F for about 3 minutes.  Let cool for 10 minutes and cut into squares.

PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
2  c. cooked macaroni
1 to 1 1/2  lb. browned hamburger
4  oz. mushrooms, drained
2  c. pizza sauce
8  oz. tomato sauce
1  c. Parmesan cheese
1/2  pkg. pepperoni, sliced
1/2  c. onions
  salt and pepper
  oregano
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together and put  in 2 quart casserole dish.   Bake  at 350° for 30  minutes.  Sprinkle  1  cup Mozzarella cheese and heat until cheese melts.

BREAKFAST PIZZA
ingredients
1  tube crescent roll dough
2  c. frozen shredded hash browns, defrosted
1  c. shredded cheddar cheese
5  eggs
  salt and pepper to taste
2 1/2  oz. Canadian bacon, cut into cubes
preparation
      Heat the oven 400°.  Unroll crescent roll dough and fit into a 12 inch pizza pan, pressing seams together to form a crust. Sprinkle with the defrosted hash browns and cheese.  Beat the egg in a bowl and season with salt and pepper.  Pour over the pizza. Place Canadian bacon cubes on top.  Bake 20 minutes, until eggs are set and crust is golden.

HOT PIZZA DIP
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/2  tsp. dried oregano
1/2  tsp. dried parsley
1/4  tsp. dried basil
1  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
1  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1  c. pizza sauce
2  Tbsp. chopped green bell pepper
2  oz. pepperoni, chopped
2  Tbsp. sliced black olives
preparation
	In a small bowl, mix together the cream cheese, oregano, parsley and basil.	Spread mixture in the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate.  Sprinkle 1/2 cup of the Mozzarella cheese and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese on the top of the cream cheese mixture. Spread the pizza sauce over all. Sprinkle with remaining cheese, then top with green pepper, pepperoni and olive slices. Cover and microwave for 5 minutes. Serve hot.
	Wheat Thin crackers are very good to use with this dip.

PIZZA CORN DOG SNACKS
ingredients
1  pkg. (16 oz.) frozen corn dogs, thawed
1/2  c. pizza sauce
3  Tbsp. chopped ripe olives
1  jar sliced mushrooms, drained
1/4  c. shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Remove stick from each corn dog; cut into 1 inch slices. Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Spread with pizza sauce. Top with olives, mushrooms and cheese. Bake at 350° for 15-20 minutes.

CHOCOLATE CHIP ROCKY ROAD PIZZA
ingredients
2 1/4  c. all-purpose flour
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. soda
3/4  c. packed brown sugar
3/4  c. sugar
1  c. oleo, softened
2  eggs
1  tsp. vanilla
12  oz. pkg. semi-sweet mini chocolate chips
1  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Combine  flour, salt and soda in  a  bowl.  In  another bowl cream oleo and sugars until blended.  Beat  in  eggs  and vanilla. Mix in dry ingredients along with  chips  and  nuts. Pat  into 14-inch round pizza pan, which  has  been  greased. Bake  at  375° for 20 to 25 minutes.  Remove  from  oven  and immediately sprinkle  topping  over   cookie   crust.   Cool completely, cut in wedges.
Topping:
ingredients
6  oz. pkg. semi-sweet mini chocolate chips
1  c. miniature marshmallows
1  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Combine chips, marshmallows and nuts.

PIZZA CASSEROLE II
ingredients
1  lb. Italian sausage
12  oz. wide noodles, cooked according to pkg. instructions
2 (14 oz.)  jars pizza sauce
2  c. Cheddar cheese, shredded
6  oz. pepperoni, sliced
preparation
	Preheat oven to 350°. Crumble sausage into a medium skillet; cook over medium heat until browned, stirring occasionally. Remove sausage and drain on paper towels. In a large lightly greased casserole dish, layer 1/2 of the noodles, 1/2 of the sausage and 1/2 of the remaining ingredients. Repeat with second layer of noodles, sausage and remaining ingredients. Reserve several pepperoni slices to garnish top. Bake 35 to 40 minutes. Serve immediately. Serves 6 to 8.

TACO PIZZA DIP
ingredients
1  (8 oz.) sour cream
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1/2  pkg. taco seasoning
  lettuce
  black olives
  green peppers
  shredded cheese
  tomatoes
  nachos
preparation
      Mix sour cream, cream cheese and taco seasoning together; spread on a foil-lined pizza pan. Add toppings. Serve as nacho dip. Keep refrigerated.

CHICAGO STYLE PIZZA
ingredients
1 small  pkg. dry yeast
1  c. warm water (115~ max)
1  Tbsp. sugar
2 3/4  c. sifted flour
1 1/2  tsp. salt
1  Tbsp. olive oil
12  oz. Mozzarella cheese
1 (28 oz.)  can well drained tomatoes or equivalent garden fresh peeled and seeded tomatoes
1  lb. hamburger
1  lb. Italian sausage
1  medium onion
1  green pepper, chopped
1  pkg. pepperoni
  green olives and black olives to taste
2  tsp. oregano
1  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. fennel seeds, ground in pestle with salt
1/2  tsp. basil
1/2  c. Parmesan cheese
  mushrooms to taste
preparation
      Brown meat and onion; drain. Dissolve yeast in water. Add sugar and allow to set for at least 5 minutes. Place flour and salt in mixer. Add yeast and water to flour; knead with dough hook. Add oil and knead until smooth and elastic. Place in oiled bowl (lightly oiled with olive oil). Cover with damp towel and place in warm place until doubled in bulk (approximately 30 minutes).
      Punch down.  Brush 14-inch round x 2-inch deep pan with olive oil.  Sprinkle pan with corn meal.  Press dough on sides and bottom, making 2-inch rim (for thinner crust pizza, use larger round pan).  Let rise 20 minutes.  Place Mozzarella cheese on dough.  Add cooked meat onto cheese.  Add well drained tomatoes; sprinkle salt and fennel mixture on tomatoes, then sprinkle oregano and basil on tomatoes.  Add peppers and mushrooms, then sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Add pepperoni last.
       Preheat oven to 500°. Place pizza in oven; reduce heat immediately to 450° and bake 30 to 35 minutes. Baking times will vary so check after 25 minutes. Bake until crust is to your taste.

VAL'S PIZZA
Dough:
ingredients
1 1/8  c. water
1  pkg. yeast
2  tsp. sugar
4  Tbsp. olive oil
2  tsp. salt
3 1/2  c. sifted flour
preparation
      Mix well.  Knead.  Let rise 1 to 2 hours.
Meat:
ingredients
1  lb. hamburger
1  lb. sausage
preparation
      Cook and pour off the fat.
Sauce:
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato sauce
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato paste
1/8 to 1/4  tsp. thyme
1/4  tsp. oregano
1  bay leaf
1/4 to 1/2  tsp. caraway seed
preparation
      Simmer and cool slightly.
Cheese:
ingredients
1/3 to 1/2  lb. Mozzarella
1/3 to 1/2  lb. Monterey Jack
preparation
      Grate and mix together.
      Divide dough and roll out for 2 (12-inch) round pans.  Pour on sauce, meat and cheese.  Bake 12 to 15 minutes at 450° or bake longer at lower temperature.

PIZZA SOUP
ingredients
2  lb. Italian sausage, browned
  pepperoni
  black olives
  chopped mushrooms
2  cans tomato soup
2  cans milk
preparation
      Make soup according to the directions on the can. Add remaining ingredients and simmer. The longer you cook, the thicker the soup. Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese when served.

DEEP DISH SAUSAGE PIZZA
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  can tomatoes
1/4  tsp. salt
1  tsp. sugar
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/4  tsp. basil
1  tsp. oregano
2 1/2 to 3  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
1/2  lb. sausage
preparation
      Bake sausage in oven about 20 minutes; drain and set aside. Squeeze tomatoes to remove juice.  Mix seasonings into squeezed tomatoes.
      Place dough in oiled pan, spreading with fingers around bottom and partway up sides.  Spread Mozzarella on top of dough.  Place pieces of sausage over cheese.  Place tomato mixture on top of sausage.  Sprinkle with additional oregano.  Bake in 425° oven about 20 to 25 minutes.

PIZZA POPCORN
ingredients
1/3  c. butter or margarine
1  clove garlic, minced
1/2 to 1  tsp. oregano
8  c. prepared popcorn
2  Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      In saucepan, melt butter with garlic and oregano. Pour over popcorn; mix well and toss with cheese.

MINI APPETIZER PIZZAS
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  lb. ground sausage
1  onion, chopped
10  oz. processed American cheese, cubed (Velveeta)
32  oz. cocktail rye bread
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°. In a large skillet, brown ground beef and sausage. Mix onion into sausage and beef mixture and sauté it until tender. When meat is browned and onion tender, drain the grease out of the skillet. Stir processed cheese into meat and onion mixture. Continue cooking until the cheese melts. Arrange slices of bread on a cookie sheet. Place a heaping spoonful of the meat, cheese and onion mixture onto each slice of bread. Bake 12 to 15 minutes. Serve warm. Makes approximately 20 servings.

PIZZA PASTA SALAD
(This salad is good for barbecue time.)  
ingredients
1  lb. rotini cooked and drained
3  med tomatoes diced and seeded
1  lb. shredded Cheddar cheese
1  c. sliced green onions
3  oz. sliced pepperoni
3/4  c. vegetable oil
2/3  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1/2  c. red wine vinegar
2  tsp. each salt and garlic powder
1/4  tsp. pepper
  croutons optional
preparation
      Combine rotini, tomatoes, Cheddar cheese, green onions, and pepperoni.  In smaller bowl combine Parmesan cheese, vinegar, oil and seasonings; mix dressing with rotini mixture cover and refrigerate overnight.  Add croutons before serving.

50's Style Pizza
Crust:
ingredients
2  c. flour
3  tsp. baking powder
2 to 4  Tbsp. shortening
1  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. mustard
1/2  c. milk
preparation
      Measure dry ingredients into bowl.  Stir mustard into milk; blend milk and shortening into dry ingredients.  Roll or press into 9 x 13 cake pan.  Prick surface with fork.  Bake in hot oven, 425° for 5 to 7 minutes.  Remove.  Reduce heat to 375°.
Sauce:
ingredients
2  cans (8 oz.) tomato sauce
1  Tbsp. sugar
1  Tbsp. minced onion
2  Tbsp. mustard
1/4  tsp. oregano
preparation
      Mix in saucepan and simmer 10 minutes.  Spread sauce over crust.
Toppings:
ingredients
  hamburger, browned
1 1/2  c. or more Velveeta cheese, grated  (or Cheddar)
2  Tbsp. Parmesan
preparation
      Add toppings.  Bake 12 to 15 minutes more.  Can also add pepperoni and other toppings as desired.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
1 1/4  c. all-purpose flour
1/3  c. brown sugar
2/3  c. butter, softened
3  tsp. confectioners sugar
1/2  c. granulated sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
12  oz. cream cheese
  blueberries
  peaches
  kiwi
  cantaloupe
  honeydew melon
  strawberries
  ground pecans
preparation
      Mix flour, brown sugar, confectioners sugar and butter until it forms a ball. Press on bottom of pizza pan. Bake in oven 10 to 15 minutes, until golden brown. Cool.
      Beat cream cheese, granulated sugar and vanilla together. Spread over crust. Arrange fruit on top. Garnish around edges with Cool Whip. Use fruits of choice.

STRAWBERRY PIZZA
ingredients
1 (20 oz.)  package refrigerated sugar cookies
8  ounces cream cheese
1  cup powdered sugar
8  oz Cool Whip
1  cup fresh strawberries
1  cup sugar
2  Tbsp cornstarch
preparation
      Crust:  1 (20 oz.) package refrigerated sugar cookies.  Press onto greased pizza pan or 15 X 10 baking pan.  Using floured fingers, press dough evenly into pan.  Bake at 350° for 12-15 minutes until golden brown.  Cool.
      Filling:  8 oz cream cheese, 1 cup powdered sugar, 8 oz Cool Whip.  Beat cream cheese and sugar together until smooth.  Fold in cool whip.  Spread on crust.
       Glaze: Crush 1 cup fresh strawberries. Add 1 cup water and cook for 2 minutes, strain. Combine 1 cup sugar and 2 tbsp cornstarch in saucepan, stir in berry juice. Cook until clear, stirring constantly. Cool. Arrange sliced strawberries on the filling. Spoon the glaze on top and refrigerate until set.

BANANA SPLIT BROWNIE PIZZA
ingredients
1  box brownie mix
8  oz. cream cheese
1  tsp. sugar
1  c. fresh sliced/diced strawberries
1  banana, sliced/diced
  chocolate sauce/syrup
preparation
      Bake brownies according to box directions.  Mix cream cheese with some sugar to sweeten.  When brownie cools, spread cream cheese on brownies leaving an inch or so around crust.  Sprinkle strawberries and bananas over the cream cheese.  Finally, drizzle chocolate sauce over it and serve.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
  Pillsbury sugar cookie dough
8  oz. cream cheese
8  oz. Cool Whip
1/4  c. sugar
  assorted fruits--strawberries, kiwi, grapes, mandarin oranges, blueberries, etc.
preparation
      Spread cookie dough on pizza pan; bake at 350° for 10 to 15 minutes.  Cool.  Mix cream cheese with sugar and Cool Whip. Spread on cooled crust.  Layer fruits on top, as desired.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
ingredients
2  tubes crescent rolls
2 - 8  oz. cream cheese
2/3  C. mayonnaise
1  tsp. dill weed
2  tsp. onion flakes
preparation
      Press crescent rolls into a cookie sheet and bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes.  Cool.
      Mix together:  cream cheese, mayonnaise, dill weed and onion flakes.  Spread on cooled crust and top with your favorite vegetables:  tomatoes, peppers, onion, cucumber, olives, mushrooms, etc.
      Sprinkle grated cheese on top.

SAUSAGE AND EGG BREAKFAST PIZZA
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. regular roll sausage, cooked, crumbled and drained
1  can refrigerated crescent rolls
1  c. frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
3  Tbsp. diced sweet red bell pepper
3  Tbsp. diced green bell pepper
3  Tbsp. diced yellow bell pepper
1  c. grated sharp Cheddar cheese
2  Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese
5  eggs, beaten
1/4  c. milk
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. black pepper
preparation
      Heat oven to 375°.  Separate crescent rolls into eight triangles.  Place in an ungreased 12-inch pizza pan with points toward the center.  Press crescent rolls together to form a crust and seal perforations.  Sprinkle cooked sausage evenly over crust. Top with potatoes and diced bell peppers.  Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese.  Combine beaten eggs, milk, salt and pepper.  Pour over crust.  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Bake the pizza for 25 to 30 minutes or until crust is browned and eggs are set.  Makes 1 pizza.  Yields 6 to 8 servings.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
ingredients
2  rolls of Pillsbury crescent rolls
16  oz. cream cheese
1  pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch Dressing, dry mix
  diced mushrooms
  chopped black olives
  broccoli florets, very small
  carrots, diced
  radishes, sliced thin
  cauliflower florets, very small
  tomatoes, diced
  bell pepper, diced
  shredded cheddar cheese
  shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Pat crescent rolls on ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake as directed.  Cool.  Mix cream cheese and dressing mix.  Spread on cooled crust.  Spread diced and chopped vegetables thinly on cream cheese mixture.  Garnish with cheeses.  Cut into bite size squares.  Refrigerate.

PIZZA SPAGHETTI PIE
ingredients
1  lb. hamburger
1/2  c. fine dry bread crumbs
1/2  c. chopped onion
1  tsp. salt
  dash of pepper
2/3  c. evaporated milk
4  oz. spaghetti, cooked and drained
1  egg, beaten
1/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
2  Tbsp. butter
1  (8 oz.) pizza sauce
1/2  tsp. oregano
1  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Combine hamburger, bread crumbs,  onion,  salt,  pepper and evaporated milk.  Press firmly onto bottom  and sides of a 9-inch pie plate.  Bake at 350° for 35  to  40 minutes.  Spoon off drippings.
      Combine spaghetti with egg, Parmesan cheese and butter. Spread in baked meat shell.  Top with pizza sauce, oregano and Mozzarella cheese.  Bake an additional  10 minutes.  Let stand 5 minutes before cutting into wedges.

PIZZA BREAD
ingredients
2  egg yolks
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  tsp. oregano
1  Tbsp. parsley
1  Tbsp. Parmesan cheese
1  Tbsp. oil
  frozen bread dough
3/4  lb. pepperoni
8  oz. Mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Press bread like pizza dough.  Mix all ingredients together. Put mixture on dough, saving a little for top.  Put pepperoni on dough and Mozzarella cheese.  Roll up like jellyroll, pinching ends together.  Brush remaining mixture on top.  Spray cookie sheet.  Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.  Cool and slice.

HOMEMADE PIZZA
ingredients
  Rhodes frozen bread loaves or Texas rolls
  Mozzarella cheese, shredded
  Cheddar cheese, shredded
  Monterey Jack cheese, shredded
  Contadina pizza sauce (comes in squeeze bottle)
  ground beef, browned
preparation
      Slightly thaw bread or rolls, enough to spread out on baking dish. Spread amount of sauce you desire on the dough. Add any toppings you like. Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes, depending on thickness of your crust.

PIZZA DIP
ingredients
8  oz. cream cheese, softened
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1/4  tsp. oregano
1  jar Pizza Quick sauce
  shredded mozzarella cheese
  shredded cheddar cheese
  parmesan cheese
  green peppers (optional)
  black olives (optional)
  pepperoni (optional)
preparation
      Spread cream cheese in a greased pie pan. Sprinkle with oregano and garlic powder. Spread pizza sauce on top. Sprinkle with shredded mozzarella, and cheddar (if desired). Sprinkle parmesan cheese on top. Serve hot with Doritos. Can add green peppers, black olives, and pepperoni to sauce, if desired.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
3  Tbsp. powdered sugar
1 (8 oz.)  carton Cool Whip
1  (20 oz.) roll sugar cookies
8  oz. cream cheese, softened
  Several varieties fruit (canned or fresh - see below)
preparation
      Mix Cool Whip, sugar, and cheese and set aside.  Lightly grease pizza pan.  Slice cookie dough 1/4 inch thick; lay in pan and smooth together to make crust.  Cook per directions.  Cool. Spread cheese mixture over crust.  Arrange fruit and top with glaze. Suggested fruits:  peaches, strawberries, pineapple, grapes, pears, mandarin oranges, strawberries, bananas, kiwi fruit.
Glaze:
ingredients
1/2  c. orange or pineapple juice
1/2  c. water
1/2  c. sugar
1  Tbsp. cornstarch
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Boil, stirring constantly till thick.  Cool.  Pour over fruit.

VEGGIE APPETIZER PIZZA
ingredients
2  tubes refrigerated crescent rolls
2  pkg. (8-oz. each) cream cheese, softened
1  c. mayonnaise
2  pkg. (1.0 oz. each) Hidden Valley Ranch Original Ranch Salad Dressing Mix
1  c. broccoli, finely chopped
1  c. cauliflower, finely chopped
2  medium tomatoes, seeded and chopped and drained on paper towels
1  can (4.5-oz.) sliced ripe olives, drained
1/2  c. grated carrots
1  c. cheddar cheese, shredded
preparation
      Preheat oven to 400°.  Press crescent rolls onto pan; form edges.  Bake for 9-10 minutes (don't let it brown).  Let cool. Mix softened cream cheese with mayonnaise and dry salad dressing mix.  Spread cream cheese mixture on cooled crust and top with vegetables and cheese.  Press down lightly and chill for at least 1 hour.  Cut into pieces.  (Don't make this too much in advance as crust becomes soggy if allowed to sit for very long.)

UPSIDE DOWN PIZZA
ingredients
2  lb. ground beef
1/4  c. onion, chopped
1  pkg. spaghetti sauce mix
2 8  oz. cans tomato sauce
1 1/2  c. shredded mozzarella cheese
1/2  c. sour cream
1 8  oz. can refrigerated crescent rolls
2  Tbsp. melted butter
1/3  c. parmesan cheese
preparation
      Brown ground beef and onions, drain. Add spaghetti sauce mix and tomato sauce. Simmer gently to let flavors combine. Spread meat mixture in 9 X 13 pan. Layer on mozzarella cheese and sour cream. Top with crescent rolls, brush with butter and sprinkle on parmesan cheese. Bake at 375°for 20 to 30 minutes. Serves 8 to 10.

EASY ITALIAN CRUST PIZZA
ingredients
  flour or cornmeal
1  1/2 lb ground beef or bulk sausage
1  c all purpose flour
1  tsp italian seasoning or oregano
1/2  tsp salt
1/8  tsp pepper
2/3  c milk
2  eggs
1/4  c chopped onion
1 4 oz  can mushrooms
1  8 oz tomato or pizza sauce
  1-2 tsp oregano (dried) leaves
4  oz (1 c) mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Heat oven to 425°.  Lightly grease 12-inch pizza pan; Sprinkle with flour.  In a large skillet lightly brown ground beef; drain. In a small bowl, combine 1 c flour, italian seasoning, salt, pepper, milk and eggs; blend until smooth.  Pour batter into greased pan, tilting pan so batter covers bottom.  Spoon beef over batter, top with onions and mushrooms.  Bake at 425° for 25-30 min. on the lowest oven rack.  In a small bowl, combine tomato sauce and oregano; spoon over pizza.  Sprinkle with cheese; bake an additional 10-15 min.

GRILLED PIZZA WITH RED PEPPERS AND CHEESE
(Makes 4 Servings)  
ingredients
1/2  lb. pizza dough
1  Tbsp. olive oil
2  roasted red peppers, sliced
4  whole black olives, pitted and sliced
4  oz. Feta cheese, crumbled
  pinch of kosher salt or sea salt
  freshly ground black pepper
2  Tbsp. fresh oregano leaves
preparation
      Spray the grill grate with nonstick spray and preheat the grill to medium.
      Roll out the pizza dough with a rolling pin or use your hands to pat the dough into a circle about 12 to 14-inches across and 1/4-inch thick.
      Lightly drizzle one side of the dough with some of the olive oil and carefully place the dough, oil side down, on the grill. Lightly drizzle the other side of the dough with more of the olive oil (the side facing up). When the dough is golden brown on one side, turn it over using a long spatula.
       Arrange the roasted red peppers, olives and Feta cheese on top of the pizza. Sprinkle with salt, pepper and the remaining olive oil. Place the cover on the grill and cook until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.
       Using a long spatula or 2 smaller ones, remove the pizza from the grill and sprinkle the oregano leaves over the top. Cut into slices and serve. Preparation time: 20 minutes. Cooking time: 15 minutes.

PARTY PIZZA APPETIZERS
(Makes 90 Appetizers)  
ingredients
1  lb. hot sausage, cooked, drained and crumbled
1  c. onion, chopped
1/2  c. sharp cheese, grated
1/2  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1 1/2  tsp. oregano
1  tsp. garlic salt
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato sauce
1 (6 oz.)  can tomato paste
3  cans flaky biscuits (Hungry Jack brand)
preparation
      Combine first 8 ingredients.  Separate each biscuit into 3 pizza rounds.  Spread with mixture.  Put pizzas on cookie sheet and freeze.  Remove from cookie sheet and store in plastic bags. Bake frozen pizzas at 425° for 10 minutes.  Great for a cocktail party.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

PIZZA ROLL
ingredients
1  loaf frozen bread dough, thawed
3  Tbsp. butter, melted
1  tsp. oregano, add to melted butter
8  oz. shredded Mozzarella cheese
  pepperoni, or other meat of your choice
  mushrooms, if desired
  pizza sauce
preparation
      Roll out bread dough, use flour underneath.  Brush with butter/oregano mixture.  Sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese and meat. Add mushrooms.  Roll up the long way and pinch dough together. Lay the dough on cookie sheet, pinched side down.  Brush with butter/oregano mixture again.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes, or until it bursts open and cheese oozes out.  Cut into slices and dip in pizza sauce.

VEGGIE PIZZA
ingredients
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. crescent rolls
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/4  c. mayo
1  pkg. (1 oz.) ranch style dressing mix
1  red pepper, chopped
  shredded carrots
  green onions, chopped
  broccoli, finely chopped
  shredded cheddar cheese
preparation
      Unroll crescent rolls and line bottom of 15 x 9 x 1 inch pan. Cook at 350° for 7 to 8 minutes or until golden brown. Mix cream cheese, mayo and dressing mix on medium speed one minute. Spread on crescent rolls and top with vegetables. Your may adjust the vegetables to your taste, but this mix is very colorful. Top with shredded cheese. Cover and chill over night. Cut into small squares.

POPOVER PIZZA
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1  large onion, chopped
1 (1.5 oz.)  pkg. spaghetti sauce mix
1 (15 oz.)  can tomato sauce
1/2  c. water
2  eggs
2  c. (8 oz.) shredded Mozzarella cheese
1  c. milk
1  Tbsp. oil
1  c. all-purpose flour
1/4  tsp. salt
1/2  c. grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Cook ground beef and onion in  a  large  skillet  until meat is browned, stirring to crumble  meat;  drain.  Add sauce mix, tomato sauce and water, stirring  well.  Simmer  10  minutes. Spoon meat mixture into a lightly  greased  9 x 13-inch pan; sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese.
      Beat  eggs, milk and oil until  foamy.  Add  flour  and salt. Beat until smooth.  Pour  batter  over  meat  mixture. Spread evenly.  Sprinkle with Parmesan  cheese.  Bake  at 400° for 30 minutes or until the top is  puffed  and  golden brown. Serve hot.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
ingredients
2 (8 count)  cans crescent biscuits
1  (16 oz.) container cottage cheese
1/2  c. mayonnaise
1  pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch salad dressing
  finely chopped vegetables
  finely chopped meats
  finely chopped cheese
preparation
      Press crescent biscuits into and halfway up the sides of 15 1/2 x 10 1/2-inch jelly roll pan. Bake at room temperature given on biscuit can. Let cool. Blend Hidden Valley Ranch salad dressing mix until smooth, then spread on cooled crust. Put finely chopped vegetables, meat and cheese on top. You can use broccoli, cauliflower, fresh mushrooms, green onion, radishes, pepperoni, cooked sausage, ham and shredded cheese. Just use your imagination. Chill before serving.
      This recipe can be halved and you use a 9 1/4 x 13 1/4-inch jelly roll pan.

PARTY PIZZA
ingredients
2  lb. mild sausage
1  lb. hot sausage
2  lb. Velveeta cheese
1  large onion, diced
2  green peppers, diced
1  tsp. oregano
1  tsp. fennel (not required)
preparation
      Scramble and brown sausage.  Drain.  Melt cheese in double boiler.  Sauté onion and green pepper.  Drain.  Add sausage, green pepper and onion to cheese.  Spread on party rye bread.  Bake 10 minutes at 350°.  This makes enough for 2 loaves of bread.

VEGETABLE PIZZA-FINGER SALAD
ingredients
2  pkg. crescent dinner rolls
2  pkg. (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
1  c. mayonnaise
1  pkg. original Hidden Valley dressing
1  c. green pepper, finely chopped
1  c. carrots, finely chopped
1  c. black olives, sliced
1  c. Cheddar cheese, shredded
preparation
      Unwrap rolls and lay flat in jelly roll pan to form crust. Bake crust at 350° for 10 minutes.  Allow to cool.  Mix cream cheese, mayo and Hidden Valley dressing with electric mixer.  When smooth, spread over cooled crust.  Sprinkle vegetables, cheese and olives over cream cheese layer and cut into squares.

QUICK PIZZA DIP
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese, softened
1  c. Kraft 100% grated Parmesan cheese, divided
1/2  c. pizza sauce
1/2  c. Kraft shredded Mozzarella cheese
2  Tbsp. chopped green pepper
2  Tbsp. chopped red pepper
preparation
      Mix cream cheese and 1/2 cup of the Parmesan cheese with the electric mixer on medium speed until well blended.  Spread on bottom of 9-inch pie plate.  Top with pizza sauce, Mozzarella cheese, remaining 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese and peppers.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until thoroughly heated.  Serve with assorted Nabisco crackers or Stella D'Oro breadsticks.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1 small  pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix
2  cans Pillsbury crescent rolls
3/4  c. mayonnaise
  assorted vegetables (tomatoes, olives, celery, onions, broccoli, cauliflower, carrots, mushrooms), chopped
preparation
      On a cookie sheet with sides, spread pieces of crescent roll dough. Pinch seams together to make complete crust. Bake at 400° as per package directions. Mix together cream cheese, dressing mix and mayonnaise. Spread on cooled crust. Top with assorted chopped vegetables.

PIZZA LOAF
ingredients
1  1lb. loaf frozen bread dough (thawed)
1  lb. hamburger
1/4  c. sliced mushrooms
1  medium chopped onion
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
2  Tbsp. melted butter
1  tsp. paprika
1/2  tsp. oregano
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
1 8  oz. can tomato sauce
1  c. shredded cheddar cheese
3/4  c. shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Let bread dough rise.  Prepare filling:  Cook meat with onions, mushrooms, salt and pepper in large skillet.  Drain.  Stir in tomato sauce, paprika, oregano and garlic salt.  Bring to a boil, lower heat, cover and simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cool. punch down dough.  Press out onto a 15 x 12 greased cookie sheet.  Spoon meat filling down center third of dough.  Sprinkle cheeses on filling.  Make diagonal cuts in dough, 1 1/2 inches apart down each side, to within 1/2 inch of filling.  Criss cross srtips over filling, pressing down and sealing with a drop of water.  Brush top of loaf with melted butter.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until golden brown.  Cut in thick slices to serve. Serves 6.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
1 (20 oz.)  pkg. refrigerated sugar cookies
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/3  c. sugar
1/2  tsp. vanilla
  banana slices
  peeled kiwi slices
  strawberry halves
  blueberries
1/2  c. orange marmalade, peach or apricot preserves
2  Tbsp. water
preparation
      Freeze cookie dough 1 hour.  Slice into 1/8-inch slices. Line foil-lined 14-inch pizza pan with slices, overlapping edges slightly.  Bake at 375° for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool.  Invert onto serving plate; carefully remove foil.  Invert to right side.
      Combine cream cheese, sugar and vanilla, mixing until well blended.  Spread over crust.  Arrange fruit over cream cheese layer.  Glaze with combined marmalade and water; chill.  Cut into wedges.  Makes 10 to 12 servings.
      Variations:  Substitute one or more of the following for the banana, kiwi, strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, red or green grape halves, pineapple chunks, maraschino cherry halves (drained), thin sliced peaches, pears or apples or Mandarin orange segments (drained).

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

BANANA BERRY BROWNIE PIZZA
ingredients
1/3  c. water
1 (15 oz.)  pkg. brownie mix
1/4  c. oil
1  egg
preparation
	Preheat oven to 350°.  Bring water to boil. Mix together brownie mix, water, oil and egg in large bowl until well blended. Pour into greased and floured 12-inch pizza pan. Bake 25 minutes.
Topping:
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/4  c. sugar
1  egg
1  tsp. vanilla
  strawberry slices
  banana slices
1 (1 oz.)  sq. semi-sweet chocolate, melted
preparation
	Beat cream cheese, sugar, egg and vanilla in small mixing bowl until well blended. Pour over crust.  Bake 15 minutes.  Cool. Top with fruit; drizzle with chocolate. Garnish with mint leaves, if desired.  Makes 10 to 12 servings.

POCKET PIZZA
ingredients
  Pizza Dough (below)
1  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1/4  c. pizza sauce
1/2  c. each shredded Mozzarella cheese and cooked Italian sausage
1  Tbsp. finely chopped onion
1/8 to 1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1/4  pkg. (3 oz. size) sliced pepperoni
2 to 3  Tbsp. pizza sauce
1/2  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Heat the oven to 425°. Lightly grease a cookie sheet with shortening.
       Prepare Pizza Dough. Roll into a 12-inch circle. Fold loosely in half; place on cookie sheet and unfold. Brush with oil.
      Layer remaining ingredients on half of the circle in order listed; fold dough over filling. Turn edge of the lower dough over edge of the top dough; pinch edge to seal. Prick top with a fork. Bake until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes.
Pizza Dough:
ingredients
1  c. Gold Medal all-purpose flour
1/3  c. milk
2  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1  tsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. salt
preparation
      Beat the flour, milk, oil, baking powder and salt in a bowl until the dough leaves side. Turn onto a lightly floured surface; gather into a ball. Knead 10 times. Cover with a bowl; let stand 15 minutes.

PIZZA SWIRLS
ingredients
1  (1 lb.) loaf frozen bread dough, thawed
1/4  c. prepared pasta sauce
1/2  c. shredded Mozzarella
2  Tbsp. finely chopped pepperoni
1  Tbsp. olive oil
2  Tbsp. grated Parmesan
preparation
	Preheat oven to 450°. Generously coat a rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray. Roll out dough to a 10-inch square on a floured surface. Spread pasta sauce over dough. Reserve 2 tablespoons Mozzarella; sprinkle remaining Mozzarella over sauce. Top with pepperoni. Roll dough jelly roll style to enclose filling. Cut roll crosswise into 10 slices. Place slices, cut side down, on prepared baking sheet. Brush tops with oil. Sprinkle with Parmesan and reserved Mozzarella. Bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter and serve immediately.

HOMEMADE PIZZA SAUCE
ingredients
1/2  bushel tomatoes (26 lb.)
6 garlic cloves, chopped or 3/4  tsp. garlic powder
6  medium onions, chopped
1  c. chopped parsley
1/2  c. brown sugar
1/4  c. salt
3  Tbsp. oregano
2  Tbsp. basil
1  Tbsp. pepper
preparation
      Cook  tomatoes, onions, garlic and fresh parsley.  Then run through ricer.  Return to kettle and add remaining ingredients. Cook  to  desired thickness, about 4 hours.  Good for spaghetti too.

VEGGIE PIZZA
ingredients
2  pkg. crescent rolls
16  oz. soft cream cheese
1  c. mayo
1 1/2  pkg. dry ranch dressing
  assorted chopped vegetables
  shredded Cheddar
preparation
      Place rolls on cookie sheet and press seams together.  Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.  Mix cream cheese, mayo and dressing; spread over cooled crust.  Add chopped veggies and cheese.  Cut into squares.

PASTA PIZZA
ingredients
2  c uncooked macaroni
3  eggs, beaten
1/2  c milk
1/2  c cheddar cheese, shredded
1/4  c onion, finely chopped
1/2  tsp salt
1/4  tsp black pepper
1  lb ground beef, lean
14  oz spaghetti sauce
1  medium tomato, thinly sliced
1  green pepper, sliced into rings
1-1/2  c shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Cook macaroni according to package directions.  Drain. Combine eggs and milk and stir into cooked macaroni.  Stir in cheddar cheese, onion, salt and pepper.  Mix well.  Spread mixture evenly over a buttered 14 inch pizza pan.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.
      Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook ground beef until browned. Drain off fat.  Stir in spaghetti sauce.  Spoon meat mixture over baked macaroni crust.  Arrange tomato slices and pepper rings on pizza.  Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.  Bake for additional 15 minutes or until cheese is bubbly.
      Makes 8 servings.

POUR PIZZA
ingredients
1  lb. hamburger
1  onion, chopped
1  c. flour
1  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. pepper
1/8  tsp. oregano
2  eggs
2/3  c. milk
1 (15 oz.)  can pizza sauce (pt.)
1 1/2 to 2  c. grated cheese
preparation
      Preheat  oven  to  400°.  Brown  hamburger  and  onion. Season with salt and pepper.  Set aside.  Combine flour, salt, pepper, oregano, eggs and milk, making  a soft batter.  Grease a 9 x 13-inch pan.  Sprinkle with  cornmeal.  Pour  batter  in pan. Sprinkle  meat over batter.  Bake  15  to  20  minutes. Spread pizza sauce and cheese over meat.  Bake  15  more  minutes. Yields 1 (9 x 13-inch) pan.

BARBECUE CHICKEN PIZZA
ingredients
2  c. chopped cooked chicken
3/4  c. barbecue sauce
1  pkg. (14 oz) prebaked Italian pizza crust
1  c. (4 oz) shredded mozzarella cheese
1/4  medium size red onion, thinly sliced
2  green onions, chopped
preparation
      Combine chicken and barbecue sauce.  Place pizza crust on a baking sheet.  Spread chicken mixture over pizza crust.  Top with remaining ingredients.  Bake at 450° for 15 minutes or until cheese melts.

HOT PIZZA DIP
ingredients
8  oz. cream cheese, softened
1  tsp. Italian seasoning
1  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
2  Tbsp. sliced green onions
3/4  c. Parmesan cheese
8  oz. pizza sauce
2  Tbsp. chopped green pepper
  piping hot loaf bread, baked in bread tube or tortilla chips
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Combine cream cheese and Italian seasoning; mix well.  Spread in bottom of 9-inch round cake pan. Combine cheeses.  Sprinkle half of cheese mixture over cream cheese.  Spread pizza sauce over cheese.  Top with remaining cheese, peppers and onions.
      Bake 15 to 18 minutes or until cheese is melted and mixture is bubbling around the edges.  Serve hot with bread or chips.

MINI PIZZAS
ingredients
  tortilla shells
1  jar spaghetti sauce
8  oz. Cheddar cheese block, grated
  peppers, onion, meat, mushrooms, olives (optional)
preparation
	Take tortilla shell and spread spaghetti sauce until covered. Add cheese. Top with optional ingredients. Bake at 350° until cheese bubbles.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
1  (18 oz.) roll refrigerator sugar cookie dough
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/2  c. sugar
1  envelope dry Dream Whip
  fruit of your choice (see recipe notes)
  light colored jelly (any flavor)
  whipped topping, thawed (optional)
preparation
      Slice cookie dough and place on pizza pan that has been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Pat dough over top of pizza pan making sure no openings are left. Bake according to package directions, but only until light tan in color. Set aside to cool.
      In medium mixing bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Add sugar and dry Dream Whip. Beat until all ingredients are combined and mixture is smooth. Spread over top of cookie crust. Add sliced fruits of your choice, in layers, over top of crust.
      In small saucepan over medium heat, melt a small amount of apple, peach or any other light colored jelly. Drizzle over layers of fruit. Cut pizza into slices. Garnish with whipped topping, if desired.
      Recipe Note: Suggested fruits to be added to pizza in layers are strawberries, blueberries, kiwi, bananas, apples, fresh pears or fresh peaches or any fruit you desire. If using any fruits that turn brown, dip them in apple juice before adding to pizza.

GARDEN VEGGIE PIZZA SQUARES
ingredients
8  oz pkg refrigerated crescent rolls
8  oz pkg cream cheese, softened
1  oz pkg Ranch-style dressing mix
2  carrots, finely chopped
1/2  c red bell peppers, chopped
1/2  c green bell peppers, chopped
1/2  c fresh broccoli, chopped
1/2  c green onions, chopped
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°.  Roll out crescent rolls onto a large non-stick baking sheet.  Stretch and flatten to form a single rectangular shape on the baking sheet.  Bake 11-13 minutes in the oven, or until golden brown.  Allow to cool.  Place cream cheese in a medium bowl.  Mix cream cheese with 1/2 of the ranch dressing mix.  Adjust the amount of dressing mix to taste.  Spread the mixture over the cooled crust.  Arrange carrots, red bell peppers, broccoli and green onions on top.  Chill in the refrigerator approximately 1 hour.  Cut into bite-sized squares to serve.

CHICKEN PESTO PITA PIZZAS
ingredients
1 12  oz. bag frozen Fully Cooked Chicken Breast Fajitas
6  KRONOS Authentic Pita flat breads
2/3  c. regular or reduced fat mayonnaise
2  Tbsp. Racconto Traditional Basil Pesto
1 14  oz. can Reese Quartered Artichoke Hearts, drained
1 6  oz. jar Harvest Moon Sliced Mushrooms, drained
1  small red bell pepper, seeds removed
2  c. shredded four cheese pizza blend
preparation
      Heat oven to 450 degrees.  Place 2 oven racks in bottom half of oven.  Remove fajitas from packaging and place in a microwave safe dish.  Heat on HIGH power until pieces begin to thaw; stir and rearrange fajitas in dish as necessary.  Pull apart to separate; tear or cut chicken into bite-sized pieces.  Meanwhile, line 2 large baking sheets with foil.  Lay 3 pita shells on each baking sheet.  Combine mayonnaise with pesto; spread evenly over tops of pita bread, about 2 tablespoons on each.  Place chicken, artichoke hearts, and mushrooms over pesto layer.  Cut pepper into thin strips; lay strips over tops of pizzas and sprinkle evenly with cheese, 1/3 cup over each pizza.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes, or until cheese melts and begins to brown.  Let stand 2 to 3 minutes, cut into slices and serve.

PIZZA SWIRLS
ingredients
1  (1 lb.) loaf frozen bread dough, thawed
1/4  c. prepared pasta sauce
1/2  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
2  Tbsp. finely chopped pepperoni
1  Tbsp. olive oil
2  Tbsp. grated Parmesan
preparation
      Preheat oven to 450°.  Generously coat a rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray.  Roll out dough to a 10-inch square on a floured surface.  Spread pasta sauce over dough.  Reserve 2 tablespoons Mozzarella; sprinkle remaining Mozzarella over sauce. Top with pepperoni.  Roll jelly-roll style to enclose filling. Cut roll crosswise into 10 slices.  Place slices cut side down on prepared baking sheet.  Brush with oil.  Sprinkle with Parmesan and reserved Mozzarella.  Bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes.  Transfer to a serving platter and serve immediately.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
Spread:
ingredients
11  oz. cream cheese
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1  tsp. dill weed
3/4  c. mayonnaise
1/4  tsp. onion salt
preparation
      Mix and spread:
Topping:
ingredients
  broccoli
  green pepper
  lettuce
  black olives
  cauliflower
  grated carrots
  tomato
preparation
      Top with grated cheese. Cut with pizza cutter. Sour cream can be substituted for cream cheese.

FRUIT PIZZA
(Low Calorie)  
ingredients
1  roll refrigerated sugar cookies
1  (8 oz.) fat free cream cheese
1/3  c. Splenda
1/2  tsp. vanilla
preparation
      Cut cookie dough into 1/8 inch slices and line pizza pan. Bake at 375° for 12 minutes or until brown. Let cool. Then mix together cream cheese, Splenda and vanilla. When ready to serve, top with fresh strawberries, bananas, pineapple, blueberries, etc. (your choice). Make sure to dip bananas in lemon juice to keep them from browning.  About 140 calories and 5 grams of fat.

SPAGHETTI-PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. spaghetti
1  c. milk
2  eggs
1  lb. ground beef
1  medium onion, chopped
1  medium green pepper, chopped
1 (32 oz.)  jar spaghetti sauce
1 (4 oz.)  can sliced mushrooms, drained
1 (12 oz. )  pkg. pepperoni
2  c. (8 oz.) Mozzarella cheese, shredded
1  c. (4 oz.) Cheddar cheese
preparation
	Cook spaghetti; drain and place in a lightly greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Combine milk and eggs; stir well. Pour over spaghetti. Cook ground beef, onion and green pepper in a large skillet. Stir until beef crumbles; drain well. Stir in spaghetti sauce and spoon over spaghetti. Layer mushrooms and pepperoni on top. Bake at 350° for 20 to 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheeses; bake 10 minutes more or until cheeses are melted.

DEEP-DISH PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  lb. hamburger
1/2  c. chopped onion
3/4  c. water
1 1/2  tsp. oregano
1  c. Cheddar or Mozzarella cheese
1 (6 oz.)  can tomato paste
1  can (10) biscuits
preparation
      Cook hamburger and onion. Drain grease. Add water and tomato paste. Simmer 10 minutes. Spread biscuits in dish that is greased to make crust. Pour mixture over biscuits and add cheese. Cook at 350° for 20 minutes.
      You can add anything to mixture you'd normally put on pizza.

FRIDAY NIGHT PIZZA
Dough:
ingredients
1  c. scalded milk
1/4  c. ice cold water
3  c. white flour
1 1/2  Tbsp. sugar
1  tsp. salt
3  tsp. yeast or 2 tsp. fast rising yeast
preparation
      Place 1 cup of milk in microwave for 3 minutes. Add ice water. Put in freezer to cool. Mix flour, sugar, salt and yeast. (You can use your bread maker, a Kitchen Aid mixer or just a wooden spoon and your hands to mix the dough.) Once the milk/water mixture is cool enough, add gradually to the dough. Knead very thoroughly. Let rise in a warm place for 1 hour. Grease a cookie sheet or a pizza pan. Roll out the dough on a floured surface. Form a pizza crust with your hands by tossing it while stretching the dough. Stretch to fit your pizza pan or a large cookie sheet. Make sauce after you've formed your crust on your pan.
Sauce:
ingredients
1 small  can tomato paste
1/2 small  can of water
1  tsp. garlic powder
1  tsp. onion powder
1/2  tsp. basil
preparation
      Mix well. You can melt butter and garlic and spread evenly on your crust. Or you can spread olive oil on your crust mixed with basil or garlic or whatever sounds good to you or you can just leave the crust dry if you're watching calories! Spread pizza sauce evenly onto pizza.
       Toppings are up to you. I use Mozzarella, onions, tomatoes, peppers, ham, olives or whatever I have on hand. I've even tried fresh spinach and it was yummy! Pepperoni is always a plus! The possibilities are endless!

PIZZA DOGGIES
ingredients
1  clove garlic, minced
2  Tbsp. olive oil
1  can tomato soup
1/4  c. water
2  Tbsp. parsley, chopped
1/2  tsp. crushed oregano
  hot dogs, slit lengthwise
8  hot dog rolls, slit
6  oz. sliced Mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Cook garlic in oil until lightly browned. Add soup, water, parsley and oregano. Cook over low heat for 15 minutes. Stir often. Place hot dogs on buns in large shallow baking pan. Fill hot dogs with sauce. Top with cheese. Place under broiler for about 1 minute or until cheese melts.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
1  roll sugar cookie dough
1  small container strawberry or pineapple cream cheese
1  jar marshmallow cream or 1 (8 oz.) container Cool Whip
  mandarin orange sections, pears, bananas, peaches, grapes, strawberries and/or kiwi*
  chopped nuts (if desired)
preparation
      Spread cookie dough over round pizza pan. Bake it in oven at 250° until golden brown and slightly soft. Allow to cool.
       Hand mix cream cheese and marshmallow or whip cream in bowl until soft. (Soften cream cheese and marshmallow cream before attempting to mix.) Spread cream mixture over cookie dough crust until entire crust is covered. Sprinkle variety of fruits on top of mixture. Add nuts if desired. Chill for 1/2 hour. Bless and serve.
      *Choose the fruit and amount of each according to personal taste and preference.

PIZZA DELIGHTS
ingredients
1  lb. hot or mild sausage
1 (14 oz.)  jar pizza sauce
2  Tbsp. ketchup
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
2 (10 oz.)  cans biscuits
  shredded Mozzarella
  grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      In a 10-inch skillet, cook sausage over medium heat; drain off fat. Stir in pizza sauce, ketchup and garlic powder. Set aside. Press biscuits into 20 well-greased muffin cups. Spoon 1 to 2 tablespoons of the meat and sauce into each biscuit. Top with Mozzarella cheese and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake at 350° for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Yield: 20 muffin size pizzas.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
ingredients
1  pkg. crescent rolls
8  oz. cream cheese
8  oz. sour cream
1  pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix
  broccoli
  cauliflower
  carrots
  red cabbage
  green onions
  cucumbers
1  pkg. shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
	Spray a 9 x 13-inch pan with cooking spray. Spread crescent rolls in bottom of pan. Bake according to instructions on package. Set aside to cool.
	 Mix cream cheese, sour cream and Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix together and spread over rolls. Chop vegetables into small pieces. Spread in layers over the cream cheese mixture. Top with cheese. Refrigerate until chilled. Set out of the refrigerator 1 hour before serving.

DESSERT PIZZA
ingredients
1  pkg. refrigerated sugar cookie dough
4  oz. cream cheese, softened
2  Tbsp. sugar
1  Tbsp. milk
8  oz. Cool Whip
  Toppings:  chocolate chips, strawberries, grapes, nuts
preparation
      Heat oven to 350 degrees. Press cookie dough into 12 inch pizza pan. Beat cream cheese, milk and sugar with wire whisk. Stir in whipped topping. Spread on cookie crust. Garnish with toppings.

PIZZA CUPS
ingredients
3/4  lb. ground beef
6  oz. can tomato paste
1  Tbsp. onion, minced
1  Tbsp. Italian seasoning or oregano
1/2  tsp. salt
1  can biscuits
3/4  c. Mozzarella cheese, shredded
preparation
      Brown meat and drain. Add tomato paste and seasonings. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes; stir frequently. Press biscuits up sides of muffin pan. Spoon meat mixture in them and sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 400° for 10 to 12 minutes.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
2  pkg. sugar cookie dough
3  pkg. cream cheese (8 oz.)
1  tsp. vanilla
1  c. powdered sugar
1/2  tsp. lemon (if desired)
  fruit (i.e., raspberries, blueberries, grapes, strawberries, approximately 2 c.)
preparation
      Spread the sugar cookie dough on a cookie sheet. Bake and let cool.
       Mix the cream cheese, vanilla, powdered sugar and lemon and spread on cookie sheet.
       Drain the fruit desired. Sprinkle on top. Enjoy. Refrigerate. I don't think this goes in the low carb section!

PIZZA MUFFINS
ingredients
4  pack Pillsbury Tenderflake biscuits
1  pkg Turkey Pepperoni or regular
1  jar Ragu Traditional sauce
1  pkg shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Heat oven to 350°. Spray muffins pans with Pam. Half each biscuit, place one half in each muffin cup. Then spread small amounts of Ragu, add 2 or 3 slices of pepperoni and shredded cheese then top each one with the other biscuit half. Place in oven and bake until golden.

EASY STUFFED CRUST PIZZA
ingredients
1  can refrigerated pizza crust
20  slices pepperoni
7  pieces string cheese
1/2  c. pizza sauce
1/2  c. shredded mozzarella
preparation
      Grease a 9x13 inch pan.  Unroll dough and press in bottom of pan and 1 inch up sides.  Place pieces of string cheese along inside edge of dough.  Fold dough over and around cheese; press dough edges to seal.  Top crust with pizza sauce, pepperoni and cheese.  Bake at 425° for 15 min. or until crust is golden brown and cheese melts.

UPSIDE-DOWN PIZZA
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
  onion
1  can pizza sauce
8  oz. Mozzarella cheese slices
1/2  c. sour cream
8  oz. pkg. crescent rolls
1/2  c. Parmesan cheese
2  Tbsp. butter
preparation
      Brown beef and onions; add sauce.  Spread in casserole dish. Cover with sliced cheese.  Spread on sour cream.  Cover with whole roll of crescent rolls.  Mix Parmesan cheese with butter; crumble on top.  Bake at 375° for 18 to 25 minutes.

PIZZA CRESCENT BAKE
ingredients
2  (8 oz.) tubes refrigerated crescent rolls
1 1/2  lb. ground beef
1 (15 oz.)  can pizza sauce
1  c. (4 oz.) shredded Cheddar cheese
1  c. (4 oz.) shredded Mozzarella cheese
preparation
	Unroll one tube of crescent dough; place in a lightly greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Press to seal perforations.
	In a skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.  Sprinkle over dough. Top with pizza sauce and sprinkle with cheeses. Unroll remaining crescent dough and place over cheese; seal perforations.	Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 30 minutes or until golden brown.  Yield: 6 to 8 servings.
	Variations can be made to add different meats, cheeses and veggies.

SPAGHETTI AND PIZZA SAUCE
ingredients
12  c. diced tomatoes
1  c. chopped onions
6  - 7 garlic cloves
3  (6 oz.) tins tomato paste
1  large chopped green pepper
1 1/2  Tbsp. oregano (or 3 Tbsp. chopped fresh)
1 1/2  Tbsp. basil (or 3 Tbsp. chopped fresh)
1  bay leaf
9  Tbsp. sugar
2  Tbsp. salt
1/4  tsp. black pepper
1 1/2  tsp. chili powder
preparation
      Combine all ingredients in a large pot and simmer for 1 hour. Put into jars and seal.  Yields 3 quarts.

PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
2  lb. ground chuck
1  green pepper, diced
1  onion, diced
1  qt. Ragu Spaghetti sauce
1  can cream mushroom soup
1 12  oz. box wide noodles
3  c. mozzarella cheese
1  pkg. pepperoni
preparation
      Brown ground chuck, green pepper, and onion together.  Drain off grease.  Mix together spaghetti sauce and mushroom soup, then add meat.  Cook and drain noodles.  Mix with meat mixture and pour in baking dish.  Top with mozzarella cheese and pepperoni.  Bake until brown.  Approximately 30 minutes at 350°.

FRUIT COOKIE PIZZA
ingredients
1  pkg. sugar cookie dough
1  small tub Cool Whip
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
1 small  jar marshmallow cream
preparation
      Mix well together. Spread cream mixture on cookie.  Top with variety of fruit slices, strawberries, grapes, kiwi and banana.

PIZZA LASAGNA
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  box lasagna noodles
1  lb. ground beef
1 (3 lb.)  jar Prego spaghetti sauce with meat
1  tsp. garlic powder
1/2  tsp. oregano
1  (16 oz.) container small curd cottage cheese
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. Mozzarella cheese
  Parmesan cheese
  pepperoni
preparation
	Fry ground beef and drain. Add spaghetti sauce, oregano and garlic powder to ground beef. Simmer. Cook noodles as package directs. Stir in cottage cheese to sauce. In greased baking dish, alternate layers of noodles, sauce and cheese. Place pepperoni on top. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

BURRITO PIZZA
ingredients
2  soft taco shells
1/4  c. refried beans
2  Tbsp. chunky salsa
1/4  c. shredded cheddar cheese
preparation
      Place taco shell on microwave safe plate. Spread with refried beans and salsa. Sprinkle with cheese and top with second tortilla. Microwave on high for 1 1/4 minutes. Cut into wedges. Serve with additional salsa and shredded lettuce, if desired. makes 1 serving. Repeat for each serving.

HOT PIZZA DIP
ingredients
8  oz. softened light cream cheese
1  T. dried Italian seasoning
1  c. shredded mozzarella
1  c. shredded parmesan
8  oz. pizza sauce
1/4  c. chopped green onion tops
preparation
      Combine cream cheese and Italian seasoning.  Spread into the bottom of an 8 inch baking dish.  Sprinkle 1/2 cup mozzarella and 1/2 cup parmesan evenly on top of the cream cheese mixture.  Pour pizza sauce uniformly over the cheeses.  Sprinkle remaining cheeses evenly over pizza sauce.  Top with chopped onion.  Bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees.  Serve with bread sticks.

PIZZA MEATLOAF
ingredients
2  lb. ground round
1  c. cracker crumbs
1 (8 oz.)  jar pizza sauce, divided
1/2  c. onion, chopped
1/4  c. green pepper, chopped
1/2  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1/4  c. shredded mozzarella cheese
2  eggs
1  tsp. seasoned salt
1  tsp. oregano leaves, crushed
1/4  tsp. pepper
  Shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Combine meat, cracker crumbs, 3/4 c. pizza sauce, onion, bell pepper, Parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, eggs and seasonings. Mix lightly.  Press meat mixture into an 8-inch square baking pan. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.  Pour off drippings.  Spread remaining pizza sauce over meat.  Bake 10 minutes longer. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.  Return to oven until cheese begins to melt.  Garnish with green pepper rings.  Serves 8.

MACARONI "N" CHEESE PIZZA
ingredients
8  oz. uncooked elbow macaroni
3  eggs
1  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
1  lb. ground beef
3/4  c. chopped onion
1 (15 oz.)  can pizza sauce
1 (4 oz.)  can mushroom stems, drained
  pepperoni slices
1  c. shredded Mexican cheese blend
preparation
	Cook macaroni according to package directions; drain. In a bowl, beat the eggs; stir in Cheddar cheese and macaroni. Spread onto a 14-inch pizza pan. Bake at 375° for 15 minutes.
	Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is well done; drain. Add pizza sauce and mix well. Spread over macaroni crust. Sprinkle with mushrooms, pepperoni and Mexican cheese. Bake for 15 to 20 more minutes or until cheese is melted. Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes before slicing.
	(NOTE)	I like to use 2 cups of Mexican cheese for more cheesy taste.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
1  roll chocolate chip cookie dough
1 large  jar marshmallow cream
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
  a variety of fruit (strawberries, grapes, kiwi, pineapple, peaches, etc.)
1  bag shredded coconut
preparation
      Spray a pizza pan with Pam and spread the cookie dough out on the pan. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until done. COOL in the refrigerator. Mix marshmallow cream and the cream cheese in a bowl; spread over the cooled cookie. Then top it with the fruit of your choice and then sprinkle shredded coconut over the fruit. Enjoy!!!

FREEZER PIZZA CRUST
ingredients
1 1/3  c. lukewarm water
1  pkg. (Tbsp.) yeast
1  tsp. seasoned pepper
1  tsp. garlic salt
2  Tbsp. oil
1  tsp. Italian seasoning
3 to 4  c. flour
preparation
      Dissolve yeast in water.  Add rest of ingredients.  Let rise 1  hour.  Put in greased pans  and  add  favorite  pizza toppings. Bake at 425° for 20 to 25  minutes.  After  it  has risen  you may freeze in 2 (1  quart)  containers.  Yields  2 pizzas.

FUN PIZZA
ingredients
  bread slices
  shredded cheese
  Mozzarella cheese
  pizza sauce
  choice your own topping
preparation
      Take a slice of bread, spread with 1 tsp of pizza sauce, sprinkle your favorite topping and finish with sprinkling some cheese.  Put it in the toaster oven and let it bake for 5 minutes or until crispy.  To make whole lot at one time put it on pizza pan and bake in the oven until crispy and cheese is melted.

VEGETABLE PIZZA SQUARES
ingredients
2  cans crescent rolls
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
3/4  c. mayonnaise
1  pkg. Ranch dry dressing
3/4  c. following vegetables: cauliflower, broccoli, red onion and fresh mushrooms
  shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
	Press rolls together in a jelly roll pan to make crust. Bake until brown. Mix the cream cheese, mayonnaise and dressing together and spread over cooled crust, forming filling. Sprinkle the raw vegetables over filling and top with the shredded cheese. Cut into squares.

CRUSTY PIZZA DISH
ingredients
2  pkg. refrigerator crescent rolls
1 1/2  lb. ground beef
1  onion, diced
8  oz. pizza sauce
1  tsp. oregano
8  oz. shredded Cheddar cheese
8  oz. shredded Mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Unroll 1 package dough, leaving seams intact.  Press into 13 x 9-inch pan.  Brown ground beef and onion until meat is done. Spread over dough.  Combine sauce, oregano and cheese; spread over meat.
      Cover with crust of remaining roll of dough.  Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.

FRUIT PIZZA
ingredients
1  lb. (1 pkg.) sugar cookie mix
8  oz. cream cheese
1/2  c. sugar
1/2  tsp. vanilla
1/2  c. kiwi, sliced
1/2  c. strawberries, sliced
1/2  c. blueberries, whole
preparation
      Prepare cookie mix according to package directions.  Spread cookie dough 1/8 inch thick on an ungreased pizza pan.
      Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely, about 30 minutes.
      Combine together cream cheese, sugar and vanilla; mixing until well blended.  Spread mixture over crust.  Arrange fruit over cream cheese layer.

EASY PEPPERONI PAN PIZZA
ingredients
1/2  lb. browned drained ground beef
1  small chopped onion
  salt and pepper to taste
1  can refrigerated pizza crust dough
1  jar pizza sauce
3  oz. pepperoni slices
1  c. shredded pizza blend cheese
preparation
      Press dough into a greased 8 inch deep dish pie pan.  Spread pizza sauce over dough.  Mix meats, seasonings, and onion. Sprinkle this mixture over pizza sauce.  Top with cheese and bake for 25 minutes at 375 degrees.  Serve immediately.

PIZZA ROLL-UPS
ingredients
1/2  lb. ground beef
1 (8 oz.)  can tomato sauce
1/2  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
1/2  tsp. dried oregano
2  (8 oz.) tubes refrigerated crescent rolls
preparation
      In a skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain.  Remove from the heat.  Add tomato sauce, Mozzarella cheese and oregano.  Mix well.  Separate crescent dough into eight rectangles, pinching seams together.  Place about 3 tablespoons of meat mixture along one long side of each rectangle.  Roll up, jelly roll style, starting with a long side.  Cut each roll into three pieces.  Place, seam side down, 2-inches apart on greased baking sheets.  Bake at 375° for 15 minutes or until golden brown.  Yield: 2 dozen.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

PIZZA HOT DISH
ingredients
2  lb. hamburger
1  onion, chopped
1  tsp. garlic salt
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. pepper
15 1/2  oz. jar Ragu spaghetti sauce
8  oz. can tomato sauce
1/4  tsp. oregano
8  oz. Cheddar cheese soup
  Mozzarella cheese
  mushrooms
8  oz. noodles
preparation
      Brown the hamburger with the onion. Add the garlic salt, salt and pepper. Drain. Add sauces and oregano. In kettle, cook noodles according to package directions; drain. Then mix in soup. Layer in casserole 1/2 the noodles, 1/2 the meat, remaining noodles and rest of the meat. Cover and bake at 350° for 45 minutes. Remove cover; sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese and bake until cheese melts.

SALAD PIZZA
Crust:
ingredients
1/2  c. butter
1  c. flour
4  eggs
preparation
      Mix 1  cup water with butter in saucepan and bring to a boil. Add  flour, all at once, and stir rapidly until mixture forms a ball.  Remove from heat and cool.  Beat in eggs, 1 at a  time, beating  well after each one.  Spread  in  ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.  Cool.
Topping:
ingredients
4  c. chopped or sliced mixed vegetables (lettuce, onions, broccoli, cauliflower, radishes, carrots, peppers, celery, cucumbers and tomatoes)
1  (8 oz.) cream cheese
1 1/2  c. sour cream or mayonnaise
1  pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix
2  c. shredded cheese
preparation
      Mix cream cheese, sour cream or mayonnaise and dressing mix together well.  Spread  on  top of cooled crust.  Top with mixed vegetables and sprinkle  cheese  on  top  of  all.  May sprinkle crumbled bacon on top of cheese or cream cheese, sour cream mixture.

PIZZA TREATS
ingredients
2  lbs. ground beef
1  lb cheddar cheese - grated
1  tsp. oregano
1/2  tsp salt
2  cans tomato sauce
4  small green onions chopped
3  Tbsp oil
preparation
      Brown ground beef and drain. In bowl mix all other ingredients. Mix in ground beef and put by spoons full on party rye bread and freeze until ready for use.

QUICK AND EASY PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  box fettucine noodles, (cooked and drained)
1  jar spaghetti sauce
1  pkg. sliced pepperoni
1  can sliced mushrooms
  Parmesan cheese (as desired)
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together.  Place into a baking dish with cover.  Top with Mozzarella cheese and bake 20 minutes at moderate heat.   Serve hot.
