FIFTH SUNDAY BREAKFAST PIZZA
ingredients
2 (10 each)  cans flaky biscuits
6  eggs
2  c. shredded cheese (Cheddar or 4 cheese blend)
1  lb. bacon, cooked and crumbled
8  oz. cream cheese
preparation
      Divide flaky biscuits into 2 layers each.  Begin in the middle of a large pizza pan.  Place biscuit layers close together to fill pan. Pat gaps together.  Set aside.  In mixing bowl, beat eggs with softened cream cheese.  Spoon egg mixture over biscuit crust.  Sprinkle cheese over entire pizza.  Top with crumbled bacon.  Bake at 400° for 10 to 15 minutes, until edge is lightly browned and center is set.  Cut into wedges or squares.  Serves 8 as main dish, 12 as appetizer.

EASY PIZZA BROWNIES
ingredients
3/4  c. (1 1/2 sticks) butter or margarine, melted
1 1/2  c. sugar
1 1/2  tsp. vanilla extract
3  eggs
1/2  c. Hershey's cocoa
3/4  c. all-purpose flour
1/2  tsp. baking powder
1/4  tsp. salt
preparation
      Heat oven to 350°.  Grease 12-inch pizza pan or 13 x 9-inch baking pan.  If using a disposable pizza pan, place on cookie sheet to bake.  Use only a spoon to beat melted butter, sugar, vanilla and eggs in large bowl.  Stir in dry ingredients until well blended.  Spread into pan.  Bake 20 to 22 minutes or until top springs back when touched lightly.  Serve plain or sprinkle hot brownie with chocolate or white chips, peanut butter chips, coconut or toffee bits.

GREEK PIZZA
ingredients
1/4  c. olive oil
2  c. chopped onion
3  cloves garlic, minced
3 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
1/2  c. chopped fresh basil
2  Tbsp. chopped fresh oregano
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  tsp. ground black pepper
20  sheets Athenos fillo dough
1/2  c. butter, melted
4  c. (1 lb.) grated Mozzarella cheese
3  medium tomatoes, sliced thin
2  c. crumbled Feta cheese
1  c. bread crumbs
preparation
      In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Saut for 5 minutes. Add spinach and saut until all excess moisture has evaporated. Add basil, oregano, lemon juice and pepper. Mix well. Cool. Place length of fillo across width of buttered 15 x 10 x 1-inch baking dish. Use 10 sheets of fillo dough, brushing every two with melted butter or margarine. Overlap each set of fillo sheets at the center. At the edges of the baking dish, roll fillo onto itself to form "pizza crust." Brush top layer with melted butter or olive oil. Spread spinach mixture on prepared fillo sheets. Top spinach with 1/2 of the Mozzarella. Dredge tomatoes in bread crumbs and arrange on top of Mozzarella. Top with remaining Mozzarella and Feta cheese. Bake in preheated oven at 400° for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown.

PIZZA DIP
ingredients
8  oz. cream cheese
1/2  c. sour cream
1/2  tsp. oregano
1/2  c. pizza sauce
1/8  tsp. crushed red pepper
1/2  c. chopped onion
1/2  c. chopped green pepper
1/2  c. chopped pepperoni
1/2  c. Mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Mix the cream cheese, sour cream, oregano and crushed red pepper.  Spread in bottom of pan.  Cover with pizza sauce. Sprinkle onion, green pepper and pepperoni on top.  Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.  Top with Mozzarella and return to oven.  Remove when cheese has melted.  Serve hot with crackers, bread sticks or garlic bread.

POPOVER PIZZA
ingredients
1  lb. ground beef
1 (15 oz.)  can tomato sauce
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. Mozzarella cheese
1  envelope spaghetti sauce mix
1/2  c. water
preparation
      Brown beef.  Add sauce mix, tomato sauce and water.  Simmer 10 minutes.  Spoon into greased 9 x 13-inch pan.  Top with cheese. Put in 400° oven to keep warm.
Popover Batter:
ingredients
2  large eggs
1  c. milk
1  Tbsp. oil
1  c. flour
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  c. Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Beat eggs, milk and oil.  Add flour and salt and beat until smooth.  Pour over pizza filling.  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake at 400° for 30 minutes.

PIZZA MACARONI BAKE
ingredients
1  pkg. (7 3/4 oz.) macaroni and cheese dinner
6  c. water
1  lb. ground beef
1  medium onion, chopped
1  small green pepper, chopped
1  c. shredded cheddar cheese
1  jar (14 oz.) pizza sauce
1  pkg. (3 1/2 oz.) sliced pepperoni
1  c. shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation
      Set the cheese packet from dinner mix aside. In a saucepan, bring water to boil. Add macaroni; cook for 8-10 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook the beef, onion and green pepper over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. Drain macaroni; stir in the contents of cheese packet. Transfer to a greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Top with beef mixture, pizza sauce and pepperoni and mozzarella cheese. Bake uncovered at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until heated through.

COOL SHRIMP PIZZA
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. refrigerated crescent rolls
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/4  c. dairy sour cream
1 1/2  tsp. snipped fresh dill or 1/2 tsp. dried dill weed
1/2  c. bottled cocktail sauce
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. frozen peeled cooked shrimp, thawed
1/2  c. chopped green sweet pepper
1/3  c. chopped onion
1  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese (4 oz.)
preparation
      Preheat oven to 375°.  Unroll dough and pat dough evenly onto 12-inch greased pizza pan, sealing perforations. Bake for 11 to 13 minutes or until crust is light golden brown. Remove pan from oven. Cool completely on a wire rack.
      Meanwhile in a small bowl, stir together cream cheese, sour cream and dill.  Spread cream cheese mixture on top of cooled crust. Spread the cocktail sauce evenly over cream cheese mixture. Top with shrimp, green pepper, onion and cheese. Cover and chill 2 to 24 hours.

STRAWBERRY PIZZA
Bottom:
ingredients
1  c. flour
1  stick melted butter
2  Tbsp. sugar
1/2  c. chopped nuts (pecans)
preparation
      Mix together and put in bottom of pan.  Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.  Let cool.
Second Layer:
ingredients
8  oz. cream cheese
1/2  c. powdered sugar
8  oz. Cool Whip
preparation
      Mix together and spread on crust.
Top (Red Filling):
ingredients
1  c. sugar
1  c. cold water
3  Tbsp. strawberry jello
3  Tbsp. cornstarch
preparation
      Mix and cook until thick.  Once mixture cools, add strawberries.

FRUIT PIZZA
(The Best)  
Crust:
ingredients
3/4  c. butter
1/2  c. powdered sugar
1 1/2  c. flour
preparation
      Mix ingredients until crumbly. Pat into 12-inch round pizza pan. Bake at 350° for 10 to 15 minutes. Cool.
Filling:
ingredients
8  oz. cream cheese
1/3  c. sugar
1  tsp. vanilla or almond flavoring
1  c. water or liquid from canned fruit
2  Tbsp. cornstarch
1/2  c. sugar
1  tsp. lemon juice
preparation
      Mix in saucepan. Stir over medium heat until it thickens and cool before spooning over fruit. Make sure to cover each piece of fruit with the sauce. Refrigerate and serve as pie slices.

VEGETABLE PIZZA
ingredients
2  pkg Crescent rolls
2 8  oz. pkg Cream Cheese
1  cup Mayonnaise
1  tsp Dill Weed
1  tsp Onion Salt
  Chopped:  Broccoli, Celery, Onion, Tomato, Cauliflower, Red/Green Peppers, Green/Black Olives
preparation
      Pat Crescent rolls in greased jelly roll pan, bake at 350 degrees until lightly browned.  Mix together Cream cheese, Mayonnaise, Dill Weed and Onion Salt and spread onto cooled crust. Cover with Chopped vegetables and cut into small squares.

PIZZA GRILLED CHEESE
ingredients
1  Tbsp. butter or margarine, softened
2  slices bread
1  slice Provolone or Mozzarella cheese
6  slices pepperoni
3  Tbsp. pizza sauce
preparation
      Butter one side of each slice of bread. Place one slice in skillet, butter side down. Top with the cheese, pepperoni, pizza sauce and second bread slice, butter side up. Cook over medium heat until golden brown, turning once. Serve with additional pizza sauce if desired. YIELD: 1 serving.

ANNIE'S PIZZA BITES
ingredients
2  pkgs. refrigerated pizza crust dough
4  oz. pizza sauce
1/2  c. chopped pepperoni
1  c. shredded pizza blend cheese
preparation
      On a 9 by 13-inch cookie sheet, roll out 1 can pizza dough to edges of cookie sheet.  Spread pizza sauce evenly over crust leaving 1/2-inch space around the edges of the crust.  Sprinkle pepperoni and cheese evenly over sauce.  Roll out remaining can of dough into a 9 by 13-inch rectangle.  Carefully place this on top. With a pizza cutter, score into 16 rectangles.  Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes.  Serve warm.

PIZZA CASSEROLE
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. ground beef
1  pkg. pepperoni
1  large onion
7  oz. elbow macaroni
1 large  jar spaghetti sauce
1  can mushrooms (optional)
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. Mozzarella cheese (for top)
  salt
  pepper (I use white pepper)
preparation
      Cook macaroni until tender; drain liquid off. Brown ground beef; season with salt, pepper and onions. Drain fat. Mix all other ingredients together, except cheese. Pour into 9 x 13 baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese to edge. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Serve with salad and bread sticks for a complete meal.

HOT PIZZA DIP
ingredients
1 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1  tsp. Italian seasoning
1  c. (4 oz.) shredded Mozzarella cheese
3/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1 (8 oz.)  can pizza sauce
2  Tbsp. green onion, chopped
2  Tbsp. thinly sliced green pepper
preparation
      In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and Italian seasoning. Spread in an ungreased 9-inch microwave-safe pie plate. Combine Mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses. Sprinkle half over cream cheese. Top with the pizza sauce, remaining cheese mixture, green pepper and onion. Microwave on High for 3 to 4 minutes, uncovered, or until the cheese is almost melted. (Rotate a half turn several times.) Let stand for 1 to 2 minutes. Yields about 3 cups. Serve with tortilla chips or breadsticks.

LITTLE PIZZAS
ingredients
1  lb. Italian sausage links
1  c. onion, chopped
1  Tbsp. oregano, dried
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
  dash of black pepper
2  loaves (8 oz.) sourdough or party rye bread
1  lb. hot bulk sausage
1/2  green pepper, chopped
1  Tbsp. fennel seed
1/2  tsp. salt
1  lb. box American cheese
preparation
      Use heavy-duty large pan. Crumble Italian sausage, after taking casing off sausage, into a skillet. Add bulk sausage. Stir and cook on medium heat until well mixed. Then add all the other ingredients. Turn heat down to low. Cook until all the cheese is melted and all the ingredients are well done.  When done, use a tablespoon to cover slices of bread. Place on a cookie sheet and freeze. When frozen, place in freezer bags. Take out of the freezer when ready to bake.
      To bake, preheat oven to 400°. Place bread slices on lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake 6 to 8 minutes, until well heated.

HALLOWEEN COOKIE PIZZA
Pizza:
ingredients
3/4  c. packed brown sugar
1/2  c. margarine
1  egg
1  Tbsp. water
1  tsp. vanilla
1 1/4  c. flour
1/2  tsp. baking soda
1/4  tsp. salt
1  c. peanut butter chips
1  c. mini-marshmallows
1/2  c. semi-sweet chocolate chips
1/2  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°. Lightly grease a 12 inch pizza pan. In a large mixer bowl, beat sugar and margarine until creamy. Add egg, water and vanilla. Beat well. In a separate bowl, stir together flour, soda and salt. Add to sugar mixture, beating on low until blended. Stir in peanut butter chips. Spread batter in prepared pan to within 1/2 inch of edge. Bake 11 to 13 minutes or until set. Remove from oven. Sprinkle marshmallows, chocolate chips and nuts over top. Return to oven. Bake 5 to 7 minutes or until marshmallows are lightly browned. Cool completely.
Chocolate Drizzle:
ingredients
1/4  c. semi-sweet chocolate chips
2 or 3  tsp. margarine
preparation
      Melt together. Drizzle over top of cooled pizza.
Orange Drizzle:
ingredients
1/2  c. powdered sugar
1  Tbsp. water
3  drops yellow food coloring
2  drops red food coloring
preparation
      Blend together and drizzle over chocolate drizzle. Let stand a minute to let drizzles set.

BREAKFAST PIZZA
ingredients
1  can crescent rolls
  sausage
1  c. Mozzarella cheese
1  c. Cheddar cheese
6  eggs
1/2  c. milk
preparation
      Spread rolls on cookie sheet and bake for 5 minutes.  Brown sausage and sprinkle on top.  Sprinkle cheese on top of sausage. Mix 6 eggs and milk.  Pour slowly on top.  Bake at 325° for about 30 minutes or until done.

MINIATURE PIZZA
ingredients
1  lb. sharp Cheddar cheese
1  small onion, chopped
1  small bell pepper, chopped
8  strips bacon, fried and crumbled
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together with a small amount of mayonnaise to make a spread. Spread on party rye or pumpernickel. Cook in 300° oven for approximately 10 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve warm.

CHEDDAR APPLE PIZZA
ingredients
  pastry for single crust pie
4 large tart apples, peeled and cut into 1/4-inch  slices (about 5 c.)
1/2  c. shredded Cheddar, Mozzarella or Swiss cheese
1/2  c. packed brown sugar
1/2  c. chopped walnuts
1/2  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/2  tsp. ground nutmeg
2  Tbsp. cold water
preparation
      Roll pastry to fit a greased 12-inch pizza pan. Flute edges. Bake at 400° for 10 minutes. Arrange apples in single layer. Sprinkle with cheese. Combine the brown sugar, walnuts, cinnamon and nutmeg. Sprinkle over cheese. Cut butter into small pieces and dot top of pizza. Bake for 20 minutes or until apples are tender. Cut into wedges. Serve warm. Yield: 12 servings.

TAFFY APPLE PIZZA
ingredients
1  pkg. refrigerated sugar cookie dough
8  oz. softened light cream cheese
1/2  c. brown sugar
1/4  c. reduced fat creamy peanut butter
2  peeled, cored, & sliced Granny Smith apples
1/4  c. caramel ice cream topping
1/2  c. chopped peanuts
preparation
      On a well greased 15-inch pizza pan, press out cookie dough into a 14-inch circle.  Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Combine cream cheese, peanut butter, and sugar.  Spread this mixture evenly over cooled cookie.  Arrange apple slices over this mixture.  Uniformly sprinkle on chopped peanuts and drizzle with caramel topping.  Slice and serve with vanilla ice cream or cool whip.

UNCLE  THANKSGIVING DRESSING
ingredients
3/4  loaf of bread--Mom uses seasoned bread crumbs
2  large onions, diced fine
2  green peppers, diced fine
2  stalks celery, diced fine
  medium jar stuffed olives, diced fine--Mom uses salad olives
preparation
      Fry onion, celery, peppers and olives in a liberal amount of shortening--Mom uses butter--until celery is rather soft.  Season with salt and pepper.  Crumble bread and pour drippings from the bird on bread.  Mom uses chicken bouillon cubes.  Add mixture and mix.  Moisten well and season to taste.  Place in oven in greased baking dish 'till browned.  350 degrees about 45 minutes to an hour.

THANKSGIVING YAMS
ingredients
3  c. mashed yams
1/3  c. milk
1  tsp. vanilla
1/3  c. Kahlua or Amaretto or a mix of the 2
1  tsp. orange juice
3/4  c. sugar
1/3  c. butter
1  tsp. cinnamon (more if you like)
1  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Mix all ingredients in a casserole dish.
Topping:
ingredients
1/3  c. flour
1  c. chopped pecans
1/3  c. margarine
1  c. brown sugar
preparation
      Combine ingredients in a separate bowl. Sprinkle topping on top of yams. Bake 30 minutes at 350°.

THANKSGIVING DINNER
ingredients
1  car (or some mode of transportation)
1  tank of gas (depends on distance to drive)
1  pocket of money (for gas, depends on second ingredient)
1  empty stomach (or 2 if you bring your spouse and more if you bring the children)
1  safe trip to your mother's house
preparation
      Depending on how far you have to drive (pack clothes for an overnight trip) get up early on Thanksgiving Day and go to your mother's house.
      If traveling a long distance use plenty of second and third ingredients.  Upon arriving at your destination, prepare your nostrils for some luscious mouth-watering smells. Help your mother prepare a wonderful dinner (or stay out of the way).  Sit down at the table, say grace, and enjoy, enjoy, enjoy.  To help make the dinner more enjoyable (especially to your mother) wash the dishes.

THANKSGIVING CASSEROLE
ingredients
1  pkg. Pepperidge Farm cornbread dressing
1  stick oleo
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1  can cream of chicken soup
4  large chicken breasts
  medium onion, chopped fine
  sage to taste (I use 1 level tsp.)
preparation
      Stew chicken (slightly salted) until done.   Remove meat from bones and set aside after cutting into medium size pieces.    Melt margarine and add onion and sage.   Stir into dressing.   In a large, greased casserole, begin with a layer of dressing crumbs. Add a layer of chicken, then a can of mushroom soup diluted with 3/4 can of reserved chicken broth.  Again, a layer of crumbs and chicken, then cream of chicken soup diluted with 3/4 can of reserved chicken broth.    Top with crumbs and bake at 350° until done.

THANKSGIVING PIE
ingredients
1  measure of health, past or present
1  measure of family
1  measure of friends
1  ray of Sonlight (not sunlight)
1  whisper of hope
1  heartful of God's peace
preparation
      Crust:  Take one measure of thankfulness and thoroughly sift out all lumps of sin and selfishness with a Calvary sieve.*  Add one heaping measure of patience and moisten with the water of God's Word until dough is pliable enough to stretch without tearing.  Fit into heart-shaped container and bake at highest heat until very firm.  Then fill with the following:
      Filling:  Combine seven measure of God's mercy with one heartful of God's love.  Blend in one full individual realization of unqualified grace, and stir well.  Then fold in the following ingredients, one at a time, alternating each addition with a generous measure of praise.
      After all ingredients are combined, pour into prepared crust. Allow to settle and smooth out; top with a meringue of pure joy. Reheat until piping hot** and serve to the Lord.
      *If in doubt as to ingredients, equipment or procedures, consult the Master Cookbook at once.
      **This recipe will be unpalatable if served lukewarm!  All ingredients must be imported from God's Kingdom -- do not substitute.  The mixture will be sweet, and no additional sweeteners are necessary!

THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY APPLE SALAD
ingredients
4  c. fresh cranberries
2  tsp. grated orange rind
1  c. sugar
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. lemon jello
2  c. boiling water
1  c. cold water
1  c. finely diced celery
2  apples, diced
preparation
      Wash and grind the raw cranberries and combine with orange rind and sugar.  Let stand 30 minutes.
      Meanwhile, dissolve gelatin in the boiling water.  Add the cold water and chill until slightly congealed and syrupy.  Add the cranberries, celery and apple.  Turn into a mold that has been rinsed in cold water.  Chill.  Makes 12 servings.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

A THANKFUL THANKSGIVING
ingredients
  One day full of gathering together and sharing conversation
  A bunch of family and friends
  A household of happiness
  A handful of good memories
  Three tons of love and kindness
  Three hours of eating and sharing food
preparation
      Start with a houseful of happiness.  Add a bunch of family and friends.  Next include three hours of eating and sharing food. Throw in three tons of love and kindness.  Mix together with a day full of gathering and sharing conversation.  Leave with one handful of good memories.  Makes one Thankful Thanksgiving.
      By Mrs. Hamilton's Fifth Grade, November '93.

THANKSGIVING CHOWDER
ingredients
8  slices bacon, fried until crisp
1/4  c. bacon grease
2  c. chopped onions
4  c. chopped potatoes
1/2  c. chopped celery
2  c. turkey broth
1/2  tsp. salt
4  c. turkey, cooked and cut up
1  can whole kernel corn
1  can cream-style corn
1  pt. half and half
  dash of coarsely ground pepper
preparation
      Fry bacon.  Drain and reserve.  Saute until tender the onions in bacon grease.  Then add potatoes, celery, turkey broth and salt. Simmer, covered, until potatoes and celery are tender.  Add turkey, whole kernel corn, cream-style corn, half and half and ground pepper.  Heat thoroughly.
      When serving, crumble the bacon on top and sprinkle with a little parsley.  Makes 6 to 8 servings.

EASY THANKSGIVING DRESSING
ingredients
1/4  c. butter or margarine
1  c. onions, chopped
1  c. celery, chopped
2  cans chicken broth
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. seasoned croutons
2  c. apples, chopped
1  c. toasted pecans
preparation
      Saute onions and celery in butter or margarine.  Add chicken broth and bring to a boil.  Toss in croutons, apples and pecans. Put in greased 12 x 8-inch pan.  Bake at 375° for 20 to 30 minutes.

YUMMY YAMS - THANKSGIVING
ingredients
3  c. mashed sweet potatoes
1  c. granulated sugar
1  tsp. vanilla
1/2  c. melted butter
2  eggs, beaten
1  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. flour
1  c. chopped walnuts
1/2  c. butter
preparation
      Mix first 5 ingredients together.  Top with a mixture of the last 4 ingredients.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.  You can put a layer of marshmallows on top for the last 5 minutes of cooking.

THANKSGIVING ONION PIE
ingredients
4  onions
1  Tbsp. butter
4  slices bread
1/2  c. Parmesan cheese
2  eggs
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  c. milk
preparation
      Slice onions and saute in butter. Toast bread and butter, if desired.  Cut toast into 1-inch cubes.  Layer in 1 1/2-quart casserole pan. Spread onions on top of bread cubes. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over onions.  Beat eggs.  Add pepper and milk. Pour this mixture over top of ingredients.  Cover and chill 6 hours.  Bake, uncovered, at 350° about 30 minutes.

JUDY'S THANKSGIVING POTATOES
ingredients
1 (2 lb.)  pkg. frozen hash browns, thawed
2  c. sour cream
1  can cream of chicken soup
2  c. grated cheese (Colby or Cheddar)
1  can potato soup
1  tsp. salt
1/2  c. melted butter
  pepper to taste
1/2  c. Parmesan cheese
  milk
preparation
      Combine and place in a greased 9 x 13-inch casserole dish. Bake 1 hour at 350°.

THANKSGIVING CIDER
ingredients
2  qt. chilled cranberry juice
1  can frozen pink lemonade concentrate
1  qt. ginger ale
preparation
      Empty the cranberry juice into a punch bowl.  Stir in the frozen lemonade until melted.  When you are ready to serve, pour in the ginger ale.

THANKSGIVING PIE
ingredients
1  c. sugar
1/2  c. butter
2  eggs
1  tsp. vinegar
1  tsp. vanilla
1/2  c. coconut
1/2  c. pecans
1/2  c. raisins
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  Put into a frozen pie crust.  Bake at 325° for 30 minutes.

THANKSGIVING PUDDING
ingredients
1 1/2  c. grape juice
8  eggs
1 1/2  c. sugar
1 large  box vanilla wafers
1 medium  bottle cherries
1  c. pecans
2  Tbsp. unflavored gelatin, dissolved in 1 c. warm water
preparation
      Heat grape juice to boiling point; add gelatin and stir.  Add egg yolks which have been creamed with sugar.  Have egg whites beaten stiff; add to grape juice mixture and blend thoroughly. Remove from stove.  In large bowl, alternate layers of wafers, cherries and nuts until all are used.  Pour grape juice mixture over this and place in refrigerator to set.  Serve with whipped cream.  Makes a large amount.

THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. raw cranberries, ground
2  oranges, ground
1 small  can crushed pineapple
1  c. sugar
2 (3 oz.)  pkg. raspberry Jell-O
2  c. boiling water
1  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Dissolve  Jell-O  in  boiling water.  Mix pineapple and sugar together and add to Jell-O.  Put into refrigerator until slightly jelled.  Add oranges, cranberries and nuts.  Put into a mold for a beautiful congealed salad.

TENNEFOS FAMILY THANKSGIVING FRUIT COCKTAIL
ingredients
10  to 15 oranges
5  grapefruit
1  bunch red grapes (seedless)
1  bunch green grapes (seedless)
  unsweetened orange juice
1 (8 oz.) small  jar maraschino cherries
preparation
      Peel, section and de-membrane oranges and grapefruit.  Wash and separate grapes.  Cut cherries in half, reserving the juice.  Mix fruit in large bowl.  Cover with orange juice and add maraschino cherry juice.

THANKSGIVING PIE
ingredients
1  c. good thoughts
1  c. kind deeds
4  c. consideration for others
2  c. sacrifice for others
3  c. forgiveness
2  c. well beaten faults
preparation
      Hugging is healthy; it helps our body's immune system, it keeps you healthier, it cures depression, reduces stress and induces sleep.  It's invigorating and rejuvinating.  It has no unpleasant side effects and hugging is nothing less than a miracle drug. Hugging is all natural.  It is organic, naturally sweet.  It has no pesticides, no preservatives and no artificial ingredients.  And it is 100% wholesome.  Hugging is practical.

THANKSGIVING SAUSAGE DRESSING
ingredients
1  lb. pork sausage
2  medium onions, diced
4  stalks celery, diced
5  c. cornbread crumbs
3  c. white bread cubes, toasted
2  tsp. rubbed sage
1/4  tsp. pepper
2 to 3 1/2  c. chicken or turkey broth
2  eggs, beaten
preparation
      Cook sausage, onions and diced celery in a skillet over medium heat until sausage is brown.  Drain.  Add remaining ingredients; stir well.  Spoon into a 9 x 13-inch greased baking dish.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.  Yield: 8 to 10 servings.
      A great holiday dish!

THANKSGIVING HOT DISH
ingredients
2  lb. hamburger
3  stalks celery
1  box croutons
2  cans cream of chicken soup
1  c. water
1  onion
1  can cream of celery soup
preparation
      Put raw hamburger in 9 x 13-inch pan, pat down slightly.  Boil until tender 1 cup water, celery and onion.  Pour this over 1 box croutons and add celery soup and 2 cans chicken soup.  Pour this all over hamburger and bake 1 hour at 350°.  Let stand 15 minutes. Cut into squares and serve.

THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY COBBLER
ingredients
2 (16 oz. each)  cans sliced peaches in light syrup, drained
1 (16 oz.)  can whole berry cranberry sauce
1  pkg. Duncan Hines bakery style cinnamon swirl muffin mix
1/2  c. chopped pecans
1/3  c. butter or margarine, melted
  whipped topping or ice cream
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.    Cut peach slices in half lengthwise. Combine peach slices and cranberry sauce in ungreased 9-inch square pan.  Knead swirl packet from mix for 10 seconds.   Cut off one end of packet.   Squeeze contents evenly over fruit.
      Combine muffin mix, topping packet from mix and pecans in large bowl.  Add melted butter.  Stir until thoroughly blended (mixture will be crumbly).  Sprinkle crumbs over fruit.  Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until lightly browned and bubbly.  Serve warm with whipped topping or ice cream.

THANKSGIVING CASSEROLE
ingredients
4  large chicken breasts
1  pkg. Pepperidge Farm cornbread dressing
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1  can cream of chicken soup
1  stick margarine
preparation
      Stew the chicken until done (do not saute).  Remove meat from bones; set aside.  Reserve the broth.  Melt the margarine; stir into the dressing.  In a greased casserole dish, begin with a layer of dressing, then a layer of chicken.  Next, layer the mushroom soup, diluted with one can of reserved chicken broth, a layer of dressing, then the rest of the chicken.  Add a can of cream of chicken soup, diluted with one can of reserved broth. Top with the remainder of dressing.  Bake at 350° until brown (approximately 30 to 40 minutes).

THANKSGIVING BROWN SUGAR BROWNIES
ingredients
2/3  c. butter, melted
2  c. packed brown sugar
3  eggs
1  c. flour
1  tsp. vanilla
2  c. nuts
preparation
      Melt butter, then add brown sugar.  Add eggs, flour, vanilla and nuts.  Mix and put mixture into oblong pan.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.  Remove and let partially cool.  Cut into squares.

THANKSGIVING TURKEY COOKIES
ingredients
  chocolate stars
  chocolate covered cherries
  candy corn
  fudge stripe round cookies
  chocolate frosting
preparation
      For each turkey you will need 2 chocolate stars for the feet, 1 chocolate covered cherry or candy of similar size and shape for the body, 2 candy corn for the head and 1 cookie for the tail feathers.
      With frosting , "glue" the body to the feet.  The body is the chocolate cherry on its side.  Glue the fudge stripe to the bottom of the chocolate cherry so the fudge stripe is upright. Glue the corn to the body so one is on top pointing forward and one is on the front pointing down.

THANKSGIVING APPLESAUCE CAKE
ingredients
3  c. applesauce
3/4  c. shortening
3  eggs
2  c. sugar
3 1/2  c. flour (plain)
2  tsp. soda
1  tsp. salt
4  tsp. cinnamon
1  tsp. nutmeg
3/4  tsp. cloves
1  c. chopped nuts
1  lb. raisins
1  lb. orange slices, cut into 1/8-inch pieces (candy)
preparation
      Cream shortening, sugar and eggs until light and fluffy.  Sift all dry ingredients together.  Add to cream mixture alternately with applesauce.  Add nuts, raisins and orange slices.  Bake 1 1/2 hours in a 350° oven in a greased, paper-lined tube pan.

A TASTE OF THANKSGIVING
ingredients
16  oz. frozen egg noodles
2  c. cooked turkey, diced
2  oz. pimento, chopped
10  oz. pkg. frozen peas and carrots
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1/2  c. milk
1  c. water
3  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
preparation
      Cook noodles in boiling water for 20 minutes.  Drain.  Combine noodles, turkey, pimento and peas and carrots in large mixing bowl.  In saucepan, combine soup, milk, water and cheese.  Heat to boiling point, stirring frequently to prevent scorching.  Pour cheese sauce over other ingredients and mix.  Place entire noodle mixture into 9 x 13-inch baking dish.  Bake at 375° for 30 minutes.  Makes 8 servings.

THANKSGIVING DINNER IN A DISH
ingredients
6  c. seasoned bread cubes
2  Tbsp. oleo, melted
2  c. chicken broth
3  c. cooked chicken
1/2  c. chopped onion
1/4  c. chives
1/2  c. celery
1/2  c. mayonnaise
3/4  tsp. salt
2  eggs
1 1/2  c. milk
1  can cream of mushroom soup (10 3/4 oz.)
1/2  c. grated cheese
preparation
      In medium bowl, mix bread cubes, oleo and 1 1/4 cups broth. In another bowl, mix chicken, 3/4 cup broth, chives, onion, celery, salt and mayonnaise.  Spread 1/2 of bread mixture in greased 9 x 13-inch baking dish.  Spread chicken mixture on top and top this with rest of bread mixture.  Whisk eggs, milk and soup in bowl and pour over casserole.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.

DAY AFTER THANKSGIVING TURKEY SOUP
ingredients
3  Tbsp. butter
1  onion, chopped
1  clove garlic, minced
1  carrot, sliced
1  celery stalk, sliced
2 or more  c. leftover cooked turkey, diced
6  c. turkey stock or chicken broth (homemade or canned)
1/2  tsp. white pepper
3  Tbsp. chopped parsley
1  potato, cubed
  salt to taste
1  c. heavy sweet cream
preparation
      Heat butter in a skillet and saute onion and garlic until onion is translucent.  Transfer contents of the skillet into a slow cooker.  Add all other ingredients except the cream.  Cover, turn on low and cook for about 6 hours or until the vegetables are tender.  Stir in heavy cream and heat thoroughly before serving. Serves 8.

THANKSGIVING DAY SALAD
(Make The Day Before)  
ingredients
2  c. water
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. raspberry-flavored gelatin
2 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen sliced strawberries, thawed
1 (16 oz.)  can whole cranberry sauce
1/2  c. pecan pieces
  lettuce leaves
preparation
      Bring water to a boil in a saucepan over  high heat.  Pour over the gelatin in a mixing bowl.  Stir to dissolve the gelatin. Add the strawberries and cranberry sauce, stirring to break up the sauce.  Stir in the nuts.  Pour into a pretty 2-quart ring mold.  Refrigerate overnight.
      Before Thanksgiving dinner, unmold the salad on a large platter.  (To help unmold the salad, run a knife around the edge of the mold.   Dip the mold into warm water for a few seconds, being careful not to get water on the salad.  Place serving platter over the top and turn over, holding both together.) Surround with lettuce leaves.  Refrigerate and prepare the topping.
Topping:
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1  c. dairy sour cream
1/3  c. sugar
1  Tbsp. fresh lemon juice
preparation
      Combine cream cheese, sour cream, sugar and lemon juice in a small bowl.  Beat with an electric mixer until well blended. Spoon into a serving bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate until ready to serve.  Makes 10 servings.

THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1  lb. cranberries
1 small  can crushed pineapple, drained
3/4  c. cane sugar
2  c. whipping cream or 8 oz. Cool Whip
3/4  c. chopped pecans
preparation
      Grind cranberries fine.  Add pineapple and sugar.  Stir well. Let stand in refrigerator overnight (covered).  Two hours before serving, whip cream.  Add nuts.  Place in a serving bowl and chill.

THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1 large  box cherry or raspberry jello
1  jar cran-orange sauce
1  c. chopped celery
1  c. walnuts, chopped
2  c. sour cream
preparation
      Make jello, less 1 cup water called for.  Chill for 15 minutes.  Stir in cran-orange sauce.  Chill 30 minutes.  Stir in celery and walnuts.  Pour 1/2 of jello mix into a bowl; spread with sour cream.  Spoon remaining jello over the top.  Chill overnight.

THANKSGIVING APPLE SALAD
(Serves 8)  
ingredients
3/4  c. sugar
1/3  c. all-purpose flour
1  c. heavy cream
1 (20 oz.)  can crushed pineapple, drained
1/4  c. (1/2 stick) butter
3  to 4 large red apples, diced
1  c. chopped nuts
1/2  c. halved maraschino cherries
preparation
      Stir together the sugar and flour. Whisk in the cream. Pour the cream mixture into a heavy non-aluminum saucepan. Continue mixing. Add the pineapple and cook over medium heat, whisking constantly, until the mixture thickens. Add the butter; remove the pan from the heat and let the mixture cool. When cooled, add the apples, nuts and cherries and mix well. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

THANKSGIVING DAY SALAD
ingredients
1 1/2  c. water
2 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen strawberries, thawed
1/2  c. pecan pieces
1  (6 oz.) raspberry jello
1 (16 oz.)  can whole cranberry sauce
preparation
      Dissolve jello in boiling water.  Add strawberries and cranberry sauce.  Stir in nuts.  Pour in mold.  Refrigerate. Serve on lettuce leaves.
Salad Topping:
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/2  c. marshmallow cream
1  c. sour cream
1  Tbsp. fresh lemon juice
preparation
      Combine in bowl.  Beat with electric mixer until well blended. Refrigerate.

SOUTHERN CORNBREAD THANKSGIVING STUFFING
ingredients
  Cornbread (recipe follows)
7  slices oven-dried white bread
1  sleeve saltine crackers
2  c. celery, chopped
1  large onion, chopped
8  Tbsp. butter
7  c. chicken stock
1  tsp. salt
  freshly ground black pepper
1  tsp. sage (optional)
1  Tbsp. poultry seasoning (optional)
5  eggs, beaten
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.  In a large bowl, combine crumbled cornbread, dried white bread slices and saltines; mix together and set aside.  In a large skillet, saut the chopped celery and onion in butter until transparent, approximately 5 to 10 minutes.  Pour sautéd mixture over cornbread mixture.  Add the stock.  Mix well; taste and add salt, pepper to taste, sage and poultry seasoning. Mix well.  Add beaten eggs and mix well.  Reserve 2 heaping tablespoons of this mixture for the giblet gravy.  Pour mixture into a greased pan and bake until dressing is done, about 45 minutes.  Serve with turkey as a side dish.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

GRANNY'S THANKSGIVING DRESSING
ingredients
4  c. cornbread
2  c. white bread
4 1/2  c. chicken broth
1  c. chopped celery
1/2  c. chopped onion
2  boiled eggs
1/2  Tbsp. sage
preparation
      Mix all ingredients.  Be sure to brown onion and celery first. Put in a greased pan.  Bake at 375° for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

THANKSGIVING STUFFING
ingredients
2  c. chopped baking apples
1 1/2  c. (5 oz.) natural sliced almonds
3/4  c. chopped onions
3/4  c. chopped celery
4  Tbsp. butter
1/2  tsp. poultry seasoning
1  tsp. cinnamon
1/4  tsp. salt
6  c. cubed bread (dry)
1  egg, lightly beaten
1/3 to 1/2  c. apple cider or juice
preparation
      Add barbecue sauce to leftover meats and serve as sandwiches.
      Turkey, ham, chicken and pork roast can be added to your favorite pasta salad.
      Make a gravy with bouillon, add cut up vegetables and meat. Thicken and serve over rice. You can also get stir-fry vegetables and be daring to try your own combinations.
      If the meat has been in the fridge too long, give it to the dog.

THANKSGIVING DINNER
ingredients
1  car (or any other mode of transportation)
1  tank of gas (depending on distance of travel)
1  empty stomach (or more depending on how many in your family)
1  safe trip to destination
preparation
      Get up early on Thanksgiving Day and travel to the location of the dinner.  (If the visit requires an overnight stay, be sure to pack.)  Upon arriving at your destination, be prepared for luscious, mouth-watering smells.  Help with any preparations or stay out of the way.   Sit down at the table, say grace and enjoy, enjoy, enjoy! It is always a good idea to help with the clean up!

THANKSGIVING PILGRIM PUNCH
ingredients
3  c. cranberry juice
2  c. orange juice
3  c. ginger ale
3  scoops orange sherbet
preparation
      Stir juices and ginger ale; add sherbet.  (Should be easiest recipe in book!)

THANKSGIVING STUFFING
ingredients
1  lb. pork sausage (Bob Evans mild)
1  c. chopped celery
1/2  c. chopped onion
1/4  lb. (1 stick) butter
1  loaf white bread, cubed and dried
1/4  loaf whole wheat, cubed and dried
2  eggs
  milk to moisten
  poultry seasoning
1  can mushrooms, stems and pieces
preparation
      Fry sausage. Pour off grease, drain on paper towels.  Place in frying pan butter, celery and onion and fry until celery is soft. Pour over breadcrumbs.  Add sausage.  Mix together milk and eggs. Pour over crumbs and add poultry seasoning, to taste.  Add mushroom pieces chopped fine.  Stuff turkey and enjoy.

THANKSGIVING APPLE CAKE
ingredients
3  eggs
1 1/2  c. oil
2  c. sugar
3  c. flour
1/4  c. milk
1  tsp. cinnamon
1  tsp. soda
1  tsp. salt
2  tsp. vanilla
3  c. chopped apples
1  c. chopped pecans
preparation
	Combine  all ingredients in order; spread evenly in 9 x 13-inch greased pan.  Bake 1 hour at 350°.
Topping:
ingredients
1  stick butter
1/4  c. milk
1  c. brown sugar
preparation
	Bring to boil; cook 2 1/2 minutes. Spread on warm cake.

THANKSGIVING DINNER CASSEROLE
ingredients
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. Pepperidge Farm dressing pkg.
2  sticks butter, melted
2  c. chicken broth
3  c. diced chicken or turkey
1  c. onion, chopped
1  c. celery, chopped
1  c. mayo
4  eggs, slightly beaten
3  c. milk
2  cans mushroom soup
  grated cheese
preparation
      Mix and divide Pepperidge Farm dressing, butter and chicken broth.  Put half in bottom of baking pan.
      Mix chicken or turkey, onion, celery and mayo thoroughly and spread over dressing in pan.
      Beat eggs slightly with milk.  Pour over contents.  Cover top with other half of bread stuffing.  Cover with Saran Wrap and leave in refrigerator overnight.  Take out 1 hour before baking. Spread mushroom soup over top.  Bake uncovered at 325° for 40 minutes.   Spread grated cheese over top and return to oven for 10 minutes.  Will serve 24 or more.
      Recipe can be easily cut in half.  Use two fryer broiler chickens, approximately 3 pounds each for 6 cups chicken.  Bake chicken before adding to casserole.  Turkey can be substituted.

THANKSGIVING DINNER RICE
ingredients
1  pkg. Uncle Ben's long grain and wild rice plus 3/4 c.  regular long grain rice
1 1/2  c. water
1  tsp. salt
1/2  c. parsley flakes
1 small  can mushrooms, chopped
1  medium chopped onion
1/2  c. chopped celery
3/4  c. chopped walnuts or whatever (sunflower seeds)
preparation
      Prepare rice however is says on package, plus 1 1/2 cups of water.  Saute the onion and celery in 2 tablespoons of oil until transparent.  Add mushrooms, parsley and nuts; saute 1 to 2 minutes.  Add this to rice and water.  Cook until all water is absorbed (approximately 20 to 30 minutes).

THANKSGIVING TURKEY GRAVY
ingredients
4  c. chicken broth
4  c. water
2  carrots, halved
2  to 3 celery stalks, halved
1  large onion, quartered
  turkey neck and giblets
  turkey drippings
2  c. flour
1  c. butter, chilled
  salt and pepper
  sage, thyme and poultry seasoning
preparation
      Combine first 6 listed ingredients and bring to boil.  Reduce heat and cover, then simmer 1 hour.  Cool a little, then strain, keeping liquid, neck and giblets.  Discard vegies.  (At this point you may freeze liquid and neck separately for up to 1 week.)  Cut butter into flour and make four balls; put into freezer.  Thaw liquid and neck day of dinner; add in salt, pepper and herbs to taste.  Adding neck, giblets and drippings to liquid, bring to boil, then reduce to medium heat.  Remove flour and butter balls from freezer.  Place one at a time, in center of wire whisk.  Stir whisk with ball into the liquid until dissolved.  Repeat with each ball until desired thickness is achieved.  Bring to low boil for 3 minutes to remove any flour taste.

THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY RELISH CUPS
ingredients
4  c. cranberries
2  c. sugar
2  oranges
1  lemon
preparation
	Wash  cranberries.  Select  large  thin skinned oranges and lemon.  Wash  and  cut  in	pieces,  then put through food chopper,  skins  and all together with cranberries.  Add sugar and mix  well.	Chill.	Let  stand  at	least  24 hours before serving.  Serve in orange cups.
	To  make orange cups, cut small oranges in half.  Scoop out pulp and flute edges of shells with scissors.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

THANKSGIVING SALAD
ingredients
1  pkg. lemon gelatin
1  c. hot water
1  pkg. cream cheese
1/2  c. crushed pineapple
1/2  c. chopped celery
4  Tbsp. mayonnaise
1/4  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in boiling water and allow to cool.   Mix rest of ingredients.  Stir into cooled gelatin.   Put in mold and chill.

THANKSGIVING JELLIED SALAD
ingredients
1 (9 oz.)  can pineapple chunks
2  pkg. cherry jello
2  c. hot water
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
  dash of salt
3/4  c. sugar
1 1/2  c. coarsely ground cranberries
1/2  c. finely ground orange with peel
1  c. mandarin oranges
3/4  c. celery, chopped
1/3  c. walnuts, chopped
1  c. cold water
preparation
      Drain pineapple; keep juice.  Dissolve jello in hot water. Add cold water, pineapple juice and salt.  Chill until partially set.  Stir sugar into ground fruits; fold into jello.  Add pineapple, oranges, celery and walnuts.  Pour into ring mold. Chill until firm.  Yields 8 to 10 servings.

THANKSGIVING DRESSING
ingredients
1  recipe Pinkie's Cornbread
12  biscuits, crumbled
15  slices bread, crumbled
6  c. good turkey or chicken stock
1 1/2  c. cream of chicken soup
6  large eggs
1  c. melted butter
2  c. celery, chopped
2  Tbsp. m.s.g. (Accent)
1  Tbsp. black pepper
1  tsp. salt or less
1  tsp. poultry seasoning
  pinch of celery seed
2  c. chopped onion
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together in casserole dishes sprayed with Pam.  Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour.  Serve with gravy and cranberry sauce.  Serves 25.
Pinkie's Cornbread:
ingredients
4  c. cornmeal (self-rising)
2  c. buttermilk
6  eggs
2  sticks melted butter
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together and pour into a greased 9 x 13 x 1/2-inch pan; bake at 375° for 20 to 25 minutes.  Great for making ahead and freezing.

GRANDMA SCOLARO'S THANKSGIVING MEAT STUFFING
ingredients
1  lb. hamburg
1  lb. ground pork
2  pkg. saltines, finely crushed
3  Tbsp. Bell seasonings
  salt and pepper
1  large onion, chopped
preparation
      Cook onion in oil in a large pan. Add the meat and cook fully. Mash crackers and add the Bell seasonings, salt and pepper. Add to the meat mix. Place in the turkey and cook.

THANKSGIVING TOMORROW
ingredients
3  c. Stove Top dressing or homemade dressing
2  c. turkey, cooked and diced
1  c. cream of mushroom soup
1/2  c. diced celery
1/2  c. diced onion
1  tsp. poultry seasoning
1/2  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Heat oven to 350°.  Combine all ingredients, adding turkey broth or water if mixture is too dry (I use turkey gravy if any left).  Place in lightly greased  1-quart casserole dish.  Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until hot and lightly brown on top. Garnish with cranberry jelly or sauce if desired.

THANKSGIVING DAY WILD RICE STUFFING
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. sliced mushrooms
2  c. chopped celery
2  c. chopped onions
1  c. butter
6  c. cubed, whole wheat bread
1  c. chopped pecans
2  tsp. sage
1  tsp. thyme
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  c. chicken broth
1 1/2  c. cooked, wild rice, cooled
preparation
      Saute, in 1/2 cup of butter, then onions, mushrooms and celery; salt lightly.  In large bowl, combine bread, pecans and seasonings. Add sauteed vegetables.  Saute wild rice in remaining 1/2 cup butter and chicken broth; simmer 5 minutes.  Add rice to bread mixture.  Combine thoroughly.  Makes 12 cups.  Will stuff a 12 to 14 pound turkey, or cook separately for 40 minutes in a covered dish.

DIABETIC THANKSGIVING CHEESECAKE
ingredients
3  oz. box sugar-free jello (any flavor)
12  oz. lite Cool Whip
22  pkg. Equal
8  oz. pkg. light cream cheese
2  c. graham cracker crumbs
7  Tbsp. low-fat margarine
preparation
      Dissolve jello in 1 cup warm water.  Set aside to cool.  Stir together 6 packages Equal with graham cracker crumbs.  Add melted margarine.  Press 2 cups of the mixture firmly in 9 x 13-inch pan. Reserve rest of crumbs for top.
      Cream 16 packages Equal with cream cheese.  Mix with jello. Stir in Cool Whip.  Spread mixture on top of crust.   Sprinkle with remaining crumbs.  Chill 3 to 4 hours.  Also freezes well. Makes 36 squares (37 calories per square).

THANKSGIVING CAKE
ingredients
1 1/2  c. oil
2  c. sugar
3  eggs
1/2  tsp. salt
1  tsp. soda
2  c. flour
1  tsp. cinnamon
1 (6 oz.)  pkg. butterscotch chips
1 1/2  c. chopped pecans
2  tsp. vanilla
3  c. chopped apples
preparation
      Mix oil and sugar; add eggs and beat well.  Stir in dry ingredients.  Add apples, butterscotch chips,  nuts and vanilla. Bake in 9 x 13-inch pan at 350° for  50  to  60  minutes. While cake is warm, prepare topping.
Topping:
ingredients
1/2  c. brown sugar
1/2  c. butter
1/8  c. milk
preparation
      Combine and cook 3 minutes;  pour over cake while warm.

KRIEGER THANKSGIVING SQUASH
ingredients
2 to 3  lb. cooked butternut squash
1  to 2 chopped onions
1/2  stick margarine
1  c. shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
3  to 4 eggs
  milk if needed
  crushed Ritz crackers for topping
preparation
      Saute onions in butter; add eggs.  Combine all ingredients, except crackers.  Pour into buttered 9 x 13-inch pan and top with crushed Ritz crackers.  Bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes.

THANKSGIVING POTATOES
ingredients
9  large baking potatoes, peeled and diced
1/2  c. (1 stick) unsalted butter (room temperature)
12  oz. cream cheese (room temperature)
3/4  c. sour cream
1/2  tsp. ground nutmeg
  salt to taste
  pepper to taste
preparation
      Place the diced potatoes in a large saucepan and add water to cover.  Heat to boiling.  Reduce heat and simmer over medium heat until tender.  Drain.  Place the potatoes in a mixer bowl.  Cut the butter and cream cheese into small pieces and add to the potatoes. Beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.  Beat in the sour cream.  Season with nutmeg, salt and pepper to taste.  Serve immediately or reheat in a buttered casserole at 300° for 20 minutes, if you want to prepare them in advance.  Yields 8 servings.

THANKSGIVING DRESSING
ingredients
8 to 10  slices dry bread
1  Tbsp. margarine
2  stalks celery, diced
2  eggs
1/2  c. dry milk
1  c. water
1/2  c. chicken livers, chopped, 1/2 c. ground beef or 1/2 c. ground pork
1  Tbsp. Gourmet chicken spice
1  tsp. sage
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Mix bread, celery, margarine, spices and chicken livers.  Add water and mix.  Beat eggs and dry milk.  Add to bread mixture. Bake at 350° for 1 hour.  Stir after 15 minutes.  Continue baking.
      Why I like (or memories of) my grandma or grandpa's recipe: It's good!  She makes it every year for Thanksgiving.

THANKSGIVING PUNCH
ingredients
2  1/2 cups Southern Comfort
2  1/4 quarts 7-up
6  oz fresh lemon juice
  1-6 oz can frozen O.J.
  2-6 oz can frozen lemonade
preparation
      Chill ingredients. Mix in Punch bowl adding 7-up last.  Add a few drops of red food coloring, orange slices & lemon Slices.

THANKSGIVING SALAD
ingredients
1 small  can crushed pineapple
1 small  pkg. raspberry Jell-O
1/2  c. pecans
3  oz. cream cheese
1 1/2  c. boiling water
1  c. whole berry cranberry sauce
preparation
      Mix the Jell-O and water; dissolve.  Cream the cream cheese. Add pineapple with juice.  Add remaining ingredients and mix with Jell-O.  Chill until congealed.

NO FAIL THANKSGIVING TURKEY
ingredients
12 to 15  lb. turkey
1  loaf stale bread, cubed
1 1/2  c. chopped onion
1  c. celery, cut up
1  Tbsp. dried parsley
3  eggs or egg substitute
1/2  stick margarine
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Defrost turkey in refrigerator.  Remove neck and giblets.  Wash turkey in cool water.  Pat dry.  Melt margarine in large pan. Saute chopped liver until no longer pink.  Add onion, celery and parsley and saute until soft.  Add bread cubes and mix.  Add beaten eggs or egg substitute.  Mix well.  Generously sprinkle turkey cavities with salt.  Spoon in stuffing, but do not pack. Brush outside of turkey with melted margarine.  Place in roaster on rack.  Cover with foil tent.  Refer to turkey packaging for proper cooking times.

THANKSGIVING CHICKEN CASSEROLE
ingredients
4  large chicken breasts
1 small  pkg. pepperidge farm corn bread dressing
1  stick margarine
1  small onion - chopped fine
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1  can cream of chicken soup
  celery and sage if desired
preparation
      Stew chicken until done (do not salt).  Remove meat from bones.  Reserve broth.  Melt margarine and stir in dressing and onions (celery and sage).  In a greased 9 x 13 casserole dish, begin with a layer of dressing crumbs.  Add a layer of chicken, then a layer of mushroom soup, diluted with 1 can of reserved chicken broth.  Again, a layer of crumbs and chicken, then a can of cream of chicken soup diluted with 1 can of reserved chicken broth.  Top with crumbs and margarine.  Bake at 350° for 35 minutes or until top is brown.  Serves 10 - 12.

THANKSGIVING APPLESAUCE CAKE
ingredients
3/4  c. shortening
2  c. sugar
3  eggs
3  c. applesauce
3 1/2  c. flour
2  tsp. baking soda
4  tsp. cinnamon
3/4  tsp. cloves
1  tsp. nutmeg
1  tsp. salt
1  c. chopped nuts
1  lb. raisins
1  lb. orange gum candy, cut up
preparation
      Cream shortening and sugar.  Add eggs and applesauce.  Sift together flour, soda, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg and salt and stir into shortening mixture.  Add nuts, raisins and cut up candy. Pour into greased tube pan and bake at 325° for approximately 1 1/2 hours.

THANKSGIVING SALAD
ingredients
  red leaf lettuce
  romaine
  sliced cucumbers
  seasoned croutons
preparation
      Combine ingredients to taste.
Dressing:
ingredients
1  part sour cream (imitation sour cream or sour half and half works just as well)
2  parts mayonnaise (low-fat mayonnaise works just as well)
1  part crumbled Bleu cheese
preparation
      Combine sour cream, mayonnaise and Bleu cheese for dressing. Ring dressing with seasoned pepper.  Cover and refrigerate for 2 to 24 hours.  Just before serving, mix seasoned pepper into dressing.  Toss dressing with salad and serve.

THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY SALAD
ingredients
1 (3 oz.)  box cherry Jell-O
1 (3 oz.)  box raspberry Jell-O
1  (15 oz.) crushed pineapple with juice
1/2  can whole cranberry sauce (note: can use whole can for more cranberry flavor)
1  or 2 apples (depending on size)  and 1 or 2 oranges, ground or chopped fine
1  c. pecans, chopped coarse (if desired)
preparation
      Dissolve gelatin in 1 1/2 cups hot water. Add all other ingredients. Mix and chill until set. Best if left overnight.

CRANBERRY SALAD FOR THANKSGIVING
(Aunt Helen's Recipe)  
ingredients
1  pkg. fresh cranberries
1  pkg. raspberry jello
1  c. chopped nuts
2  oranges, chopped
2  c. sugar
1  c. water
preparation
      Dissolve jello in 1 cup boiling water.  Cool.  Add sugar to chopped fresh cranberries; then add oranges and nuts.  Combine with jello and refrigerate to congeal.

THANKSGIVING RELISH
(Excellent)  
ingredients
3  lb. raw cranberries
3  lb. apples
1/2  doz. large oranges
1 large (16 oz.)  can crushed pineapple
2  c. sugar
preparation
      Wash berries and apples; core, but do not peel apples.  Peel all but one orange.  Put all of this through grinder.  Add can of crushed pineapple and 2 cups sugar; stir and blend well.
      Note:  You may add some chopped nuts to this also.  "Happy Thanksgiving."

THANKSGIVING EVE SPAGHETTI SAUCE
ingredients
1 (28 oz.)  can crushed tomatoes
1 (12 oz.)  can tomato paste
1 (28 oz.)  can tomato sauce
7  chopped garlic cloves
1  large chopped onion
1 to 1 1/2  lb. ground beef
1  Tbsp. sugar
1/2  c. red wine (optional)
1/2  tsp. oregano
1/2  tsp. basil
1/2  tsp. marjoram
1/2  tsp. rosemary
  salt and pepper
  water (as needed for sauce consistency)
preparation
      Brown ground beef, saving 1 to 2 tablespoons of drippings. Saute onions and garlic in drippings.  Add crushed tomatoes.  Add sauce.  Add paste to onions and garlic.  Add sugar and spices. Stir together well.  Add ground beef; stir well.  Let simmer for at least 3 hours.  Serve over hot pasta.

THANKSGIVING KUCHEN
(Or Dyk Filler, As Lou Calls It)  
ingredients
3  c. flour
2  c. sugar
2  c. pumpkin
2  tsp. baking powder
2  tsp. soda
1/2  tsp. cinnamon
4  eggs
1  c. cooking oil
1/2  tsp. salt
1  c. chopped nuts
6  oz. raisins
6  oz. chocolate chips
preparation
      Sift dry ingredients together into a mixing bowl.  Add eggs, oil, pumpkin and remainder of ingredients; mix thoroughly. Lightly oil and flour a tube pan so batter will not stick.  Add batter.  Bake in a 350° oven for about 1 hour and 10 minutes. Drizzle with orange frosting after cake is baked and cooled.  I prefer cake plain or with powdered sugar.

ARIZONA BITTINGER'S THANKSGIVING FRUIT CAKE WITH LOLA SCHOPPERT'S
ingredients
1  c. butter or Crisco
1  c. sugar
4  eggs, beaten
2  c. Brer Rabbit molasses (yellow label)
1/2  c. each citron, orange peel, lemon peel
2  slices candied pineapple, cut up
1  tsp. soda
1  tsp. each: nutmeg, allspice and cloves
1/2  lb. English walnut kernels (1 lb. shelled) (Lola use 2 lb. nuts)
1  lb. currants
1  lb. seedless raisins
1/4  c. buttermilk
1/2  c. candied cherries
5  c. flour
preparation
      Cream sugar and shortening well.  Add beaten eggs, then the molasses; mix well.  Add soda to buttermilk and beat until foamy, then add to other ingredients.  Measure the flour and add the spices to it and sift together 2 to 3 times.  Have the nut meats, raisins, currants and candied fruits in separate containers and take a couple of tablespoons of the flour and mix through each thoroughly.  Start adding a handful of each to the first mixture along with the flour until all is in, then mix well.
      Grease funnel pan and cut heavy brown paper to line the bottom and sides (such as a large grocery sack).  Fill the pan 3/4 full and bake at 250° (slow oven) for 2 1/2 hours or until tested done. After I put the batter in the pan, I decorate the top with thin slices of the candied pineapple and halves of candied cherries and halves of English walnuts.  I get two cakes out of this batch.

THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY JELLO SALAD
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  pkg. cranberries
1  c. water
1 large  pkg. Jell-O (cherry, strawberry or raspberry)
1  c. sugar
1  can crushed pineapple, drained
1  c. chopped celery
1  c. halved grapes
1  c. Cool Whip
1  c. nuts
2 (8 oz.)  pkg. cream cheese
1  c. Marshmallow Creme
preparation
      Cook cranberries in water until they pop open.  Add Jell-O and sugar.  Mix until Jell-O dissolves.  Set until cool.  Add pineapple, celery, grapes and nuts.  Set.
      Topping:  Mix Cool Whip, cream cheese (softened) and Marshmallow Creme.  Spread over cranberry mixture.  Set and chill overnight.

THANKSGIVING DAY SALAD
ingredients
2  c. water
6  oz. cranberry jello
2 (10 oz.)  pkg. frozen, sliced strawberries, thawed
16  oz. can whole cranberry sauce
1/2  c. pecan pieces
  lettuce leaves
preparation
      Dissolve jello in boiling water; cool.  Add strawberries and cranberry sauce.  Stir.  Add nuts.  Pour into 2-quart ring mold. Refrigerate overnight.  Put on lettuce leaves to serve.

PAT'S THANKSGIVING POTATOES
ingredients
10  medium potatoes, boiled and peeled
1/2  c. butter
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1  c. scalded milk
8  oz. cream cheese (room temperature)
preparation
      Mash potatoes with all ingredients.  Put into a casserole dish and refrigerate until 2 to 3 hours before needed.  Bring to room temperature and bake at 325° for about 25 minutes.

THANKSGIVING CORNBREAD
(Easy)  
ingredients
1/2  c. cornmeal
1/4  c. white flour
1/4  c. whole wheat flour
1  Tbsp. maple syrup
1  tsp. baking powder
1/2  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. shortening or butter
1  egg
1/2  c. milk
preparation
      Mix cornmeal, flours, maple syrup, baking powder and salt.  Add shortening, egg and milk.  Pour into buttered loaf pan.  Bake at 400° for 25 minutes.  Serves 8. Easy for children to make.

AFTER THANKSGIVING SPECIAL
ingredients
1  bag frozen English peas, cooked
1  bag frozen corn, cooked
2 or 3  c. cubed potatoes, cooked
2 or 3  c. chopped turkey, cooked
1 (10 3/4 oz.)  can cream of chicken soup
2  bags instant creamy chicken microwavable soup
1  tsp. poultry seasoning
1  Tbsp. minced onions
1  Tbsp. black pepper
1  Tbsp. salt
2 or 3  cans water
preparation
      Mix all ingredients together and cook on low until all mixture is hot.  Serve with bread or crackers.

THANKSGIVING APPLESAUCE CAKE
ingredients
3  c. applesauce
3/4  c. oil
3  eggs
2  c. sugar
3 1/2  c. flour
1  lb. raisins
1  lb. candy orange slices
2  tsp. soda
4  tsp. cinnamon
1  tsp. nutmeg
1  tsp. salt
3/4  tsp. cloves
1  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Grease and flour (can use 1 long or 2 round cake pans). Preheat oven to 325°.  Cream oil, sugar and eggs.  Add dry ingredients alternately with applesauce.  Add nuts, raisins and cut-up orange gum candy.  Bake for 1 1/2 hours at 325°.

MRS. LOWELL'S THANKSGIVING CORNBREAD
ingredients
12  oz. corn muffin mix
4  eggs
8  oz. sour cream
1/2  stick melted butter
1  Tbsp. sugar
16  oz. creamed corn
preparation
      Beat eggs in bowl.  Add corn muffin mix, sour cream, corn, melted butter and sugar.  Grease an 8 x 8-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for about 1 hour.
      Kids love this moist, sweet bread.  We bake it for our Thanksgiving feast.

THANKSGIVING CAKE
ingredients
2  sticks butter (1 c.)
5  eggs
1  c. evaporated milk
1  c. raisins
1  c. coconut
1  tsp. vanilla
2  c. sugar
1 (14 oz.)  box vanilla wafers, crushed
1  (16 oz.) container fruit cake mix or candied fruit
2  c. pecans, chopped
preparation
      Cream butter until light.  Add sugar slowly, beating well. Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each, then add wafer crumbs alternating with milk.  Add vanilla extract.  Add coconut, then mix fruit, nuts and raisins into bowl with 1/4 cup flour.  Cover well and shake, dusting well with flour, then mix with batter. Pour in well-greased and papered tube pan.  Cook 1 1/2 hours at 325°, then let cool.

THANKSGIVING PEACHES
ingredients
1 large  can peach halves
1/3  c. brown sugar
1/4  tsp. cinnamon
  dash of cloves and nutmeg
4  tsp. cornstarch
  marshmallows
preparation
      O, the comfort, the inexpressible comfort of feeling safe with a person.  Having neither to weigh thoughts, nor measure words, but pouring them right out, just as they are!!  Chaff and grain together.  Certain that a faithful hand will take and sift them. Keep what is worth keeping and with the breath of kindness, blow the rest away.  Amen.

"AFTER THANKSGIVING" TURKEY CORN SOUP
ingredients
1  (16 oz.) portion cream-style corn
1  can chicken broth or 16 oz. homemade
2  c. cooked, diced turkey
1 1/2  c. seasoned mashed potatoes
1/4  tsp. dried thyme leaves, crushed
1 1/2  c. chopped, cooked green vegetable (broccoli, green beans or peas)
1/2  c. milk
1/8  tsp. pepper
preparation
      In 4-quart saucepan over medium heat, heat the corn, broth, turkey, potatoes and thyme to boiling.  Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Stir in green vegetable, milk and pepper.  Heat through.  Yields approximately 8 cups.

THANKSGIVING RICE
ingredients
3  c. uncooked rice
1  lb. country sausage
1  c. celery, chopped
2  medium onions, chopped
1  green pepper, diced
1  egg, beaten
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Boil rice; set aside in colander.  Use a large skillet to cook sausage thoroughly.  Saute celery, onions and pepper in sausage fat.  When vegetables are lightly browned, add the rice.  Stir well for about 3 minutes.  Remove from heat; put into a large mixing bowl.  Combine with egg and seasonings.  Mix well.  Put into greased casserole dishes for serving or freezing.  Reheat in oven until rice is hot.   Yield:  12 to 14 servings.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

THANKSGIVING ROLLS
ingredients
2  pkg. yeast
2  c. warm water
1  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. sugar
1  c. butter
2  eggs
3/4  c. sugar
6  c. flour
preparation
      Dissolve salt, yeast, water and 2 tablespoons sugar.  Melt butter and add to yeast mixture. Beat eggs and add to mixture. Add 3/4 cup sugar and flour; mix well.  Let rise to double. Roll 1/4-inch and cut out. Put in pan and brush with melted butter. Let rise to double again. Bake at 400° until brown.
      These rolls have become a Thanksgiving tradition in our family. But they are great anytime!

THANKSGIVING MOUNTAIN GROUSE
ingredients
2  c. Morton Tender Quick
1 (16 oz.)  can chicken broth
1  lb. bacon
2  c. soy sauce
1  oz. Sun Luck Chinese style Five Spice
6  to 8 ruffled grouse breasts
preparation
      Defrost breasts overnight in large roasting pan with cold water and Tender Quick.  Rinse birds off and pan out thoroughly in morning.  Combine soy sauce and Five Spice into bowl until a granulated consistency occurs.  Rub mixture deeply into breasts. Strip bacon to cover bottom of roasting pans and add breasts. Cover and refrigerate until ready to cook.
      When ready, add 1/2 can chicken broth and toothpick remaining bacon on top of breasts.  Bake at 325° for 1 hour, then uncover and brown for 20 minutes.  Use leftover broth for a hearty bacon gravy.

THANKSGIVING APPLE-CHERRY PIE
Flaky Pastry:
ingredients
2  c. flour
1  tsp. salt
2/3  c. shortening
2  Tbsp. butter or margarine, melted
5  Tbsp. cold water
1  Tbsp. vinegar
preparation
      Mix flour and salt well.  Cut in shortening and butter until coarse crumbs.  Add water and vinegar, mixing with fork.  Form in ball.  Roll out.  Carefully lift to pie plate (pastry is tender and may tear).  Makes pastry for 2-crust 8 or 9-inch pie or 2 shells.
      Note:  Very easy to handle and roll out; needs no chilling.

THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY RELISH MOLD
ingredients
1  medium orange
12  oz. fresh cranberries
1/2  c. sugar
1 (3 oz.)  pkg. black cherry gelatin
preparation
      Cut orange into small sections; remove seeds.  Process orange, cranberries and sugar in food processor until fruit is coarsely chopped.  Prepare gelatin using package directions.  Chill until partially set.  Add chopped fruit; mix well.  Pour into large mold.  Chill until set.  Unmold onto serving plate.  Garnish with orange slices and parsley.  Chill until serving time.  Yield: 8 servings.

AFTER THANKSGIVING DINNER
ingredients
1/2  c. butter or margarine
3  c. crumbled cornbread
1  c. dry bread crumbs
3  c. chopped cooked turkey
1 1/4  c. turkey or chicken broth
1 (10 1/2 oz.)  can cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
1  c. chopped celery
1  c. chopped onion
1  tsp. poultry seasoning
1  tsp. salt
1  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Power:  High.
      Microwaving Time:  11 to 14 minutes.
      Place  butter  in a large glass mixing bowl.  Microwave at High  1  to  2 minutes or until melted.  Add cornbread and bread crumbs.  Stir  to  coat.  Add  other  ingredients  and combine thoroughly.  Spread  mixture  into a buttered 2-quart casserole. Cover  with  waxed paper.  Microwave at High 10 to 12  minutes. Let  stand,  covered,  2 minutes before serving. Yields 4 to 8 servings.

THANKSGIVING DINNER
ingredients
1  car or some mode of transportation
1  tank of gas (depends on distance to drive)
1  pocketful of money (for gas; depends on ingredients #1 and #2)
1  empty stomach (or 2 if you bring your spouse, yes; and more if you bring the children)
1  safe trip to your mother's house
preparation
      Depending on how far you drive (pack clothes for an overnight trip).  Get up early on Thanksgiving day and go to your mother's house.  If traveling a long distance, use plenty of ingredients 2 and 3. Upon arriving at your destination, prepare your nostrils for some luscious, moth-watering smells.  Help your mother prepare a wonderful dinner (or stay out of the way).  Sit down at the table, say grace and enjoy.  To help make the dinner more enjoyable (especially to your mother) wash the dishes.

THANKSGIVING PIE
ingredients
2  c. fresh cranberries
1/2  c. walnuts
1/2  c. sugar
1  c. sugar
1  c. flour
1/2  c. melted butter
2  eggs
preparation
      Butter a 10-inch pie pan or 2 small ones.  Put cranberries, walnuts and 1/2 cup of sugar in pie pan and mix.
      In a bowl, beat eggs well.  Add 1 cup of sugar, flour and melted butter.  Mix well and spread on top of cranberry mixture. Bake at 325° for about 1 hour.

THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY COBBLER
ingredients
1  pkg. Duncan Hines Deluxe yellow cake mix
1/2  tsp. ground cinnamon
1/4  tsp. ground nutmeg
1  c. butter, softened
1/2  c. chopped nuts
1  can peach pie filling
1  can whole cranberry sauce
  vanilla ice cream or whipped cream
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Combine dry cake mix, cinnamon and nutmeg in bowl.  Cut in butter with pastry blender or two knives until crumbly.  Stir in nuts; set aside.
      Combine peach pie filling and cranberry sauce in ungreased 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan.  Mix well.  Sprinkle crumb mixture over fruit. Bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes or until golden brown.  Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

THANKSGIVING CORN CASSEROLE
ingredients
1/2  cup melted margarine
1  can cream style corn
1  can whole kernel corn
2  Tbsp. green peppers (chopped)
2  Tbsp. onion (chopped)
1  pkg. corn muffin mix
1/4  cup mayo
1  cup shredded cheddar cheese
2  eggs well beaten
  dash of salt, pepper and sugar
preparation
      Mix all together and bake in a casserole dish for 1 hour at 325° or until the center of the dish is firm to the touch.

THANKSGIVING COBBLER
ingredients
1  pkg. yellow cake mix
1  tsp. cinnamon
1/4  tsp. nutmeg
1  c. butter, softened
1  c. nuts
1  can peach pie filling or 18 oz. peach preserves
1 (16 oz.)  can whole berry cranberry sauce
  vanilla ice cream or Cool Whip
preparation
      Preheat oven to 350°.  Combine dry cake mix and spices in bowl.  Cut in butter until crumbly.  Stir in nuts.  Set aside.
      Combine pie filling and cranberry sauce.  Spread in ungreased 13 x 9-inch cake pan.  Sprinkle crumb mixture over fruit.  Bake 45 to 50 minutes, until golden brown.  Serve warm with ice cream or Cool Whip.

THANKSGIVING DRESSING
ingredients
  turkey or hen broth
  corn meal (Martha White)
2  eggs
  milk
  Crisco shortening
4  small onions, minced
3  stalks celery (without ribs), minced
3  cans cream of chicken soup
  salt and pepper to taste
1/2  tsp. (heaping) sugar
5  eggs
1  stick butter
preparation
      Bake 2 iron skillets of cornbread as per directions on back of Martha White package.  Bake at 450° for 20 to 25 minutes.
      Saute onions and celery in 1 stick butter.  In large bowl, break up cornbread into crumbs.
      Add soup and 1 can water to dilute soup.  Add turkey broth, enough to have a good consistency (pourable but not too liquidy). Mash with potato masher until creamy.  Add onions and celery before or after mashing to your liking.  Add 5 eggs.  Stir well.  Pour in 9 x 13-inch pan.  Cook at 350° until golden brown all over.

THANKSGIVING TOMORROW
ingredients
3  c. leftover stuffing or 1 pkg. (6 oz.) stuffing mix, prepared according to pkg. directions
2  c. turkey, cooked and cubed
1  can cream of mushroom soup
1/2  c. celery, chopped
1/2  c. onion, chopped
1  tsp. poultry seasoning
1/2  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Heat oven  to 350°.  Combine all ingredients, adding turkey broth or water if mixture is too dry.  Place in lightly greased 1-quart casserole dish.   Bake 35 to 45 minutes or until hot and lightly browned on top.

THANKSGIVING TURKEYS

THANKSGIVING TOMORROW
ingredients
2  c. turkey, cooked and cubed
3  c. leftover stuffing
1  can low-sodium cream of mushroom soup
1/2  c. chopped celery
1/2  c. chopped onion
1/2  tsp. pepper
1  tsp. poultry seasoning
  turkey broth or water if needed
preparation
      Heat oven to 350°.  Combine all ingredients, add turkey broth or water if mixture is too dry.  Place in lightly greased casserole dish.  Bake 35 or 45 minutes or until hot and lightly browned on top.  Garnish with cranberry sauce if desired.

LYNN'S FOOLPROOF STUFFING FOR THANKSGIVING TURKEY
ingredients
3/4  lb. mild pork sausage
1/2  c. butter or margarine
1 1/2  c. chopped celery
1  c. chopped onion
1/2  c. chopped carrot (or grated)
9  c. dry bread cubes
1  large apple, cored and finely chopped
1  tsp. ground sage
1/2  tsp. thyme, crushed
1/2  tsp. dried rosemary, crushed
1/4  c. snipped parsley
1/2 to 3/4  c. turkey or chicken broth
  salt and pepper
preparation
      In a large skillet, crumble sausage.  Cook and stir until sausage is brown.  Drain off all but 1/4 cup drippings.  Add butter, celery, onion and carrot.  Cook, stirring occasionally until onion is tender.  In a very large bowl, combine bread cubes, apple, sage, thyme, rosemary, parsley and sausage mixture.  Toss lightly.  Add enough broth to moisten.  Salt and pepper to taste. Use to stuff 1 (10 to 12 pound) turkey.

THANKSGIVING BEANS
ingredients
1 (16 oz.)  can green beans
1 (16 oz.)  can yellow beans
1  can sliced water chestnuts
1  can mushroom soup
1  can onion rings
1/2  c. bacon bits
preparation
      Mix beans, bacon, chestnuts and soup.  Place in casserole. Cover with onion rings.  Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.

DAY AFTER THANKSGIVING CASSEROLE
ingredients
6  oz. pkg. white and wild rice mix (Uncle Ben's)
2 to 3  c. cooked, cubed turkey or chicken
2  Tbsp. diced onion
1  stalk celery, diced
1  c. water
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  can cream of chicken, celery or mushroom soup
8  oz. can sliced water chestnuts, drained
4  oz. can mushroom stems and pieces (undrained)
1/4  c. chopped, roasted almonds (optional)
preparation
      In a 2-quart casserole, combine uncooked rice and packet of seasoning with remaining ingredients except nuts.  Mix well. Bake, covered, at 375° for 45 minutes.  Remove cover; sprinkle with nuts and continue baking for 15 minutes or until rice is done.  Makes 6 servings, 275 calories per serving.

THANKSGIVING PUMPKIN CRUNCH
ingredients
1 (29 oz.)  can pumpkin
1 (13 oz.)  can evaporated milk
3/4  c. sugar
3  eggs, beaten
1/4  tsp. pumpkin pie spice mix
1/4  tsp. cinnamon
1  yellow cake mix
1  c. nuts
2  sticks melted butter, cooled
1  large Cool Whip
preparation
      Line 9 x 13-inch pan with wax paper.  Mix first 5 ingredients and pour in pan.  Shake dry cake mix and nuts over this. Dribble melted butter on top.  Bake at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes.  Cool, invert pan, remove wax paper and top with Cool Whip when ready to serve.  "Better than pumpkin pie".

TZIMMES DELUXE (GREAT FOR THANKSGIVING)
ingredients
2  large yams, peeled and cut into cubes
2  carrots, sliced
1/2  c. pitted prunes
1  c. water
1  apple, cored and cubed
  honey to taste
  walnuts can be added for crunch
preparation
      Put yams, carrots, prunes and water in saucepan.  Bring to a boil; cover and simmer for 25 minutes or until tender.  Add apple and honey and cook 25 minutes longer.  Preheat oven to 300°.  Turn mixture into a heatproof serving dish and bake uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes.  Yields 4 servings.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

THANKSGIVING PICKLES
ingredients
2  c. vinegar
2  Tbsp. salt
1 1/2  Tbsp. whole mixed spices
1  Tbsp. powdered alum
  cucumbers
preparation
      Pack whole cucumbers in 1/2 gallon jar. Mix vinegar, salt, spices and alum together.  Pour over cucumbers. Finish filling jar with cold water.  Put Saran Wrap on jar; seal tight and set aside. In fall when you want to eat, take out of jar and dry off.  Slice pickles about 1 1/2-inches thick.  Pour about 1 1/2 pounds sugar over them; seal and shake jar to dissolve sugar.  Leave in refrigerator as you use them.  The longer they set, the crispier they get.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

THANKSGIVING SALAD
ingredients
  Fuyu persimmons
  Asian pears
  raisins
  walnuts or pecans
  orange slices
  pomegranate seeds
preparation
      Mix all the fruits together or layer them in a clear glass bowl.  Serve without dressing.

DAY AFTER THANKSGIVING CASSEROLE
ingredients
6  c. turkey stuffing
1 (16 oz.)  can whole berry cranberry sauce
1/2  c. coarsely chopped walnuts (optional)
3  c. cubed, cooked turkey
1 (14 1/4 oz.)  can turkey gravy
preparation
      Prepare stuffing according to package directions. Stir cranberry and nuts into stuffing. In a 3-quart oblong baking dish, spoon stuffing. Arrange turkey pieces on top of stuffing. Pour gravy over turkey. Bake at 400° for 20 minutes or until hot. Serves 6.
      Four cups of turkey is good, too.

THANKSGIVING DRESSING
ingredients
3  pkg. stuffing bread
2  onions, chopped
4  to 5 eggs
  sage
  salt
  pepper
preparation
      Mix bread, onions and eggs.  Then add sage, salt and pepper to taste.  Pour enough broth (from cooking giblets) in mixture to moisten.  Stuff turkey.

THANKSGIVING POTATOES
ingredients
10  large potatoes
  butter
1  lb. Cheddar cheese
  green onions to taste
  milk
1  can cream of chicken soup
1 to 2  pt. sour cream
preparation
      Peel and boil potatoes; drain.  Mash potatoes.  Add milk and butter as needed.  Add cream of chicken soup to mixture.  Layer mashed potatoes, sour cream and shredded cheese in a rectangular baking dish.  (Spray sides and bottom of dish with a little Pam.) Last layer should have cheese on top.  Sprinkle green onions on top.   Cover with foil, bake 30 minutes at 350°.

THANKSGIVING CROCK-POT DRESSING
ingredients
1  c. butter
2  c. chopped onion
2  c. chopped celery
1/4  c. parsley
2 (8 oz.)  cans mushrooms, drained
12 to 13  c. slightly dry bread crumbs
1  tsp. poultry seasoning
1 1/2  tsp. salt
1 1/2  tsp. sage
1  tsp. dried thyme
1/2  tsp. pepper
1/2  tsp. marjoram
3 1/2 to 4 1/2  c. broth and giblets
2  well beaten eggs
preparation
      Melt butter in skillet and saute onion, celery, parsley and mushrooms.  Pour over bread cubes in very large mixing bowl.  Add all seasonings and toss together well.  Pour in enough broth to moisten; add beaten eggs and mix together well.  Pack lightly into crock-pot.  Cover and set at high for 45 minutes, then reduce to low to cook for 4 to 8 hours.
      Note:  If using a seasoned stuffing mix, omit herbs and salt.

THANKSGIVING OR ANY DAY SALAD
ingredients
1  large orange jello
1  can crushed pineapple
2  c. buttermilk
1  regular size Cool Whip
1  can mandarin oranges
1  c. chopped nuts
preparation
      Boil  jello  and  pineapple together until jello melts. Refrigerate  until  thick,  but not hard.  Add buttermilk; mix thoroughly  and  refrigerate until thick.  Then add Cool Whip, mandarin oranges and chopped nuts.  Let set, then serve.
