Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

GRILLED ITALIAN TOMATOES
ingredients
3  large firm ripe tomatoes
2  Tbsp. commercial Italian dressing
1 1/2  tsp. basil
  salt and pepper to taste
1/4  c. melted butter or margarine
1  c. breadcrumbs
preparation
      Cut tomatoes in half crosswise and sprinkle each half with 1 teaspoon Italian dressing, 1/4 teaspoon basil, salt and pepper. Combine butter and breadcrumbs; spoon over tomato halves.
      Place tomato halves on heavy-duty aluminum foil.  Seal foil, leaving a small amount of space for steam to escape.  Cook over hot coals for 10 minutes.  Yields 6 servings.

GRILLED HAM AND EGG SALAD SANDWICHES
ingredients
1  unsliced round loaf bread (8-inches)
2  Tbsp. horseradish
1/2  lb. thinly sliced cooked roast beef
2  Tbsp. prepared mustard
1/2  lb. thinly sliced cooked ham or turkey
4  slices Swiss cheese
2  Tbsp. mayonnaise
1  small tomato, thinly sliced
6  bacon strips, cooked
4  slices American cheese
1  small onion, thinly sliced
1/4  c. butter, melted
1  Tbsp. sesame seeds
1/2  tsp. onion salt
preparation
      Slice bread horizontally into 5 equal layers.  Spread bottom layer with horseradish; top with roast beef.  Place next slice of bread over beef; spread with mustard on top with ham or turkey and Swiss cheese.  Add next slice of bread and top with American cheese and onion.  Cover with remaining bread.  Combine butter, sesame seeds and onion salt.  Brush over top and sides of loaf. Place on baking sheet; loosely tent with heavy duty aluminum foil. Bake at 400° for 15 to 20 minutes or until heated through. Carefully slice into 8 wedges.  Makes 8 servings.

GRILLED CHICKEN WITH SWEET ONION RELISH
Chicken:
ingredients
2  lb. skinless chicken pieces
1/2  c. orange juice
2  Tbsp. honey
1  Tbsp. Dijon mustard
1  Tbsp. grated gingerroot
2  tsp. reduced sodium soy sauce
preparation
      Combine all ingredients in a large self closing bag, mixing well. Seal and marinate in refrigerator at least 2 hours, turning bag occasionally. Spray the grill with no stick spray before heating. Remove chicken from bag, reserving marinade. Place chicken on the rack over coals. Grill uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink. Brush frequently with reserved marinade while grilling. Serve with relish.
Relish:
ingredients
1  Tbsp. butter
1/2  c. chopped red onions
1/2  c. chopped green peppers
1/2  c. chopped tomatoes
3  Tbsp. all fruit orange spread
2  tbsp. chili sauce
1  Tbsp. cider vinegar
1/2  tsp. thyme (optional)
preparation
      Melt butter in small saucepan. Add onions and peppers and cook until tender. About 4 minutes. Stir in rest of ingredients. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat and set aside.

BEST EVER GRILLED CHICKEN
ingredients
1  large fryer, cut up
1  c. Italian salad dressing
1/2  c. lemon juice
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1/2  tsp. onion powder
1/2  tsp. paprika
1  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
preparation
      Place fryer into a bowl with a tight fitting lid.  Combine all other ingredients and pour over chicken early in the day.  Place in the refrigerator.  Shake the bowl several times that day.  Cook on an outdoor barbecue grill as you would any other chicken.  Use the sauce to baste the chicken while cooking.  The whole family should go for this one.  Serves 4.

ASIAN-STYLE GRILLED BEEF
ingredients
2  Tbsp. soy sauce
1  Tbsp. sesame oil
1  Tbsp. brown sugar
1  lb. round steak, sliced into 1/4-inch strips
1  large carrot
6  green onions
preparation
      Combine soy sauce, sesame oil and brown sugar in a medium baking dish; mix well. Add steak, stirring to coat. Preheat grill or broiler. Cut carrot and green onions into 1 1/2-inch slices. Remove steak from sauce. Reserve sauce.  Thread carrot, green onions and steak onto 6 skewers. Brush kabobs with sauce. Grill or broil, turning once, until steak is browned, about 3 minutes on each side.

EASY HERBED GRILLED SALMON
ingredients
1/2  lb. salmon filet
1  Tbsp. butter or margarine
1/2  lemon
2  Tbsp. white wine
1/2  tsp. salt (optional)
1/2  tsp. onion powder
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
1/2  tsp. lemon pepper
1  tsp. oregano
1/2  tsp. dill weed
1/2  tsp. parsley flakes
1/4  tsp. paprika
preparation
      Preheat grill. Make a tray out of heavy-duty foil by folding a long piece in half and folding up all 4 sides with the dull side up. Spray the bottom of the foil tray with cooking spray. Place fish filet in the tray, skin side down. Smear a thin line of butter on filet. Squeeze lemon juice liberally over filet and then a splash of white wine. Sprinkle remaining seasonings lightly over filet and transfer the foil tray to the hot grill. Cover. Cook for 10 minutes per inch of thickness of filet. DO NOT overcook or it will be dry and unpalatable. Turning is not necessary. Salmon is done when it turns a light pink color throughout.

GRILLED RED SNAPPER
ingredients
8  portions of fish fillets
1/4  lb. butter
2  onions, chopped
2  cloves garlic, minced
  juice from 2 limes or lemons
3  Tbsp. spicy mustard
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation
      Melt butter in a saucepan.  Add onions and sauté until clear. Add garlic, lemon/lime juice, mustard, salt and pepper.
      Preparation time:  15 minutes.  Cooking time:  10 to 15 minutes.

GRILLED VEGGIES
ingredients
2  medium zucchini
1/2  onion
1/2  lb. mushrooms
2  medium crookneck squash
3  tomatoes
4  Tbsp. margarine
preparation
      Slice squash, onion and mushrooms.  Chop tomatoes.  Lay out on a large piece of heavy-duty foil.  Cut butter in pieces and scatter over vegetables.  Fold over foil and seal well.  Cook on barbecue grill for 15 to 20 minutes, turning several times.

Grilled Garlic Shrimp
ingredients
2  lb. large unshelled shrimp, deveined
1/2  c. melted, unsalted butter
1/2  c. olive oil
1  Tbsp. minced shallots or green onions
3 large peeled  cloves garlic
1  tsp. salt
1 1/2  Tbsp. fresh lemon juice
1/4  c. minced parsley
  salt and freshly ground pepper
  parsley sprigs (garnish)
preparation
      Wash shrimp in cold water and dry well.  Pour butter and olive oil into a 3-quart shallow bowl.  Add shallots.  Chop garlic with salt on a cutting board (this helps eliminate the strong garlic aftertaste).  Add garlic and salt mixture to bowl.  Roll shrimp in this mixture until well coated.  Sprinkle with lemon juice and parsley.  Marinate at least 30 minutes, turning shrimp several times.
      Place shrimp on gas grill over medium flame and grill 5 to 7 minutes on each side, depending on size of shrimp.  Salt and pepper to taste.  Serve in individual dishes and spoon heated marinade over them.  Garnish with parsley.  Yield:  6 servings.

GRILLED SALMON
ingredients
1 to 1 1/2  lb. salmon fillets with skin on
1/4  c. butter or margarine
1/4  c. lemon juice
1/8  tsp. garlic (more is optional)
preparation
      Heat grill to medium. In a very small saucepan, melt butter. Add lemon juice and garlic. Place salmon, skin side down, on grill (do not turn). Baste with butter sauce approximately 3 times while grilling. Grilling time will be approximately 9 to 15 minutes, depending on the thickness of the salmon.

GRILLED CHICKEN PASTA SALAD
ingredients
1 (17 oz.)  pkg. multi-color spiral pasta
1  c. julienne carrots
1/2  c. red and green bell peppers, diced fine
1  c. raw broccoli florets
1 (8 oz.)  bottle Paul Prudhomme's poultry seasoning
1 (8 oz.)  bottle Ranch dressing
1 (8 oz.)  bottle Italian dressing
  Blue cheese crumbles (optional)
8  skinless, boneless chicken breasts
preparation
      Cook pasta according to package. Rinse with cold water. Season chicken breasts, back and front, with poultry seasoning. Grill or saut. Let cool. Cut in strips and then dice. Add vegetables and chicken to pasta. Mix dressings together and then add to pasta until you reach desired taste and consistency.
      Optional (Tastes Great): Sprinkle with Blue cheese crumbles. Garnish with slices of fresh fruit. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

SEAFOOD ON THE GRILL
ingredients
  lemon
  butter
  salt
  pepper
  any type seafood
  onions
  bell peppers
preparation
	When grilling seafood, season with lemon, butter, salt, pepper, onions and bell peppers. Wrap in foil and place on grill for approximately 20 minutes. Easy to cook. Tastes great!

GRILLED FISH
ingredients
2  lb. fish
1/2  c. salad oil
1/3  c. freshly squeezed lemon juice
1/4  c. chopped onion
2  Tbsp. capers and juice (optional)
2  Tbsp. catsup
1  tsp. salt
2  Tbsp. sugar
2  tsp. Worcestershire sauce
4  bay leaves, crushed
1/4  tsp. pepper
2  cloves garlic, finely chopped
  paprika
preparation
      Marinate fish for 30 minutes in mixed ingredients.  Cook on grill about 8 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork.  Baste fish while grilling and sprinkle with paprika.  Baste shrimp or scallops only, don't marinate.

DILLY GRILLED TURKEY
ingredients
1  bone-in Turkey Breast half (2-1/2 to 3 lb)
1  c. plain non-fat yogurt
1/4  c. lemon juice
3  tsp. vegetable oil
preparation
      This recipe calls for half of a fresh or frozen turkey breast.  If your market carries only whole turkey breast, ask the butcher to cut one in half for you.

TURKEY ON THE GRILL
ingredients
1  (12 to 14 lb.) turkey
1  stick butter
2  stalks celery
1  onion
  salt and pepper
1  qt. water
preparation
      You will also need heavy-duty aluminum foil (can use purchased foil pan).
      Wash turkey thoroughly.  Salt and pepper neck and body cavities and outside of turkey.  Stuff cavities with celery and onions. Make an aluminum foil pan of 4 thicknesses of foil; pan should be about 2 inches deep.  Place turkey in pan; place on gas grill which has been turned on "low."  Pour one stick of melted butter over turkey and pour water in base of pan.  Baste turkey at 30 minute intervals.  Cook 4 1/2 to 5 hours with grill lid closed.  Replace water as needed.

POTATOES ON A GRILL
ingredients
  potatoes (uncooked), sliced thin
  green peppers, cut in pieces
1  large onion, chopped (or more if desired)
  paprika, salt and pepper
  butter
preparation
      Mix together potatoes, green peppers and onion.  Season with paprika, salt and pepper.  Put mixture on heavy-duty foil and dab butter on top in several places.  (Spraying the inside of foil with Pam helps a lot!)  Wrap the potatoes in the foil real well and cook on grill, turning often, about 1/2 hour.  Can be done in oven at about 400°.

CRACKER BARREL GRILLED CHICKEN TENDERLOIN
ingredients
1  lb. chicken breast tenders
1/2  c. Italian dressing, drain and discard spices
1  tsp. fresh lime juice
1 1/2  tsp. honey
preparation
      Mix dressing, lime juice and honey together. Pour over chicken tenders, making sure all tenders are covered. Marinate 1 hour. Braise tenders in a nonstick pan or grill to lightly golden in color, but not dry.

GRILLED CARROTS
ingredients
6  medium carrots
1  Tbsp. dehydrated onion flakes
1/2  tsp. garlic salt
  black pepper to taste
1/4  c. soy sauce
1/4  c. water
2  Tbsp. wine vinegar
preparation
      Place carrots on a large double layer of aluminum foil; fold up sides to form a container.  Sprinkle carrots with onion flakes, garlic salt and pepper.  Combine all remaining ingredients in a small jar or measuring cup; pour over carrots.  Wrap foil tightly around carrots to make a packet.  Marinate 2 hours, turning occasionally.  Remove carrots from foil; place on hinged grill or on a rack 4 inches from source of heat.  Grill 45 minutes or until carrots are tender.  Makes 6 servings.

MARINADE FOR GRILLED CHICKEN
ingredients
1/2  c. soy sauce
1/4  c. white wine or lemon juice
1/4  c. oil
1/4  c. chopped onion
1/4  tsp. fresh minced garlic
preparation
      Mix all ingredients and pour over boneless chicken breasts. Marinate for at least 30 minutes, but preferably 2 hours. Grill on medium heat for about 4 minutes on each side or until done.
      Note: I usually pound the breasts slightly to have a consistent thickness for even cooking.

GRILLED FRENCH BREAD
ingredients
1  unsliced loaf French bread
1/2  c. soft butter
2  Tbsp. minced parsley
  onions
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
1  tsp. celery salt
preparation
      Mix butter, parsley, onions, garlic powder and celery salt. Cut bread into 1-inch slices, cutting to bottom crust but not through.  Spread butter mixture on each slice.  Wrap in heavy-duty aluminum foil.  Heat over hot coals for about 20 minutes.  Turn often during heating.

"GRILLED MARINATED CHICKEN BREAST"
ingredients
1/2  c. soy sauce
2  garlic cloves, minced
1  Tbsp. brown sugar
1  Tbsp. olive oil
1  tsp. ginger
1/2  tsp. meat tenderizer
6  boneless, skinless chicken breasts, halved
  bottle of Hellmann's honey mustard
preparation
      Combine first 5 ingredients in Ziploc bag; shake to mix well. Add chicken. Seal and chill 1 hour, turning once. Remove chicken from marinade, discarding marinade.
      Grill chicken covered with lid over medium-high heat (350° to 400°) for 5 to 8 minutes on each side or until done. Drizzle with honey mustard. Serve over bed of white rice with mango salsa.
"Mango Salsa":
ingredients
2 ripe mangoes, peeled and diced or 1 (26 oz.)  jar refrigerated mango slices may be substituted
1  medium red bell pepper, diced
1  jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced
2  Tbsp. mint
1  small red onion, chopped
3  Tbsp. honey
1  Tbsp. fresh lime juice
1/4  tsp. ground red pepper
1/4  tsp. salt
preparation
      Stir together all ingredients; cover and chill at least 2 1/2 hours.

GRILLED TRI-TIP ROAST
ingredients
1/2  c. fresh lime juice
1/2  c. chopped fresh cilantro
1/2  c. olive oil
1/3  c. soy sauce
1/4  c. tequila
7  garlic cloves, finely chopped
2  tsp. grated lime peel
2  tsp. ground cumin
2  tsp. dried oregano
1  tsp. ground black pepper
2  (2 lb.) beef loin tri-tip roasts, trimmed
preparation
      Whisk first 10 ingredients in medium bowl.  Using small sharp knife, pierce meat all over.  Place meat in large resealable plastic bag; add marinade.  Seal bag.  Refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight, turning plastic bag occasionally.
      Prepare barbecue (medium-high).  Remove meat from marinade. Discard marinade.  Grill meat to desired doneness, about 10 minutes per side for medium-rare.  Transfer to cutting board.  Tent with foil; let stand 10 minutes.  Cut diagonally across grain.  Serve meat with Cherry Tomato Relish.
Cherry Tomato Relish:
ingredients
1/4  c. balsamic vinegar
4  tsp. chopped fresh oregano
3/4  c. olive oil
2/3  c. drained canned diced mild green chilies
4  green onions, finely chopped
4  c. halved cherry tomatoes
preparation
      Whisk vinegar and oregano in medium bowl to blend.  Gradually whisk in oil.  Mix in green chilies and green onions.  (Can be made 6 hours ahead.  Cover; chill.)  Add tomatoes; toss to coat.  Season with salt and pepper.

GRILLED SUMMER VEGETABLES
ingredients
4  medium size new potatoes, cut in 1/4-inch slices
2  medium zucchini, cut into 1/4-inch pieces
1  medium yellow squash, cut into 1/4-inch slices
1  medium onion, thinly sliced
1  medium yellow pepper, seeded and cut into thin strips
1/2  tsp. dried whole basil or 2 tsp. chopped fresh basil
1/2  tsp. freshly ground pepper
preparation
      Cook potatoes in boiling water to cover 5 minutes or just until tender; drain.  Arrange equal amounts of potato, zucchini, squash, yellow peppers and onion on 4 squares of aluminum foil.  Sprinkle with equal amounts of basil and pepper.  Fold foil over vegetables, sealing securely.  Grill over medium coals 15 minutes, turning once.  Serves 4.

STEAK HOUSE-STYLE GRILLED STEAK
ingredients
2  tsp. garlic powder
2  tsp. onion powder
2  tsp. brown sugar
1  tsp. coarsely ground black pepper
4  beef tenderloin steaks
  vegetable oil
preparation
      Mix seasonings and brown sugar.  Brush steaks with oil. Sprinkle seasoning mixture over both sides; press into steaks. Place steaks on medium-hot grill.  Grill 6 to 8 minutes on each side or until cooked to desired doneness.

MESQUITE GRILLED CAJUN TURKEY
ingredients
3  lb. boneless breast of turkey, thawed
  oil
1  Tbsp. onion flakes
1  Tbsp. garlic powder
1/2  tsp. thyme leaves
1/4  tsp. cayenne
1/4  tsp. anise seed
1/4  tsp. ground cloves
1/4  tsp. ground allspice
1  bay leaf, crushed
preparation
      Prepare grill for indirect method.  Brush turkey with oil. Combine remaining ingredients and sprinkle over turkey.  Place turkey on grill.  Cover grill and cook according to package directions.  Wrap in foil and let stand 10 to 15 minutes.  Remove netting from turkey and slice turkey.

HONEY LIME GRILLED CHICKEN
ingredients
1/2  cup honey
1/3  cup soy sauce
1/4  cup line juice
4  boneless, skinless, chicken breast halves
preparation
      In a resealable plastic bag, combine the honey, soy, and lime juice, mix well.  Add chicken and turn to coat.  Seal and refrigerate for 30 - 45 minutes.  Drain and discard the marinade. Grill the chicken uncovered, over medium heat for 6 - 7 minutes on each side or until juices run clear.

Grilled Pizza
(Yield: 4 Servings)  
ingredients
1  package Fresh Pizza Dough
2  Tbsp. Olive Oil
2  cloves Garlic, minced
1/2  cup Freshly Grated Parmesan Cheese
1  1/2 cups Shredded Mozzarella Cheese
preparation
      1. Lightly brush 10 x 15-inch cookie sheet with olive oil.
      2. Roll out pizza dough to fit and press onto cookie sheet. Cover with plastic wrap and freeze 1 hour.
      3. Heat grill on high.
      4. Remove plastic wrap from top of frozen dough and lightly brush top of dough with olive oil.
      5. Turn over dough onto hot grill.  Cover grill and cook until bottom is lightly browned.  Brush top with olive oil and turn over.
      6. Sprinkle garlic, parmesan and mozzarella on top.  Lower grill heat to low and cover grill.  Cook until cheese is melted and underside is browned - about 5-8 minutes.  Slide back onto cookie sheet and let stand 3 minutes.
      7. Slice and enjoy!

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

GRILLED VEGETABLES
ingredients
2  yellow squash
2  zucchini
1  eggplant
1  large red onion
  olive oil
  Emeril's Southwest seasoning
preparation
      Slice the vegetables into long 1/4-inch thick slices.  Toss in the olive oil and season well with the Southwest Seasoning on both sides. Place on a hot grill and watch carefully, they can burn quickly.

MUSTARD-GRILLED CHICKEN
ingredients
2/3  c. (6 oz.)  Dijon mustard
2  Tbsp. cayenne pepper
1/4  c. (2 oz.) vegetable oil
2  Tbsp. white wine vinegar
1  broiler chicken, about 2-1/2 lb.
preparation
      In a small bowl, stir together 1/3 c. of the mustard, 1 Tbsp. of the cayenne, the vegetable oil, and the vinegar.  Place the chicken in a large lock-top plastic bag and pour in the mustard mixture.  Press out the air and seal the bag tightly.  Massage gently to distribute the marinade.  Set in a large bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, turning and rubbing the bag occasionally.  Prepare a fire for indirect-heat cooking in a covered grill.  Combine the remaining 1/3 c. mustard with the remaining 1 Tbsp. cayenne.  Remove the chicken from the marinade, allowing as much marinade as possible to cling to the surface. Place the chicken, skin side down, in the center of the grill rack.  Grill, turning frequently, for about 25 minutes; do not worry if some of the marinade sticks to the grill.  Turn the chicken skin side up and brush it with the mustard-cayenne mixture.  Cover the grill, open the vents halfway, and cook until opaque throughout and the juices run clear, about 10 minutes longer.  If necessary, cut the chicken into smaller portions, then transfer to warmed individual plates and serve.

SAUSAGE ROLLS ON GRILL
ingredients
12  oz. turkey or pork sausage
1 (10 count)  can biscuits
2  Tbsp. chopped onions
1/2  c. chopped apples
1  c. shredded Colby cheese
1  Tbsp. brown sugar
1/4  tsp. cinnamon
preparation
      Brown sausage in skillet, stirring until it crumbles. Drain and cool. Place biscuits on floured pastry board; flatten and pinch seams together. Roll into an 8 x 12-inch rectangle. Sprinkle sausage and remaining ingredients on rectangle. Roll to enclose filling; seal edges. Cut into 6 slices. Place slices in 2 disposable baking pans. Grill with lid down over medium indirect heat for 30 to 35 minutes or until rolls test done.

GRILLED DRY RIBS AND SAUCE
Grilled Ribs:
ingredients
1  Tbsp. salt
2  tsp. coarsely ground black pepper
1/2  tsp. crushed hot red pepper
6  lb. pork spareribs
  Rib Sauce (see following)
4  to 6 handfuls hickory chips
preparation
      Combine salt and peppers; rub mixture all over ribs.  Let ribs stand in refrigerator for 4 hours.  Bring to room temperature before cooking.  Soak wood chips for 30 minutes.  Prepare a medium-hot fire in a covered charcoal grill.  Push coals to one side.  Just before cooking, toss 1/2 of the wood chips onto the coals.  Grill ribs on the side of the grill away from the coals. Turn about every 30 minutes.  Add remaining wood chips after 45 minutes.  Cook until ribs are crusty on the outside and tender on the inside, about 1 1/2 hours.  Serve with Rib Sauce (follows).
Rib Sauce:
ingredients
2  c. bottled chili sauce
1/3  c. cider vinegar
1/3  c. ketchup
1/3  c. dark brown sugar
3  Tbsp. soy sauce
3  Tbsp. dry sherry
1 1/2  tsp. ground ginger
3/4 to 1  tsp. crushed red pepper
2  garlic cloves, crushed
preparation
      Combine all ingredients in a saucepan.  Simmer, stirring occasionally, until sauce just coats a spoon (about 20 minutes). Will keep in refrigerator for 1 week.

GRILLED SHRIMP
ingredients
  peeled shrimp
1/2  c. lemon
1/4  c. Italian seasoning
1/4  c. water
1/4  c. soy sauce
3  tbsp. Italian seasoning
3  tbsp. minced onion
  garlic salt (according to taste)
1/2  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Combine all ingredients.  Place in large ziploc bag. Marinate 4 hours.  Grill 3-4 minutes on each side.  Baste often.

GAS GRILLED CHICKEN
ingredients
1  whole fryer
1  C water
  Salt
  Aluminum foil
  Kraft barbecue sauce (optional)
preparation
      Wash and clean chicken. Do not cut up. Salt to taste, cover with foil. Before closing foil, pour in the cup of water. Close foil.  Place on grill and cook with hood down for 1 hour at 350 degrees. Uncover and brush on sauce. Cook uncovered for 10 minutes or until brown.

GRILLED VEGETABLE SANDWICH
ingredients
6  Tbsp. mayonnaise
1/2  tsp. chopped fresh parsley
  pinch of dried oregano
  salt
1  red bell pepper
1  small zucchini
1  yellow summer squash
1/4  eggplant
1/4  c. olive oil
2  sourdough French rolls
1  Tbsp. fresh grated Parmesan cheese
6 to 8 separated onion ring  slices (2 whole slices)
3 to 4  slices tomato (1 medium tomato)
2  leaves red leaf lettuce
preparation
      Preheat the barbecue or stovetop grill.
      To prepare a spread, put 3 tablespoons of mayo into a small bowl and add parsley, oregano and pinch of salt.  Set this and remaining mayo aside until you're ready to make the sandwich.
       Prepare the bell pepper by cutting it into quarters and seeding it. Brush the entire surface with olive oil. Slice the zucchini, squash and eggplant into lengthwise slices no more than 1/8 to 1/4-inch thick. Brush these slices with oil as well. Cook the red pepper on a hot grill for 2 to 3 minutes. At that point, add the remaining vegetables to the grill and cook everything for 4 to 5 minutes or until all the vegetables are tender. Be sure to salt the vegetables and, of course, turn them halfway through cooking time. When veggies are tender and begin to char, remove them from the grill and prepare each sandwich by first cutting the rolls in half lengthwise through the middle. Spread the parsley-mayo over the face of the bottom halves. Arrange the veggies on roll by stacking the zucchini, yellow squash and then eggplant. Peel the skin off the red peppers, then stack on eggplant. Divide the Parmesan cheese and sprinkle it over the peppers. Arrange the onions on peppers, then tomato slices. Add lettuce leaves. Finish topping with the remaining mayo and top of roll.

GRILLED TERIYAKI SALMON
ingredients
1  salmon fillet (2 to 3 lb.)
1/4  c. teriyaki sauce
1  tsp. garlic powder
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/8  c. water
1  large onion, sliced into rings
1  Tbsp. parsley flakes
2  Tbsp. onion flakes (dried)
  Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Put seasoning on fish with 1/8 cup of water. Marinate overnight, skin side down. Place salmon on grill, medium-low, skin side down. Grill for 10 to 12 minutes, basting with olive oil every few minutes. Put onion rings on salmon 5 minutes into cooking. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese after salmon is removed from grill. Serves 4.

EASY GRILLED YELLOW FIN TUNA STEAKS FOR 4
ingredients
2 one  lb. yellow fin tuna steaks
3/4  c. Stubbs pork marinade
1  Tbsp. molasses
1/4  c. soy sauce
1/4  tsp. ground pepper
preparation
      Turn grill on and bring temp to medium high (approx. 20 minutes). Meanwhile, mix Stubbs pork marinade, molasses, soy sauce and ground pepper in a bowl or large cup. Set aside. Wash tuna steak with tepid tap water and place in flat bottom dish with sides (will be holding marinade, too). Fresh tuna should not smell fishy. Add marinade. Cover and set aside for 15 minutes or so. Turn tuna with tongs and let set for another 15 minutes. When grill is ready, place marinated tuna steaks on grill to sear side one. Pour part of the marinade on tuna. Cook on this side approximately 2 or 3 minutes with grill covered. Turn tuna over using flat spatula by quickly shoving under tuna while pressing down on grilling surface. This will help keep tuna intact. Reduce heat to low, pour on the rest of marinade and close lid. Tuna will continue to sear on higher heat and cook while temp. goes down. Turn once more after 4 or 5 minutes. Check tuna often during this stage. Remove from grill and let set for 5 minutes or so. Slice in half and serve.
       Usually a piece of tuna 5 x 4 x 1 1/4 inch will cook to medium rare in 8 to 10 minutes total. It should look whitish/beige brown on outside and bright pink inside for medium rare. All grills are different so you may have to practice the cooking of tuna a few times to get it just the way you want it. Cooking time will vary according to size of tuna.

GRILLED PARMESAN SPUDS
ingredients
1/2  c. margarine or butter
3/4  c. grated Parmesan cheese
1/4  c. all-purpose flour
1  tsp. cayenne pepper
1/2  tsp. black pepper
1/4  tsp. salt
2  potatoes, peeled and halved lengthwise
preparation
      Place cast iron skillet on briquettes in gas grill or any grill.  Melt margarine in skillet on low setting.  Combine cheese, flour, peppers, & salt in bowl.  Dampen potato halves in water, place in dry mixture.  Put in cast iron skillet.  Cook on medium setting with grill cover down for 35 minutes or until done.  Turn once.

GRILLED CORN-ON-THE-COB
ingredients
4  ears of corn, fresh and shucked, or frozen
  bacon
  chili, curry, ginger or paprika to taste
preparation
  Season each of corn with your choice of seasoning, just enough to give it zing.  Wrap a slice of bacon around each ear.  Roll up each ear in aluminum foil, twisting ends.  Place on hot grill for appr. 10 minutes each side, or until done.
  QUICK TIP:  For easy corn shucking, wet the outside of each husk. Microwave each ear on HIGH for 4 minutes.  The husks and silk will come of easily.

ITALIAN MUSHROOM GRILL
ingredients
12  oz. fresh mushrooms
1  c. Italian salad dressing
preparation
      Combine mushrooms and salad dressing in a small bowl and toss to coat.  Let stand 10 minutes.  Thread mushrooms on skewers and place 6 inches above hot coals.  Grill 5 minutes or until tender, turning often and brushing with remaining salad dressing.  Makes 6 servings.

SOUR CREAM POTATOES ON GRILL
ingredients
1 1/2  c. sliced, cooked potatoes or 1 (9 oz.) pkg. frozen French fries
1  Tbsp. butter
1  c. sour cream
1  packet dry onion soup mix
1/4  c. light cream
preparation
      Place potatoes in center of 14-inch square of heavy-duty foil. Spread with butter.  Blend remaining ingredients and pour over potatoes.  Close foil and fold into secure package.  Grill over flame at medium setting 20 to 30 minutes.  Turn occasionally.

GRILLED VEGETABLE SALAD
ingredients
1/3  c. white balsamic vinegar
2  Tbsp. olive oil
2  shallots, finely chopped
1  tsp. dried Italian seasoning
1/4  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
1 1/2  tsp. molasses
1/2  lb. carrots, scraped
1  sweet red pepper
1  sweet yellow pepper
2  zucchini
2  yellow squash
1  large onion
preparation
      Combine first 7 ingredients, set aside.  Cut carrots and remaining vegetables into large pieces.  Add to vinegar mixture, toss to coat.  Let stand 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Drain, reserving vinegar mixture.  Cook, covered with grill lid, over medium hot coals, turning occasionally.  Return vegetables to vinegar mixture, tossing gently.  Cover and refrigerator overnight.  Serves 6.

ON-THE-GRILL FISH STEAKS
ingredients
2  lb. fresh fish steaks, 3/4-inch thick
1/2  c. melted margarine or butter
1/4  c. lemon juice
1  dash hot pepper sauce
  paprika
preparation
      Place serving size portions of fish on well-greased grill. Spray grill well before putting on fish.  Baste fish with sauce and sprinkle with paprika.  Cook about 5 inches from hot coals for 8 minutes.  Baste with sauce, then turn and cook for 7 to 10 minutes longer or until fish flakes or turns shiny white.  Serves 4.

LIME-SEARED GRILLED WHITEFISH
(With Mango Salsa)  
Fish:
ingredients
2  filets whitefish (tilapia is best)
1/4  tsp. oregano
1/8  tsp. paprika
  pinch cayenne
preparation
      Mix the spices and sprinkle onto only one side of the fish. Squeeze 1 lime over fish, and grill over medium coals until fish is flakey. Garnish with mango salsa.
Salsa:
ingredients
1  peeled mango
  juice of 1 lime
1  garlic clove
1  green jalapeno, chopped (and de-seeded if you want it less spicy)
preparation
      Throw all into a food processor and blend away. Blend less if you want it chunkier.

GRILLED CHEESE BREAD
ingredients
1  loaf (1 lb) Italian bread
1/2  c. (1 stick) unsalted butter, softened
1/4  c. sun-dried tomatoes in oil, drained
2  Tbsp. jarred pesto
1  clove garlic
1/4  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. black pepper
1 1/2  c. shredded Provolone cheese
preparation
      Heat grill.  With serrated knife, slice bread lengthwise in half, horizontally.
      In food processor, pulse together butter, sun-dried tomatoes, pesto, garlic, salt and pepper until thoroughly combined and sun-dried tomatoes are chopped.  Scrape into bowl; stir in 1 cup shredded cheese.
      Grill bread, cut side down, until toasted, about 1 1/2 minutes.  Spread butter mixture onto cut side of each half, dividing equally.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
      Grill bread, cut side up, over indirect heat, with grill covered, until topping is melted, 8 to 10 minutes.  Let cool slightly.  With serrated knife, cut into slices.  Serve warm.

STUFFED GRILLED BURRITOS
ingredients
15  oz. can refried beans
8  oz. shredded cheese (Cheddar)
1  pkg. large flour tortillas
1  pkg. Lipton Spanish rice
1  lb. beef, browned and drained
1  can Ro-Tel
preparation
      Pour Ro-Tel in raw beef.
Sauce:
ingredients
1  c. mayo
1/2  c. picante
preparation
      On large tortilla, layer in middle the refried beans, beef, rice, cheese and sauce. Fold and brown on both sides in hot skillet.

GRILLED CAYENNE CHICKEN
(Makes 4 Servings)  
ingredients
1/2  c. mayonnaise
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
2  Tbsp. lime juice
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. cayenne pepper
4  skinless boneless chicken breast halves (about 1.25 lb.)
preparation
      Preheat grill or broiler.  Combine mayonnaise, garlic powder, lime juice, salt and cayenne in a shallow bowl; stir well.  Place chicken on grill rack.  Coat well with sauce.  Grill chicken for about 5 minutes; turn.  Brush with remaining sauce.  Broil chicken until juices run clear when meat is pierced with a knife, about 10 minutes longer.

LIME GRILLED CHICKEN
ingredients
  4-6 pieces of boneless chicken breast
1/3  c. soy sauce
2  Tbsp. fresh squeezed lime juice
2  Tbsp. olive oil
1 small  clove garlic, minced
preparation
      In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, lime juice, olive oil, and garlic.  Pour over chicken.  Cover and marinate for 1 hour.  Heat grill to medium.  Cook chicken 5 minutes, turn and cook 5 move minutes, turn again 2 more times.  You may need to turn heat to low depending on your grill temperature.

CITRUS GRILLED SALMON
ingredients
2  lb. salmon filets
2  Tbsp. soy sauce
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/4  tsp. salt
1/4  c. orange juice
1  Tbsp. olive or vegetable oil
2  Tbsp. finely minced onion
preparation
      Cut salmon in serving sized pieces.  To make marinade:  Combine all of the other ingredients in a small non-metal bowl.  Put salmon in a large non-metal container and pour the marinade over the fish. Marinade the fish for 10 minutes on each side.  Discard the marinade.  Place fish on a hot grill and cook for 4 minutes on each side or broil 8 minutes on each side until fork tender.  Can be doubled for 4-6 pounds of salmon.

GRILLED FLOUNDER WITH OLIVE BUTTER
ingredients
2  oz. butter (room temperature)
2  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  tsp. lemon zest (rind)
1/4  c. pitted and finely chopped kalamata or other black olives
4  flounder fillets
preparation
      Puree butter, lemon juice and olives.  Season flounder with salt and pepper.  Broil 3 to 4 minutes per side; place each serving on plate.  Top with 2 tablespoons of olive butter.

GRILLED LEMON DILL FISH
ingredients
1/2  c. Kraft Light Mayonnaise
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  tsp. dill weed
1/2  tsp. grated lemon peel
1  lb. firm-textured fish filets (such as cod, catfish or salmon)
preparation
      Mix mayonnaise, lemon juice, dill and lemon peel.  Place fish on greased grill over medium coals.  Brush with 1/2 of the mayonnaise mixture.  Grill 5 minutes, turn.  Brush with remaining mayonnaise mixture.  Grill an additional 5 to 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork.
      Kitchen Tip:  For more flavor, increase lemon juice to 2 tablespoons.

SPICY GRILLED CORN
ingredients
1/3  c. butter or margarine
2  Tbsp. prepared mustard (Dijon style)
1  Tbsp. prepared horseradish (white)
1  tsp. Worcestershire sauce (white)
1/4  tsp. lemon pepper
6  ears fresh corn (husks and silks removed)
preparation
      In a saucepan, melt butter.  Stir in mustard, horseradish, Worcestershire sauce and lemon pepper.  Place each ear of corn on a 12 x 9-inch piece of heavy-duty foil.  Drizzle butter mixture over corn.  Fold edges of foil to seal pouch securely, leaving space for steam expansion.  Grill over medium hot coals, turning occasionally for 15 minutes.  Serves 6.

LIGHT BASTING SAUCE FOR THE GRILL
ingredients
1/2  cup vegetable oil
1/2  cup lemon juice
1/2  cup wine vinegar
1/4  cup soy sauce
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/2  tsp. salt (if desired)
preparation
      Combine ingredients in tight glass jar.  Refrigerate till needed.  Shake well before using.  May be used for basting beef, pork, chicken or lamb.

LEMON GRILLED SALMON
ingredients
2  tsp. fresh snipped dill or 3/4 tsp. dill weed
1/2  tsp. lemon-pepper seasoning
1/2  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. garlic powder
1/4  c. packed brown sugar
3  Tbsp. chicken broth
3  Tbsp. vegetable oil
3  Tbsp. soy sauce
3  Tbsp. finely chopped green onions
preparation
      Combine first 4 ingredients. Sprinkle over salmon and place in a reclosable bag. Place in a shallow glass container. Combine rest of ingredients. Pour over salmon and place in refrigerator at least 1 hour. Remove from bag and place on tinfoil. Cover with thinly sliced lemon and onions and wrap in foil, skin side down. Grill over medium heat 15 to 20 minutes until fish flakes. Enjoy.

GRILLED CHICKEN AND ORANGE SAUCE
ingredients
8  boneless fryer breasts
1  qt. frozen pure orange juice
1/8  tsp. nutmeg
1  tsp. lemon juice
1  c. brown sugar
2  Tbsp. pure butter
1  c. water
2  Tbsp. cornstarch
1/4  c. cold water
preparation
      Grill breasts and put in baking pan. Mix the first 6 ingredients and bring to a boil on low heat. Mix cornstarch and water until smooth and add to mixture. Simmer until sauce thickens. Pour sauce over chicken and bake for 15 minutes in low heat oven. Serve with rice pilaf or unseasoned rice of your choice.

GRILLED FISH FILLETS
ingredients
2  fillets orange roughy or other fish
  Lawrys seasoned salt
1  zucchini
1  yellow squash
1  red or orange pepper (not the hot kind)
  lemon juice
  margarine
preparation
	Rinse fillets in cold water, pat dry with paper towel.	Place in center of square of foil, sprinkle both sides with seasoned salt. Wash zucchini and squash, no need to peel.  Cut into 2 to 3 inch sticks.  Slice red pepper to 1/4 inch thickness.  Place vegetables on foil with fish, dribble lemon juice over all.  Put about a tsp. of margarine on top and seal foil with double fold on top and ends.  Pierce foil on top with 2 small holes to vent. Place on hot grill for about 15 minutes, no need to turn.  Cooking time varies according to the thickness of fish and heat of the grill, also whether or not grill has a lid.  Fish can be baked in oven at 400° for 15 minutes.

EASY GRILLED CHICKEN
ingredients
6  to 8 chicken breasts (boned or boneless)
8  oz. Italian dressing
1/4  c. soy sauce
preparation
      Mix dressing and soy sauce. Marinate chicken 3 hours or overnight. Cook on grill or bake.

GRILLED STEAK WITH BEARNAISE
ingredients
1  (2 lb.) flank steak
2  cloves garlic, minced
2  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1  Tbsp. white wine vinegar
1  tsp. salt, divided
1/2  tsp. white pepper
1/2  c. white wine or broth
2  Tbsp. each chopped shallot and fresh tarragon, divided
2  Tbsp. chopped fresh chervil, divided
1  bay leaf
4  egg yolks
1 1/2  tsp. water
8  Tbsp. (1 stick) butter
preparation
      Score both sides of steak in a diamond pattern. Rub with garlic.  Place in a shallow bowl. Coat lightly with the vegetable oil, vinegar, 3/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon white pepper. Let steak stand for 30 minutes.
      Preheat the grill to medium.  Grill steak 4-inches from the heat for 4 to 5 minutes per side.
       Combine the wine, shallot, half the tarragon, half the chervil, bay leaf and remaining salt in a medium skillet. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is reduced by two-thirds.
      Place egg yolks and water in the top of a double boiler.  Pour over boiling water. Cook, beating continually, until the egg yolks begin to thicken, about 3 minutes. Stir in butter, 1 tablespoon at a time. Remove from heat. Stir in the wine mixture and the remaining tarragon, chervil and white pepper. Discard bay leaf. Serve sauce with thinly sliced steak.

GRILLED SALMON SKILLET
ingredients
  lemon pepper to taste
  butter
  liquid smoke
  crushed dill to taste
  garlic to taste
  salmon
preparation
      Take one large salmon; cut in half to form a slab. Lay on grill with flame as low as possible. Coat fish with butter, then with liquid smoke. Add lemon pepper, crushed dill and garlic on top. Cook until well done.

GRILLED TUNA STEAKS
ingredients
4  to 6 tuna steaks
1/4  c. white wine
2  Tbsp. Dijon mustard
2  Tbsp. soy sauce
1  Tbsp. honey
1/2  tsp. curry powder
preparation
      Mix ingredients and pour over tuna steaks. Marinate for 1 hour. Grill to desired doneness.

BARBECUE CHICKEN FOR THE GRILL
ingredients
1  fryer chicken (3 to 4 lb.), quartered
1/4  c. cider vinegar
1/4  c. butter or margarine
1/4  c. water
1/8  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. black pepper
1/4  tsp. each: thyme, oregano, garlic powder and rosemary
preparation
      Place chicken in a shallow glass dish. In a small saucepan, combine vinegar, butter, salt, pepper, water and spices. Bring to a gentle boil. Pour over quartered chicken. Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours, turning once.
       Drain and discard marinade. Grill, covered, for 30 to 40 minutes (or place in  lightly greased baking pan and cook in 375° oven for 50 minutes, until tender).

GRILLED TERIYAKI CORN ON THE COB
(China)  
ingredients
  Fresh corn on the cob
  Kikkoman Teriyaki Baste and Glaze or Kikkoman Teriyaki Baste and Glaze with honey pineapple
preparation
      Remove husk from corn.  Lay each ear of corn on a piece of foil large enough to wrap around it.  Brush lightly with teriyaki baste and glaze.  Wrap foil around corn and seal edges.  Cook on a grill for 20-30 minutes or until corn is tender.  Turn frequently.  (Or bake on a baking sheet at 325F for 30 minutes, turn 1 time.)

GRILLED CORN-ON-THE-COB
ingredients
6 fresh  ears of corn with husks on
6  Tbsp. oleo
36  sprigs or leaves cilantro or basil
  lime or lemon wedges (optional)
preparation
      You also need 100% cotton kitchen string.
      Carefully peel back husk but DO NOT remove. Remove and discard silks. Gently rinse corn; pat dry. Spread corn with oleo. Place cilantro and/or basil evenly over corn, pressing into oleo. Gently fold husks back around corn. Tie with string at top of cob. Grill over medium coals for 25 to 30 minutes, turning 3 times. Remove strings; peel off husks. Squeeze lime if you use cilantro. Squeeze lemon if you use basil.

GRILLED BREAD
ingredients
1  packet original ranch dressing mix
1/2  c. margarine
2  loaves French bread, cut in half lengthwise
preparation
      Soften margarine and stir in dressing mix.  Spread on bread. Grill or broil until golden.  Makes 2 loaves.

GRILLED ONIONS
ingredients
12  to 15 small white onions
  oleo or butter
  salt and pepper
preparation
      Peel onions and rinse.  Tear aluminum foil into pieces slightly larger than onions.  Cut each onion in half and place both halves on a square of foil.  Put a pat of butter or oleo between the halves of an onion; salt and pepper to taste.  Wrap thoroughly. Continue with all onions.  Cook by placing foil packets around outside edge of grill while the meat cooks.  Onions are done when they can be pierced easily with a fork.

ALL SEASON GRILLED CHICKEN
ingredients
1-1/2  c. chili sauce
3/4  c. red-wine vinegar
1-1/2  Tbsp. prepared horseradish
2 small  cloves garlic, halved
1  tsp. salt
4  bone in chicken breast (6 oz. each)
preparation
      Mix chili sauce, vinegar, horseradish, garlic and salt in a bowl.  Reserve half of mixture.  Add chicken to bowl; turn to coat.  Cover; marinate in refrigerator about 5 minutes.  Remove chicken from marinade; place chicken on grill or on broiler pan. Grill or broil; turning and basting frequently with the reserved marinade; about 30 minutes.  Serve remaining marinade with chicken.

GRILLED DILL SALMON
ingredients
1  large salmon fillet (about 2 lb.)
1  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1/4  tsp. pepper
1/2  c. dill dip
2  Tbsp. milk
preparation
      Heat coals or gas grill. Place fish on 24-inch piece of heavy-duty aluminum foil. Brush salmon with oil and sprinkle with pepper. Wrap foil securely around fish. Cover and grill fish 4 to 6-inches from medium heat 20 to 30 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Mix dill dip with milk until smooth. Serve salmon with dill sauce. Makes 6 servings.

GRILLED HAWAIIAN CHICKEN
ingredients
  chicken parts (dark meat stays juicier on grill; white and dark will marinate fine however)
8  oz. teriyaki glaze or sauce
1/2  c. honey or maple syrup
1/4  c. soy sauce
  buttery spray or light oil (like canola)
1  c. pineapple juice
1  c. orange juice
  garlic salt
  Greek seasoning
  pepper
1  c. brown sugar
preparation
      Spray or lightly oil meat. Rub dry mix on meat. Grill until almost done. Remove and place into container of liquid ingredients. Baste for approximately 10 to 15 minutes. Grill 2nd time for 5 to 10 minutes, turning often. Do not overcook. Garnish with grilled orange or pineapple slices.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

GRILLED TURKEY
(Very Moist)  
ingredients
14 to 24  lb. turkey
1  c. lemon juice
1/4  bottle Tabasco sauce
  dash of liquid smoke
1/4  c. pickling salt
1/3  tsp. garlic juice
1  c. warm water
1  lb. butter
preparation
      You will need syringe and needle (can purchase at any pharmacy).
      Defrost turkey and wash bird.  Mix all ingredients.  Inject with hypodermic needle in all parts of turkey.  Put in plastic bag and refrigerate 24 hours.  Put butter in cavity of bird, then put on grill and cook allowing about 15 minutes per pound.  Best to use meat thermometer.  Enjoy!

GRILLED LEMON SALMON
ingredients
2  tsp. fresh dill
1/2  tsp. pepper
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
1 1/2  lb. salmon filet
1/4  c. brown sugar
3  Tbsp. oil
1 cube chicken bouillon, mixed with 3  Tbsp. water
3  Tbsp. soy sauce
4  Tbsp. green onions
1  lemon, thinly sliced
2  slices onions, separated into rings
preparation
      Sprinkle dill, salt, pepper and garlic powder over salmon and place in shallow pan. Mix sugar, bouillon, oil, soy sauce and green onions. Pour over salmon. Cover and chill for 1 hour; turn once. Drain and discard marinade. Put on grill over medium heat; place lemon and onion on top. Cover and cook for 15 minutes or until fish is done.

GRILLED CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
4  eggs, boiled and sliced
1  cucumber, sliced
1  head lettuce
  red onion, sliced
2  leaves romaine lettuce
4  boneless, skinless chicken breasts
1/2  c. Italian dressing
2  Tbsp. honey
2  tsp. lemon pepper
  salt to taste
  favorite salad dressing
preparation
      Mix honey and dressing for marinade.  Place chicken breasts, cut in strips, in 1/2 marinade in refrigerator for 3 hours.  Pour out marinade.  Grill chicken until done, basting with remaining marinade that chicken was not in.
      Mix together eggs and salad greens.  Add others if you wish. Cube chicken over salad.  Pour on favorite dressing.

GRILLED TURKEY BREAST
ingredients
1  turkey breast, halved to reduce thickness
8  oz. Italian salad dressing
8  strips bacon
preparation
      Pour dressing over halved turkey breast; refrigerate and marinate overnight.  Remove meat from marinade and use toothpicks to pin 2 strips of bacon to each side of each half.  Grill over charcoal, turning frequently, long enough to cook thoroughly but not long enough to dry out the meat.

Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

GRILLED PORK TENDERLOIN
ingredients
1  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1  c. chopped onion
5  Tbsp. sugar
1 1/2  c. dry red wine
3/4  c. reduced-sodium soy sauce
1/4  c. balsamic vinegar
2 1/2  Tbsp. chopped, peeled, fresh ginger
1/2  tsp. ground black pepper
3  (14 to 16 oz.) pork tenderloins
3 medium, fresh peaches, peeled and sliced or 1  can sliced, drained peaches
2  Tbsp. chopped, fresh chives
preparation
      To make marinade and sauce:  Heat oil in medium saucepan; add onions and sugar. Sauté until onions are golden (6 minutes). Mix in wine and next 5 ingredients. Cook 1 minute longer.  Remove from heat; cool completely.
      Place tenderloins in heavy Ziploc bag.  Pour 1 cup cooled marinade into bag. Seal.  Refrigerate 6 hours. Cover remaining sauce separately and refrigerate.
      Prepare grill (medium heat). Remove pork from marinade; discard this marinade. Grill until meat thermometer registers 155° (35 minutes) when inserted into tenderloin.
      Meanwhile, boil remaining marinade until reduced by 1/2. Slice meat in thin slices; place on platter. Place peaches on top. Pour sauce over top.

GRILLED CHICKEN
ingredients
  3-4 oz. chicken breast fillet per person
  1-2 Tbsp. Italian Salad Dressing per chicken breast
preparation
      Marinate chicken for a few hours or overnight. Discard marinade. Grill or broil chicken until juices run clear.

HOME STYLE GRILLED HAMBURGERS
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. hamburger
1  pkg. onion gravy mix
1 1/2  Tbsp. water
1/2  c. sour cream
preparation
      Mix together lightly; shape in patties.  Grill or fry until done.

GRILLED VEGETABLES
ingredients
3  yellow squash, sliced diagonally
1  red bell pepper, cut into 6 pieces
3  zucchini squash, sliced diagonally
1  purple onion, cut into 1/2-inch slices
preparation
      Optional: Any over veggies - mushrooms, green or yellow bell pepper, tomato, asparagus, etc.
Marinade:
ingredients
1/3  c. olive oil
1  garlic clove, pressed
1/4  tsp. salt
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1/2  tsp. dried marjoram
1/2  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Place veggies in heavy-duty Ziploc bag.
      Whisk marinade together and pour over veggies.  Marinate for 1 hour.  Arrange evenly in a grill basket (or foil pan).  Grill (grill closed) 20 minutes or until crisp and tender, turning and brushing occasionally with marinade.

ZESTY GRILLED HAM
ingredients
1  c. packed brown sugar
1/3  c. prepared horseradish
1/4  c. lemon juice
1  fully cooked ham steak (1 to 1 1/2 lb.)
preparation
	In a small saucepan, bring brown sugar, horseradish and lemon juice to a boil. Brush over both sides of ham. Grill over medium hot coals, turning once until heated through and well glazed, about 20 to 25 minutes.

GRILLED CHEVRON CHOPS
(Beef Goat Chops)  
ingredients
  Goat chops (loin or rib)
  balsamic vinegar
  olive oil
  dijon mustard
preparation
      Marinate loin or rib chops in a mixture of equal amounts of balsamic vinegar, olive oil, and dijon mustard for several hours in the refrigerator and then barbecue.

GRILLED MAHI MAHI
(Yield: 4 Servings)  
ingredients
4  (4 oz.) mahi mahi fillets
  cooking spray
1  Tbsp. mixed herbs including fresh basil, oregano, parsley and thyme
1/4  tsp. sea salt
1/8  tsp. black pepper (fresh ground)
4  pineapple rings
preparation
      Season fillets with oil spray, mixed herbs, sea salt and pepper. Grill fillets 3 to 4 minutes per side or to desired doneness (medium and moist). Set aside on a warm plate until needed. Grill pineapple rings with charred crisscross markings from the grill. Arrange fillets and pineapple rings on plate and add garnish to suit.

GRILLED PORK TENDERLOIN MARINATE
ingredients
1/2  c. peanut oil
1/3  c. soy sauce
1/4  c. red wine vinegar
3  Tbsp. lemon juice
2  Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1  clove garlic, crushed
1  Tbsp. chopped fresh parsley
1  Tbsp. dry mustard
1 1/2  tsp. pepper
2  (3/4 lb.) pork tenderloins
preparation
      Combine first 9 ingredients; place in a heavy-duty, zip-top plastic bag or shallow container. Add tenderloins, turning to coat. Seal or cover and marinate in refrigerator 4 hours, turning occasionally. Remove tenderloins from marinade, discarding marinade. Grill tenderloins, uncovered, over medium coals (300° to 350°) 16 minutes or until a meat thermometer inserted in thickest part registers 160° (medium), turning once. Let stand 5 to 10 minutes before slicing. Serves 6.
      NOTE: If you want to baste pork while grilling, reserve marinade and bring to a boil in a small saucepan. Remove from heat and baste tenderloins as desired.

THE ULTIMATE GRILLED CHEESE
ingredients
1  pkg. (3 oz.) cream cheese, softened
3/4  c. mayonnaise
1  c. shredded Cheddar cheese
1  c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
1/2  tsp. garlic powder
1/8  tsp. seasoned salt
  crumbled cooked bacon, as much as you want
preparation
      In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth.  Stir in cheeses, garlic powder, salt and bacon.  Spread the mixture on a slice of bread (about 1/3 cup).  Top with another slice of bread.  Butter the outsides of the bread and grill.

BROWN RICE SALAD WITH GRILLED CHICKEN
ingredients
3  c. cooked brown rice
2  c. cubed grilled chicken breast
2  medium tart apples, diced
1  medium sweet red pepper, diced
2  celery ribs, finely chopped
2/3  c. chopped green onions
1/2  c. chopped pecans
3  Tbsp. minced fresh parsley
1/4  c. vinegar
3  Tbsp. olive or canola oil
1  Tbsp. lemon juice
1  tsp. salt
1/4  tsp. pepper
preparation
      In a large bowl, combine the first 8 ingredients.  In a jar with a tight-fitting lid, combine the vinegar, oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper; shake well. Pour over rice mixture and toss to coat.  Serve immediately or refrigerate.

GRILLED VENISON (DEER)
ingredients
  Bacon strips
  Soy sauce
  Worcestershire sauce
  Seasoned pepper
  Lemon juice
  Deer meat
preparation
      Take small pieces of deer meat and tenderize until very thin. Remove as much stringy fat as possible. Roll meat to about the size of a meat ball. Wrap with 1/2 slice of bacon, securing with toothpick. Combine other ingredients, any amount you need to cover for marinating. Let set at least overnight or 2 days if you want. Remove from marinade and grill. This can be seasoned if you desire. The seasoned pepper needs to be used sparingly, unless you want spicy taste.

GRILLED SWORDFISH STEAKS
ingredients
1  Tbsp. sweet butter, softened
1/2  tsp. chili powder
1  tsp. fresh chives, minced
1  lb. swordfish steaks
preparation
      Preheat broiler or grill.  In a small bowl, combine butter, chili powder and chives. Put a small amount of seasoned butter on the top side of each steak.  Grill or broil for about 5 minutes, then turn steaks and put seasoned butter on other side (don't use all of butter).  Grill or broil 5 minutes more, then use remaining butter on top of the grilled fish. Serve hot.

QUICK AND TASTY GRILLED BEEF ROAST
ingredients
3  lb. chuck roast
1  pkg. Lipton beefy onion soup mix
preparation
      Marinate roast in beefy onion soup mix all day and night (turn often).  Preheat gas grill; sear roast on both sides.  Turn grill to low setting and baste well.  Cook until inside temperature is about 140° to 150°.

SKEWERED TURKEY GRILL
ingredients
1  turkey half breast
2  green bell peppers, cut into 1-inch squares
2  heads fresh garlic cloves, separated and peeled
1/2  fresh pineapple, cut into wedges
2  zucchini, cut into chunks
16  cherry tomatoes
1/4  c. oil
1/2  tsp. thyme
1/2  tsp. oregano
1/2  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. black pepper
preparation
      Cut turkey into 1-inch chunks. Thread on skewers, alternating with bell pepper squares and whole garlic cloves. On separate skewers, spear pineapple, zucchini and cherry tomatoes. Mix oil and seasonings; brush ingredients on skewers with oil. Cook skewers with turkey over hot coals 5 minutes. Place remaining skewers on grill; cook, basting occasionally, 10 minutes longer until turkey is done.

GRILLED ZUCCHINI
(Barbecue or Foreman Grill)  
ingredients
2  medium size zucchini
1/2  c. balsamic vinegar
1/2  c. freshly grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Slice zucchini lengthways (6 slices each).  Place in dish with balsamic vinegar.  Cover and let sit for at least 30 minutes. (If time allows, cover and refrigerate for up to 2 hours.)  Place marinated zucchini slices on hot grill for 2 minutes.  Flip slices and sprinkle Parmesan cheese over slices.  Close grill for 2 minutes.  Promptly remove and serve.

GRILLED THREE CHEESE POTATOES
ingredients
6  large potatoes, sliced 1/4-inch thick
2  medium onions, chopped
1/3  c. Parmesan cheese
1  c. shredded Cheddar cheese, divided
1  c. Mozzarella cheese, divided
1  lb. sliced bacon, cooked and crumbled or bacon bits
1/4  c. butter or margarine, cubed
1  Tbsp. minced or dried chives
1 to 2  tsp. seasoning salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
preparation
      Divide the potatoes and onions equally between 2 pieces of heavy-duty foil that have been coated with nonstick cooking spray. Combine Parmesan cheese and 3/4 cup each Cheddar and Mozzarella. Sprinkle cheese over potatoes and onions. Top with bacon, butter, chives, salt and pepper. Bring opposite ends of foil together over filling and fold down several times. Fold unsealed ends toward filling and crimp tightly. Grill, covered, over medium heat for 35 to 40 minutes or potatoes are tender. Remove from grill. Open foil and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
      Can be cooked in oven at 350° for 1 hour.

GRILLED ASPARAGUS
ingredients
  1-lb asparagus
3  Tbs balsamic vinegar
3  Tbs lemon juice
1  Tbs olive oil
1  Tbs soy sauce
1/8  tsp pepper
preparation
      Marinate asparagus in next 5 ingredients for 30 minutes. Grill for 5 minutes each side.

ZESTY GRILLED PORK MEDALLIONS
ingredients
2  c. salsa
1/4  c. sugar
4 1/2  tsp. sweet and sour sauce
1  Tbsp. vegetable oil
1  Tbsp. green taco sauce
2  tsp. balsamic vinegar
  dash of hot pepper sauce
2  pork tenderloins (about 1 lb. each)
preparation
      In a bowl, combine the first 7 ingredients; mix well. Set aside 1 cup for dipping; cover and refrigerate. Pour remaining marinade into a large resealable plastic bag; add the pork. Seal bag and turn to coat; refrigerate overnight. Drain and discard marinade. Grill pork, covered, over indirect medium heat for 30 to 40 minutes or until a meat thermometer reads 160°. Warm the dipping sauce; serve with sliced pork. Yield: 6 to 8 servings.

EASY GRILLED HAM
ingredients
1  2 inch thick, fully cooked ham steak
1/2  c. ginger ale
1/2  c. orange juice
1/4  c. firmly packed brown sugar
1  Tbsp. cooking oil
1/2  tsp. dry mustard
1/4  tsp. ground ginger
1/8  tsp. ground cloves
1/2  tsp. white vinegar
preparation
      Place steak in a large shallow dish.  Combine ginger ale, orange juice, brown sugar, vegetable oil, vinegar, mustard, ginger and cloves.  Stir until sugar dissolves.  Pour over steak.  Cover and refrigerate 8 hours, turning meat occasionally.
      Drain steak, discarding marinate.  Grill, covered, over medium heat-hot coals for 15 minutes on each side.

RASPBERRY GRILLED CHICKEN SALAD
ingredients
  mixed salad greens
1/2  c. chopped celery
1  small Granny Smith apple, chopped
1/2  c. seedless grapes
1/2  c. raisins
1  large boneless chicken breast, grilled
  raspberry vinaigrette dressing
1/2  c. glazed walnuts
preparation
	Arrange on serving platter as listed.

GRILLED CHICKEN TACOS
ingredients
12  chicken breast tenders
1  tsp. cumin
1/2  tsp. salt
1/8  tsp. ground red pepper
2  Tbsp. vegetable oil, divided
6  corn tortillas
1  small avocado, peeled and cut lengthwise into 12 strips
  salsa
1 1/2  c. shredded iceberg lettuce
preparation
      Preheat grill to medium heat. In small dish, combine cumin, salt and red pepper. Wash hands. Rub spices and 1 tablespoon oil onto chicken. Wash hands.
      Place chicken on grill.  Grill, turning once, 5 to 6 minutes or until internal juices of chicken.  (Or insert instant-read meat thermometer in thickest part of chicken.  Temperature should read 170°.)
      Just before chicken is done, brush both sides of tortillas with remaining 1 tablespoon oil.  Grill just until softened, about 15 seconds per side. Fill center of each tortilla with 2 chicken tenders, 2 slices avocado, 1 tablespoon salsa and 1/4 cup lettuce. Fold tortilla over; serve with extra salsa, if desired. Refrigerate leftovers.

MARINATED SCALLOPS ON THE GRILL
ingredients
1  medium onion, chopped
1/2  c. vegetable oil
  juice of 1 lemon
1/2  tsp. minced garlic
1/4  tsp. salt
1/2  tsp. pepper
2  lb. scallops
preparation
      Combine onion, oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt and pepper in a large shallow dish.  Add scallops, stirring gently to coat. Refrigerate 2 hours.  Thread scallops on skewers.  Place kabobs 4 to 5 inches from hot coals; grill 10 to 12 minutes, turning and basting occasionally with leftover marinade.  Yield:  6 servings.

GRILLED ROAST BEEF SANDWICHES
ingredients
1 (4 oz.)  can chopped green chilies, drained
2  Tbsp. mayonnaise
1  Tbsp. Dijon mustard
10  slices rye bread
5  slices Swiss cheese
10 thin  slices cooked roast beef
2  Tbsp. butter or margarine, softened
  salsa or picante sauce (optional)
preparation
      Combine chilies, mayonnaise and mustard; spread about 1 tablespoon on one side of each slice of bread. Top half of the bread with 1 slice of cheese and 2 slices of beef. Cover with remaining bread. Butter the outside of bread. Grill sandwiches on a griddle or in a large skillet over medium heat until both sides are golden brown and the cheese is melted. Serve with salsa or picante sauce, if desired. Yield: 5 servings.

GRILLED SHRIMP KABOBS
ingredients
1 1/2  lb. peeled deveined shrimp
1/2  c. melted butter
1/2  c. honey
preparation
      Thread shrimp onto wooden skewers, using 2 skewers per kabob to facilitate turning (1 skewer through the meaty part, 1 skewer through the tail part of each shrimp).  Brush grill with oil. Combine melted butter and honey (or substitute 1 cup Italian dressing for butter and honey).  Cook shrimp over hot coals, basting frequently with honey mixture or Italian dressing for 10 minutes per inch of thickness or until shrimp are tender and no longer translucent in the center.  Yield:  4 servings.

Could NOT Open Recipe Page Due To:
Conversion from type 'DBNull' to type 'String' is not valid.

GRILLED BACON WRAPPED WIENERS
ingredients
16  wieners
16  buttered buns
16  slices bacon or 16 slices ham
1  lb. Cheddar cheese
preparation
      Split wieners lengthwise part way.  Cut cheese in long strips and put one piece in each wiener.  Press together and wrap with bacon or ham, fastening the ends with toothpicks.  Roast on grill over hot coals until bacon is crisp and wieners are heated through. Yield:  8 servings.

GRILLED APPLESAUCE CAKE
ingredients
1 1/2  c. sugar
1/2  c. packed brown sugar
1  c. vegetable oil
3  eggs
1  tsp. vanilla
2  c. applesauce
2 1/2  c. unsifted all-purpose flour
2  tsp. pumpkin pie spice
1 1/2  tsp. baking soda
1  tsp. salt
1/2  c. confectioners sugar
2  tsp. apple juice
preparation
      Combine sugar, brown sugar, oil, eggs and vanilla; beat until smooth.  Stir in applesauce.  Sift together flour, pumpkin pie spice, soda and salt; add to mixture, mixing well.  Pour into greased and floured 12-cup Bundt pan.  Preheat gas grill.  Cook with cover down using indirect cooking method on high setting 40 minutes, or until done.  Cool in pan 5 minutes.  Remove from pan; cool thoroughly on wire rack.  Combine confectioners sugar and apple juice; drizzle over cake.
      Gas Grill Indirect Cooking Directions:  Light only one side of dual-burner gas grill.  Preheat grill with cover down.  Place food on grid above unit burner.  Cook according to time given in recipe.

GRILLED CHICKEN AND BROCCOLI
(Low Carb)  
ingredients
3/4  lb. chicken cutlets, pounded to 1/4 in. thick
1- 1/2  tsp. Dijon mustard
  juice and pulp of 1lime
2  tsp. olive oil
1/2  TBSP. finely slivered red bell pepper
2  TBSP. chopped  water chestnuts
4  c. chopped broccoli, steamed
  Grated Parmesan cheese
preparation
      Brush the chicken with the mustard, and grill or broil until cooked through, about 4 minutes on a side.  Slice into thin strips. Whisk together the lime juice and pulp, oil, thyme, pepper, and water chestnuts.  Arrange the broccoli and chicken on a serving plate.  Sprinkle with the lime dressing and Parmesan.  Serve warm. Makes 4 servings.  Per serving:  141 calories, 22 grams protein, 6 grams carbs, 4 grams fat, 1 gram sat. fat, 50 mg chol., 3 grams fiber, 136 mg sodium.  Diet Exchanges:  0 milk, 1 vegetable, 1/2 fruit, 0 bread, 3 meat, 1/2 fat.

SOUTH AFRICAN GRILLED CHICKEN
ingredients
1/2  c. vinegar
1/2  c. oil
1/2  Tbsp. worcestershire sauce
1/2  tsp. powdered mustard
2  tsp. cayenne pepper
3  tsp. salt
1  tsp. paprika
2  Tbsp. ketchup
2  cloves garlic, crushed
2  broilers, cut up
preparation
      Combine all ingredients, except chicken, in a glass bowl and let stand for 12 - 24 hours.  Reserving some sauce for basting, marinate chicken pieces in remaining sauce for at least 4 hours in the refrigerator (the longer it marinates, the stronger the flavor).  Grill chicken, basting with reserved marinade until well done.

GRILL BAKED APPLE-GINGER CAKES
ingredients
1 (14 oz.)  pkg. gingerbread mix
1 (16 oz.)  can applesauce
preparation
      You will also need 8 to 10-inch squares foil.
      Follow package directions for making gingerbread mix.  Shape foil by placing a glass in center of square, bringing edges up around foil; remove glass and brush centers with shortening. Divide applesauce among cups and spoon gingerbread mix over the applesauce.  Crimp edges of foil, leaving space for batter to rise. Place around edges of grill and allow to cook for 20 to 30 minutes. Remove from grill; open foil and allow to cool slightly.  Serve as is or with whipped cream or ice cream.

GRILLED BRATS IN BEER
ingredients
4  to 6 bratwurst
1 1/2  c. onion, coarsely chopped
1 (12 oz.)  can beer
2  Tbsp. butter, softened
1/2  tsp. onion salt
1/2  c. shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
4  to 6 buns
preparation
      In skillet, put brats, onion and beer; simmer, uncovered, for about 30 minutes.  Mix butter and onion salt together; spread on buns.  Remove brats from beer; fill slit with cheese and place in buns.  Broil 4 inches from heat, until cheese melts.  Watch closely.

GREEN BEANS ON THE GRILL
ingredients
1  lb. green beans
1  medium onion, sliced or diced
1/2  green pepper, sliced or diced
1  c. fresh mushrooms, chopped (I used 4 oz. can, drained)
1/3  c. butter
2 or 3  tsp. horseradish
2  Tbsp. brown sugar
1 1/2  tsp. salt
  pepper (as much as desired)
preparation
      Mix butter, horseradish, brown sugar, salt and pepper.  Dab this mixture over green beans and wrap in heavy-duty foil and put on grill for 20 minutes.  Remove and cut up 1 or 2 tomatoes into wedges and place over top of beans, return to grill for 10 to 15 minutes more.  Unwrap and enjoy!

GRILLED PORK CHOPS
ingredients
4  (3/4 to 1-inch thick) pork chops
1/4  tsp. salt
3/4  tsp. lemon pepper seasoning
1/2  tsp. dried whole oregano
preparation
      Sprinkle pork chops with salt, lemon pepper and oregano.  Place chops 4 to 5 inches from coals.  Grill over low to medium hot coals 25 minutes or until the chops are no longer pink, turning once. Yields 4 servings.
